title: Facebook and That $2 Billion
description: Once again, the social-networking Web site Facebook is drawing gasps and snorts for its supposedly bubbly valuation. The site, founded in 2004 by a Harvard student, has grown to include millions of users  mostly in college and high school  and has become a sort of proxy for the renewed excitement about certain kinds of Internet startups.

title: Hail and Farewell
description: It is hard to believe that popular prophets at the close of 1959 were hailing this now faded decade the Golden, Sixties. The label no doubt was another of those triumphs of hope over experience without which the human race might find it hard to keep going. But it had a certain plausibility, too.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
Mississippi Adds 3 Negroes to Storm Relief Unit
description: GULFPORT, Miss., Dec. 31 Gov. John Bell Williams bowed to pressure from many sources today and appointed three Negroes to a previously all white panel that had been set up to control all Federal money for the redevelopment of the section of the Mississippi Gulf Coast ravaged last summer by Hurricane Camille.

title: I.C.C. AIDE IS NAMED AS ACTING CHAIRMAN
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Dec. 31President Nixon today des ignated a member of the In terstate Commerce Commis sion, George M. Stafford, as acting chairman of the 11mem ber commission, pending the appointment of a new perma nent chairman of the reorgan ized agency.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor:

title: TRAFFIC SNARLED BY FREEZING RAIN
description: Sleet and freezing rain coated the metropolitan area with a slick film of ice yester day, causing snarls in highway and rail transportation as well as slippery inconvenience to pedestrians.

title: BUSINESS TAX BILLS SIGNED BY SHAFER
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Dec. 31 The Legislature approved a $255million business tax pack age today, ending a yearlong deadlock over the state budget for the current fiscal year.

title: Article 4  No Title
CIGARETTE MAKER LOSES COURT TEST
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31The manufacturer of Pall Mall Gold and Silva Thin cigarettes lost the last of three preliminary skirmishes today in a court cat tle in defense of television com mercials that the Federal Trade Commission had branded as misleading.

title: Builder Is Accused of Perjury In CityPlanning Bribery Case
description: Melvyn Kaufman, a builder and owner of Manhattan office buildings, was arrested yester day on charges of firstdegree perjury arising from an alleged effort to bribe a member of the City Planning Commission.

title: Quadrille Ball Funds to Go to 2 Groups
description: Proceeds from the Quadrille Ball, to be held at the Ameri cana on Jan. 16, will be di vided between the German istic Society of America and the Institute of International Education for a scholarship fund for the exchange of American and German grad uate students. Mrs. Peter J. Kessler is chairman for the 10th annual event, which is under the sponsorship of Lutt hansa German Air Lines.

title: Hawks Defeat Bullets
Few U.S. Blacks Migrate
description: VANDERHOOF, B.C., Few American Negroes have migrated to Canada, whose population is less than 1 per cent black, and few of the draft evaders and deserters are black. On the other hand, a number of American Negro athletes who came to Canada toplay professional football have settled here.

title: Dr. Theodor Reik, Freud Protege, Is Dead at 81
description: Dr. Theodor Reik, one of the first students of Sigmund Freud and later the author of many books on psychoanalysis includ ing Listening With the Third Ear, died yesterday at the age of 81 in Montefiore Hospital, the Bronx.

title: JANICE WINTERLING
description: Mrs. Janice Siesel Winterling, a Westchester realestate deal er, died yesterday in her home on East Middle Road in Bedford Village. She was 53 years old, and was the wife of Henry F. Winterling.

title: Richard Frankenfelder, Beauty Chain Executive
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 31 Richard Frankenfelder died at his home here last night. Until his retirement in 1959 he was executive vice president of Cameo Beauty Departments, a chain of concessions, later merged into Seligman & Latz, Inc. He was 68 years, old and lived at 10 Old Mamaroneck Road.

title: LEE SHIPPEY, WROTE CALIFORNIA COLUMN
description: Lee Shippey, a newspaper columnist and author, died Tuesday in a nursing home in Encinitas, Calif., after a long illness. He was 86 years old.

title: Queen's Honors List Changes Name On the Marquee to Sir Noel Coward
description: LONDON, Thursday, Jan. 1 Nol Coward, the 70yearold playwright, composer and actor who says he keeps fit on lots of aspirin and marrons glars, received a knighthood on the New Year's honors lists issued today by Prime Minister Wilson.

title: In The Nation: The Devil and Dean Rusk
description: WASHINGTON, Dec.31The old year, going its unmourned way amid so many clamors and defeats, closed on at least one note of welcome generosity. After a year in intellectual and political exile, former Secretary of State Dean Rusk is, as he puts it, going home to Georgia as a member of that state's university faculty.

title: Braves Report a Profit
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 31 (UPI) The baseball Atlanta Braves Made a net profit of $347,000 in 1969, with the National League playoff against the New York Mets a major con tributing factor. Bill Bar ??holomay, the president also an bounced today that the Atlanta Chiefs soccer team, a sub sidiary of the Braves, had reduced its losses to approx imately $200,000.

title: 2 FamousName Ships Face New Careers
description: The end of the line as ac tive ships does not spell the end of useful life for two ves sels that evoke memories of the old days here and at Bos ton.

title: 2 HOUSING MEN GET HEAT SUMMONSES
description: Criminal summonses for two city housing officials have been obtained by tenants or a South Bronx apartment house that has allegedly been without heat for more than a month.

title: LINDSAY IS ACCUSED IN PROTEST CLASH
description: The national director of the Jewish Defense League charged yesterday that Mayor Lindsay's office was responsible for the league's confrontation with the police Tuesday night outside the Soviet Mission to the United Nations.

title: Market Place
description: PETER L. BERNSTEIN, au thor, lecturer on finance and investment management consultant, believes that the wrong question is being asked about the economy.

title: Article 3  No Title
India's New Hope Fades
description: The first session of Indian Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's New Congress party in Bombay did lithe to fulfill the promise of a more vigorous drive for social and economic progress that Mrs. Gandhi made when she broke with the old guard of the Congress party earlier last year.

title: Painting of Young Mao Is Removed in Vatican
description: ROME, Dec. 31The pic ttite of Mao Tsetung as a young man disappeared to day from a wall of the Vati can presi room, where it had hung for about six weeks.

title: YIPPIE DENIES BID TO KIDNAP OFFICER
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 31Despite vigorous protests by defense at torneys, Abbie Hoffman was questioned closely today about his alleged plan to kidnap a highranking Chicago police of ficial.

title: Athlete Files for Bankruptcy
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 31 (UPI) Jerry Lucas, the professional basketball star, has filed a petition for bankruptcy listing personal debts of $721,814 and assets of $363,707. Mrs. Treva Lucas, his wife, also filed a bankruptcy petition, and one was filed in behalf of his restaurant chain. Mrs. Lucas listed personal debts of $691, 500 and assets of $6,207. The restaurant chain, Jerry Lucas Beef n'Shakes, Inc., listed debts of $822,679 and assets of $438,500.

title: FAIR HOUSING LAW HELD INEFFECTIVE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31 William Hamilton, a Cleveland real estate dealer, says the 1968 Federal Fair Housing Act has made little or no difference in getting Negroes into the nearly allwhite suburbs that ring Cleveland.

title: THIEU VICTORIOUS AS HOUSE SCORES 3
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 31After two days of boister ous debate, a narrow majority of the House of Representatives decided today that three of its members had engaged in pro Communist activities.

title: RCA Staff Increase Set
description: The RCA Corporation said yesterday that it expects to add up to 900 persons, primarily engineers and technicians, in the southern New Jersey area as a direct result of the recent receipt of a $253million con tract from the Navy.

title: BONDS RISE A BIT; TRYING YEAR ENDS
DIXIE DAVIS DIES; RACKETS LAWYER
description: BELAIR, Calif., Dec. 31 (UPI) J. Richard (Dixie) Davis, for mer New York gangland lawyer, died of a heart attack in his home here yesterday, after learning that two masked gun men had bound his wife and grandson and had stolen jewels, furs and cash. He was 65 years old.

title: CENTER HERE SEEKS MORE BLOOD DONORS
description: The Greater New York Blood Program appealed again yester day for volunteer donations to meet its seasonal shortage.

title: Europeans See U.S. Boon in Gold Pact; Special Drawing Rights to Begin Today
description: PARIS, Dec. 31  European central banking sources said today the most significant fea ture of a gold agreement be tween the International Mone tary Fund and South Africa was that it would ease pres sures on American gold re serves.

title: Divorce, California Style, Called A Reflection of the Restless West
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 31A new law goes into effect to morrow that will enable Cali fornia's 20 million residents one of every 10 Americansto gain a divorce virtually on de mand.

title: Worsley Considers Retiring Instead of Taking Demotion
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 31 AP) Lorne (Gump) Worsley, 40year old goalie of the Montreal Canadiens, has indicated he will retire rather than accept a de Motiou to a farm, team, Ole Na tional Hockey League club said today.

title: PENGUINS TOPPLE CANADIENS, 4 TO 2
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 31 (AP) Keith McCreary slammed in two goals as the Pittsburgh Penguins defeated the Montreal Canadians, 42, in a National Hockey League game tonight.

title: MRS. MENTSCHIKOFF
description: MIAMI, Dec. 31Mrs. Eu genie A. Mentschikoff of Chi cago died of a heart attack yes terday in Mercy Hospital here. She was 84 years old, the widow of Roman Mentschikoff.

title: Ice Reports for Harbor And Hudson Are Begun
description: The Coast Guard said yes terday that its annual winter ice reporting service had be come operational.

title: ALLEN TO WIDEN EDUCATION'S ROLE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31Dr. James E. Allen Jr., the United States Commissioner of Educa tion, said today that his per goal for 1970 was to lead education to the top of domes tic priorities within the Nixon Administration.

title: Dickey Receives A 5Year Contract To Coach Florida
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Dec. 31 (AP)Doug Dickey accepted a fiveyear contract as Florida's football coach today after re signing as coach at Tennessee.

title: Chase Manhattan Reorganizes Top Ranks
description: In an internal reorganization at the Chase Manhattan Bank, David Rockefeller has decided to assume the role of elder statesman, while retaining the title of chairman and chief ex ecutive officer. He became chairman last March.

title: Press Institute Calls Criticism by Agnew Major Threat in '69
description: GENEVA, Dec. 31Vice President Agnew's attacks on newspapers and television were 1969's most serious threat to the freedom of information in the Western World, the Inter national Press Institute said today.

title: Some Whoop It Up, Some Sleep
description: There is no book of rules, band Certainly no con sensus, on how human beings should change Years. If there were, violations would have been rampant here last night.

title: Vietnam Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31 (AP) The Pentagon today identi fied the following servicemen from the New York area as having been lied in Vietnam:

title: Business Records BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS
description: Monday, Dec. 29, 1969

title: Questions on Songmy
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31  Each soldier, as he arrives in Vietnam for a tour of duty, is handed a small white card that he is instructed to study and carry with him at all times.

title: Happier Year for the Neediest
description: One of the most telling criticisms of the Affluent Society is the extent to which its mechanical arrange ments conceal from the comfortable the sight of the poor. The insulated life of suburbanites, the car or train that whizzes them into the city with only the flashing glimpse of a slum, the superhighway that can take them across the country in the almost exclusive company of other moteldwellersall this has spared upper and middleclass Americans the smell of pov erty, which they knew when rich and poor once shared the same community. Too often the change has turned charity from a personal feeling into a slightly chilly exercise in social science.

title: CHINA HAILS EVENTS IN '69 IN 3 NATIONS
description: PEKING, Dec. 31 (Agence FrancePresse)  The official newspaper Jenmin Jih Pao played up what it termed were revolutionary developments this year in three capitalist countries, France, Japan and the United States.

title: Top State Court Allows Appeal Of Reversal inCrimmins Case
description: Chief Judge Stanley H. Fuld, of the Court of Appeals, New York State's highest court, gave the Queens prosecutor yester day the right to appeal the Ap pellate Division's reversal of the 1968 manslaughter conviction of Mrs. Alice Crimmins in the strangling of her 4yearold daughter, Alice Marie.

title: Inter American Bank Loans Made to 3 Latin Nations
description: The Inter American Bank an nounced yesterday it had ap proved loans totaling $96.4mil lion to help finance projects designed to improve transpor tation in Argentina, Mexico and Paraguay.

title: CASTLETON SEEKS BUYER FOR BANKS
description: Castleton Industries, a diver sified company based in Boca Raton, Fla., is engaged in nego tiations seeking disposal of its banking interests valued at an estimated $12million.

title: Thomas Steiner Engaged to Wed Miss Grimmett
description: ROCHESTER, Dec. 31Mr. and Mrs. Clarence A. Grim mett Jr. have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Rebecca Grimmett, to Thomas Daniel Steiner, son of Dr. and Mrs. S. Daniel Steiner of Bloomfield Hills, Mich.

title: Mrs. Nancy Becker Is Remarried
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Dec. 31Mrs. Nancy Mills Becker was married at noon today to Dr. Robert L. Fardelmann, a surgeon.

title: MEXICOU.S. SPLIT ON SULPHUR WIDER
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 31 (UPI) The second largest sulphur producer in Mexico, Compania de Azufre de Veracruz, S.A., a subsidiary of the Gulf Resources and Chemical Corporation of Houston, will shut down oper ations tomorrow.

title: BERNARD FEINSMITH
description: Bernard Feinstein, an artist, died Dec. 20 of a heart attack at his home, 501 Surf Avenue, in the West Brighton section of Brooklyn. He was 64 years old.

title: Annual Bal Blanc Planned for Jan. 13
description: The 21st annual Bal Blanc, at which members of the lo cal Russian colony and their friends ring in the New Year according to the Russian cal endar, will be held on Jan. 13 in the St. RegisSheraton Roof.

title: Sports of The Times
description: HAPPY NEW YEAR to anyone who pays attention to children Marvelous Mary Throneberry said: Some tunes I get letters from people who say I'm their favorite ballplayer. They tell me how much they enjoy watching me play for the Mets in the Polo Grounds, then, at the bottom of the letter, they say they're 7 years old. They weren't even born when I played. But thew I know I have my fans, and I'll always have my fans, because fathers will hand it down to sons, and the sons will hand it down to their sons. And Pete Rozelle, Commissioner of Football, who tells of the young son of Lamar Hunt, president of the Kansas City Chiefs, who was playing one day with a small, extremely lively black rubber bali that bounced into his daddy's lap. His daddy asked, What's that? And young Hunt said, A super ball. And so the name of the A.F.L.N.F.L. world cham pionship game was changed to guess what.

title: N.Y.A.C. OARSMEN WIN BRONX RACE
description: Ted Bonanno of Marietta College stroked the New York Athletic Club senior eightoared shell to a onethird length vic tory over the West Side Row ing Club of Buffalo, on the Orchard Beach Lagoon yester day in the sixth annual New Year's Eve Regatta of the New York Rowing Association.

title: Diplomats Facing Ouster
description: PARIS, Dec. 31France sus pended two high defense offi cials and ordered the recall of Israeli diplomats today as five French  built gunboats entered the Israeli port of Haifa.

title: Honeywell Forms Divisions To Speed Computer Growth
description: Honeywell, Inc., announced yesterday the formation of three new divisions aimed at speeding the company's growth in the computercommunica tions and dataproducts fields.

title: Personal Finance
description: Group life insurance, which often constitutes the largest part of an individual's poten tial estate, has a brand new tax aspect. And since many people don't realize this, a good New Year's resolution for an employe would be, to investigate it.

title: Nicklaus, Kathy Whitworth Win 1969 Pro Golf Awards
description: NORWALK, Conn., Dec. 31 (UPI)On the basis of con sistent high performances, Jack Nicklaus and Kathy Whit worth were the top profession al golfers of 1969, a golf maga zine said today.

title: Sarah Oliver To Be Bride
description: WHEELING, W. Va., Dec. 31Miss Sarah Louise, Oliver and John Stanley Bodikin Jr., 1969 graduates of Wheeling College, have set June 27 for the date of their wedding.

title: Turning Out Championship Dogs Comes Natural to a Geneticist
description: IN 1956 Joyce ScottPaine visited her native England, where she bought an English cocker spaniel, Ricmour Crys tal Dawn. On the voyage home, she recalled, I was trying to think of a good call name for her. Another pas senger suggested Folly. Now I have 40 dogs at my Ancram Kennels. Perhaps I should have called the kennel ScottPaine's Fol ly However, it is scarcely that, for Ancram has turned out six champions, one of whom Ancram's Simon was the topwinning representative of his breed in America for 1969.

title: New Knight Recalls His 30 Loan to Start U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 31Among the many on Queen Elizabeth's New Year's honors list was David Owen, a Welsh economist who financed the early days of United Na tions operations with a 30 loan from his London bank account.

title: City Greets New Decade With Partying and Prayer
description: Lowering skies, slushy streets and the threat of a transit strike notwithstanding, there were heightened holiday spirits in the city last night as New Yorkers gaily greeted a new year and a new decade. Beginning. with early midday closing of many stores and offices, and rising as laughter spilled out onto the sidewalks through the rapidly spinning doors of midtown bars and taverns, an air of dogged good cheer seemed to spread out over the city.

title: ExMayor of Syracuse Named to P.S.C.
description: Governor Rockefeller an nounced yesterday his appoint ment of William F. Walsh, whose term as Mayor of Syra cuse expired last night, as a member of the State Public Service Commission.

title: Books of The Times
description: FROM THE CRASH TO BLITZ 19291939. The New York Times Chronicle of American Life. By Cabell Phillips. Produced and art directed by Harris Lewine. 596 pages. Mac millan. $12.50.

title: HAVLICEK, NELSON, SANDERS SET PACE
description: BOSTON, Dec. 31 (AP)John Havlicek, Tom Sanders and Don Nelson sparked a strong fourth period rally today as the Boston Celtics overcame an 8point def icit and went on to a 124121 National Basketball Association victory over the Detroit Pistons.

title: TRANSIT PARLEY PRESSED; 12% PAYINCREASE OFFER IS TURNED DOWN BY UNIONS
description: The city's critical transit ne gotiations moved toward a climax early this morning, but the 20cent fare already ap peared doomed.

title: Plan Stirs Optimism
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec, 31  Mr. Bechtle, a 41yearold native of Philadelphia who was named United States At torney for Eastern Pennsyl vania last May, said he hoped that the clearance of tradi tional Federal court district boundaries would help law en forcement in the Philadelphia CamdenSouth Jersey area.

title: WESTERN ELECTRIC GETS RADAR ORDER
description: The Western Electric Com pany, the manufacturing and supply arm of the American Telephone and Telegraph Com pany, has received a $230,400, 000 Army contract for radar for the Safeguard antiballistic mis sile system.

title: 76ers Rout Bulls, 129109
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 31 (UPI)  Archie Clark and Hal Greer set the pace today as the Philadelphia 76ers used a 34 point third quarter to defeat the Chicago Bulls, 129109, in a Na tional Basketball Association game. The loss was the fifth in, a row for Chicago.

title: New Year's Day
description: Today is New Year's Day. Following is a list of services that are affected.

title: For Japan, Musical Gone With Wind
description: TOKYO, Dec. 31The whole idea of creating a show, of creating a musical, is new here in Japan, Joe Layton, the Broadway direc tor and choreographer, mused during a break between re hearsals at the T.B.S. televi sion studios the other day. That's why this is such a challenging assignment, he said.

title: U.S. Population Shows Gain of 2 Million in '69
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31 (UPI) The Government said to day that the United States would begin the new year with a population of 204,334, 344a gain of 2,067,000 in, 1969.

title: U.S. HEALTH UNITS FACE SLIM BUDGET
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31  Another hungry year appears to lie ahead for the Federal health budget.

title: U.S. Brigade Uses Unusual Methods to Stress Hamlet Security
description: BONGSON, South Vietnam, Dec. 29I emphasize to my troops that we no longer are preoccupied with chasing and killing the Vietcong and North Vietnamese Army in unpopulat ed jungle and mountain areas. More important, body count is no longer the criteria for suc cess.

title: Sports Today
description: FOOTBALL

title: LONGHORNS COUNT ON RUNNING GAME
description: DALLAS, Dec. 31The eyes of Texas will be focused upon the 34th Cotton Bowl game tomorrow afternoon between the unbeaten Longhorns and Notre Dame.

title: Mayor Lindsay's Second Term
description: With rain and sleet slanting through the bitter cold and the still unresolved threat of another subway strike making the outlook even drearier, Mayor Lind say nonetheless sounded cautiously optimistic in tak ing the oath of office for a second term on the City Hall steps yesterday. The themes in his inaugural address were the ones that had carried him to surprise victory in his reelection campaign. They are good themes, in need of reinforcement by legislative and administrative action and by general public support.

title: Jimi Hendrix Blasts The Old Year Out With Space Rock
description: Jimi Hendrix, a New Year's Eve noisemaker if ever there was one, played to a capacity crowd last night at the Fillmore East.

title: R. TRENO, EDITOR OF PARIS WEEKLY
description: PARIS, Dec. 31R. Treno, publisher and editor of one of the world's most successful sa tirical journals, Le Canard En chaine, died today following an operation. Mr. Treno, whose real name was Ernest Raynaud, was 68 years old.

title: Gifts Help Brighten Dark Future Faced. By Neediest in City
description: It's New Year's Day and thousands of people cele brated the passing of the old year with friends and loved ones. In nightclubs and homes throughout the coun try enthusiastic crowds toasted the new year and honed for better days.

title: Card of Thanks
description: STEINHerman. The family of the late Her man Stein wishes to thank the many relatives, friends and neighbors, for their expressions of sympathy In our recent loss.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
NEW DELAY ASKED IN DESEGREGATION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31  The Justice Department asked the Supreme Court today to give school systems in six Deep South states until next fall to desegregate their class rooms.

title: 6Hour Police Siege Ends in Death for Harlemite
description: Johnny Hill, a troubled, 38 yearold meatmarket clerk, died yesterday In his Harlem tenement apartment, the target of a sixhour police siege after he had fired a shot through the door at two patrolmen.

title: Resourceful Israeli Admiral
description: WHEN he was 21 years old Mordechai Limon, sea captain and commando, was organizing the illegal entry of thousands of Jewish ref ugees fresh from Nazi con centration camps into Pales tine along the dark, desented Mediterranean coast beaches.

title: C.B.S. Radio Stations Go To AllNews Next Monday
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System's four owned radio sta tions, in New York, Chicago, Los Angeles and San Francisco, will begin broadcasting news on a roundtheclock basis next Monday.

title: A Busy New Year's Eve For Transit Negotiators
description: At this stage there are no periods when we sit and wait. It we're not talking to negotia tors or to Mayor Lindsay, we're talking among ourselves.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: FICTION

title: Proxmire Sees a $3.6Billion Poseidon Overrun
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31 (AP)Senator William Prox mire, Democrat of Wisconsin, said today that the Navy's Pos eidon nuclear missile program had developed a $3.6billion cost overrun.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, JANUARY 1, 1970

title: Lincoln Downs in Black
description: LINCOLN, R. I., Dec. 31 (AP) The Burrillville Racing Asso ciatibn, operators of the Lin coln Downs race track, re ported yesterday a net income of $806,402 in the fiscal year ended Aug. 31, compared with a loss of $705,806 the previous year.

title: Abrams Has Pneumonia, But Condition Is Improving
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 31 (AP)Gen. Creighton W. Abrams, the commander of United States forces in Viet nam, is suffering from pneu monia but is making quite pro gressive improvement, Army medical authorities said today.

title: Hex Signs, for Making the Sun Shine, Warding Off Evilor Just for Decoration
description: THEY may never be big in New York, although there are a few on Fire Is land, but out in the hinter lands, hex signs have be come popular in both inte rior and exterior dcor.

title: Patman and Meany Assail Rise by U.S. In Mortgage Rates
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31 (AP) Congressional investigations and legislative action were promised today in the wake of an announced increase in the maximum interest rate on Gov ernmentbacked home mort gages.

title: Canadian Bill Rates Rise
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 30 (Canadian Press)The Government today auctioned $125million of new 91day Treasury bills at an average price of 98.090 and average yield of 7.81 per cent, compared with last week's same amount of 92day bills at 98.097 and 7.77 per cent. To day's $30million of 182day bills brought 96.220 and 7.88 per cent, against last week's same amount of 184day bills lat 96.199 and 7.84 per cent.

title: COMMODITIES SET A VOLUME RECORD
description: Commodity futures traders left yesterday on a fourday New Year's holiday, following a shortened trading session on most exchanges.

title: SHANKER ASKS COURT. TO RESTUDY RULING
description: Albert Shanker, president of the United Federation of Teach ers, yesterday asked the State Supreme Court to reconsider the 15day jail sentence and $250 fine handed him as a re sult of the 1968 teschers' strike.

title: Executive Changes
description: Dr. J. C. Sluder has been appointed executive vice president of the Nestle Company, Inc., White Plains, N. Y.

title: CONGOBRAZZAVILLE A PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC
description: BRAZZAVILLE, Republic of the Congo, Dec. 31, (Agence FrancePresse)This leftist na tion today changed its name to the People's Republic of the Congo. The Internationale becomes its national anthem.

title: CESAR A. CALDERON
description: Csar A. Caldern, a director of the Commonwealth Oil Re fining Company, Inc., of Puer to Rico, since 1961, died Sun day in San Juan. He was 54 years old.

title: NEW GAIN POSTED FOR FARM PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31 (UPI)Farm prices ended the year on a rising note by regis tering an increase of onethird of 1 per cent for the month ended Dec. 15  the highest level since September, 1952 the Agriculture Department re ported today.

title: Lanier's Performance Is Talk of the Tournaments
description: Spectacular individual per formances, basically formful results and one major local disappointment marked the conclusion of college basket ball's holiday  tournament orgy Tuesday night.

title: RANGERS WILL PLAY 3 MORE DAY GAMES
description: The New York Rangers have revised their schedule for three home games, Emile Francis, coach and general manager of the club, said yesterday. Origi nally slated for the evening, the games will be played in the afternoon, each starting at 2:05 o'clock.

title: Envoy's Biting Views Of U.S. Aides in '39 Disclosed by London
description: LONDON, Dec. 31Biting as sessments of leading Americans made by the British Ambassa dor to Washington just before the outbreak of World War II in 1939 were disclosed today in hitherto secret Foreign Office documents.

title: 2 WALL ST. HOUSES APPOINT EXECUTIVES
description: Toplevel executive appoint ments were announced yester day by two of Wall Street's largest brokerage houses.

title: Article 5  No Title
Vessels Greeted in Haifa
description: HAIFA, Israel, Dec. 31  Five unarmed gunboats ended a 3,000mile journey from Cherbourg, France, here to night but their arrival did little to unravel the mystery of their departure.

title: Winds Balk Teton Climbers
description: MOOSE, Wyo., Dec. 31 (AP) Bitter cold and high winds have prevented Paul Petzoldt and his mountain climbing party from reaching the summit of Grand Teton Peak.

title: PAN AM ASSUMES TETERBORO ROLE
description: After five years of negotia tions, Pan American World Airways will finally take over operation of Teterboro Airport, starting today.

title: U.S. Treasury to Receive $850Million, Biggest Single Allocation
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31  The Treasury will receive to morrow a New Year's gift of about $850million of brand new, usable international money.

title: MICHIGAN IS PICK OVER U.S.C. TODAY
Beatrice Foods Profits Up 16% As Sales Advance to a Record
DRAFT LOTTERY PLAN TO GET A COURT TEST
description: MADISON, Wisc., Dec. 31 Federal Judge. James E. Doyle denied today a request for a temporary injunction to re strain the Selective Service from drafting men under the new lottery plan. Judge Doyle, however, denied a motion by Government lawyers to dismiss the suit, which charges the lot tery is biased against men whose birthdays fall late in the year.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON SHOW FIRM TREND
description: Prices on the London Stock Exchange were firm yesterday as interest was still centered on Australian nickel issues.

title: Transit Agency Begins To Lay In New Tokens
description: Preparing for a possible rise in the subway fare, the Transit Authority has already begun moving new tokens from storage in the Navy Yard and other places to its headquarters at 370 Jay Street in Brooklyn.

title: SEALE'S EXTRADITION IS BACKED BY REAGAN
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 31  Gov. Ronald Reagan to day granted the State of Con necticut's request for the ex tradition of the Black Panther leader Bobby G. Seale on kid napping and murder charges.

title: New York A.C. Wins Playoff For Water Polo Title, 116
description: SAN JUAN, Dec. 31 (AP) The New York Athletic Club team won the third annual in vitation water polo champion ship today, defeating Ja maica, 116, in a suddendeath playoff game.

title: Observer: Another Last Roundup
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31  Welcome, fellow sufferers, to yet another depressing decade end roundup. Here with me to round it up in terms that will make us all sorry we were ever born is a panel of distin guished correspondents. Could we start off, Bucky Shores, with some peculiarly depressing ob servations from you?

title: CHRYSLER RULES OUT EXECUTIVE BONUSES
description: DETROIT, Dec. 31 (AP)The Chrysler Corporation, whose earnings hit a new sevenyear low for the third quarter, will pay no executive bonuses for 1969.

title: TKACZUK, RATELLE TALLY FOR VICTORS
description: When it appeared the Rangers would be shut out for the first time in 100 games, they turned a brutal scoreless duel around last night to score a 21 victory over the Chicago Black Hawks.

title: WarnerLambert Fills 3 Consumer Positions
description: Three major promotions within the consumer products group of the WarnerLambert Pharmaceutical Company were announced yesterday by Robert T. Wieringa, group president.

title: Snow Ties Up Autostrada
description: ROME, Dec. 31 (Reuters) Overnight snow stranded many cars today on Italy's north south superhighway. The Auto strada del Sole, between Milan and Rome. The snow was up to 8 inches deep In the Bologna area, and about 20 inches in the surrounding mountains.

title: Strike at Puerto Rico Plant
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Dec. 31 (UPI)Construction workers building the $125million Sun Oil petrochemical complex at Yabucoa went on strike today in a dispute with the contrac tors.

title: Music: Nelson Freire Finally Arrives
description: ONE of the consistent prizewinners of the last decade has been the Brazil ian pianist Nelson Freire. He is now 25 years old and much talkedabout, and he was launched in this country by an album of concerto recordings. Last night he finally made his first New York appearance, playing the Rachmaninoff Piano Concerto No. 4 with the New York Philharmonic under Rafael Frhbeck De Burgos.

title: Nation Is Urged to Set Policy on Synthetic Foods
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31A nation whose diet is already nearly half composed of proc essed or synthetic food must develop a comprehensive policy regarding the breadness of bread and the meatness of meat, President Nixon has been told.

title: Agnew Arrives in Vietnam for a OneDay Visit
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Jan. 1  Vice Presi dent Agnew flew to Saigon un anounced this morning for a oneday visit to the nation whose lengthy war stimulated the Nixon doctrine of Asian selfreliance.

title: Well Produces Oil and Gas
description: The Hamilton Brothers Petro leum Corporation and the Ham ilton Brothers Oil Company an nounced yesterday at Denver, Colo., that the Shell Johnston well No. 2 in the Goodwater Field in Mississippi had been completed and was flowing oil at a rate of 1,000 barrels a day. The well is also producing 750, 000 cubic feet of gas a day.

title: Nixon Signs Aid Authorization; Pledges Revision of Program
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Dec. 31President Nixon signed the $1.9billion foreign aid authori zation bill today but promised extensive renovation of the program in the years ahead.

title: ARKANSAS CHOICE OVER MISSISSIPPI
HOUSTON CRUSHES AUBURN, 36 TO 7
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 31 (UPI) Jim Strong ran for 184 yards and two touchdowns to lead the University of Houston to a 367 victory over Auburn to night in the 11th annual Astro Bluebonnet Bowl game.

title: 30 Major Clashes Mar Vietnam Truce
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Jan. 1A proclaimed 24hour allied ceasefire for New Year's was, shattered last night by 30 significant viola tions that the United States command said claimed the lives of five American soldiers and 40 of the enemy.

title: Bridal Planned By Miss Shafer
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Dec. 31  Dr. and Mrs. Donald McKay Shafer have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Nancy Brady Shafer, to William Arthur Beale. His parents are Mrs. William Nelson Beale Jr. of Baltimore and the late Commander Beale, U.S.N.

title: C.B.S. ASKS CHANGE IN MUSIC PAYMENTS
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System petitioned the United States District Court yesterday for permission to pay for such music as it uses of the Ameri can Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers and Broadcast Music, Incorporated rather than pay an overall per centage of the network's net gross.

title: Front Page 3  No Title
Suspect Admits Telling F.B.I. How He Bombed Buildings Here
description: The reputed leader of an East Village radical group testified in Federal Court yes terday that he had made, dam aging admissions to the Fed eral Bureau of Investigation about bombing Federal prop lefty.

title: RICHARD BENOIT, 71 WROTE LAW TEXTS
description: Richard L. Benoit, an author and editor of law textbooks, died Tuesday at his home in New Hartford, N. Y., near Utica. He was 71 years old and lived in New York until he re tired last year.

title: Israeli Warplanes Strike At Targets Across Canal
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 31 (Reuters) Israeli warplanes today flew across the Suez Canal to strike at Egyptian military targets in the region of Suez at the south ern end of the waterway, a military spokesman announced here.

title: Americans Move to Canada in Record Numbers
description: VANDERHOOF, B. C.  Americans, some of them restless, landhungry or polit ically disillusioned, have been moving to Canada in record numbers.

title: 2 Held in Narcotics Raid
description: Four policemen dressed like collegians raided a Crown Heights apartment in Brooklyn last night and confiscated what they believed to he heroin and cocaine, as well as two pistols. An 18yearold student, Gene Colman, and his aunt, Mrs. Edith Colman, the owner of the apartment at 1092 Presi dent Street, were booked on charges of possessing drugs and dangerous weapons.

title: Bridge
description: SELECTING the best tourna ment performers in a calendar year is a difficult task. Perhaps the best cri terion is the three major na tional championships, and on this basis the honors for1969 go to three New York ex perts.

title: EXECUTIVE INDICTED IN GARAGE SLAYING
description: Louis d'Almeida, a corpora tion executive, was indicted yes terday in the death of a 20year old youth in a private sixcar garage at 160 East 82d Street last Oct. 2.

title: VICTORY CLAIMED BY SOUTH AFRICA
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Dec. 31Finance Minister Ni colaas Diederichs declared victory for South African gold in a statement today outlining the new gold marketing ar rangement endorsed by the International Monetary Fund.

title: Austrian Theater Administration Names New Chief
description: Dr. Gottfried Heindl, for the last three years director of the Austrian Cultural In stitute in New York City, has been named chief of the Austrian State Theater Ad ministration.

title: The 1960's: Haute Cuisine sn America
description: IN ALMOST every respect where food is concerned, the past decade was by far the most impressive since the one that produced the Boston tea party.

title: American Museum Restricts Children
description: The American Museum of Natural History announced yes terday a new and more restric tive admissions policy that will bar all children under the age of 18 from the museum on school days unless they are accompanied by an adult.

title: Washington: For the Record
Chess
description: ALTHOUGH the Rev. Wil liam James Lombardy of St. Mary's Church, the Bronx, did not take first place in the recent United States championship in New York, the 32yearold grandmaster recorded an impressive per formance in the 12man roundrobin.

title: Lawyer to Head Panther Inquest As Chicago Coroner Steps Aside
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 31Cook County Coroner Andrew J. To man today appointed Martin S. Gerber, a former Assistant United States Attorney, as a specialty deputy coroner to preside over an inquest into the shooting of two Black Panther leaders on Dec. 4.

title: PEPSICO IS LOSER IN BREWERY SUIT
description: A Federal Judge here yester day dismissed the complaint by Pepsico, Inc., against W. R. grace & Co. and Philip Morris, Inc., over the sale of Grace's 53 per cent interest in Miller Brewing Company to the ciga rette manufacturer.

title: Western Financial on Amex
description: The common shares of the Western Financial Corporation, the holding company for the Western Savings and Loan As sociation, will start trading Jan. 20 on the American Stock Exchange.

title: DR. ELMER ARNDT, 61, CHURCHMAN, DEAD
description: The Rev. Dr. Elmer J. F. Arndt, head of the Theological Commission of the United Church of Christ and a profes sor at the Eden Theological Seminary in St. Louis, died Tuesday evening in a St. Louis hospital after a long illness. He was 61 years old.

title: Entertainment Events
description: Opera

title: LACEY IS PLANNING TO ABET SEYMOUR
description: NEWARK, Dec. 31  The United States Attorney for New Jersey, Frederick B. Lacey, said today that he would seek a meeting with Whitney North Seymour Jr. as soon as Mr. Sey mour took office as the United States Attorney for New York's Southern District. The purpose of the meeting would be to map a joint strategy for investigat ing interstate organized crime.

title: TUESDAY NIGHT FIGHTS
description: San Antonio, Tex.Jesus Pi mentel, 115 pounds, Jallsco, Mexico; knocked out Cuervo Denitez, 115, Reynosa, Mexico, 2d round, to retain his bantam weight title.

title: Stocks Show Advance on Amex As Tape Lags in Heavy Trading
description: The American Stock Exchange ended the year in a bullish manner yesterday as the list advanced on the largest daily volume in the exchange's history. Turnover was so heavy that the exchange's highspeed ticker tape was 24 minutes late at the final bell. This was the longest the tape has been delayed since it was installed in January, 1968. The tape prints 900 charac ters a minute.

title: MEDIATORS ENTER COAST TRACK STRIKE
description: ARCADIA, Calif. Dec. 31 (UPI)Renewed negotiations to end a strike of service employes against. Santa Anita and Bay Meadows get under way Friday under the auspices of the Cali fornia State Conciliation Serv ice, amnion spokesman, said to day.

title: Francis J. Scanlon to Marry Miss Pauline Adoue on Feb. 14
description: RYE, N. Y., Dec. 31Miss Pauline Adoue and Francis J. Scanlon, will be married Feb. 14 in Bennington, Vt., where they are serving as VISTA volunteers.

title: PRINCETON LOSES TO MICNIGAN, 8072
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Dec. 31 (AP)Trailing by as many as 16 points in the first half, the University of Michigan used fullcourt press in the second half and went on to register an 8072 victory over Princeton tonight in a nonconference basketball game.

title: Professor Rusk
description: The confirmation of Dean Rusk's appointment to chair of international law at the University of Georgia represents a victory for the institution's academic leadership over the forces of bigotry. One need not agree with the policies Mr. Rusk espoused as Secretary of State to recognize his eminent intellectual qualifica tions or the extent to which these were buttressed by extraordinary experience and unassailable integrity.

title: 3 LEADS IN TOSCA EXCEL IN ROLES
description: The Metropolitan Opera cer tainly had its share of trouble in 1969, but as the year ended last night the company put on a performance of Puccini's Tosca that showed no signs of strife.

title: Senator Visits Vietnam
description: SAIGON, Dec. 31 (AP)Sen ator Harrison A. Williams Jr., Democrat of New Jersey, made ark unannounced visit to South Vietnam over the Christmas holidays and left Monday, a United States Embassy spokes man said today. Senator Wil liams made the trip partly to investigate black market cur rency manipulations, the sub ject of recent Senate hearings, the spokesman said.

title: LINDSAY, GARELIK AND BEAME SWORN IN ONE CEREMONY
description: John Vliet Lindsay was sworn in for a second term as Mayor in an icy, needle sharp rain on the City Hall steps yesterday, at noonday ceremonies that stressed hu mility and conciliation.

title: U.S. FORMS PANEL FOR MISSISSIPPI
description: JACKSON, Miss., Dec. 31 A Federal task force is form ing here in preparation for the opening Monday of more than 200 public schools ordered to integrate their classrooms com pletely.

title: Students Study Skiing at Jersey Areas
description: McAFEE, N. J., Dec. 31 Instate skiing appears to be the inthing for many of northern New Jersey's school set.

title: Article 2  No Title
Prayer Ban to Be Appealed
description: UNIONTOWN, Pa., Dec. 31 (AP)  Directors of a rural school district have voted un animously to appeal a Federal court order banning daily classroom prayer and Bible reading. The vote by the Ai bert Gallatin school board was taken last night before a crowd of citizens who had been urging a court fight since the order was handed down in Pittsburgh two weeks ago.

title: Rare 1Cent Stamp of 1856 Will Go on Block Here
description: One of the rarest artifacts in the world and, for its size and weight, conceivably the costliest, will be sold here in March.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: SOME 1970 resolutions for guilty sportsmen:

title: SOVIET DENIES PEROT A VISA TO SEND GIFTS
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Dec. 31The Texas industrial ist H. Ross Perot announced tonight that the Soviet Union would not allow him to enter the country to send supplies to American prisoners of war in North Vietnam.

title: Puerto Rico Gets Mass Car Insurance
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Dec. 31 On New Year's Day the island commonwealth of Puerto Rico becomes the fifth place in the world to adopt a compulsory auto accident compensation plan that covers the entire population.

title: Britain Makes Payment To U.S. on Postwar Loan
description: LONDON, Dec. 31 (Reuters)  The British Treasury an nounced today it had repaid $188.4million to the United States and Canada for postwar loans. The repayment amounted to $150million in interest and principal to the United States and $38.4million to Canada.

title: Text of the Lindsay Inaugural Speech
description: Following is the text of a transcript of Mayor Lindsay's inaugural address at City Hall yesterday, as recorded by The New York Times:

title: Article 1  No Title
S. E. C. ASKS DATA ON SELLING COSTS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission asked the nation's major stock exchanges today for more detailed information on their views of proposed changes in the commissions they charge.

title: Kenneth Hargreaves, 60, Motion Picture Executive
description: Kenneth N. Hargreaves, man aging director of Avco Embassy Pictures' British operations, died in a London hospital Sat urday.

title: Duke N. Stern to Wed Miss Susan Guernsey
description: RYE, N. Y., Dec. 31The engagement of Miss Susan Annan Guernsey to Duke Nordlinger Stern has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. David Taylor Guernsey of Rye and Edgartown, Mass, Her fianc is the son of Mrs. Antoinette Stern Ames of Chicago and the late Harold Gordon Stern of Richmond.

title: 2d Trial Is Ordered In Songmy Incident
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31 The Army announced today that it would try S. Sgt. David Mitchell on charges of assault with intent to murder 30 Viet namese civilians in connection with the alleged massacre at Songmy last year.

title: Theater: Twelfth Night by Students
FRANCE REPORTS MONETARY DECLINE
description: PARIS, Dec. 31 (Reuters)  French gold and foreign cur rency reserves declined by 719 million francs to 17.77billion francs in the week to Dec. 25, the Bank of France said today. This was the first decline in nine weeks, the bank said.

title: S.B.A. Insists Few Negro Areas Were Hit by Hurricane Camille
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31 Hilary Sandoval Jr., head of the Small Businets Administration, said today that the agency had approved $73million in disas ter relief to victims of Hurri cane Camille and that he ex pected the total to reach $200million.

title: NEW POLICY URGED FOR RURAL AREAS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31 (UPI) Secretary of Agriculture Clif ford M. Hardin called today for new national policies to promote unprecedented growth in rural areas.

title: NAMATH RENAIED MOST VALUABLE
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 31 (AP)Joe Namath, quarterback for the New York Jets, was named today the American Football League's most valua ble player for the second straight year by the league coaches.

title: INSPIRATION JOINS COPPER PRICE RISE
description: The Inspiration Consolidated Copper Company joined in the latest round of increases for basic copper prices yesterday, although two of the three major American producers con tinued to study the changes without matching them.

title: Ayub Says He's Quit Politics
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 31 (Reuters)Former President Mohammad Ayub Khan an nounced today that he has left politics for ever. The 63year old Mr. Ayuh was forced out of service last March after months of countrywide demon strations.

title: Vorster Rules Out Relaxation Of Apartheid Policy in Sports
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Dec. 31Prime Minister John Vorster dealt a blow to night to hopes for relaxation of apartheid in multiracial sport.

title: STOCK RALLY BIDS AULD LANG SYNE
Bud Grant Runs a Tight Ship To Put Vikings in Title Game
description: HARRY PETER (BUD) GRANT, coach of the new glamour tam of pro kings, is one of those tall, silent types with a hidden personality and aggravating selfcontrol. He likes crow shooting and family picnics (the Grants have six children), and he dislikes press confer ences, banquets and tobacco smoke.

title: Ohio School Board Keeps Band Out of Bowl Parade
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 31 (UPI)Members of the West High School band of Columbus, Ohio, quietly watched the Sugar Bowl parade in which they were supposed to march today.

title: Czechs Announce Another Party Purge
description: VIENNA, Dec. 31  The Czechoslovak Communist party announced today yet another broad purge to oust exponents of what it termed petit bour geois views in its ranks.

title: Salvatore Baccaloni, Basso Buffo, Dies
description: Salvatore Baccaloni, the pop ular bass who sang here with the Metropolitan Opera for 22 years, died last night at St. Clare's Hospital following de terioration of a number ?? organs. He was 69 years old.

title: Kyna Lynn Gould Prospective Bride
description: ALBANY, Dec. 31  Miss Kyna Lynn Gould, a sopho more at the H. Sophie New comb College of Tulane Uni versity, and Richard Lee Ep stein, a senior at Tulane, plan to be married next August.

title: Art in Brief: Norman McLaren and the Short Film
description: To Norman McLaren, brev ity is the soul of screen art. Eleven of his films are being shown in a 120minute pro gram at the Guggenheim Mu seum. Because of the public response, the museum has extended through January the weekend showings of short subjects by the Acad emy Award  winning film maker. The screenings are given at 2 and 4 P.M. on Saturdays and Sundays.

title: LONG BRANCH AIDES CALLED IN BY COURT
description: TRENTON, Dec. 31 (UPI)A New Jersey court official con firmed today that Long Branch city, officials had been asked to meet Jan. 13 with the State Supreme Court concerning op erations of the city's Municipal Court.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Announcements of deaths, marriages, births and engagements may be tele phoned to OXford 53311 until 11 P.M. in suburban offices. 9:00 A.M. to 4:30 P.M. Monday through Friday Newark (201) MArket 3.3900; White Plains (914) WHite Plains 65300; Hempstead (516) 1 Vanhoe 36660: Commack (516) 5435400: Stamford (503) 3187761.

title: Transit Situation at a Glance
description: PARTICIPANTSThe public agencies directly involved in the contract negotiations at the Americana Hotel are the Transit Authority and its subsidiary, the Manhattan and Bronx Surface Transit Operating Authority. They operate the city's publicly owned subway and bus lines. Both are arms of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, the state agency that also oversees operations on the Long Island Rail Road and the city's bridges and tunnels.

title: Customs Collections Drop Slightly Here From a Year Ago
description: Customs collections in the New York region last Novem ber dropped slightly from the total collection's in the corre sponding month in 1968, Mi chael Stramiello Jr., Regional Commissioner of Customs, said there yesterday.

title: Israel Honors Pele
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 1 (AP)  Israeli sports writers chose Pele, the Brazilian soccer star, today as sportsman of the year. The runnerup was Rod Laver, the Australian tennis champion.

title: In Memoriam
description: BLUMENTHALRose. January 2, 1958. Mother dearest: Lovingly remembered . . . sadly missed. Always in my heart.

title: Police Talks at Impasse
description: BOSTON, Jan. 1 (AP)Con tract talks between the city and the Boston Patrolman's Association have reached a most serious impasse, Samuel V. Morrick, an aide to Mayor Kevin H. White, said yesterday after another breakdown in the talks.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Forecast for 1970

title: Help's at Hand for Southpaw Minority
description: ALEXANDER THE GREAT, Leonardo da Vinci, Char lemagne and Ben Franklin were; Dick Van Dyke, Pablo Picasso, Harry Truman and two of the four Beatles are; June Gittleson isthey're all part of a neglected minority group, lefthanded people who have had to make do in a right  handed world. Miss Git tleson is the southpaw behind The Left Hand, a new shop at 145 East 27th Street (between Lexington and Third Ave nues) that will delight her fellow sufferers. Miss Gittle son is not only lefthanded, but favors her left eye, left ear and left foot as well. Even her dog offers his left paw for shaking.

title: If Only the Maitre d' Didn't Whistle
description: A selective list of restau rants in New York and vicin ity is given on this page on Friday. The restaurants are rated four stars to none, based on the relationship of food and service to cost. Credit cards are honored in the restaurants where indi cated.

title: Village Gate Adds a Buck White Act
description: A portion of the short lived Broadway musical Buck White will supple ment the program at the downtown Village Gate, Bleecker and Thompson Streets, starting tonight at 10 o'clock. The opening act only of Buck White is be ing presented by the new production company of Miles Davis, the jazz trumpeter. The star of the Broadway show, Cassius Clay, or Mu hammad Ali, did not appear in the play'sfirst act.

title: Navy Abandons All Plans To Salvage Munitions Ship
description: PEARL HARBOR, Hawaii, Jan. 1 (UPI)The Navy aban doned today all plans to sal vage the deserted munitions Ship Badger State, which has been floating for a week in the midPacific.

title: A Green Day for the Irish
description: DALLAS, Jan. 1 (AP)Notre Dame, which came out of its selfimposed bowl exile because of financial needs ranging from academics to athletics, will re ceive a substantial reward. Howard Grubbs, executive sec retary of the Southwest Confer ence, said Notre Dame should receive about $340,000 for its participation in the game.

title: Mexican Runner Is First
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, Jan. 1 (AP)JuanMartinez of Mexico was the surprise winner of the annual St. Sylvester 8,700 meter marathon race through downtown Sao Paulo streets last night in 24 minutes 2.3 sec onds. Martinez took the lead at the halfway point to beat Michael Tagg of England, Dane Korica of Yugoslavia, Eamon O'Reilly of the United States, Mario Perez Saldivar of Mexico, and 273 other long distance runners from 20 countries.

title: BODLEIAN SENDS EXHIBITION HERE
description: Manuscripts and printed treasures from one of the great libraries of the worldthe Bod leian Library of the University of Oxfordare on loan outside of Britain for the first time. They are on exhibition here at the Grolier Club, 47 East 60th Street.

title: DEMOCRAT SWORN AS SYRACUSE HEAD
description: SYRACUSE, Jan. 1  Lee Alexander, the first Democrat in 16 years to be mayor here, was sworn in today at the foot of the spiral staircase in the main hall of the Everson Mu seum.

title: MISSOURI BEATEN IN ORANGE BOWL
description: MIAMI, Jan. 1Penn State's mighty defense played the most magnificent game in its amaz ing recent history, holding an explosive Missouri time and again and grabbing a record seven interceptions to enable the undefeated Nittany Lions to beat the Tigers, 103, in the Orange Bowl tonight and ex tend Penn State's undefeated streak to 30 games over a three year span.

title: Mrs. Irving Loth, Headed TrueVue Optical Company
description: Mrs. Irving M. Loth, former president of the TrueVue Op tical Company, died Wednesday at Mount Sinai Hospital after a threemonth illness. She was 67 years old.

title: Statistics of the Game
Rape Suspect Arrested
description: The Housing Authority police reported yesterday the arrest of a 24yearold unemployed Brooklyn man who they said they believed responsible for as many as 10 rapes in the area of Whitman Houses in Brooklyn. The police said that four rape victims had identified the suspectRichard Townsend as their assailant. He will be arraigned today.

title: Fire Draft Pulls Policeman Through Manhole Opening
description: BOSTON, Jan. 1 (AP)A Boston policeman was seriously injured today when he was sucked into an open manhole by the draft caused by a fire in another manhole 50 feet away.

title: Zapata Norness Obtains $8Million Offshore Jobs
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 1 (UPI) Zapata Norness, Inc., announced yesterday it had obtained new offshore drilling contracts amounting to about $8million.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: THE latest book by John K. Terres, a naturalist, (From Laurel Hill to Stiler's Bog, Alfred A. Knopf, 227 pages, illustrated, $6.95) is nature writing and reportage at its best.

title: Reagan Reported Planning To Enter Race in March
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Jan. 1 (AP)Gov. Ronald Reagan plans to announce his candi dacy for a second term between March 1 and March 15, sources close to him said today.

title: Private Housing Partnership Is Trying to Turn $50Million Into $2Billion
description: WASHINGON, Jan. 1How to turn $50million into almost $2billion. It sounds like some thing dreamed up by boiler room salesmen or, at a mini mum, by harebrained optim ists.

title: FullScale Fighting Expected to Resume as Vietnam Truces End
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, Jan. 2Allied and en emy forces were expected to resume fullscale offensive operations this morning follow ing the expiration of a widely violated New Year's truce period.

title: 2 Found Safe After Crash Of Plane Kills 4 in Florida
description: TAMPA, Fla. Jan. 1 (AP) Two passengers who had been feared killed along with four other persons in the crash of a light plane last night were found safe in Sebring today.

title: Books of The Times
description: IT seemed for a while there as if the pill were the solutionto overpopula tion, to the complications of sexual love, to planned families and to the libera tion of women (although why on earth women should be liberated from having babies instead of men being liberated from not having them is beyond me). Then it be gan to look as if the pill might have certain drawbacks. There were indications here and there that taking it might bring on heart disease, strokes, atherosclerosis, ar teriosclerosis, varicose veins, skin discolo ration, fungi, epilepsy, migraine headaches, dizziness, cataracts, depression, hysteria, irritability, infertility, cancer, suicidal im pulses and death, among other things.

title: The Statistics
Truck Production In 69 Rose to Peak
description: DETROIT, Jan. 1 (AP)Truck production in the United States, has set a calendaryear record, but auto output in 1969 trailed the 1968 total by 617,225 units, Automotive News reported yes terday.

title: Theater: A Rare Comedy
description: CHARLIE L. Russell's Five on the Black Hand Side, at the American Place Thea ter, is possibly more enter taining for its characters than for anything else.

title: C5A Foe's Ouster Is Being Reviewed
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 1 (UPI) The Justice Department prom ised today a prompt review of the dismissal by the Air Force of A. Ernest Fitzgerald.

title: Teleprompter and Volt Revise Terms of Merger
description: The Teleprompter Corpora tion and Volt Information Sciences, Inc. disclosed yester day a revision in previously re ported terms for a merger of Volt into Teleprompter.

title: Article 4  No Title
Koch Recommends Amnesty For Those Who Flee Draft
description: Representative Edward I. Koch, back from a twoday trip to Canada where he spoke earlier this week to a score of expatriates who went there to avoid the draft, says he recom mends amnesty for them.

title: Mrs. John Hegerman Dies; Served on Rehabilitation Unit
description: Mrs. John C. Hegerman, widow of the president of Heg erman & Harris, the construc tion firm that built The Daily News Building and Rockefeller Center, died yesterday after noon at the United Methodist Convalescent Home in Shelton, Conn. She was 83 years old and lived at 412 East 55th Street.

title: Amax to Close Operations Of Western Uranium Plants
description: GRAND JUNCTION, Colo., Jan. 1 (UPI)American Metal Climax, Inc., has announced it is shutting down uranium op erations in Colorado and Utah because of weak demand fox uranium and no prospect of improvement in the years ahead.

title: Longhorns Staked Record and. Rating On One Big Play
description: DALLAS, Jan. 1There was never any doubt what play Texas would use when the Longhorns reached the Notre Dame 10yard line in the closing minutes, Darrell Royal said today.

title: Company Auction Adds $540 to Fund For Neediest Cases
description: Anything Rona Pashkin wants to bring is all right with us, the poster said in bold lettering.

title: Harvard Post Is Filled
description: BOSTON, Jan. 1 (AP) Wal ter F. Frese will fill the Harvard Business School's first endowed professorship of accounting, the Arthur Lowes Dickinson pro fessorship, school officials an nounced yesterday. Professor Frese, who has taught at the school since 195d, studied at the University of Iowa and the University of Illinois.

title: Brown Confers in Jordan
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Jan. 1 (Reu ters)  George Brown, deputy leader of the British Labor party, met today with Premier Bahjat alTalhouni of Jordan for talks officially described as a review of 20 years of Arab Israeli conflict.

title: News (Good) From Britain
description: Two days before the end of 1969, the British pound soared above par for the first time in twenty months. On the last day of the year, Britain repaid $200 mil lion on postwar debts to the United States and Canada. And the British Government celebrated the New Year by abolishing the $120 individual foreign travel allowance.

title: Article 3  No Title
ZAMBIA TAKES OVER CONTROL OF COPPER
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Jan. 1 (Reuters)The Zambian copper mining industry officially came under state control today, but few major changes are likely for several months.

title: Panamanian Shot to Death; Once Accused as Assassin
description: PANAMA, Jan. 1 (UPI)  Ruben O. Mire, a Panamanian lawyer who was tried and ac quitted in the assassination of President Jose Antonio Reimn 15 years ago, was found shot to death today.

title: ARGENTINA GAINS MIAMI NET FINAL
description: MIAMI BEACH, Jan. 1 (UPI) Argentina ousted off the top seeded South African team to day and advanced to the final of the Sunshine Cup tennis tournament against the winner of tomorrow's competition be tween the United States and Czechoslovakia.

title: La Follette's Grandnephew To Seek House Nomination
description: RACINE, Wis., Jan. 1 (UPI) Douglas La Follette, a 29year old chemistry professor who is a grandnephew of Robert M. La Follette, said yesterday he would seek nomination as a Democratic candidate for Con gress in the First District.

title: NIXON PROMISES AN URGENT FIGHT TO END POLLUTION
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 1President Nixon pledged his Administration today to a now or never fight against pollu tion as he signed legislation creating a threemember Coun cil on Environmental Quality.

title: Teledata Signs Agreement To Acquire Ranch Resort
description: Teledata, Inc., a diversified company in leisure time, home furnishings and building ma terial industries, has signed an agreement to acquire Sunny croft Ponderosa, Inc. For an un disclosed sum of cash and stock. Sunnycroft Ponderosa, operates a yearround ranch resort pro viding horseback riding, skiing, golf and other outdoor and in door sports facilities.

title: Wallace Sees the 1970's as His Greatest Decade
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala.  Not surprisingly, George Corley Wallace sees the 1970's as the time when George Corley Wallace will have his greatest impact.

title: Steven H. Kelley Will Marry Katharine Allen Next Summer
description: Miss Katharine Allen and Steven Heywood Kelley, 1969 graduates of Northwestern University, have made plans to be married next summer.

title: Vols' Eleven to Play Pitt
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Jan. 1 (AP)Tennessee has booked a twogame homeandhome foot ball series with the University of Pittsburgh, Bob Woodruff, the Vols athletic director said today. The games will be played in 1982 and 1984.

title: Convict Vanishes on Coast
description: TRACY, Calif., Jan. 1 (AP) l!Leonard Maine, 21 years Old, serving a long sentence for a slaying and a rape and shooting in 1967, is missing from the Deuel Vocational Institution, the authorities said today.

title: Wounded Policeman Shoots Man With Knife in Store
description: A rookie policeman fired two shots at a knifewielding man in a Bronx liquor store last night after the man cut him in the neck, the police said.

title: Dontzin Gets New Post With Lindsay
description: Michael J. Dontzin, a mem ber of the state policy commit tee of the Liberal party, was named counsel to the Mayor yesterday at a salary of $25,500.

title: Article 2  No Title
Modernization Proposal Is Set for Jersey Rail Lines
description: TRENTON, Jan. 1 (AP)New Jersey's passenger railroads, on the way to extinction just three years ago, are in a building boom that will modernize them over the next five years and prepare them to handle 40 pet cent more riders than they car ry today.

title: Mt. Vernon Fire Injures 8
description: MOUNT VERNON, N. Y., Jan. 1  Fire Chief Alexander W. Leggat and a fireman were con fined to Mount Vernon Hospital as a result of injuries received while fighting a fire on New Year's Eve. The fire destroyed the top story of a twofamily house at 516 South Seventh Avenue. Six other firemen were injured but were treated and released.

title: Child on Sled Is Killed
description: SPRING VALLEY, N. Y., Jan. 1 (UPI)An 11yearold boy was killed today while sledding on a hill when he failed to stop short of a highway and col lided with a car on Route 45. The boy was identified as Charles J. Lyons of 2 Singer Avenue.

title: There Was No Script, Kheel Says as Curtain Falls on Biennial Transit Drama
description: Two champagne corks popped across a 45thfloor room of the Americana hotel at 7 A.M. yesterday, ringing down the curtain on the city's biennial transit drama.

title: Mississippi Clerics Back Integration
description: JACKSON, Miss., Jan. 1 (AP) A committee of Mississippi religious leaders called today for efforts to make the state's public school system a model for the nation in the face of courtordered desegregation.

title: THOMAS JOHNSTONE, COMPOSER, 81, DIES
description: Thomas A. Johnstone, a com poser and lyricist who wrote a number of musicals for the Broadway stage in the nineteen twenties, died last nght at the Teaneck Nursing Home in New Jersey. He was 81 years old and, until last year, had lived at the Actors Fund Home of America in Englewood, N.J.

title: BUDDHISTS PUBLISH ACCOUNT OF SONGMY
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 1 (Reuters)The militant An Quang Buddhist faction pub lished today an account of the alleged massacre at Songmy, containing charges that almost 600 men, women and children were shot and piled four deep in a ditch.

title: City of Richmond Grows
description: RICHMOND, Jan. 1 (AP) Virginia's capital city of Rich mond grew in both land area and population today as 23 square miles of Chesterfield County ]and were annexed to Richmond, bringing the city's land area to 63 square miles and its population to 264,000.

title: 5,000 REVELERS LOOT IN EAST LOS ANGELES
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 1 (AP) About 5,000 young New Year's revelers went on a window smashing and storelooting ram page for two hours early today on a popular boulevard in East, Los Angeles.

title: Peking Raises Specter of Worldwide Nuclear War
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 1The possibility of worldwide nuclear war was a dominant theme of a New Year editorial appearing today in the Peking publica tions Jenmin Jih Pao, Hung Chi and Chiehfang Chun Pao.

title: Holiday Attraction: The Warm Indoors
description: The sky was gray yester day, the pavement in many places slick with ice, the temperature in the low 20's.

title: Hunter College Is Nearing Centennial
description: In the late eighteen sixties, a member of the Board of Education toured New York City schools. In one primary school he found a teacher writing a small i instead of the pronoun. When he corrected her, she looked at him in confusion and then dotted the capital I.

title: Records Show That Lax Government Regulations Allow Occupational Hazards to Grow
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 1 Thousands of American indus trial concerns violate the Fed eral Government's occupational safety and health requirements every year, but the available penalties are almost never in voked against corporate of fenders.

title: Law on Taxi Color Takes Effect
description: The police began yesterday to ticket taxis not painted the proper Color in accord ance with a local law that went into effect with the New Year.

title: Teaching by Bad Example
description: President Nixon, in rebuking Congress for its illcon sidered demand that university administrators cut off Federal subsidies for students engaged in campus dis orders, has reiterated his sound objections to placing the Federal Government in the role of campus police man. The vindictive provision, which also requires institutions to report periodically on punitive actions they have taken, is contained in a $2.4billion appro priations bill for the Departments of State, Justice and Commerce.

title: $39MILLION IN BONDS BOUGHT FOR ISRAEL
description: A sale of more than $39 million in Israel bonds for last year in the greater New York area was reported last night at the third and final perform ance of the Hanukkah Festival for Iserael at Madison Square Garden.

title: A G.I. Coffeehouse on Coast Gets Support of Operators
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Jan. 1 (AP) A group of coffeehouse op erators announced plans today for a national drive to prevent the Shelter Half Coffeehouse near Fort Lewis, Wash., from being placed offlimits by the Army.

title: Jessamyn West's Father Dies
description: NEWBERG, Ore., Jan 1 (UPI) Eldo West, father of novelist Jessamyn West, the novelist, and it distant relative by mar riage of President Nixon, died here yesterday in a nursing horde. He was 90 years old. Mr. West, was Mr. Nixon's Sunday School teacher in Whit tier, Calif.

title: General Manager Is Named For 2 Atlanta Newspapers
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 1 (UPI)  William I. Ray Jr. has been named general manager of At lanta Newspapers, Inc., which publishes The Atlanta Journal and The Atlanta Constitution.

title: Football Fan Named Nixon Spends Day Like Millions of Others
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 1Presi dent Nixon passed up his prerogative to sit on the 50yard line in Pasadena today. Instead, he joined the millions of ordinary American husbands who forgot about their businesses, their troubles and even their families and propped themselves in front of television set across the land to watch college football end one year and begin another in the Cotton, Sugar, Rose and Orange Bowls.

title: Washington: The Missing New Year's Resolutions
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 1In the planning for the seventies in the United States, one thing is clearly missing: a definition that can be understood by the American people of where they stand with one another and the rest of the world.

title: Three Groups Will Join In Series at Guggenheim
description: A subscription series of avantgarde concerts will be presented at the Guggenheim Museum beginning this month by Philip Glass, the Sonic Arts Group and Steve Reich. The concerts will be given with the aid of a grant from the New York State Council on the Arts, in cooperation with The Com poser in Performance, Inc.

title: Five Die in Nyack Fire
description: Early morning fires on New Year's Day took the lives of five men at a Nyack, N.Y., boarding house and of a wom an in a Bronx apartment. The woman's two children were seriously injured.

title: Three Orioles to Be Cited
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 1 (AP) Earl Weaver, the manager of the Baltimore Orioles, Jim Palmer, a pitcher, and Billy Hunter, a third base coach, will be honored at the 17th annual Tops in Sports dinner on Jan. 9.

title: Administration Expected To Seek ABM Expansion
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 1Top officials of the Nixon Ad ministration have tentatively agreed to seek expansion the Safeguard antiballistic missile system, according knowledgeable sources. Ap proximately $1.5billion has been earmarked for an en larged program in the new defense budget that goes to Congress later this month, the sources said.

title: JORDANIAN CANAL DESTROYED AGAIN
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 1 Jordan announced today that Israel had for the third time knocked out the vital East Ghor Canal on the east bank of the Jordan River in the course of a series of air raids in which 11 persons were killed.

title: Barbara Helena Sault Affianced
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Paul N. Sault of New York of the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Barbara Helena Sault, to Michael James Peterman, son of Dr. and Mrs. Sidney Peterman of Shaker Heights, Ohio. A May wedding is planned.

title: Text of Nixon Statement
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 1 (AP)Following is the text of President Nixon's statement today on environ mental pollution:

title: New Norwegian Cruise Vessel Has Observation Stack Lounge
description: Cruise passengers will get new point of view when the 18,000ton liner Song of Nor way, launched recently in Hel sinki, Finland, enters service out of Miami next November. A circular, enclosed observa tion lounge, extending from the rear of her large smokestack, will be reached by a staircase from the topmost passenger deck aft.

title: COLUMBIA SELECTS JOURNALISM JURY
description: Fortythree newspaper edi tors and executives were named journalism jurors for the 1969 Pulitzer Prizes yesterday by Columbia University.

title: Nixon Phones Hoover; F.B.I. Director Is 75
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 1 (Reuters)President Nixon telephoned today the director of the Federal Bu reau of Investigation, J. Ed gar Hoover, to congratulate him on his 75th birthday. Later he said that he knew of no plans for the contro versial F.B.I. chief to retire.

title: French Raise Car Prices
description: PARIS, Jan. 1 (Reuters)It will cost more to buy French cars this year. The French automobile manufacturers' fed eration said today the price of French cars will rise by an average of 3 per cent, starting tomorrow with Citron.

title: AlabamaCoushatta Tribe In Texas Installs New Chief
description: LIVINGSTON, Tex., Jan. 1 (AP)Robert Fulton Battise, 60 years old, known in cast Texas as one of its finest woodsmen, donned the headdress of chief of the AlabamaCoushatta In dian tribe today.

title: Recipient of Heart and 2 Lungs Dies Here After 9Day Struggle
description: Edward Falk, who on Christ mas Day received a heart and two lungs in a single transplant operation, died early this morn ing at New York Hospital.

title: GAIN IN ECONOMY PUT AT 7% A YEAR
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 1 (UPI)  The United States economy will grow at an annual rate of about 7 per cent for the first half of the new decade, reach ing a gross national product of $1.4trillion by 1975, the Com merce Department predicted to day.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, JANUARY 2, 1970

title: PARKING VIOLATORS FACING CRACKDOWN
description: Police and Fire Department officials announced yesterday a campaign against parking violatorsespecially those who impede access to fire hydrants in the area of lower Man hattan known as Hell's Hun dred Acres.

title: I.T.T. Says Sales During 1969 Increased to About $5Billion
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation looks for a strong and in sales in 1970, Harold S. Geneen, chairman and president, said in a statement prepared for release today. He said that I.T.T. expected to report sales and revenues for 1969 of about $5billion and that they should rise to about $6billion in the present year. This woud compare with the $4.1billion reported for 1968.

title: Isdale Sets Pace in Dinghy Regatta
description: RYE, N. Y., Jan. 1George M. (Dooie) Isdale Jr. of the host club took a 22point lead today in the opening of the an nual New Year's invitation Dyer dinghy frostbite regatta at the American Yacht Club. The threeday event ends with racing Saturday and Sunday.

title: Bigger Subway Token Ready to Go Into Use
description: New subway tokens that have been prepared for a probable increase in transit fare look much like the ones now in use, but they are bigger.

title: ARMS INDUSTRIES ASSAILED BY POPE
description: ROME, Jan. 1Pope Paul VI prayed today that the world be forgiven for the fact that giant industries prosper on the diabolical capacity to pro duce arms and powerful na tions base their stability on trading arms to poor nations lacking plows, schools and hos pitals.

title: Doctors Fight to Save Infant Born With Starving Condition
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 1 (AP) A 6weekold girl from Flint, Mich., is under treatment at University Hospital for a rare abdominal condition in which she was slowly starving to death, according to her physi cians.

title: Retrial for 3 in Heroin Factory Case Is Ordered
description: Finding that the police used ilegal wiretaps, a Supreme Court, justice has ordered a new trial for three men who got terms up to 25 years on charges of bribery and of oper ating a heroin processing fac tory in the Bronx.

title: British 18YearOlds Now Adults
description: LONDON, Jan. 1Darling! Now that we're 18 we can do something we've always wanted to do, the girl says coyly to the boy on the cover of a pop art greeting card sent out by the Labor party.

title: Rebels Down Arkansas, 27242, As Manning Stars in Sugar Bowl
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 1 (AP) Glenn Cannon, Mississippi safetyman, recovered a fumble in the final quarter to stop a Razorback drive, as the Rebels staved off an Arkansas rally and hung on for a 2722 victory today in the 36th annual Sugar Bowl football game.

title: Svoboda Bids Czech Reds Be Prudent
description: VIENNA, Jan. 1In a sub dued New Year broadcast, President Ludvik Svoboda of Czechoslovakia called on the Communist party today to work wisely and prudently and with a sensitive approach to people.

title: Debray Asks for Help For Brazil's Prisoners
