description: PARIS, Jan. 1 (Reuters) Regis Debray; a French in tellectual serving a 30year jail sentence in Bolivia for guerrilla activities, appealed tonight to his supporters to forget him and to work for prisoners in Brazil.

title: ONE DEAD, 6 MISSING AS BOAT CAPSIZES
description: MANHATTAN BEACH, Calif., Jan. 1 (UPI)Divers found the body of a teenaged girl today, and her father, her boyfriend, her brother, two sisters and a niece were missing and pre sumed drowned in a boating accident.

title: 4 NEGRO PLAYERS QUIT SOUTH TEAM
description: TAMPA, Fla., Jan. 1 (AP)  Four black players quit the South team today and ap parently left town without a word to officals of the Ameri can Bowl.

title: HOFSTRA IS VICTOR AS TOURNEY OPENS
description: EAST STROUDSBURG, Pa., Jan. 1Clutch shooting by Tom Kelleher and Bob Mc Laughlin led Hofstra to a 7671 triumph over Muhlenberg to night in the first round, of the Pocono Classic basketball tour nament.

title: Amer. Basketball Ass'n
description: WEDNESDAY NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Missing Airplane Sighted
description: CROSSVILLE, Tenn., Jan. 1 (AP)An airplane identified as that of a Kentucky pilot miss ing since Dec. 23 was sighted from the air today in a rugged mountainous area near here, the Civil Air Patrol reported. Vial Jack Slaughter of the pa trol said that the aircraft had been identified as the one Toy Lenning, 56 years old, of Mur ray, Ky., was flying when he disappeared after receiving landing clearance from the air port here.

title: For Film Extras, Variety Is Certain, Stardom Isn't
description: The phone rang in Mary Fogarty's West 92d Street apartment the other night and the caller said quickly: Come down to 42d Street tomorrow dressed as a weirdo.

title: Admiral's Recall Asked
description: PARIS, Jan. 1  France took an apparently mild meas ure against Israel today by ask ing for the recall of only one of her representatives here, Adm. Mordechai Limon, head of the Israeli arms purchasing mission.

title: 15 Pro Football Players To Tour Vietnam, Hospitals
description: Fifteen pro football players from the National Football League will tour Vietnam and hospitals in the Pacific are for the United Service Organiza tion and the Department of De fense late in January and in February.

title: South Korean Exports Rise
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Jan. 1 (Reuters)  South Korean ex ports rose 40 per cent in 1969 to $702.8million, according to statistics released today by the Commerce and Industry Minis try. Imports rose last year by $46million to $1.18billion, or 4.6 per cent higher than in 1968.

title: PopeGiven Dossier Charging Torture by Brazilian Regime
description: ROME, Jan. 1Charges of murder and torture of political opponents by Brazil's military dominated government have been presented to Pope Paul VI with the endorsement of 61 prominent European Roman Catholics.

title: Miss Brummer Advances
description: PORT ELIZABETH, South Af rica, Jan. 1 (AP)Marianne Brummer of South Africa scored a second straight upset in the Eastern Province tennis cham pionships today by defeating Kristy Pigeon, fourthseeded, of Danville, Calif., 64, 810, 61.

title: Sun and Moon
description: The sun rises at 7:20 A.M., sets at 4:40 P.M. and will rise tomorrow at 7:20 A.M.

title: Heavy Floods Near Rome
description: ROME, Jan. 1 (AP) Rains during the New Year's holiday flooded a vast area around Rome, causing landslides and killing one person. The Castelli Romani, 12 miles southeast of Rome, was the hardest hit area. A landslide near Monteporzio smashed a car, killing its driver. Five occupants of another car were injured.

title: Argentina Changes Basis Of Peso to 3.50 Per Dollar
description: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 1 (Reu ters)The parity of the Argen tine peso was technically changed today from 350 pesos to a dollar to 3.50.

title: Clark Leads in Auckland Golf
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Jan. 1 (AP)Jim Vaughan, an American pro, equaled the course record of 64 today in the first round of an open tour nament, but he trailed Denis Clark of New Zealand by a stroke. Clark posted a 63 over the par 70 course.

title: Trading Resumes Today
description: Stock markets, commodity exchanges and banks were closed yesterday in observance of New Year's Day. Today the stock exchanges and the banks will be open, but the commodity exchanges will not reopen until Monday.

title: RASKA CAPTURES SKI JUMP EVENT
description: GARMISCH  PARTENKIRCH (UPI)Jiri Raska of Czechoslo vakia, an Olympic gold medal winner, added another triumph to his international record to day by winning an interna tional ski jumping event on Garmisch's big Olympic jump ing hill.

title: Foreign Affairs: The Key to All the Trouble
description: PARISPerhaps the most sig nificant American foreign pol icy failure over the past decade came neither in Vietnam nor at the Bay of Pigs but in Laos. Had U.S. diplomacy plugged the Laotian sewer already being exploited by Communist guer rillas ten years ago, the sordid drama that subsequently tor tured external and internal U.S. relationships might, have been avoided.

title: Antisnow Salt Exacts Price: Corrosion
description: In the week between Christ mas and New Year's Day, when storms coated the city's streets with ice and snow, the Sanitation Department spread 45,000 tons of salt on those streets.

title: Paper Says Egypt Sank Israeli Submarine in 68
description: CAIRO, Jan. 1 (UPI)A Cairo newspaper said today that an Egyptian naval vessel had sunk the Israeli submarine Dakar, which disappeared with 69 aboard in the Mediterranean on Jan. 25, 1968.

title: Lumberyard Is Cleaning After Big Baltimore Fire
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 1 (AP) The job of cleaning up began today, after a 13alarm water front lumberyard fire that caused about $250,000 damage last night.

title: Israelis Warn Lebanese To Curb Guerrilla Raids
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 1Israeli leaders expressed today what appeared to be a final warning to Lebanon to restrict the ac tivities of Arab guerrillas op erating against Israel from Leb anon.

title: WOMEN IN DEMAND IN ENGINEERING
description: Demand for women college graduates  if salary is the criterion  is highest in the field of engineering, a disci pline that some might con sider unfeminine but most might consider rewarding.

title: Texas Hands Notre Dame 2117 Cotton Bowl Loss
description: DALLAS, Jan. 1Texas be gan the new decade the way it left the old today, gambling form late victory.

title: TWO ADMIT FLYING TON OF MARIJUANA
description: GUADALAJARA, Mexico, Jan. 1 (UPI)Two Los Angeles resi dents have admitted at a pre trial hearing they were carrying a ton of marijuana to Califor nia when they landed their rented plane near Guadalajara.

title: Countess Free Wins Liberty Bell Stake
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 1 (AP) Peter Fuller's Countess Free, claimed for $12,500 by her trainer, Jerry. Meyer, at Aque duct on Nov. 19, rallied from last place in a field of eight 3yearold fillies today to win the first running of the $27,500, onemile New Hope Stakes at Liberty Bell by a neck.

title: KENNETH DUFFES, CITY AIDE, IS DEAD
description: Kenneth S. Duffes, assistant administrator of the Economic Development Administration and former Acting City Com missioner of Labor, died yester day at St. Vincent's Hospital. ?? was 59 years old.

title: Yacht Dame Pattie Is Sold
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Jan. 1 (Reuters)  The owners of Dame Pattie, the unsuccessful Australian challenger in the 1967 America's Cup yacht race, confirmed today the sale of the 12meter craft to an anony mous buyer for an undisclosed price. The yacht, originally built for $500,000, has been at anchor since December, 1967.

title: EASTERN HOCKEY LEAGUE
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME

title: And Whom Does the Weary Psychiatrist Tell His Troubles To?
description: DO YOU ever get the feeling that you are constantly being ana lyzed?

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: '69 a Bad Year for Good Films, Catholic Movie Office Finds
description: The film year just ended was not a vintage one from any point of view, according to the National Catholic Office for Motion Pictures, the Roman Catholic film review ing group formerly called the Legion of Decency.

title: Harry Konner, Merchant And Jersey Philanthropist
description: Harry (Heresch) Konner, re tired Jersey City merchant and philanthropist, died Wednesday at the Hebrew Home Hospital. He was 82 years old.

title: Salvatore T. Consalvo Jr., On Atlantic County Board
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Jan. 1  Salvatore T. Consalvo Jr., an Atlantic County Freeholder, died yesterday at his home after a long illness. He was 42 years old.

title: Article 1  No Title
TRANSIT STRIKE IS AVERTED WITH 18% WAGE INCREASE; FARE RISE TO 30C EXPECTED
description: The Transit Authority and its two unions agreed on new contracts yesterday that will cost $120million Cover the two year life of the pacts and that are almost certain to neces sitate an increase in bus and subway fares.

title: ANACONDA ALTERS TWO UNITS IN CHILE
description: The Anaconda Company an nounced yesterday implementa tion of the understanding that had been reached on June 26, 1969, between the Government of Chile and Anaconda's operat ing subsidiaries in Chile, the Chile Exploration Company and the Andes Copper Mining Company.

title: Reports on Ski Conditions in the East.
description: The following reports were provided by the operators of the ski areas now open (mes sages were filed at times in dicated in parentheses).

title: NARCOTIC ARRESTS UP SHARPLY HERE
description: Narcotics arrests in New York City increased sharply during 1969, according to the Police Department.

title: Statistics of the Game
Hinson Stiles, ExManaging Editor of Mirror, Dies
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., Jan. 1 (UPI)Hinson Stiles, managing editor of The New York Mirror from 1935 to 1953, died in Palm Beach on New Year's Eve. He was 76 years old and lived in Florida for the last eight years.

title: BULLS RALLY TO TOP SEATTLE, 114 TO 111
description: SEATTLE, Jan. 1 (UPI) Clem Haskins dropped in a pair of free throws with 20 seconds left tonight and Loy Peterson added another pair to give the Chicago Bulls a 114111 Na tional Basketball Association victbry over the Seattle Super sonics.

title: VIEWS TAKING SHAPE IN OILIMPORT STUDY
description: MIDLAND, Tex., Jan. 1 (AP) James N. Allison Jr., deputy chairman of the Republican Na tional Committee, says a task force studying oil imports is expected to recommend an in crease in such imports. But he said two Administration mem bers are against more foreign oil.

title: Miss Keymar $13.40 Victor
description: LAUREL, Md., Jan. 1Miss Keymar, a surprise winner against good colts in her previ ous race, turned in another up set today when she won the 610,000 Jolly Time Purse before It crowd of 12,482 at Laurel Race Course.

title: PENN STATE, TEXAS CALLED ALL EVEN
description: MIAMI, Jan. 1 (AP)  Penn State has a friend in Dan De vine, the Missouri football coach. If I had a vote, I might vote a tie for No. 1 between Texas and Penn State, he said. I can guarantee you that wouldn't vote Penn State No. 2 under any circumstances.

title: Canada Looks to Rising Chinese Trade
description: TORONTO, Jan. 1The sug ary vision of selling more goods to mainland China, a country of 700 million inhabitants, dances before Canadian exporters and Government officials as the new year breaks.

title: O'Casey Theater Will Open With Tamalpais Exchange
description: Tamalpais Exchange, a new musical entertainment, will open Feb. 1 at the new Sean O'Casey theater building being built by Art and Burt D'Lugoff. Stephanie Sills and Lawrence Fraiberg are the coproducers. The show is named after Mount Tamalpais in San Francisco, a favorite gathering place for young people who come to lis ten to concerts, sing and ex change ideas.

title: Knicks Drill 2 Hours Here, Then Fly to Milwaukee for Bucks Game Tonight
description: It was business as usual yes to for the New York Knicks. After watching some of the early football bowl game action on television, the Knicks held a twohour practice ses sion at St. John' s University before flying to Milwaukee for their fifth meeting of the sea son with the Bucks tonight.

title: Coal Output Estimated
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 1 (UPI) The National Coal Associa tion, from incomplete reports from the railroads, estimates bituminous coal production in the United States for last week at 7.345,000 tons, down from the yearearlier 8,038,000 tons.

title: Vermont's Heavy Snow Draws A Deluge of Skiers to Slopes
description: VERMONT'S skiing entre preneurs were still dis cussing the manner in which the state's Governor Deane C. Davis had declared a state of emergency last weekend as the Green Mountain State yesterday played host to its largest turnout of enthusiasts this season. From Jay Peak at Vermont's roof top in North Troy down to Dutch Hill and Hogback, near the Massa chusetts bound ary, thousands of skiers frol licked on snow terrain rated almost everywhere as being from at least goodtoexcel lent.

title: Burglars Toil in Vain
description: WALTHAM, Mass., Jan. 1 (AP)Burglars put in several hours of hard work but failed to crack a vault at the Wal tham Savings Bank, the police reported today. Philip A. Lash way, vice president of the bank, discovered the break when he went to the bank this morning to make a routine examination.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
Britain Frees Tourist Spending Abroad
description: LONDON, Jan. 1The Brit ish Government lifted tonight its unpopular restriction on the amount Britons could spend on vacations abroad.

title: Nasser Declares He'll Arm A Million Men to Win War
description: CAIRO, Jan. 1  President Gamal Abdel Nasser declared at a rally in the Sudan tonight that the United Arab Republic would put a million men under arms and would struggle, with other Arabs, against Israel until victory was achieved and all occupied lands recovered. The speech was broadcast over the Sudanese and Egyptian radio networks.

title: ENRICO DIGIUSEPPE MAKES MET DEBUT
description: In 1959 Enrico DiGiuseppe, a tenor from Philadelphia, made his professional debut with the New Orleans Experimental Opera Theater. Last night, Mr. DiGiuseppe began the New Year with his Metropolitan Opera debut, the goal of all young American singers who give themselves to opera.

title: Perot Vows, I'm Not Giving Up
description: H. Ross Perot expressed disappointment yesterday over his failure to deliver a planeload of badly needed supplies to American prison ers of war in North Vietnam but vowed, I'm not giving up.

title: From Beryllia, Inclustry ls Born
description: Known only in the, labora tory a little more than 20 years ago, beryllia today is providing the basis for what has already become a multi milliondollar industry.

title: MAYOR AIMS AT 25C
description: Mayor Lindsay began an 11thhour drive yesterday to limit an apparently imminent increase in the transit fare to five cents.

title: 1,000 Queens Homes Lose Power in a Blackout
description: A power failure in the Fresh Meadows section of Queens cut off electrical service to about 1,000 homes last night, according to a spokesman for the Con Edison Company.

title: Miss England To Be a Bride
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 1Mr. and Mrs. Jonathan S. Eng land have made known the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Elizabeth Anne England, to Robert H. Tell. His parents are Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin L. Tell of Rock ville Centre, L.I. A wedding in June is planned.

title: RCA Device May Bring Home Remote Control Unit
description: The RCA Corporation has de veloped a new solidstate de vice that, company, spokesmen ay, may lead to TVtype remote, controls for home appliances, heating systems, office equip ment and industrial tools.

title: Gadget Man, Under Fires, Wins Tropical Park Feature by Length
description: MIAMI, Jan. 1 (AP)Gadget Man passed Tudor Scott, the fa vorite, 70 yards from the finish and won the $20,000 added New Year's Handicap at Tropi cal Park today. Advance Party also went by the tiring Tudor Scott in the last 50 yards to finish second as the favorite settled for third money.

title: Susan Cohen, G. M. Wexler Are Married
description: The marriage of Miss Susan Cohen, daughter of Mrs. Alvin Gallant of New York and the late Edward Cohen, to G. Martin Wexler, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jack Wexler of Sings Point, L. I., took place yesterday after noon in the Versailles Suite at the St. RegisSheraton. Rabbi Gunter Hirschberg per formed the ceremony.

title: Agnew Ends Visit To Vietnam,Hailing U.S. Policy as Right
description: BIENHOA, South Vietnam, Friday, Jan. 2  Vice President Agnew consoled wounded American servicemen here to day and said his 24hour visit to South Vietnam had con firmed to me the wisdom of our policies.

title: Biafra Reports Gains
description: OWERRI, Biafra (Nigeria), Jan. 1 (Agence FrancePresse) Biafran forces have beaten back a series of Nigerian at tacks in Onitsha province, the latest Biafran war bulletin as serted today.

title: Church Moves Into Conflict With Brazil's Government
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Jan. 1 Pressure within the Roman Catholic Church for social re form in Brazil has brought the church into conflict with the country's conservative, mili tarydominated Government.

title: BRICKELL, SHIELDS TIE FOR SAIL LEAD
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Jan. 1Two skippers from the Larchmont Interclub fleet, James Brickell Jr. And Cornelius (Glit) Shields Jr., set the pace in the 39th annual Frostbite Yacht Club's New Year's Regatta after five races were sailed today.

title: Greek Press Curbs Take Effect; Prices Raised to Ease Impact
description: ATHENS, Jan. 1 Greece's new press law took effect to day, and all but two of the 12 nationalcirculation newspapers immediately raised their prices to cope with the economic im pact.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Announcements of deaths, marriages, births and engagements may be tele phoned to Oxford 53311 until 11 P.M. in suburban offices. 9:00 AM. to 4:30 P.M. Monday through Friday Newark (201) Market 33900; Whit, Plain (914) White Plains 95300; Hempstead (516) Ivanhos 36660; Commack (616) 6435400: Stamford (203) 3187767.

title: KINGS ARE VICTORS OVER FLYERS, 4 TO 3
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Jan. 1 (UPI)Eddie Joyal scored two firstperiod goals and Leon Rocheford added the clincher early in the second period as the Los Angeles Kings topped the Philadelphia Flyers, 43, to night.

title: Youth Freed After Raid
description: MONTROSE, Iowa, Jan. 1 (UPI)Steven Lawse, 19 years old, charged with possession of marijuana, was released today to the custody of his parents after a police raid of a New Year's Eve party. He was the only person charged out of total of 17 persons who attend ed the party at a cottage near Montrose.

title: Chesapeake Industries, Inc., To Buy MetalDoor Maker
description: The board of directors of Chesapeake Industries, Inc., has agreed to acquire all the out standing stock (230,800 shares) of Stiles, Allen & Reimer Sheet Metal, Inc., a manufacturer of metal doors and frames with plants in Mesa, Ariz., and Pur cell. Okla.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Sol Solk has been elected vice president and merchandise manager of Pauson & Company, 12story Northern California and Nevada retail subsidiary of Botany Industries, Inc., it was announced over the holiday by Henry C. Schwartz, president of the Botany Retail Stores Di vision.

title: Advertising: In'69, Agency World Changed
description: If you're up to it this morn ing, take a quick look back at last year. The advertising industry made its share of news.

title: Credit Plan for Poor Studied
description: BOSTON, Jan. 1 (AP)A plan to give welfare recipients credit in retail stores through out Massachusetts is being considered by Gov. Francis W. Sargent. Under it, credit would be arranged and possibly backed by the state for any of the 55,000 families on welfare who choose to open charge ac counts.

title: COMPUTER FINDS NO U.S. RECESSION
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 1The nation's newest computerbased forecast of the economy pro jected today no recession in 1970 but a continued slowing of the economy with a rise in unemployment to an average of 4.4 per cent of the labor force.

title: Gorman, Ruffels Advance
description: PERTH, Australia, Jan. 1 (Reuters)  Tom Gorman, an American, and Ray Ruffels, a leading Australian player, had easy firstround victories today in the Western Australian ten nis championship. Gorman, from Seattle, defeated John Evans of Australia, 62, 62, and Ruffels beat Wayne Millen of Australia, 64, 64.

title: New Year Brings New Debutantes at Annual Assembly
description: The strains of America the Beautiful had barely fad away after Monday's International Debutante Ball at the WaldorfAstoria, when the Grand Ballroom became the scene last night of an other mass presentation of debutantes.

title: Suspect in Holdup Try Dies
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., Jan. 1 (AP)One of two men alleged to have staged an abortive holdup early today at the Haru gari Club here died this, after noon of a gunshot wound that the police said had been in flicted by his accomplice. The police said the victim identified himself before he died as Alvin Marshall, 34 years old, of Los Angeles.

title: Boy, 15, Accused of Killing Girl, a Hunting Companion
description: GAINES, Pa., Jan. 1 (AP) A I5yearold boy was charged with murder today in the shot gun death of a girl hunting companion a few miles from this rural community in north ern Pennsylvania, the state po lice said.

title: BRAZILIAN AIRLINER IS HIJACKED BY FIVE
description: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 1 (AP)  The police said that five welldressed hijackers, one a woman, seized a Brazilian jet liner at gunpoint tonight shortly after it left Montevideo, Uru guay. They forced the pilot to refuel here and to take aboard navigation maps with routes to Cuba, the police said.

title: Talks on Housing Canceled
description: CINCINNATI, Jan. 1 (AP) Charles Ball, director of the OhioKentuckyIndiana Region al Planning Agency here, called off today a lowcost housing workshop scheduled for next month after the Federal Hous ing Administration lifted inter est rates to 8.5 per cent from 7.5 per cent. The move will effectively dry up available money for housing mortgages, Mr. Ball said. There is no point in my scheduling a workshop.

title: LIMIT ON EARNINGS FOR AGED FAVORED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 1 (UPI) Allowing elderly people to earn all they can and still col lect full Social Security bene fits would help relatively few retired people and would require increased taxes for all workers, according to a study by the National Council of Senior Citizens released today.

title: Challenge by Democrats By E. W. KENWORTHY
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 1After President Nixon signed the Na tional Environmental Policy Act of 1969 in San Clemente today, separate challenges to the Ad ministration were issued by two Democratic Senators who have been zealous in promoting legis lation to rescue and preserve the environment.

title: Cultural Center Appoints Director
description: Donald H. Karshan, a print collector and writer on the graphic arts, has been ap pointed the first director of the New York Cultural Cen ter in Association with Fair leigh Dickinson University.

title: Horses Called Best 1969 Film
description: They Shoot Horses, Don't They? the adaptation of the 1935 Horace McCoy novel about marathon dancers of the nineteenthirties, has been named the best film of 1969 by the National Board of Re view of Motion Pictures. The organization, which has been selecting top movies for 49 years, chose a Swedish drama Ingmar Bergman's Shame, as the year's outstanding for eignlanguage feature.

title: Thousands Brave Cold For Mummers Parade
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan 1 (AP) Fifteen thousand men and boys pranced up Broad Street today in this city's annual Mummers Parade, and thou sands of spectators braved temperatures in the mid twenties to watch.

title: POLICE CHIEF QUITS IN CAIRO, ILL., AGAIN
description: CAIRO, III., Jan. 1 (UPI) Police Chief William Petersen resigned today, charging that appointed judges had de serted the lawabiding citi zen and made it necessary for him to provide safe escort for clenched fist mili tants to parade your streets every Saturday and Sunday.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To End Building Bias

title: Southern California Tops Michigan, 103, in Rose Bowl
description: PASADENA, Calif., Jan. 1 The Southern California Trojans, scoring on a 33yard touch down pass from Jimmy Jones to Bob Chandler, upset the fa vored Michigan Wolverines, 103 today before a record crowd of 103,878 spectators in the 56th Rose Bowl game.

title: NASA Closing Decried
description: BOSTON, Jan. 1 (AP)Elden L. Auker, president of Asso ciated Industries of Massachu setts, said today that the planned closing of the $36 million Electronics Research Center of the National Aero nautics and Space Administra tion in Cambridge was a devastating blow to the future development of our whole state. In a letter to officials in each of the 2,500 member companies of the state manu facturing organization, Mr. Auker said, The questionable logic of this socalled economy move must be challenged.

title: Turnbull & Alum Head Joins Clinton E. Frank
description: Henry R. Turnbull, who had been president of Turn bull & Allum, has joined Clinton E. Frank/New York as a vice president and brought four pieces of busi ness with him.

title: High Price of Subway Peace
description: Mayor Lindsay's second term has begun with the New Year's greeting he wanted most: assurance that there would be no repetition of the catastrophic sub way and bus strike that ushered in his first term. That assurance is a welcome relief to every other New Yorker.

title: Communique by Vietcong  Calls Situation Very Good
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 1 (Reu ters)A New Year's communi qu from Vietcong headquarters in South Vietnam describes the military situation as very good and instructs troops to kill as many American and Sai gon Government soldiers as possible.

title: FORGERY ALLEGED OVER TV LICENSE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 1  The Federal Communications Com mission is considering new hearings on a California TV li cense dispute to determine whether the signature of one of President Nixon's aides was forged on a stockholder list in 1965.

title: Museum Beckoning Space Explorers
description: I'd like people to bring a terrific amount of innocence to this, said Michael Asher, padding around the floor of his bare white chamber in stocking feet. They shouldn't have preconceived notions of What will happen, but simply experience what's here.

title: Band Leader Killed by Car
description: REVERE, Mass., Jan. 1 (AP) Frank Gee, 34yearold leader of a North Shore polka band, was killed early today in a hit run automobile accident, the police said.

title: SIERRA CLUB ACTS TO EXPAND IN EAST
description: A rapidly increasing member ship in the Eastern United States has led the Sierra Club, the national conservation or ganization, to restructure its East Coast operation here, with more emphasis on pollution, overpopulation and urban de cay.

title: Instructions Will Start Ran at the Sheridan Sq.
description: Instructions for the Run ning of Trains, Etc. on the Erie Railway to Go Into Ef fect Monday January 1, 1862.

title: 2 Abandoned Children Found Dead in Search
description: ATHENS, Ohio, Jan. 1 (UPI) Two small brothers, apparently abandoned by their mother who recently underwent treatment for a mental disorder, were found dead today along Ohio Route 100 near here.

title: ISRAEL REJECTS FRENCH CHARGES
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 1Israel tonight denied any violation of the French arms embargo against her and said that Paris's criticism of her in the case of the transferred gunboats was unjustified.

title: FogFree State Budget
description: Governor Rockefeller's disclosure that he will sup port an increase of roughly $300 million in state aid to education, should not be taken as an indication that anything like this sum in fresh money will be available to local school districts. The greater part of it will merely restore the $245 million in school aid cuts imposed by the Legislature on the Governor's recom mendation last spring.

title: Nixon Consoles Ziegler On Image in the Press
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 1 (UPI)The White House press secretary, Ron ald L. Ziegler, doesn't like everything he reads about himself. But he was consoled today by the highest source in the landPresident Nixon.

title: S. S. Kresge Reports Gain Of 24.9% in 4Week Sales
description: The S.S. Kresge Company registered sales of $351,0??0,000 in the four weeks ended Dec. 27, the chain announced yes terday. Sales were 24.9 per cent over those in the like period of 1968.

title: Mood in Capital: Change Will Be Slow
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 1 The President is off in Cali fornia watching football on television. The Vice President is off in Southeast Asia. Con gress has scattered, and the Supreme Court is out of sight.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: FICTION

title: Ford Fund to Assist Publishing And Recording of New Music
description: A $375,000 program to as sist in the recording of serious contemporary American music has been established by the Ford Foundation.

title: Bridge
description: THIS may be the year; 1970 may well see a victory for the United States in the world team championship for the first time since 1954.

title: Benjamin Hedges Is Dead at 62; Former Big Brothers Executive
description: Benjamin Van Doren Hedges, a former executive vice presi dent of the National Big Broth ers of America and a silver medalist in the 1928 Olympic games at Amsterdam, died Wednesday at Roosevelt Hospi tal of a heart ailment. He was 62years old and lived at the Columbia University Club, 4 West 43d Street.

title: Sailors Brave the Cold and Ice at Frostbite Regatta
31 Police Cars Fail Test
description: GARY, Ind., Jan. 1 (UPI) Thirtyone Gary police cars half of the department's fleet were off the streets today he cause they failed to pass safety inspection. Officials said that the cars must either be pui back into shape by the end ?? this month or be scrapped. A spokesman said that heavy wear was the chief cause for the failure.

title: Michigan Coach Felled By Abdominal Ailment
description: PASADENA, Calif., Jan. 1 Glenn (Bo) Schembecher, Michigan coach taking his first team to the Rose Bowl, went to the hospital instead today.

title: Smoke Poisoning Fatal To Man Fighting Police
description: An autopsy report from the Medical Examiner's office said yesterday that the man found dead in his burnedout Harlem apartment Wednesday was killed by asphyxia from smoke inhalation.

title: Text of Pope's World Peace Day Prayer
description: ROME, Jan. 1Following, in translation by the Vatican from the Italian, is the text of Pope Paul's prayer for peace, delivered this evening:

title: Sponsor of Pollution Control Bill
description: AS one of the most power ful members of the United States Senate, 57yearold Henry Martin Jackson en joyed a number of triumphs last year involving one of his two chief concernsthe ex tension of America's nuclear and military powers.

title: Mediums Asked to Help Find Woman Missing in London
description: LONDON, Jan. 1 (Reuters) Distraught relatives of Mrs. Al exander McKay, believed to have been kidnaped Monday, called in two mediums today to help find the ailing 55year old wife of the acting chairman of News of the World.

title: Peter B. Rankin Engaged to Wed Ellen A. Curtis
description: Mrs. Anne Semler Curtis of New York and Blue Hill, Me., and Dr. Charles Pelham Curtis of Fairfield, Conn., have made known the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Ellen Amory Curtis, to Peter Brinton Rankin. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Har ley Rankin of Haverford, Pa. The couple plan to be mar ried in June.

title: 2 Recipes for Weekend Chefs
description: IN the menus below, dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: State's New Year's Baby
description: SYRACUSE, Jan. 1 (AP) Michelle Lee Edwards let out a lusty wail today as she became the state's first new citizen of the nineteenseventies. Doctors at Community General Hospital said the sevenpound girl was born two seconds after mid night to Mr. and Mrs. Patrick Edwards of nearby Lafayette. She was described as a per fect baby.

title: Another Male Bastion, the Levee in Toronto, Falls
description: TORONTO, Jan. 1If Lieut. Gov. W. Ross Macdonald's New Year reception this morning may be taken as a sign of the times, a tear should be shed for tradition, which is losing ground in Ontario.

title: New Israeli Settlement Set Up on West Bank
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 1 (Reu ters)Israel today established its fourth settlement in the occupied Jordan Valley.

title: NETS HALT RALLY AND BEAT PACERS
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 2 (UPI) The New York Nets put down a late rally by the Indiana Pacers tonight and triumphed 125112 in an American Basket ball Association game.

title: CONSUMER FRAUD IS NASSAU TARGET
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Jan. 2  A local law under which civil pen aides of up to $500 could be imposed in cases of consumer fraud was proposed today by Nassau County Executive Eu gene H. Nickerson.

title: 1969 PROFIT EASES AT C.&O. AND B.&O.
description: The Chesapeake & Ohio and Baltimore & Ohio Railroads re ported yesterday that their con solidated profits for 1969 eased slightly to $52.5million, or $6.05 a share, from $53.9mil lion, or $6.21 a share, in 1968.

title: Queens Democrats Unite for Induction of Leviss
description: The Democratic party in Queens united yesterday to celebrate the retention of the Borough Presidency by a party offiiceholder, finding occasion in the induction of Sidney Leiiss, a chief policy maker in the borough administration fox 11 years, as head of the coun try government.

title: A Pollution Drive Aimed at Vehicles Is Started Upstate
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 2 (AP) Seven patrol cars cruised throughout Erie County to day looking for motor vehicles that were polluting the air. Inspectors reported spotting 41 of them.

title: Transport Halted in Italy
description: ROME, Jan. 2 (AP) Public transport stopped for about four hours today in major Ital ian cities in a nationwide strike. Public transport workers are seeking a new contract with higher wages from Italian mu nicipalities, most of them deep in debt. The transport employes will stirke again twice next week.

title: Family Shares Tate Estate
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., Jan. 2 (AP)The $45,000 estate of Sharon Tate, the actress, will be shared by her husband, Ro man Polanski, and four mem bers of her family, it was dis closed today.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON HOW FIRM TREND
description: Prices on the London Stock Exchange were firmer over broad front yesterday as buy ing turned more active on news of the easing of travel restric tions.

title: 16th Milan Bomb Victim Dies
description: MILAN, Italy, Jan. 2 (UPI) The bombing of a bank Dec. 12 claimed its 16th victim today with the death of Calogero Galatioto, 71 years old. Four teen persons died the day of the blast.

title: Jean D. McConnell, Teacher, Engaged
description: ENCINO, Calif., Jan. 2 The engagement of Miss Jean Daly McConnell to John Ray mond Smiley, a senior at Princeton University, has been announced by her par ents, Mr. and Mrs. Malcolm Findley McConnell. Her fi anc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Wilson Smiley of Pittsburgh.

title: Flu Epidemic Hits Players, 7 Soccer Games Canceled
description: LONDON, Jan. 2 (AP)  The flu epidemic hit soccer teams today and caused postponement of four games in the third round of the English Cup slated for tomorrow. Three league games also were called off.

title: New City Hospital Agency Is Delayed to Critical Point by Political Infighting
description: Out of public view at City Hall, months of political in fighting have delayed the for mation of a quasiindependent agency that must take over the 18 city hospitals by July 1.

title: Nigeria Says Troops Have Cut Biafra Into 3 Parts
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Jan. 2 (AP) Nigerian troops, after months of hitter fighting, have cleared vital roads through Biafra, cut ting the enclave into three parts, a Defense Ministry spokesman said today.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SATURDAY, JANUARY 3, 1970

title: BLUE CROSS GRANTED RATE RISE UPSTATE
description: The State Insurance Depart ment yesterday announced a rate increase averaging 27 per cent for subscribers of Blue Cross in northeastern New York. It is effective March 1.

title: AMERICAN HOCKEY LEAGUE
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Mrs. Jones Gains Net Final
description: PORT ELIZABETH, South Africa, Jan. 2 (AP)Mrs. Ann Jones of Britain scored an easy victory today in the semifinal of the women's singles at the Eastern Province tennis cham pionships by beating Marianne Brummer of South Africa, 64, 61.

title: Antiques: Florida's Imposing Monument of 1901
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., Jan. 2 The Henry Morrison Flagler Museuth at Whitehall, the mansion Mr. Flagler built in 1901, is proof that fine craftsmanship was still strong at the century's turn.

title: Agnew Leaves Taiwan
description: TAIPEI, Jan. 3 (UPI)Vice President Agnew left for Thai land at 11:55 A.M. today after a 70minute session with Gen eralissimo Chiang, who accom panied him to the airport.

title: Cries of Outrage and Prospect of Revolt by Riders Greet News of Fare Increase
description: The 20cent transit fare was pronounced dead yesterday and its mourners were legion.

title: FINCH RELAXES SECURITY CHECKS FOR CONSULTANTS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2The Department of Health, Educa tion and Welfare relaxed for parttime personnel today the security clearance procedures that had led to the blacklisting, of scientific consultants to the Government and the animosity of many intellectual societies.

title: College Basketball
I.T.T. Sees a Profit Rise
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation said yesterday that it was antici pated our earnings in 1969 con tinued the rate of growth dem onstrated in the first nine months, which showed an in crease of 15 per cent. The statement was issued in re sponse to queries arising after liarold S. Geneen, chairman and president, had not com7 mented on earnings in a year end review made public yester day. Mr. Geneen had reported a strong increase in sales in 1970, rising to about $5billion from $4.1billion in 1968.

title: Vikings' Groundskeeper Finds Snow Removal Painful, Costly
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Jan. 2The persistent snows of the North Country have cost the Vikings $75,000 in the last six weeks and they also cost Dick Ericson one sprained ankle.

title: New Suffolk County Legislature Replaces 287YearOld System
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., Jan. 2 Members of the new Suffolk County Legislature took their oaths of office and held their first meeting today, officially ending a form of government that has ruled the county for 287 years.

title: COURT IN PRETORIA CONVICTS RIGHTIST
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Jan. 2  Dr. Albert Hertzog, an ultrarightwing Member of Parliament, was given a sus pended sentence of a 29 fine ($69.60) or 50 days in jail for refusing to give evidence to an inquiry into state security.

title: Henry C. Strippel, 88, Dead; An Authority on Genealogy
description: WHITE PLAINS, Jan. 2 Henry C. Strippel, an authority on genealogy, died today after a long illness at White Plains Hospital. He was 88 years old and lived at 86 Caterson Ter race Hartsdale. N. Y.

title: HOOVER DEPLORES ATTACKS ON POLICE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 (UPI) J. Edgar Hoover, director of the Federal Bureau of Investiga tion, said today that black ex tremists fomenting racial tur moil killed at least seven police men in the last six months in more than 100 attacks.

title: I.M.F. ALLOCATES FIRST PAPER GOLD $3.4Billion Is Distributed to 104 Member Nations U.S. Share. Biggest
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 (AP) The International Monetary Fund said today it had com pleted the first distribution of the new money substitute known as paper gold.

title: Navy's Undersea Ambulance Being Prepared for Tests
description: SUNNYVALE, Calif.  The Navy's first undersea ambu lancea vessel designed to dive deep into the sea and rescue submarine crewmen stranded on the ocean flooris being prepared for launching late this month.

title: A Law Named for Willie Sutton Assists Physicial
description: Willie Sutton's release from prison this holiday season re calls the internationally known bank robber's indirect contri bution to medical education  a guide to doctors known as Sutton's Law.

title: Tariff Cut to 21% On Carpet Imports
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 2 (AP)  President Nixon an nounced today a sharp reduc tion in tariffs on imported Wil ton and velvet carpets and rugs of oriental design.

title: Ed A. Diddle, Basketball Coach At Western Kentucky, Is Dead
description: BOWLING GREEN, Ky., Jan 2 (UPI)Ed A. Diddle Sr., the colorful Western Kentucky Uni versit basketball coach who retired in 1964, died this morn ing at a hospital here after suffering his 13th heart attack He was 74 years old.

title: Old Enough to Know
description: Readers and viewers in this country who think journalists have problems because of occasional pres sure from Washington to tell it like it isn't ought to consider the plight of journalists in uniform in Viet nam who must try to serve two mastersthe Army and free expression. In most cases the military ver sion dominates the news in official publications and broadcasts.

title: 4 Negroes Freed in Georgia
description: SANDERSVILLE, Ga., Jan. 2 (UPI)Richard Turner, a civil rights leader, and three other Negroes were freed this after noon after spending six days in jail in connection with the shooting of Leslie Sanders, a white man, a week ago outside Mr. Turner'g home. Mr. Turner, Lonnie Cooper, Bernard An thony and a 16yearold ju venile appeared before Justice of the Peace Julian Knight, who dismissed all charges against them.

title: Oil Company Plans To Buy Charter Co. In Realty Venture
description: The Occidental Petroleum Corporation announced yester day that it had reached an agreement in principle to ac quire the Charter Company, which through its subsidiaries is engaged in the mortgage, loan, real, estate and banking business.

title: MRS. KIN HUBBARD
description: ZIONSVILLE, Ind., Jan. 2 (UPI)Mrs. Josephine J. Hub bard widow of the humorist Kin Hubbard, died yesterday in Hoosier Village, a retirement home.

title: Burlington Sights Outlays
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., Jan. 2 (UPI)  Burlington Industries, Inc., today projected fiscal 1970 capital expenditures in a range of $120million to $140million. The textile concern said its 1969 capital expenditures, were $133.7million.

title: Wharton Takes Charge As Michigan State Head
description: EAST LANSING, Mich., Jan. 2 (AP)  Clifton R. Wharton Jr. took charge of Michigan State University today.

title: Rites for Hinson Stiles
description: A funeral service for Hinson Stiles, managing editor of The New York Mirror from 1935 to 1958, who died in Palm Beach, Fla., Wednesday at the age of 76, will be held at 11 A.M. Monday at Frank E. Campbell's, Madison Avenue and 81st Street. Burial will be at Fern cliff Cemetery in Hartsdale, N. Y.

title: GALLEY'S LAWYER FLIES TO SONNY
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., Jan. 2 (AP)The Army defense attor ney for Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. and the prosecution officer left today by plane for personal investigations at Songmy, scene of an alleged massacre.

title: NEW HEAD OF BRONX URGES FREE TRANSIT
description: Bronx Borough President Robert Abrams, angered by what he called Governor Rocke feller's disgraceful acquies cence to the transit fare in crease to 30 cents, asserted yesterday that mass transit should be totally free to New Yorkers, as are police, fire and sanitation services.

title: Leonard G. Hunt, a Founder Of Emery Air Freight, Dies
description: JAFFREY CENTRE, N. H., Jan. 2Leonard Garland Hunt, a founder and former senior vice president of Emery Air Freight, died Wednesday at his home here. He was 69 years old.

title: BANK REPORT
British Bill Rate Dips
description: LONDON, Jan. 2 (Reuters) The average rate of discount it today's tender of British reasury 91day bills fell to 590 per cent from 7.650 per ent last week. This week's 100million offer met applica ions of 230,610,000. Next yeek 100million of such bills ??ill be offered, replacing 110 million of maturities.

title: 17 IN JERSEY DENY NUMBERS CHARGE
description: NEWARK, Jan. 2Simone Rizzo DeCavalcante, a reputed Mafia chieftain known as Sam the Plumber, and 16 other per sons pleaded not guilty today to Federal charges that they conspired to operate a $20mil lionavear numbers racket.

title: Mayor in 31st Year on Job
description: UNION, N. J., Jan. 2Mayor F. Edviiard Biertuempfel today began his 31st year as chief executive of this township after being unanimously reelected by the township committee at its organization meeting yester day. Mr. Biertuempfel, 75 years old, is one of the longestserv ing Mayors in the nation. The Mayor was first elected to the committee in Novernber 1929.

title: Sports of The Times
description: THE recent White House Conference on Food, Nutrition and Health, among many points raised in its final report, criticized the emphasis on interscholastic sports to the detriment of general physical fitness programs, and suggested that business and government plants and build ings include exercise facilities. The report was issued time for members of the American family to discuss it they jogged between the television set and the refrigerator during the timeouts of football Bowl games on New Year's Day. Everyone agreed that exercise was a fine thing for athletes and nuts.

title: STATE BANKS SUBJECT TO TAXES ON SALES
description: ALBANY, Jan. 2 (UPI)New York State's 200 national banks are now subject to state and local sales and use taxes, Act ing State Tax Commissioner Norman Gallman said today.

title: Buccaneers Win, 9491
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 2 (AP) A frantic lastminute rally by Los Angeles fell just a little short Friday night and the New Orleans Buccaneers edged the Stars, 9491.

title: Virginia Governor Pardons Youth, 20, On Drug Conviction
description: RICHMOND, Jan. 2 (AP)  Gov. Mills E. Godwin Jr. issued a conditional pardon today for Frank P. Lavarre, a 20yearold student whose 20year prison sentence on a marijuana pos session conviction had received wide publicity.

title: PARIS COMMUNIST SCORES HIS PARTY
description: PARIS, Jan. 2A leader of the liberal trend in Western Communism assailed the French Communist apparatus today in its own newspaper, the daily L'Humanite.

title: Colonels Top Pipers
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 2 (AP) Gene Moore, a 6foot9inch center, tossed in 35 points as the Kentucky Colonels beat the Pittsburgh Pipers, 108106, in an American Basketball Asso ciation game tonight.

title: YOUNG LORDS DEFY TAKEOVER ORDER
description: A group of young Puerto Rican militants refused yester day to comply with a court order requiring them to vacate an East Harlem church they seized last Sunday. the preliminary injunction, granted by State Supreme Court Justice Hyman Korn to offi cials of the First Spanish Methodist Church, was read aloud from the steps of the church, at 163 East 111th Street, by Deputy Sheriff Robert E. Lee at about 5:30 P.M.

title: Thursday Basketball
description: COLLEGES

title: A Correction
description: WASHINGTON, Jan., 2A news article in The New York Times of Nov. 30 concerning the misuse of Swiss bank ac counts by Americans said that Billie Sol Estes had bilked the Department of Agriculture out of millions with a mirage of liquid fertilizer tanks. Estes did not bilk the Agriculture De partment; he was convicted of having defrauded a dozen major finance Companies by selling them mortgages listing as security fertilizer tanks that existed.

title: Hirohito Shielded at Fete
description: TOKYO, Jan. 2 (Reuters) Emperor Hirohito, who on Jan. 2, 1969, was a target of mortal marbles fired from a slingshot, stood behind a protective trans parent shield today to receive traditional New Year greetings from wellwishers at the palace.

title: Saigon to Give Tet Bonus
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 2 (UPI)  South Vietnamese servicemen and civil servants will receive a bonus of 4,000 piasters or about $34, for Tet, the lunar new year, the Govern ment announced today. The bonus at Tet, 1969, was 2,000 piasters. Tet, the biggest Viet namese holiday of the year, falls on Feb. 7.

title: City's Transit Authority Run by Regional Agency
description: Six men seated around a cluttered conference table made the final decision yesterday that raised the transit fare here to 30 cents.

title: Nasser Leaves Khartoum
description: CAIRO, Jan. 2 (Reuters)  President Gamal Abdel Nasser returned home today after a twoday visit to Khartoum, the Sudan.

title: In Wartime Hanoi, Posters Are Few, Their Tone Mild
description: HANOI, North Vietnam In the curiously relaxed atmosphere of wartime Hanoi, there are a few loudspeakers scattered through the streets and some people rise at 5 A.M. to do exercises.

title: Statement From Pittsburgh
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 2A spokesman for United States Steel here said tonight that the management decision of the Fairfield Works in Alabama closing its gates to foreign made cars is not corporate policy.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHTS GAMES

title: SHARP CLASH ENDS ALLIED CEASEFIRE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 2 (AP)  In the first sharp ground action of 1970, an American patrol clashed in a fourhour battle with North Vietnamese infiltrators near the Cambodian border, mili tary spokesman reported today.

title: Eastern Europe Combats Air Pollution
description: VIETNNA, Jan. 21  A new state Commission for the Pro tection of Air Purity started its work in Budapest this week, exemplifying rising concern throughout Eastern Europe over the deterioration of the environment.

title: BANK OF JAPAN BACK IN A WORLD AGENCY
description: TOKYO, Jan. 2 (AP)The Bank of Japan announced today that it had formally returned to the Bank for International Settlements headquartered in Basel, Switzerland.

title: BEERICH, $14.40, TROPICAL WINNER
description: MIAMI, Jan. 2 (AP)Morris Wexler's Beerich closed with a rush to win today's seventh race at Tropical Park before a crowd of 9.155.

title: Demolition Worker Killed
description: A 23yearold demolition worker was killed at 10:30 A.M. yesterday in a building being torn down at 622 Third Avenue at 40th Street. The police said the victim, Eugene Boyko, of 216 West 252d Street, the Bronx, was stand ing on a secondfloor stair case when he was buried by the debris from a section of the third floor that collapsed.

title: Controversial Judge Announces Retirement From State Court
description: State Supreme Court Justice Charles Marks, who in 32 years on the bench dealt vigorously with the courtroom conduct of defense and prosecution law yers and unruly spectators, re tired yesterday.

title: Musical Casts Feature Roles
description: Liz Otto and Alan Marlowe have been signed to play fea tured roles in the new musical, I Dreamt I Dwelt in Bloom ingdale's. The production will open on Feb. 4 at the Province town Playhouse after previews starting Jan. 22. The book was written by Jack Ramer and the lyrics by Mr. Ramer and Ernest McCarty.

title: Nassau Golf Fee to Rise
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Jan. 2 (UPI) Golfers who play Nassau County's public courses may expect an increase in fees, Pub lic Works Commissioner Her bert J. Simins said today. Be cause of rising costs the County Board of Supervisors will be asked to raise the 18 nole weekday rate from $2 to $2.50 and the weekend fee from $3 to $3.75.

title: JUDGE AGAIN DENIES HOFFA A NEW TRIAL
description: CHATTANOOGA, Jan. 2 James R. Hoffa, teamsters union president, today lost another effort to get a new trial. He is serving an eightyear prison sentence for jury tampering.

title: Comely Tax, ExStable Pony, Takes Liberty Bell Park Dash
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 2 Comely Tex, a former stable Pony, captured the feature at Liberty Bell Park today.

title: Wendy Cordtz Plans Wedding
description: RYE, N. Y., Jan. 2Miss Wendy Carol Cordtz, a sen ior at Middlebury College, and Second Lieut. Samuel Knox Eaton Jr., U.S.A., a 1969 graduate of Middlebury, have chosen June 13 as the date for their wedding here.

title: Stewards' Strike Curbs Flights by Air France
description: PARIS, Saturday, Dec. 3 (AP) Air France canceled most of its European flights and two flights to New York yesterday because of a strike by steward esses and stewards. A flight to Tokyo was delayed.

title: C. W. Post Taps Cortland
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Jan. 2 Led by Jack Ferguson and Jim Webber, C. W. Post College ral lied from a 14point secondhalf deficit tonight and defeated Cortland State 8073, at Conolly Gym.

title: NIXON FINISHING HIS FIRST BUDGET
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 2 (UPI)President Nixon finished his billsigning chores today and began locking up the Federal budget for the 1971 fis cal year.

title: Al Kooper Joins 2 Rock Groups In a Blues Session at Town Hall
description: Al Kooper, who became one of the most important figures in the rock of the last few years, gave two concerts last night at Town Hall.

title: Ballet: Holiday's Fare
description: WHAT would Christmas be without The Nutcrack er? For that matter what would The Nutcracker be without Christmas? However the yearend rituals of New York City Ballet at the New York State Theater are now settled in their ways, and The Nutcracker and Christ mas go together like witches and hemlock.

title: COL. HOWARD DUNHAM
description: WETHERSFIELD, Conn., Jan. 2  Col. Howard P. Dunham, former president of the Na tional Convention of Insurance Commissioners, died yesterday at a convalescent hospital in Hartford. He was 91 years old.

title: Michigan End Hurts Knee
description: PASADENA, Calif., Jan. 2 (UPI)Billy Harris, Michigan split end, sufflered torn li gaments in his left knee in yes terday's Rose Bowl loss to Southern Califorriiia. Harris, a senior who caught one pass for 12 yards against was in jured on the Wolverines' last offensive series when he failed to catch a pass from Don Moorhead in the end zone.

title: Alcindor Scores 41 as Bucks Register First Victory Over Knicks, 118105
description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 2Mid way through their second sea son in the National Basketball Association, the Milwaukee Bucks finally managed to de feat the New York Knicker bockers tonight before a ca pacity crowd of 10,746 at Mil waukee Arena.

title: Beethoven's Bicentenary
description: Although the bicentenary year of Beethoven's birth has scarcely begun, the celebrations have already started. And what is in store for the rest of the year will make even the stanchest Beethovenlover cringe. The truth is that it is hard to know how to honor the man. There hasn't been a time when his music wasn't playedand endlessly.

title: Rockets Win 6th in Row
description: DENVER, Colo., Jan. 2 (AP) The Rockets rallied from an 8point deficit at the end of the first period tonight and downed the Washington Capitols, 129 113, for their sixth consecutive victory.

title: New Tokens Go on Sale in Subways
description: The shiny new 30cent sub way tokenbetween the size of a nickel and a quarter went on sale last night at change booths in all 484 sta tions of the rapidtransit sys tem.

title: FARE GOES UP TO 30 CENTS AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT; PLEA BY MAYOR REJECTED
description: The Transit Authority raised the bus and subway fare from 20 cents to 30 cents yesterday to provide additional revenue to meet an increasingly serious deficit.

title: Rams, Cowboys in Consolation Game
description: MIAMI, Jan. 2 (UPI)  The Los Angeles Rams and the Dal las Cowboys will vent their wounded pride against each other tomorrow afternoon in the National Football League's Playoff Bowl for a consolation payoff of $700 extra to each winning player.

title: GOVERNOR IS CHOSEN FOR FRANKLIN AWARD
description: The Franklin Award for Dis tinguished Service will be pre sented to Governor Rockefeller at the 1970 Printing Week Din ner on Jan. 22 in the Grand Ballroom of the WaldorfAs toria.

title: Prosecutor Injured by Blast in Car
description: MORGANTOWN, W. Va., Jan. 2 (UPI)Joseph Laurita, a crusading county prosecu tor, was seriously injured to day when his boobytrapped automobile exploded as he turned on the ignition.

title: For Children, It Really Is a Discovery Center
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I.  It looked a little like the year 2000  with Plexiglas mazes and sloping semicircles of white Fiberglas and curved, softly lighted bays along the wallsbut it was really a big playroom, de signed very much for today.

title: A Seasonal Letup Is Reflected In Sparse New Issues for Week
description: Activity in the newissue market slowed to a snail's pace this week, reflecting a seasonal letup of new offerings.

title: Miss Piderit Fiance Of L. P. Murphy Jr.
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Fred W. Piderit Jr. of Richmond Hill, Queens, of the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Celeste Mary Piderit, to Lawrence Patrick Murphy Jr., son of State Assembly man and Mrs. Murphy of Brooklyn.

title: Israelis Seize 7Ton Radar And Airlift It Out of Egypt
description: JERUSALEM, Saturday, Jan. 3Israeli commandos re moved a seventon radar installation last Friday night from an Egyptian coastal position at Ras Ghareb on the Gulf Suez and brought it back to Israelioccupied Sinai.

title: It's Not Just Another Apartment to the Elderly
description: ARETIRED lawyer and widower, Benjamin Esk witt, slowly surveyed one of two model apartments that recently opened at Kittay House, which will have 249 units designed for older, but still selfreliant people.

title: Miss Jennifer P. Marks Affianced
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Jan. 2Mr. and Mrs. Lionel Pea body Marks have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Jennifer Peabody Marks, to John Douglas Peck, son of Mrs. Mahlon F. Peck of Rocky Hill, Conn., and the late Mr. Peck, who was a professor of psychology at Western Maryland College.

title: PLAYER WALKOUT IS TIED TO BIAS
description: AMARILLO, Tex., Jan. 2 (AP) A North Texas State Univer sity football player said he and three other blacks quit the South team two days before tomorrow's second annual American Bowl game in Tampa, Fla., because of a racial inci dent at the hotel where they were staying.

title: For Thieu, 1969 Was a Good Year
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 2The best Nguyen Van Thieu could hope for, an ex perienced Western diplomat was saying the other day, would be another year as good as the last.

title: Liberian Ship Says'Cubans Fired Warning Shots at Her
description: MIAMI, Jan. 2 (AP) A Cuban gunboat fired warning shots at a Liberian cargo ship off the Cuban coast last night and or dered her toward port, the ship's owners reported today. The vessel, the Deep Freeze, later was allowed to continue on her way before reaching a Cuban port.

title: New Year Donors Contribute $12,415 To Neediest Cases
description: The new year is only three days old and in many homes throughout the country the signs of Christmas are being removed. Discarded Christmas trees are already a nuisance on the streets, and ornaments and artificial trees are being stored away.

title: Baltimore Pressmen Call Strike Against 3 Papers
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 2Local 31 of the Web Pressmen's Un ion struck the city's three newspaper publishers tonight over higher wages.

title: West German Border Guards Rescue Youth Hurt by Mine
description: MELLRICHSTADT, West Ger many, Jan. 2. (AP)  Three West German border guards risked their lives last night to rescue a 17yearold East Ger man in danger of bleeding to death in an East German mine field.

title: Construction Rate Declines
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2The value of new sonstruction ac tivity fell substantially in No vember to an annual rate of $92billion from a revised rate of $93.9billion in October, the Commerce Department reported here today.

title: Boston Stock Exchange Votes on Japan Members
description: BOSTON, Jan. 2 (AP)Mem bers of the Boston Stock Ex change are to vote Jan. 12 on admitting three more Japanese concerns as members, the ex change announced today.

title: 17% Rate Rise Is Granted In Fire Pool Insurance
description: The New York State Depart ment of Insurance announced yesterday that it had author ized a 17 per cent rate increase for coverage written through the New York Property Insur ance Underwriting Association, known also as the Fire Pool.

title: Westbury Opens Trot Season Tonight on New $1Million Rubberized Track
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Jan. 2 Harness racing bounces back onto gait here tomorrow night on a new rubber track sup posedly as resilient as horseplayer's bankroll.

title: Francis I. duPont Appoints Executives
description: John W. Allyn and Milton A. Speicher have been named senior partners of the invest ment firm of Francis I. du Pont & Co.

title: Son to Mrs. Kirsten
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Joachim R. Kirsten of New York on Dec. 23 in the LyingIn Hospital. Mrs. Kirsten is the former Miss Victoria Campbell, daughter of Sir Ralph Campbell, Chief Justice, Supreme Court, Nas sau, the Bahamas, and Lady Campbell of Bournemouth, England. The child, whose father is president of Pan continental Marine, Inc., has been named Charles Richard.

title: REV. A. J. L. WILLIAMS
description: The Rev. A. J. Langtry Wil liams, who retired in 1967 as rector of St. Andrews Episcopal Church in Astoria, died Tues day in St. John's Hospital, Brooklyn. He was 75 years old.

title: BULLETS CONQUER ROYALS, 118 T0 116
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 2 (AP) A rolling hook shot by Wes Unseld with 50 seconds to play, followed by Kevin Loughery's key steal, gave the Baltimore Bullets a 118116 National Basketball Association victory over the Cincinnati Royals tonight.

title: Poverty Witness Put Under Guard After Threat Here
description: A major witness against Coy D. Smith, a member of the Durham Mob indicted for al legedly stealing more than $500,000 in antipoverty funds, was shot at last week and has been placed under 24houra day guard.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX SHOW BIG UPTURN
description: The American Stock Ex change made its biggest ad vance in five months yesterday as volume slumped from Wednesday's record daily total.

title: ARAB STATES' OFFER TO JEWS REPORTED
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Jan. 2A spokesman for Al Fatah, the largest Palestinian commando group, reports that certain Arab states have told his or ganization that they are will ing to receive back Jews who emigrated to Israel and now wish to return to their coun tries of origin.

title: Commodity Markets Closed
description: The nation's principal com modity futures exchanges were closed yesterday, giving traders a long fourday New Year's holiday. Therefore no price quotations were available. All the exchanges will be open for business as usual on Monday.

title: Carlen Is Hired by Texas Tech; Bowden Replaces Him at W. Va.
description: LUBBOCK, Tex., Jan. 2 (AP) Jim Carlen, whose West Vir ginia football team lost only to Penn State in the season just ended, became head football coach of Texas Tech today.

title: RICHARD DUBORD, 48, EXMAINE OFFICIAL
description: WATERVILLE, Me., Jan. 2 Richard J. Dubord, a former Maine Attorney General and a Democratic National Committee man for 12 years, died early today in a Boston hospital at the age of 48. He had under gone surgery yesterday for a ruptured blood vessel in the head.

title: Pilot's Body in Wreckage
description: CROSSVILLE, Tenn., Jan. (UPI)The body of a 56year old professional pilot of Murray, Ky., was found today in the wreckage of his plane in rugged section of the Cumber land Mountains. The victim was identified as Toy Lenning, whose twinengine Piper Co manche disappeared Dec. 23. The plane apparently crashed while approaching the Cross ville airport for a landing.

title: Train Riders Here Delayed In Series of Breakdowns
description: Train commuters suffered a series of delays here yesterday.

title: Topics:
description: LONDON. Chroniclers of the calendar make a big fuss about the turn of a new decade but those of us who have seen the turn of a century are a little more blas. We still measure time for ourselves, family and friends by something much more personal birthdays.

title: CURBS ON CREDIT CONTINUE TIGHT
description: Demand for bank loans con tinued to increase and the Federal Reserve continued to pursue its effort to restrain credit, banking data published yesterday indicated.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Medical Priorities

title: FINALWEEK PUSH AIDS STORE SALES
description: A burst of sales in the final week before Christmas pushed December volume up by 9 per cent in New York department stores over the level of the year before.

title: Hepburn to Reveal Plans for Coco by Tuesday
description: By next Tuesday, Katharine Hepburn is expected to make known to the management of Coco her decision as to whether she will agree to an extension of her contract with the musical based on the life of Gabrielle Chanel, the de siener.

title: Gary School Strike Forecast
description: GARY, Ind., Jan. 2 (AP) Charles Smith, president of the Gary teachers union, said today that he saw no hope of averting a strike Monday. The contract with Local 4, American Federa tion of Teachers, expired Dec. 31 but Monday is the first scheduled day for classes after the Christmas holidays.

title: Triangular Wrestling Listed
description: New York Maritime College for Fort Schuyler in the Bronx will be host team in a trian gular wrestling match on Mon day night against the Univer sity of Michigan and the New York Athletic Club. The matches will be held at the New York A.C. Four national champions from Japan will be among those representing the N.Y.A.C.

title: Bridge
description: AN expert can usually judge quite quickly the caliber of an opponent who is un known to him. It is reason able to assume that a player who makes a good play has not done so by accident.

title: Driver of Gypsy Cab Shot In a Dispute With Police
description: A 28yearold gypsycab driv er was shot and seriously wounded last night when he hit one of two patrolmen with the other's nightstick while they were Riving him a summons.

title: SMITHERS ELECTS 2 AND INCORPORATES
description: F. S. Smithers & Co., an 113 yearold New York investment banking concern, announced yesterday its incorporation and the election of Arthur D. Lewis as chairman of the board and chief executive officer and W. Truslow Hyde Jr. as president.

title: LEON COTNAREANU OF LE FIGARO DIES
description: PARIS, Jan. 2  Lon Cot nareanu, former coowner of Le Figaro, the conservative Paris daily, and retired chair man of the Coty Perfume Com pany, died yesterday after a long illness in Geneva. He was 78 years old.

title: Harvard Six Wins, 74
description: MONTREAL, Jan. 2 (AP) Leif Rosenberger, John Turco and David Cavanaugh scored two goals each as Harvard de feated McGill, 74, in the Loyola College invitation hockey tour nament tonight.

title: Pound Circulation Fell $2.17Million in the Week
description: LONDON, Jan. 2 (AP)The statement of account of the Bank of England for the week ended Wednesday in thousands of pounds was as follows:

title: Brandt Will Visit Britain
description: LONDON, Jan. 2 (Reuters) Chancellor Willy Brandt of West Germany will officially visit Britain March 3 and 4, it was announced here today. Mr. Brandt's talks with Prime Min ister Wilson will cover pros pects for British membership in the Europtan Common Market

title: LEGISLATOR PLANS RACE AGAINST DODD
description: HARTFORD, Conn., Jan. 2 State Senator Edward L. Mar cus of New Haven, majority leader of the State Senate, is scheduled to announce next Thursday his candidacy for the Democratic nomination for the United States Senate in oppo sition to Senator Thomas J. Dodd.

title: Israelis Capture 21 in Raid in Lebanon
description: JERUSALEM, Saturday, Jan. 3 An Israeli commando unit en tered a Lebanese village this morning and captured 21 Arab prisoners, presumably to ex change for a 54yearold Israeli watchman kidnapped on Thurs day.

title: BillionDollar Mall
description: Governor Rockefeller's administration has at last reluctantly conceded that the total cost of the Albany South Mall project may exceed $1 billion. This more than four times the original estimate for the 98.5acre complex that will stretch from the State Capitol south for five blocks almost to the Gover nor's Mansion.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: R. Craig Campbell has been elected president and chief executive officer of Welch Foods, Inc., succeeding Ray mond T. Ryan, who is retiring after 25 years with the com pany.

title: Market Place:
description: WITH a disastrous year be hind the young money managers, Wall Street is ask ing the question: Is youth over the hill?

title: Thant Arrives in Senegal
description: DAKAR, Senegal, Jan. 2 (UPI)Secretary General Thant of the United Nations arrived here today on the second leg of a 10nation tour of Africa. Mr. Thant, who flew here from Nouakchott, Mauritania, was applauded by crowds as he drove with President Leopold Senghor through streets deco rated with United Nations and Sengalese flags.

title: Kings Name Cahan Captain
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 2 (AP) The Los Angeles Kings of the National Hockey League an nounced today that Larry Ca han, defenseman, had been appointed captain.

title: Makarios Stops in Greece; Confers on Cyprus Impasse
description: ATHENS, Jan. 2Archbishop Makarios, the President of Cyprus, conferred with leaders of Greece's military backed Government here today in re newed efforts for a formula of peaceful coexistence for Cy prus's Greek and Turkish com munities.

title: Nixon to Speak at Syracuse
description: SYRACUSE, Jan. 2 (AP) President Nixon will speak June 6 at Syracuse University's com mencement, the university said today. The President will help mark the 100th anniversary of the founding of the school.

title: Unsung Quarterbacks Make Sweet Music.
description: Through the entire season, scoutes condemned James Street, the Texas quarterback, as a baseball pitcher who couldn't throw a strike on the football field.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: THURSDAY NIGHT'S GAME

title: Coast Chief Justice to Resign; Reagan Will Choose Successor
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 2  Chief Justice Roger J. Traynor of the California Supreme Court announced his retirement today after 30 years on the bench.

title: COLGATE UPSETS MICH. TECH BY 94
description: SYRACUSE, N. Y., Jan. 2 (AP)Colgate upset Michigan Tech, 94, tonight in the open ing game of the second annual Syracuse invitation hockey tournament.

title: Promotion at Space Center
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 2 (UPI) Sigurd A. Sjoberg has been pro moted from deputy director to director of flight operations at the Manned Spacecraft Center, replacing Christopher C. Kraft Jr. Mr. Kraft was recently ap pointed deputy director of the center.

title: U.S. RAIDS ATTACK GAMING SYNDICATE
description: DETROIT, Jan. 2A nation wide gambling syndicate re puted to involve widely known sports figures was the target of a series of New Year's raids by Federal agents around the country.

title: Jeremy Kagan, Gretchen Frank Wed in Arizona
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Jan. 2 Miss Gretchen Lorraine Frank, daughter of Mr. And Mrs. John P. Frank, was mar ried at her parents' home here today to Jeremy Paul Kagan, a filmmakerdirector at the Center for Advanced Filmaking of the American Film Institute in Los Angeles. The ceremony was performed by Rabbi Jerrold Goldstein.

title: Herbie Hingle Wins
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 2 (AP) Herbie Hingle took the lead today and remained in front to win the feature race by a neck at the New Orleans Fair Grounds. The victor ran the six furlongs in 1:13 and paid $7.60, $4 and $2.60. Action Getter was second and returned $3.80 and $2.80. Storm Dance, the favorite, returned $2.80 to show.

title: Elizabeth Skinner Bride Of James W. Walkup Jr.
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Jan. 2 Miss Elizabeth Jean Skin ner and James William Walk up Jr., who received degrees last June from the Princeton Theological Seminary, were married in the Miller Chapel there this afternoon. The Presbyterian ceremony was performed by the Rev. Dr. Coval. MacDonald, professor of religious studies at Rice University and a former mem ber of the seminary's faculty.

title: Evolution of Fare Rises, Starting at 5c in 1904
description: Here is the evolution of the New York City transit fare: 5 centsFrom Oct. 27, 1904, to July 1, 1948. 10 centsFrom July 1, 1948, to July 25, 1953. 15 centsFrom July 25, 1953, to July 5, 1966. 20 centsFrom July 5, 1966, to Jan. 4, 1970. 30 centsBeginning at 12:01 A.M. on Jan. 4, 1970.

title: Browns' Coach Pessimistic About Chances Against Vikings in Title Game
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Jan. 2Bud Grant, coach of the Minnesota Vikings, and Blan ton Collier, his Cleveland coun terpart, reflected today the roles cast for their teams in Sunday's National Football Leaeue championship game.

title: Road Policeman Charged In Westchester Shooting
description: THORNWOOD, N. Y., Jan. 2 (AP)  A Westchester County parkway policeman shot his estranged wife and sisterin law yesterday following an ar gument, the Mount Pleasant police charged today.

title: Transport News and Notes
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 2 (AP) The world's largest railroad car, 177 feet long, left today with a 760,000kilowatt genera tor for the Turkey Point nu clear power plant in Florida.

title: St. Peter's Triumphs, 10583
description: JERSEY CITY, Jan. 2 St. Peter's College, scoring 64 points in a secondhalf surge, defeated Le Moyne, 10583, be fore 2,513 fans tonight at the City Armory.

title: Taxi Industry Due to Seek Higher Fares by Midyear
description: The taxi industry expects to ask the City Council for a fare increase by midyear so that it can remain competitive with the subway and bus system in attracting drivers.

title: THOUSANDS PHONE ON LACK OF HEAT
description: Complaints by the thousands poured into city offices yester day from tenants whose apart ments were without heata chronic winter problem and the most acute symptom of hous ing decay here.

title: Reputed Mafioso Surrenders
description: Natale Evola, a reputed Mafia chieftain, surrendered to District Attorney Eugene Gold of Brooklyn yesterday and be gan serving a 30day sentence for contempt, the District At torney's office said. Evola, 60, balked before a Brooklyn grand jury investigating seven mur ders and four shootings and the disappearance of Frank Mari, a reputed Mafia captain last Sep tember, and refused to testify.

title: Strike at Catholic Schools Is Set For Jan. 19 Unless Cooke Acts
description: A union representing lay teachers broke off contract ne gotiations yesterday and said it would strike the 301 schools of the Roman Catholic Archdi ocese of New York on Jan. 19 unless Cardinal Cooke reopened the talks.

title: Kerr Resigns as Coach of Suns; General Manager Takes Helm
description: PHOENIX, Jan. 2 (AP)  Johnny Kerr, who could not make the Phoenix Suns a win ner despite the addition of su perstar Connie Hawkins, re signed today.

title: CHIEFS' TOP TASK: TO STOP LAMONICA
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., Jan. 2  Dinner had been scheduled for 6:30 in the Ban quet Room of the Santa Bar bara Inn, where the Kansas City Chiefs have been lodged this week. When the steaks were slow in arriving last night, most of the Chiefs were con tent to watch the Orange Bowl game on the color TV set perched atop a table.

title: 6 Children and 2 Adults Die in Upstate Farm Fire
description: WILTON, N. Y., Jan. 2  A mother, father and six children died early today when a fire destroyed their farmhouse in this hamlet near Saratoga Springs.

title: Albany, With 20 Below, Coldest for 48 States
description: ALBANY, Jan. 2 (UPI) Subzero cold clutched much of upstate New York for the second day in a row today, with Albany having the low est temperature reported by the United States Weather Bureau in the 48 contiguous states.

title: CITY BANKS LIST RISE IN SAVINGS OUTFLOW
description: The 15 largest New York City savings banks experienced a net outflow of $116,621,000 in the threeday grace period at the end of 1969, according to data supplied yesterday by the Savings Banks Association of New York State. This com pares with an outflow of $82,667,000 in the yearearlier period.

title: Kuznetsov Back in Peking
description: PEKING, Jan 2 (Agence FrancePresse)ChineseSoviet border talks were expected to resume here shortly following the return to Peking today of Vasily V. Kuznetsov, chief So viet negotiator and the First Deputy Foreign Minister. The talks began on Oct. 20 and were recessed on Dec. 13, when Mr. Kuznetsov returned to Moscow, officially in order to, attend a session of the Supreme Soviet.

title: Stony Brook Triumphs
description: MASSENA, N. Y., Jan. 2 (AP) Stony Brook beat Platts burgh, 6956, and Potsdam downed Brooklyn College, 6964, tonight in the first night of play in the Potsdam State Holiday tournament. The high scorer for Potsdam was George Pieper, with 31 points, and Dennis Ozer, for Brooklyn with 21 points.

title: New Title for British Lord: Bobby
description: LONDON, Jan. 2 (AP) Britain got its first titled po liceman today. Lord Strath naver, 21yearold heir to a 90room castle and one of the largest estates in Scot land, is going to pound a beat.

title: Deborah Harold, Middlebury '70, Is Betrothed to Douglas B. Reed
description: GUILFORD, Conn., Jan. 2 Dr. and Mrs. William J. Harold Jr. of Sachem's Head have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Deborah Anne Harold, to Douglas Brewster Reed. He is the son of Mrs. Stephen W. Reed of Leete's Island and the late Mr. Reed, who was associate professor of sociology at Yale University and dean of Yale's Calhoun College. Dr. Harold is a dentist.

title: CASTRO'S TAKEOVER MARKED AUSTERELY
description: HAVANA, Jan. 2 (Reuters) Cuba observed the 11th anni versary of Premier Fidel Castro's revolution on a note of auster ity today and with extra efforts to harvest the important sugar crop.

title: CAIRO, ILL., NEGROES URGE MARTIAL LAW
description: CAIRO, Ill., Jan. 2 (UN) The predominantly Negro Unit ed Front Organization today asked Gov. Richard B. Ogilvie to impose martial law in this racially troubled river town.

title: Celtics Down Pistons
description: DETROIT, Jan. 2 (UPI)Bos ton took advantage of two De troit cold streaks tonight and John Havlicek led the attack with 23 points as the Celtics defeated the Pistons, 11092, In a National Basketball Associa tion game.

title: Berlitz Taking Legalese To Win Use of Name
description: Charles F. Berlitz, grand son of the founder of the worldwide language schools, is getting his first lesson in a language that is new to him legalese.

title: POLITICAL PRISONERS IN GREECE ISSUE PLEA
description: ATHENS, Jan. 2  Political prisoners in the Greek Govern ment's largest detention camp appealed today for medical care and the release of the seriously ill, the invalid and the aged.

title: Clark, Dodge Elects
description: Carnot W. Evans, Edward C. R. Whitcraft, Nelson R. Jesup, Donald Arthur Jr., Rob ert D. Hill and Henry T.
