Johannesburg's Sun day Times said that two Rho desians jailed on charges of passing information on Rho desia's activities to a Western power had been in the pay of the United States Government.

title: LindsayRockefeller Feud May Have Echo at Polls
description: The LindsayRockefeller fight over the transit farewith each side blaming the other for the jump to 30 centshas con vinced many politicians that the issue could have a sizable impact on the gubernatorial election this fall.

title: Two HighFashion Models Who Believe There's More Challenge in Acting
description: LAUREN HUTTON and Sunny Griffin have a lot of things in common. Both are tall, skinny, curlyhaired, wholesomely beautiful, and in their middle 20's. Both are top Ford models. And both have made more money in a year than a lot of cor poration heads.

title: Stockton, Dibbs Help U.S. Win Sunshine Tennis Cup
description: MIAMI BEACH, Jan. 4 (UPI) Dick Stockton and Eddie Dibbs triumphed in the doubles final today to give the United States tennis team the title in the 12th annual Sunshine Cup tournament.

title: U.S. Is Pressing Suits in the North to Eliminate De Facto Segregation
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4While tomorrow will bring the newest in a series of school desegrega tion deadlines in the South, Tuesday will bring a milestone of a different, rarer sortin the field of desegregation of Northern and Western schools.

title: GOVERNOR TO ASK DRIVE ON RUBELLA
description: Governor Rockefeller will ask the 1970 Legislature on Wednesday to set up a state wide program to provide com pulsory immunization shots against German measles for all schoolchildren.

title: Books of The Times
description: IN talking about major American novel ists, Wright Morris's name comes up from time to time. People will mention his latest novel and declare hesitantly, as if they'd been out of the country for a while, that he must be one of the country's most underrated writers. This has been going on for quite a while now, for Mr.

title: Democrats' 1970 Strategy: Blame the Administration for Inflation
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (AP) Democrats plan to use infla tion as a major election issue in 1970, Senator Fred R. Har ris said today.

title: MOST BACK CALLEY IN A POLL FOR TIME
description: A majority of Americans are more disturbed over publicity given the alleged Songmy mas sacre than they are over the apparent killings, Time maga zine reported yesterday.

title: Thirsfy Aussie Soldiers Finally Get Their Beer
description: VUNGTAU, South Viet nam, Jan. 4 (Reuters)  The Australian beer thirst ended in Vietnam today when the ship Jeparit arrived with 1,632,000 cans of beer.

title: Dickey Signs Vols' Aides
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Jan. 4 (UPI)  Doug Dickey, new Florida University coach, an nounced today that he is mov ing three of his former assist ant from Tennessee here. Dickey, who last week gave up his Tennessee job to take over from Ray Graves at Florida, said he had hired Jimmy Dunn, Doug Knotts and Jack Hall, all top aides with the Volunteers.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
CANADA PLAGUED BY WHEAT SALES
description: TORONTO, Jan. 4An in crease in illegal wheat sales in Canada's central provinces, in cluding interprovincial bootleg ging, has put the Federal Gov ernment in an awkward posi tion. It has also led to open hostility between a Federal Min ister and a provincial premier, both members of the Liberal party.

title: Joseph Hodgson, Helped Organize Shipping Line
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J., Jan. 4 Joseph Hodgson, cofounder of Seatrain Lines, Inc., died here today after a long illness. He was 91 years old and lived at 10 Crestmont Road.

title: Agnew Tells the Thais To Ignore U.S. Critics
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Jan. 4  Vice President Agnew dis cussed foreign aid and Ameri can dissent with Thai leaders today and then; shoeless, toured Thailand's most famous temple.

title: CLUB HONOR GOES TO COCKER SPANIEL
description: A vivacious particolor cocker spaniel named Ch. Be Gay's Tan Man, owned by Bill and Gay Ernst of New Milford, Conn., scaled the highest peak avail able to the spaniel breeds last night when he became best in show in the national specialty of the American Spaniel Club. The event was held at the StatlerHilton Hotel and the en tries were a record 451 in five breeds.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: The Weedkiller's Daughter, by Har riette Simpson Arnow (Knopf, 6.95). The secret world of a 15 yearold girl.

title: Amer. Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: BEIRUT AIDE URGES
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 4 The Israeli raid into Lebanon early yesterdayin which 22 Lebanese were abducted in re prisal for a commando raid in which one Israeli guard was taken prisonerthreatens to reopen the explosive issue of the commandos' presence on Lebanese soil.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Knit Dresses and Pacifiers New in Stores
description: THIS is merry markdown time in most stores and Bloomingdale's is no excep tion. It's cutting prices on quite a lot of furniture in cluding a group caller Bartiki. Made of African walnut, which has a dark, unobtru sively grained surface, it comes in pieces for diningroom and bed room in a clean Shop lined modern de Talk sign with legs of chromeonsteel. Asked why a just arrived group should be marked down 15 per cent, spokesman for the store said it was being done to intro duce people to furniture in a wood we've never had be fore. Some of the Bartiki line is to be found in the model rooms: a round dining table, for instance, whose four chrome legs are spaced around the rim and whose price tag says $400, reduced from $475.

title: TEMPLETON FUND 1969'S TOP GAINER
description: The Templeton Growth Fund, Inc., a small Torontobased fund that is not currently offer ing shares to the public, ran away with top prize in the mutual fund performance sweepstakes for 1969, data compiled by the Arthur Lipper Mutual Fund Performance Anal ysis Service disclosed yester day.

title: Providence Six Wins Final
description: TROY, N. Y., Jan. 4Bob Badyk scored two goals to lead Providence to 52 victory over Bowling Green in the final of the Rensselaer Polytechnic In stitute's invitation hockey tour nament today.

title: ROBERT W. HAMSHAR
description: Robert W. Hamshar, who worked in the news depart ment of the old NewYork Trib une and The New York Herald Tribune from 1902 to 1948, died Saturday at the home of a son, Edwin Hamshar, in Dur ham, N. C. He was 81 years old.

title: Robert Shaw: Actor, Novelist, PlaywrightSinger?
description: Robert Shaw, the actor, novelist and playwright, has sung in cars, bars and baths hut, he explained proudly the other day, I have never sung publiclysober or ac companiedexcept for one song on a recent Dick Cavett Show. Te has also never danced, not even with my wife, Mary Ureuntil now. Undeterred by his own inex perience, he is currently re hearsing his first musical, Gantry, based on the Sin clair Lewis novel, Elmer Gantry. On Feb. 15, after a month of previews, the show opens at the George Abbott Theater.

title: MANSFIELD URGES WARPOWERS CURB
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (UPI) The Senate Democratic Lead er, Mike Mansfield of Montana, said today that the Senate should repeal a series of reso lutions that give extraordinary war powers to the President.

title: Hospitals Drop Tobacco
description: DUBUQUE, Iowa, Jan. 4 (UPI)Four hospitals in Du buque County announced today they were discontinuing the sale of tobacco on their grounds to aid in the campaign against smoking.

title: EASTERN HOCKEY LEAGUE
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES New Haven 9, New Jersey 2. Charlotte 6, Nashville S. Clinton 7, Syracuse 5. Greensboro 3, Jacksonville 3.

title: Vikings 13 Over Chiefs
description: LAS VEGAS, Jan. 4 (UPI) The Minnesota Vikings were posted as 13point favorites over the Kansas City Chiefs in the Super Bowl by oddsmakers today.

title: Thant Urges Biafran Leader To Accept O.A.U. Proposal
description: DAKAR, Senegal; Jan. 4 (Reuters)  Secretary General Thant of the. United Nations appealed today to Gen. Odu megwu Ojukwu, the Biafran leader, to conform to an Or ganization of African Unity resolution calling on the two sides in the Nigeria civil war to recognize the unity of Ni geria.

title: Lindsay Aide Backs Youths Who Seized East Harlem Church
description: More than 20 Puerto Rican leaders, including an aide to Mayor Lindsay and several an tipoverty and community offi cials, pledged their support yes terday to the occupation of an East Harlem church by a group of young Puerto Rican mili tants.

title: Brook Farm Below the Equator
description: ARUSHA, TanzaniaSigns of prosperity are visible enough in East Africa: vast plantings of coffee and tea and sisal, new office buildings in the cities, luxury hotels. But as general economic indicators, they are grossly misleading.

title: Bomb Explodes in Turin
description: TURIN, Italy, Jan. 4 (UPI) A crudely made bomb exploded today outside a branch of the Bank of America and Italy.

title: Racing Account Slated For McCannErickson
description: Although not exactly from the horse's mouth, the word is that after just about a year at Doyle Dane Bern bach the New York Racing Association is trotting back to McCannErickson.

title: Musica Aeterna Gives Unusual Choral Works
description: Ordinarily, the Musica Aeterna concerts at the Metro politan Museum of Art are symphonic. Those given Satur day and last night were not. A sizable professional chorus occupied the space usually filled by the orchestra, and Frederic Waldman conducted a program of seldomheard choral works.

title: At Meets 4,000 Miles Apart, a Pair of Skiers Reach for the Sky
description: BEAR MOUNTAIN, N. Y., Jan. 4  It didn't take long for the skijumping season to produce a major surprise.

title: 33 Die as Water Roars Through Andean Town
description: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 4 (AP)Tons of water from a broken reservoir roared to day through the streets of the Andean city of Mendoza. The Argentine policemen said the number of persons killed was incalculable.

title: Exodus Seen as Threat to the System on Eve of Integration Move
description: JACKSON, Miss., Jan. 4On the eve of widespread class room desegregation, a mass ex odus of white students to pri vate schools is posing a serious threat to Mississippi's public education system.

title: Norman, Craig Is Given U.S. Toshiba Account
description: Norman, Craig & Kummel enters the new year on an exotic notethe assignment of Toshiba America, the United States subsidiary of Tokyo Shibaura Electric, makers of home appliances, consumer electronics and business equipment.

title: Advertising: New Era and New Products
description: The eagerness of manufac turers to develop new prod ucts, combined with relaxed attitudes in sexual matters, should bring some major and rather startling changes in advertising. As a matter of fact, it's started already.

title: Stone Captures Perth Title, Tops Dent in Straight Sets
description: PERTH, Australia, Jan. 4 (AP)Allan Stone of Aus tralia defeated Phil Dent, 63, 63, 97, in the final of the West Australian lawn ten nis championships today.

title: Britain's ExForeign Chief Meets Nasser on Mideast
description: CAIRO, Jan. 4  George Brown, the former British For eign Secretary, met tonight with Gamal Abdel Nasser, Pres ident of the United Arab Repub lic to discuss the Arab conflict with Israel.

title: Federal Aid to Public Schools Drops
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (AP) Federal spending for public schools dropped for the second straight year in 1969 while state and local community con tributions to schools reached a new high, the National Edu cation Association reported today.

title: Japan Is Entering the 1970's With SelfConfidence Restored and Economy Thriving
description: TOKYO, Jan. 4The Japa nese nation, 100 million strong, has plunged into the decade of the nineteenseventies with re vived selfconfidence and a feeling of readiness to tackle any challenge, combined with uneasy uncertainty as to what the challenges might be.

title: ITALIANS CAPTURE 2MAN BOB TITLE
description: CORTINA D'AMPEZZO, Italy, Jan. 4 (AP)Italy's Gianfranco Gaspari and Mario Armano streaked down a snowbattered track four times tonight to win the European twoman bob sledding championships.

title: EUROPEANS HEED BRUNDAGE EDICT
description: GENEVA. Jan. 4Canada withdrew as host of the 1970 world championship when the International Ice Hockey Fed eration (I.I.H.F.) decided today against allowing professionals on the Canadian team.

title: Potholes Jolting City Motorists; Crews to Push Fast Repairs
description: At 42d Street near 10th Avenue in front of the West Side Airlines Terminal yester day, automobiles made loud thumping noises as they passed over deep potholes.

title: School Fair Held to Aid The Neediest
description: A school bazaar Dec. 17 in which $113.15 was realized for the 58th annual appeal of the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund brought a happy additional dividend in the mail yesterday.

title: Gunboat Plot: Model of Legal Evasion
description: When Walter Eytan, the Israeli Ambassador to France, stepped out of his car at the Elyse Palace New Year's Day for President Pompidou's diplomatic reception, he was handed a ticket with a num ber, by which his chauffeur would be called through loudspeaker after the party.

title: Survey Reports Some Microwave Ovens Are a Health Hazard
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (AP) The Department of Health, Education and Welfare said today that a random survey of microwave ovens had shown that one in three leaked enough radiation to present a health hazard to users.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: YESTERDAY'S GAMES

title: 3 Carolina Universities Join to Fight Dirty Air
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Jan. 4 Three major North Carolina universities will form the na tion's first regional clean air consortium in a ceremony to morrow as a major step in the Nixon Administration's war against air pollution.

title: In Memoriam
description: DUFFYJames Edmund: One lonely Yearl Nothing can ever take away the love a heart holds dear. His life was gentle and the elements so mixed In him that nature might stand up and say to all the world This was a man!

title: Israel Assails France As Unfair on Arms Sale
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 4Israel today denounced France for embargoing military equip ment sold to her while offer ing to sell arms to a country pledged to attack her.

title: NEW YORK GETS 4 IN SECOND PERIOD
description: While 17,250 fans watched, bewildered but happy, the Rangers scored four goals in the second period last night and trounced the Oakland Seals, 52.

title: Roy Jenkins in California
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 4 (Reuters)British Chancellor of the Exchequer Roy Jenkins ar rived here today on an eight day visit to the United States. His trip coincided with the start of a twoyear campaign in this state to expand sales of British goods, ranging from clothes to electronic equipment.

title: Cuite, Challenged, Offers His Own Reform Ideas
description: The Democratic leader of the City Council, facing a challenge for his job from a Coucilman who has pro posed reforms in the way the Council operates, made public yesterday his own reform proposals.

title: Talks With Vorster Asked Over Apartheid in Sports
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Jan. 4Leading figures in South African sports circles have called for a meeting with Premier John Vorster, follow ing his New Year's Day warn ing that South Africa was pre pared to break off relations rather than yield time and again to leftist and Communis tic pressure.

title: Louise Bennett A Future Bride
description: SLINGERLANDS, N. Y., Jan. 4Mr. and Mrs. Noel Sisson Bennett Jr. of Slinger lands and Weekapaug, R. I., have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Louise Sisson Bennett, to Carroll Francis Jones, son of Mr. and Mrs. J. Paul Jones of Pembroke. N. H.

title: Valerie C. Cotsidas Is Married In Bay State to James Pappas
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Jan. 4 Miss Valerie Collette Cots idas, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Angelus Nicholas Cots idas, was married here this afternoon to James Arthur Pappas, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Charles Pappas of Milton.

title: Perry of Dartmouth Takes Eastern Slalom Open Meet
description: INTERVALE, N. H., Jan. 4 Sheldon Perry, captain of the Dartmouth ski team, won the Harvard Challenge Cup, an open Eastern slalom meet, at the Intervale Ski area today. His combined time for the two 54gate runs was 100.87 sec onds.

title: ISRAELI JETS FIGHT EGYPTIAN PLANES OVER SUEZ CANAL
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 4Israeli and Egyptian jet fighter pilots battled over the Suez Canal today, and each side reported that it had inflicted losses on the other.

title: Elusive Credit Crimps Hair Stylist's Plans to Open More Shops
description: Renell, a men's hair stylist with the manner of an alert but shy lamb who owns a shop bearing his name at 45 West Fiftyfifth Street, thinks life in the United States is just great. For as Merek Watnicki, a young pharma cist when Hitler's armies invaded his native Poland, he was successively impris oned in several of the most notorious Nazi concentration camps. He lived in constant fear that his Jewish origins would be discovered.

title: COMMON MARKET SHIFTS ON TRADE
description: PARIS, Jan. 4Massive shifts are taking place in the flow of International commerce as the world's biggest trading unit moves from surplus into deficit.

title: Card of Thanks
description: BROWNAnna. The sisters of the late Anna Tynan Brown wish to thank their friends, relatives and clergy for the kind expres sions of sympathy extended to them.

title: Parishioners Conduct Service at Church in Village
description: A committee of three pa rishioners selected by their peers conducted Sunday service yesterday at Washington square Methodist Church in Greenwich Village.

title: MARTINEZ RALLItS FR GOLF VICTORY
description: MISSION VIEJO, Calif., Jan. 4 (AP)Dick Martinez of La guna Beach shot a twoover par 73 today that was enough to win the $52,000 Southern California open golf tourna ment by one stroke with a 54 hole total of 214.

title: Richard Brown, 53, Headed Jersey Vocational Project
description: MAPLEWOOD, N. J., Jan. 4 Richard Brown, director of the pilot vocational education program in Edison of the New Jersey Department of Educa tion, died of a heart attack yes terday at the Roosevelt Hospi tal in New York. He was 53 years old and lived at 11 Harvard Avenue.

title: Peking Assails Moscow Anew Before Border Talks Resume
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 4 (Reu ters)China strongly criticized the Soviet Union again today, accusing the Russians of nuclear blackmail as the Chinese and the Soviet Union prepared to re sume border talks in Peking.

title: Most Japanese Adhere to 2 Faiths
description: TOKYO, Jan. 4Most Japanese, like their Premier, Eisaku Sato, are both Bud dhist and Shinto. If they have children they probably have also adopted Santa Claus.

title: Students Arrested in Japan
description: SAPPORO, Japan, Jan. 4 (UPI) About 200 riot policemen were called in today to evict radical students who had seized one of the faculty buildings of Hokkaido University. Two stu dents were arrested on charges of unlawful assembly and carry ing dangerous weapons.

title: Lawyer to Wed JoAnn V. Giffuni In Paris Feb. 2
description: Mr. and Mrs. Joseph V. Giffuni of Jamaica Estates, Queens, have announced that their daughter, Miss JoAnn Veronica Giffuni, and Michael Sher, a lawyer with the New York firm of Phillips, Nizer, Benjamin, Krim & Ballon, plan to be married in Paris on Feb. 2.

title: DANIEL P. CASSIDY
description: Daniel P. Cassidy, depart Inent service officer of the New York and Brooklyn regional office of the Veterans of Foreign Wars, died Satur day at the Veterans Adminis tration Hospital here. He was 56 years old and lived at 186 North Manhattan Avenue, North Massapequa, L. I.

title: Paris: Tempest in the Temple of Art
description: PARISSoon they'll be putting cemeteries into question! This Parisian's re mark was prompted by the storm of criticism suddenly raised around France's most venerable andat least so everyone thoughtlethargib institution of culture: the Louvre. The cause of the con troversy? The re organization of the museum's fabulous collec tion of paintings. It was made pos sible by the retrocession to the Louvre of the Pavillon de Flore, which prolongs the Seine wing of the palace in the direction of the Place de la Concorde and which for generations had been occu pied by the Ministry of Finance. This considerable increase in exhibition space lay at the root of the new overall plan. Art triumphant over Moneya heartwarm ing parable: Appropriately enough, Flore opened just before Christmas. Its 27 large, welllit rooms now house French sculpture of the 17th and 18th centuries, Spanish painting and a bril liant selection of pastels. French.

title: Third Effort Planned to Put Fourth Intelsat 3 in Orbit
description: WASHINGTON Jan. 3 (AP) A third effort to place a fourth Intelsat 3 commercial com munications satellite in syn chronous earth orbit has been planned for Wednesday, the Communications Satellite Cor poration announced today.

title: Czechoslovaks Ask Asylum
description: MILAN, Italy, Jan. 4 (Reu ters)Thirty Czechoslovaks, including seven women, today asked for political asylum in Italy. They arrived a few days ago as tourists.

title: Personal Finance
description: Like keeping up with the Jonses, keeping up with little changes in income tax rules has become vitally important to the status of dollarwary taxpayers.

title: Sociology Racing Ahead
description: Sociologists, in the estima tion of Neil J. Smelser, so ciologist of the University of California at Berkeley, are the psychoanalysts of the sixties  without the mys tique.

title: Linda K. Little Plans Nuptials
description: SCARSDALE, Jan. 4Miss Linda Kathryn Little, a sen ior at Centenary College for Women, plans to be married in June to Robert Martin Konetchy, a senior at Pace College.

title: Inflation Nips at Wage Earner's Increases
description: I get an increase every year and I just never find myself ahead.

title: She Throws Out All the Furniture and Moves Every Few Years
description: WHEN Juleen Compton movesand she moves fairly oftenshe likes to get rid of everything but her portrait by Diego Rivera and the bust of her by Jacob Epstein. Then in the new place she can start from scratch.

title: Japanese Leads Lorin Hollander In Ravel by American Symphony
description: A pair of musicians in their 20's appeared as guests with the American Symphony Orches tra yesterday afternoon at Car negie Hall, and immediately the future of music grew brighter.

title: Strengthening the Dollar
description: The world's major financial powers, led by the United States, have made the right arrangement with South Africa on gold. Although South Africa is now protected against a collapse of the gold price in the private market and can sell limited amounts of gold to central banks via the International Monetary Fund, the understanding was a major victory for the dollar and a serious defeat for gold.

title: Hijacked Jet Still in Cuba
description: HAVANA, Jan. 4 (Reuters) A hijacked Brazilian airliner was still awaiting permission to leave Cuba today after hav ing spent the night at Havana airport. The Caravelle jet landed in Havana Saturday with 21 passengers and seven crewmen.

title: ClosedEnd Funds
5Alarm Brooklyn Fire, Out of Control 4 Hours, Destroys 9 Stores
description: A fivealarm fire that raged out of control for nearly four hours destroyed nine stores in Brooklyn on Saturday night.

title: 13 Die in Canada House Fire
description: ST. ROCHE DE L'ACHIGAN, Quebec, Jan. 4 (AP)Thirteen persons died today in a fire that destroyed the house in which they had gathered for weekend family reunion. A neighbor, Mrs. Etienne Meunier, said Maurice Proulx, his fami ly and relatives were in the house. It burned quickly, she said, and she heard no cries. This small village is 30 miles north of Montreal.

title: SERIOUS SEX CRIMES STEADY IN DENMARK
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Jan. 4 (UPI)  Criminalogists cautioned today against credit ingg a drop in sex crimes in Denmark during 1969 to the new laws legalizing the sale of pornography.

title: Connecticut Driver Honored
description: The American Trucking Asso ciations has named Frank De Lucia of Hamden, Conn., 1970 Driver of the Year. Mr. De Lucia, a 53yearold truck driver, has driven more than 3.5 million miles in commercial operations spanning 34 years. He is employed by Adley Ex press Company of New Haven. The award will be presented to Mr. DeLucia in Washington on Jan. 21 by Secretary of Transportation John A. Volpe.

title: Passenger and Conductor Injured on Penn Central
description: BRONXVILLE, Jan. 4The conductor and a passenger were injured today when the air hose on a New Yorkbound Penn Central train from Brews ter broke as the train neared the station here at 7:30 A.M.

title: Reward Posted in Bomb Attack On Prosecutor in West Virginia
description: MORGANTOWN, W. Va., Jan. 4A $5,000 reward for information leading to the ar rest and conviction of persons who attempted to kill Monon galia County Prosecutor Joseph A. Laurita Jr. was posted today by the West Virginia News paper Publishing Company.

title: Toomey Takes Pentathlon
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 4 (UPI)Bill Toomey, the world record holder and Olympic gold medalist in the decathlon, won the indoor pentathlon last night at the AllAmerican track and field games.

title: FLAREUP IN RAIDS. BY FOE NEAR DMZ REPORTED BY U.S.
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Jan. 5  The United States command today reported a significant increase in enemy activity in the northern most military region yesterday and Saturday, including three, ground attacks that saw two Americans killed and 18 wounded.

title: Bowie Track Opens 52Day Meeting Today
description: BOWIE, Md., Jan. 4 (AP) A 52day meeting opens at Bowie Race Course tomor row, officially launching Maryland's 1970 racing sea son.

title: Rumanian to Visit Belgrade
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Jan. 4 (APPremier Ion Gheorghe Maurer of Rumania will visit Yugoslavia Jan. 1215, an of ficial announncoment said today.

title: Oakland Draws First Blood, but Kansas City, Led by Dawson, Scores More Often
6 Are Seized in Brooklyn As Cockfight Is Broken Up
description: The police broke up a cock fight in the basement of a tene ment at 1047 Flushing Avenue in the Williamsburg section ofd Brooklyn yesterday afternoon, arrested six persons and gave summonses to 95 persons, charging them with being spec tators at the event.

title: Theater: A Reappraisal
description: A LITTLE more than a year ago a musical ar rived off Broadway from the underground theater and dis armingly smashed its way in to town. The musical was Dames at Sea, and it has been alive, afloat and firing from all nuns ever since.

title: Newcombe and Roche Gain In RoundRobin Tennis
description: BRISBANE, Australia, Jan. 4 (AP)John Newcombe and Tony Roche, Australian tennis professionals, easily won their first matches in the $10,000 roundrobin tournament against European players in searing heat today.

title: Miss Wheeler Will Be Bride Of Law Student
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Jan. 4 The engagement of Miss Mar tha Hale Wheeler to Rhidian Morrow Morgan Morgan has been announced by the fu ture bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. William Augustus Kilner Wheeler. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Aubrey Niel Morgan of Ridgefield, Wash., and a grandson of the late Senator Dwight Whitney Morrow of New Jersey, who had also been United States Ambassador to Mexico and partner in J. P. Morgan & Co.

title: Work Time Lost in Strikes Reported Much Less in '69
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (AP)  More but smaller strikes in 1969 added up to a substantial decline from 1968 in work time lost due to walkouts, the Labor Department reported today.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Bruce Carswell has been elected vice presidentindustrial relations for Sylvania Electric Products, Inc., a subsidiary of the General Telephone & Elec tronics Corporation.

title: 4 INTERCEPTIONS THWART OAKLAND
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Jan. 4 Blessed by the American Foot ball League's playoff format, the Kansas City Chiefs quali fied today for the Super Bowl with a 177 victory over the Oakland Raiders as Len Daw son guided an erratic offensive unit that was saved by four interceptions, three in the final quarter.

title: APOLLO MISSIONS EXTENDED TO '74
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 4 (UPI)  Budget limitations have caused the space agency to cancel one lunar landing and stretch the remaining seven missions in the Apollo moon exploration pro gram into 1974, the agency's deputy chief said today.

title: Pass Rush Did It, Say Jubilant Chiefs
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Jan. 4 Even before Kansas City's victory over Oakland had been completed today, the Chiefs on the sidelines lifted their coach, Hank Stram, to their shoulders. They kept him there as the final seconds ticked off.

title: HEAVY BOND SLATE IS DUE THIS WEEK
description: The money and capital mar kets, after two weeks of rest and rehabilitation, face a heavy schedule of new financing this week in an atmosphere lacking any real conviction about what interest rates are going to do next.

title: Dr. Alfred Fisher Dies at 67; ExSmith Professor and Poet
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Jan. 4  Dr. Alfred Y. Fisher, professor emeritus of English at Smith College, Northampton, Mass., died in Princeton Hospital yes terday after a heart attack. He was 67 years old and had been living in France.

title: Burma Marks Independence
description: RANGOON, Burma, Jan. 4 (Reuters)Messages of con gratulations from world leaders poured into Burma today as she celebrated her 22d anniver sary as an independent nation. President Nixon said: We respect your country's efforts in maintaining its independence and neutrality.

title: Furor in Cambridge
description: The nation, moving toward new priorities in this new decade, must prepare for inevitable disloca tions and hardship as existing facilities are closed to permit shifting of resources to other uses. In the absence of such preparation, these shifts are bound to arouse resistance from local interests that are immediately and adversely affected.

title: ISDALE CAPTURES FROSTBITE REGATTA
description: RYE, N. Y., Jan. 4Leading the fleet today for the second time in the three days of the competition, George M. (Dooie) Isdale Jr. of the host club won the annual New Year's Invita tion Dyer dinghy frostbite regatta at American Yacht Club.

title: Newcombe and Roche Gain In RoundRobin Tennis
description: BRISBANE, Australia, Jan. 4 (AP)John Newcombe and Tony Roche, Australian tennis professionals, easily won their first matches in the $10,000 roundrobin tournament against European players in searing heat today.

title: Team Hails Kapp's Soulful Play
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Jan. 4There were five or six black players off in one corner of the Viking club house and they were chanting the same slogan.

title: NIXON FAMILY FLIES TO PALM SPRINGS
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Jan. 4 (AP)President Nixon flew by helicopter today to Palm Springs for an overnight stay.

title: Accuracy Stressed For Crystal Device In Japanese Watch
description: If you're one of those rare persons who must be accurate within five seconds a month, the Japanese have a wristwatch for you. Right now it costs $1,250 and is available only in Japan in a solid 18karat gold model.

title: Judge Orders M.T.A. To Defend Fare Rise
description: A State Supreme Court jus tice ordered the Metropolitan Transit Authority last night to defend its fare increase at a hearing on Wednesday.

title: 2 Survive 12 Days in Arctic, Ask for Showers and Food
description: UMIAT, Alaska, Jan. 4 (UPI) Two men who survived the downing of their jet helicopter and 12 days in the Arctic wilds wailted only showers, food and some rest today after hiking into this tiny village late last night.

title: DEFENSIVE SLIPS HURT CLEVELAND
BIRTH CURB PILLS TO GET U.S. STUDY
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (UPI) United States health officials will soon begin analyzing data that convinced the British medical authorities that women using certain birth control pills run a greater risk of serious and sometimes fatal blood clotting.

title: WALDO B. FARNUM, PHYSICIAN, IS DEAD
description: Dr. Waldo Beattie Farnum, former president of the medical board of St. Luke's Hospital, died yesterday in his home at 4977 Henry Hudson Parkway, Riverdale, the Bronx. He was 78 years old.

title: Joanne Pechter Becomes a Bride
description: ALTOONA, Pa., Jan. 4 The marriage of Miss Joanne Pechter to Richard Alan Fain, a medical student at the Uni versity of Guadalajara in Mexico, took place here to day at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Freder ick A. Pechter. Rabbi.Nathan Kaber performed the cere mony.

title: Libyan Leader in Surgery
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, Jan. 4 (Reuters)  Col. Muammar el Qaddafi, chairman of the Lib yan Revolutionary Command Council, underwent surgery last night for appendicitis, the Lib yan press agency reported to day. Colonel Qaddafi, leader of the group of army officers that deposed King Idris last September, was said to be in good condition.

title: Albany's Year: From Abortion to Redistricting
description: When the State Legislature convenes for its 193d session Wednesday, it will face a com plex and difficult series of issues. Governor Rockefeller has Republican majorities to sup port him in both houses, but the Democrats plan to press harder than ever for more lib eral state aid to education, to the cities and to the poor.

title: Gabriel's Decision to Stay a Pro Gave Little Comfort to Cowboys
description: MIAMI, Jan. 4 (AP)Roman Gabriel's decision to stay in professional football must have been one filled with inspiration.

title: JIM MILLER VICTOR IN NORDIC SKI TEST
description: LAKE PLACID, N. Y., Jan. 4 (AP)A 22yearold skier from Maine added a thirdplace crosscountry race finish today to a victory in yesterday's ski jump competition to take the national Nordiccombined championship.

title: Minnesota and Kansas City Win League Titles and Meet in Super Bowl Next Sunday
WashingtonMoscowPeking
description: The return of Soviet Deputy Foreign Minister Vasily Kuznetsov to Peking last week suggests that the recessed SinoSoviet negotiations will resume soon, perhaps today. This renewed effort to ease tensions between the two Communist giants comes after two other noteworthy contributions toward a better inter national atmosphere: the successful preliminary Soviet American Strategic Arms Limitations Talks in Hel sinki and the resumption of official ChineseAmerican diplomatic contacts in Warsaw.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: INNSBRUCK, Austria, Jan. 4 (AP)Bjoern Wirkola of Norway won the third event of the fourhill ski jumping tournament today in a dra matic recordshattering duel with Horst Queck of East Germany.

title: In Camille's Wake: An Economic Crisis
description: BILOXI, Miss.Tiny green sprigs of leaves crown the oak trees that stand bleached and solid along the shoreline of the Gulf of Mexico here.

title: G.I.'s Outburst Widens Censorship Issue
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 4American military spokes men, who have quarreled with reporters for years over news in Vietnam, are now encounter ing bitter controversy on the subject in their own ranks.

title: PLACEMENT AGENCY TO RETURN DEPOSITS
description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz announced yester day that his office had come to an agreement with an execu tiveplacement agency that ac cording to a member of Mr. Lefkowitz's staff had not re turned $65,000 in deposits to job applicants.

title: China Has a Severe Quake; Southern City Believed Hit
description: HONG KONG, Monday, Jan. 5 (Reuters)A severe earth quake centered in southern China was recorded here early today, and there was an un confirmed report that it might have leveled part of the city of Kunming, which has a pop ulation of about a million.

title: David Eisenhowers Back
description: David and Julie Eisenhower returned yesterday from a Christmas visit to his parents, Ambassador and Mrs. John Eisenhower, in Brussels, the As sociated Press reported. The couple were flown from Ken nedy International Airport by Air Force jet to Westover Field, Mass., to return to college President Nixon's daughter at Smith and Mr. Eisenhower at Amherst.

title: VANDEN HEUVEL DUE TO ANNOUNCE
description: The first formal announce ment by a Democrat for the Governorship is expected Wednesday from William J. vanden Heuvel, a lawyer who was an aide to President John F. Kennedy and Senator Rob ert F. Kennedy.

title: Dutch Catholic Unit Meets
description: NOORDWLTKERHOUT, the Netherlands, Jan. 4 (UPI) Dutch Roman Catholic Bishops met today with some 200 priests and laymen for a conference that may challenge the doctrine of priestly celibacy. Church sources said they expected the fourday conference of the Na tional Pastoral Council to urge the Bishops to make celibacy optional for priests in the Neth erlands.

title: HECKSCHER REJECTS PARK CONVERSION
description: The city's Parks, Recreation and Cultural Affairs Adminis tration, August Heckscher, dif fered strongly yesterday with one of his predecessors on the advisability of using parkland for housing.

title: Hamburg Plans Port for Giant Ships at Scharhorn
description: BONN, Jan. 4The port city of Hamburg, West Germany's traditional gate to the world, disclosed details this week of a bold plan to build a new har bor for supertankers and other large vessels in the outer Elbe estuary88 miles from the city and its present piers.

title: Governor of Texas Orders Extradition In the Tate Murder
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Jan. 5 (UPI) Gov. Preston Smith today or dered 24yearold Charles D. Watson of Copeville, Tex., ex tradited to California to stand trial in the murder of Sharon Tate and six others.

title: World Bank Plans to Keep 7% Loan Rate Until June
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5Thee World Bank, after a periodic review, has decided to keep un changed its 7 per cent lending rate for the first half of 1970, a spokesman disclosed today.

title: Philadelphia Official Sworn
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 5 (UPI) Tom Gola, the La Salle Col lege basketball coach, was sworn in today as city control ler. Mr. Gola, a Republican, was elected to the post last Novem ber and now ranks as the eco nomic and fiscal expert of a Democratic city administration.

title: Manhattan Jewel Swindler Gets 78 Years in $476,200 Thefts
description: A confidence man who swindled four Manhattan jewel ers out of $476,200 in diamonds and diamond jewelry was sen tenced yesterday to seven to eight years in prison.

title: Namath Withdraws From. AllStar Game in Hope of Avoiding Knee Surgery
description: In the hope of prolonging his career as a quarterback by avoiding a fourth knee opera tion, Joe Namath will not com pete in the American Football League AllStar Game on Jan. 17 in Houston.

title: MRS. GEORGE T. LISTER
description: ROME, Jan. 5Mrs. Frances Trammel Lister, a longtime resident of New York and a former kindergarten teacher in Manhattan's Washington Heights section, died in a hos pital here on Dec. 16 at the age of 89.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME

title: Boy Sealed 2,000 Miles In a Refrigerated Truck
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 5Work men unloading a refrigerated truck here today found an unconscious and unclothed boy among crates of toma toes that had been sealed in side the vehicle a week ago in Nogales, Ariz, 2,000 miles away.

title: NOVEMBER ARRESTS 28% OVER '68 TOTAL
description: Arrests for all types of viola, tions of law increased 28 per cent in November, compared with the same period in 1968, the Police Department reported yesterday. The totals were 19,406 and 15,160.

title: NLT WILL SPIN OFF ITS NASHVILLE BANK
description: The NLT Corporation, which owns the $485million Third National Bank of Nashville, said yesterday that it would distribute its shares of the $500million bank to NLT's more than 10,000 shareholders in the ratio of one share of the bank's stock for approximately every 17 shares of NLT now held.

title: Coin Flips to Break Ties In Pro Football Draft Picks
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 5 (AP) Coin flips necessary to break ties in order of selection for the 1970 pro football draft will be held here Friday at the site of the Super Bowl game, Com missioner Pete Rozelle an nounced today.

title: Market Place
description: THE best record of any mu tual fund in 1969 was made by New York Venture Fund, Inc., and Jeremy H. Biggs, one of its three port folio managers, says to chalk it up to the fund's relatively small size.

title: BANKS' GAINS PARED BY NEW ACCOUNTING
description: New accounting procedures now required of commercial banks acted to reduce substan tially their earnings gains, ac cording to yearend statements of several banks reporting yes terday.

title: A Draft Office Is Damaged By Vandals in Racine, Wis,
description: RACINE, Wis., Jan. 5 (UPI) The Selective Service head quarters in Racine was van dalized late yesterday, less than 24 hours after the latest in a series of similar occurrences in Madison.

title: Gulistan Chairman Retires
description: Steele L. Winterer has retired as chairman of the Gulistan carpet division of J. P. Stevens & Co., Inc., it was announced yesterday. Mr. Winterer joined A. & M. Karagheusian, Inc., as vice president in 1939 and was named president in 1948. In 1964, Karagheusian became a part of Stevens and in 1965 was set up as the Gulistan carpet division of Stevens.

title: Julius Delbos Dies at 90; Known for WaterColor Art
description: Julius Delbos, an artist who specialized in waterColors, died Saturday at Dover (N. J.) General Hospital. He was 90 years old and lived at the Mary Heart Nursing Home in Succasunna, N. J.

title: Fatah at Five
description: Al Fatah, the Palestinian guerrilla organization, cele brates its fifth anniversary this week, riding a wave of undiscriminating Arab enthusiasm. From a ragtag band of 82 men with $1,000 worth of secondhand weapons, Fatah has expanded to more than 20,000 men, equipped with the latest Russian and Chinese arms and supported by a budget this year estimated at $5.6 million.

title: Bronx Grand Jury Calls for Dismissal of Elections Board Aide
description: A Bronx grand jury, finding that voting machines had been tampered with in an attempt to change the outcome of an election, called yesterday for the immediate dismissal of the deputy chief clerk of the Bronx office of the Board. of Elec tions.

title: Compliance vs. Deception
description: Mississippi's response to Federal court orders to desegregate its public schools is couched in those tragically misguided tones of myth and prejudice that have done so much to hurt the South and the nation. The only positive note was the appeal by Gov. John Bell Williams for abstention from violence and destruc tion of public property. But even that appeal was sadly lacking in the enlightened leadership essential to end the irrationality of the white supremacy doctrine.

title: Tonnage Near Record
description: Steel production last week was 6.1 per cent higher than that of the preceding week, the American Iron and Steel Insti tute reported yesterday.

title: MOON ROCKS YIELD FORMATION CLUES
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 5After a detailed study of the first lunar samples brought back to earth, it has been concluded that, if the moon was torn from the earth, it must have occurred either during the earth's forma tion or immediately afterward.

title: Freshman Stars Draw Raves From Pro Basketball's Scouts
description: Most professional basketball scouts, who log about 100,000 miles annually each keeping abreast of college talent, appear to be more excited about the outstanding crop of freshmen than they do about this sea son's banner senior harvest.

title: 3 Networks Protest Curbs on Coverage Of Agnew in Saigon
description: The three major television networks have protested to Herbert Klein, Director of Com munications of the Nixon Ad ministration, that their camera crews were excluded from cov ering parts of Vice President Agnew's stopover in Saigon.

title: Reserve Voted Money Rein Despite Effect on Banks
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5The Federa Reserve's openmarket committee voted to keep its monetary policy unchanged at its Oct. 7 meeting although projections showed an un changed policy would mean a significant decline in total bank deposits, it was disclosed today.

title: PROFIT INCREASE POSTED BY A. & P.
description: Although earnings of the Great Atlantic & Pacific Tea Company in the third fiscal quarter were only 2.5 per cent ahead of the level in the pre ceding year, the gain for the ninemonth period was 11.9 per cent over profits for the cor responding threequarters of fiscal 1968, the report disclosed yesterday.

title: Jury Is Selected and Isolated For De Carlo Trial in Jersey
description: NEWARK, Jan. 5A jury was selected today in the ex tortion trial of a reputed Mafia figure and was immediately sent to a hotel to remain in sulated from any information except what was produced in the courtroom.

title: Argentine Markets Reopen
description: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 5 (Reu ters)Banks, commodity mar kets and the stock exchange reopened today after a fiveday recess to permit conversion of Argentine currency to its new values, technically effective since Jan. 1. The new peso dollar parity has been changed to 3.50 instead of 350 previ ously.

title: Ayerst Premarin Goes To Sadler & Hennessey
description: Ayerst Laboratories, an ethical drug subsidiary of American Home Products, has moved its Premarin, an es trogen, to Sudler & Hennes sey, after 12 years at Klempt ner Casey and its predeces sor agency.

title: 36 Cars Derailed Upstate
description: ROCHESTER, Jan. 5 (AP) Thirtysix cars of a PennCen tral freight train carrying flour, feed and lumber were derailed today in suburban Chill, south west of here. No one was in jured. The railroad said the cause of the derailment was under investigation.

title: QUALIFYING SYSTEM REVISED BY PRO GOLF
description: A pointscoring system will replace official money earnings in determining automatic ex emptions and other privileges for the 1970 Professional Golfers Association tour, the P.G.A. tournament players di vision announced yesterday.

title: VIKINGS ARE MADE 13POINT FAVORITE
description: In the closest betting spread of the four Super Bowl games, the Minnesota Vikings were in stalled yesterday as a 13point favorite over the Kansas City Chiefs by Jimmy (The Greek) Snyder, the Las Vegas odds maker.

title: Financier Becomes Chief Executive
description: Milton A. Gordon, a finan cier who delights in turning small investments into big ones, became president and chief executive of Halle & Stieglitz, Inc., yesterday.

title: U.N. GIVEN NEW PLEA OF TWO SOVIET JEWS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 5  Israel has given the United Nations a letter from or Jewish couple complaining that they have been prevented from emigrating from the Soviet Union to join their son in Israel.

title: Vietcong Terrorists Return at Funeral of Victim
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 5 (AP)The farmer kneeling before the body of his wife looked up at the old wall clock, which he had set 15 minutes fast to give him an earlier start on the day. Last night she was alive, he said to himself.the three Vietcong took them without resistance.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Herbert W. Osterland, James Kelly and Robert B. Jenning have been elected directors of the Gunlocke Company, a sub sidiary of the Sperry & Hutchin son Company. Lee Industries, Inc., subsidiary of S. & H., has elected as directors. Frederick A. Collins, executive vice presi dent of S. & H., and James Mills, vice president in charge of subsidiaries for the parent company.

title: Turkish Students Hijack Buses In Ankara Dispute Over Fares
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Jan 5 (AP) More than 30 city buses were hijacked by students of Ankara University today in protest against a cancellation of re ducedfare permits.

title: Retired.News Editor Joins Columbia's Press Institute
description: Columbia University's Amer ican Press Institute announced yesterday that. Samuel G. Black man, who recently retired as general news editor of The Associated Press, had joined the institute on a temporary assignment.

title: 7 Canadians in Boat Drown
description: CAMPBELL RIVER, B. C., Jan. 5 (UPI)A weekend outing aboard a new 22foot cabin cruiser in the Strait, of Georgia ended in the deaths of a man and two children and the ap parent death of five other chil dren. The Royal Canadian Mounted Police reported the body of the skipper, Harry Dirks, and two other bodies were found today on a Quadra Island beach. The search for the others continued.

title: G.M. in a December Drop3 Others Report Today
description: DETROIT, Jan. 5New car sales were still falling as the year ended, the General Motors Corporation reported today.

title: 11 Marines Die in Attack By Enemy on Night Camp
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tues day, Jan. 6The United States command said that enemy sol diers attacked a Marine night camp south of Danang early this morning, killing 11 marines and wounding 59.

title: Wisconsin Picks Aide
description: MADISON, Wis., Jan. 5 (UPI) Paul Roach, offensive back field coach at the University of Wyoming since 1962, was named to the coaching staff to day as an aide to John Jardine, new head football coach at the University of Wisconsin.

title: A Terrified June A llyson Wins Plaudits as Star of Forty Carats
description: I was terrified. From the first curtain to the last, I was terrified.

title: CITIES SERVICE SETS 6 OPERATING GROUPS
description: The Cities Service Com pany announced yesterday realignment of its activities into six operating groups. Charles S. Mitchell, chairman and chief executive, said the changes would expand market ing opportunities, eliminate du plicate functions, and effect greater flexibility and cost savings.

title: Bank Debits Up Here
description: Charges against checking ac counts in New York rose slight ly in November while such debits dipped in 232 other money centers across the na tion, Federal Reserve data showed yesterday. The level rose in New York to a season ally adjusted annual rate of $4.21trillion, compared with $4.13trillion in October and $3.93 trillion in November, 1968.

title: Mississippi Victor, 5957
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Jan. 5 (UPI)Bruce Rich hit on a one hand jumper at the buzzer to give Mississippi a 5957 double overtime victory over Tennes see tonight, the Rebels' first Southeastern Conference vic tory of the season.

title: Kentucky Routs Mississippi
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Jan. 5 (UPI)  Undefeated Kentucky trounced Mississippi State, 11176, tonight in registering its second Southeastern Con ference victory and 10th over all.

title: Anaconda Raises Copper Price; Output of Steel Gains Sharply
description: The Anaconda Company raised the price of primary cop per yesterday by 4 cents a mond to 56 cents.

title: Another Jolt for Subway Riders
description: Among the Christmas presents that Tiffany's had for under $10always a rather fabulous collectionone its best sellers was a sterling silver token holder for $9.75. But whatever joy a recipient got out of one was shortlived; the holders were for 20cent tokens.

title: KENNEDY ANSWERS INQUEST QUERIES
description: EDGARTOWN, Mass., Jan. 5  For the first time under oath, Senator Edward M. Ken nedy answered questions today about his movements before and after the drowning of Mary Jo Kopechne nearly six months ago.

title: Amati Ensemble of Berlin Makes Its Local Debut
description: The Amati Ensemble of Ber lin, a conductorless, standup group of 11 string players, made its local debut at Tully Hall last night.

title: FUNDADVISER HOUSE SUSPENDED By S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission today suspended Philadelphia mutual fund man agement company, a brokerage house and two individuals. The S.E.C. accused them of having split commissions with other firms that bought and sold stock for the fund.

title: I.O.S. Fund Group Accused by Greece Of Illegal Activity
description: ATHENS, Jan. 5Investors Overseas Services, Ltd., the giant Swissbased mutual fund organization, was accused today by the Government of engaging in illegal transac tions in Greece.

title: THE MET BORROWS A TENOR NEXT DOOR
description: The New York City Opera is turning out to be a good neigh bor of the Metropolitan Opera at Lincoln Center. The latter company had engaged one of the former's tenors, Enrico Di Giuseppe, for a performance of Madama Butterfly last week. When he couldn't make last night's repetition of the Puccini work because he had to step into a morning rehearsal at the last minute, the Met recruited another City Opera tenor, Nich olas Di Virgilio, to take his place.

title: U.S. Attorney Says Dizzy Dean Aids in Attack on Gambling Ring
description: DETROIT, Jan. 5  Jerome (Dizzy) Dean, the former base ball pitching star, is furnishing information to Federal au thorities attacking a gambling syndicate with wide connec tions in the sports world, a United States Attorney in De troit said today.

title: Prices of Commodity Futures
description: SUGAR CONTRACT No. 8

title: LENT SUPPORTED BY G.O.P. LEADERS
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Jan. 5 State Senator Norman F. Lent was virtually assured today that he will be the Republican candidate this year in the Fifth Congressional District.

title: BRAZILIANS CURB NEWS MAGAZINE
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Jan. 5  While officially there is no Government censorship of the Brazilian press, this week's edition of the weekly news magazine Veja was reviewed by two army commands and the Brazilian Federal Police before it was allowed onto newsstands across the country today.

title: Miss Penkower Is Future Bride Of J. C. Kaplan
description: Miss Sharon Susan Pen kower, and Joseph Charles Kaplan, will be married here on March 29.

title: LOUIS SUTTON, HEAD OF CAROLINA UTILITY
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Jan. 5 (AP) Louis V. Sutton, a pioneer of the electric power industry in North Carolina, died in Rex Hospital today after an illness of several weeks. He was 80 years old.

title: A Viennese Ball Jan. 23 to Mark Lehar Birthday
description: The 100th birthday of Franz Lehr, who wrote The Merry Widow, will be the theme of the 15th annual Viennese Opera Ball at the WaldorfAstoria on Jan. 23. The dinner dance will bene fit the Margit BokorNorman Scott Memorial Fund for Cancer Research at Columbia University.

title: Record $1.9Billion Asked For City's Aid to the Poor
description: Almost $2billion, the most money ever asked by a city agency, was requested by the Human Resources Administra tion yesterday for a year that officials said would start with 1.1 million New Yorkers on wel fare.

title: STOCKS ADVANCE ON A BROAD FRONT
description: The stock market, bolstered by seasonal factors at the start of a new year, maintained yes terday its unblemished record for 1970. The market has gone up in two out of two sessions.

title: SAIGON SENATORS DECLARE SONGMY AN ISOLATED ACT
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 5The South Vietnaese Senate adopted a resolution to night describing the alleged massacre of Vietnamese civil ians at Songmy as an isolated act by an American unit and not the policy of the United States armed forces. The Senators declined to label the incident, on March 16, 1968, as a massacre or even a killing, despite the report of an investigation by the Senate De fense Committee that said that at least 47 men, women and children had been slain at Songmy.

title: Maravich Is Hailed as Basketball Artist
description: PISTOL Pete Marovich, who led the nation's college basketball players in scoring the last two seasons, is lead ing again and is only 168 points short of breaking the major college career scoring mark of 2,973 points, set by Oscar Robertson at the Uni versity of Cincinnati from 1957 to 1960. Yet his Louisiana State University team is not ex pected to be in the running for the national championship.

title: SEARCH PRESSED FOR MISSING BOY
description: HILLSBOROUGH TOWN SHIP, N. J., Jan. 5  Nearly 1,000 policemen, state troopers, National Guardsmen and ci vilian volunteers searched over snowcovered expanses of more than two square miles here today but failed to uncover clue to the fate of missing 2 yearold Gregory Scott Lowe.

title: APOLLO 13 AND 14 MAY BE SET BACK
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 5 (UPI) The Apollo 13 moon flight may be delayed a month to April and the launching of Apollo 14 will be set back three or four months this year, the head of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration said to day.

title: Theater: ANTA Series
Upstate G.I. Dies in Vietnam
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (UPI) The Defense Department an nounced today that Army Spe cialist 4 Charles E. Moore Jr. of Rensselaer, N. Y., had been killed in action in Vietnam.

title: Rhode Island Loses
description: MIAMI, (UPI)Five Univer sity of Miami players scored in double figures tonight as the Hurricanes defeated Rhode Island, 10595. John Fultz was the top scorer for the Rams and the game with 35 points and 14 rebounds.

title: Troy Council Fails to Agree on Mayor
description: TROY, Jan. 5This city, which has not had a City Hall building for 31 years, complet ed its fifth day today without a mayor.

title: SILVER FUTURES PRESS UPWARD
description: Silver futures prices began the New Year yesterday with strength. Brokers could cite no specific reason, but talked of influences such as higher prices in London, the more hopeful aspect of the stock market, which has been rising recent ly, and the end of tax selling.

title: Israelis Report They Killed 9 In Egyptian Raid Across Canal
description: TEL AVIV, Tuesday, Jan. 6 Egyptian commandos landed on the East Bank of the Suez Canal last night but Israel said it had quickly repulsed them.

title: Extensive Vandalism Closes Greenwich High School
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Jan. Greenwich High School was closed today because of exten sive vandalism in which every floor of the threestory building was flooded, two computers were broken, laboratory equip ment was destroyed and furni ture tossed about.

title: Gordon Chase Sworn In
description: Gordon Chase, a 37yearold management specialist, was sworn in by Mayor Lindsay yesterday as Health Services Administrator. The appointment of Mr. Chase to the $37,500a year position caused consider able controversy in the medical field. He will have overall di rection of both the Health and Hospitals Departments.

title: Entertainment Events
description: Theater

title: Trenton Mayor to Run Again
description: TRENTON, Jan. 5  Mayor Carmen J. Armenti, a Demo crat, announced today that he would seek a second fouryear term in the May 12 nonpartisan mayoral elections.

title: Canadian in Inflation Vow
description: TORONTO, Jan. 5  Finance Minister Edgar J. Benson, pledging the Government to take all necessary steps in order to win the battle against inflation in this country, warned today that the next several months are crucial.

title: MISSISSIPPI LAGS ON SCHOOL ORDER
description: JACKSON, Miss., Jan. 5  Mississippi school officials, who have been ordered to desegre gate their schools completely, played a waiting game with the Federal courts today.

title: Late Gifts Arrive to Aid The Neediest
description: Today is the 12th day of Christmas and in many parts of the world it is the day for giving presents. According to the New Testament it was on the 12th night that the Magithe Three Wise Men from the Eastarrived In Bethlehem bearing gifts of gold, frankincense and myrrh for the Christ child.

title: Jersey Rescinds Increase. In Auto Insurance Rate
description: TRENTON, Jan. 5 (AP)The State Banking and Insurance Commissioner, Horace J. Bryant Jr., announced today that he was revoking an average 26 per cent increase in the auto insur ance rate he had granted to the Travelers Indemnity Company.

title: Networks to Increase Affiliates' Costs
description: Two of the major television networks have increased the commercial time on a number of major programs to offset higher line charges by the American Telephone and Tele graph Company.

title: South Carolina 6552 Victor; Penn Topples Princeton, 7569
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., Jan. 5 (AP)Six baskets by John Ri bock in the first half broke the back of North Carolina's shuffle defense and sent thirdranked South Carolina on its way to a 6552 Atlantic Coast Conference basketball victory tonight.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: AMERICA'S young people are playing an important role in the growing reaction against environmental pollu tion.

title: Vornado, Inc., Elects
description: Edward H. Feldman has been named a vice president of Vor nado, Inc., operator of the Two Guys discount stores and the Food Giant and other stores on the West Coast. Mr. Feldman was executive vice president of the Vornado LeedsFox divi sion.

title: Job Hunter to Job Holder: It Can Be a Tale of 2 Wardrobes
description: EVEN in these freewheel ing days a young woman who goes job hunting at one of the big companies had better be fairly conservative in appearancehair not too long, skirt not too short, blouse not too sheer, legs not bare.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY Commission on Interna tional Trade Law, Working group on the international sales of goods10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Time for Transit Teamwork
description: The first Monday of the thirtycent transit fire was torture for subway riders. From now on the pain will subside to a dull ache, another burden to add to the many that oppress New Yorkers in these days of inflation and possible recession.

title: Connecticut Beats Maine
description: ORONO, Me., Jan. 5 (AP) Bob Boyd's 27point perform ance led Connecticut to an 83 76 basketball victory tonight over Maine in a Yankee con ference game.

title: JEW AND NEGRO TAKE 2 TOP ATLANTA JOBS
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 5  This city's first Jewish Mayor, Sam Massell Jr., was inaugurated tonight and pledged to pay Negroes a debt dating back over 100 years.

title: Boom Is Predicted in Building Of General Cargo Freighters
description: LONDON, Jan. 5 (AP)A boom in the construction of general cargo freighters, de spite the present trend toward container ships, was predicted today in a confidential report to the British shipbuilding in dustry.

title: Advertising: Splash for Springmaid Special
description: Deep under Pennsylvania Station in a chilly, drafty tun nel yesterday, Spring Mills, which is very big in textiles in the sunny South, unveiled its fourcar publicrelations supertrain.

title: 6 Jersey Companies Told To Stop Polluting the Hudson
description: TRENTON, Jan. 5 (AP) Four large industrial concerns in Hudson County and two in Bergen were directed by the state Health Department today to halt what it called the un lawful pollution of the Hudson River.

title: H L. M'LAUGHLIN, SURGEON, 63, DIES
description: Dr. Harrison Lloyd McLaugh lin, professor of clinical ortho pedic surgery at the College of Physicians and Surgeons of Co lumbia University, died Sunday at the Harkness Pavilion of the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. He was 63 years old and lived at 64 Standish Ave nue, Tuckahoe, N. Y.

title: Pentagon's Civilian Payroll To Be Cut by 5 Per Cent
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (UPI) The Defense Department an nounced today that it would cut its civilian payroll by 5 per cent, or 76,700 employes, by next June 30.

title: 21COLLEGES RULED INELIGIBLE FOR AID
description: ALBANY, Jan. 5State Edu cation Commissioner Ewald B. Nyquist reluctantly ruled today that 21 colleges with religious affiliations were not eligible under the State Constitution to participate in a $24million pro gram designed to aid private colleges and universities.

title: Nigerian Troops Report Downing a Biafran Plane
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Jan. 5 (Reu ters)  Nigerian troops have shot down a Biafran plane on a bombing raid in the north west sector, it was announced here tonight.

title: A. & S. Sets TopLevel Changes
description: Sidney L. Solomon, chief executive officer of Abraham & Straus since 1960 and its chairman since 1963, is re linquishing those posts on Jan. 19.

title: Hanoi Shaken by Tremors; China Is Silent on Quake
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Jan. 5 (Agence FrancePresse)  Hanoi residents fled from their homes before dawn today as light tremors from the severe earthquake that shook south ern China were felt here.

title: Miss Cogswell, William Palmer Planning Bridal
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Jan. 5  Dr. Walter F. Cogswell has announced the engage ment of his daughter, Miss Heather Frances Cogswell, to Pvt. William Albert Palmer, U.S.A. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert C. Palmer of Manchester, Vt., formerly of New York. A wedding next August is plamied.

title: NASSER OFFER OF AID TO ARAFAT REPORTED
description: CAIRO, Jan. 5  A leading Cairo editor reported today that President Gamal Abdel Nasser brought tears of grati tude to the eyes of Yasir Ara fat, the Palestinian commando leader, during the recent Arab conference in Rabat, Morocco, with an offer to turn over to the Palestinians $60million in funds intended for Egypt's armed forces.

title: Stony Brook Receives Grant
description: STONY BROOK, L. I., Jan. 5 The State University center here announced today the re ceipt of a $50,000 National Sci ence Foundation grant that it will use to provide science training for 225 elementary teachers in Suffolk County. The program includes a series of weekend workshops, summer study and evaluation sessions.

title: BERNARD HORNE, LED STORE IN PITTSBURGH
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 5  Bernard Shea Horne, retired board chairman or the Joseph Home Company department store and an authority on Izaak Walton, died yesterday in the Cape Cod Hospital, Hyannis, Mass. He suffered a cerebral hemorrhage on Wednesday. Mr. Horne was 64 years old and had moved to Hyannis Port after his retirement in 1964.

title: Powers Promoted to Presidency
description: Smith, Barney & Co., Inc., announced yesterday the election to new posts of sev eral senior executives of the large investment banking and brokerage concern.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: TAXAGENCY TO STUDY SHELL OIL LECTURES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (UPI) The Internal Revenue Serv ice has agreed to investigate whether the Shell Oil Com pany is trying to deduct from taxes the cost of mandatory lectures for its employes in which the company presented its views against cutting the oil depletion allowance.

title: Telling the Troops
description: The Army information officer who described his job as being essentially to make the military look good posed the dilemma confronting both the armed forces and the journalistsinuniform broadcasting and writing in Vietnam.

title: Gannett Board Gets Sargent
description: PORTLAND, Me., Jan. 5 (AP) The curator of the Nieman Fellowship program at Harvard University has been named to the board of directors of the Guy Gannett Publishing Com pany. Dwight E. Sargent, whose appointment was announced yesterday, had been a member of the staff of The Bortland Herald Press and The New York Herald Tribune, now defunct, before becoming Nieman cura tor in 1964.

title: TRUSTEES OFFERING CONTROL OF CURTIS
description: Working control of the Curtis Publishing Company is being offered for sale by the trustees of the estate of the late Cyrus H. K. Curtis.

title: De Kooning Suing Dentist To Get 3 Paintings Back
description: Willem de Kooning, the art ist, is suing a Queens dentist to recover three paintings that the abstract expressionist claims are his sole property and never offered for sale.

title: LEHIGH WRESTLERS DEFEAT MARYLAND
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., Jan. 5  Eight Lehigh wrestlers remained undefeated in dual competition tonight as the Engineers de feated visiting Maryland, 313, before 2,500 spectators.

title: Challenge to Election of Rochester's Mayor Depends on 1 Councilman's Vote
description: ROCHESTER, Jan. 5Ste phen May finally moved, into the Mayor's thirdfloor suite in City Hall today, but the political atmosphere in the city was as chilly as the weather.

title: Unblocking Legal Aid
description: The Office of Economic Opportunity's Legal Services branch stands at the cuttingedge of the fight to give the poor a middleclass weapon against enforced pov erty. Because its 1,800 attorneys have shifted their focus recently to test cases that challenge established legal practices and community traditions, some local and state officials have resisted the Federal program.

title: UNION OIL PLANS TO CUT SPENDING
description: The Union Oil Company of California plans a sharp re duction in its capital expendi tures this year, Fred L. Hartley, president, announced yesterday

title: Oil Merger Is Set For $240Million By Union Pacific
description: The Union Pacific Corpora tion announced yesterday that it has completed the acquisi tion of Champlin Petroleum Company and Pontiac Refining Corporation in a transaction valued at $240million.

title: Injured RobinsonFeels He Won't Play
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 5 Jim Marsalis, a rookie quar terback with the Kansas City Chiefs, had a bruised kidney and did not accompany the American Football League champions on their chartered flight here today for the Super Bowl game on Sunday.

title: Quake Shakes San Jose
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Jan. 5 (UPI)  A small earthquake shook Sam Jose today. The University of California seis mograph station said that the tremor was centered about three miles east of San Jose and had a Richter magnitude of 3.3. A quake list Friday was centered about four miles west of today's and had a magnitude of 4.

title: POLICE PERMITTED TO WEAR THE FLAG
description: The Police Department said early this morning that it would issue orders today permitting its men to wear American flags.

title: Unruh Urges Conservation Move As California Legislature Meets
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Jan.  The California Legislature opened it 1970 session today amid scrambling between party leaderships for the preeminent role in environmental protec tion.

title: GEN. VALLUY DEAD; HIGH NATO OFFICIAL
description: PARIS, Jan. 5General of the Army JeanEtienne Valluy, a former commanderinchief of the North Atlantic Central European Forces, died here yes terday at the age of 70.

title: AGNEW, IN NEPAL, DISCUSSES U.S. AID
description: KATMANDU, Nepal, Jan. 5 (Reuters)  Vice President Ag new arrived in this Himalayan kingdom bordering on Tibet to day on a 22hour visit that included brief political talks.

title: Sports of The Times
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 5It's just as well that all the preliminaries ended yesterday for next Sunday's climac tic Super Bowl. If the boisterous brutalities of the two championship games had been permitted to continue over an even more extended period of time, there might not hive been sufficient survivors to man the platoons.

title: City to Ban Meter Parking In Midtown by November
description: Daytime parking of passenger cars at all 1,000 metered spots in midManhattan will be banned by next Thanksgiving at the latest, Traffic Commissioner Theodore Karagheuzoff said yesterday.

title: Pittsburgh Mayor, at Public Inauguration, Vows a Housecleaning
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 5May or Peter F. Flaherty pledged today to appoint a fresh new team of city officials in a housecleaning intended to re form the government of this industrial city.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Dr. Max Born, Pioneer Nuclear Physicist, Dies
description: BONN, Jan. 5Dr. Max Born, the German physicist and pio neer of modern nuclear phys ics, died today in the Gttingen University Medical Clinic. He was 87 years old.

title: SHIFTS DUE TODAY IN HOUSING POSTS
description: Over the strong reservations of the Liberal party leadership and some West Side Reform Democrats, Mayor Lindsay plans to name Albert A. Walsh, a 41yearold Republican, to the post of Housing and Develop ment Administrator today.

title: After the Pope's Visit, Garbage Again Piles Up in Slum
description: ROME, Jan. 5Special sani tation crews removed the most visible heaps of garbage from the rutted mud streets of Rome's Borghetto Prenestino slum just before Pope Paul VI went there Christmas morning to say mass. The street clean ers have not been back since.

title: Daley on Stand in Chicago Today
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 5The de fendants in the Chicago con spiracy trial announced plans today to indict Mayor Rich ard J. Daley when he appears as a witness tomorrow.

title: Air Service to St. Martin
description: ALM Dutch Antillean Air lines will offer direct DC9 jet service between New York and the Caribbean island of St. Martin beginning Jan. 14. Roundtrip flights will be flown on Wednesdays and Saturdays. An operational stop, for refuel ing only, will be made at Ber muda. On the flight from St. Martin a stop will also be made at San Juan.

title: CHARLES SADEK, 76, IMPORTER OF GIFTS
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Jan. 5Charles Sadek, who was born on New York's Lower East Side and rose to success in business, died Saturday of cancer in his home here, 29 Disbrow Lane. He was 76 years old on New Year's Day.

title: MORGENTHAU JOINS LINDSAY'S GABINET AS DEPUTY MAYOR
description: A beaming Mayor Lindsay yesterday appointed Robert M. Morgenthau, the deposed Unit ed States Attorney, who is a leading Democrat, to the newly created post of a third Deputy Mayor.

title: Call by Bonn's Army Chief For Discipline Is Reported
description: HAMBURG, West Germany, Jan. 5 (AP)  The magazine Spiegal reported today that the commander of the West Ger man Army had called for a re emphasis on German soldierly traditions to counteract paci fistic, uptopian tendencies, ;menacing the armed forces.

title: British Soccer Standing
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: Miss Diane Tietjen Is Married To Gerard Henry Dericks Jr.
description: Miss Diane Tietjen and Ge rard Henry Dericks Jr. were married last Wednesday in the Methodist Church in St. Maarten, the Netherlands An tilles. The Rev. R. J. Willing ham performed the ceremony.

title: Deputy Mayor Morgenthau
description: Mayor Lindsay has given dramatic recognition to the nonpartisan nature of his election victory by Choosing an outstanding Democrat as one of his three Deputy Mayors. In drawing Robert M. Morgenthau into his administration, Mr. Lindsay has not only honored a pledge to develop a true coalition govern ment for the city but has made an imaginative and thoroughly admirable appointment.

title: Warriors Triumph, 118102, As Mullins, Thurmond Star
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 5 (UPI)Jeff Mullins and Nate Thurmond combined for 54 points tonight in leading the San Francisco Warriors to a 118102 victory over the Detroit Pistons in a National Basketball Association game in which changed hands several times.

title: Isaac Bashevis Singer Takes Success in Stride
description: I tell you, the only dif ferences that success has made for me are that I work more and that I don't have this fear, which I had for many years, that I will starve.

title: V.A. Medical Chief Named
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (AP) Dr. Marc J. Musser, a former career medical officer in the Veterans Administration, was appointed today as the agency's chief medical director.

title: Pope Meets Wives of 7 Men Missing in Vietnam
description: ROME, Jan. 5 (UPI)Pope Paul VI assured the wives of seven United States servicemen today he was doing everything he Could to try to help them learn whether their husbands were alive or dead in North Vietnam.

title: Addonizio Deputy Begins Effort To Draft Mayor for ReElection
description: NEWARK, Jan. 5Newark's deputy mayor began what he called a grass roots move ment today to draft Mayor Hugh J. Addonizio as a candi date for reelection this spring.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: 1,200 CITY WORKERS STRIKE IN CINCINNATI
description: CINCINNATI, Jan. 5About 1,200 of the 4,000 nonuniformed employes of this city of 500,000 went on strike today in defi ance of a temporary injunction.

title: Murphy to Get Clinic Check up
description: The latest thing that has happened to the latest radical weekly is that it is no longer called Mayday.

title: 2 Boys Shot in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (AP) A 16yearold boy was killed and a 14yearold boy wounded today in shootings at two jun ior high schools in southeast Washington. The fatality oc curred in what the police de scribed as a possible holdup attempt. In the other shooting, in a thirdfloor hallway, the boy was wounded in the thigh.

title: Nixon Frees Leader of Negro SelfHelp Unit
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 5In his first act of executive clemency, President Nixon com muted the sixmonth prison sentence of Dr. Thomas W. Matthew, a Negro neurosurgeon who heads the National Eco nomic Growth and Reconstruc tion Organization in New York City.

title: KNICKS, SAGGING, GET OUT OF TOWN
description: The New York Knickerbock ers begin their longest journey of the National Basketball As sociation season tonight, the type of trip the clichemongers like to call an odyssey, by playing the Bullets in Baltimore. The fans at home can see the game on Channel 9 at 9 P.M.

title: FIRMS SPEAK OUT ON CERTIFICATES
description: A recent study calling for the elimination of the stock certificate on Wall Street was challenged yesterday by the Association of Stock Exchange Firms.

title: Police Seize Fighting Birds
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 5 (AP)Po licemen raided an abandoned tavern northwest of the down town district yesterday and con fiscated 15 fighting cocks val ued, officials said, at $1,000 each. Mrs. Anna Colon, 38 years old, who lives behind the tavern was arrested on charges of cruelty to animals and being the keeper of a gambling house.

title: BOND ISSUE SOLD AT LOWER YIELD
description: The 1970 corporate bond market got under way yester day with interest rates well below the peak levels they reached early in December.

title: Statement of Judge on Inquest Rules
description: EDGARTOWN, Mass., Jan. 5Following is a statement today by Judge James A. Boyle, presiding over the in quest into the death of Mary Jo Kopechne:

title: Transport News and Notes
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (AP) The Civil Aeronautics Board has ruled against an aircraft leasing plan that would have enabled Trans Caribbean Air ways and American Airlines jointly to provide direct serv ice between the Caribbean area and a number of cities.

title: PRICES IN LONDON AND TOKYO GO UP
Israel Guards Oil Pipeline From Elath With Silence
description: ELATH, Israel, Jan. 3Just outside Ramle, on the main Tel AvivJerusalem highway, a motorist passes two huge stor age yards. One contains hun dreds of Egyptian military vehicles captured in the sixday war of June, 1967. The other is filled with 42inchdiameter pipes.

title: 3 Arabs in Zurich Appeal
description: ZURICH, Switzerland, Jan. 5 (Reuters)  Three Palestinian commandos, sentenced last month to 12 years at hard labor for attacking an Israeli airliner here Feb. 18, have appealed their conviction and sentence.
