The Arabs, Mohammed Abu al Haija, Ibrahim Tawfiq Youssef and Miss. Amina Dahbourt have lodged appeals in both the Zu rich Cantonal Appeal Court and the Federal Supreme Court in Lausanne.

title: TV: Dick Gregory Speaks Out at U. of Alabama
description: DICK GREGORY, the hu morist and champion of the human rights of blacks, now passes nearly 98 per cent of his time at colleges lectur ing on the evils of racism and the shortcomings of democ racy as he sees them. Last night National Educational Television, with the financial support of the Corporation of Public Broadcasting, gave an illustrated version of his talk on noncommercial TV (Chan nel 13).

title: U.S. Agency Fears Loani Aided Mafia Concerns
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5  The director of the Small Business Administration said today that two loans totaling $560,000 had been granted by the agency to firms suspected of having un derworld connections.

title: 2 New Productions And 2 Premieres Planned by Joffrey
description: The City Center Joffrey Bal let will present new produc tions of Petrouchka and Pineapple Poll as well as two premieres by Gerald Arpino in its season at the City Center from Feb. 25 through April 5.

title: G.O.P.Led Supervisors Hold First Meeting  Format Is Little Changed
description: WHITE PLAINS, Jan. 5  Westchester's new 17member County Legislature met for the first time today, but few peo ple expect it to differ signifi cantly from the 45member Board of Supervisors it re placed.

title: Rockefeller Will Ask the Legislature for a State Consumer Protection Board
description: ALBANY, Jan. 5  Governor Rockefeller will ask the Legis lature to create a new Board of, Consumer Protection in the executive department and to broaden the powers of the At torney General to act on be half of consumers.

title: Consul in Rhodesia Denies U.S. Link to Espionage Case
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Jan., 5A press report that two men jailed in Rhodesia last month for economic espionage were lin the pay of the United States Government was described to day as. pure fantasy by the American consulincharge in Salisbury, W. Paul O'Neill Jr.

title: BEAMON REQUESTS RULING ON STATUS
description: Bob Beamon, the world rec ord holder in the long jump, will ask the Eastern College Athletic Conference to clarify his college athletic eligibility, Ron Bazil said yesterday.

title: Foreign Bookstores in City Growing
description: Nous avons dj vendu plus de 1,000 exemplaires et nous les avons recommands une fois de plus, Lon Amiel, the portly managing director of Librairie Larousse, told a customer the other day.

title: Dance: New Cunningham
description: IT so happens I have suf fered much in the cause of art. Last night I think I may have contracted pneumonia. The occasion was the open ing of Merce Cunningham's new season at the Brooklyn Academy of Music and the world premiere of his latest piece, Tread.

title: BANK OFFERS 7% TO SMALL SAVERS
description: The First Pennsylvania Bank ing and Trust Company, Phila delphia's largest bank, offered yesterday to pay 7 per cent to savers with as little as $100 to invest.

title: JOHNSON OF BROWNS ESCAPES OPERATION
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 5 (UPI) Walter Johnson, Cleveland Browns' defensive tackle, rested in Shaker Medical Center today, after a scare over the possi bility of losing part of one or more fingers on his right hand through frostbite.

title: Rhodesia Reports Attack By Infiltrating Guerrillas
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Jan. 5 (Reuters} Rhodesian secu rity forces said today that Af rican nationalist guerrillas crossed the Zambezi River from Zambia last Saturday and attacked a Rhodesian patrols launch, wounding one police man.

title: Pilot System to Warn of Floods And Hurricanes in New England
description: WALTHAM, Mass., Jan. 5 An automatic data collection network, envisioned as the pilot for a nationwide flood control and hurricane protec tion system, was dedicated here today.

title: School Board Alters Stand on Districts
description: The Board of Education has told leaders in the Legislature that it has no objection to retaining six school districts in Manhattan under decentraliza tion if the state law is changed.

title: Books of The Times
description: BEFORE we've even had a chance to analyze and classify the fiction of Colin MacInnes, he confounds us with another book. Only a year ago, Mr. Mac Innes's London novelsAbsolute Be ginners, City of Spades, Mr. Love and Justicewere published in this country for the first time, eliciting critical huzzahs not without the usual admixture of self  congratula tion: For too long the American pub lic has ignored . . . Why did it take 10 years? . . . etc. They were good novels, with moral bite, sharply ob served, genuinely amusing, steeped in that contem porary London un derworld to which, with the exception of Gerald Kersh, most British writ ers have been re cently indifferent. Moreover, one of his principal concerns was the urban subculture of the black im migrant. Long before the fingering of racial wounds became popular on this side of the Atlantic, the white Mr. Maclnnes had al ready managed remarkably imaginative acts of empathy and identification.

title: Mrs. Efrem Zimbalist Sr., Curtis Heiress, Is Dead
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 5 Mrs. Mary Louise Curtis Bok Zimbalist, founder of the Curtis Institute of Music and wife of Efrem Zimbalist Sr., the vio linist, died yesterday at her home nere. She was 93 years old.

title: County Executive Calls for Widened Plan to Fight Drugs and Pollution
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Jan. 5Nas sau County Executive Eugene H. Nickerson called today for expansion of the county's pro grams to combat drug abuse and pollution of the air and water, which he said are reaching disaster proportions.

title: Yogurt Maker Said to Reduce Packages as Well as People
description: The city charged yesterday that some yogurt being sold here was even more slimming for dieters than its labelling would indicate.

title: A Trace of Gold Is Found By Moon Rock Analysts
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 5There's a trace of gold on the moon's Sea of Tranquility and an un familiar yellowish mineral, too.

title: Russi Takes Giant Slalom; Brechu 2d in German Event
description: HINDELANG, Germany, Jan. 5 (UPI)Bernhard Russi of Switzerland won both heats of the giant slalom today with an aggregate time of 2 minutes 21.99 seconds. He covered the first run in 1:08.38 and the sec ond in 1:13.61.

title: DR. GEORGE BUCKLEY OF N.Y.U. DENTAL, 61
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Jan. 5 Dr. George A. Buckley, pro fessor and chairman of the de partment of removable prostho dontics at the New York Uni versity School of Dentistry, died yesterday at his home, 194 Nassau Boulevard. He was 61 years old.

title: Commercial Use of Apartments Barred Because of  Harassment
description: The State Supreme Court has Issued an injunction against a landlord for using a calcu lated program of harassment to force tenants out so their space could be rented to com mercial enterprises at far high er rates.

title: PHIPPS AMONG 33 TO GAIN AWARDS
description: KANSAS CITY, Jan. 5 (UPI) Mike Phipps, Purdue's all America quarterback, and 32 other senior football players were awarded $1,000 post graduate scholarships today by the National Collegiate Athletic Association.

title: Negroes, Too, Found Quitting City Slum Areas
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5The Bureau of the Census released new figures today that docu mented earlier estimates that both whites and Negroes had been fleeing the poverty areas of cities.

title: Husak Scores Czech Ultraconservatives And Dubcek
description: VIENNA, Jan. 5Dr. Gustav Husak, the Czechoslovak Com munist leader, today attacked ultraconservatives in the party who he said wanted to turn the clock back to the harsher pe riod before the 1968 democra tization.

title: His Wife's $40,000aYear Job Was a Surprise to Him
description: BALTIMOREVilliam Roy Bentley, who was a Bal timore school teacher, worked days, and his wife, Helen Delich Bentley, who was a newspaper reporter, worked nights. So in 1968 they opened an antique shop in order to have something in common.

title: ITALIAN PARTY HEADS MEET TO SEEK UNITY
description: ROME, Jan. 5Efforts to achieve a strong majority na tional government to deal with continuing strikes and unrest throughout Italy inched for ward today with a meeting of leaders of four centerleft po tential coalition partners.

title: National Film Critics Crown Z, Jon Voight, Miss Redgrave
description: Z, the French film drama dealing with a Greek political assassination, was voted the best movie of 1969 in the fourth annual poll of the Na tional Society of Film Critics. The group, which cast its bal lots at the Algonquin Hotel Sunday, cited the winners at reception at the hotel yester day.

title: Air, Road and Rail Travelers Find Getting Here Is No Fun
description: Numerous delays plagued rail commuters here yesterday as metropolitan area residents sought to return to work fol lowing the fourday New Year's holiday.

title: In The Nation: Is There a Nixon Doctrine?
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 If you've seen one Agnew, you've apparently seen them tall.

title: Church Occupiers Ordered to Court
description: Members of the Young Lords organization their support ers who have been occupying a red brick church in East Harlem for the last eight days were ordered yesterday to appear in court this morning and state why they should not be held in contempt.

title: Indictment Against Cohn Returned in Chicago Case
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 5 (UPI) Roy M. Cohn, New York finan cier and onetime aide to the late Senator Joseph R. Mc Carthy of Wisconsin, was in dicted today With three other men on charges of violating Illinois banking laws.

title: Times Will Make a Donation To Neediest and Drop Lists
description: The New York Times will make a contribution to the Neediest Cases Fund beginning in the 197071 fund drive. The contribution will be in lieu of the publication of the names of donors to the Neediest Cases Fund.

title: GROUP PICKS WAR AS ELECTION ISSUE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (AP) A group of associates and former campaign workers of Senator Eugene J. McCarthy, Hubert H. Humphrey and the late Robert F. Kennedy an nounced today a campaign to make the 1970 Congressional elections a referendum on the Vietnam war.

title: Alexander Purdon Is Dead at 60; ExHead of United States Lines
description: Alexander Purdon, who re signed in 1968 as president of United States Lines, the steam ship company, died of a heart attack Sunday in Overlook Hos pital, Summit, N. J. For the last nine months, he had been administrative vice president of Wagner College, Grymes Hill, S. I. He was 60 years old and lived at 34 Southview Drive, Berkeley Heights, N. J.

title: Pamela Reid Eakins Engaged To Albert Louis Nelson 3d
description: GLEN COVE, L. I., Jan. 5 Mr. and Mrs. William Shan non Eakins have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Pamela Reid Eakins, to Albert Louis Nel son 3d of Los Angeles. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Nel son Jr. of St. Louis. An early spring wedding is planned.

title: Group of Dissident Athletes Demands Organizational Changes by A.A.U.
description: Seeking a more meaningful voice in the administration of the sport in this country, top track and field athletes have recommended sweeping organ izational changes to the Ama teur Athletic Union.

title: St. Peter's 7365 Victor
description: JERSEY CITY, Jan. 5St. Peter's College evened its rec ord at 55 by defeating Fair leigh Dickinson 7365, before 2,215 fans tonight at the Jersey City Armory.

title: Boss of N.H.L. Referees Tells Of Hot Time They Have on Ice
description: With compassion and an oc casional wince, the refereein chief of the National Hockey League asked yesterday for un derstanding for his men, who are washed up when they're 42 years old, in the prime of life.

title: A Correction
description: The area net gain of 138,000 jobs during 1969, reported by the Federal Bureau of Labor Statistics for the New York northeastern New Jersey area involved New York City, Nas sau, Suffolk, Westchester and Rockland Counties and eight northeastern New Jersey coun ties. As a result of a typo graphical error in The New York Times yesterday, the defi nition of the area dropped mention of the New Jersey counties.

title: Bowie Opens Meet Under Sunny Skies and 38Degree Temperature
description: BOWIE, Md., Jan. 5  With winter racing now a fact of life on the thoroughbred scene, the Bowie Race Course opened its 52day season today under excellent conditions.

title: Tex Ritter Runs for Senate
description: NASHVILLE, Jan. 5 (UPI) Tex Ritter, the singing cowboy, announced today his candidacy as a Republican for a seat in the United States Senate.

title: PRICES RISE AGAIN IN AMEX TRADING
description: The American Stock Exchange scored its fourth consecutive advance yesterday in stepped up trading.

title: Recital to Aid Chinese
description: Ma SiHohn, violinist, and Tung KwongKwong, pianist, will give a concert on Jan. 24 at the Alice Tully Hall for the benefit of the Scholarship and Expansion Fund of the New York Chinese School.

title: International Loans Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5The following is a list of loans and other aid extended last week by United States and other international lending agencies here:

title: Mary Ballard Hobart Is Betrothed
description: NORTHFIELD, III., Jan. 5 Mr. and Mrs. John H. Hobart have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Mary. Ballard Hobart, a sen ior at Skidmore, to Jonathan Petke, a second lieutenant in the Marine Corps, who is in helicopter pilot training at Hunter Stewart Army Air field in Savannah, Ga.

title: HobokenChicago Run Ends
description: HOBOKEN, N. J., Jan. 5 (UPI) The ErieLackawanna Lake Cities trains made their final passenger runs today between here and Chicago. Five states had sought to force the line to continue the service but the plea was denied Friday by As sociate Justice Potter Stewart of the United States Supreme Court.

title: 3 Ministers Are Affected In Panama Cabinet Shuffle
description: PANAMA, Jan. 5 (AP)A Cabinet reshuffle in the Gov ernment of President Demetrio B. Lukas was announced today.

title: TROT WHIP RULE DRAWS 2 PROTESTS
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Jan. 5  As 15,379 fans attended the second night of harness racing at Roosevelt Raceway, George Morton Levy Sr., track presi dent, announced he had sent a letter of protest to the State Harness Commission chairman, Robert A. Glasser, against the nowhipping rule that went into effect last Saturday nignt.

title: Shirley Booth Signs for Broadway After 10 Years
description: After an absence of almost 10 years, Shirley Booth is re turning to Broadway as the star of Look to the Lilies, the new musical based on the successful movie and novel, Lilies of the Field. It opens March 23 at the LuntFon tanne Theater.

title: 23,000 Teachers in Kenya Strike Demanding Back Pay
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Jan. 5 More than 23,000 Kenya teach ers did not turn up for work at the start of the 1970 term today.

title: DR. HILARY HOLMES, HOSPITAL AIDE, 51
description: Dr. Hilary Holmes, assistant attending physician and Presby terian Hospital, died Saturday in a shooting accident while duck hunting on Little Nob Is land near Larchmont, N.Y. He was 51 years old and lived at 5445 Palisade Avenue, River dale, The Bronx.

title: Yablonski of U.M.W. Slain With Wife and Daughter
description: CLARKSVILLE, Pa., Jan. 5 Joseph A. Yablonski, whose un successful challenge last year for the presidency of the Unit ed Mine Workers of America touched off the bitterest elec tion campaign in the union's 79year history, was found shot to death today, with his wife and daughter in their home here.

title: Youth Leaves Virginia Prison With Pardon on Drug Charge
description: RICHMOND, Jan. 5 (AP) Frank Lavarre, a 20yearold college student, walked out 01 the Virginia Penitentiary today with a conditional pardon from a 20year sentence for posses sion of marijuana.

title: TWO NEGRO DEATHS DISPUTED IN SOUTH
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Jan. 5  Two young Negro men were fatally shot last night during what the police called an ar son attempt. Today, the police and a local civil rights leader disputed the circumstances of the shootings.

title: Schranz Takes Slalom After Theoni Admits Error
description: ADELBODEN, Switzerland, Jan. 5 (UPI)Karl Schranz of Austria, the World Cup cham pion, scored his first victory of the new Alpine skiing season today, when Gustavo Thoeni of Italy admitted at the finish line that he missed a gate in the second giant slalom heat.

title: Jersey Landmark Destroyed
description: RAHWAY, N, J., Jan. 5The Cross Keys Hotel at 27 West Cherry Street, a landmark here for about 200 years, was de stroyed during the night by a fire of undetermined origin. Two firemen and several of the 48 guests in the 20room hotel were treated for smoke inhala tion. The fire, according to the police, started in a basement area under the kitchen.

title: Duquesne Winner, 10364
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 5 (AP) Jarrett Durham poured in 32 points as Duquesne made a shambles of American Univer sity's early fullcourt press to defeat the Eagles, 10364, to night.

title: RAIDERS REJECT LOSERS STIGMA
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Jan: 5 The Oakland Raiders aren't the Dallas cowboys; Tom Keat ing says, but they're not the Kansas City Chiefs either and that's why Keating will be in the stands instead of on the field in New Orleans Sunday.

title: TIJERINA SENTENCED IN COURTHOUSE RAID
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M., Jan. 5 (AP)Reies Lopez Tiperina was sentenced today to con current state prison terms of 1 to 5 years and 2 to 10 years on convictions stemming from the raid on the courthouse at Tierra Amarilla June 5, 1967.

title: Token Lines Make Thousands Late
description: On the first weekday test of the new 30cent transit fare, thousands of persons got to their jobs late be cause of long waits to buy .the new tokens, disorderly protests were mounted against the increased cost and 11 persons were arrested on charges of trying to evade paying any fare at all or trying to encourage others to avoid paying fares.

title: ExPostal Workers Jailed in Mail Thefts In a Stricter Policy
description: In a new get tough policy toward postal employes who steal from the mails, Federal Judge Edward C. McLean im posed prison sentences yester day on two former post office workers.

title: 2 TEACHER UNIONS ON COAST MERGING
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 5  The two teachers' unions in Los An geles, with a school district second in size only to New York's, announced today an agreement to merge.

title: Strong Advocate of Reform Praises Administration
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5  Myrl E. Alexander, director of the Federal Bureau of Prisons, who is a strong advocate of prison reform, will retire Jan. 31, Attorney General John N. Mitchell announced today.

title: Dutch Clergy Start Talks
description: NOORDWIJKERHOUT, the Netherlands, Jan. 5 (UPI) Members of the Dutch Roman Catholic clergy and laymen held their first working sessions to day in a fourday conference that is expected to challenge the doctrine of priestly celibacy. Msgr. Angelo Felici, the Vati can's official representative in the Netherlands, was absent from the opening session last night, causing some speculation that he was boycotting the meeting.

title: Argentine Toll Rises to 36 In Flooding of Andean City
description: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 5 (Reu ters)  At least 36 bodies were taken to a hosiptal and police stations throughout the city of Mendoza today after a dam broke and sent a sixfoot wall of water and mud roaring into the city.

title: Phyllis Walker, '68 Debutante, To Be Married
description: SUMMERVILLE, S. C., Jan. 5The engagement of Miss Phyllis Corson Walker to James Gillespie Blaine Ewing 3d has been announced by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence Adams Walker. Her fianc is the son of Mrs. Marjorie Ewing of Aiken and J. G. Blaine Ewing Jr. of Bedford, N. Y.

title: Bridge: Taiwanese Team Captures Honors in Far East Play
description: THE Far East Champion ship, played last month in Taipei, Taiwan, was won convincingly by the repre sentatives of Taiwan. The winners will play in the next Bermuda Bowl in Stockholm in June, hoping to repeat their 1969 world champion ship success when they fin ished second behind Italy and ahead of the United States and France.

title: MERGER ACTIVITY SET A 1969 RECORD
description: Merger activity rose to a rec ord in 1969 although the num ber of tender offers was down sharply, according to the an nual merger survey and analy sis made by W. T. Grimm & Co. that was released yester day.

title: Grant Prepares to Move South; Chiefs, Not Pheasant, the Game
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Jan. 5  A year ago Bud Grant was so en grossed in the last week of the pheasant season in Nebraska that he didn't have time to watch the Super Bowl, on tele vision.

title: OHLSSON SELECTS RAVEL FOR DEBUT
description: The world is not full of young pianists who want to make their New York debuts by playing Ravel's Gaspard de la Nuit, so Garrick Ohlsson's recital last night at the Metro politan Museum of Art's Grace Rainey Rogers Auditorium had a certain builtin fascination. The Scarbo finale of the Ravel is only for the upper ranks of virtuosos to practice, let alone perform in public, let alone in a debut.

title: New Orders Down; Durable Goods Off by $700Million
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 Manufacturers' inventories rose $450million in November, somewhat less than in most other recent months, the Com merce Department reported to day.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Transit CliffHanger

title: Censorship of Stars and Stripes Denied
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5The former editor in chief of the pacific editions of Stars and Stripes said today that no cen sorship or news management had been applied to his news papers, although there were cases of highlevel military pressures and complaints.

title: U.S.Pays $6,100 in Damages For Casualties in Cambodia
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (AP) The United States has paid $6,100 to the families of 11 Cambodians who were killed in two border incidents and to 13 Cambodians who were wounded at the same time, the State Department said today.

title: Student Charged on Coast In the Murder of Director
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., Jan. 5 (AP)A 25yearold graduate student was formally charged with murder today in the fatal stabbing last Satur day of Robert B. Sinclair, a re tired theatrical director.

title: Peking Giving Little Information in Official Press
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 5Com munist China has, in the last year, steadily reduced the flow of information to the outside world through its official press.

title: Observer: Youth Sees the Light
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 54s it not splendid that college stu dents have begun to behave with maturity again? Their rude shouting has abated. They are less impulsive about seiz ing the dean's office. They are beginning to shut up about the war. If the boys would get crewcuts and the girls would put on bobby socks and saddles, our college problems would be over.

title: Galamison's Church Is Occupied By Group Trying to Aid Addicts
description: A group of 15 to 30 demon strators occupied Soloam Pres byterian Church in Brooklyn's BedfordStuyvesant section yes terday, demanding space to set up a rehabilitation center for narcotics addicts.

title: Knight Names Psychologist
description: MIAMI, Jan. 5 (UPI)Byron B. Harless, 53 years old, a psy chologist who has specialized in newspaper personnel programs for 21 years, today was ap pointed vice president for per sonnel of Knight Newspapers, Inc., based in Miami.

title: Sometimes at Hat Shows They Get Around to Showing Hats
description: NOBODY goes to a hat show any more just to look at the hats. Sometimes there aren't anya head band, a flower, a scarf tied under the chin is enough to keep the millinery franchise.

title: 2 Whites and 1,391 Blacks In a Mississippi School
description: WOODVILLE, Miss., Jan. 5 Annette Brown stood in the rain with her little brother, Tommy, biting her lips and waiting for a bus to take them home from their first day as the only white stu dents in a sprawling, one story public school that has 1,391 black students.

title: U.S. Tuna Boats Fear New Clashes
description: SAN DIEGO, Calif., Jan. 4 The American tuna fleet has put to sea for the start of a new season that seems bound to reopen the United States dispute with South American countries over fishing rights on the high seas in the eastern Pacific.

title: President of Ivory Coast Appoints a New Cabinet
description: ABIDJAN, Ivory Coast, Jan. 5 (Agence France  Presse) President Felix HouphoutBolg ny reorganized his Ivory Coast Government today, naming nine new ministersall of them un der 40 years of age.

title: RENTS PROTESTED IN GARMENT AREA
description: Representatives of small businessmen in the garment industry and the drycleaning trade complained yesterday that rent increases of 100 per cent and more were threatening to drive them from the city.

title: RAIL TONMILEAGE SHOWS 5.1% RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5  Freight traffic on United States railroads in the week ended Dec. 27 was above the corre sponding week of last year, while intercity truck tonnage was below the 1968 figure.

title: France Said to Inform U.S. of Deal With Libya for Capital Goods and Arms
description: PARIS, Jan. 5France is be lieved to have officially in formed the United States and Britain that she is negotiat ing with Libya the sale of arms and capital goods for Libya's economic development.

title: Conductor of Inquest
description: EDGARTOWN, Mass., Jan. 5  Whenever the court docket permits, Judge James A. Boyle, the presiding justice of the Dukes County District Court and holder of two holes  in  one, likes to get away from the red brick courthouse by 1:30 in the afternoon and head for the first tee at the Mink Meadows Golf Club at West Chop. But I for the next few days, weather per mitting or not, the 63yearold judge will be preoccupied as the presiding officer at the in quest into the death of Mary Jo Kopechne. He is aware that the report he will be required to write about his findings will have political and per haps even historical implica tions, involving as it will the activities of Senator Edward M. Kennedy on the night of July 18, 1969.

title: Rates of Bills Register a Decline At Weekly Auction by Treasury
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5  Treasury bill rates declined at today's auction from last week's levels, the Government reported late this afternoon.

title: HIREDCAR OWNERS ADOPT SET OF RULES
description: Adoption of selfpolicing rules by a group of private carfor hire owners banded together since last April as the public Livery Association was an nounced yesterday by Willie Clowers president.

title: Abbado Displays Relaxed Style Conducting the Philadelphians
description: Claudio Abbado was the guest conductor of the Phila delphia Orchestra in its concert in Philharmonic Hall last night. A winner of the Mitropoulos contest seven years ago, he, has appeared here since with the New York Philharmonic and the Metropolitan Opera. Now in his mid30's, he is perma nent conductor at La Scala, and a sign of his increasing success is the frequency with which he turns up on the in ternational orchestral circuit.

title: Pentagon Is Studying Mobile Garage for the Minuteman to Help Missile Survive a Surprise Attack
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6The Defense Department is studying a novel technique that officials say could increase the ability of existing Minuteman missiles to survive a surprise attack.

title: Trudeau Skis in French Alps
description: COURCHEVEL, France, Jan. 6 (Reuters)  The Canadian Prime Minister, Pierre Elliott Trudeau, started his winter sports holiday today with four hours of skiing on the slopes of this resort in the Alps.

title: Lebanese Parliament Meets
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 6 The Lebanese parliament met in secret session tonight after deputies from southern districts demanded immediate action to make their region more secure from Israeli attacks.

title: Haughton Assistant Takes Driver Seat And Wins 2 in Row
description: WESFBURY, L. I., Jan. 6 Billy Haughton, the old master horseman spending the winter training his extensive string in Florida, received a tonguein cheek message tonight from his headquarters here: Don't hur ry back, all is well at Roosevelt Raceway.

title: Namath, Dawson Reported Among Those to Be Called in Gambling Inquiry
description: Joe Namath of the New York Jets and Len Dawson of the Kansas City Chiefs will be asked to appear before a Fed eral grand jury in Detroit in vestigating sports gambling, the National Broadcasting Company reported yesterday.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: FiveDay Forecast
description: (January 8 through January 12)

title: Psychiatrist to Examine Suspect in Coast Slayings
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 6 (UPI) A psychiatrist was appointed today to examine Leslie Van Houten and give a report on her sanity to the lawyer pre paring her defense.

title: ROCKEFELLER TO ASK NEW SAFEGUARDS FOR ENVIRONMENT
description: ALBANY, Jan. 6Governor Rockefeller will ask the Legis lature when it convenes for its 193d session tomorrow to cre ate a new State Department of Environmental Conservation to protect natural resources and combat pollution.

title: SPEEDUP WEIGHED IN TAX COLLECTION
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6  A new tax program that could raise more than $5billion in additional revenue next year through increased taxes on cigarettes, liquor and gasoline and through acceleration of the collection of some other taxes has been proposed by the Treasury Department.

title: Allied Stores Broadens Top Management
description: Theodore Schlesinger, 61 yearold president of the Allied Stores Corporation, was named chairman yesterday of Allied, the country's second largest de partmentstore chain.

title: CITY HEALTH UNITS ASK $844MILLION
description: Health Services Adminis trator Gordon Chase requested $844million yesterday to op erate the city superagency dur ing the coming fiscal year.

title: Kennecott Joins Price Increase For Electrolytic Copper Items
description: Matching similar moves by other producers, the Kennecott Copper Corporation yesterday raised the price for fullplate electrolytic copper cathodes produced and sold in the United States by 4 cents a pound, to 55 cents, effective immediately.

title: Books of The Times
description: OF Susan Sontag, Richard Gilman writes: I think her one of the most interesting and valuable critics we possess, a writer from whom it's continu ally possible to learn, even when you're most dissatisfied with what she's saying, or perhaps especially at those times. Yes. And equally true of Richard Gilman him self, professor of playwriting and criticism at the Yale Drama School, former literary editor of Commonweal and The New Re public, former drama editor of Newsweek. One might (I do) disagree with at least 65 per cent of what he says in The Confusion of Realms, and yet to grapple with ?? perspective is to grapple with one's own flaccid preconceptions; to be roused from torpor for a cultural wrestling match and to find oneself a gastropod pitted against a Viking. What's more, the Viking wears hobnailed boots.

title: HANDSOME RODOLFO TOPS MET'S BOHEME
description: Ion Buzea, a Rumanian who made his Metropolitan Opera debut last night as Rodolfo in La Boheme, is that rare spec imen, a tall tenor. Since he also is romantically dark and handsome, and actor enough to walk across the stage with out arousing anxiety over whether he will fall into the promoter's box, he made an un usually credible figure of Puc cini's dashing poet.

title: SUPERVISORS VOTE RAISE IN NASSAU
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Jan. 6The Nassau County Board of Super visors quietly raised their sal aries yesterday through an emergency measure.

title: Villanova Pilot Resigns; To Coach R. I. Eleven
description: VILLANOVA, Pa., Jan. 6 (AP)Jack Gregory resigned as head football coach at Villanova University ap parently to accept a similar post at the University of Rhode Island.

title: HOSPITAL IS TOLD TO REHIRE NEGRO
description: The City Commission on Hu man Rights directed Einstein Medical College and Lincoln Hospital in the Bronx yesterday to reinstate a Negro social worker who had contended she was being discriminated against because of her race.

title: Chase Selling Unsecured Notes; Earnings Advance at City Bank
description: The Chase Manhattan Cor poration has started to sell commercial paper in an effort to reduce its overall cost of borrowed money.

title: Crealy Beats Schloss
description: HOBART, Tasmania, Jan. 6 (AP) Dick Crealy, the Aus tralian Davis Cup player, fought back to beat Len Schloss of Baltimore, 108, 86, in the sec ond round of the Tasmanian, tennis championships today. Schloss had four set points in the first set.

title: Brown & Williamson Picks Executive Vice Presidents
description: A reorganization of the exec utive structure of Brown & Williamson Tobacco Corpora tion was announced yesterday by Edwin P. Finch, president.

title: Famechon Stops Harada, Keeps Title
description: TOKYO, Jan. 6 (AP)  Johnny Famechon retained his share of the world feath erweight championship to night by knocking out Fight ing Harada at 1 minute 9 sec onds of the 14th round.

title: Rockland Legislature Seated
description: NEW CITY, N. Y., Jan. 6 After 171 years of a County Board of Supervisors govern ment, Rockland County, as a result of the United States Su preme Court's oneman, one vote rule, inaugurated today the 18man legislature it elected in November. John B. Lovett, Orangetown Supervisor was elected chairman of the legisla ture, which the Republicans control by a 144 margin.

title: JOHN HYNES DIES; BOSTON EXMAYOR
description: BOSTON, Jan. 6 (AP)John B??Hynes, Mayor of Boston for 10 years and a former State Banking Commissioner, died to day at Carney Hospital. He was 72 years old.

title: Cancer Center Started
description: BOSTON, Jan. 6 (AP)Ground was broken today in the heart of Boston's largest hospital area for a comprehensive adult can cer center with resources avail able to every doctor in behalf of his patient with cancer.

title: AWARD TO NEWBERG ENDS CHRYSLER SUIT
description: DETROIT, Jan. 6  The ghost of Chrysler Corporation's con flictofinterest scandal a dec ade ago was buried today with the automaker paying $85,000 to a former president. William C. Newberg, and the dropping of all law suits.

title: City's Adaptable Labor Peacemaker
description: IN October, 1942lopg be fore he had traveled over a million miles to arbitrate, to mediate, to factfind and to settle grievous labor dis putes in most of the coun try's major industriesRon ald Waring Haughton was dispatched suddenly one chilly afternoon to East St. Louis, Ill. Assigned by the war Labor Man Board in Wash in the ington to settle a News bitter strike in a munition plant that was interfering with war production, he arrived in town without a clean shirt, without a toothbrush and without a friend.

title: Finance Group Elects
description: The election of Lawrence S. Ritter as president of the American Finance Association was announced yesterday. He is professor of economics and finance of the Graduate School of Business of New York Uni versity, where he has also been chairman of the department of finance since 1962.

title: Taliaferro on Squad
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 6 (AP) Mike Taliaferro, quarterback of the Boston Patriots, was added to the East squad and Len Dawson, quarterback of the Kansas City chiefs, was added to the West squad today for the American Football League AllStar game Jan. 17 in Houston.

title: 3 BOMBS ARE FOUND AT WISCONSIN PLANT
description: MADISON, Wis., Jan. 6An unsuccessful attempt to bomb an Army ammunition plant from a stolen airplane was the latest reported incident in a wave of terrorist attacks on area military and Selective Service installations.

title: Circus Warms Up For Its 100th Edition
description: VENICE, Fla.An old, rather pleasant malaise called circus fever has bro ken out in this lovely town and its environs. The inci dence began on about Dec. 9 when the Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey organiza tion began rehearsing in its headquarters here.

title: Lester Penner, Karen A. Thorn Planning to Wed
description: Miss Karen Ann Thorn, a master's degree candidate in psychiatric nursing at New York University, and Lester S Penner, director of engi neering for the General In strument Corporation in Hicksville, L. I., plan to be married in June.

title: STEPHEN F. NEEDHAM, NEWSPAPER ADMAN
description: NORWALK, Conn., Jan. 6 Stephen F. Needham, who re tired in 1968 as secretary and treasurer of Jann & Kelley, Inc., New York newspaper repre sentatives, died today of pneu monia after a long illness at Norwalk Hospital. He was 78 year old and lived at 12 Bauer Place, Westport.

title: Dartmouth Beats Amherst
description: HANOVER, N. H., Jan. 6 Alex Winn's 28 points and 17 rebounds led the Dartmouth College to a 9366 triumph over Amherst tonight at Alumni Gym. Dave Auten scored 33 fur Amherst.

title: New Housing Chief Would Rebuild Slums to Draw Middle Class
description: Albert A. Walsh, the city's new Housing and Development Administrator, said yesterday that he would pursue a policy aimed at attracting substantial numbers of middleclass resi dentswhite and blackto the impoverished slums within a generation.

title: Organizing the City Council
description: Insurgent members may not succeed today in their effort to oust Democrat Thomas Cuite of Brooklyn as vice chairman and majority leader of the City Council but they already have assured several wel come changes in the way the Council conducts its busi ness. Mr. Cuite has responded to his challengers by promising a number of badly overdue reforms.

title: Donald C. Duvall Is Dead at 54; Led Pittsburgh Steel Concern
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 6Don ald C. Duvall, president of the WheelingPittsburgh Steel Cor poration, died here today. He was 54 years old.

title: Memorial Services
description: FRANKWalter. A memorial service for Walter Frank, who died Dec. 28, 1969, will be held by his friends, at the Society for Ethical Culture, 2 W. 64th St., New York City, on Jan. 8, 1970, at 6 P.M. Algernon Black will preside. The speakers will in clude Roger Baldwin, Judge Jane Bolin, LeRoy Bowman, Osmond K. Fraenkel, Isidore Minkin, Earle K. Moore, and John de H. Pemberton.

title: Corporation Reports
description: The First National City Cor poration, New York's largest banking organization, reported net income for 1969 of $119.4 million, or $4.41 a share, yes terday, up 9.3 per cent from $109million, or $4.08 a share in 1968.

title: ERWIN C. BRUCE
description: NORWALK, Conn., Jan. 6 Erwin C. Bruce, sales manager for the Consolidated Edison Company, died today at his home, 24 Red Coat Road. He was 62 years old.

title: Lunar Churning Surmised From Samples of Rock
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 6  Studies of the cosmic rays and solar particles bombarding the moon led scientists today to theorizes that the lunar surface under goes extensive churning, per haps every 15,000 years, andi may have been enveloped in a weak atmosphere early in its history.

title: Maine Paper Costs 12c
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Jan. 6 (AP) The Daily Kennebec Journal has increased its price to 12 cents a copy at newsstands. It also raised its home delivery rate by 10 cents a week to 75 cents.

title: STOCK PRICES DROP ON LONDON BOARD
description: Prices on the London Stock Exchange declined yesterday, with the fall attributed mainly to a remark by the Chancellor of the Exchequer that there would be no letup in the eco nomic squeeze.

title: Securities Group Elects
description: William B. Denney of Dole, O'Connor & Co., Inc., has been elected president of the Se curities Traders Association of New York. Arthur K. Salomon of Salomon Brothers & Hutzler was elcted first vice president and Paul R. Yednak of Sidney A. Siegel & Co., Inc., is sec ond vice president. Donald E. Williams of Baer Securities Cor poration is secretary and J. Peter Thompson of Paine, Web ber, Jackson & Curtis is treasurer.

title: Jumbo Jet Service Will Start on Jan. 21
description: Jumbo jet service with Boeing 747's will be inaug urated on Jan. 21 by Pan American World Airways, the airline announced yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Power Plant Sites

title: India to Hold a 1,375Mile Rally
description: BOMBAY, IndiaIn the face of India's desperate eco nomic needs, motor sports have a low priority. But whatever the obstacles, a group of enthusiasts here are planning a rugged cross country rally of, they hope, international stature.

title: Heavy Snow Forecast for City as Storm Moves Up the Eastern Seaboard
description: The Weather Bureau issued a heavysnow warning for the metropolitan area yesterday, predicting a fall of up to four inches by about 8 A.M. today.

title: PHONE BONDS SOLD AT REDUCED YIELD
Drop in Enemy Defectors Recorded
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 6Defections by people with connections with the Vietcong were reported to have dropped sharply in De cember, to less than half the number who switched sides in October, a record month.

title: BELL CANADA PLANS A $94MILLION ISSUE
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 6 (Canadian Press)  The Canadian Trans port Commission has author ized Bell Canada, formerly the Bell Telephone Company of Canada, to raise $94million in new funds by an offering of stock coupled with the first pub lic sale of shares in an electron ics industry subsidiary.

title: Court Trustee Suggests R. Hoe Sell a Holding
description: The concern, which also manufactures saws, is under going reorganization.

title: Times Women's News Writer Shares Award for Coverage
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 6 (AP)Rita Reif, women's news writer for The New York Times, and Ruth Wagner, home furnishings edi for of The Washington Post, shared the Dorothy Dawe award for home furnishings news cov erage yesterday.

title: ROCKWELL SHIFTS AEROSPACE UNITS
description: A reshuffling of its aero space and systems organization was announced yesterday by North American Rockwell Cor poration in an effort to strengthen the operating divi sions.

title: GANTRY PREVIEW BARS CITY CRITICS
description: The producers of Gantry, a musical that is omitting a pre Broadway tour, have invited 10 drama critics from Washington, Boston and Philadelphia to at tend any preview for purposes of comment.

title: SOUTH AFRICA TO GET BILL DEFINING DEATH
description: CAPETOWN, Jan. 6  The South African Parliament will, be presented with a bill rede fining the moment of death to remove uncertainty from heart transplants when it reassem bles at the end of this month, it was disclosed today.

title: Stram Calls Robinson Doubtful And Marsalis Probable Starter
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 6 Coach Hank Stram of the Kan sas City Chiefs said today that it was very doubtful that Johnny Robinson, the injured safetyman, would play in the Super Bowl game on Sunday. Robinson suffered rib damage in the game with the Oakland Raiders last Sunday.

title: Brown Quits School Post; Heller Resigns in Dispute
description: Dr. Nathan Brown announced yesterday that he would step down as Acting Superintendent of Schools on March 1 to be come president of a college being established in Israel.

title: CANADIENS HAND KINGS 43 DEFEAT
description: MONTREAL, Jan. 6 (UPI) Jacques Lemaire of Montreal, the National Hockey League's leading goal scorer, tallied his 21st tonight as the Canadiens defeated the Los Angeles Kings, 43, and moved to within a point of the secondplace Boston Bruins in the East Division.

title: God Is Dead Theme Assailed by the Pope
description: ROME, Jan. 6Pope Paul VI challenged today the so called new theology idea that God was dead or could die.

title: M'CARTHY IN SOVIET; HE MAY SEE KOSYGIN
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 6Senator Eugene J. McCarthy arrived today for a fiveday visit. He told newsmen he hoped to see Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin and to talk about EastWest trade.

title: 12 ARE ARRESTED IN FARE PROTESTS
description: Twelve persons were arrested and 24 were served with sum monses yesterday for pushing through subway gates and turn stiles without paying in a day of continuing protests by New Yorkers against the new 30 cent fare.

title: Excerpts From F.B.I. Transcripts of Tapes Released at the De Carlo Trial
description: Following are excerpts of transcripts of electronic recordings made by the Federal Bureau of Investigation from 1961 to 1965. They were made at places frequented by Angelo (Gyp) De Carloidentified as Raywho is defendant with three others in a conspiracyextortion trial now in progress in Federal Court in Newark.

title: Market Place
description: BERNARD GEIS ASSOCI ATES, the publishing com pany that brought you Val ley of the Dolls and The Voyeur, is about to offer piece of publishing pie to the public.

title: City Renamed for Voroshilov
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 6 (Reuters) The Ukrainian city of Lugansk, birthplace of former President Kliment Y. Voroshilov who died last month, has once more been named Voroshilovgrad in his honor. Lugansk was first renamed in honor of Marshal Voroshilov in 1935, but re verted to its old name in 1958 after he had fallen into dis favor under Nikita S. Khru shchev then the Soviet leader.

title: U.S. PRESSES PACTS WITH 3 COUNTRIES IN FIGHT ON HEROIN
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6  White House officials reported today a major diplomatic break through toward cutting off a very large part of the flow of heroin into the United States.

title: MURRAY MILLER, 50, ADMIRALTY LAWYER
description: Murray A. Miller, a special ist in admiralty law, died yes terday in front of 185 Monta gue Street, Brooklyn. He was 50 years old and lived at 7 Copper Beach Place, Merrick, L. I. His office was at 305 Broadway.

title: Jan. 19 Dinner to Aid L.I. Hospital
description: Women invited to the Jan. 19 dinner dance in the Plaza's Terrace Room are turning positively blond with joy for their cause, the Southampton (L. I.) Hospital, which will get four $700 special beds from the evening's sponsor, Roux. The company that makes the hair rinses also is picking up the entire check for the party.

title: Mortgage Offers Hit a Record Level
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6The rise in the interest rate ceiling on Governmentbacked mort gages to 8 per cent produced a recordbreaking flood of offers to sell mortgages at the auction of the Federal National Mortgage Association, the as siciation disclosed today.

title: Coaches' Poll
description: Other teams ??ving 5 ormore points. Pennsylvania, Niagara, Illinois, Louisville, Villanova, Baylor.

title: Faults Termed Merits
description: In her novel, South of the Angels, Jessamyn West tells of Orange County, California, half a century ago. It was a harsh, demanding land where every drop of water, at first, had to be carted in. It was a land that yielded little fruit or pleasure to the Quakers who had come west to settle and could go no farther without dropping into the Pa cific. Yet to Richard M. Nixon, a cousin of Miss West, it must have seemed a free and won derful place, a Hannibal, Mo., transplanted in time and space.

title: PRAGUE BARS TRIP BY JEWISH AUTHOR
description: VIENNA, Jan 6  A leading Czechoslovak author and play wright, Pavel Kohout, notified the literary society of Lucerne, Switzerland, today that he had not been authorized to leave the country to keep a lecture engagement in that city to morrow.

title: Insurer Fills Post
description: Albert L. Lund has been elected a director and a senior vice president of Marsh & Mc Lennan, Inc., insurance brokers and employe benefit consult ants. His primary responsibil ity will be client relationships, account development and new business production.

title: Harsh Criticism of China Resumed by Soviet Press
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 6 Pravda charged today that Communist China had been making un ceasing malicious attacks on the Soviet Union.

title: 30th Version of Ice Capades Glides Into Garden
West, Cunningham, Alcindor Are N.B.A. Scoring Leaders
description: The midway point of the Na tional Basketball Association season finds Jerry West with the best scoring average, Billy Cunningham owning the high est point total and Lew Alcin dor making the most progress. The figures were issued by the N.B.A. yesterday.

title: SOUTH YEMEN PARTY OUSTS 2 EXLEADERS
description: ADEN, Southern Yemen, Jan. 6 The ruling National Libera tion Front party has decided to expel the former President of Southern Yemen, Qahtan al Shaabi, and the former Premier, Faisal AbdulLatif, from mem bership.

title: CHIEF U.S. MEDIATOR TO ENTER G.E. TALKS
description: Secretary of Labor George P. Shultz announced yesterday that J. Curtis Counts, head of the Federal Mediation and Con ciliation Service, would join the efforts to end the strike against General Electric Company.

title: JERSEY TOWNS ASK TO USE MEADOWS
description: HACKENSACK, N. J., Jan. 6 Eight municipalities in the Hackensack Meadows charged today that they would lose mil lions of dollars in revenue if the Hackensack Meadows De velopment Commission's pro posal for a twoyear freeze on commercial development went into effect.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, JANUARY 7, 1970

title: Vietnam Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (UPI) The following servicemen from the New Yorlz area were identified by the Defense De partment today as having been killed in Vietnam:

title: GARY SCHOOLS CLOSE AS TEACHERS STRIKE
description: GARY Ind., Jan. 6The pub lic schools were shut down here today when the 2,200member Gary Teachers Union went on strike.

title: James Felt & Co. Elects President
description: Abram Barkan, executive vice president of James Felt & Co., Inc., realtors, has been named president. He suc ceeds Irwin Baron, who had been president since 1956 and is moving up to chair man of the board.

title: '69 INFILTRATION TO SOUTH VIETNAM IS PUT AT 100,000
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 6Infiltration by North Viet namese into South Vietnam in 1969 totaled 100,000 to 110,000 men or 30,000 to 40,000 fewer than in 1968, according to esti mates by allied officials here.As in 1968, they said, infiltra tion rose at year end from a seasonal low point, but the monthly figures for November and December, 1969, were still reported below the 3,500 and 4,503 figures for November and December, 1968.

title: Lamonica Out of Game
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Jan. 6 (UPI)  The Oakland Raiders' quarterbick, Daryle Lamonica, who suffered damage to a joint in his right wrist in the Ameri can Football League playoffs, withdrew today from the West Squad of the A.F.L. AllStar game.

title: Francis A. Shields Is Fiance Of Mrs. Diana L. Auchincloss
description: Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Boyer Schoen have announced the engagement of Mrs. Schoen's daughter, Mrs. Diana Lippert Auchincloss, to Francis Alex ander Shields.

title: CATLEDGE RETIRES AS TIMES OFFICIAL
description: The retirement of Turner Catledge as a vice president of the New York Times Com pany was announced yesterday by Arthur Ochs Sulzberger, president and publisher.

title: Woodstock Festival Host Sued by Farming Neighbor
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., Jan. 6 (UPI)Max Yasgur, the Sulli van County dairy farmer who was host to the Woodstock Mu sic and Arts Festival last Au gust, has been sued for $35,000 by a neighbor.

title: Train Here Kills Fireman Investigating Track Fire
description: A fireman sent to investi gate a blaze on the Penn Central railroad tracks at Park Avenue near 96th Street last night was killed by a passing train as he was walk ing back to report that the fire was already out.

title: Loyalty Oath for U.S. Employes Abolished After Successful Suit
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6The loyalty oath that the past gen eration of Federal employes has been forced to sign is dead.

title: Two Lawyer Friends of Kennedy Testify at Inquest
description: EDGARTOWN, Mass., Jan. 6  The two men whom Senator Edward M. Kennedy turned to in desperation after the drowning of Mary Jo Kopechne were asked today at a closed inquest to describe their actions on that July, night on Chappaquiddick Island.

title: F.T.C. Is Charging Arden With Antitrust Violation
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (AP) The Federal Trade Commis sion charged a West Coast su permarket chain today with violating antitrust laws by re ceiving brokerage services with out paying for them.

title: Gloria A. Czerniuk Prospective Bride
description: Brig. Gen. Edward J. Czer niuk, U.S.A., retired, and Mrs. Czerniuk of Flushing, Queens, have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Gloria Ann Czerniuk, to Capt. Richard H. Clark, U.S.A., son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph M. Clark of Brooklyn. An Octo ber wedding is planned.

title: Joan Crawford Stars in Unexpected Role: A Model at Millinery Show
description: Do you want me to come and help? Joan Craw ford asked from her seat in the audience. Emme had been explaining that one of her mannequins was missing, felled by the flu. Miss Craw ford whipped off her sable toque, right in the middle of the signature sequence, and headed backstage. Any thing can happen at a mil linery show.

title: Rangers' Neilson Rescues Daughter, Suffers Burns
description: NEW HYDE PARK, L. I., Jan. 6Following the time honored tradition of hockey players, the Rangers turned two neartragedies today into lighthearted jokes as they worked out at Skate land for tomorrow night's game at Pittsburgh.

title: Pull Up the Boulder and Have a Seat
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 6At O'Hare Airport, they're leaving no stone unturned in an effort to find Piero Gilardi's seating arrangement, which had been shipped in for the International Home Furnishing market. But if the seats got separated from their crate, the searchers are in trouble. The seats look just like stonesboulders, in fact. It's a big disappointment for Stendig, the importers, because the polyurethan ottomans might have generated an avalanche of interest at these rela tively quiet wholesale showings which continue through Sat urday. Two years ago, Mr. Gilardi brought in from Italy foam carpeting in three dimensions the garden pattern, for in stance, had foam fruit grow ing where the tufts would be. This year his missing three piece seating set looks like a grouping of rocks  only they're a lot softer and light er. The biggest ottoman is 19 inches high, 27 inches wide and 23 inches deepbefore it's sat on and the air is squooshed out.

title: REDEMPTIONS TOP NEW SAVINGS BONDS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (UPI) The Treasury reported today that redemptions of United States savings bonds in 1969 exceeded purchases by $724 million as rising interest rates prompted Americans to shift their savings to other invest ments.

title: CHOIR OF TEMPLE U. EXCELS ON CLASSICS
description: When the Temple University Concert Choir of Philadelphia sings motets by Palestrina and Victoria, Johann Pachelbel's Nun danket alle Gott and Charles Pachiebel's Magnificat, it sounds like a mature choral ensemble of remarkable preci sion, finesse and artistry, When the same group gets into an ap palling arrangement of Say, now ye lovely social band and is on the way to They Call the Wind Maria, it sounds like any college glee club singing junk.

title: KATHARINE S. HALL
description: FALL RIVER, Mass., Jan. 6 Katharine Stanley Hall, daugh ter of the Rev. Dr. Charles Cuthbert Hall, former president of the Union Theological Semi nary, died yesterday at Trues dale Hospital here after a long illness. Miss Hall was 83 years old and lived at Westport Point, Mass. She graduated from Well esley College.

title: In This Corner, Cassius Clay, the Author
description: Cassius Clay, deposed heavweight champion, Black Muslim, actor, singer, televi sion personality and publicity man extraordinary, yester day unveiled his latest incar nation: author.

title: Executive Changes
description: Lloyd Burns has been appointed executive vice president of Screen Gems, succeeding John H. Mitch ell, who was recently named president of the com pany, which is the television production and distri bution division of Columbia Pictures Industries.

title: PRICES DECLINE IN AMEX TRADING
description: Prices declined for the first time in five sessions yesterday on the American Stock Ex chanee on lower volume.

title: Bridge:
description: THE simplest form of dupli cate organization is that required by a headtohead team match. All that is nec essary is to insure that the players are seated correctly and that the boards are inter changed between the two tables.

title: Brown's Trial Postponed
description: BELAIR, Md., Jan. 6 (UPI)  The conspiracy trial of H. Rap Brown was postponed for the second time today, until March 2 at the request of his attorney, William M. Kunstler. The defendant is accused of conspiracy to arson and riot in connection with a disturbance and series of fires in Cam bridge, Md., in July, 1967.

title: Knicks Put On FourthQuarter Drive and Triumph Over Bullets, 129 to 99
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 6Pre scription for a New York Knickerbocker basketball team ailing and in a slump: Go to Baltimore.

title: Hofstra Wrestlers Win
description: Fred Kemp and Bill Stauffer led Hofstra's wrestling team to a 2810 victory over Columbia last night in the Lions' gymna sium. Mike Quinn and George Klosko were the only two win ners for Columbia.

title: U.S. Concedes Foe Hit Base
description: SAIGON, South. Vietnam, Jan. 6  An enemy attack that American information officers here first depicted as an as sault on a temporary night en campment of United States Ma rines was revealed today to have been a savage North Vietnamese assault on a heavily fortified Marine battalion head quarters.

title: John Bacon 3d, Miss Crisona Plan to Marry
description: State Supreme Court Jus tice James J. Crisona and Mrs. Crisona have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Cynthia Peys son Crisona, to John A. Bacon 3d, a stockbroker with Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith.

title: Theater: Play About Erie Is OffTrack Too Often
description: THE play, Instructions for the Running of Trains, Etc. on the Erie Railway, to go into Effect January 1, 1862, which opened last night at the Sheridan Square Playhouse, is an earnest, edu cational, and at times enter taining experiment in im provisational theater. But it create a successful evening nor freeform enough to create a successful evening.

title: Edgartown, Mass.: The Strange Case of Senator Kennedy
description: EDGARTOWN, Mass., Jan. 6 Senator Edward Kennedy be gins to look like a man who is finally recovering from a long illness. The visible edgi ness of last summer is gone. He now seems a little more solid, a little more composed, and a little more patient with the crowds that still point and mutter as he goes by.

title: U. S. PLANS FIGHT ON PATENT CURBS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6In auguration of a new, coordi nated attack on violations of the antitrust laws through il legally restrictive patent agree ments was announced today by the Justice Department. A new Patent Unit has been formed within the Antitrust Division to handle all cases involving il legally restrictive practices in the licensing of patents and technology.

title: TRANSPORT NOTES: TRAIN BIDS BACKED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (AP) Federal authorities will per mit New York and Connecticut to advertise for bids for 144 new railroad cars for the New Haven division of the Penn Central, Representative Lowell P. Weicker Jr. said today.

title: Foreign Affairs: Keep Your Head Down, Sammy Boy
description: PARISThe greatest success of the Nixon Administration as it closed out 1969 may conceiv ably have been defusing the Vietnamese war. Past predic tions on this intricate problem have been proven wrong by future events but present au guries seem modestly hopeful.

title: Radio
Foes of War Plan Taxpayer Rallies on April 15 and Aid to Political Candidates
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6The Vietnam Moratorium Commit tee announced today that it would sponsor nationwide tax payer rallies on April 15 and would start a campaign service to help political candidates op posed to the war.

title: French Mergers Set Records In Face of U.S. TakeOver Trend
description: PARIS, Jan. 6France is go ing through the greatest merger wave in her history as she strives for more efficient in dustrial production in an era of giant international corn panies.

title: Tova League Will Sell Art
description: An art sale and a tour of the town house art gallery of Valdis Kupris at 437 West 24th Street has been planned by the Tova League, an affiliate of the Women's Divi sion of United Cerebral Palsy of New York, for Sunday, Jan. 18.

title: 3 Astronauts Grounded For Violating Air Rules
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 6 (AP) Three astronauts, including Navy Capt. Alan L. Bean, a member of the Apollo 12 crew, have been grounded for violating flying regu lations.

title: NIXON AIDE URGES MONETARY EASING
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 Secretary of Labor George P. Shultz became today the first member of the Nixon Adminis tration to say openly that the Federal Reserve Board should move now to relax somewhat its extremely restrictive mone tary police.

title: Two Billion for Poverty ...
description: The high cost of poverty to every New Yorker is reflected in the budget request of nearly $2 billion submitted by Human Resources Administrator Mitchell I. Ginsberg an increase of 16 per cent over the allot ment for the present fiscal year.

title: F.B.I. Lists a New Fugitive
description: WASHINGTON, Jan 6 (AP) The Federal Bureau of Inves tigation said today that it had placed the name of James John Byrnes, a 41yearold escaped convict wanted for two kidnappings and airplane theft, on its list of 10 most wanted fugitives. Byrnes, who is 6 feet, 3 inches tall, with a slender build, blue eyes and brown hair, escaped with an other prisoner from a jail in Kansas last September.

title: ...and $1.85 for Working Poor
description: Governor Rockefeller's plan to ask the State Legis lature to raise the state's minimum hourly wage from $1.60 to $1.85 represents a realistic effort to shore up the earnings of those hardest hit by the upsurge in living costs.

title: Collins, Former Astronaut, Sworn In as State Department Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 Mi chael Collins, the astronaut, be came a diplomat today, taking the oath of office as Assistant Secretary of State for Public Affairs and promising to bring the State Department and the American public closer together.

title: Dance: Crises Revived
description: MERCE CUNNINGHAM is a nice guy to watch but a difficult man to write about. His dances are celebrations, or less often admonitions. His dancers are like stars ex ploding in a still night air. They are serene. Even their energy seems secure.

title: In Memoriam
description: KEMBLEWilliam. Lovely memories of one we hold so dear. Daughters Viola & Mildred.

title: 3 PANTHERS SNUB HAMPTON INQUEST
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 6The first three Black Panther witnesses before a blue  ribbon coroner's panel investigating the death of Fred Hampton refused today to answer any questions and walked out of the opening day of the inguest.

title: Altman's Imports Bossa Nova Beat
description: THERE'S an awful lot of Brazil at B. Altman's. First there's coffee, natural ly. It can be boughtor sampledalong with other Brazilian delicacies, on the main floor. And then you have Brazilian luggage, and scarves, and purses, and jewelry, and handkerchiefs, and wood sculp turesand men's and women's fashions that re flect the mood and color of Rio at carnival time. It's all part of the store's Carnaval Do Brasil, a selling festival that will continue through the month of January.

title: JIM WALTER CORP. RAISES EARNINGS
description: Despite the drop in national housing starts and pressures from tight money and rising costs, the Jim Walter Corpora tion lifted sales and earnings in the quarter ended Nov. 30 over the preceding year's peri od, according to the report is sued yesterday.

title: SHIPPING/MAIL
description: ALL HOURS GIVEN IN EASTERN STANDARD TIME

title: HARMAN ANFANGER OF MOUNT SINAI, 59
description: WHITE PLAINS, Jan. 6 Dr. Herman Antangcr, associ ate attending pediatrician at Mount Sinai Hospital in New Yonk, died last night of leuke Hi at the hospital. He was 59, gears old and lived at 177 Hillair Circle here.

title: Advertising
description: At Compton Advertising yesterday morning, Barton A. Cummings relinquished the chief executive title he car ried proudly for 14 years to C. Stuart Mitchell, 24 years with the agency.

title: NEW TAPES BY F.B.I. LINK POLITICIANS TO JERSEY MAFIA
description: NEWARK, Jan. 6Boasts by members of the Mafia of deal ings with major political figures and law enforcement officials were disclosed today in the con spiracyextortion trial in Fed eral Court here of Angelo (Gyp) De Carlo and three other de fendants.

title: Daley Is Curbed as Chicago 7's Witness
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 6  Mayor Richard J. Daley spent about three hours on the witness stand in the Chicago con spiracy trial today but uttered only a few hundred words.

title: Parents and Teachers Score Double Sessions
description: Parents and teachers of Public School 81 in ??lyn blocked traffic at DeKalb and Stuyvesant Avenues for four hours yesterday and threat ened to demonstrate there again today to head off an impending switchover to dou ble sessions at the over crowded school.

title: Gulf & Western Acquires 10% of Cone Mills Stock
description: Gulf & Western Industries, Inc., has purchased almost 10 per cent of the outstanding stock of the Cone Mills Cor poration, a major textile pro ducer, over the last 12 months.

title: Fanny May Reports a Record For Offers to Sell Mortgages
Florida Names Coach's Aide
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Jan. (UPI)Gene Ellenson, a defen sive coach of the Florida foot ball team, was appointed execu tive assistant to the athletic director, Ray Graves, today.

title: Gifts Large And Small Aid Neediest
description: A onedollar bill, 37 cents, $1.25, $1.84, $5 and 75 cents were among the contributions recorded yesterday by the 58th annual appeal of the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: 3 COPTERS DOWNED BY ENEMY IN CLASH
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Jan. 7, (Reuters) Vietcong gunners shot down three American helicopters yes terday in a new outbreak of fighting near Danang. There were no casualties.

title: Morgenthau Honors Crew of Ship Named for Father
description: Robert M, Morgenthau, who is scheduled to become Dep uty Mayor, performed a sen timental gesture yesterday in memory of his father.

title: DODD WILL SEEK 3D SENATE TERM
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 6Senator Thomas J. Dodd, who was cen sured by the United States Senate in 1967 for diverting to his personal use funds raised at political testimonial dinners, announced today that he would be a candidate for renomina tion to a third term at the Democratic state convention here June 26 and 27.

title: U.S. Yawl Shares Lead In Hobart to Auckland Race
description: HOBART, Tasmania, Jan. 6 (AP)The American yawl Salty Tiger, owned and skippered by Jack Powell of St. Petersburg, Fla., shared the lead today with Fidelis of New Zealand in the Hobart to Auckland, New Zea land, yacht race.

title: DR. RUBY KENNEDY
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., Jan. 6 Dr Ruby In Reese Kennedy, ch:airrnan of the sociology de partment at Connecticut College died yesterday in her home at Waterford. She had specialized in studies of mental retardation.

title: Popular Music Linked To Rising Use of Drugs
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 6 An article in the latest issue of The United Nations Bulletin on Narcot ics, covering the last three months of 1969, says that popular songs and those who sing them are possible causes of spreading drug addiction.

title: Job Loss Laid to Backing Young Lords
description: One of the city's trouble shooters in community prob lems said yesterday that he had been removed from his job after announcing his support of the aims of a militant Puerto Rican group occupying an East Har lem church.

title: 2 Panels Are Set Up to Counter Threat of Community Disputes
description: With guiding boards of notables and the blessing of Mayor Lindsay, two new organizations got under way yesterday as twin efforts to counter growing threats of dis ruption to society from community  as distinct from labor  disputes.

title: Iyy Presidents Back Yale in N.C.A.A. Dispute
description: The presidents of the eight Ivy League institutions en dorsed unanimously yesterday the action of Yale, in allowing Jack Langer to play college basketball in defiance of rul ings by the Eastern College Athletic Conference and the National Collegiate Athletic As sociation.

title: Trading Reported For 98 Subscribers By Autex Service
description: The Autex Service Corpora tion, a computerized block trading concern, has signed up 64 institutions and 34 broker age houses, including three of Wall Street's leading block trading firms.

title: Moon Soil Indicates Clue to Life Origin
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 6The con troversial idea that organic substances falling frorn the heavens helped to provide the starting material for the origin of life has been considerably strengthened by the analysis of lunar soil.

title: Dutch Report Asks Celibacy Be Left Up to Each Priest
description: NOORDWIJKERHOUT, the Netherlands, Jan. 6 (Reuters) Abolition of mandatory celiba cy for Roman Catholic priests and a greater role for women in church work was strongly recommended in a Dutch eccle siastical report published today.

title: ISRAEL AND EGYPT RENEW AIR RAIDS
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 6In re newed air action today, Israeli jets struck targets in Lebanon and the United Arab Republic, and Egyptian aircraft attacked the Israelioccupied Sinai Pen insula.

title: Negro Executives Oppose Brimmer On Capitalism View
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (AP)  Eight Negro businessmen today challenged the position of Andrew F. Brimrner of the Federal Reserve Board on black canitalism.

title: NewCar Sales Fell as Old Year Waned
description: DETROIT, Jan. 6Last month marked the coldest December for the United States auto mobile industry in seven years.

title: Ramos Agrees to Title Bout
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 6 (UPI)  Mando Ramos, the world lightweight boxing champion, agreed today to defend his title March 3 against Ismael Laguna here at the Sports Arena. Ramos, whose license was sus pended Nov. 13 by the State Athletic Commission after he was arrested on a charge of possession of marijuana, is scheduled to go to trial Feb. 2. In California, all boxers' li censes expire at the end of each year. If he is exonerated in court, Ramos is expected to reapply for a license Feb. 6 at a meeting of the commission.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Margaret Halstead Mason, Soprano With Met in '30's
description: Mrs. Margaret Halstead Mason, a dramatic soprano who made her debut with the Metropoli tan Opera Company in 1932, died yesterday at St. Luke's Hospital. The wife of Anthony T. Mason, she was 66 years old and lived at 419 East 57th Street.

title: Milford James Baker, 74, Dies; ExOfficer of Young & Rubicam
description: DARIEN, Conn., Jan. 6 Milford James Baker, who re tired in 1961 as a vice pres ident and manager of the con tact department of Young & Rubicam, Inc., the advertis ing agency, died Monday at Stamford Hospital. He was 74 years old and lived at 2 May wood Road here.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: Westminster Draws 2,618 Dogs, Failing to Reach Goal of 3,000
description: Entries for the 94th West minster Kennel Club show at Madison Square Garden Feb. 9 and 10 closed yesterday with 2,618 dogs representing 121 breeds and varieties. Although the limit of 3,000 was not reached, this will be the largest entry for America's most pres tigious show in 25 years.

title: U.S. AGAIN QUERIES PARIS ON LIBYA DEAL
description: PARIS, Jan. 6 (Reuters) Ambassador Sargent Shriver met for an hour today with Foreign Minister Maurice Schu mann as reliable sources said that the United States had been consulting with the French on their negotiations with Libya on a possible arms deal.

title: Lacey Charges De Carlo With Terror in Extortion
description: NEWARK, Jan. 6In a heav ily guarded courtroom, which no one was permitted to enter without passing through an electronic firearms detector, the Government opened its con spiracy and extortion case against a reputed Mafia figure, Angelo (Gyp) De Carlo, and three other men today.

title: I.0.S. Is Seeking Details Of Charges Made in Athens
description: GENEVA, Jan. 6 (Reuters) Investors Overseas Services (I.O.S.), the Genevabased mu tual funds operation, said to day that it was seeking full and precise details of reports that the Athens public prosecu tor had opened an investiga tion into I.O.S. activities in Greece.

title: Leftist Protest Mars Agnew's Arrival in Kabul
description: KABUL, Afghanistan, Jan. 6 (Reuters)A brief outburst by leftwing students marred an otherwise friendly welcome to day for Vice President Agnew, who arrived here for a 19hour visit on his 11nation tour of Asia.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Announcements of deaths, marriages, births and engagements may be tele phoned to Oxford 53311 until 11 P.M. in suburban offices. 9:00 A.M. to 4:30 P.M. Monday through Friday Newark (201) Market 33900; White Plains (914) White Plains 95300: Hempstead (516) Ivanhoe 36660: Commack (516) 5435400: Stamford (203) 3187767.

title: Missussippi Blacks Scoff at Whites' Plans for Schools
description: JACKSON, Miss., Jan. 6 Many of Mississippi's principal, black activists chose to stand on the sidelines as the Federal Government began yesterday an attempt to desegregate some 30 Mississippi state school dis tricts.

title: Amer. Basketball Ass'n
The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Country Friend Triumphs At Tropical by 3 Lengths
description: CORAL GABLES, Fla., Jan. 6 (UPI)Circle M's Country Fiend scored a threelength vic tory today in Tropical Park's featured $5,000 allowance race.

title: New President Elected By James Felt & Co.
description: Abram Barkan, executive vice president of James Felt & Co., Inc., realtors, has been named president. He suc ceeds Irwin Baron, who had and is moving up to chair man of the board.

title: Buck Foundation Denied License By Pennsylvania to Seek Funds
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Jan. 6 Pennsylvania denied the scan dalplagued Pearl S. Buck Foundation tonight a license to solicit funds to aid Amerasian children.

title: Jeanne Carnevale to Be Wed To David C. Taylor in May
description: NORWOOD, N. J., Jan. 6 Mr. and Mrs. Bernard L. Car nevale have made known the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Jeanne Carnevale, to David Christopher Taylor. He is the son of Paul E. Taylor of Overbrook, Phila delphia, and the late Mrs. Taylor. A wedding in May is planned.

title: Bowie Cancels Today's Card; Secret Landing 7Length Victor
description: BOWIE, Md., Jan. 6 (AP) Bowie Race Course, faced with an overnight snowstorm, called off tomorrow's ninerace pro gram and said the same card would be scheduled for Thurs day.

title: Draft Boards Up to No. 30 In First Month of Lottery
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6Draft boards, under instructions from the national Selective Service System headquarters, are not inducting anyone into the military in January whose lottery number is above 30.

title: Passenger Thwarts Plane Hijacking
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Jan. 6 (UPI)A man who has been charged with threatening the life of President Nixon tried to day to hijack a Delta Air Lines jet but was overpowered by a slightly built businessman.

title: Leasco Adds Subsidiary
description: The Leasco Data Processing Equipment Corporation an nounced yesterday the forma tion of a new subsidiary, the Leasco Systems Corporation, to offer computer services on a specialized basis to various industries. Robert E. King, vice president for computer services at the parent company, will be president of the new subsidiary, which will have its headquar ters in Chicago.

title: LARRY M'CANCE
description: Larry McCance, a Canadian repmentative of the Actors Equity. Association, died in Toronto Saturday at the age of 52. He was one of the foun ders of Theater Under the Stars, a radio program.

title: Saperstein Foresaw His Murder In Letter to F.B.I. a Day Earlier
description: NEWARK, Jan. 6 (AP)The day before he died of arsenic poisbning, Louis B. Saperstein wrote to the Federal Bureau of Investigation that he feared he would be murdered unless he paid $115,000 to a reputed Mafia figure.

title: STOCK PRICES SLIP ON PROFIT TAKING
Nixon Friends Seek TV License In Miami Held by News Group
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 A group including close friends and a former business associate of President Nixon has applied to take control of Miami's tele vision Channel 10 from Post Newsweek Stations, Inc.

title: ALCINDOR PICKED ON ALLSTAR TEAM
description: Lew Alcindor of the Milwau kee Bucks was the only rookie on the eightman Eastern Divi sion squad selected yesterday to meet the West in the Na tional Basketball Association's AllStar game Jan. 20 in Phila delphia.

title: Bronfman New Chairman Of Sagittarius Productions
description: Edgar M. Broniman, president of Joseph E. Seagram & Sons and former board chairman of MetroGoldwynMayer, Inc., has been elected chairman of Sagit tarius Productions, Inc., a com pany based here that produces feature motion pictures for the atrical distribution and operates two music subsidiaries, the Centaur Publishing Corporation and the Bow Man Music Cor poration.

title: A Federal Panel Urges Research On Heart Transplant Rejection
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6  If the main bar to success in transplanting the human heart is solved there might be as many as 12,000 such operations a year in the United States, according to a Government re port.

title: Bridal Planned By Miss Barry
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Jan. 6 Mr. and Mrs. William K. Barry of Stamford, formerly of Darien, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Deborah Ann Barry, to John Gano Prentice, son of Dr. and Mrs. Stanley E. Prentice of Tenafy and Mantoloking, N. J.

title: Met Will Raise Ticket Prices With Further Losses Expected
description: Officials of the Metropolitan Opera Association, anticipating annual deficits of more than $6million after the recent labor settlement, said yesterday that they would have to raise ticket prices next season. The amount was not specified.

title: Peking Rebuffs Extreme Leftists on Building Party
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 6Peking appears to have dealt a severe blow to the aspirations of ex treme leftists who continue to advocate violent upheavals.

title: South's New White Schools May Face a U. S. Tax Move
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 Robert H. Finch, Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, said today that there was a move, which he supports, with in the Administration to end tax exemptions for private schools set up to avoid desegregation in public schools.

title: Catholic Official in Denver Resigns From Priesthood
