description: DENVER, Jan. 6 (AP) The Rev. John E. Cotter, chancellor of the Roman Catholic Arch diocese of Denver, has resigned from the priesthood, the arch diocese announced today.

title: Kreiss Scores Upset
description: BLOEMFONTEIN, South Af rica, Jan. 6 (AP)Mike Kreiss of Beverly Hills, Calif., upset seventhseeded Fred Hemmes of the Netherlands, 61, 61, in the third round of the Free State tennis championships to day.

title: RALLY BY ROYALS TOPS SUNS, 128124
description: CINCINNATI, Jan. 6 (UPI) The Cincinnati Royals rallied from 15 points behind in the second half tonight and beat the Phoenix Suns, 128124.

title: Sports of
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 6This was a day that had to make the Minnesota Vikings feel perfectly at home. It was raw, cold and miserable. As the Kansas City Chiefs began preparations today for Sunday's collision with the Vikes in the Super Bowl, their manifest distaste for the lousy weather was obvious to a shivering handful of expert observers. But one Chief gloried in it.

title: Big 4 Meet on Mideast
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 6Representatives of the Big Four  United States, Britain, France and the Soviet Unionconferred this morning on preparatory work to find solution to the Middle East conflict. No statement was is sued at the end of the meeting, at the Soviet mission, except that the representatives would meet again Thursday.

title: De Carlo Finds Judges Lenient to Drug Dealers
description: Angelo (Gyp) De Carlo, the underworld figure whose con versations were made public yesterday, told his friends in one of those conversations that judges were too lenient with narcotics dealers.

title: Reagan Stresses Pollution Fight in Annual Report to Legislature
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Jan. 6 Gov. Ronald Reagan added his voice today to the chorus warning that damage to air and water and the land may soon make life difficult if not intolerable in some sections of California.

title: Reports of the Arrival of OutofTown Buyers in New York
Twins Send Miller to Indians To Complete Earlier Trade
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Jan. 6 (UPI)The Minnesota Twins named a pitcher, Bob Miller, as the fourth player today in forfortwoman trade with the Cleveland Indians.

title: You Asked for This ... And You've Got It
description: I make the decisions about how material will be released. You asked for this material, and you've got it.

title: DAVIS CUP PARLEY IS URGED ON U.S.
description: LONDON, Jan. 6 (UPI)The International Lawn Tennis Fed eration has suggested that the United States, as holder of the Davis Cup, call an emergency meeting of cup nations, to settle the question of the entry of South Africa and Rhodesia, au thoritative sources said today.

title: Graham Hill Quits Lotus
description: LONDON, Jan. 6 (UPI) Graham Hill of Britain, unable to walk without crutches since an accident in the United States grand prix last year, said today he was leaving the Lotus works team to drive for the Bob Walker stable. His physicians expect him to be able to drive in October.

title: Many Lament a Changing Greenwich
description: GREENWICH. Conn.. Jan. 6John N. Bird, the princi pal of Greenwich High School sat deep in his chair. Not quite directly above him, a chunk of plaster was miss ing from the ceiling.

title: Western White House's Cost Is $250,000, With $100,000 Annual Expense
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 6President Nixon's Western White House has already cost the taxpayers $250,000 in fixed installation expenses and is like ly to cost them about $100,000 to operate each year Mr. Nixon remains in office.

title: LITTLE HOPE IS SEEN IN MINDSZENTY CASE
description: ROME, Jan. 6The case of Jozsef Cardinal Mindszenty, the primate of Hungary, who has been in political asylum for 13 years in the United States Em bassy in Budapest, is practi cally insoluble, according to Franz Cardinal Kiinig, Arch bishon of Vienna.

title: Farmer Royal Suite at English Depot Is Happy if Chilly Home
description: WOLFERTON, England, Jan. 6The big clock in the little railroad station here says 7:25, and it probably al ways will. But this village station in Norfolk, unlike. hundreds of others in Britain that have also recently been shut, has a new life.

title: Storefront Postal Academies Planned by U.S. for Dropouts
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6The Nixon Administration unveiled today a pilot program to op erate storefront postal acad emies that would utilize post al employes and resources to give high school dropouts re medial education, counseling and parttime postal jobs.

title: Death of a Miner
description: Violence is part of the tradition of mine unionism, and it was no secret to Joseph Yablonski, a man as rugged as the coal, that death might be the price of his challenge to the leadership of the United Mine Workers.

title: Eisenbud Aide Also Leaves
description: Two top officials have re signed from the Environmental Protection Administration amid charges of internecine warfare in the superagency.

title: COMMODITY PRICES REPORTED FOR WEEK
Kapp Takes Speaking Role: Namath's
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 6Just as Joe Namath had the leading role in last year's Super Bowl buildup, Joe Kapp is center stage this time.

title: The Idea Was to Gain Insight Into the Racial Crisis in U.S
description: TWENTYFIVE housewives ranging from suburban swinger to bluishhaired ma triarch paid $15 apiece to confront the racial crisis yes terday in the woodpaneled library of an Upper East Side mansion.

title: Union Reward Offer
description: CLARKSVILLE, Pa., Jan. 6 The United Mine Workers of America, accused by the family of Joseph A. Yablonski of com plicity in his murder and that of his wife and daughter here, will offer a substantial re wardperhaps $100,000  for the apprehension and convic tion of their killers, union sources said today.

title: 100 BATTLE FLAMES AT SKYSCRAPER SITE
description: A threealarm fire swept through the second floor of an officebuilding construction site opposite Lincoln Center yester day.

title: EXOILER OFFICIAL IS HIRED BY COLTS
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 6 (AP) The Baltimore Colts revamped their front office and prepared for their move into the National Football League's American Conference today by hiring Don Klosterman as general man ager.

title: Former Governor Of West Virginia And 31 Indicted
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Jan. 6A grand jury in Kanawha County indicted former Gov. W. W. Barron, two state offi cials and several former offi cials today on charges of brib ery and conspiracy in the han dling of state business.

title: Orr, With 56 Points, Paces Scoring Leaders in N.H.L.
description: Bobby Orr of the Boston Bruins could become the first defenseman to win a scoring title in the 53year history of the National Hockey League.

title: Revised Soviet Party History Is Published
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 6The So viet Union has published a new history of the Communist party after lastminute revisions to soften criticism of Communist China and to improve slightly Stalin's image as a Soviet leader.

title: Miss Jacot Captures Cup Special Slalom
description: GRINDELWALD, Switzer land, Jan. 6 (AP)  Michle Jacot of France led a teen age one, two, three sweep of a thrilling World Cup special slalom race today. Less than fivetenths of a second sepa rated the top five.

title: Strike Call Issued
description: MONONGAH, W. Va., Jan. 6 (AP)A strike call for West Virginia's northern coal fields was issued at a rally of Marion County miners here tonight, a spokesman for the group said.

title: Women's Group Urges Network To Take Ads Off Children's TV
description: The women from Boston are active crusaders advocating drastic changes in the concepts of children's programing by commercial television. They wrote letters to the three net works asking that they be al lowed to present their ideas.

title: Purdue Sinks Wisconsin, 9074
description: LAFAYETTE, Ind., Jan. 6 (UPI)  Rick Mount scored 36 points to lead Purdue to a 9074 Big Ten basketball victory over Wisconsin tonight, extending the Boilermakers' home court winning streak to 26 games.

title: Japan's Police Keep Eye on Rightists
description: TOKYOAll it would take is one pistol shot killing one important politician and the right wing would again be a dangerously significant factor in Japan, said Sadakazu Araki.

title: High and Lows
description: TUESDAY, JAN. 6, 1970

title: EAST GERMAN TAKES OVERALL SKI TITLE
description: BISCHOFSHOFEN, Austria, Jan. 6 (AP) Jiri Raska of Czechoslovakia won the final contest of the fourhill ski jumping tournament today, but the overall championship went to Horst Queck of East Ger many.

title: Yarborough Gets Challenger
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Jan. 6For Representative Lloyd M. Bentsen Jr. announced his can didacy today for the Demo cratic nomination for Senator. He will oppose the incumbent, Ralph W. Yarborough, in the May 2 primary.

title: Sun and Moon
description: The sun rises at 7:20 A.M., sets at 4:45 P.M. and will rise tomorrow at 7:20 A.M.

title: Argentine City Digs Out After 25 Die in Flood
description: MENDOZA, Argentina, Jan. 6 (Reuters)This city in the foothills of the Andes today was clearing away masses of mud and slime left Sunday night by floodwaters that killed 25 persons, at least nine of them children.

title: Fishing in Troubled Waters
description: An American tuna fleet has set sail from San Diego to fish in troubled waters off the west coast of South America, raising storm signals for possible damaging new conflicts between the United States and several Latin governments.

title: TARKENTON ADDED TO EAST PRO TEAM
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 6 (AP) Fran Tarkenton of the New York Giants was named today as a quarterback for the East in the annual National Football League Pro Bowl game Jan. 18.

title: JAPAN HINTS CURB ON TEXTILE TALKS
description: TOKYO, Jan. 6 (Reuters) Japan warned today that she would not resume talks on re stricting her textile exports to the United States unless Wash ington presented a proposal that took the Japanese view point into account.

title: E. F. Hutton & Co. Names 2 to Major Executive Posts
description: E. F. Hutton & Co., one of the nation's largest brokerage houses, announced two major executive changes yesterday. It said John S. R. Shad has been elected executive vice president and Peter M. Detwiler had been named a senior vice president.

title: Mitchell Orders F.B.I. to Join Inquiry Into Yablonski Slayings
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6At torney General John N. Mitchell ordered the Federal Bureau of Investigation today to actively enter the investigation concern ing the death of Joseph A. Ya blonski, his wife and his daugh ter. He acted under the Lan drum Griffin Act, which grants Federal protection in union elections.

title: Leaderless School System
description: The decision of Dr. Nathan Brown to resign as Acting Superintendent of Schools at the end of next month leaves the city school system in a precarious position at a time of uncertainty and change. As the system's second in command, Dr. Brown agreed to fill in tem porarily when Superintendent Bernard E. Donovan stepped down last year.

title: PRICE FOR SILVER RISES AT AUCTION
description: The Government got higher prices for silver at its weekly silver auction yesterday, but the price of silver futures on the Commodity Exchange, Inc., fell a few cents an ounce. In other words, silver in the two markets was showing a split personality yesterday.

title: HARVARD VICTOR OVER NAVY, 9273
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 6 A sophomore forward, Brian Newmark, racked up 25 points and hauled down 12 rebounds to lead Harvard to a 9273 vic tory over Navy today. It was the Cantabs first triumph in history over the middies after 11 straight defeats.

title: Hijacker With Toy Gun Surrenders in Spain
description: SARAGOSSA, Spain, Thurs day, Jan. 8 (Reuters)An 18 yearold Spaniard gave him self up to the police today after hijacking a passenger plane in midair with a toy plastic pistol, airport officials said.

title: CITY PANEL BACKS RENEWAL PROJECT
description: The Cooper Square urban renewal plan, under discussion for 10 years, was approved yesterday by the City Planning Commission.

title: Chapman Plans to Whip in Tight Race
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Jan. 7 Sitting on the edge of a chair, John Chapman thrust bent arms forward and struck a pose of exaggerated driver stiffness.

title: British Newsman Ordered To Leave Czechoslovakia
description: VIENNA, Jan. 7The Czech oslovak Foreign Ministry to day told a British correspon dent, Kenneth Ames, of the Economist, that his visa would not be renewed and ordered him to leave Czechoslovakia by tomorrow.

title: Job Outlook Called Rosy; Goals Urged for Economy
description: A generally rosy view of the employment outlook for the nineteenseventies was outlined yesterday in a speech here by a Nixon Ad ministration official.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: F.B.I. Studies 3 Bombs
description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 7 (UPI) The Federal Bureau of Investi gation said today that it was investigating three bomblike devices found at the Badger Army Ammunition Plant near Baraboo. Certain objects were found, but I can't reveal exact ly what, said Edward J. Hayes, special agent in charge of the Milwaukee F.B.I. office.

title: Community Peacemakers
description: The selection of Ronald W. Haughton to head the new Board or Mediation for Community Disputes pro vides a basis for hope that it can help defuse social tensions in this city. The usefulness of such an agency has already been demonstrated on a national basis by the Center for Dispute Settlement established over a year ago by the American Arbitration Association.

title: Inquirer Names Executive
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 7 (UPI) Mordecai Persky, 38 years old, an assistant managing editor of The Detroit Free Press, was appointed today as sistant to the executive editor of The Philadelphia Inquirer. Mr. Persky began his newspa per career in 1953 with The Augusta (Ga.) Herald, later joining The Atlanta Constitu tion, The Miami Herald, The New York Herald Tribune and The Free Press.

title: Facade of Amity in the Legislature
description: ALBANY, Jan. 7Democrats and Republicans indulged in their annual ritual of ceremo nial amity today at the opening of the legislative session, vow ing to work together for the good of the people of New York State.

title: St. Francis Routs Queens
description: Led by Jon Conforti's 24 points, St. Francis routed Queens College, 9563, last night for its sixth victory in seven starts. Queens suffered its seventh setback in 13 games.

title: Executive Changes
description: Anthony A. Barnett has been named executive vice president of the BunkerRamo Corporation's business and industry division, Stamford, Conn. He is succeeded as vice president, marketing, by Guy Mallery.

title: Executive Leaving Russ Togs
description: Henry Benach, executive vice president of Russ Togs, Inc., will end his employment at the diversified apparel manufactur ing concern March 31, Eli Roussso, president, and Mr. Benach announced yesterday. Mr. Rousso, who said Mr. Benach's leaving was amica ble, said that he regrets the move. Mr. Benach said that he had no immediate plans.

title: Personal Finance
description: If you have been watching the ads of thrift institutions lately, you may have noticed that just about everybody (that may be a slight exag geration) is offering some kind of gift to bring in new deposits.

title: Market Place:
description: RUBEN SHOHET of Burn ham & Co. watched 650,600 shares of American Airlines trade in a block yes terday at 29, the day's low. He commented on exaspera tion that, to him at least and as far as the airlines are concerned, the mutual funds tend to sell when they should be buying.

title: S.E.C. Suspends Trading In Ultra Jet for 10 Days
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (UPI) The Securities and Exchange Commission today suspended for 10 days overthecounter trading in stock of Ultra Jet Industries. Inc., a Florida corp oration. The S.E.C. said the company had no business of fices hut apparently had more than six million shares of stock outstanding.

title: Scranton on Pan Am Board
description: William W. Scranton, Gov ernor of Pennsylvania from 1963 to 1967, has been elected to the board of directors of Pan American World Airways, it was announced yesterday. A native of Madison, Conn., Mr. Scranton is a graduate of Yale University and the Yale Law School. He is currently chairman of the hoard of the National Liberty Corporation.

title: Chemical Duty at Issue
description: GENEVA, Jan. 7The United States has been accorded a second year of grace by its principal European trading part ners to make good a promise to repeal the American Selling Price system for the evalua tion of customs duty collected on imports of benzenoid chem icals, it was announced today.

title: Mayor Discussing Switch To Democrats, Aide Says
description: Mayor Lindsay and his top aides have discussed his pos sible conversion to the Demo cratic party in informal talks with Democratic legislators and county leaders, a high mayoral aide confirmed yesterday.

title: F.C.C. UNIT SCORED ON MIX LICENSE
description: Forum Communications, Inc., which is challenging the broad cast license of WPIXTV, Chan nel 11 here, yesterday accused the Broadcast Bureau, the Fed eral Communications Commis sion's investigative arm, of bias in favor of WPIX.

title: THEODORE SMORODIN
description: Theodore Smorodin, business manager of Locals 456 and 486 of the International Union of Electrical, Radio and Machine Workers, died yesterday at Beth Israel Hospital of a heart attack, He was 58 years old and lived at 57A Newark Way, Maplewood, N. J.

title: DEFREGGER IS NAMED IN MASSACRE REPORT
description: L'AQUILA, Italy, Jan. 7 (Reuters)Italian police inves tigators have completed a re port confirming that a massa cre occurred in the central Italian village of Filetto during World War II.

title: CORPORATE BONDS DECLINE IN RATE
description: Interest rates on corporate bonds continued to move down ward yesterday, pushing yields on topquality utility bonds one half a percentage point below the peak levels set at the be ginning of December.

title: Observer: New Frankness Gets Boy and Girl
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7The problems that the new frank ness can get a moviemaker into are illustrated in a Dustin Hoff manMia Farrow film called John and Mary.

title: Williams Revival? Ask the Playwright
description: This is turning out to be Tennessee Williams Revival Week in New York.

title: GROUP LEAVESSAIGON AFTER SONGMY STUDY
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Jan. 8Lieut. Gen. William R. Peers and two civilian lawyers left here this, Morning after a 12day inquiry into the alleged massacre of civilians at Songmy. He said the inquiry had uncovered some things that will have a bearing on current court martial proceedings.

title: Excerpts From Governor Rockefeller's Address at Opening of the Legislature
description: We are here today to examine chal lenges, weigh priorities and set goals for the nineteen seventies.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: THIS is the time of year for hare and rabbit hunting in New England, New Jersey and New York.

title: McCarthy Meets in Kremlin With Legislative Leaders
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 7 (Reuters) Senator Eugene J. McCarthy met today the chairmen of the two chambers of the Supreme Soviet (Parliament) for talks in the Kremlin.

title: Music: Rubinstein's Concerto Series
description: ARTUR RUBINSTEIN, the indefatigable, started a concerto series last night in Philharmonic Hall with an orchestra conducted by Al fred Wallenstein. He played the Chopin E minor, the Nights in the Gardens of Spain by Manuel de Falla and the Tchaikovsky B flat minor. Next week he will pray three more works for piano and orchestra. Satur day evening will find him playing chamber music with the Guarneri Quartet. Which is a good week's work for anybody, much less on an octogenarian.

title: Chicago 7 Witness Criticizes Judge
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 7A wit ness in the Chicago conspiracy trial accused Judge Julius J. Hoffman today of hampering his testimony with legal nice ties.

title: A. Edward Miller Elected Berlitz Schools President
description: A. Edward Miller, former president of the World Publish ing Company, has been elected president of the Berlitz Schools of Languages of America, Inc., succeeding Robert Strumpen Darrie.

title: BUCYK OF BRUINS GETS 300TH GOAL
description: OAKLAND, Jan. 7 (UPI)  Phil Esposito and Johnny Bucyk each tallied two goals tonight to power the Boston Bruins to a 61 trouncing of the Oakland Seals.

title: ALEXANDER TO HELP HARVARD ON HIRING
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 7 Harvard University announced today the appointment of Clif ford L. Alexander, former head of the United States Equal Em ployment Opportunities Com mission, to recommend changes in Harvard's minorities hiring practices for all nonteaching positions.

title: School Integration by Feb. 1 Ordered in 4 Areas in South
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 7 (AP) Four Southern school dis tricts were ordered today by the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit to desegregate all classes by Feb. 1 in line with plans sub mitted by the Department of Health, Education and Welfare.

title: Boston College Tops Yale For 10th Hockey Victory, 64
description: NEW HAVEN, Jan. 7 Pad Schilling scored three goals and Tim Sheehy had a goal and two assists tonight as Boston College defeated Yale's hockey, team, 64.

title: Big Board Planning Vote In Spring on New Fees
description: The New York Stock Ex change indicated yesterday that its board of governors would be asked to vote on a proposed new commissionrate schedule some time during the spring, barring any interruptions in plans.

title: 3 UTILITIES PLANNING TO EXPAND OUTLAYS
description: The nation's largest indepen dent telephone system, a large operating company in the Bell System and a large electric and gas utility in the upper Middle West announced plans yester day for increases in capital spending.

title: Avoiding DrugCulture Language
description: Advertising can contribute to the growing problem of drug use among the nation's young, according to one expert.

title: Pope Criticizes Both Liberals and Conservatives in the Church
description: ROME, Jan 7 (UPI)  Pope Paul VI criticized Roman Cath olic liberals sand conservatives alike today and appealed to them to follow his authority and that of other church pas tors.

title: CITY'S PAYCHECKS EVIDENCE IN TRIAL
description: A prosecutor introduced 11 boxes of paychecks yesterday representing $500,000 that a former official was charged with stealing from the city's Neighborhood Youth Corps.

title: They Solo on Spinning Wheels at a Rock Festival
description: CROTONONHUDSON, N. Y., Jan. 7 A small rock festival was held here today, but the only long hair belonged to sheep.

title: JOHN T. VAN SANT
description: John T. Van Sant, a former teacher and associate principal and controller of Horace Mann School, died yesterday at his home, 258 West 246th Street, in the Riverdale section of the Bronx. He was 85 years old.

title: U.S. Ends the First Stage In Evacuation of Wheelus
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Jan. 7 (AP)The United States com pleted the first stage in the evacuation of Wheelus Air Force Base today, the Tripoli radio reported.

title: ... and a Constitutional Retreat
description: Governor Rockefeller's recommendation that the Legislature take initial action to repeal the socalled Blaine Amendment and replace it with the less restrictive language of the Federal Constitution on separation of church and state is clearly a retreat from an important principle.

title: STOCK PRICES EASE ON LOWER SALES
description: The stock market, showing narrow changes throughout a rather slow session, ended yes terday on a mildly lower note.

title: PRO MUSICA OFFERS EARLY ITALIAN SONG
description: People who wonder how long it will be before America will have fully homegrown serious music of its own might have pondered last night's program by the New York Pro Musica at Alice Tully Hall. As the eve ning demonstrated, it took Italy two centuries before she gave birth to composers of the stat ure of Luca Marenzio and Mon teverdi, who broke through the benign tyranny that Flemish composers exercised over Italy throughout the 15th and 16th centuries.

title: HIGH JUMP EVENT IS WON BY GORMAN
description: Mel Davis, St. John's 6foot 6inch freshman who had con fined his serious jumping to the basketball court, came out for his first attempt at track last night in the Metropolitan Junior Amateur Athletic Union meet at the 102d Engineers Armory and finished second in the high jump.

title: The Theater: Love and Maple Syrup
description: CANADA is a country that is neither the United States nor Britain. She is not even France, and she seems sad about it all. Strange.

title: Tkaczuk's 2 Goals Help Rangers Beat Penguins, 53, Despite Loose Defense
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 7The Rangers closed out tonight the first half of what may be their first championship season since 1942 with a 53 victory over the Penguins in a game that often bordered on the dreadful.

title: City's Horse Trader in Albany
description: ALBANY, Jan. 7At 7:30 this morning, an hour at which very few legislators were stirring, Richard Allen Brown tucked away a break fast of pancakes and cheer fully contemplated a work ing day that would not end for 14 or 15 hours.

title: Wildcats in Fast Start
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 7 (UPI) Villanova bolted to a 2510 lead, then coasted to an 8759 basketball victory over Fair field University tonight at the Palestra.

title: Memorial Servires
description: FRANKWalter, A memorial service for Walter Frank, who died Dec. 28, 1969, will be held by his friends, at the Society for Ethical Culture, 2 W. 64th St., New York City, on Jan. 8, 1970, at 6 P.M. Algernon Black will preside. The speakers will in clude Roger Baldwin, Judge Jane Bolin, LeRoy Bowman, Osmond K. Fraenkel, isidore Minkin, Earle K. Moore, and John de H. Pemberton.

title: THOMAS H. ALLEN, A CITY RIGHTS AIDE
description: Thomas H. Allen, deputy ex ecutive director of the City Commission on Human Rights, was found dead yesterday aft ernoon at his apartment at 505 La Guardia Place. He was 49 years old. The police said he had apparently died of natural causes.

title: Hanoi Embassy in Soviet Aids Father of U.S. Flier
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 7 (AP) The father of a missing Unit ed States Marine pilot said today that the North Viet namese Embassy in Moscow has agreed to ask Hanoi whether his son had been captured alive or killed in action.

title: Fortunate Are Guests Who Feast From This Chinese Hot Pot
description: IT must be true, more often than not that newcomers to this country who make their home here adopt American dining patterns with no un certain dispatch. Before you can say disestablishmentari anism, they are feasting on hot dogs on a bun, hamburg ers on a roll and coveting the likes of grilled steaks and broiled lobster. Not Michael and Irene Tong.

title: Hofstra Beats Temple
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Jan. 7 Bob McLaughlin's field goal with 74 seconds remaining led Hofstra to a 6763 Middle At lantic Conference victory over Temple tonight.

title: Article 1  No Title
Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGSM

title: U.S. COURT UPHOLDS GAMBINO EJECTION
description: A 1967 deportation order against Carlo Gambino, head of a Mafia family in the metro politan area, was upheld here yesterday by the United States Court of Appeals.

title: Elizabeth Barrow to Be Wed To Glenn A. Wagner in April
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, L. I., Jan. 7Mr. and Mrs. Donald Fraser Barrow have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Eliza beth Bruen Barrow, to Glenn Arthur Wagner. He is the son of Jean Irwin Wagner of Huntington and the late Mrs. Wagner.

title: Fading Capital Slowed by Snow
description: ANLBANY, Jan. 7As the bill mill began grinding in the 1970 State Legislature up the hill, Michael Zavisky stood in 18 inches of snow on State Street, dipping a longhandled brush in a pail of hot water.

title: Great Southwest In an Agreement To Buy I.C. Deal
description: The Great Southwest Corpo ration announced yesterday it had reached an agreement to purchase I. C. Deal Com panies, a large privately owned Dallas corporation involved in building apartment houses and in developing real estate, for stock worth at least $20mil lion.

title: Aviation News and Notes
description: The first domestic 747 jumbo jet service will be offered by Trans World Airlines Feb. 25 with daily nonstop round trip service between New York and Los Angeles, the airline an nounced yesterday.

title: Robert Reynolds, Teacher, Makes Local Debut at Piano
description: Robert Reynolds, a teacher of piano at Wisconsin State University in Eau Claire, made his New York debut at Carnegie Recital Hall last night playing Beethoven's Sonata in C minor (Op. 111), Bartk's Improvisa tions (Op. 20), Book I of De bussy's Preludes and Abram Chasins's Fantasy on Themes from Weinberger's Schwanda.

title: MILITARY CHIEF OUSTED IN BEIRUT
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 7 The Lebanese Cabinet removed the commander in chief of the armed forces, Maj. Gen. Emile Bustani, tonight and named in his place Maj. Gen. Jean Njaim.

title: Swedes' Labor Stability Shaken As Miners in Arctic Stay Out
description: KIRUNA, Sweden, Jan. 7 Sweden's proud reputation for virtually strikefree relations between labor and management is being tarnished by a wildcat walkout at a stateowned min ing company in the Arctic.

title: RECITAL OF LIEDER BY WALTER BERRY
description: Carnegie Hall was surely one of the most civilized spots in the world while Walter Berry, the baritone, held an audience spellbound with a lieder recital last night.

title: Cuite Retains City Council Post Alter Stormy Opening Session
description: The Democrats on the City Council rejected a challenge by a Manhattan Reform Demo crat yesterday and reelected a Brooklyn regular to the most powerful position on the local legislature.

title: GILES ST. CLAIR SR. OF DRUG CONCERN, 53
description: Giles St. Clair Sr., a former vice president of S. B. Penick & Co., a drug manufacturing concern, died yesterday at Bap tist Memorial Hospital in Coral Gables, Fla., after a brief ill ness. He was 53 years old and lived at 1 South Mountain Ter race, Montclair, N. J.

title: More Eligible in New York
description: Many more of New York City's poor will be eligible to moreand more flexiblefood assistance under the new Fed eral food stamp program.

title: Jenkins Assesses Economic Strength Of Britain's Policy
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 7 (Reuters)  Chancellor of the Exchequer Roy Jenkins of Britain said to day the Labor Government's tough economic measures were beginning to pay off in Britain.

title: Dance: Piece for Brass
description: THE New York University School of Continuing Edu cation opened its new dance series last night with Pearl Lang and Dance Company at the School of Education audi torium, 35 West Fourth Street.

title: Chess:
Labor Department Welcomes Contractors' Suit Testing Legality of Philadelphia Job Plan
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 7The Department of Labor welcomed today the first court test of the constitutionality of the Nixon Administration's controversial Philadelphia Plan.

title: ELI BERNSTEIN
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Jan. 7 (UPI)Eli Bernstein, editor of United Press International Newspictures, died here today at his home, where he had been recuperating from open heart surgery performed last fall. He was 42 years old.

title: Miss Cotter, H. C. Parke 3d Plan to Marry
description: BALA CYNWYD, Pa., Jan. 7Miss Stephanie Davenport Cotter and Hervey Coke Parke 3d, who was named for his late greatgrandfather, a founder of Parke, Davis & Co., will be married here Feb. 21 in St. Matthias Roman Catholic Church.

title: LISBON TRIAL OPENS IN NEWS BLACKOUT
description: LISBON, Jan, 7  A Portu guese revolutionary leader, Her minio da Palma Incia, went on trial in absentia today for the biggest bank robbery in this country's history. Several po licemen, one armed with a sub machine gun, were stationed in the Boa Nora Courthouse fori the trial.

title: POWER FAILURE CUT GREGORY IN CHICAGO
description: A power failure in north west Chicago Monday night cut off a National Educational Television program on Dick Gregory throughout the city and brought hundreds of pro tests from viewers who sus pected political motives.

title: Northwestern Mutual Gains
description: The Northwestern Mutual Life Insurance Company reported yesterday that new business set a record of $2,014,877,000 in 1969, up 10 per cent from $1,817,491,189 the year before.

title: A Green Revolution Turns Red
description: A recent report by India's Home Ministry points up a paradox that could spell serious trouble for many developing countries in the new decade: The green revolution, which has dramatically increased farm output through the introduction of new seeds and techniques, is raising rather than lowering the level of rural discontent.

title: ROCKEFELLER OFFERS PLAN TO REVAMP STATE AGENCIES TO MEET PROBLEMS OF 70'S
description: ALBANY, Jan. 7Governor Rockefeller established his goals for the new decade today. in, an electionyear message to the Legislature that called for a major reorganization of state government to meet problems of pollution, crime and increas ing population.

title: TEKTITES' ORIGIN ON MOON DOUBTED
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 7Scientists expressed strong doubts today that any glassy objects from the moon had ever rained down on the earth's surface.

title: Nigerian Paper Belittles Thant's Appeal to Ojukwu
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Jan. 7 (Reu ters)A Nigerian newspaper described as sheer wishful thinking today the appeal by Secretary General Thant of the United Nations to the Biafran leader, Gen. Odumegwu Ojuk wu, to help end the Nigerian war.

title: LAIRD SAYS SOVIET SPEEDS UP THREAT
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7  De fense Secretary Melvin R. Laird asserted today that the Soviet Union, if it continued its stra tegic weapons buildup at the current pace, might be in a position to destroy most of America's Minuteman missiles even earlier than 1974, the date he forecast to Congress last spring.

title: Sports of The Times
description: BALTIMORE Jan. 7If we lost, said Dave DeBus schere, I was going to pray for a whole lot of snow. But now I want to get out of this city and on with the trip.

title: De Carlo Seeks Mistrial Over Bugging Publicity in ConspiracyExtortion Case
description: NEWARK, Jan. 7Attorneys for Angelo (Gyp) De Carlo and three codefendants moved sev eral times today Federal District Court that a mistrial be declared in the trial of the four on charges of conspiracy and extortion.

title: MARTIN LEVINE
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Jan. 7 Martin Levine, founder of the Marle Company, electrical equipment suppliers, died in Hollywood, Fla., yesterday. He was 70 years old and lived at 165 North Lake Avenue.

title: Tapes Reveal Underworld Life
description: An insight into the man ners, mores and methods of the Mafia has been revealed by the Federal Bureau of In vestigation's tape recordings of private conversations be tween numerous gangland figures.

title: Pennies and Dollars From Pupils Help Swell Funds for Neediest
Harvard Six Routs Brown
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Jan. 7 Harvard University exploded for four goals in the second pe riod tonight and went on to defeat Brown, 63, in an Ivy League hockey contest. Bob Havern and Skip Freeman tal lied two goals each to pace the Harvard attack. Don McGinnis, the Brown goalie, had 40 saves.

title: Hogan Chooses Assistants To Lead Four Bureaus
description: Manhattan District Attorney Frank S. Hogan named four assistants yesterday to head the Supreme Court, Criminal Court, homicide and complaint bureaus of his office.

title: Storm Cancels Racing At 4 Northeast Tracks
description: The heavy snowstorm yes terday in the Northeast forced the cancellation of racing at three major tracks in the area.

title: Sarnoff Retires as RCA's Chairman
description: David Sarnoff, a pioneer in the electronics world, took his official leave yesterday from the RCA Corporation, the company he led into the $3billionplus giant it is to day.

title: Young Join Moscow Christmas Mass
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 7I believei in one God, chanted the, voices of more than a thousand Russian Orthodox Christians; early today as they attended Christmas mass in Yelokhov skaya Cathedral.

title: Soviet Defense Lawyers' Rights Backed
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 7A Soviet Supreme Court Justice, rankled that official legal bodies often show disrespect for defense at torneys, called today for steps to guarantee that those accused of crimes receive the strongest possible defense in court.

title: GOLD PACT HAILED BY SOUTH AFRICAN
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Jan. 7South Africa ex pects to sell virtually all its gold production averaging about 30 to 35 million ounces a yearon the free market dur ing the next 12 months, the Minister of Finance, Dr. Nicho laas Diederichs, said here today at a news conference.

title: In The Nation: The Morgenthau Caper
description: The appointment of Robert M. Morgenthau as a Deputy Mayor of New York City nicely illustrates the possibilities of the unique political position Mayor John Lindsay has at tained. But it also suggests the Mayor's major difficulty, which is that his cards may be strong er to hold than to play.

title: U.S. Judge Dismisses Suit Protesting the War
description: A Federal District Judge yesterday threw out a suit by a Queens hospital admin istrator to have the war in Vietnam declared unconstitu tional.

title: Bank Group Supports Private Export Finance Unit
description: The formation of a new billiondollar private company to finance exports of jet air craft and other big ticket items was authorized yester day by a group of the nation's largest banks.

title: NAMATH DEPLORES GAMBLING REPORT
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 7Joe Namath, the quarterback of the New York Jets, dismissed today his alleged involvement in the Justice Department's investiga tion into nationwide sports gambling.

title: Texaco Trinidad Expands
description: Texaco Trinidad, Inc., a subd sidiary of Texaco, Inc., an nounced yesterday that it had been granted an exploratory and producing license covering 175,900 acres along the south coast of Trinidad by the Government of Trinidad and Tobago.

title: Three Supporters of Dubcek Face Party Charges in Prague
description: VIENNA. Jan. 7  The Czechoslovak Communist party announced today that it had opened proceedings against three supporters of Alexander Dubcek, who was party chief during the liberalization of 1968.

title: Britain Agrees to Provide Defensive Missiles for Qatar
description: LONDON, Jan. 7 (AP)Brit ain has agreed to sell ground toair Tiger Cat missiles to the sheikdom of Qatar in the Per sian Gulf, officials said today.

title: Maple Leafs Rally To Tie Stars, 33, On Pulford's Goal
description: TORONTO, Jan. 7 (UPI)Bob Pulford's goal at 9:40 of the final period capped a Toronto comeback that enabled the Leafs to tie the Minnesota North Stars, 33, tonight.

title: A LIGHT SN0WSTORM BRUSHES THE CITY
description: The major snowstorm that had been forecast for New York Tuesday night turned out yes terday to be more of a simple inconvenience than an emer gency in most of the metropoli tan area.

title: WEATHER SPURS SOYBEAN FUTURES
description: The hampering bitter cold and snow in the Midwest spurred some buying of grains and soybean futures yesterday, pushing up prices sharply dur ing the day.

title: Norwegian Official Denies an Oslo Role In Gunboat Affair
description: OSLO, Norway, Jan. 7For eign Minister John Lyng said in parliament today that it was Martin Siem, a prominent Nor wegian shipbuilder, who had signed the contract for the pur chase of the five Frenchbuilt gunboats that made their way from Cherbourg, France, to Is rael recently.

title: TV: Charles Russell's Portrayal of the Early West
description: A SUPERB portrayal of the early West, with wel come sympathy for the noble Indian who was to succumb in the longest war in Ameri can history, was related last night in a review of the work of Charles Russell, the artist and sculptor, who captured in watercolor, clay and on canvas the heights and end ing of an era in Montana.

title: Bridge:
Lindsay Backs School Addition, And Protest in Brooklyn Ends
description: Parents and teachers of Pub lic School 81 in Brooklyn ended a day of picketin and protest yesterday morning when Mayor Lindsay authorized immediate work on plans for a 12class room addition to ease over crowding.

title: Knicks Rally to Triumph Over Warriors, 9994, With FourthPeriod Surge
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 7 Two of the toughest defensive teams in the National Basket ball Association banged each other around tonight and the New York Knickerbockers, sav ing their best efforts for the fourth quarter, posted a 9994 victory at Civic Auditorium.

title: KAISER LIFTS PRICE OF FLUOROCARBONS
description: The Kaiser Aluminum and Chemical Corporation an nounced yesterday that it would raise prices, effective Feb. 1, by 2 cents a pound (about 8 per cent) on certain fluoro carbons.

title: Abrams Sworn in Bronx As Borough President
description: Robert Abrams, who was graduated from Christopher Columbus High School in the East Bronx in 1956, was sworn in there last night as the new Bronx Borough Pres ident.

title: I.B.M.'s Chief Advocates a Governmental Body to Implement Aims
description: The establishment of annual goals for the American econ omy similar to those utilized by industry was called for yester day by Thomas J. Watson Jr., chairman of the International Business Machines Corporation.

title: JAMES EDWARDS, FILM ACTOR, DEAD
description: James Edwards, the stage, screen and television actor, died Sunday night in San Diego after suffering a heart attack. He had reportedly been work ing on a film script in a rented house in San Diego, when he complained of chest pains. He was taken to Sharp Memorial Hospital, where he died. His age was given as 42.

title: Aetna, Citing Ban on Rise, Plans To Drop Car Insurance in Jersey
description: The Aetna Casualty and Surety Company announced yesterday that it would stop writing private passenger auto mobile insurance in New Jersey because that state's Insurance Department had refused to grant premium rate increases.

title: MILLS VOWS ACTION ON NEW EXCISE TAX
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (AP) President Nixon can have prompt consideration of any excise tax increases he pro poses, Wilbur D. Mills. Arkan sas Democrat who is chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee said today.

title: COURT DOOR IS OPEN TO NEW HOE OFFERS
description: Federal Judge Sylvester J. Ryan, who is supervising the trustee's management of R. Hoe & Co. in the sale of its press business, said here yesterday that he had given all parties in terested in the company until Jan. 14 to make new offers or for additional offers eo be pre sented.

title: Monetary Discord: Stand by Shultz Recalls Brief Conflicts Between Presidents and the Reserve Board
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7The statement yesterday by Secre tary of Labor George P. Shultz that the tight money policy of the Federal Reserve Board is too drastic and should be somewhat eased has raised the ghost of past conflicts between politically elected Presidents and the independent Federal Reserve, which is the nation's cep tral bank. If his tory is any guide the conflict will not last long. At crucial turning points the economy1957, 1959, 196 and 1970 Presidents have wanted the Federal Reserve to be a little easier on money and credit and interest rates, be cause Presidents fear a too se vere check to prosperity.

title: GAINS ARE REPORTED BY 3 RETAIL CHAINS
description: Substantial gains in Decem ber sales were reported yester day by the F. W. Woolworth Company, the W. T. Grant Company and the Walgreen Company.

title: Finnish Communists Act To End NineMonth Split
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Jan. 7 (Reuters)  The Central Com mittee of Finland's Communist party and the leadership of Stalinist splinter group have ac cepted a compromise proposal aimed at ending a ninemonth split.

title: Riot Charge Dropped
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Jan. 7 (AP)  An assistant Middlesex County prosecutor, Richard Mulligan, said yester day day that charges would be dropped against 45 persons accused of rioting during a Perth Amboy disturbance three years ago, in which 27 police men were injured. None of the accused can be positively iden tified, the Prosecutor said. The disorder took place between July 31 and Aug. 2, 1967.

title: PRISONER FOUND HANGED IN A CELL
description: A 27yearold prisoner at the Brooklyn House of Detention was found hanged by his scarf early yesterday morning. His death was the ninth in city cor rectional institutions since the beginning of 1969, with the first eight classed suicides.

title: Kennedy Inquest Nears End
description: EDARTOWN, Mass., Jan. 7 The inquest into the death of Mary Jo Kopechne approached an end today.

title: More Miners Protest Slayings
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7  A spreading strike by coal miners, angry over the murder of Jo seph A. Yablonski and his wife and daughter, threatened today to reduce further the waning stockpiles of fuel for the electric power industry.

title: U.S. RELEASES FUNDS  FOR ROAD IN OZARKS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7The Government released $182,000 in Federal funds yesterday for an Arkansas road project that Washington officials had feared might promote the activities of Gerald L. K. Smith. the right wing extremist wno gained fame in the nineteenthirties.

title: State Official Appointed
description: Marshall H. Peck Jr., a for mer newsman with The New York Herald Tribune, today was appointed a deputy com missioner of the State Division of Human Rights. The an nouncement was made by Commissioner Robert J. Man gum, who said that the 47 yearold Mr. Peck would suc ceed Barry Van Laree, who resigned to accept an appoint ment as deputy director of the State Office for Urban Innova tion.

title: Magnetic Sensor May Predict Quakes
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (UPI)  Scientists have developed an instrument so accurate that it is expected to disclose wheth er eartliquakes are preceded by local changes In the earth's, magnetic field.

title: DEPUTY TO COSTELLO IS GIVEN NEW DUTIES
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday the promotion of Dr. Emanuel S. Savas, the city's computersystem expert, to the $32,500ayear post of first deputy city administrator.

title: Dell Won't Seek Tennis Post
description: Donald Dell, captain of the victorious United States Davis Cup teams for the last two years, withdrew his name yes terday from consideration for the post this year.

title: Boston Theft Charge Fought
description: BOSTON, Jan. 7 (AP)Mo tions to dismiss conspiracy and larceny charges against George L. Brady in connection with the theft of about $788,000 from the Boston Common under ground garage project were filed today in Suffolk Superior Cour. Mr. Brady, former chair man of the Massachusetts Park ing Authority, was arrested in Atlantic City last Nov. 13, six years after his disappearance from Boston.

title: DOVE GETS 27 POINTS AS NETS WIN, 133124
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Jan. 7 (UPI)Sonny Dove and Ed Johnson led the New York Nets to a 133124 victory over the Pittsburgh Pipers in an American Basketball Associa tion game tonight.

title: Motorized British Hunting Fans Chase Horses Chasing the Fox
TEAMSTERS SEEK 75% PAY INCREASE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 Negotiations between the team ster union and Trucking Em ployers, Inc., the bargaining arm of the nation's trucking industry, began formally today with the union asking for a 75 per cent basic wage increase plus other benefits during the next three years.

title: Girl Strives to Be Pro Handler
description: WHEN a young owner handler takes a young dog to victory in a national event, spectators are likely to respond with more than usual warmth. It happened last weekend at the specialty of the American Spaniel Club in the English cocker spaniel breed, so an inquiry into the principalsap peared in order. The show was at the StatlerHilton Hotel. The han dler was Pamela Hall of Oceanside, L. I., a tall, poised, darkhaired 17year old, and the dog Ch. Kenobo Constellation, 18 months old and exactly one year in com petition when he became best of breed at the specialty. He had started in it last Janu ary and had won the best puppy award.

title: 2 U.C.L.A. Football Aides Join Jardine at Wisconsin
description: MADISON, Wis., Jan. 7 (AP) The University of Wisconsin hired two more assistant foot ball coaches today. They are Lew Stueck, 34 years old, and Norman Dow, 24, both of the University of California, Los Angeles.

title: 2d Senate Unit to Monitor Strategic Arms Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7  Jurisdictional battle lines were drawn in the Senate today for an expected debate over how far the United States should go in seeking an agreement with the Soviet Union to control strategic arms.

title: Squash Racquets
description: METROPOLITAN LEAGUE

title: 105 Members of Young Lords Submit to Arrest, Ending 11Day Occupation of Church in East Harlem.
description: The 11day occupation of an East Harlem church ended early today as 105 members and supporters of the Young Lords organization submitted peaceably to arrest by eight unarmed sheriff's deputies.

title: EMILE JACOBY
description: Emile Jacoby, past commo dore of the New Jersey Power Boat Association, died Tuesday in a nursing home after a long illness. He was 72 years old and lived at 7316 Kennedy Boule vard, North Bergen, N. J.

title: Flyers Tie Blues, 22
New Orleans Weather Is Not Scoring Points
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 7 Outside the Fontainebleu Hotel, where the Kansas City Chiefs are lodged this week, there is a large fountain against a backdrop of palm trees. But today the water in the fountain was frozen, and the palms were almost blue.

title: Vikings Try Out the Game Plan; They'll Know Sunday if It Fits
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 7 Apart from game day, Wednesday is the most im portant day in the pro foot ball week. It is the day the team drills on the game plan the defenses and plays the coaches believe will work on Sunday.

title: L.I.U. Downs Iona, 7251
description: Long Island University moved to a 20point lead at halftime and coasted to a 7251 victory over Iona College last night at the winner's court in Brooklyn. It was the seventh victory in 12 games for L. I. U.

title: 1969 EARNINGS UP AT HANOVER BANK
description: The Manufacturers Hanover Corporation reported yesterday that its net income last year was $68.95million, or $4.93 a common share, up 4.7 per cent from $65.84million, or $4.70 a share in 1968.

title: Linda Whiteside Engaged
description: Lieut. Col. John J. White side, U.S.A.F., and Mrs. White side of Fort Totten, Queens, have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Linda Gay Whiteside, to Steven Michael Henman, son of Lieut. Col. Floyd J. Hen man, N.S.A.F. and Mrs. Hen man of Lebanon, Ill. Miss. Whiteside and her fianc are seniors at Southern Illinois University. Her father heads the Air Force Information Office here.

title: Italy Forgets Woes in TV Spectacular
description: ROME, Jan. 7Most of Italy forgot strikes, the flu epidemic,, political drift and a host of lesser problems last night to watch television while a skinny singer named Gianni Morandi and the wheel of fortune made an unidentified Italian $240,000 richer.

title: METS RAISE PRICES FOR SOME TICKETS
description: A home schedule featuring more day games and a slight rise in the price of some tickets were announced yesterday by the New York Mets. They will open their season at Shea Sta dium on Tuesday, April 14, against the Pittsburgh Pirates, one week after they begin Na tional League competition in Pittsburgh.

title: Golden Gate Lightship May Yield to Automation
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 7 (AP)  The San Francisco lightshipa mariner's beacon anchored 11 miles offshore may be traded in for an auto mated device.

title: Washington of 76ers Hurt
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 7 (UPI) A severe back strain has made Jim Washington of the Phila delphia 76ers a doubtful starter against Seattle in a National Basketball Association game Friday night.

title: AMOROUS LINE SUNG BY MISS TRAFICANTE
description: As part of her unusual pro gram at the New York Cultural Center last night, Marie Trafi cante gave the first perform ance of The Amorous Line, a setting by Joseph Frank Pouhe of six sonnets and a lyric by Edna St. Vincent Millay.

title: Jane Radenbaugh Prospective Bride
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 7Miss Jane Radenbaugh, who is with the Welfare Department here, plans to be married on Jan. 24 to Thomas Moulding Beers Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Beers of Potomac, Md. His father is a vice president of the National Geographic Society.

title: ROBERT MESKILL OF BOOK CONCERN
description: Robert Meskill executive editor of the Cowles Book Company, died Tuesday in St. Vincent's Hospital after heart attack. He was 51 years old and lived at 320 East 52d Street.

title: Airline Death Toll Is 158 for Year, Lowest Since '57
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6The nation's airlines ended 1969 with their best safety record since the jet age began.

title: MALAYSIAN GUARD HEAVY FOR AGNEW
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Thursday, Jan. 8Vice Presi dent Agnew relaxed here to day although hundreds of armed sentries and security guards did not.

title: Four New Shows Booked on Broadway
description: In a burst of booking ac tivity, four new shows have signed contracts for Broad way theaters, three for open ing next month and one in April.

title: Henry L. Manfredi Dies at 54; Aide to Narcotics Bureau Head
description: Henry L. Manfredi, special assistant to the Director of the United States Bureau of Nar cotics and Dangerous Drugs, died Tuesday night of a heart attack at George Washington Hospital in Washington. He was 54 years old.

title: FILM ADMISSIONS UP AGAIN IN 1969
description: Moviegoers paid an esti mated total of $1.065billion in admissions to the nation's theaters in 1969, the highest boxoffice figure for any year in the last seven, according to the Department of Commerce.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Unreasonable Fares

title: Vanden Heuvel Joins Contest for Governor
description: William J. vanden Heuvel, who was a close associate of the late Senator Robert F. Ken nedy and who has long been active in Democratic politics here, announced yesterday his candidacy for the party nomi nation for Governor.

title: 2 Holdups Staged in Queens
description: A bank and a savings insti tution in Queens were robbed, a halfhour apart yesterday by gunmen who escaped with labout $1,800 from each, the police said. The robberies were not connected, they said. The first robbery took place at the Maspeth Savings and Loan As sociation, at 64th Street and Woodhaven Boulevard in Rego Park at 2:15 P.M. The second was at the Bayside branch of the First National City Bank, at Bell Boulevard and 38th Avenue.

title: Parental Acquiescence
description: YAZOO CITY, Miss., Jan. 7 A large majority of the white parents of this onceresistant little town swallowed their pride, gritted their teeth and sent their children to com pletely integrated schools today for the first time.

title: REVENUE PROPERTIES WINS ON 3 CHARGES
description: TORONTO, Jan. 7 (Canadian Press)Three charges against the Revenue Properties Com pany, Ltd., of Toronto of filing false and misleading financial statements in its 1968 annual report were dismissed today by Provincial Judge S. Tupper Bigelow. He reserved judgment to Feb. 9 on a prosecution motion to have a fourth charge of omitting a statement of source and application of funds filed under a different section of the Ontario Securities Act.

title: Opinion Divided on Media Fairness, Gallup Finds
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Jan. 7 Americans are almost evenly divided on the question of whether the TV networks are fair in presenting news dealing with political and social issues, the Gallup Poll reported today.

title: Previews of Winter Antiques Show Set for Jan. 22
description: A double preview, with cocktails at both, on Jan. 22 will herald the 16th annual Winter Antiques Show at the Seventh Regiment Armory. The show, open to the public the next day, will run through Feb. 1.

title: Advertising: Fertile Fields Yield Answers
description: I wanted to be a college professor because my father had been one, said Roy H. Campbell. Not an unusual sentiment, that. Except, of course, if the man expressing it had just retired from 27 years in advertising and mar keting, was 5S years old and planned to get a master's and a doctorate.

title: Jerry West Top Choice On N.B.A. West Stars
description: Jerry West of Los Angeles, the leading scorer this season in the National Basketball Association, was the leading votegetter among the West ern Division AllStars named yesterday. The N.B.A. All Star game is set for Phila delphia Jan. 20.

title: F.C.C. TO CONSIDER LICENSE STATEMENT
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7The Federal Communications Com mission has On its agenda, for consideration possibly as early as tomorrow, a policy state ment as to standards it will use in deciding whether to per mit competitive applications for broadcast licenses when old licenses are up for renewal.

title: New Battles Erupt Near Danang and Cambodia
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 7 (AP)New fighting was reported today in South Viet nam's coastal lowlands south of Danang and to the southwest along the Cambodian border.

title: Sports Today
description: HARNESS RACING

title: BLYTH & CO. TO QUIT SELLING U.S. BONDS
description: Blyth & Co., Inc., announced yesterday that it intended to discontinue its activities as dealer in United States Gov ernment securities.

title: A.B.A. Seeks Renewed Talks, But N.B.A. Disdains a Merger
description: Jack Dolph, the commissioner of the American Basketball As sociation, said yesterday after a league meeting that he planned to ask Walter Kennedy his counterpart in the National Basketball Association, to re sume merger talks between the leagues.

title: Dutch Council Asks End of Priestly Celibacy Rule
description: NOORDWIJKERHOUT, the Netherlands, Jan. 7A repre sentative assembly of the Neth erlands' Roman Catholic Church voted overwhelmingly today in favor of lifting the ban on mar ried priests and admitting women to the priesthood.

title: Irish Triumph by 9176
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Jan. 7 (UPI)Austin Carr's 29 points, 23 in the second half, led Notre Dame to a 9176 basketball victory over Fordham tonight.

title: Insiders' Stockholdings
ISRAELI JETS RAID CAMPS NEAR CAIRO
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 7Israeli jets bombed targets 18 miles from Cairo today. According to a communiqu issued here, three Egyptian military camps were hit.

title: G.I. Who Accused Military Of Censorship Is Charged
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Jan. 8  The Army said today it had charged Spe cialist 5 Robert E. Lawrence, with disrespect to a superior and failure to obey orders, but asserted that the charges had nothing to do with his broad cast Jan. 3, in which he charged the military with cen soring news broadcasts.

title: Unusual Pattern Found In Some Lunar Rocks
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 7An ex traordinary candystripe pat tern has been found, on a mi croscopic scale, in some lunar rocks.

title: Princeton 6 Overtime Victor
description: TROY, N.Y., Jan. 7John Hepburn of Princeton scored the typing goal at the buzzer tonight and then added the winning marker at 8:04 of the overtime period to give Prince ton a 43 victory over R.P.I. in an E.C.A.C. Division I hockey game.

title: Stamford Antiques Show
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Jan. 7 A winter antiques show sponsored by the Women of St. Francis Episcopal Church will be held at the new parish house on Long Ridge Road for three consecutive days beginning Jan. 15. Twenty seven dealers from Connecti cut, New York and Rhode Is land will exhibit their wares. Luncheon will be served daily from noon to 2 P.M. Mrs. Bruce Whitman is chairman of the committee.

title: Lee Polk to Take N.E.T. Post
description: Lee Polk, director of news and public affairs at Channel 13, is resigning to become di rector of children's programing for National Educational Telo vision. He will replace Paul Taft, who has resigned from N.E.T. to join the Connecticut Television Network.

title: 30 Georgia Districts Will Again Receive U. S. School Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (AP) The Government announced today that it was restoring eligibility of 30 Georgia school districts to receive Federal funds and taking action to deny assistance to nine other South ern school districts.

title: Jersey Commission Scans Mafia Tapes
description: NEWARK, Jan. 7The chair man of the State Commission of Investigation said today that his agents were obtaining copies of the new Mafia con versations, involving high po litical and law enforcement of ficials, in the hope that they would provide evidence for new investigations of organized crime and official corruption in New ersey.

title: Sulky's Tire Blowout Turns Pace Into Flat
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Jan. 7 A blowout on the tire of one of the sulkies led to an un usual spill tonight in the eighth race at Roosevelt Race way.

title: Geologist Gives Up Idea For Explosion on Moon
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 7 (AP) Pressure from other scien tists and the public has led a lunar geologist to drop his idea of exploding a nuclear device on the moon. But the geologist, Dr. Gary V. Latham, says that he would still like to make the moon ring like a gong with some big im pact.

title: TOP U.S. MEDIATOR ENTERS G.E. TALKS
description: The head of the Federal Me diation and Conciliation Serv ice, J. Curtis Counts, met here yesterday for the first time with the parties involved in the 11weekold strike at the Gen eral Electric Company.

title: Policeman Who Led Chicago Panther Raid Testifies at Boycotted Inquest
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 7The po lice sergeant who led the pre dawn raid in which two Black Panthers were shot to death testified today before a coro ner's jury that was boycotted by the Panthers who were in the raided apartment.

title: Film Resale Is Involved
description: PARIS, Jan. 7A blow has been struck against resale price maintenance in West Germany as a result of a precedentset ting action taken by the Execu tive Commission of the Euro pean Economic Community.

title: De Carlo's Old Barn Now Houses Dogs
description: Twenty miles west of Wall Streetout beyond the ragged ring of oil refineries, factories and motelsfour dogs named Ringo, Judy, Whitey and Blackie are the sole remaining inhabitants of the Barnonce the headquarters of Angelo De Carlo, reputed Mafia captain, Rambler and loanshark.

title: U.S. Extends the Food Stamp Program to 211 New Districts
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7Clif ford M. Hardin, the Secretary of Agriculture, authorized 31 localities across the country today to start food stamp pro grams for the first time and approved requests from 180 more areas, including New York City, to switch from food dis tribution plans to food stamps.

title: An Unmoving Message...
description: Even by the lenient standards that Governor Rocke feller himself has helped establish, the Governor's address to the opening session of the State Legislature in Albany yesterday was uninspiring. It was also dis appointing.

title: British Football Resultsi
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE Association Cup Third Round

title: The Legality of Tapes
description: NEWARK, Jan. 7By open ing to public inspection 1,200 pages of conversations among alleged Mafiosi, recorded ille gally by agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, Federal Judge Robert Shaw has provid ed another tantalizing chapter in the annals of organized crime. But he has also provided a host of legal questions that have lawyers here and elsewhere shaking their heads in confusion and disbelief and even a bit of horror. According to many of the lawyers, Judge Shaw may have prejudiced the rights of Angelo De Carlo, whose case he is now hearing; he may have made impossible a New Jersey trial for scores of other men, and he almost certainly has es tablished a precedent that, if followed, will allow a new di mension in the ability of the Government to expose the private actions of any of its citizens.

title: Lake Placid Snow Satisfies Chairman Of Nordic Tourney
description: NO SNOW fell on Lake Placid yesterday and Ver non Lamb was happy. Lamb, the competitions chairman of the major threeday Nordic ski competitions jamboree that starts at the Adirondack re sort tomorrow, is hoping the weather doesn't change.

title: Queens Hospital Names Aide
description: J. Donald Rodda has been named director of public rela tions for Flushing Hospital and Medical Center, the oldest vol untary hospital in Queens. Mr. Rodda, who retired recently as chief of public relations for the Sanitation Department after 24 years in the city's service, was previously a sports writer and book editor.

title: Heller Quit Post in City to Take Environmental Job in Delaware
description: Austin N. Heller said yester day that he resigned suddenly yesterday as the city's Com missioner of Aft Resources be cause he was offered, out of the blue, a job as head of Delaware's new Department of Natural Resources and Environ ment.

title: New Team Plans to Revamp Paris Opera
description: PARIS, Jan. 7The news that the Paris Opera may be drastically reorganized after all was music to the ears of opera fans and taxpayers alike.

title: Allison L. Simmons to Be Bride
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Jan. 7Mrs. Leslie L. Simmons has announced the engage ment of her daughter, Miss Allison Lovejoy S??nons, to Bruce MacFarlane Chapin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert M. Chapin Jr. of New York and Sharon, Conn. A June wedding is planned.

title: East German Defects to Westl
description: BONN, Jan. 7 (AP)Fritz Ralf Guhre, a member of the East German trade mission in Amsterdam, has defected to West Germany and was expect ed to ask for political asylum, the West German Security Of fice reported today.

title: FRANCE CONFIRMS SHE IS ARRANGING LIBYA ARMS SALE
description: PARIS, Jan. 7  The French Government officially confirmed today that it was arranging an arms deal with Libya as part of a wider commercial agreement that would extend French influ ence in North Africa and the Arab world.

title: M'CORMACK MEETS MORGENTHAU AIDES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 Speaker of the House John W. McCormack said today that he had completed the second of two meetings with representa tives of Robert M. Morgenthau, United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

title: TUESDAY NIGHT FIGHTS
description: Tokyo  Johnny Famechon, 124 pounds, Australia, knock ed out Fighting Harada, 126, Japan, 14 rounds. Famechon re tained World Boxing Council version of featherweight cham pionship.

title: Firecrackers Banned on Tet
description: SAIGON, Jan. 7 (Reuters) The Saigon Government an nounced today that firecrackers would be banned during the Vietnamese Lunar New Year, Tet, next month. Firecrackers are a traditional feature of the observance, but since the Viet cong's nationwide Tet offensive in 1968, the Government has forbidden their use.

title: Executive Appointment Made by Bache & Co.
description: The promotion of Edward I. O'Brien to executive vice president from senior vice president of Bache & Co., Inc., was announced yester day.

title: TIMKEN BEARING SEES PROFIT RISE
SOVIET BANS SHIPS FROM SEAL REGION
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 7 (UPI)The Soviet Union has declared a ban on all shipping within 30 miles of the Russian islands closest to America's Aleutian chain, according to the official press agency Tass.

title: ROBERT SCHAGANE
description: Robert Schagane, a copy edi tor at The New York Post, (lied Tuesday at his home of a heart attack. He was 36 years old, and resided at 41 Eastern Park way, Brooklyn.

title: Asturias Mine Strike Challenges Franco Regime
description: MADRID, Jan. 7  The coal miners of Asturias, who para lyzed much of Northern Spain with a series of strikes in 1962, are again challenging the Franco Government with a widespread walkout.

title: NICKEL TAKES STEP ON ALASKA PIPELINE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (AP)  Secretary of the Interior Walter J. Hickel ordered an ex ception today to the freeze on Federal lands in Alaska for construction of an oil pipeline from the state's North Slope to a southern port.

title: HURRICANE AID UNIT DIVIDED BY POLITICS
description: BILOXI, Miss., Jan. 7A spe cial Senate subcommittee look ing into the management of Federal assistance to the hurri canestricken Mississippi If Coast got off today to an un steady start that appeared to divide the panel along partisan lines.

title: Static Electricity Is Suspected in Tanker Blasts
description: LONDON, Jan. 7The ex plosions in three large oil tank ers off Africa last month may have been caused by static electricity produced by power ful jets of water breaking into droplets during tankcleaning in the tropics.

title: Transcripts and Freedoms
description: Transcripts of bugged conversations between a reputed Mafia leader and his friends have been spread before the public by the Federal judge and United States Attorney in Newark during the course of a trial for conspiracy and extortion. The activities and names of various people mentioned make interesting reading; but the method of disclosure scarcely makes for good law.

title: A Protest by Parents
description: PETAL, Miss., Jan. 7Near ly 300 white parents and their children staged a sitin at an elementary school here today, peacefully protesting an inte gration plan that assigned the youngsters to classrooms 13 miles away.

title: 6 COMPANIES STALL U.S. CURBS ON DDT
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (UPI) A Government drive to end all but essential uses of DDT by the end of 1970 has been stalled in its initial stages by appeals from six major pesti cide companies.

title: Grant, Stram Honored
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (AP) Bud Grant and Hank Stram, whose Minnesota Vikings and Kansas City Chiefs clash in the Super Bowl Sunday, were chosen by the Touchdown Club today as professional football's coach of the year in their respective leagues.

title: A Lean Year for Cooperstown?
description: THE annual election for the Baseball Hall of Fame at Cooperstown, N. Y., is now in progress, with the ballots in the hands of qualified mem bers of the Baseball Writers Association of America members with 10 years or more of active service.

title: HAWKS SET BACK CELTICS, 112106
description: BOSTON, Jan. 7 (AP)Jim Davis came up with a pair of key plays in the last two min utes tonight as the Atlanta Hawks pulled out a 112106 victory over the Boston Celtics in the second half of a Na tional Basketball Association doubleheader.

title: Books of The Times
description: ROSS MacDONALD, in his most recent novel The Goodbye Look, has his detective Lew Archer tell a young woman: I don't believe people know everything at birth and forget it as they get older. Raymond Aron, in his most recent book The Elusive Revolution, observes: A professor would have to be very ignorant indeed to be more ignorant than his students, par ticularly in their first years at uni versity. Margaret Mead, in this slim volume of shining intelligence, sees the situation from a less comfortable point of view. The young, she says, know something the rest of us re fuse to admit. They know that there are no adults any where in the world from whom they can learn what the next steps should be. What the next steps should be . . . a deceptively simple and ultimately horrifying formulation to de scribe that most notorious of holes, the Generation Gap.

title: Workers in Saigon Strike to Demand Public Bus Service
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 7 (Reuters)  A 24hour general strike by thousands of Saigon workers affected docks, factories, fuel companies and some offices today. Tonight it was ordered extended for a day to back demands for a pub lic bus service in this city of three million people.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON SHOW SHARP DROP
description: Still reflecting reaction to the statement by Roy Jenkins, the Chancellor of the Exchequer, in San Francisco on Monday that there would be no letup in the economic squeeze, stocks on the London Stock Exchange closed sharply lower yesterday. Also influencing the market was the decline experienced by the New York Stock Exchange on Tues day.

title: Being Mia's Sister Was Tisa's Burden
description: SHE'S Baby to her family, Mia Far row's sister to movie moguls, and Tisa to her friends.

title: F.B.I.Taped Conversation Sheds Light on 1962 Gangland Slaying of Strollo
description: According to the transcript of underworld conversations overheard and recorded by the Federal Bureau of Investiga tion, Ruggiero (Richie the Boot) Boiardo, a reputed high ranking Mafioso in New Jersey, sought to give the impression that he alone was responsible for the death of Anthony (Tony Bender) Strollo.

title: New Freight Car Offered
description: The Kansas City Southern Railway yesterday introduced a waffleside freight car that was designed and built by the PullmanStandard division of Pullman, Inc. The car is the first of a $10million order for 500 cars. The new freight car has a series of nine wafflelike embossments running up each

title: Jet Crash Toll Rises to 14
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 7 (AP) The death toll has risen to 14 as a result of the Dec. 22 crash of an F8 Crusader jet into a crowded hangar at Miramer Naval Air Station. Richard C. Boniella of San Diego, a Navy petty officer, died in Balba Naval Hospital yesterday.

title: Nixon Commitment To Balanced Budget Reaffirmed by Aide
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 7The White House reaffirmed today President Nixon's stated commitment to achieve a bal anced budget in the fiscal year 1971 which starts July 1.

title: Rozelle Quotes U.S. Attorney as Saying He Has No Charges Against Players
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 7Pete Rozelle, the Commissioner of pro football, said tonight that the United States Attorney in Detroit investigating nationwide sports gambling had told him that no information had come to his attention to warrant pre ferring charges against any pro football players.

title: MICHAEL W. ZEAMER, WRITER FOR GODFREY
description: Michael W. Zeamer, director and chief writer for Arthur Godfrey Productions, died at his home at 21 West 16th Street yesterday morning after a short illness. He was 45 years old.

title: U.S. GIVES ESTIMATE ON INFILTRATIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7The State Department said today that North Vietnamese infiltra tion into South Vietnam in 1969 was less than onehalf of the flow in 1968.

title: THE GREAT IMPOSTER REPORTEDLY A CLERIC
description: FRIDAY HARBOR, Wash., Jan. 7 (AP)Ferdinand Waldo DeMara, famed as the Great Imposter over the years, has turned up in this island ham let as the new pastor of the San Juan Baptist Church. The Seattle Times said today.

title: PRICES ON AMEX SHOW AN UPTURN
description: Most prices on the American Stock Exchange finished higher yesterday in comparatively slow trading.

title: Queens Group Plans Campaign To Roll Back Fare to 20 Cents
description: As another legal attack on the city's new 30cent transit fare was argued yesterday, a group of Queens politicians and civic workers arranged for a conference tomorrow in Flush ing to plan a campaign to roll hack the cost of a ride to 20 cents.

title: MRS. BARTLETT ARKELL
description: Mrs. Louise Ryals Arkell, widow of Bartlett Arkell, foun der of the Beechnut Packing Company, died yesterday in her home, 15 West 10th Street. She was 84 years old.

title: UNION TO OBSERVE KING'S BIRTHDAY
description: A major union of office work ers and sales people announced yesterday that it was calling on 30,000 members in 2,000 companies in the metropolitan area to take a day off next Thursdaythe birthday of they late Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.regardless of contractual obligations or permissions of employers.

title: Mollenhopf, Near 65, Retires As Football Coach at Purdue
description: LAFAYETTE, Ind., Jan. 7 (AP)  Jack Mollenkopf an nounced his retirement as foot ball coach at Purdue today, six months before reaching the mandatory retirement age of 65.

title: Republican Accord Is Near On Redistricting for State
description: ALBANY, Jan. 7Republican leaders are nearing agree ment on the broad outline of a new Congressional reappor tionment plan that could permit the election of the first Puerto Rican to the House of Representatives from New York City.

title: JERSEY LEADERS DENY MAFIA TIES IMPLIED ON TAPES
description: NEWARK, Jan. 7David T. Wilentz, Democratic national committeeman from New Jer sey, strongly denied today that he had protected criminal gam bling operations as outlined in a Federal Bureau of Investiga tion transcript of talks among alleged Mafia leaders.

title: Governor's Proposal to Lift Ban on State Aid to Parochial Schools Stirs Opposition
description: ALBANY, Jan. 7  Governor Rockefeller's call to repeal the Blaine Amendment, which pro hibits state aid to parochial schools, was quickly and sharp ly denounced today by leaders of the American Jewish Con gress and the New York State Teachers Association.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
NORTHEAST CUTS CREW STRENGTH
description: MIAMI, Jan. 8 (AP)North east Airlines has announced that it is laying off 55 flight crewmen this weekend.

title: Book of Job Choral Drama To Be Presented Sunday
description: Congregation Rodeph Sholom will present The Book of Job, a choral drama designed and directed by Orlin and Irene Corey, and the premiere con cert performance of Tamar and Judah, by the late Israeli composer Marc Lary, during its third annual festival of the Jewish arts.

title: SovietSwedish Accord Set
description: STOCKHOLM, Jan. 8 (UPI) The Government said today that Industry Minister Krister Wickman would sign an agree ment in Moscow next Monday providing for Swedish coopera tion with the Soviet Union on the peaceful uses of nuclear power and on other scientific and economic matters. The ac cord, it was said, will be Swe den's first nuclear agreement with an Eastern nation.

title: Hitchcock Gets Expos' Post
description: MONTREAL, Jan. 8 (UPI) Billy Hitchcock, a former major league manager with the Baltimore Orioles and Atlanta Braves, was named director of field instructions today by the Montreal Expos. Jim Fanning, the Expos' general manager, also named Ray Hayworth as a special assignment scout.

title: The Philharmonic, Led by Fruhbeck, Performs Mahler
description: At age 36,Rafael Frhbeck de Burgos comes to us as a con ductor of considerable celebrity, with international guest tours and stacks of recordings already to his credit.

title: Woman Slain and Another Kidnapped in Wilton
description: WILTON, Conn., Jan. 8A 33yearold mother of four was strangled to death yesterday, another Wilton housewife re ported that she was kidnapped and a Stamford woman report ed that she fought off an at tempted rape.

title: U.S. CUTS GRANTS ON RENEWAL WORK BEGUN IN 50 CITIES
