description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8  George Romney, Secretary of Housing and Urban Develop ment, confirmed today that his department had imposed an across the board cutback in some urban renewal grants that many cities had regarded as commitments.

title: MARCH 10 OPENING SET FOR AQUEDUCT
description: The State Racing Commis sion announced yesterday it had approved 234 racing days at the three major tracks in New York in 1970. The thoroughbred season will open at Aqueduct on March 10, a Tuesday, and close at the same track on Dec. 7.

title: Statement by Mormons on Role of Negro
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Jan. 9 Following is the text of a statement from the office of the first presidency, Church of Jesus Christ of LatterDay Saints, to Mormon leaders around the world, on the church's position toward Ne groes:

title: 2 MORE G.I.'S FACE SONGMY CHARGES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8Two soldiers who were scheduled to leave the Army next week were charged with murder and other offenses today in connection with the alleged killing of civil ians in Songmy, Vietnam, on March 16, 1968.

title: Article 3  No Title
JOHN PRINZ JOINING THE MUNICH BALLET
description: John Prinz, one of the New York City Ballet's younger prin cipals, has left the company to join the Munich Ballet.

title: Caledonian Club Defeats Nutmeg in Curling, 13 to 9
description: MOUNT HOPE, N. Y., Jan. The New York Caledonian Curling Club No. 2 Rink, skipped by Archibald W. Smith, and the Canadian Club of New York, skipped by Carl Fellows, won the opening matches of the 35th annual Douglas Medal bonspiel tonight at St. An drew's Golf Club.

title: LEASCO REFOCUSING ITS BUSINESS GOALS
description: The Leasco Data Processing Corporation told a meeting of security analysts yesterday that the company planned to focus its efforts on the development of computer services here and abroad.

title: Mediator Named for Talks On Railroad Crew Dispute
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (UPI) Frederick R. Livingston, a New York lawyer with long ex perience in labormanagement relations, was naancl today as a special mediator in the dispute over whether there should he firemen on diesel locomotives.

title: Polish ExDiplomat, a Jew, Given Asylum in Denmark
description: AARHUS, Denmark, Jan. (AP)  Julius KatzSuchy, for mer Polish representative to the United Nations, has been grant ed political asylum in Denmark and has accepted an offer of an assistant professorship at the University of Aarhus.

title: BELGRADE ASSAILS NEW SOVIET VIEW
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Jan. 8 (AP)A Yugoslav Govern ment spokesman charged the Soviet Union today with ma nipulating historical fact and said that this was quite unac ceptable to this independent Communist country.

title: STOCKS IN TOKYO PLUNGE SHARPLY
DOUGLAS R. GRAY
description: MAPLEWOOD, N. J., Jan. 8 Douglas R. Gray of 407 Walton Avenue, former lawyer, retired legal writer, and editor of Cor pus Juris, a case reference vol ume for lawyers, died yesterday at his home. He was 77 years old and lived at 407 Walton Avenue.

title: Kicker Could Be Sunday's Hero
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 8 Bud Grant doesn't go around tossing predictions and dec larations all the time. But when he has something to say, he has been known to be right.

title: Joblessness Reported Steady in December
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8  The nation's unemployment rate continued low in Decem ber, at or near the 3.4 per cent rate of November, it was reported tonight.

title: CARBIDE REDUCES SOLVENTS PRICES
description: The Union Carbide Corpora tion reduced prices yesterday on its major glycol ethers, widely used as industrial sol vents, by amounts ranging from about 12 per cent to more than third.

title: Bus Crash Kills 23 in Brazil
description: BELO HORIZONTE, Brazil, Jan. 8 (AP)Twentythree per sons died today in a fiery bus truck collision near Mantes Calaros, about 320 miles north of here, in eastern Brazil, the police reported. An undeter mined number of bus passen gers were reported seriously in jured.

title: ANOTHER DEMOCRAT SEEKING DODD'S SEAT
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 8Edward L. Marcus of New Haven, Democratic majority leader of the State Senate, said today he would seek the Democratic nomination for the United States Senate. He is the third announced candidate for the nomination.

title: Governor Williams Denies Race Bias in Hurricane Aid
description: BILOXI, Miss., Jan. 8Gov. John Bell Williams interrupted the hearings of a United States Senafe subcommittee today to denounce the leader of the Mississippi branch of the Na tional Association for the Ad vancement of Colored People.

title: Open Road on Wages
description: Secretary of Labor George P. Shultz thinks it time to ease the Government's stranglehold on interest rates. As former dean of a graduate school of business, Dr. Shultz undoubtedly has credentials to advise on monetary policyeven though little in the present runaway state of inflation seems to justify this particular bit of advice.

title: Loss of Instruments Poses No Hurdle for Muscovites
description: The Moscow Philharmonic Orchestra laughed when it sat down to play yesterday afternoon in Philharmonic Hall. Somebody had ne glected to'bring the instru ments.

title: Canadiens Defeat Penguins by 31 To Tie for 2d Spot
description: MONTREAL, Jan. 8 (AP) Jean Beliveau scored one goal and assisted on Bobby Rous seau's tiebreaker tonight to help give the Montreal Cana diens a 31 victory over the Pittsburgh Penguins in the Na tional Hockey League's East Division.

title: ROBERT BARRAT, CHARACTER ACTOR
description: HOLLYWOOD, Jan. 8 (UPI) Robert Barrat, the character actor, died yesterday at Mid way Hospital here of a heart ailment. He was 78 years old.

title: COACH OF VIKINGS CITES FOES' DEPTH
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 8Al though his team is favored by 13 points, Coach Bud Grant of the Minnesota Vikings pre dicted today that Sunday's Super Bowl game here between the Minnesota club and the Kansas City Chiefs would be close.

title: MRS. C. PRESTON KREBS
description: PASCAGOULA, Miss., Jan. 8 Mrs. Agnes O. Krebs died here today of complications after a stroke. She was 76 years old and the widow of C. Preston Krebs.

title: Czechs Tell 2d Newsman In 2 Days to Leave Nation
description: PRAGUE, Jan. 8 (Reuters) Eric Bourne, the East European correspondent of The Christian Science Monitor, was refused renewal of his accreditation and visa today in Czechoslovakia.

title: Archeologists Meet
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., Jan. 8 (AP) The International Society for Historical Archeology opened its third annual meeting today.

title: Abernathy Calls for a People's Holiday' for Dr. King
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (AP) The Rev. Ralph David Aber nathy called today for observ ance next Thursday of the birthday of the Rev. Dr. Mar tin Luther King Jr., as a na tional people's holiday.

title: Okun, in New Book, Urges Federal WagePrice Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (AP)  The creation of a nonpartisa board to serve as an advisory umpire on wage and price in creases was urged today by a former chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers.

title: 7 BLUES SELECTED ON ALLSTAR TEAM
description: The highflying Blues placed seven players among the first 12 selected yesterday for the West Division squad that will meet the East in the National Hockey League AllStar game on Jan. 20.

title: Transport News and Notes
description: SEATTLE, Jan. 8 (AP)  American tourists soon may be paying about $800 each to vacation in Siberia.

title: DeMoss, Mollenkopf No. I Aide, Replacing Him as Purdue Coach
description: LAFAYETE, Ind., Jan. 8 (UPI)  Bob DeMoss, who helped to develop some top quarterbacks as an assistant coach at Purdue, was appointed head coach of the Boilermakers today, succeeding Jack Mollen kopf, who announced his re tirement yesterday.

title: PARAGUAY CURBS RELIEF BY CHURCH
description: ASUNCION, Paraguay, Jan. 7 President Alfredo Stroessner has ordered an end to all Roman Catholic Church welfare services in his country. The move was the latest in a long struggle between the reformist Paraguayan church and Gen eral Stroessner's conservative and authoritarian Government.

title: Peale Invited by Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 8 (AP) Dr. Normal Vincent Peale of New York and the Vienna Boys Choir will be at the White House Sunday to take part in services in the Eeast Room at 1 A.M., Eastern standard time. More than 300 guests, includ ing members of the Cabinet and a group of ambassadors have been invited. Dr. Peale is head of the Marble Collegiate church.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: TROY COUNCIL PICKS MAYOR ON 10TH TRY
description: TROY, N. Y., Jan. 8After an eightday deadlock in the City Council, Nathan Werlin, local pharmacist, was elected Mayor of Troy.

title: Apollo's Schedule Shifted by NASA
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 8  The space agency announced today that it was delaying the next moonlanding flight by a month and stretching out the Apollo project by changing to a sched ule of two launchings a year.

title: ExYouth Corps Aide Testifies 10,500 on Payroll Did No Work
description: A former auditor testified in Manhattan Supreme Court yesterday that 10,500 young sters on the payroll of the city's Neighborhood Youth Corps in August, 1968, did not actually work in the program.

title: Tough Judge on Jersey Bench
description: NEWARK, Jan. 8  The whispered warning, Old Iron Fist wants you, gen erally means here that Dis trict Court Judge Robert Shaw wishes to express his displeasure over an untidy corridor in the Federal Court house, or over a lawyer's lack of preparation. Judge Shaw is presiding over the trial in Federal court of Angelo (Gyp) De Carlo and three codefendants on charges of conspiracy and extortion in loanshark deal ings with the late Louis B. Saperstein, a Newark in surance broker and labor racketeer.

title: T.W T.W.A. Airliner Hijacked To Beirut by a Frenchman
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Friday, Jan. 9An armed European hijacked a Trans World Airlines jet with 20 persons aboard early today and forced the pilot to fly to Beirut. Shortly after the Boeing 707 landed here, the hijacker fired sev eral shots into the plane's instrument panel. Some shots were fired earlier, but nobody was hurt.

title: Sports of The Times
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 8The Rumor is halfway around the world before Truth gets its boots on.

title: Nitro Robber Gets $2,000
description: The American Bank and Trust Company branch at 562 Fifth Avenue, near 46th Street, was robbed of $2,000 yester day by a man wielding a bottle of colored fluid that he de scribed as nitroglycerine, the police said. The man, de scribed as about 30 years of age, approached a teller at 2 P.M. and said in a threatening manner while he held up the bottle of fluid in one hand: This is nitroglycerin; give me $2,000. The teller passed over the money in $20 bills to the man. On his way out, the man dropped the bottle in the lobby. It contained water.

title: KNICKS' BARNETT AN OLD PRO AT 33
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 8A steady rain that diluted the pleasures of a day off amid the beauties of this colorful city was falling as Coach Red Holzman of the New York Knickerbockers spoke about one of his favorite basketball players.

title: Australian Girl Defeats Debbie Meyer in 800
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Jan. 8 (AP)Karen Mores, Aus tralia's 15yearold swimming star, beat Debbie Meyer, the Olympic champion and world recordholder, in the 800 meter freestyle final of the New South Wales champion ships tonight.

title: Merrick Is Buying Stock And May Seek 20thFox
description: David Merrick, Broadway's most successful producer, who sold the movie rights to Hello Dolly to Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation, may be planning to take a much more active interest in the affairs of the movie company.

title: Sellout of Chicago Edison Issue Spurs Advances in Bond Prices
description: The earlyJanuary advance in bond prices and decline in interest rates gained strength yesterday. The Common wealth Edison Company sold a $100million issue of tripleA fiveyear bonds at a yield of 8.44 per cent, and investors quickly purchased all of them. It was the second swift $100million corporate bond sale this week, and it helped push prices of outstanding bonds higher.

title: Washinton: The Triumph of Indifference
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8This Is supposed to be a time of pub lic indignation. You can hardly get to work and back these days without reading about or running into somebody demon strating or picketing over some real or imagined grievance. Authority is said to be on the defensive almost everywhere.

title: Article 4  No Title
Improved Subways Unlikely Till 1971, According to Ronan
description: The higher transit fare that many New Yorkers are now grudgingly paying will not bring with it any immediate improvement in subway serv ice, according to transit offi cials, who acknowledge that service has deteriorated to a serious point in the last year.

title: Those Vintage Dresses That Defy All the Whimsies of Fashion
description: THERE'S practicality, but not much chic, in wearing a dress a year or two old. Transpose the years into decades and it's another matter.

title: Federal Grand Jury in Newark Questions North Bergen Mayor
description: NEWARK, Jan. 8  The Mayor of North Bergen, Angelo J. Sarubbi, was questioned to day by a Federal grand jury investigating municipal crime and corruption in New Jersey.

title: West Berlin Faculty Strikes to Protest Terror by Students
description: BERLIN, Jan. 8  Twenty eight professors of the Free University of West Berlin went on strike today in protest against what they described as student terror. They called a oneweek halt to all lectures and other university work.

title: Borek Cards a 71 for 219 And 2Shot Lead in Florida
description: PALM BEACH GARDENS, Fla., Jan. 8 (AP)Gene Borek, the pro at the Pine Hollow Country Club of East Norwich, L. I., shot a 71 today and took the lead after 54 holes of play in the Professional Golfers As sociation strokeplay champion shin.

title: B52's Strike Suspected Enemy Positions
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 8United States B52 bombers were reported to have struck yesterday and today against suspected enemy posi tions where fighting has in creased recently and where the foe is believed to be concen trating men and supplies.

title: Workers in Okinawa Strike Over Cutbacks at U.S. Bases
description: NAHA, Okinawa, Jan, 8 Thousands of Okinawan work ers on United States military bases went on strike today to protest the reduction of the work force announced here re cently as part of overseas spending cuts by the United States.

title: POLLUTION AGENCY BEING REORGANIZED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (AP)  The Federal Water Pollu tion Control Administration an nounced today a major reor ganization to make this agency more immediately responsive to the enormous water pollution problems in this country.

title: F.T.C. DEFENDANTS TO GET LEGAL AID
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (UPI) The Federal Trade Commis sion voted today to provide legal counsel for the people who cannot afford lawyers to defend them against charges of consumer fraud or other civil violations of the agency's law.

title: Tickets for Frazier Boat To Go On Sale Monday
description: Tickets for the world heavyweight championship fight between Joe Frazier of Philadelphia and Jimmy Ellis of Louisville, Ky., will go on sale Monday at the Madison Square Garden box office.

title: Paul Niven, TV Correspondent, Dies After a Fire Sweeps Home
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8Paul Niven, for 20 years a leading broadcast newsman, died today after a fire swept through his Georgetown home here early this morning. His age was 45.

title: PARTY SHIFT TALKS DENIED BY LINDSAY
description: Mayor Lindsay strongly de nied yesterday that he or his aides had engaged in any dis cussions with top Democratic leaders about his possible con version to the Democratic party, but Deputy Mayor Rich ard R. Aurelio acknowledged that informal talks had taken place.

title: Coeds at Berkeley Demonstrate Against AllMale Karate Class
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Jan. 8 For the last two days members of the militant feminist Wo men's Liberation have demon strated at the University of California demanding ad mittance to the physical edu cation department's karate classes.

title: $15,000 for Winning Player
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 8 (UPI)  The winning team in the Super Bowl Sunday between the Minnesota Vikings and Kansas City Chiefs will dis tribute $15,000 each to its players. The losing team will get $7,500 a man.

title: Foreign Affairs: An Alliance That Never Was
description: SCHRUNS, Austria  One casualty of the nineteen seventies will almost certainly be the SEATO alliance devised in 1954 after France was driven from Vietnam and its former colony partitioned. SEATO has never worked in the sense of safeguarding the area it hoped to protect or mustering in its defense all signatory powers, but it did achieve the principal aim seen for it by its sponsor, John Foster Dulles.

title: Company Officials Send Contribution To Aid the Neediest
description: As we reflect on our good fortunes, we cannot help but be mindful of the countless numbers who are illfed, ill clothed, illhoused and in ill health, the officers of the DoAll Chemical Corporation said in part in a letter to their clients. We have resolved this year to express our thoughts in deeds.

title: GERMANY FACES PRICE PRESSURES
description: FRANKFURT, West Ger many, Jan. 8Three months after the upward revaluation of the mark, West Germany is facing mounting pressure on prices in a period of unparal leled prosperity. Consumer prices are up by 3 per cent, modest rate by most other countries' standards, but ex cessive for Germans, who after a history of currency problems regard price stability almost as a religion.

title: LIBERTY BELL BIG E IS WORTH $15,246
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 8  Four ticketholders among the 6,079 fans hit on the Big E com bination at the Liberty Bell track today and were the win ners of $15246.60.

title: Mafia Miffed by Failure To Make City Crime Pay
description: The Mafia's tribulations  and enormous expenses  out weighed its profits in trying to establish police  protected dice games in New York City during 1961 and 1962, accord ing to a transcript made by the Federal Bureau of Investiga tion.

title: U.S. Again Moves To Organize Talks In Walkout at G.E.
description: The Federal Government's top mediator made a second effort yesterday to bring the General Electric Company and its striking union employes to gether in fruitful negotia tions.

title: Thant Arrives in Ghana
description: ACCRA, Ghana, Jan. 8 (Agence FrancePresse)Secre tary General Thant of the Unit ed Nations was greeted by Prime Minister Kofi A., Busia of Ghana when he arrived here today for a twoday visit. Ghana is the fifth stop on a 10nation tour of West Africa by the Secretary General, who flew here from Liberia.

title: Solti and Chicago Symphony Fit Well
description: It is a temptation to para phrase the old movie slogan and say that Georg Solti is back and the Chicago Symphony Or chestra's got him. It seems too flippant a remark to make about such an august Institution and such a distinguished musician. Still, it's true. And it's important, because the partnership is a great one, judging by the con cert in Carnegie Hall last night. Mr. Solti has not conducted an orchestral program here since 1964, and his appearance comes during his first season as music director of the Chicago en semble. The latter has always been one of the top orchestras in the country, but the conduc tor has had a marked impact on its sound and playing. It made its most notable impres sion of recent visits.

title: REV. DANIEL F. RYAN, FORDHAM LAW DEAN
description: LENOX, Mass., Jan. 8The Rev. Daniel F. Ryan, dean of Fordham University Law School from 1922 to 1925, died today at St. Luke's Hospital in Pitts field. He was 81 years old and lived at the Novitiate of St. Stanislaus in Stockbridge.

title: Sitin at School Board Follows Dispute Over Ocean Hill Posts
description: A new dispute involving ap pointments to the staff of the Ocean HillBrownsville Commu nity Education Center in Brook lyn led to a peaceful sitin yes terday by center employes and their supporters at Board of Education headquarters.

title: SWISS GRANT ASYLUM TO CZECH NEWSMEN
description: GENEVA, Jan. 8Dusan Havlicek, 46yearold Czecho slovak journalist who worked closely with Alexander Dubcek, the dismissed Communist party chief, was granted asylum to day by the Swiss Government.

title: SAMUEL MANCHESTER
description: Samuel E. Manchester, cantor, died Tuesday evening at a hospital in New London, Conn., after a brief illness. He was 88 years old and lived at 28 Channing Street in New London.

title: David Rockefeller Says He Supports Security of Israel
description: David Rockefeller, chairman of the Chase Manhattan Bank, said yesterday that the United States must do all it can to safeguard the security and sov ereign existence of Israel.

title: Paper Institute Appoints
description: The American Paper Institute has announced the appointment of Dixon Donnelly as vice presi dent for public affairs. Mr. Donnelly formerly was special assistant for public affairs to Secretary of the Treasury David M. Kennedy. Prior to that, he was Assistant Secretary of State for Public Affairs.

title: Israel Bars a U.N. Inquiry From Areas She Occupies
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Jan. 8 (Reuters) Israel today re fused to permit a threemember United Nations committee to conduct an inquiry into the ob servance of human rights in Arab territories that she oc cupies.

title: Congressional District Lines
description: As the Federal court deadline approaches for adop tion of constitutionally valid boundaries for the state's 41 Congressional districts, the Republican legislative leaders charged with preparing the new maps say they are not yet ready. If true this is inexcusable, since the deadline of Jan. 30 was fixed last June.

title: Pentagon Profligacy
description: When Senator Proxmire of Wisconsin suggested recently that military spending could be cut by $10 billion, some members of his HouseSenate Economy subcommittee scoffed. But when the subcommittee resumed its probe of Pentagon profligacy last month, Mr. Proxmire demonstrated he was not just pulling figures out of thin air, as his critics had charged.

title: Addict Is Accused Of 200 Cab Holdups In 3 Months Here
description: An alleged drug addict who reportedly spends more than $150 a day on heroin was ar rested yesterday and accused of holding up more than 200 taxicab drivers during the last three months.

title: BLACK ATHLETES ASK ACTION BY ARIZONAU.
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Jan. 8 (AP) Blacks on the University of Arizona basketball team pro posed tonight that a clause be added to the school's scholar ships giving blacks the right to refuse to compete against some teams.

title: Modern Names Hightower Director
description: The board of trustees of the Museum of Modern Art yesterday elected John High tower, executive director of the New York State Council on the Arts, as director. The appointment ends a search that began last May, when the board ousted Bates Lowry, director for less than 10 months.

title: Ginsberg to Quit City Post at End of '70
description: Mitchell I. Ginsberg, head of the often embattled Human Re sources Administration, will leave the city goverAment at the end of this year, Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday.

title: JOB ABUSES PUSH L.I.R.R. COSTS UP, LEVITT CHARGES
description: ALBANY, Friday, Jan. 9A sharply critical audit report of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority's administration of the Long Island Rail Road, with findings of revenue losses and lax supervision of maintenance and train crews, was released yesterday by Controller Arthur Levitt.

title: Kenya Reduces Sentence For New York Photographer
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Jan. 8 (UPI)Kenya's High Court to day substituted a fine of $1,200 for a sentence of 18 months' improsonment and 12 strokes of the cane imposed on a wild life photographer and f writer, Peter Hill Beard of New York Mr. Beard was sentenced in November for assaulting and causing bodily harm to Jared Nzioka, whom he caught poach ing.

title: Port Authority Adopts Budget of $640Million
description: The Port of New York Au thority adopted a record $640.5 million budget for 1970 at its monthly meeting yesterday. Last year's budget was $557.8 million.

title: HINTS OF EASING IN CREDIT EMERGE
description: Hints of a subtle easing in the Federal Reserve System's program of monetary restraint were all around last week, but it would take a brave analyst to predict that credit policy had, in fact, changed.

title: U.S. Regulatory System Urged For Environment in Industry
description: The head of the American Can Company called yesterday for a national body to set policy and make regulations or the orderly use of the country's environment. He suggested the establishment of an agency set up like the Federal Reserve System.

title: SALE OF THEATER ENDS ERA IN MAINE
description: SKOWHEGAN, Me., Jan. 8 Recollections were the order of the day in theatrical circles in Maine yesterday.

title: A Guide to Dining: Well, There's an Oyster Bar at the Plaza
description: A selective list of restau rants in New York and vi cinity is given on this page on Friday. The restaurants are rated four stars to none, based on the relationship of food and service to cost. Credit cards are honored in the restaurants where indi cated.

title: U.S. Ski Teamto Let A.B.C. Film Races
description: THE television controversy between the United States Ski Association and the American Broadcasting Com pany, which erupted last month at the World Cup races at Val d'Isere, France, has been settled.

title: LUTZ AND MIANUS GAIN SEMIFINALS
description: HOBART, Tasmania, Jan. 8 (AP)Bob Carmichael, an Aus tralian who now lives in France, upset topseeded Arthur Ashe of Richmond, 46, 63, 62. to day and wen on to join two Americans, Bob Lutz and Jim McManus, in the semifinals of the Tasmanian tennis cham pionships.

title: Wisconsin Governor Gets Wider Emergency Power
description: MADISON, Wis., Jan. 8 (AP) Disturbed by threats of van dalism against the state Capitol, legislators gave the Wisconsin Governor special authority yes terday to expand his emergency police powers.

title: Burns Urges 3 Special Votes To Fill Vacancies in Assembly
description: The Democratic state chair man, John J. Burns, called on Governor Rockefeller yesterday to order special elections in two Assembly Districts where Democratic incumbents have resigned and a third where the Democratic incumbent is to give up his seat in a month or so.

title: Republicans in Wisconsin Pick New State Chairman
description: MADISON, Wis., Jan. 8 Reed Coleman, 36 years old, a Madison industrialist, was elected today state chairman of the Wisconsin Republican party. He succeeds Ody J. Fish, Pewaukee, who had held the Post for five years.

title: Article 5  No Title
S.E.C. Ends Registration Of M. G. Davis & Co. Here
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (UPI) The Securities and Exchange Commission revoked today the brokerdcaler registration of M. G. Davis & Co. of New York. It also sanctioned four men for violations of antifraud provi sions of Federal securities law.

title: Other Obituaries On Page 33.
description: Other Obituaries On Page 33.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Mrs. King to Get Degree
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Jan. 8 Mrs. Martin Luther King Jr. will receive an honorary degree of doctor of laws from the Uni versity of Bridgeport during graduation exercises for 650 students on Jan. 23. The widow of the slain civilrights leader will be the commencement speaker. Dr. King received an honorary doctorate of laws from the university in 1961.

title: Bridal Set for Margot Waters And Eric R. Warner in August
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Jan. 8Miss Margot Dan forth Waters and Eric Rud loff Warner of Cambridge, Mass., have made plans to be married in August.

title: Ransome J. Williams, 78, Former Carolina Governor
description: MYRTLE BEACH, S. C., Jan. 8 (AP)Former Gov. Ran some J. Williams, who served as chief executive in 1945 and 1946, died here last night. He was 78 years old.

title: Comedie Francaise to Play For 3 Weeks at City Center
description: The Comdie Frangaise will open a threeweek engagement at the City Center on Feb. 3 with the double bill of La Troupe du Roi, consisting of excerpts from plays by Molire, and a new production of Am phitryon.

title: City Hall's EverPresent Don Quixote
description: The bespectacled and bearded scourge, critic and comic relief artist at virtu ally every public City Hall meeting was on hand yester day to lecture the new Board of Estimate.

title: MISSISSIPPI FACES NEGROES' BOYCOTT
description: JACKSON, Miss., Jan. 8  Mississippi Negroes are organ izing economic boycotts of white merchants who are said to support the allwhite private schools being set up to avoid desegregation of public schools.

title: HIGH VATICAN AIDE WILL VISIT NIXON
description: ROME, Jan. 8The Vatican announced today that Arch bishop Giovanni Benelli, one of Pope Paul's most influential ad visers, would discuss world peace and economic develop ment with President Nixon and Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau of Canada during a 10 day visit to North America be ginning Monday.

title: Flyers Rout Kings, 41
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 8 (AP) The Philadelphia Flyers, paced by Gary Dornhoefer's three goals, defeated the Los Angeles Kings, 41, tonight at the Spec trum to move into a tie with the Minnesota North Stars for second place in the National Hockey League's West Division.

title: L.I. RIGHTS GROUP FIGHTS DISMISSAL
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Jan. 8 Ralph Watkins, chairman of the Suffolk Human Relations Com mission, said today that the executive director of the com mission was illegally removed from his office last month by County Executive H. Lee Den nison.

title: Silent Screen, at 128 Pounds, Heads Experimental Rankings
description: Silent Screen, the New York bred colt considered pounds the best of last year's 2year olds, was rated five pounds the best yesterday by Tommy Trotter.

title: High State Court Upholds Right Of Nader to Sue General Motors
description: ALBANY, Jan. 8The state's highest court today upheld the right of Ralph Nader, a leading auto safety advocate, to sue the General Motors Corporation for invasion of privacy.

title: Edwards Rites Tomorrow
description: A funeral service will be held tomorrow at 11 A.M. at the Mount Zion Baptist Church in Hammond, Ind., for James Ed wards, the actor, who died of a heart attack on Sunday in San Diego, Calif. He was 51 years old. Mr. Edwards is sur vived by his widow, the former Mrs. Leola Mosley of St. Albans, Queens; a daughter, Eugia, and a stepdaughter, Pamula, his father, James Edwards, and his mother, Mrs. Anne Riley, both of Hammond, four sisters, and four brothers.

title: The Vanishing Loyalty Oath
description: The end of the loyalty oath for Federal workers has come so quietly, almost surreptitiously, that one hardly knows that a political sin of historic dimen sions has at long last been abjured. Through the dark McCarthy years many an outraged citizen fought this futile and demeaning requirement with no visible result except to draw suspicion on himself as a prob able subversive. Now, the Civil Service Commission has discarded it as though it were nothing more than a social custom no longer de rigueur. Surely the moment deserves a less muted observance.

title: Wholesale Prices Up But Rise Rate Lags
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8  In dustrial wholesale prices rose by four tenths of one per cent in December, the Labor Depart ment reported today.

title: Bethlehem Steel Elects
description: Thomas S. Gates, chairman of the executive committee of J. P. Morgan & Co., Inc., and of its subsidiary, the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company of New York, has been elected to the board of the Bethlehem Steel Corporation. He was Sec retary of Defense in the final year of the Eisenhower Admin istration.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
FRIED & CO. SUES COMMONWEALTH
description: A Wall Street firm has charged that the Common wealth United Corporation stripped the Seeburg Corpora tion of its assets in exchange for virtually worthless Com monwealth securities.

title: State Department Urges South Africa Admit Ashe
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (Reu ters)  The State Department said today it had asked the South African Government to give sympathetic consideration to a request by Arthur Ashe to play in the South African tennis championships in April.

title: Reports on Skiing Conditions in the East
News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, JANUARY 9, 1970

title: L.I. Trust Merger Set
description: Directors of the Long Island Trust Company, Garden City, and of the Seaside Bank, West Hampton Beach, announced yesterday approval of a merger calling for the exchange of nine shares of Long Island Trust for each share of Seaside.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: Additional News Of Sports Events On Page 30

title: STATE'S TOP COURT RULES ON ART SALE
description: A Los Angeles art collector who bought two paintings at auction by telephoning from California to New York while the sale was in progress, and then refused to accept his pur chases, discovered yesterday that contrary to his conten tion he could be sued in the New York courts.

title: State Tax Increase in '71 Predicted by Conservative
description: James D. Griffin, executive director of the state's Conser vative party, said yesterday that Governor Rockefeller's message to the Legislature on Wednesday was a political blueprint for election  year spending paid for by tax in creases the year after election.

title: ARMY LETTER BARS CLUB PROFITS TRIAL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (UPI) The Army, in a letter released today, said it lacked sufficient evidence to bring criminal charges against a group of career sergeants accused in Senate testimony of reaping fortunes from servicemen's clubs at home and abroad.

title: CLASSICS DONE WELL BY MUSICA AETERNA
description: There were all kinds of en joyment at the Musica Aeterna concert led by Frederic Wald man at Tully Hall last night. There was also something to quibble about.

title: Market Place
description: WHEN Howard Butcher 3d that anomaly of anom alies, an outspoken Philadel phia financierrattles off a story about the Penn Central Company, even Wall Street listens.

title: Vietnam Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (AP) The Defense Department to day listed the names of the following servicemen from the New York area as having been killed in Vietnam:

title: New Orleans Heart Implant
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 8 (UPI) William I. Taylor, 52 years old, of Metairie, La., received today the heart of a 36yearold woman in a threehour opera tion. The woman had died of a brain hemorrhage. The patient was listed in satisfactory condi tion after the operation at Ochsner Foundation Hospital. It was Louisiana's first, and the world's 151st, human heart transplant.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: THE AMERICAN Littoral Society has asked Wil liam T. Cahill, New Jersey's new governor, to renew, and then honor, the moratorium, begun June 21, 1969, intended to halt sale of stateowned tidelands.

title: HILTON WILL ACCEPT MAJOR CREDIT CARDS
description: The Hilton Hotels Corpora tion, in a major departure from a practice initiated almost 10 years ago, disclosed yesterday that it now would accept Amer ican Express and Diners' Club credit cards in addition to Carte Blanche cards.

title: MOON SOIL CARBON GAINS WITH DEPTH
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 8  Analy sis of material collected by driv ing a tube into the moon's sur face at the Apollo 12 landing site has shown that the rich ness in carbon at a depth of one foot is about seven times what it is at the surface.

title: In Art Class, a 3YearOld Can Learn About the World
description: THERE was paint every where: all over the vinyl coated tarpaulin on the floor; streaked up and down the walls, and joyously slathered on sheets of paper that hung from clothespins on a drying line. And on the smocks of the 3yearolds who had come to the art class that morning.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor:

title: WESTBURY FREEZE WARMS FAVORITES
description: WESTBURY L. I., Jan. 8 A gathering of 9,879 action seekers exhibited disdain of the 10degree temperature in a courageous attempt to fight the battle of the mutuel ma chines at Roosevelt Raceway tonight. The battle had its fair share of reward to those fans conservative enough to go with the favorite in the feature event on the ninerace card, a Class B1 pace of one mile.

title: Physician Weds Barbara Jeffrey
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 Miss Barbara Vereina Jeffrey was married here this eve ning to Dr. Winslow Brab son, a resident physician at the George Washington Uni versity Hospital. The Rev. Phillip Wheaton performed the ceremony in St. Augus tine's Episcopal Chapel.

title: CUNNINGHAM OFFERS WALKAROUND TIME
description: Walkaround Time, choreo graphed two years ago, is one of Merce Cunningham's lengthi est and least Cunninghamish works.

title: Carrier Ending Active Duty
description: BREMERTON, Wash., Jan. 8 (AP)The aircraft carrier Ben nington, which underwent nu merous conversions to keep up with changing national defense needs since her commissioning in 1944, will join the mothball fleet here Jan. 15.

title: Navy Quintet Routs Gettysburg, 7656, Ends Losing Streak
description: ANNAPOLIS, Jan. 8 (AP) Jack Conrad scored 24 points today as Navy routed Gettys burg, 7656. The victory broke a ninegame losing string for the midshipmen.

title: New College Names Chief
description: BAR HARBOR, Mc., Jan. 8 (AP)Trustees of the College of the Atlantic, which will open in 1971, announced today the appointment of Edward G. Kael ber, 45 years old, as its first president. He has been associate dean of Harvard's graduate school of education for six years.

title: ALFRED BURGENI, RESEARCH LEADER
description: Dr. Alfred A. Burgeni, a phy sical chemist, who held basic patents on absorbent fiber structures widely used in sani tary napkins, died Tuesday at, St. Barnabas Medical Center in Livingston, N. J. He was 66 years old and lived at 10 Park Road, Short Hills, N. J.

title: CHEMICAL SHIPMENT EXPLODES UPSTATE
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N. Y., Jan. 8A freight car with 65,000 pounds of sodium peroxide ex ploded in the Penn Central rail road yards here today, shaking nearby houses. There were no injuries.

title: MARKET INCHES UP AS CAUTION REIGNS
description: The stock market, with in vestor caution holding most price changes to a narrow range, moved up a little yester day after dipping in the pre vious session.

title: Estrada Picked by Mets To Coach Farm Pitchers
description: Chuck Estrada, the rookie star of the Baltimore Orioles' pitching staff a decade ago, was named the minor league pitching coach of the New York Mets yesterday.

title: U.N. Aides Meet on Mideast
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 8 (Reuters)  Representa tives of the United States, the Soviet Union, Britain and France held their second meet ing of this week today on the Middle East crisis.

title: Designer of PostWar Jeepster Turns Sports Car Into Speedboat
description: IT'S a car! It's a boat! It's a dynamic duo! Persons at tending the San Francisco Boat Show, which begins to day and runs through Jan. 18, will be treated to a sight that could well have come from a James Bond movie an automobile that disen gages its outer shell and turns into a high powered speed boat. This time, however, the creator was not Hollywood but rather, Brooks Stevens, the designer of, among other things, the remodeled post war Jeepster and the schmal tzy Excalibur motor car.

title: BIAFRAN DISPUTES REPORT OF LOSSES.
description: PARIS, Jan. 8 Dr. K. O. Dike, Biafra's roving ambassa dor, acknowledged today that the secessionist territory had suffered a setback in one or two sectors of the 30month old war with Nigeria, but de clared that the area now held by Biafra was twice as large as it was in September. 1968.

title: Woman Survives Fall Under subway Train
description: A. 59yearold woman fell from the platform of the IND station at 42d Street and Eighth Avenue yesterday and rolled into the trough as two cars of a southbound E train passed over her with out touching her.

title: SIDNEY P. M'CORD JR., LAWYER IN JERSEY
description: COLLINGSWOOD, N. J., Jan. 8 (AP)Sidney P. McCord Jr., a Camden County lawyer and former Republican Assembly man, died Thursday at his home, 441 Collings Avenue. He was 57 years old.

title: Agnew Winning Praise on Diplomatic Trip
description: SINGAPORE, Friday, Jan. 9 Vice President Agnew stepped confidently to the first tee of the Royal Selangor Golf Course in Malaysia, took a practice swing and then drove the ball 180 yards down the middle.

title: Boston Utility Rebuffed
description: BOSTON, Jan. 8 (AP)The Massachusetts Public Utilities Commission today denied a re quest by the Boston Edison Company for a $3.5million an nual rate increase but granted permission to file new tariffs for an annual increase of $1.9 million to become effective 14 days after filing.

title: Indian Dies at Alcatraz
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 8 (UPI)Yvonne Oakes, the 12 yearold daughter of Richard Oakes, the leader of the Indians who are occupying Alcatraz Is land, died today of head injuries suffered in a fall at the old Fed eral penitentiary.

title: WestEast Car Smuggling Ring In Europe Is Reported Broken
description: VIENNA, Jan. 8Austrian and Italian police in a coordi nated action during the last few days are reported to have broken up an international ring that stole autos in the West to smuggle them into Eastern Europe.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: RELIGIOUS SERVICES

title: French Dismiss 2 Aides Who Had Gunboat Role
description: PARIS, Jan. 8Two high officials suspended last week for their role in allowing Is rael to gain control of five gunboats that France had embargoed have been dis missed from their posts.

title: Rapist's Execution Stayed
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (AP) Lucious Jackson, a convicted Georgia rapist, was granted a stay of execution today by United States Supreme Court Justice Hugo L. Black. Jackson was to have been executed to morrow. The stay will keep him alive at least until the Supreme Court considers an appeal.

title: James M. Hanrihan, Agent Called Richard LaMarr, 65
description: James Merlin Hanrihan, a theatrical agent under the name of Richard LaMarr, was found dead in his apartment at 101 West 55th Street early Wednes day after a fire. He would have been 66 years on Tuesday.

title: Masefield Suffered On The Lonely Sea
description: The British poet laureate John Masefield (18781967) became famous for his cele bration of the sea beginning:

title: American Museum Seeking $25Million
description: The American Museum of Natural History opened a $25 million centennial fundraising drive yesterday, seeking to en large and improve its over crowded facilities as it moved into its second century.

title: Karen Kredo to Be Wed To M. N. Daroff in June
description: ORELAND, Pa., Jan. 8  The engagement of Miss Karen Lynne Kredo to Mit chell N. Daroff has been announced by the future bride's parents, Dr. and Mrs. Albert H. Kredo. Her fianc is the son of Michael Daroff, president and board chair man of Botany Industries, Inc., and Mrs. Daroff of Philadelphia and Bal Harbor, Fla.

title: HUSSEIN IS HOPEFUL ON MIDEAST PEACE
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 8 King Hussein of Jordan told his people in a broadcast tonight that there was still a chance for a political settlement of the conflict with Israel.

title: Theresa Linda Mak Is Betrothed
description: Announcement has been made here by Mr. and Mrs. James Mak of Sao Paulo, Brazil, of the engagement of their daughter, Miss Theresa Linda Mk, a student at the Newton (Mass.) College of the Sacred Heart, to Thomas K. Hsu of Cambridge, Mass.

title: Police Say Prints Weren't Sought on Panther Guns
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 8The police sergeant who led a predawn raid in which two Black Pan thers were slain told a special coroner's jury today that the police had not checked for fingerprints any of the weapons they said they had seized in the raid.

title: 2 RADICALS OFFER CONTRAST AT TRIAL
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 8Two di vergent wings of the American radical movement went on dis play today at the Chicago con spiracy trial.

title: Lebanon Struck Again
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 8 For the third time in a week, Israeli jets attacked southern Lebanon today, striking at tar gets  presumably commando campson the western side of Mount Hermon between Ras haiya, Kfar Shaba, Kfar Haman and Ain Qiniya.

title: 400 PROTEST FARE TO FAR ROCKAWAY
description: About 400 subway riders staged a noisy, twohour demon stration at the Far Rockaway terminal of the IND line last night, demanding a single in stead of double 30cent fares for the ride onto the peninsula.

title: NO HALPERN CENSURE, HOUSE UNIT DECIDES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (UPI) The House Ethics Committee has concluded it cannot censure Representative Seymour Hal pern, New York Republican who accepted unsecured loans from banks that were interested in bills before the House Banking Committee, of which he is a member.

title: Millikan Memorial Reset
description: A memorial program honor ing the late Dr. Max F. Milli kan, director of the Massa chusetts Institute of Technol ogy's Center for International Studies, will be held at 4 P.M. on Feb. 17 at the institute's Kresge Auditorium in Cam bridge, Mass. Dr. Millikan, who died Dec. 14, was director of the center for 18 years. The memorial was originally sched uled for yesterday.

title: Dutch Group Plans to Place Married Priests in Parishes
description: NOORDWIJKERHOUT, the Netherlands, Jan. 8 (UPI)A group of liberal Dutch priests said today that they would place married Roman Catholic priests in communities willing to accept them without waiting on a new policy ruling from the Dutch Episcopate.

title: WELFARE MARCH ON ALBANY SET UP
description: A march on the State Capitol is being planned by welfare groups for Feb. 17, when poor people throughout the state are scheduled to board buses and ride in caravans to Albany to demand more money.

title: 12Lane Section to Open On Jersey Turnpike
description: The New Jersey Turnpike will open its first 12lane section running for 20 miles north from the new Inter change 10 at Edison, north of New Brunswick, to the New ark area, on Monday.

title: JULIUS STONE
description: Julius Stone, a theatrical treasurer and manager, died of heart failure Wednesday at In terboro General Hospital in Brooklyn. He was 78 years old and lived at 24033 Newhall Avenue in Rosedale, Queens.

title: REUTHER ATTACKS INFLATION POLICY
description: DETROIT, Jan. 8  Walter P. Reuther, the president of the United Automobile Workers, said today that the Nixon Ad ministration was obsessed with fighting inflation and pre dicted a recession in three to four months unless national economic policy was changed.

title: MORTIMER RODGERS, GYNECOLOGY HEAD, 71
description: Dr. Mortimer W. Rodgers, di rector of gynecology and ob stetrics at Lenox Hill Hospital from 1956 to 1962 and presi dent of its medical board in 195960, died Wednesday at Memorial Hospital. He was 71 years old and lived at 132 East 72d Street. He was the brother of Richard Rodgers, the com poser.

title: 2 HARTWICK STARS PICKED IN SOCCER
description: Len Rencry, a halfback from Columbia, and Abdula Lama, the outside right of New York University, were named yester day to the AllAmerica team by the National Soccer Coaches Association.

title: Oil Tests on North Slope Good; Mobil Sees Significant Potential
description: The Mobil Oil Corporation announced yesterday the first actual production test results of oil drilling on the North Slope of Alaska and said the results indicated that the wells there had good producing characteristics and signifi cant potential.

title: Indicted State Senator To Seek Reelection
description: ALBANY, Jan. 8Senator William E. Adams, Buffalo Republican, who is under Federal indictment on a per jury charge, has announced he will seek reelection this year.

title: Asghar Khan Plans to Run
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Jan. 8 (Reuters)Air Marshal Moham mad Asghar Khan, former commander of the Pakistani Air Force, announced today that he would reenter politics only a month after saying he had quit. The 48yearold air marshal said at a news confer ence that he would campaign as an independent in the Na Itional Assembly elections sched uled for Oct. 5.

title: Executive Changes
description: Frederick N. Goodrich, executive vice president of the United States Trust Company of New York, has been elected vice president of the board of the United States Trust Company International Corpo ration.

title: Railroad Negotiators Agree To a Recess Until Jan. 19
description: WASHINGTON, (UPI)Con tract talks resumed today be tween the nation's railroads and four shop craft unions, but after a twohour session were recessed until Jan. 19the final day of a nostrike pledge by the unions.

title: Carlos Is Hoping Pro Football Keeps Him in 100Yard Range
description: By the end of this month, John Carlos will learn what the professional football scouts really think of him as a 6foot3inch, 205pound prospect.

title: Article 1  No Title
Loew's Theatres Conducts Its Talkathon
description: For two hours and fortyfive minutes yesterday, stockhold ers of Loew's Theatres, Inc., were treated to a spectacle of sight and sound that included drama, laughter, chitchat, cheers, jeers and Just plain boredom.

title: France Arms the Arabs
description: The longterm cause of FrenchAmerican friendship and the more immediate problem of peace in the Middle East are not well served by the State Depart ment's effort to shrug off reports of substantial French arms sales to Libya.

title: PRISONERSUICIDE CALLED AN ADDICT
description: The deputy chief medical ex aminer for Kings County said yesterday that the hanging death Wednesday of a prison er in the Brooklyn House of Detention was suicide and that marks on one arm of the vic tim indicated that he was a narcotics addict.

title: Tennessee Court Bars Ray's Plea for New Trial
description: KNOXVILLE, Term., Jan. 8 The Tennessee Supreme Court refused today to hear argu ments for a new trial for James Earl Ray, serving a 99year sentence in the 1968 slaying of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. in Memphis. An eight page unanimous opinion said:

title: Apollo Conference Ends With a Wealth of Data but an Unclear Picture of Lunar Origin
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 8Scientists ended a fourday lunar science conference today with the frustrated confession that they had a wealth of information but no clear picture of the origin, evolution or structure of the moon.

title: MARAVICH STILL NO. 1 IN COLLEGE SCORING
description: Pete Maravich of Louisana State University leads the major college basketball scorers for the 29th straight week and needs only a 10.5 average the remainder of this season to break the scoring record of 2,973 points by Oscar Robertson of Cincinnati in 195860.

title: Chadbourn Set to Expand
description: Chadbourn, Inc., Charlotte, N.C., one of the hosiery indus try's largest producers and the only one that is also making its own nylon yarn, is prepar ing to enter the carpet indus try, both as a producer and yarn maker.

title: Increase in Melville's Bail Upheld in BombsPlot Case
description: The United States Court of Appeals yesterday upheld the doubling of bail to $100,000 for Samuel J. Melville, one of three persons charged with conspiring to bomb government property.

title: South African Miners Killed
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Jan. 8 (Reuters)Five African miners were killed and one was seriously injured in a rockfall at the Free State Ge duld gold mine at Welkom to day.

title: JAMES SADLER BAKER
description: James Sadler Baker, a senior geologist on the headquarters staff of Mobil Oil Corpora tion's international division, died Tuesday at Midtown Hos pital here. He was 46 years old and lived at 53 Jonathan Road, New Canaan. Conn.

title: TV Review
description: As Bob Newhart readily acknowledged, last night's special was something of an impossible mission, taking A Last Laugh at the 60's. Trying to summarize 10 years of comedy in 60 minutes would seem the quickest route to madness for any editor, and the chronicle over the American Broadcasting Company net work never aspired to any thing like completeness. But even within the time limita tions the show had some fleeting funny moments.

title: Independent Rival Accuses Cahill of Filing False Oath
description: TRENTON, Jan. 8 (AP) Jack D. Alvino of Trenton, an unsuccessful independent candi date for Governor last year, filed a criminal complaint to day against Governorelect Wil liam T. Cahill, charging the Republican with signing a false oath about campaign expendi tures.

title: Nixon Registers to Vote in California Elections
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 8  President Nixon registered today as a voter in the state where he began his political career and on which the Re publican party is pinning much of its political future.

title: PALMER, ON 35, 32, IS ONE SHOT BACK
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 8  Arnold Palmer came within a stroke of catching the three who shared the firstround lead today in the $100,000 Los Angeles Open, as a new year began on the pro golf circuit.

title: Chiefs Named Home Team; 2Point Conversion Barred
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 8 (UPI) The Kansas City Chiefs, repre senting the American Football League in Sundays Super Bowl, have been declared the home team and will wear their colored jerseysred with white numer als. The Minnesota Vikings will wear white jerseys with purple numerals.

title: Severe Quake in Yunnan Is Confirmed by Peking
description: HONG KONG, Friday, Jan. 9 (Reuters)The Chinese Com munists confirmed today that a severe earthquake rocked the southern province of Yun nan Monday.

title: City Shivers as Cold Numbs Wide Area
description: Temperatures fell to their lowest point of the season yes terday in the metropolitan area, causing delays on subways and trains and the cancellation of six of the 12 daily New York Washington Metroliners.

title: HUGHES CONDEMNS RELEASE OF TAPES
description: TRENTON, Jan. 8  Gov. Richard J. Hughes denounced today the public release of the Federal Bureau of Investi gation's transcripts of recorded Mafia conversations.

title: U.S. AIDE PREDICTS HEALTH INSURANCE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (UPI) The Surgeon General of the Public Health Service, Dr. Jesse L. Steinfeld, believes that the country is moving toward a na tional health insurance program and that the Federal Govern ment should begin pilot projects to prepare for it.

title: 6 GOLF PROS GAIN OPEN EXEMPTIONS
description: Frank Beard, the leading moneywinner on the pro tour last year, and five other players not otherwise eligible have been declared exempt from local and sectional qualifying for the 1970 United States Open champion ship through a new point sys tem adopted by the United States Golf Association.

title: Defense Accuses Shaw Of Political Motivation
description: NEWARK, Jan. 8  Defense attorneys tried again today and failed to get Federal Judge Rob ert Shaw to disqualify himself from continuing to conduct the conspiracyextortion trial of Angelo (Gyp) De Carlo, a re puted Mafia figure, and three others.

title: $6Million Is Asked to Help Hebrew Day Schools Here
description: The Association of New York City Yeshiva Principals and Ad ministrators said yesterday that it would picket the Federation of Jewish Philanthropies unless the federation gave financial assistance to the 150 Hebrew day schools in the metropolitan area.

title: City Hall Making No Move to Put Shanker in Jail
description: The Lindsay administration has made no move to carry out a 15day jail sentence imposed on Albert Shanker, president of the teachers' union, because he led three illegal school strikes in the fall of 1968.

title: Jersey Standard Adds Unit
description: The Standard Oil Company (New Jersey) announced yester day the formation of a public affairs department and the ap pointment of Charles O. Peyton as its head, Mr. Peyton former ly was executive vice president and a director of Esso International, Inc., a subsidiary of Jersey Standard. The activities of the new department will in clude functions previously as signed to the government rela tions and public relations de partments and will also be re sponsible for specialized activi ties in education, urhan affairs and air and water conservation.

title: NEGRO GROUP ASKS USE OF 2 ISLANDS
description: Dr. Thomas W. Matthew, head of NEGRO, the National Economic Growth and Recon struction Organization, said yesterday that his black self help program would ask Pres ident Nixon for the use of Ellis and Alcatraz Islands.

title: Satellite Shot Called Off
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Jan, 8 (UPI) A second attempt to launch a communications satellite that is insured against launching failure was called off tonight because of a leak in the rocket's second stage. The launching morns rescheduled for 6:10 P.M. tomorrow.

title: PRICES GAIN AGAIN IN AMEX TRADING
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange continued to move higher yesterday as the trading pace increased.

title: Inquiry Is Ordered Into Mine Election
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 Secretary of Labor George P. Shultz ordered today a full scale investigation of the United Mine Workers of America election in which Joseph A. Yablonski was de feated by the incumbent union president, W. A. (Tony) Boyle.

title: Maine Bars Governor Raise
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Jan. 8 (AP) The Legislature dropped to day a bill that would double the Governor's annual salary to $40,000. On a 19to10 standing vote, the Senate followed earli er House action in accepting an ought not to pass report on the measure from the State Government Committee.

title: F.B.I. Holds 5 as Cheats In Gambling on Planes
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 8 (AP) Five men, accused of cheat ing passengers in card and dice games on plane flights to Las Vegas, were arrested today by agents of the Fed eral Bureau of Investigation.

title: U.S. AND RED CHINA AGREE TO RESUME WARSAW PARLEYS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8The United States and Communist China agreed today to resume their formal ambassadorial meetings in Warsaw after a twoyear suspension.

title: Began as Strongman
description: Mr. Barrat, who played many gruff, tough character roles in feature movie assignments, was born here on July 10, 1891, and was educated in local pub lic schools. He began his acting career as a teenager with a stock company in Springfield, Mass., and subsequently ap peared in a long series of roles in stock touring companies and on Broadway, including the 1928 production of Eugene O'Neill's Marco Millions.

title: Canadian Women Plan Maple Leaf Dance for Jan. 23
description: The Canadian Women's Club of New York will hold its 50th anniversary Maple Leaf dinner dance at the Plaza on Jan. 23.

title: GUERRILLAS YIELD TO BEIRUT'S PLEA
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 8 Interior Minister Kamal Jum blatt announced today that a new agreement had been reached with Palestinian guer rillas operating in Lebanon in which the guerrillas promised to refrain from shooting across the border into Israel.

title: DDT Ban Voted in Wisconsin
description: MADISON,Wis., Jan. 8The Wisconsin Senate today com pleted legislative action and sent to Gov. Warren P. Knowles a bill that imposes an immediate statewide ban on the sale and use of the pesticide DDT.

title: Margaret E. Smith Prospective Bride
description: WELLFLEET, Mass., Jan 8 Miss Margaret E. Smith, an insurance underwriter with Chubb & Son, Inc., in New York, and Ens. Law rence L. Hale, U.S.C.G.R., will be married here on June 28.

title: Marsha Kesselman, a Student, Engaged to Jeffrey Silverman
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., Jan. 8 Mr. and Mrs. Sanford E. Kesselman have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Marsha Kes selman, to Jeffrey Alan Sil verman. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Lloyd Silverman of Somerville. A wedding in September is planned.

title: ROBINSON JOINS CHIEFS' WORKOUT
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 8 Among the Kansas City Chiefs, there is little doubt that Johnny Robinson will be their free safetyman when the Super Bawl game begins. He suffered damaged ribs last Sunday in the American Football League championship game, but his teammates rememoer an inci dent that occurred a few sea sons ago.

title: Bridge:
description: MANY famous personalities in bridge could claim to have contributed more than anyone else to the promo tion of the game. One of the strongest candidates would certainly be Richard L. Frey of Greenwich. Conn., who re tires today after 12 years as director of public relations for the American Contract Bridge League.

title: MELVIN A. ZURN, LED CONTROLS COMPANY
description: Melvin A. Zurn of Erie, Pa., chairman from 1956 to 1965 of Zurn Industries, Inc., producers of equipment for the environ mental control field, died Wednesday at the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minn. He was 69 years old.

title: Chrysler Realigns TopManagement Ranks
description: DETROIT, Jan. 8  The Chrysler Corporation, pressed by sales and profit problems the last year, realigned its man agement today.

title: PAPER SCORES SOVIET ON TALKS WITH CHINA
description: HONG KONG, Friday, Jan. 9 A Communist newspaper that maintains close ties with Pe king reported today that two months of negotiations be tween China and the Soviet Union on border questions had failed to produce any results and said that the Soviet Union was to blame.

title: Home Appliances Said to Mask Noise of Planes Near Airports
description: A novel method of minimiz ing aircraft noise in homes near airports was outlined here yes terday at the monthly meeting of the TriState Transportation Commission.

title: ARMY NEWSMAN DISPUTES CHARGES
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 18The Army broadcaster who accused the United States com mand of censorship last week end took issue today with court martial charges that have been lodged against him in connec tion with a previous incident.

title: Mormons Reaffirm Curb on Negroes
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 8 The top leadership of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latterday Saints (Mormon) has reemphasized its re ligious policy that bars Ne groes from priesthood in the

title: Theater: Camino Real After 17 Years
Integration: Mississippi Town Isn't Like It Used to Be
description: HOT COFFEE, Miss., Jan. 8 Thirsty visitors here may choose between water or soft drinks or, rumor has it, highquality moonshine whisky, but the steaming liquid for which this tiny village was named is not available.

title: Israelis Say They Shot Down 3 Syrian MIG21's
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 8Israel re ported today that her pilots had shot down three Syrian MIG21 jets, bombed Egyptian military installations for more than two hours and strafed guerrilla bases in Lebanon for an hour and a half.

title: Norwalk Armory Started
description: NORWALK, Conn., Jan. 8 Ground was broken today for a new National Guard district ar mory on an 11acre site off New Canaan Avenue, just below the Merritt Parkway. It will cost $1.3million and will contain a drill hall, office wing and main tenance facilities. It is expected to be completed in 15 months.

title: REV. RUSH SLOANE, 85, LONG ISLAND RECTOR
description: GLEN COVE, L. I., Jan. 8 The Rev. Rush Richard Sloane, rector emeritus of St. John's of Lattingtown Episcopal Church, Locust Valley, died today in Community Hospital. He was 85 years old and lived at 5 Cir cle Drive.

title: Tucker, at Met 25 Years, Still Isn't Slowing Down
description: Success hasn't spoiled Rich ard Tucker. It has just made him run harder.

title: Books of The Times
description: SOME novels are better to have read than to read. Julian Mitchell's fifth, and first to be published in this country, is a case in point. The first half of The Undiscovered Country consists of an autobiographical account  complete with real people and events (Oxbridge literateurs and incidents in Mr. Mitchell's writing career)  of his deep friend ship with one Charles Hum phries, the pseu donym of an ac tual person, Mr. Mitchell tells us in an introductory note. It was a friendship that be gan in 1944 when Julian and Charles were new boys together at a prep school in the Mid lands and lasted until Charles's death 21 years later. It was a frustrating, be wildering friendship, from Julian's point of view, and from ours, too, since we experi ence it anew through Julian's eyes.

title: Thieu Says U.S. Combat Troops Cannot All Be Withdrawn in '70
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, Jan. 9  President Nguyen Van Thieu said today that it would be impossible and impractical to withdraw all American combat troops from South Vietnam in 1970.

title: GOLD HITS $34.95; BUYERS ARE WARY
description: LONDON, Jan. 8 (Reuters) Gold was offered for sale here today at its Lowest price in more than 12 years, but no body wanted to buy it.

title: Officer Named by Fund For Mutual Depositors
description: The election of Roger F. Murray as president of the Fund for Mutual Depositors, Inc., was announced by the mutual fund. He is a director of the fund and chairman of its investment committee.

title: Japanese Outpoints Korean
description: TOKYO, Jan. 8 (AP)Koichi Okada, a Japanese bantam weight contender, won a unani mous decision tonight from LIChong Pak, of South Korea, in a 10round bout. There were no knockdowns. Okada weighed 122 pounds, Pak 122.

title: CITY SCHOOL AIDES CONFER IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, Jan. 8Staff aides to Governor Rockefeller and the state legislative leaders conferred today With New York City school officials to clear the way for early passage next week of changes in the school decentralization plan.

title: BULLS HAND SUNS 152123 TROUNCING
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 8 (AP)The Chicago Bulls compiled the big gest point total in their four year National Basketball Asso ciation history tonight by rout ing the Phoenix Suns. 152123.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES SHOW SOME GAINS
description: The price pep was out of the grain and soybean markets yesterday following their rise earlier in the week because of the bad weather. Yesterday, at the close of trading, soy beans had edged forward by about a cent a bushel in some contracts, corn was up by a fraction of a cent a bushel, and wheat dropped by a frac tion of a cent.

title: Closed Inquest Into Kopechne Death Ends; judge Is Planning an Early Report to Court
description: EDGARTOWN, Mass., Jan. 8  The closed inquest into the death of Mary Jo Kopechne, who drowned when Senator Ed ward M. Kennedy's automobile plunged from a bridge on Chap paquiddick Island the night of July 18, ended today.

title: U.S. PLAN ON TALKS SPURNED BY HANOI
description: PARIS, Jan. 8  The United States today revived a proposal to begin restricted sessions of the Vietnam peace talks as a way of ending sterile de bate.

title: Rail TonMileage Drops 3.5% From YearAgo Level
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 The Association of American Railroads reported freight traf fic in the week ended Jan. 3 totaled an estimated 11.1 bil lion tonmiles, 3.5 per cent be low the corresponding week last year. Carloadings for the same week totaled 386,829 cars, a decrease of 19,603 cars, or 4.8 per cent below the same period last year.

title: Italian Church Looted; Loss Put at $800,000
description: PESCARA, Italy, Jan. 9 (AP)  Thieves using poles, iron bars and pickaxes broke into a church here today and made off with gold and art objects valued at $800,000.

title: DE CARLO WITNESS GOT RICH IN HURRY
description: NEWARK, Jan. 9The con spiracy  extortion trial of An gelo (Gyp) De Carlo, a 67year old reputed Mafia figure, was enlivened today with a dazzling tale by a 32yearold witness of how he made a $1million in five years and paid no income taxes on it.

title: NEW ENVOY FOR U.S. ARRIVES IN ATHENS
description: ATHENS, Jan. 9Henry J. Tasca, the new United States Ambassador to Greece, arrived in Athens today.

title: Fans Barter Super Bowl Seats
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 9Max Winter, small and smiling, has been a promoter of sports and theatrical enterprises for many years, always hustling tickets in his hometown of Minneapolis. This has been a strange week for Winter, the president of the Minnesota Vikings, because people are begging him for Super Bowl tickets and he has none to spare.

title: POLICE TO RESUME FULL DUTY IN ULSTER
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, San. 9 (Reuters)The British Army, which took over security duties here following bloody religious riots in the summer, will soon hand back full respon sibility to the police, it was announced here tonight.

title: Sweden Aids Red Cross
description: STOCKHOLM, Jan. 9 (Reu ters)  The Swedish Govern ment today allocated $775,000 to the International Red Cross for humanitarian aid to Viet nam. The sum was requested by the international organiza tion, which will decide how it will be divided between North and South Vietnam, the Foreign Minister here said.

title: McCarthy Near End of Visit
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 9 (AP)Sen ator Eugene J. McCarthy, in the fourth day today of a scheduled fiveday visit here, had no in dication he would see Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin, which he hoped to do. Yesterday the Minnesota Democrat visited the Soviet Institute for the Study of the United States and the Institute of World Economy and International Relations.

title: Proposed Fare Increase Is Protested
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Jan. 9 Commuter organizations voiced anger, riders expressed frustra tion and dismay, and public officials of both parties pledged a fight as the Long Island Rail Road's impending proposal to increase fares became known.

title: Entertainment Events
description: Opera

title: German Liver Patient Dies
description: BONN, Jan. 9 (Reuters) West Germany's first liver transplant patient, 31yearold Volkmar Gaudigs, died here to day, more than six months after the operation. Surgeons at Bonn's University Clinic last June removed his cancerous liver and replaced it with one from a man of about the same age.

title: Bridge
description: THE film star Omar Sharif ends a strenuous week in London today under the glare of television cameras. He has been acting out in real life his movie role in Funny Girl as a big gam bler, playing a rubber bridge match against top interna tional experts for the highest stakes ever known in the game.

title: Action on 2 Fronts
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 9 (AP)  Israeli jets were reported ac tive over the Suez Canal area and Lebanon today, while Is rael and the United Arab Re public exchanged artillery fire across the waterway.

title: Antiques: Pewter, Plain and Rococo
description: CONTINENTAL pewter, par ticularly the more dec orative kind, is worth investigating these days.

title: Taiwan to Get 18 F104's From Excess U. S. Stocks
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9The United States has agreed to provide the Chinese Nationalist Government with a squadron of F104 Starfighter jets from Air Force excess stocks. In a dispute between the Sen ate and the House, Congress has not acted finally on proposal to equip the Taiwan armed forces with the more advanced Phantom jet fighter bombers.

title: U.S. Reports 109 of Foe Killed in Battle
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 9American infantrymen supported by tanks, artillery and air strikes today reported having killed 109 North Viet namese and Vietcong soldiers in two days of fighting on the slopes of a mountain overlook ing the sprawling American base at Tayninh.

title: Lions Win, 8180
description: A 45foot shot by Mike Mc Laren of Yale bounced off the rim with 2 seconds left last night, and what might have been Elis' second Cinderella story chapter of the season wound up instead as their sev enth loss in 13 games as Co lumbia scored its third Ivy League victory of the season, 8180, in University Gym.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: PLEA IS PRESSED FOR MYRTLE LINE
description: State legislators, students and residents from southern sections of Queens pleaded at a State Transportation Com mittee hearing here yesterday for restoration of the anti quated Myrtle Avenue elevated railway, where service was. abruptly terminated in Oc tober.

title: Bankers Said to Favor a $35 FloorWashington Disclaims Knowledge
description: PARIS, Jan. 9  European central bankers are consider ing reviving the gold pool to prevent prices in London and Zurich from falling below the official $35anounce level. The market closed today, at $34.90, after touching $34.85. Gold has never sold so low in a decade.

title: JOHN S. POTTER, 87, WROTE ABOUT CHINA
description: John Stauffer Potter, a for mer real estate executive in Shanghai and coauthor of the book Flight From China, died Tuesday at the Todd Nursing Home in Southampton, L. I. He was 87 years old and lived at Pao Hai, First Neck Lane in Southampton.

title: U.S. TO SCRUTINIZE COPPER PRICE RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9  A special committee of subcabi netrank officials was named by President Nixon today to study the persistent rise in the price of copper. It will be head ed by Hendrik S. Houthakker, member of the Council of ECO nomic Advisers.

title: NICKERSON SUPPORTS PLEAS FOR REZONING
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Jan. 8De mands by the National Associa tion for the Advancement of Colored People to rezone resi dential land In Nassau County to permit the development of low and middleincome hous ing received the support of County Executive Eugene H. Nickerson today.

title: Dennison Defends His Decision In Dismissing Rights Director
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., Jan. 9 Suffolk County Executive H. Lee Dennison told the 10 mem bers of the Suffolk Human Re lations Commission today that they should drop their opposi tion to his removal of the commission's executive direc tor or submit their resignations immediately.

title: U. S. Blames Soviet for Deadlock in the Mideast
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9The United States blamed the So viet Union today for the con tinued deadlock in the Middle East peace negotiations and charged that Moscow had, in effect, gone back on an earlier agreement on a settlement.

title: Mrs. Kostelanetz Becomes Bride Of S. G. Adler Jr.
description: Mrs. Sara Gene Orcutt Kostelanetz was married here yesterday afternoon to Sam G. Adler Jr., president of the Leopold Adler Com pany, a department store in Savannah, Ga. The ceremony was performed in the chapel of the Fifth Avenue Presby terian Church by the Rev. Donald C. McFerren.

title: Intelsat 3 Again Delayed
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Jan. 9 (Reuters)The launching of an advanced commercial com munications satellite, Intelsat 3, was postponed tonight for the third night in a row after strong winds developed at high altitude. Intelsat 3 is one of a series of commercial satellites being launched by the United States for Comsat, the satellite communications concern.

title: Weather Ship to Improve Forecasts for East Coast
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9 (AP) The Coast Guard will put a weather ship and a large au tomated buoy in the Atlantic to help improve forecasts for the East Coast, Secretary of Trans portation John A. Volpe an nounced today.

title: Panama Officer Kills Hijacker During Plane's Refueling Stop
description: PANAMA, Jan. 9  A mili tary officer shot and killed a Panamanian today who had been trying to hijack an air liner to Cuba.

title: ATTORNEYS CLASH IN PANTHER CASE
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 9  A spe cial coroner's inquest into the deaths of two Black Panthers ended its first week today in a shouting match between rival lawyers as the coroner cut off a line of inquiry by an attorney for the family of one of the dead men.

title: Market Place
description: WHEN a mutual fund sells shares, it does so in se cret to protect the manage ment from possible criticism for a bad job on the stock in question.

title: Vasquez Passes Forum Test, Stopping Wilson in 3d Round
description: David Vasquez is a sociology student at Manhattan Commu nity College.

title: Cairo Editor Chides Leaders on Failure at Rabat
description: CAIRO, Jan. 9  In an in trospective analysis, the influ ential Cairo commentator, Mo hammed Hassanein Heykal, complained today that a pri mary cause of the collapse of last month's conference of Arab leaders was their reluctance to delegate authority to subordi nates.

title: MILITARY NEWSMEN SHIFTED IN SAIGON
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 9 (AP)  Two military newscasters who accused the United States command of cen sorship were transferred today from the American radio and television network to other du ties within the command in Saigon.

title: M.T.A. TO OPERATE STEWART AIR BASE
description: ALBANY, Jan. 9Governor Rockefeller announced today an emergency appropriation of $326,110 to permit the Metro politan Transportation Author ity to take over operation of the Stewart Air Force Base near Newburgh.

title: Amy Jacobson. And Eric Yoffie To Wed in June
description: CHESTNUT HILL, Mass., Jan. 9  Miss Amy Beth Jacobson, a junior at Brandeis University, plans to be mar ried in June to Eric Howard Yoffie, a magna cum laude graduate of Brandeis. The wedding is to take place at Temple Emanuel in Newton.

title: SHIPPING/MAIL
description: Incoming Passenger and Mail Ships

title: DEFICIT ON L.I.R.R. IS CITED IN MOVE FOR A FARE RISE
description: The Long Island Rail Road told the Metropolitan Trans portation Authority yesterday that the line needed a fare increase to meet a rising deficit.

title: Rain Possible at Super Bowl
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 9 (UPI) Weathermen said today the Super Bowl game Sunday would be played amid a slow, warming trend and the possi bility of scattered showers. Temperatures for game time should he between 39 and 59 degrees, the Weather Bureau said.

title: STATE EMPLOYES TO GET 14% RAISE IN A 2YEAR PACT
description: ALBANY, Jan. 9  Gover nor Rockefeller and the Civil Service Employes Association announced agreement today on a pay increase of about 14 per cent for most state employes in a twoyear, $250million pack age said to be the largest in the state's history.

title: LEONA POWERS, 73, LONG AN ACTRESS
description: Leona Powers, a character actress who appeared in hun dreds of plays as well as on radio and television programs, died Wednesday at Sanger's Nursing Home, 500 West 57th Street. She was 73 years old and lived at 15 Abingdon Square.

title: MG Snorts Car Line Shows Changes Inside and Out
PACE GAINS A BIT FOR NEW ISSUES
description: A New Jersey distributor of fishing tackle and ski equip ment and a Tennessee guard service concern stood out in an otherwise spotty newissue market this week.

title: REED'S 26 POINTS SPARK WINNERS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 9 The New York Knickerbockers  rested and in top form crushed the San Francisco War riors, 12393, tonight in the sec ond game in three nights be tween the clubs at Civic Audi torium. Two nights ago, the Knicks were extended to the fullest to top the Warriors, 99 94.

title: TV: A Fantasy on C.B.S
