description: ROROS, Norway, Jan. 10 In this old copper mining town 300 miles north of Oslo, the tang of woodsmoke is in the air. A comfortable lodge, the Roros Tourist Hotel, with open fires and a sauna, houses English and Nor wegian actors and a British, Scandinavian and American production team.

title: A 28Point Increase To $5.80 Forecast For City Realty Tax
description: City homeowners and land lords face the likelihood of a 28point rise in the real es tate tax rate from the cur rent $5.519 to about $5.80 for each $100 of assessed valua tion for the year starting July 1, the Citizens Budget Corn mission said yesterday.

title: Coaches Hold Annual Huddle; Decide Not to Kick on the Rules
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 Breaking with its tradition of wanting annual drastic Changes in football rules, the American Football Coaches Association expressed nearly complete satisfaction today with the way the college game is being played and conducted.

title: $10Million Eurobond Issue sold by American Medical
description: American Medical Enter prises, Inc., announced yester day that it had completed the sale of a $10million Eurodollar bond issue through a wholly owned subsidiary, American Medical International N. V., a Netherlands Antilles corpora tion.

title: Rogers May Appoint Herter
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12  State Department sources said today that Secretary of State William P. Rogers planned to name Christian A. Herter Jr., son of the former Secretary of State, to be head of a new Of fice of Environmental Affairs.

title: Meany Says Nixon Is Using Jobs Plan As a Political Tool
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12. (AP) A.F.L.C.I.O. President George Meany charged today that the Nixon Administration's Phila delphia Plan for opening con struction jobs to minority workers was nothing more than a political tool and would prove of little value.

title: Pan Am Jumbo jet Crosses the Atlantic in 61 Hours
description: LONDON, Jan. 12A Boeing 747, the world's largest passen ger airliner, landed here today. The transAtlantic crossing was the first such flight of the 747 by Pan American World Air ways.

title: Moon Rock Gifts Smooth Agnew Trip
description: DENPASAR, Indonesia, Jan. 12The moon rocks  that Vice President Agnew present ed here yesterday to Adam Malik, Indonesia's Foreign Min ister, were almost identical with those he has passed out in eight other countries on his current trip on behalf of Presi dent Nixon and the American people. They are chips from a rock brought back from the lunar surface by the crew of Apollo 11.

title: Biafra Surrenders
description: Biafra surrendered yesterday. It was an inevitable end to a struggle that was unequal from the beginning and for a cause whose hopelessness has been apparent for many months. The surrender statement by Brig. Philip Effiong suggests that many in Biafra's leader ship had long recognized that continued military resistance could only increase the already grievous losses of the Ibos and their allies; but it was not until General Ojukwu had fled that the realists could take the needed action to end the war.

title: M'Cormack Asserts Aide Still Has Right to a Trial
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 John W. McCormack, the Speaker of the House, said to day, I have no comment to make on the indictment of his friend and administrative as sistant of 24 years, Dr. Martin Sweig.

title: BULLS. OVERCOME 76ERS BY 117113
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 12 (AP)Roy Petersen, a reserve, sank four free throws in the final minute tonight to lift the Chicago Bulls to a 117113 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers in, the Na tional Basketball Association.

title: Draft Boards Often Give Wrong Answers on Questioners' Status
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12  A man called up a draft board in a Los Angeles sub urb the other day and said he had a question about his draft status.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: HER ARMS AND HANDS ENRICH VETRA DANCE
description: Vija Vetra presented a pro gram of dance at the Cubiculo last night that ranged from the extreme delicacy of Japanese theater movement to the raucus blaring gesture of the circus midway. At times it appeared as if she were going to attempt a study in every style of dance that she had ever seen, simply to show that she could.

title: Sports of The Times
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 12The Ameri can Football League commenced operations 10 years ago and it was a joke. It ceased its existence as an entity in the Super Bowl yesterday and made its exit laughing. The Kansas City Chiefs ad ministered a shocking upset to the highly favored Minnesota Vikings, 237, and they did it with a decisiveness that could not have been more convincing.

title: 32Story Tower on Times Square Will Be 6th New Project in Area
description: Another skyscraper office building will soon begin to rise at Times Square, bringing to six the number that have been completed or begun along Broadway in the last few years.

title: '69 Net Earnings Gained At New York Reserve Bank
description: The Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yester day that its net earnings rose last year to $788.43million from $648.42million in 1968.

title: Temple Names Hardin Football Coach to Succeed Makris
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 12 (AP)  Wayne Hardin, who left as Navy coach in 1965 amid controversy, signed a threeyear contract today to coach Temple University's foot ball team. He succeeds George Makris, who resigned last, month after 10 years as Owl coach.

title: Jets for Taiwan Confirmed
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 (AP) The Pentagon formally an nounced today that the United States would provide the Nat ionalist Chinese Government on Taiwan a squadron of F104 fighters in the next several months. The announcement conflizted unofficial word Sat urday from Government sources.

title: Market Place:
description: IT IS OFTEN said that stock brokers don't care whether the market goes up or down they make commissions either way.

title: Nursing Home Toll at 26
description: MARIETTA, Ohio, Jan. 12 (UPI)The deaths today of three women over 80 years old raised the toll in a weekend nursing home fire to 26 pa tients. Hospital officials identi fied the latest victims as Mrs. Lydia Parks, 83, of Elzabeth, W. Va.; Mable Hubbell, 87, of Marietta, and Myrtle Roby, 82, of St. Mary's, W. Va.

title: LowIncome Shoppers Cool to Prim Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 An experiment here in unit pricinglisting the price per pound or pint of packaged foods and detergents has produced strong evidence that pinching pennies in supermarkets is more appeal ing to the affluent than to the needy.

title: New College Board Head
description: HERSHEY, Pa., Jan. 12 (AP) G. Albert Shoemaker, former president of Sonsolidation Coal Company of Pittsburgh, has been elected president of the board of trustees of Pennsyl vania State University. Mr. Shoemaker was chosen Satur day to succeed Roger W. Row land of New Castle, Pa., who has held the post since 1963.

title: CONFUSION FOUND ON LOAN INTEREST
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 Many lowincome families are aware that they do not really know what rate of interest they are paying on consumer loans. Higherincome individuals think they know, but are often wrong.

title: STUDY INCONCLUSIVE ON DEFREGGER ROLE
description: ROME, Jan. 12A judicial police inquiry has beep unable to fix responsibility for the wartime reprisal killing of 17 Italian villagers nor to deter mine the exact role of the Most Rev. Matthais Defregger, Aux iliary Bishop of Munich, who, as a Nazi officer, passed on the order for the shootings.

title: ArtSong Recital Is Offered by Janice Harsanyi
description: Idea's From Interlochen seemed a misleading title for what turned out to be an art song recital last night at Carne gie Recital Hall. If there were ideas other than old and time tested ones being offered, this listener did not notice them.

title: ATTACK ON OBOTE AROUSES UGANDA
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Jan. 11 Driving into Uganda from Kenya, the visitor is stopped five times at roadblocks over the 120 miles to Kampala. Soldiers with machine guns or rifles ask the purpose of the trip, look over the luggage and wave the car on.

title: Hearing Examiner Named
description: The appointment of Richard M. Hartsock as a hearing ex aminer has been announced by the Federal Maritime Com mission. He has served in a similar capacity with the Inter state Commerce Commission since November, 1965.

title: Statement by the Biafran Commander
description: Fellowcountrymen, as you know I was asked to be the officer administering the government of this republic on Jan. 10, 1970.

title: MITE SUCCESSFUL IN HELICOIL BID
description: The fivemonthlong attempt of the Mite Corporation to acquire the HeliCoil Corpora tion ended successfully yester day with the announcement that an agreement in principle had been reached between the two companies.

title: SMALLER PROFITS FORECAST IN 1970
description: A majority of more than 1,000 of New York credit and financial executives see 1970 as a year with a number of unfavorable prospects.

title: Ray Assigned to Prison Job, But He'll Work by Himself
description: NASHVILLE, Jan. 12 (UPI) James Earl Ray, who com plained that his isolated im prisonment was cruel and asked for some work to do, has been assigned to paint the interior of the state prison's maximum security buildingby himself.

title: British Soccer
description: FOOTBALL ASSOCIATION CUP

title: Robbins's Night Postponed
description: The premiere of Night, Jerome Robbin's ballet for the New York City Ballet, has been postponed until Jan. 29. The first performance was original ly scheduled for Thursday.

title: Russell Clarifies Position
description: Earl Russell has informed The New York Times that he did not repudiate the objec tives of the Bertrand Russell Peace Foundation in the United States, as reported in The Times on Dec. 11, 1969. Lord Russell reiterated that he had repudiated any connection with his former secretary, Ralph Schoenman, or knowledge of his activities. Following this statement, Mr. Schoenman an nounced here that the founda tion in this country had been renamed the American Foun dation for Social Justice.

title: Supreme Court Actions
description: WASHINGTON,Jan. 12 The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Prague Says Trotskyite Plot Has Been Found
description: VIENNA, Jan. 12 The Czechoslovak Government said today it had uncovered a Trot skyite plot aimed at over throwing the existing political system.

title: Vikings Leave for Northern Chill
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 12 The Minnesota Vikings, out played and outcoached in the Super Bowl game yesterday by the winning Kansas City Chiefs, left town today in as sorted groups.

title: Market Summary
description: Monday, Jan. 12, 1970

title: U.S. DENIES WHITE REVIEW ON ALLIS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 (AP) The Supreme Court's refusal to intervene in a court case involving White Consolidated Industries' unsuccessful at tempts to take over AllisChal mers Manufacturing company was one of several decisions today affecting business.

title: Israelis See a Parallel In the Plight of Biafra
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 12Is raelis viewed the fall of Bi afra today as an example of what can happen to a small nation when it becomes the subject of bigpower poli tics.

title: Blanche Stuart Scott, 84, Dies; Made First Solo Flight in 1910
description: ROCHESTER, Jan. 12 (AP) Mrs. Blanche Stuart Scott, a pioneer aviator, died today at Genesec Hospital. She was 84 years old.

title: Violence and the Penny Press
description: Benjamin Day, the 19th century publisher mentioned yesterday in the report that noted the history of the rela tionship between violence and the press, was the proprietor of The New York Sun, which was started on Sept. 3, 1833.

title: BLAST DAMAGES FLATBUSH SCHOOL
description: A pipe bomb exploded yes terday morning, before the start of classes, in the deans office at James Madison High School in the Flatbush section of Brooklvn.

title: Amanda Luria Engaged to Wed Russell Handler
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Jan. 12  Miss Amanda Daniel Luria, a sophomore at Boston University, plans to be mar ried in June to Russell Hart mann Handler, a member of the Air, National Guard, who is attending school at Lack land Air Force Base in Texas.

title: Long Jump Getting Short Shrift
description: Norman Tate has a prob lem. He is an Olympic track andfield athlete with no forum to showcase his mar velous talent.

title: A.E.C.'s Safety Standards Attacked in Court
description: DENVER, Jan. 12An attor ney for the American Civil Lib erties Union charged today that the safety standards of the Atomic Energy Commission grossly underestimate pos sible damage from radiation.

title: 2 Highly Placed, but Little Known, Capitol Figures
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 Nathan M. Voloshen is a man known to many on Capitol Hill, but what they knowor acknowledge they knowabout the man who was indicted in New York today is meager. It is clear, however, that from his youth in Baltimore, the son of immigrant parents, he rose to a position of standing: He was the man to see it you needed help in dealing with a wide assortment of Federal departments or agencies.

title: Noise Level Called a Peril to City Life
description: Mayor. Lindsay's Task Force on Noise Control, after three years of study, reported yesterday that noise here had reached a level intense, con tinuous and persistent enough to threaten basic community, life.

title: Litsky Is ReElected
description: Frank Litsky of The New York Times was reelected president of the Track Writers Association of New York yes terday. Jim Dunaway, Eastern editor for Track and Field News, was reelected secretary.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
METAL CRACK CALLED F111 CRASH CAUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12The Secretary of the Air Force said today that the primary cause of an F111 airplane crash on Dec. 22 was a manufacturing defect that caused the swing wing jet fighter to lose its left wing.

title: Women's Skiing Put Off
description: BAD GASTEIN, Austria, Jan. 13 (AP)The women's down hill race for World Cup skiers was postponed today because of unfavorable snow conditions and rescheduled for Wednes day. Judy Nagel of the United States was out of the competi tion because of a sore ankle.

title: Pistons Vanquish Hawks
U.S. JURY INDICTS VOLOSHEN, SWEIG ON FRAUD COUNT
description: Dr. Martin Sweig, suspended administrative assistant to Speaker of the House John W. McCormack, and Nathan M. Voloshen, a lobbyist accused of posing as a member of the Speaker's staff, were indicted yesterday on charges of de frauding agencies of the Fed eral Government.

title: A Dinner Menu With Recipes to Match
description: HERE'S a dinner menu (recipes for the starred dishes) with seafood in skilletfried cakes and the poultry crisp beneath a sea soned orange sauce. For a luncheon, the shrimp cakes could be the entree, served with a mlange of stirfried vegetables and the bean sprout salad.

title: CARL L. TIMIN
description: Carl L. Timin, executive di rector since 1949 of the Friars Club, the theatrical social organization, died Sunday at his home, 1107 York Avenue, after a long illness. He was 63 years old, and had belonged to the club since 1928.

title: Much of Biafra Chaotic as Refugees Jam Roads
description: SOMEWHERE IN BIAFRA, Jan. 12 (Agence FrancePresse) The situation was chaotic to day in many parts of Biafra, with roads packed with re fugees. Thousands of others have been cut off behind the lines of the advancing Nigerian troops.

title: Shriver Sees Schumann
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 (Reu ters)  Ambassador Sargent Shriver held a long meeting in Paris today with the French Foreign Minister, Maurice Schumann. The topics included the French proposal to sell 50 Mirage fighterbombers to Lib ya, informed sources said here tonight.

title: Norell Shuns Role as Fashion Dictator
description: IT'S not that he's convinced they're about to take over, but Norman Norell managed to include a number of below kneelength skirts in his spring collection yesterday. He's old enough to know nobody has the inside track onwhere fashion's going. Most of the time, hemlines stopped several inches above the knee, and Norell insisted he loved both lengths. We're not supposed to, be dictators any more, he said. I don't think people should be so rigid.

title: Slain Panther Accused by a Policeman
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 12The po lice sergeant who led a pre dawn raid in which two Black Panthers were killed changed today the police account of who had fired the first shot.

title: Moscow Radio Hails Victory of Nigerians
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 12 (Reu ters)  The Moscow radio tonight hailed Nigeria's vic tory over secessionist Biafra as the victory of progres sive forces of the whole Af rican continent over impe rialism.

title: Mother Brown of Harlem Dead; Born Into Slavery 116 Years Ago
description: Mrs. Alice Peyton Brown, who was born into slavery near Lexington, Va., eight years before the Civil War began, died Friday in Knickerbocker Hospital. She was 116 years old.

title: Screen: A Young Couple at Fire Island
POTATO FUTURES SET RECORD HIGHS
description: Futures prices of Maine pota toes hit new highs yesterday on the New York Mercantile Exchange because of the cold weather and resulting bad transportation facilities. A total of 2,770 contracts was traded.

title: New Social Contract Urged for College Heads
description: Under the terms or Ms contract, said Dr. Edward J. Bloustein, president of Benning ton College in Vermont, college presidents would be freed from commitment to the dominant values of society to militate for social and political change, stu dents and faculty would be given, a greatly enhanced but not necessarily equal role in governing the schools, and the president would represent the full range of interests em bodied in his institution.

title: Text of Soviet Note to U.S. on Mideast Settlement
description: The everdeteriorating sit uation in the Middle East area, brought about by con tinuing Israeli aggression against the neighboring Arab states as well as by its non fulfillment of the provisions of the Security Council reso lution of Nov. 22, 1967, de mands urgent steps to promptly establish just and stable peace in that area.

title: INDIVIDUALS BUY TREASURY BILLS
description: Individuals in increasing num bers shifted their funds from ??vings accounts and stocks yesterday into Treasury bills yielding more than 8 per cent.

title: Thin, Wet Snow Falls on City But Proves Mostly a Nuisance
description: A thin, wet snow drizzled on the slushy streets yester day, permeated the air with nasty chill and inconvenienced New Yorkers who were al ready inconvenienced by the normal discomforts of winter.

title: PRICES SHOW DIP IN AMEX TRADING
description: Prices on the AmericanStock Exchange closed mostly lower yesterday in light trading.

title: Sweig Office Abounds. With Loyalty Themes
description: On a wall in the Capitol office of Dr. Martin Sweig, tacked up among the stand ard autographed portraits of politicians, there is a framed homily from Elbert Hubbard on loyalty.

title: CoasttoCoast Operation in Influence Peddling Alleged in Federal Indictment
description: Conspiracy and perjury in dictments handed up against Nathan Voloshen and Dr. Mar tin Sweig, former administra tive assistant to House Speaker John W. McCormack, outlined an alleged influencepeddling operation that reached from coast to coast.

title: GRAHAM TO RETURN TO COAST GUARD
description: WASHINGTON, Jana 12 Otto Grahani, who was dropped as the Washington Redskin' head coach after three losing seasons, will return to his for mer post as athletic director at the United States Coast Guard Academy in New London, Conn.

title: ROCKEFELLER SAYS CITIES CAN EXPECT RISE IN STATE AID
description: ALBANY, Jan. 12Governor Rockefeller said today that there would be substantial in creases in state aid to local governments this year, but seemed to rule out a program to restructure state aid, pro posed by the mayors of the state's six largest cities.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, JANUARY 13, 1970

title: WELFARE CHILDREN ON COAST UNDERFED
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Jan. 12 A committee of the State Legislature warned today that half a million youngsters in the state program of Aid to Families With Dependent Children were failing to get enough food for their proper development and were therefore in danger of be coming lifelong unemployables and welfare recipients.

title: Nigerian Tribal Issue Remains
description: The collapse of Biafra by no means marks the final solution of the Ibo problem. That prob lem, whose intensity was vivid ly demonstrated by the mas sacres in northern Nigeria in 1966, will only be solved when the Ibo tribe believes that it is safe. The massacres, in which as many as 40,000 Ibos were killed, convinced the tribe that it could find no secu rity in Nigeria. The 30month war that is now ending has shown that the independent state of Biafra could not pro vide a safe haven either.

title: Chicago Negroes Win Accord on Construction Jobs
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 12  After months of negotiations and conflict, a program to train Ne groes in skilled construction jobs was agreed upon today by leaders of the black community and union and construction in dustry officials.

title: Seven Agencies Vie for McDonald's
description: Late last week the McDonald's Corporation, the Chicago based hamburgerstand czars, invited five hometown agencies to pitch for its $5million account. Then over the, weekend two New York shops were added to the list of competitors Doyle Dane Bernbach and Wells. Rich. Greene.

title: Excerpts From Conclusions and Recommendations of Study Group on Mass Media
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 Following are excerpts from the conclusions and recom mendations of the study group on the mass media of the National Commission on the Causes and Prevention of Violence, as released today by the commission:

title: WRITERS' POLL
description: The top 20, with points fig ured on a 2018161412109 87654321 basis for first through 15th place (firstplace voles inparentheses) and won lost records through games of last Saturday:

title: YEWS MEDIA GUIDE URGED IN REPORT
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12  A study group of the National Commission on the Causes and Prevention of Violence has recommended the creation of an independent national center for media study, that would judge the performance of the press and broadcast journalism.

title: Court to Weigh Loyalty Test for Bar
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 The Supreme Court agreed to day to decide if law graduates may be required to show that they are loyal to the Govern ment and are of good moral character before they may be licensed to practice law.

title: 12 Districts Integrate
description: JACKSON, Miss., Jan. 12 (UPI)A dozen more Missis sippi school districts complied today with the,Supreme Court's total desegregation ruling, and the result was thorough integra tion in some areas and white abandonment of public schools in others.

title: S.E.C. Suspends Trading In Two Stocks to Jan. 21
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 (UPI)The Securities & Ex change Commission today sus. pended overthecounter trad. ing through Jan. 21 in the securities of Carbon, Inc., and Naturizer. Inc.

title: STOCKS RETREAT ON BROAD FRONT
description: The stock market observed the old 1969 tradition of Blue Monday yesterday as it sagged alone a broad front.

title: 2 SCHOLARS TO JOIN TOP HARVARD BOARD
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 12 For the fisrt time in more than 150 years, two scholars were elected today to the high est governing board of Harvard University.

title: McCarthy, Mrs. Binh Confer for Two Hours
description: PARIS, Jan. 12 (Reuters) Senator Eugene McCarthy, who led an electionyear po litical revolt against Amer ican policy in Vietnam, con ferred today with Vietcong and American peace negoti ators

title: Nixon Gives Seymour Interim Appointment
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 President Nixon gave a re cess appointment today to Whitney North Seymour Jr. as United States attorney for the Southern District of New York to succeed Robert M. Morffenthau.

title: HORTENSE ODLUM OF BONWIT TELLER
description: INDIO, Calif., Jan. 12 (AP) Hortense Odlum, former presi dent of Bonwit Teller, the spe eialty store, died here today. She was 78 years old.

title: Castleton Drops Holding
description: Directors of Castleton In dustries, Inc. voted yesterday to dispose of the company's bank holdings. Consisting of an interest in six Florida banks, the holdings were valued at about $9million last March. The board also elected Frederick L. Van Lennep, presi dent; as chairman to replace Milton N. Weir, who resigned Dec. 31.

title: Atlanta's New Integration Plan Delayed by U.S. Judge to March
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 12  Judge Frank Hooper of United States District Court announced today that he would delay for month, from Feb. 1 until March 5, implementation of the city's school system's newest integra tion plan.

title: L. I. R. R. SAYS LOSS ON FREIGHT GROWS
description: It costs the Long Island Rail Road about $169 to handle a freight car in its shorthaul, but intricate, operations, according to the line's figures.

title: 153d Metropolitan Branch Of Chase Bank Is Opened
description: The Chase Manhattan Bank opened yesterday its 153d met ropolitan area branch in tem porary quarters on the second floor of One New York Plaza in the financial district.

title: Bill Rates Show Sharp Decline At Treasury's Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12  Treasury bill rates declined sharply at today's auction from last week's levels, the Govern ment reported late this after noon.

title: Scandal in the House
description: It will take the acquittal of Nathan Voloshen and Martin Sweig to lift the shadow that has fallen on the office of the Speaker of the House of Representatives. The indictment of the lobbyist and of the former administrative assistant to Speaker John W. McCor mack alleges that serious crimes were committed in that office and perjury was used to conceal them.

title: Knicks Rout Suns, 130114, as 4 Players Tally Over 20 Points in Salt Lake City
description: The New York Knicks out scored the Phoenix, Suns in every quarter tonighttallying 30 or more points in eachas they romped to a 130114 vic tory in a National Basketball Association game before 12,3841 fans at the Salt Palace.

title: Farm Tax Ruling Issued
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 (AP) The Internal Revenue Service said today that farmers and fishermen who did not file an estimated income tax return by Thursday would have until March 2 to file a final return and pay taxes on their 1968 income. Farmers and fisher men who do file their estimates by Thursday, however, will have until April 15 to file their final returns.

title: Sorensen to Speak to Harnizrachi Group
description: Theodore C. Soienseh will be the main speaker Sunday at the eighth annual dinner, of the Hapoel Hamizrachi Women's Organization at the WaldorfAstoria. About 1,000 people are expected at the event, which is planned as a testimonial to Mr. and Mrs. Max Bernstein, the founders of and major contributors to the organization. Proceeds will help build a girls' voca tional school dormitory in B'nai Brak, Israel. Reserva tions for the dinner may be made with Mrs. Abraham Weifiherger of 45 East 17th Street.

title: Spartans Industries Buys. Some of Own Stock
description: Spartans Industries, Inc., has been offered and has purchased 275,000 shares of its common stock, Charles C. Bassine, chair man announced yesterday.

title: Gerald Duncan, Editorial Writer On World Journal Tribune, Dies
description: Gerald Duncan, who was the chief editorial writer of the former World Journal Tribune, died yesterday in his home at 401 East 74th Street. He was 66 years old.

title: Goodrich Lifts Vinyl
description: The B. F. Goodrich Chemical Company, a division of the B. F. Goodrich Company, an nounced yesterday it would in crease the price of its type rigid powder polyvinyl chloride compounds for PVC pipe by about 5 per cent, effective Thursday. The new price will be 19 cents a pound in car loads.

title: Welfare Protesters Disrupt Legislature
description: ALBANY, Jan. 12About 125 angry, shouting young black and Puerto Rican militants from New York City disrupted the Senate's first working day of the 1970 legislative session to day, forcing it to recess.

title: American Raceways Halts Its S.C.C.A. Race Series
description: American Raceways, Inc., and the Sports Car Club of America, which sanctions three professional series of road races, parted company vester day after an association of only one season.

title: Wide Observances Due on King Birthday Thursday
description: Martin Luther King's birth day will be observed with spe cial programs and memorial services by many organizations in the city on Thursday, al though the day is not a legal holiday.

title: Paris Denies Holding Talks With Iraqis on Mirage Sale
description: PARIS, Jan. 12The French Defense Ministry denied today that negotiations were under way to sell Iraq Mirage jet fighter planes.

title: Gantry Scuttles Plan to Bar Local Critics
description: The producers of Gantry have rescinded their invita tions to 12 outoftown critics to attend previews of the show here for the purpose of comment while excluding New York reviewers from these performances.

title: Street, Steinmark Lauded At Texas Football Banquet
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Jan. 12 (AP) James Street, a quarterback, was named last night as the most valuable player on the 1969 national championship Texas football team. But the most applause went to a player who could hardly walk.

title: F.B.I. Helps to Seek ExConvict Accused In Wilton Slaying
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 12  The Federal Bureau of Investigation joined the state and local po lice today in the search for a paroled convict, Louis Cofone Jr., who is accused of murder ing one Wilton housewife and kidnapping another and of at tempting to rape a woman in Stamford.

title: GIRL, 14, IS CHARGED IN FATHER'S SLAYING
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 (UPI) The police today charged the 14yearold adopted daughter of a local official with beating him to death with a crowbar. Also charged with murder were two young men who had been living with the girl in a hippie colony apartment on Du Pont Circle.

title: Next U. S Pullout Includes First Division
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 12The United States mil itary command announced here today that the First Infantry Division would be the major combat element to leave South Vietnam in the third phase of President Nixon's withdrawal program.

title: Buick Recalls 4,000 Cars For Inspection of Wheels
description: FLINT, Mich., Jan. 12 (AP) The Buick Division of General Motors announced today the recall of 4,000 newmodel La Sabres, Wildcats, Electras and Rivieras for replacement of wheels which might have im proper welds that could cause a failure.

title: BIAFRANS CAPITULATE TO NIGERIA, ENDING 30MONTHLONG CIVIL WAR; U.S. INCREASES GRANT FOR RELIEF
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Tuesday, Jan. 13Biafra, with its last de fenses crumbling and its sup plies of food and ammunition exhausted, capitulated yester day to the Nigerian Govern ment.

title: 3 FERRARI 5LITERS ENTERED AT DAYTONA
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla. Jan. 12 (UPI) A threecar team of new 512S sports racers signals Ferrari's return to international road racing in the 24 Hours of Daytona, the auto company an nounced today. The race will be run over the Daytona Speed way's highbanked, twisting 3.81mile road course Jan. 31 Feb. 1.

title: Well, Another Bad Day for L.I.R.R.
description: Bad news came in several forms yesterday for riders of the Long Island Rail Road.

title: 4 Pilots' Wives Abandon Attempt to Get Soviet Aid
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 12 (Reuters)I The wives of four American pilots missing in Vietnam said today that they were abandon ing attempts to seek the help of Soviet officials in getting news of their husbands.

title: Javits Is Seeking To Assure Israelis
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 12Sena tor Jacob K. Javits said today that Israeli leaders might be un duly concerned over what they believe to be misguided Ameri can policy in the Middle East.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: HOUSTON, Tex., Jan. 12A convention of 1,100 college presidents and deans was urged today to adopt a new academic social contract to bail the schools out of turmoil.

title: Man Sought In a Murder Sees 2d One
description: A homicide suspect wait ing in an East Harlem serv ice station to meet his law yer and surrender to the police became a witness in another murder yesterday when a robber walked in with a rifle and fatally shot the station manager.

title: COACHES' POLL
description: The top 20, with points fig ured on a 10987654321 basis for first through 10th places (firstplace votes in pa rentheses) and wonlost records through games of Iasi Satur day:

title: Bridge:
description: THE higheststake rubber bridge match ever played ended in London in the early hours of Monday morning in a victory for Omar Sharif's Circus team over two Eng lish experts. Sharif played most of the 80rubber match with the French star Claude Delmouly. When either of them rested, two Italian World Champions, Benito Garozzo and Giorgio Bella donna, served as replace ments.

title: Wiley Talks of New Sugar Ray As He Trains Marks for Fight
description: When Carlos Marks talks, you can almost hear calypso music.

title: Marine Midland Elects
description: Ronald G. Cobleigh has been promoted to vice president of the Marine Midland Grace Trust Company of New York. Mr. Cobleigh is in charge of the bank's office at 7 Hanover Square.

title: New Books
description: The Bridge at Chappaquiddich, by Jack Olsen (Little, Brown, 6.95). A reconstruction of the Mary Jo Kopechne death.

title: Singer Co. Appoints Officer
description: The appointment of Andrew J. Reinhart as a third member of the president's office of the Singer Company was an nounced yesterday by Donald P. Kircher, president and chief executive officer of the $2bil lion company. Mr. Reinhart, vice president, has been con troller for the last four years, Donald W. Smith, chairman of the executive committee, is the second member of the presi dent's office.

title: DeBusschere, Knicks' Ace, Is Added to East AllStars
description: Dave DeBusschere of the New York Knicks was one of the eight players named yesterday to complete the EastWest squads for the 20th annual National Basketball Association AllStar Game next Tuesday night in Philadelphia.

title: A Reputed Mafioso Is Indicted Again Over Income Taxes
description: James Plumeri, a reputed Mafia figure long described as a garment district racketeer, was indicted yesterday by Federal grand jury on income taxevasion charges.

title: Biafrans in London Bitter At British Role in Defeat
description: LONDON, Jan. 13  Hun dreds of Biafrans, emotions etched on many faces, crowded together today in a red brick Victorian building that has been the headquarters here for rep resentatives of the govern ment of Maj. Gen. Odumegwu Ojukwu.

title: Senate Panel to Open Hearing on Birth Pill
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 (AP) Researchers who sus pect birth control pills of causing sterility, genetic damage and cancer will lead off testimony this week as Congress takes its first look into the safety of oral con tracentives.

title: CZECH POLICE LINK OLD REDS TO PLOT
description: VIENNA, Jan. 13Czecho slovak police investigators who are tracing the ramifications of a clandestine Maoist faction have found that it comprised oldtime members of the Com munist party as well as young intellectuals and students, ac cording to information reach ink here.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Soviet Mideast Aims

title: Mrs. Kennedy in Hospital
description: Joan Kennedy, the wife of Senator Edward M. Kennedy, was admitted to Lenox Hill Hos pital yesterday for a tonsilec tomy. A hospital spokesman said the operation would be performed at 7:30 A.M. today by, Dr. Wilbur Gould.

title: California U. to Ask Doubling of Students' Fees
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 13 This state's proud century old tradition of tuitionfree higher education will be broken if Regents of the University of California adopt a proposal to be submitted reluctantly to them later this week by Charles J. Hitch, the universi ty's president.

title: THE TIMES SETS UP FEATURE SERVICE
description: The New York Times has an flounced that it is expanding its editorial services to other newspapers and to magazines with the formation of The New York Times Special Features, a new syndicate.

title: Under Fire, Last Plane Leaves Biafra
description: SAO TOME, Jan. 13The only plane known to have left Biafra since the seces sionist state's surrender evad ed panicky mobs of Biafrans and flew through machine gun fire as it tbok off last night. It arrived Only 15 min utes behind schedule at this equatorial island, which has served as the base for the Biafran relief airlift since 1968.

title: Franklin National Bank Fills Executive Post
description: The appointment of Harry P. Barrand Jr. to the newly created, office of executive vice president of the Franklin National Bank in charge of international banking, was announced yesterday by Har old V. Gleason. president.

title: Washington: The BigPower Nightmare
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13An odd thing is now happening in world politics. The small and middle nations, which used to be afraid that the United States and the Soviet Union would blow up the world, now seem to be afraid that Washington and Moscow will get together and organize the world in their own national interests and against the interest of many other nations.

title: 2 in London Chained to Railing in Protest
description: LONDON, Jan. 13 (Reuters) The Rev. Ian Paisley, ex tremist leader of Northern Ireland's Protestants, was in volved in a bizarre incident to day that left two fellow clergy men chained to the railings of luckingharn Palace. The Rev. an Foster, 26 years old, a Free Presbyterian, and the Rev. Jack Glass, 32, a Baptist, chained themselves to the railings to protest church unity talks being held at nearby Windsor this week. Then Mr. Paisley drove off with the key to the lock. His colleagtles vowed they would stay there until Friday. Within minutes, the police were on the scene and snipped them free with wire cutters.

title: Finch Says Congress Tries To Scuttle Welfare Reform
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 (AP) The Nixon Administration to day dropped as inadequate its mild approach to welfare reform and turned instead to public castigation of what it termed the intent of Congress to scuttle the plan.

title: Books of The Times
description: I WOULD like to write a serious book, says the hero near the end of Cecil Brown's first novel, but because I'm black, America wouldn't let me. All the publishers are interested in selling books and if you say something about sex and being a nigger then you got a best seller. he buried assumptions here seem to be that publishers' in terest, sex, nigger hood, and bestsell erdom coopt (that, someone has sug gested, is babytalk for corrupt) se riousness. None of these assumptions has deterred Cecil Brown, an ex sharecropper from North Carolina who, at the age of 18, broke his ties with the agrarian tradition, turned [his] nose North, and has been pur suing a literary ca reer ever since. His The Life & Loves of Mr. Jiveass Nigger is flimflamboyantly erotic. Hardly a paragraph goes by that isn't pitchy with black con sciousness. And if bestsellerdom eludes Mr. Brown for the time being, it will only be because his writing genuinely agitates, be cause his story is a nightmare dreamed on a bed of nails.

title: AUTHORITY SHIFT ASKED IN SCHOOLS
description: A study group of the Citizens Committee for Chil dren urged a major shift of authority in the city's public high schools yesterday, say ing that this would help restore a climate for learning that was dangerously polluted by an increasing estrangement be tween students and faculty.

title: Nixon Frees 2 Inmates With Terminal Illness
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 (UPI)President Nixon an nounced today he had freed two Federal prisoners be cause they were suffering terminal illnesses.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON SHOW FIRM TREND
Comet to Be Visible in Southwest
description: Beginning tomorrow night, a comet discovered last Oc tober almost simultaneously by three Japanese should be visible to persons living in the latitude of New York if the southwestern skies are clear after sunset.

title: Albany Theater to Close
description: ALBANY, Jan. 13 (UPI) The state's capital has lost another major business attraction the last movie theater in the down towndistrict. A spokesman for the Strand Theater said the op eration would cease after Jan. 20. In the last year or so, the city has lost its railroad passen ger station, its largest hotel, its largest department store and several other businesses.

title: Theater: Some WhiteBlack Vignettes
description: BLACK and white in con frontation is the motive force between a strange yet effective evening at the St. Marks Playhouse, which has now opened the third season of the splendid Negro En semble Company. In passing, I feel I must comment upon how quickly the company has established itself as a vital part of our cultural life. In little more than two years it has become one of the signi ficant theatrical forces in the countrya force that is hon est, stimulating, provocative and as valid for the white for the black.

title: Yablonski Lawyer Asks Inquiry On U. M. W. by 4 U.S. Agencies
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 The Labor Department was urged today to vacate the elec tion in which the late Joseph A. Yablonski was defeated for the United Mine Workers pres idency last month and direct a broad Federal inquiry into all of the union's affairs.

title: Chief of Detectives Loses Sole Control Over Promotions
description: The New York Chief of De tectives, long the independent head of a powerful fiefdom within the Police Department, has been shorn of an impor tant part of his personal pow er: the exclusive right to de cide which detectives will be promoted.

title: CHOTINER NAMED TO NIXON'S STAFF
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 President Nixon today named Murray M. Chotiner, one of his earliest, closest and most con troversial political advisers, to a post on the White House staff.

title: NO PROGRESS NOTED IN CEMETERY TALKS
description: A state mediator, Meyer Drucker, reported yesterday that no progress had been made toward ending a strike of 1,700 gravediggers at 44 metropolitan Roman Catholic, Jewish and nonsectarian cemeteries.

title: FEDERAL LAWYERS AID PANTHERINQUIRY
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 13 (AP)A team of Justice De partment lawyers operating under sealed orders from At torney General John N. Mitchell is aiding a Federal grand jury here in a broadscale investiga tion of the national Black Pan ther party.

title: Turnstiles Take Varied Fare
description: Some subway riders are beating the new 30cent fare by using any of at least sev en cheaper foreign coins that are accepted by subway turn stiles.

title: Subway Protests Continue
description: Protests against the 30 cent fare continued yester day in the Rockaways, where users of the Independent sub way have to pay a double fare. In the morning, some riders jammed the three turnstiles at the Beach 60th Street station with slugs, put ting them out of use dur ine the rush hour.

title: Listing of New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: Head of a Lawyers' Service Accused of Forgery
description: The head of a company that provided services for lawyers was charged yesterday with forging the names of State Su preme Court justices and City Court judges to subpoenas.

title: DONALD STRACHAN, A SQUASH CHAMPION
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Jan. 13 Donald Strachan, a retired sales executive who was a three time national squash champion, died today in Princeton hospital after a short illness. He was 60 years old and lived on Rose dale Lane here.

title: Ibos Noted for Strong Will, Which Some Denounce
description: It would appear that the God of Africa has specially created the Ibo nation to lead the children of Africa from the bondage of the ages, Dr. Nnamdi Azikiwe, an Ibo who was the father of Nigerian na tionalism and chief architect of Nigeria's independence, wrote in 1949.

title: PANTHER OFFICERS SEIZED IN QUEENS
description: Two members of the Black Panther party from Oakland, Calif., were arrested here short ly after midnight last night by three policemen who said the Panthers had scuffled with them. The Panthers denied the police version of the incident.

title: SCHOOLS IN CITY CURB DEFERMENTS
description: Applicants for teaching posts here will be eligible for draft deferments only if they go to one of the 450 schools in pov erty areas.

title: Argentine in U.S. on Visit
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 (Reu ters)  Brig. Gen. Jorge Miguel Martinez Suviria, Argentina's air force commander, arrived here today for an eightday visit.

title: DANIEL H. CONROY
description: BOUND BROOK, N. J., Jan. 13 (AP)Former Mayor Daniel. H. Conroy, died in Somerset, Hospital Sunday. He was 56 years old.

title: Jews in Czechoslovakia Fear Rise of AntiSemitism in Party
description: VIENNA, Jan. 13  Czecho slovak Jews are increasingly worried by what they consider to be a surge of antiSemitism in the Communist party appa ratus, according to reliable pri vate information reaching here.

title: THIEU ASSAILS FOES WHO SEEK COALITION
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 13 (Reuters)President Nguyen Van Thieu today again strongly criticized advocates of coalition or neutralism in South Vietnam, calling them political witches and racketeers.

title: Pan Am Cancels Tour Of Europe by Giant Jet
description: LONDON, Jam 13 (UPI) Pan American World Airways today canceled the remainder of a scheduled European tour by the line's first Boeing 747 jumbo jet airliner. The plane headed back to New York.

title: Bonn's Triple Probe
description: Chancellor Willy Brandt clearly runs the risk of being whipsawed by heading into separate but simul taneous negotiations with three Communist countries the Soviet Union, Poland and East Germany. But, he is doing so in the belief that a working relationship with a reluctant East Germany, his chief Objective, can onjy be achieved with the help of Moscow and War saw. The question now is whether that gamble will Day off.

title: ZylisGara Exudes Warmth and Charm As Mozart's Pamina
description: Teresa ZylisGara was the fetching new Pamina in the Metropolitan Opera's perform ance of The Magic Flue last night. In addition to a naturally feminine warmth and charm, Miss ZylisGara interjected a pleasant note of humor into her early scenes and a genuine tragic pathos later on in Act 2effectively staving off the danger of goodygoody insipidity that can so easily affect this character.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Jan. 14, 1970 GENERAL ASSEMBLY Commission on Interna tional Trade LawWorking Group on the International Sale of Goods  10:30 A.M. and 3:30 P.M.

title: M'KESSON ACQUIRES PRESCRIPTION GROUP
description: ForemostMcKesson, Inc., whose McKesson & Robbins Drug Company is the nation's largest prescriptiondrug whole saler, yesterday announced its entry into the comparatively new field of servicing third party prescription plans.

title: All 30 Aboard DC3 Die In Air Crash in Samoa
description: PAGOPAGO, American Sa moa, Jan. 13 (AP)A twin engine airliner crashed into a lagoon today after takeoff during a heavy rain at Faleolo Airport in Western Samoa, killing all 30 persons aboard.

title: INCREASES SCORED IN BUSINESS RENTS
description: Two city attacks on high commercial rent increases were pressed yesterday.

title: U.S. GROUP CLARIFIES PLAN FOR PALESTINE
description: An organization of American and ArabAmerican supporters of the Arab position in the Middle East suggested yester day that meetings between American Zionists and Arab sympathizers might help to ward lasting peace in the Mid dle East.

title: BOEING TO LAY OFF 18,000 IN COAST AREA
description: SEATTLE, Jan. 13The Boeing Company announced here today that it plans to re duce its local work force in 1970 by 18,000, to 62,000.

title: Dowell Gains in Seniors Golf By Beating Bryne, 3 and 2
description: BELLEAIR, Fla., Jan. 13 (UPI)Walter Dowell of Wal nut Ridge, Ark., shooting for his third straight title, defeated John Bryne of Cincinnati, 3 and 2, today in an openinground match of the 12th annual Belair seniors golf tourney.

title: SWEDEN RAISES TAX ON HIGHER INCOMES
description: STOCKHOLM, Jan. 13The Swedish Government, introduc ing its budget for the 197071 fiscal year today, outlined a tax reform program that will mean increases for persons in higher income groups.

title: Black Americans' Response: Like Whites'
description: Most black Americans re sponded to the war in Biafra like most whites, said Franklin H. Williams, a former Ambas sador to Ghana. He noted that a lack of knowledge about the war had promoted a general confusion so that many people did not know what to say or do.

title: NEWARK'S BLACKS PLAN FUND DRIVE
description: NEWARK, Jan. 13  Seven black and one Puerto Rican candidate, nominated in No vember by a community con vention in Newark as can didates for Mayor and City Council announced a national fundraising campaign at a news conference here today.

title: Black Panthers Lose Plea to Bar A Subpoena for Three Doctors
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 13A Fed aral judge refused today to set aside a subpoena ordering three doctors who performed an in dependent autopsy of Fred Hampton, the slain Black Panther leader, to appear before a Cook County grand jury.

title: Rep. Bush Enters G.O.P. Race For Yarborough's Senate Seat
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Jan. 13 United States Representative George Bush, Republican of Houston, announced his can didacy today for the Senate seat held by Ralph W. Yarbor ough, Democrat of Austin.

title: TV: Golden Age of the Automobile
description: THE birth of the automo bile, contributing to social revolution that has yet to reach its conclusion, was presented last night by John Secondari and his wife, Helen Jean Rogers, in a doc umentary over the American Broadcasting Company's net work. It was an hour of assured pleasure, for antique car buffs, but rather abrupt in dealing with the modern problems posed by the in ternal combustion engine.

title: Lukens in Ohio Race
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Jan. 13 Representative Donald E. Lukens, the former president of the Young Republican Na tional Federation, announced here today that he would seek the Republican nomination for Governor of Ohio.

title: Long Weekend for Pupils
description: AURORA, Ohio, Jan. 13 (UPI)The 2,000 students at tending Aurora schools have completed an unscheduled fourday weekend. On Friday school was called off because someone let the air out of 10 of the system's 13 school buses. The same thing hap pened yesterday.

title: Mother Bear Kills Two Cubs
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 13 (AP) Only one of the San Diego Zoos Eurasian brown bear triplets born New Year's Day remains alive. The second to die met the same fate as the firstcuffed to death by its mother, zoo officials said yes terday. The third cub has been placed in an incubator and ap pears to be doing well.

title: Tex Ritter Backs War Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 (AP) Tex Ritter, former Western singing star and a candidate for the Republican nomination for the Senate from Tennessee, said today he agrees with President Nixon's Vietnam pol icy. Mr. Ritter, 65 years old, came to Washington to meet party leaders, Tennessee Re publicans and reporters.

title: Forecasting a Recession
description: Forecasters who shout down any possibility of reces sion in 1970 base their judgment on two important premises: that consumers will spend a major part of the $13billion they will receive because the surtax has been halved and because Social Security bene fits have been increased and that businessmen will not slash radically their plans to invest in new plant and equip ment. As subsidi ary points, they note that busi nessmen have been cautious in their man agement of warehouse and shelf stocks, making massive inventory correction unnec essary, and that the disap pearance of a full employ ment, budget surplus makes Federal spending stimulative once again. they will receive because the surtax has been halved and because Social Security bene fits have been increased and that businessmen will not slash radically their plans to invest in new plant and equip ment. As subsidi ary points, they note that busi nessmen have been cautious in their man agement of warehouse and shelf stocks, making massive inventory correction unnec essary, and that the disap pearance of a full employ ment, budget surplus makes Federal spending stimulative once again.

title: Wind sors Discuss Marriage, Golf and Being With It on B.B.C.
description: LONDON, Jan. 13The Duchess of Windsor said that she would like to be the head of an advertising agency. The Duke of Windsor said that his doctor had told him it was better to smoke mari juana than ordinary tobacco but that he did not intend to try it.

title: An ExPublisher Says Peru Gags Critics
description: MEXICO CITY, Jan. 13 Manuel Ulla founder and former publisher of the Lima newspaper Expreso, said today that the new Peruvian press law was designed to gag crit icism of the inept military Gov ernment in Peru.

title: Race Drivers Shift Their Allegiances
description: LET'S see, now, where were we? Ah, yes: Dan Gurney's opening the switch season by leaving Ford to drive Plymouth. Super Birds in stockcar road races and Barracudas in the Trans American series, As drivers and team managers have moved around, Plymouth has come out well. Besides Gurney, the company has won Richard Petty has won more than 100 stockcar races, had left Plymouth in 1969 to drive Fords. But, as he puts it, the Pettys and Plymouth arewell, like family. Some family: the Pettys are under stood to be getting between $2million and $3million in the new Plymouth deal.

title: Gov. Williams Urges Tax Aid by State to Users of White Schools
description: JACKSON, Miss., Jan. 13 Gov. John Bell Williams asked the Mississippi Legislature to day to give financial assistance to private, racially segregated schools by providing state tax relief to their patrons.

title: Development Bank Post
description: Roger H. Wall has been elected president of the Govern ment Development Bank for Puerto Rico. He succeeds Juan Labadie Eurite, who has retired. Angel M. Martin, secretary of the Treasury of Puerto Rico, had been elected chairman of the board of directors of the Government Development Bank.

title: Stanford U. Gives Up Control Of Institute A ssailed by Students
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Jan. 13 Stanford University has agreed to give up control over the Stanford Research Institute, tar get of campus demonstrations, for payments of more than $25 million spread over a period of years.

title: European Football
description: By Reuters

title: HONORS FOR DR.KING SETS FOR TOMORROW
description: Tomorrow has been proclaimed Martin Luther King Day by both Governor Rockefeller and Mayor Lindsay.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: MISS MEYER GAINS TOPATHLETE PRIZE
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Jan. 13 (AP)  Debbie Meyer, 17yearold schoolgirl from Sacramento, Calif., who won three swimming gold medals in the Mexico City Olympics, was selected today as The As sociated Press female athlete of the year for 1969. She almost won the award in 1968, but she was narrowly beaten in the poll by the ice skater, Peggy Fleming.

title: Frank Folsom, Head of R.C. A. During Early Rise of TV Dead
description: Frank M. Folsom, former president of the Radio Corpo ration of America, an aggressive merchandiser whose bold sell Ing concepts played a major part in the commercial expan sion of television, died Monday night after a brief illness.

title: Alabama Cases Pressed
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 (AP) The Government moved to day to speed up school deseg regation in three southern Ala bama counties.

title: The Funny Thing Is That They Are Still Feminine
description: TIME was when a woman comedian had to make herself ugly, cross her eyes, or fall down in order to get laughs. Her hair stuck straight up in the air or else it resembled a ragmop. And it didn't hurt any if she was a few dozen pounds overweight.

title: By PHILIP H. DOUGHERTY
description: When Norton Garfinkle was teaching economics and economic history at Amherst students would occasionally askas they are wont to do if you're so smart, why aren't you rich?

title: BUCKS TURN BACK ROYALS, 112 TO 92
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 13 (AP) Jon McGlocklin scored 10 points and Lew Alcindor 9 in the third quarter tonight as the Milwaukee Bucks pulled away from the Cincinnati Royals for a 11292 National Basketball Association victory.

title: CHIEFS' ACE FEELS INJURY WILL HEAL
description: In his firm but quiet manner, Len Dawson, the quarterback of the world champion Kansas City Chiefs, indicated here yes terday that he would spurn surgery for his damaged left knee and also spurn his wife's plea that he retire from pro football.

title: GOLD QUOTA SET FOR SOUTH AFRICA
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 South Africa's right to sell gold to the International Monetary Fund will be determined daily by prices on the London gold market and the amount will be about onefifth of a week's gold production, it was disclosed today.

title: 2 TEACHERS OUSTED OVER CLASS ON SEX
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Jan. 13 (AP)Four nude modelstwo pale, two femalepostured be fore the coeducational sociol ogy class of 250 persons.

title: Plan to Hold L. I. R. R. Fare Under Study.
description: A state loan to the Long Is land Rail Road in anticipation really, in hopeof a favor able Federal ruling on division of freight rates was being ex plored in Albany yesterday as a way to avert or hold down a new passenger fare increase.

title: CHERINGTON QUITS AS AIDE TO VOLPE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 Paul W. Cherington, Assistant Secretary of Transportation for policy and international affairs, confirmed today that he would leave the Government next month to return to the Harvard Business School faculty and to consulting work for private industry.

title: Mrs. Nixon Gets Press Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 (AP) Miss Martha Doss, a 29year old secretary from Birmingham, Mich., has joined the press staff of Mrs. Richard M. Nixon. The seventh member of the White House press office staff, she was transfered to the White House from her job in the De partment of Housing and Urban Development to be a secretarial assistant to Helen Smith, Mrs. Nixon's director of press rela tions.

title: N.B.C. CREATES POST FOR CHILDREN'S TV
description: The National Broadcasting Company named George A. Heinemann yesterday to the new post of vice president for children's TV programs.

title: 50,000 NASA JOBS TO BE ELIMINATED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 The National Aeronautics and Space Administration an nounced today that it would cut 50,000 jobs from its programs in the next 18 months to save nonev.

title: SOUTHLAND LIST SOUGHT BY MESA
description: The Mesa Petroleum Com pany announced yesterday it had filed suit in the Court of Chancery in Wilmington, Del., in an attempt to force the Southland Royalty Company to provide Mesa with a list of its shareholders.

title: Machinists Threaten Strike Against T.W.A.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 (UPI)An offcial of the Inter national Association of Ma chinists and Aerospace Work ers said today that the; union would go on strike against Trans World Airlines at 3 A.M. Thursday if negotiators had not reached an agree ment on a new contract be fore then.

title: Boycott of G.E. Gets Mixed Shopper Reaction
description: While one Brooklyn house wife refrained recently from buying an electric cutting knife made by the General Electric Company, a Manhattan woman, event out of her way to several, stores just so she could buy a General Electric frying pan.

title: CITY PLANNING CHIEF ACCUSES THE TIMES
description: The chairman of the City Planning Commission charged yesterday that a New York Times news story Dec. 29 on the commission's preparation of the capital budget for 1970 71 contained unsupported and erroneous allegations.

title: GALLAGHER FIRST AT SKIING TRIALS
description: PUTNEY, Vt., Jan. 13Mike Gallagher, a hungrylooking skier from upstate Killington, and Mike Elliott, a graduate student at Colorado State, clinched berths today on the United States crosscountry squad that will compete in the world championships Feb. 14.

title: 2 Burning Ships Call Off SOS After Fires Go Out
description: The Norwegian tanker Condo and the threemasted schooner Tina Maria Doncine of unknown registry were both reported to Eave called off rescue efforts by the Coast Guard yesterday aft er catching fire in the Atlantic Ocean.

title: CASE TO BE GIVEN FURTHER STUDY
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 Yale University was placed on athletic probation for 17 months by the Eastern College Athletic Conference's executive council today, but within three hours after announcing the penalty, the council withdrew it for further study.

title: Smith and M'Manus Gain Second Round In Victorian Tennis
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Jan. 13 (AP)Stan Smith, the top ranked United States tennis ace, led an American charge into the second round today at the Victorian open champion shins.

title: Advertising: Brand Rating Held a Success
description: Advertising: Brand Rating Held a Success

title: Britain Broke Even in Trade For December, Figures Show
description: LONDON, Jan. 13Britain broke even in her merchandise trade with the rest of the world in December, Government fig ures showed today. After de ductions for freight and insur ance, the value of imports was balanced by the value of ex ports.

title: JERSEY ISSUE SOLD IN BOND MARKETS
description: In the first major tripleA taxexempt financing this year, New Jersey sold $25million of bonds yesterday, and under writers priced them to yield at least half a percentage point less than similar securities mar keted when interest rates were at their peak in midDecem ber.

title: Ethiopia Gives $20,000
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Jan. 13 (Agence FrancePresse)  Emperor Haile Selassie today ordered the transfer of $20,000 to the Nigerian Government to help victims of the civil war and appealed to the world com munity to rush food and medi cal supplies to starving civil iaps.

title: REAGAN ASKS FUND TO FEED CHILDREN
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Jan. 13 Gov. Ronald Reagan, respond ing to a State Assembly, Com mittee's report that California's welfare grants were insufficient to feed children properly, asked today for an emergency appro priation of $6million to provide free meals for needy school children

title: ROCKEFELLER ASKS FUND FOR HARLEM
description: ALBANY, Jan. 13Governor Rockefeller today sent to the Legislature a $93.7million de ficiency budget that included request for $6million more for the controversial Harlem State Office Building.

title: ALFRED BUEHLER, TAX EXPERT, DIES
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 13 Dr. Alfred G. Buehler, one of the nation's leading tax author ities, died yesterday in Bryn Mawr Hospital. His age was 69.

title: Offshore Oil. Rig Blows Out
description: SABINE PASS, Tex., Jan. 13 (UPI)An oil well rig 15 miles from the Texas coast blew out and caught fire early today, forcing 28 men to leap into the Gulf of Mexico. One man drowned and nine suffered minor burns and injuries. The flames quickly, engulfed the 180by106foot rig platform. The well casing collapsed un der the heat of the flames and fell back into the well hole, Plugging it and stopping the fire.

title: MENKES FEUER
description: Menkes Feuer, president of Menkes Feuer, Inc., and chair man of the board of the Feuer Hide and Skin Corporation and Feuer Hide and Skin Interna tional, Inc., of New York and Gloversville, N.Y., died yester day at the FlowerFifth Avenue Hospital. He was 73 years old and lived at 15 Central Park West. Mr. Feuer was a mem ber of the national panel of the American Arbitration Associa tion.

title: NIGERIAN REJECTS HELP FROM GROUPS THAT AIDED BIAFRA
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Jan. 13 Maj. Gen. Yakubu Gowon, Ni geria's head of state, today con demned foreign relief agencies that had aided Biafra. He charged that they had inter fered with the conduct of the Nigerian civil war and with Nigeria's attempts to handle the problems of hunger and the dis tribution of food and medical supplies.

title: Defoliation Said to Cut Cambodian Rubber Output
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 Two teams of scientists have reported that they found that United States defoliation efforts in the Vietnam war had damaged rubber production in adjacent Cambodia.

title: De Carlo Trial Delayed
description: NEWARK, Jan. 13The Fed eral extortion conspiracy trial of Angelo (Gyp) De Carlo, re puted Mafia figure, and three other men was not held today because of the illness of Judge Robert Shaw. The defendants are accused of making extor tionate loans to the late Louis B. Saperstein, a Newark broker and labor racketeer. other men was not held today because of the illness of Judge Robert Shaw. The defendants are accused of making extor tionate loans to the late Louis B. Saperstein, a Newark broker and labor racketeer.

title: Dictated in Cairo?
description: The Soviet reply to United States proposals for a negotiated settlement in the Middle East is a disap pointing exercise in diplomatic cowardice. Retreating from positions that American diplomats say the Rus sians had advanced in private conversations, the Soviet note seems designed to appease the most intransigent Arabs, as though dictated in Cairo.

title: Sato to Be Renominated Premier by the Diet Today
description: TOKYO, Wednesday, Jan. 14 (Reuters)  Premier Eisaku Sato's Cabinet resigned today to enable the formation of a new Government following general elections last month.

title: Adelphi Coach Builds His Team By Pulling Some Apron Strings
description: A belated invitation helped squeeze Adelphi University into one of the secondary relay races at the Wanamaker Mill rose games last year.

title: WELSH FLEE HOMES NEAR STRAINED DAM
description: MAERDY, Wales, Jan. 13 Engineers and firemen were racing against time and rain tonight to pump hundreds of tons of water from the reser voir at the head of this mining valley in Glamorgan County. Officials are concerned about the condition of the 70yearold dam, and 2,000 people have left their homes in areas threatened with flooding.

title: Crockford, Famed London Club, Will Lose Its Gambling License
description: LONDON, Jan. 13Games of chance will not be permitted at Crockford's, London's most re nowned gambling club, after July 1.

title: LONG BRANCH GETS JERSEY WARNING
description: TRENTON, Jana 13  The State Supreme Court warned the municipal officials of Long Branch today that their local court would be abolished if they did not put art end to local and public controversy involving the court.

title: Dr. King's Body Moved; A Memorial Is Planned
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 13The body of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. has been transferred to a site adjacent to his former church, his fam ily announced today. The move was the first step in the creation of a memorial center for the slain civil rights leader.

title: SILVER FUTURES SHOW FIRM TONE
description: The General Services Admin istration sold 1,662,000 ounces of silver of 1,737,000 ounces offered yesterday at prices ranging from a high of $1.8240 to a low of $1.8061 an ounce. This was slightly lower than last week's prices.

title: A Yiddish Poet in Moscow Appeals for Help to Emigrate to Israel
description: I am a Yiddish poet and as such I am utterly superfluous in the Soviet Union. Surely no one can any longer deny that because of certain historical developments, there is abso lutely no future for Yiddish culture here.

title: Antihijacking System Is Demonstrated
description: A vehicle surveillance sys tem that can tell a dispatcher lone of his trucks is being hi jacked was demonstrated here yesterday by the Hazeltine Cor poration.

title: Mays Goes to Bat for Stock in Trade
description: Willie Mays, who first ex cited New Yorkers in 1951, makes his first gala New York City appearance of 1970 today, in honor of his 600th home run. Just to describe his itinerary involves a longer list of com mercial announcements than primetime movie on television.

title: A Correction
description: In a dispatch in The New York Times yesterday from Lusaka, Zambia, it was incor rectly stated that Togo and Upper Volta were among the four African nations that rec ognized Biafra. In fact, the Ivory Coast and Gabon as well as Tanzania and Zambia rec ognized Biafra. Upper Volta and Togo supported the stand of the Organization of African Unity, of which they are mem bers, urging a unified Nigeria.

title: School Segregation Emerging as Key Issue of 70's in Atlanta, a Liberal Bastion in the South
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 13On they came, marching along the chilled, rainglistened streets, crying out for justice and fair ness in the schools of the city.

title: British Shipbuilders to Get Cheap Credit
description: LONDON, Jan. 13 (AP) British banks have announced agreement in principle with the Government and the Bank of, England on granting cheap credit to British shipbuilding concerns.

title: EXETER DEAL MADE BY COMMONWEALTH
description: In the corporate reorganize tion of the Commonwealth United Corporation, in which Louis J. Nicastro became presi dent and chief executive offi cer, the company has agreed to transfer the assets of its real estate division to a new ven ture, which the Exeter Inter national Corporation and Com monwealth will jointly own.

title: A Correction
description: A report in yesterday's New York Times that former Water Commissioner James L. Marcus pleaded guilty to a charge of having solicited and received a bribe from the Consolidated Edison Company was in error. Marcus did agree to solicit and accept the bribe, $20,000, but, as the indictment said, from another persoh, not Consoli dated Edison. The bribe was to permit Con Ed to rebuild its transmission line in West chester County.

title: Rotz, Released by Hospital, Seeks Clearance to Ride
description: MIAMI, Jan. 13 (AP)John L. Rotz, who was injured in threehorse spill yesterday at Tropical Park, was released from a hospital today.

title: Zamyatin Finds It Too Early to Assess Progress
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 13The Sov iet Union and Communist China have resumed negotiations in Peking, a Soviet Government spokesman announced today.

title: Lacey Proposes Program For Jersey's Crime Fight
description: NEWARK, Jan. 13United States Attorney Frederick Lacey disclosed today a sixpoint program that he plans to present to New Jersey legislators in an effort to win the battle against organized crime. Megardless of how forcefully the Federal Govern ment prosecutes organized crime, he said at a news con ference in his office at the Federal Building here, it can not be wiped out until there is vigorous enforcement on state and local levels.

title: Soviet Favors U.S. Role In European Conference
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 13  The Soviet Union has taken a favorable attitude toward United States participation in the proposed allEuropean security conference, a Soviet Government spokesman said to day.

title: GENE SCOTT TAKES COURT TENNIS TEST
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 13 Gene Scott, a former Davis Cup player from New York, sur prised by gaining the quarter final round of the United States open court tennis championship with a 48, 81, 85 victory over James L. Van Alen 2d of Phila delphia today at the Racquet Club.

title: Article 1  No Title
New Boon to Cars on Ice
description: BOSTON, Jan. 13 (UPI)The Massachusetts Division of the American Automobile Associa tion has suggested a new way to give automobiles traction in icy weatherkitty gravel. This granular substance, which is used in a cat's litter basket, can be scattered on slick places to give, traction in starting a car and is said to be much better for he job than sand.

title: No Major Tet Flareup Seen
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 13Analysts here say they do at expect enemy forces to mount a major military offen sive during the threeday Tet, or Lunar New Year, holiday next month.

title: 5th Coup Effort Since May In Sudan Is Reported Foiled
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, Jan. 13 (AP)Defense Minister Khalid Hassan Abbas said to day that an attempted coup d'etat had been foiled by the Sudan's, revolutionary Govern ment. This was said to have been the fifth attempted coup since the Government came to power last May.

title: BROODMARE BRINGS $56,000 AT SALES
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Jan. 13 (AP)John R. Gaines of Lex ington paid $56,000 today for the broodmare Victoria Cross II, in foal to Dr. Fager, at the Keeneland winter sale of thoroughbred horses of all ages.

title: Carole L. Keith Plans Wedding
description: Mr. and Mrs. Herbert R. Keith of New York and Greenwich, Conn., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Carole Louise Keith, to Lieut. F. David KempPotter of the British Navy. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. F. Richard KempPotter Hillside of Fin don, Sussex, England.

title: 3 ARAB COUNTRIES CLOSER TO A PACT
description: CAIRO, Jan. 13The United Arab Republic, the Sudan and Libya moved a step closer to day to a regional alliance, agreeing to organize a series of ministerial commissions to study coordination of economic, cultural, military and political affairs.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, JANUARY 14, 1970

title: Nolet's 2 LastPeriod Goals Down Seals for Flyers, 31
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Jan. 13 (UPI)Simon Nolet's two third period goals paced the Philadel phia Flyers to a 31 National Hockey League victory over the Oakland Seals tonight. The secondplace Flyers, undefeated in their last five games, solidi fied their position, 3 points in front of Minnesota.

title: Fanny May Results Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13Mortgages prices declined sharply on, continued heavy volume at this week's auction, the Federal National Mortgage Association disclosed today.

title: Miss Stephanie Nickerson Engaged
description: ROSLYN HARBOR, L. I., Jan. 13Nassau County Ex ecutive Eugene H. Nickerson and Mrs. Nickerson have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ste phanie Westcote Nickerson, to Stephen Baldwin Bromley Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Bromley of Upper Nyack, N Y

title: Article 2  No Title
description: International MahJongg Tournament

title: Schumann Defends Libyan Deal as Help To French Influence
description: PARIS, Jan. 13  Foreign Minister Maurice Schumann told Gaullist Deputies today that France's policy in the Mediter ranean area had helped her re gain her influence in the Arab world. He defended the Govern ment's approval of a sale of 50 MirageIII fighter planes to Libya by saying that the con ditions and dates of delivery would not compromise efforts by the Big Four powers to agree on a solution to the ArabIs raeli conflict.

title: There's Reason for the Broken Glass
description: PEOPLE just stop inside the door and stare, said Martin Noren, who, with his brother, David, runs the Gem Monogram and Cut Glass Corporation. Then they say, I thought this was just going to be some little repair shop.

title: Terrorist Attack Reported On U.S. Base in Thailand
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Jan. 13 (AP) Sixteen terrorists were reported to have attacked the Ubol air base early today. Six of them were killed and an American airman was wounded.

title: Office Furniture for the Office at Home
description: The designs by William Lansing Plumb and Associ ates include some of the smartest, most colorful desks, cabinets and sausage seating in town.

title: Enemy Base Near Danang Captured by U.S. Troops
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 13 (AP)United States troops, pursuing a North Vietnamese force in foothills west of Tam ky, captured a freshly built base camp today in an area where enemy troop concentra tions have been renorted.

title: Opera Auditions in March
description: The Juilliard American Opera Center, which is directed by Tito Capobiano, will hold au ditions for singers between the ages of 20 and 33 from March 2 through 7 in the Juilliard Theater. The opera center pro vides young singers with per formance experience needed to bridge the gap between final training and a fulltime profes sional career. For applications, write to the Opera Center, the Sunliard School, Lindoln Center Plaza, New York, N. Y. 10023.

title: At Ojukwu's Last Cabinet Meetings Some Wept, but Some Were Beyond Tears
description: LIBREVILLE, Gabon, Jan. 13 (Agence FrancePresse)The final meetings of Gen. Odumeg wu Ojukwu, the Biarfran lead er, with his cabinet and mili tary advisers were long, sad affairs, according to those who were present.

title: U.S. Found Leading World In Those Quitting Cigarettes
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 (Reu ters) Anticigarette campaign ers today began Washington's first No Smoking Week and said the United States led the world in the number of people who have quit smoking ciga rettes.

title: AMERICAN HOCKEY LEAGUE
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME

title: Assembly Gets Ethics Measure Concerning Banking Committee
description: ALBANY, Jan. 13A resolu tion was introduced in the As sembly today to prohibit any one who owns stock in a bank, or serves as an employe, officer or director of a bank from sitting on the Assembly Banks Committee.

title: Miss Amara to Be Aida
description: The Metropolitan Opera has announced that Lucine Amara will replace Gabriella Tucci in the title role of Verdi's Aida. Miss Tucci has returned to Italy to be with her mother, who is. ill. The company also announced that Stanislaw Skrowaczewski will replace Kurt Adler as con ductor of Mozart's Die Zau berflte in the performance to be given next Monday.

title: LEGISLATURE BARS MANHATTAN PLAN FOR SCHOOL ZONES
description: ALBANY, Jan. 13The Leg islature approved a series of changes in New York City's school decentralization law to day, but the Senate rejected a proposal that would have per mitted the city's Board of Edu cation to deviate from the basic plan and establish the Spanish speaking community of East Harlem as a separate school district.

title: Agnew Gives Australia Partnership Vow
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Jan. 13  Vice President Agnew greeted Australians today with a pledge of partnership in the Pacific and a friendly wave to antiwar demonstrators.

title: Nixon to Fete Wyeth At the White House
description: Andrew Wyeth, the be laureled painter whose pain stakingly realist work is adored by conservative art critics and scorned by the avantgarde, has a friend at the White House.

title: NEW CREDIT SYSTEM SET BY DINERS CLUB
