description: Studies reported here yester day indicate that chronic ex posure to low levels of carbon monoxide, a common air pol lutant, may produce damage to the arteries and heart muscle and hinder the development of the unborn child.

title: Increase in Earnings Is Reported by the Corning Glass Works
description: Consolidated net earnings of Corning Glass Works were up seven per cent to $50,029,547, or $7.26 a share in 1969, from $46,766,679 or $6.79 a share earned the year before.

title: DARTMOUTH SINKS HARVARD, 83 TO 80
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 14 Dartmouth scored 18 straight points in the final 5 minutes tonight to overcome a 15point deficit and hand Harvard an 8380 defeat in an Ivy League basketball game.

title: NASSAU DISTRICTING RULED AGAINST LAW
description: ALBANY, Jan. 14The Court of Appeals ruled today that the present weighted voting plan of the Nassau County Super visors was unconstitutional but that a new plan was not neces sary until after the 1970 Fed eral census.

title: Nassau County Aide Named
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Jan. 14A. William Larson, the unsuccess ful Democratic candidate for Presiding Supervisor of the Town of Hempstead in last fall's election, was named to day as head of the Nassau County Department of Com merce and Industry. He will succeed Thomas F. Greene, who resigned, in he $29,000a year post.

title: INTEREST RATES UP ON BOND MARKET
description: Interest rates on new issues of corporate bonds were raised slightly yesterday, interrupting the downward trend that began in early December.

title: FURTHER GAIN SEEN FOR SPORTING GOODS
description: The fourday Sporting Goods Fair closed yesterday at the New Yorker Hotel, with manu facturers and retailers con vinced that their industry's up ward movement will continue this year.

title: MRS. J. B. NEUMANN
description: PORT CHESTER, N. Y., Jan. 14Mrs. Elsa Schmid Neu mann, a mosaic artist, died of cancer yesterday in United Hospital. She was 75 years old and lived in Rye. Mrs. Neu mann was the widow of J. B. Neumann, an art critic and lecturer.

title: Plane Called Back To Kennedy Airport And a Gun Is Found
description: The police may have foiled an attempted hijacking early yesterday morning when they called back to Kennedy Inter national Airport an Eastern Air lines jet on its way to Puerto Rico.

title: Nigerian Agency's Role
description: GENEVA, Jan. 14The Nige rian Red Cross said today that it expected to he the sole source of food for 1.5 million people in the liberated areas of. Bi afra. It submitted an urgent re quest to the League of Red Cross Societies for heavy, trucks, LandRovers and a ves sel to help distribute the food, but said it did not need any aircraft.

title: Seaver Is Named in Poll As Male Athlete of Year
description: Tom Seaver, whose pitching arm helped make the New York Mets world champions, was named male athlete of the year yesterday in The Associated Press's annual poll.

title: Biologist Urges a Drive to Study Possible Genetic Peril in Drugs
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14 There is an imperative need for more research on the possibility that dangerous genetic damage may be done by some drugs, food additives and other chemi cals, a scientist said today.

title: Sports Today
description: HARNESS RACING Roosevelt Raceway, Westbury, L. I, 8 P.M.

title: Soviet Begins a Nationwide Census Today, the First in 11 Years
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 14A half million census takers begin the nationwide task tomorrow morning of recording the popu laton changes that have taken place in the Soviet Union since the last census in 1959.

title: Curbing Drugs at Their Source
description: One hundred and thirty years ago, a Chinese Gov ernment alarmed by the spread of opium addiction among its people addressed an eloquent appeal to Queen Victoria to cut off the lucrative opium trade that British merchants were then promoting between India and China. An enlightened Chinese commis sioner at Canton, the chief port of entry, wrote:

title: FOUR COUNTRIES BARRED BY LAGOS FROM GIVING HELP
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Jan. 14The Nigerian Government an nounced today that it would accept no assistance for the re lief of the victims of its civil war from France, Portugal, South Africa, Rhodesia or any other country or agency that had been studiously hostile toward Nigeria through the lone conflict.

title: STUDENT DISORDER FOUND PAST CREST
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 14College administrators seem to have de veloped a new sense of confi dence in dealing with student upheaval.

title: Personal Finance: TakeHome Pay
description: Have you noticed that your takehome payunless you got a raise at New Year's is lower than it was only a few weeks ago?

title: A Drug Is Shown to Combat Parkinson's Disease
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14  The first widescale results of the experimental use of the con troversial drug LDOPA were reported today, showing that it had dramatically reversed the course of Parkinson's disease in almost 5 per cent of those who had been treated with the chemical.

title: Young Pros Ready to Challenge Top Stars in Phoenix Open Tourney Today
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Jan 14 (AP)  A rising tide of young stars is ready to give a sea of trouble to the old pros Billy Casper and Gene Littler for the favorite's role in the $100,000 Phoenix open golf tournament.

title: Rozelle Will Enter N.F.L. Owner Talks If Impasse Remains
description: The owners of the 13 teams in the new National Conference of the National Football League went through five more hours of meetings here yesterday without reaching a solution for realignment.

title: Government Payments Held Vital for Farm Incomes
description: TOPEKA, Kan., Jan. 14 (UPI) Government payments to farmers will be needed to bring farm incomes to the level of other American groups, a top Government official said today.

title: RADICAL TO HEAD PRESBYTERY HERE
description: The Rev. James D. Watson, a minister from Queens who calls himself a radical, has been elected moderator of the New York Presbytery of the United Presbyterian Church.

title: Vietnam Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14 (AP) The following servicemen from the New York area were identified by the Defense De partment today as having been killed in Vietnam:

title: Appeal for Neediest Brings Responses From Around Globe
description: While most of the contri butions and letters to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund come from per sons in the metropolitan area, donations have come in from all over the world.

title: Bessemer Mayor Reelected
description: BESSEMER, Ala., Jan. 14 (UP)Jess Lanier, a strong supporter of George C. Wal lace, easily won a third term, yesterday as Mayor of this city, where Negroes make up 60 per cent of the population. Mr. Lanier received 3,279 votes, Claude J. Smith 1,887 and James Harrington 895. All three are white, but Mr. Har rington had strong Negro backing. Officials said that a turnout of only 45 per cent of the registered voters had ap ??ently helped Mr. Lanier. Mr. Lanier received 3,279 votes, Claude J. Smith 1,887 and James Harrington 895. All three are white, but Mr. Har rington had strong Negro backing. Officials said that a turnout of only 45 per cent of the registered voters had ap ??ently helped Mr. Lanier.

title: Werblin to Be Honored
description: Sonny Werblin, former own er of the New York Jets, will be honored by the Sports Lodge of B'nai B'rith for his success in thoroughbred racing at the annual Bill Corum memorial dinner Jan. 24 at the Hotel Roosevelt. Werblin's Silent Screen was voted the out standing 2yearold horse of 1969.

title: Anxiety Rises in Europe
description: Anxiety Rises in Europe

title: York Rides Seven Winners, One Short of Tying Record
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Jan. 14 (AP) Ray York came within one victory today of tying a nation al thoroughbred racing record for jockeys when he rode seven winners on the 10race program at Turf Paradise.

title: A MIRV Test Moratorium Is Supported by DuBridge
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14In the arms control delibera tions within the Administration, the proposal for a mora torium by the United States and the Soviet Union on the testing of multiple missile warheads is gaining the tech nical support of Dr. Lee Du Bridge, the President's science adviser.

title: Walton League Sues to Protect a Wilderness Area
description: DULUTH, Minn., Jan. 14 The Izaak Walton League be gan legal proceedings here to day to block all mineral ex ploration by private companies in the vast Boundary Waters Canoe Area.

title: A.H.S.A. MEETING SET HERE TODAY
description: The annual convention of the American Horse Shows As sociation begins today at the WaldorfAstoria Hotel with a meeting of the board of direc tors. The convention will run through Saturday.

title: T.W.A. AND UNION PRESSING TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, Thursday Jan. 15 (UPI)A Federal me diator reported progress last night in contract talks between Trans World Airlines and rep resentatives of 15,000 ground service personnel.

title: Pope Gives $30,000 in Aid
description: VATICAN CITY, Jan. 14 (Reuters)Pope Paul VI has made a personal contribution of $30,000 to help relieve suf fering in Nigeria, the president of the Roman Catholic relief organization Caritas, said to night.

title: Utility Expansion Set
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14 (UPI) The Federal Power Commis sion today authorized the Mon tanaDakota Utility Company to build $6.4million of natural gas pipeline facilities in North Dakota.

title: Oil Find Is Reported
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq, Jan. 14 (Reuters)  The Iraq National Oil Company announced today that oil has been found in com mercial quantities in the AlTeeb area of southern Iraq. A com pany spokesman said the dis covery was made recently by ERAP, a consortium of French companies which has been prospecting in the area under a 1968 agreement.

title: Ballet: Return to Normal
description: NO one who loves the dance can afford to knock The Nutcracker. Apart from that of the Ford Foundation, it is the greatest subsidy dance the United States has ever known. We are humiliatingly grateful for what it does for ushowever, there is a kind of song in our hearts when it is all over until next Christ mas. Even the greatest Nut cracker palls with time.

title: THIEU IS PLANNING CHANGES IN ARMY
description: BANMETHUOT, South Viet nam, Jan. 14 (Reuters)Presi dent Nguyen Van Thieu said today he expected to announce a reorganization of South Viet nam's armed forces later this year.

title: The Tin Council Continues Suspension of Sale Rule
description: LONDON, Jan. 14 (Reuters) The International Tin Coun cil decided today to continue another six weeks a suspension of its buffer stockpile manager's obligation to offer tin at the ceiling price of 1,605 ($3,852) a metric ton when the price is above or at that level.

title: U.S. Charges 7 Concerns Pollute Waterways Here
description: Seven industrial concerns were accused in Federal Court in Brooklyn yesterday of polluting New York City waterways or creating navigational hazards. It was the first concerted effort of the Fed eral Government to crack down on alleged polluters in the area following a call for such action several months ago by Secretary of the Inte rior Walter J. Hickel.

title: N. E. T. Will Survey Communes In Canadian Glimpse of China
description: A onehour Canadianpro duced documentary on present day China will be broadcast next Monday evening by Na tional Educational Television over the 165 stations of the country's public television net work. Until yesterday it was not at all certain that the pro gram would be shown.

title: The Case of the Mistaken Parole
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 14  I believe we've got to admit we've made a mistake, said J. Bernard Gates. I couldn't feel worse if it had happened to my wife.

title: 2 JAPANESE FILMS GIVEN TO MUSEUM
description: Two Japanese propaganda films that have never been shown in the Western hemis phere have been acquired by the Museum of Modern Art film archives. They were directed by Tomotako Tasaka in 1939, dur ing the SinoJapanese War.

title: TOP A. F. L. STARS OF DECADE PICKED
INTELSAT VEHICLE IS PLACED IN ORBIT
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Jan. 14 (AP)On the sixth attempt, the first rocket ever insured against failure hurled a com mercial communications satel lite into a successful prelimi nary orbit tonight.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: Senator Hart's Wife and Seven Others Go on Trial for Protest
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14 The wife of Senator Philip A. Hart, Democrat of Michigan, and seven codefendants went on trial today for breaking Federal building violations by attempt ing to hold an ecumenical mass for peace inside the Pentagon last Nov. 13.

title: Spy and Surfing Films Share Neighborhood Screens
Peck & Peck Announces Management Appointments
description: Peck & Peck, FifthAvenue based retail store chain, an nounced the appointments yes terday of a vice president and an advertising manager.

title: AGNEW, IN CANBERRA, HOLDS NEWS PARLEY
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Jan. I4Vice President Agnew ap peased one set of Australian critics today but avoided a con frontation with another.

title: Texas Quota for Oil Is Held at Record
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Jan. 15The Texas Railroad commission de cided today to hold the Febru ary allowable for Texas crude oil at the January market demand factor of 68 per cent, a record high since 1953. This is calculated to yield actual production of some 3,250,500 barrels per calendar day.

title: Soviet Economy Remains Sluggish
description: MOSCOW  The Soviet Union is entering the 1970's with its economy continu ing to react sluggishly to the efforts of Soviet leaders to instill a new sense of dynamism into both the in dustrial and agricultural sec tors.

title: Swiss Growth Elicits Groans
description: GENEVA  The fastmov ing Swiss economy is picking up speed at a rate that is causing the Government to groan with concern over the specter of inflation.

title: Floridians Rout Pipers
description: MIAMI, Jan. 15 (AP)Miami's Floridians racked up a 146121 American Basketball Associa tion victory over the Pittsburgh Pipers tonight setting team records for total points and margin of victory.

title: Striking Teachers in Britain Threaten Stronger Action
description: LONDON, Jan. 15 (AP)  About 5,000 school teachers, boycotting their classrooms in the biggest strike in the history of British education, warned today they might take tougher measures unless they got pay increases totaling $100million. measures unless they got pay increases totaling $100million.

title: Who Cares If Roof Leaks?
description: A selective list of restau rants in New York and vici nity is given on this page on Friday. The restaurants are rated four stars to none, based on the relationship of food and service to cost. Credit cards are honored in the restaurants where it is indicated.

title: Big Cases Remain as Morgenthau Leaves
description: The alleged involvement of State Supreme Court justice with Nathan Voloshen, a re puted influence peddler, and the possible misconduct of state Democratic figure are among two of the major cases that remain unresolved as Robert M. Morgenthau steps down as United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

title: Nassau Vows to Prosecute Sale Or Use of Peace Symbol on Flag
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Jan. 15The use of the American flag with the peace symbol displayed across its face was declared to be a violation of state law today by Nassau County District At torney William Cahn.

title: PERJURY CHARGED TO TWO CITY AIDES
description: Two high officials in the City Controller's office were ar rested yesterday on firstdegree perjury charges accusing them of lying to a grand jury in con nection with an application for city mortgage money.

title: FROMIN HONORED AT LIBERTY BELL
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 15 Marty Fromin ended his jockey apprenticeship today in an ac complished manner at Liberty Bell race track by riding two winners and raising his meet leading total to 57.

title: Northern Rebel Scores
description: BOWIE, Md., Jan. 15 (AP) Missing the sixfurlong tract record by only a fifth of a sea and while posting 1:09 2/5, Mar. ion R. Frankel's Northern Reb. sped to the lead near the last turn and won the feature at the Bowie race course today. The victory paid $4.80.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS EASTERN DISTRICT

title: Southern White Leaders Voice Anger and Dismay Over Integration Ruling
description: Anger and dismay appeared to be the prevailing emotions in the comments of some South ern white political leaders and many school officials on the Supreme Court's most recent integration ruling.

title: Cheryl Catton, Teacher, Affianced
description: SCOTT AIR FORCE BASE, Ill., Jan. 15  Gen. Jack J. Catton, U.S.A.F., commander of the Military Airlift Com mand, and Mrs. Catton have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Cheryl Lee Catton, to Capt. Francis Edward King, U.S.A.F., son of Mr. and Mrs. George King of Pinetta, Fla. A spring wed ding is planned.

title: GEORGE WEHNER.
description: George Wehner, a composer, actor, and writer, died Monday at Long Island College Hospi tal, Brooklyn. He was 79 years old and lived at 69 Cranberry Street, Brooklyn.

title: Football Owners Tackle. Realignment Again Today
description: National Football League club owners failed once more to come up with a realignment plan for the 1970 season dur ing a meeting yesterday.

title: Police on Alert as Many Czechs Honor Memory of Jan Palach
description: VIENNA, Jan. 15Strong police forces were securing the center of Prague tonight, the eve of the first anniversary of Jan Palach's selfimmolation.

title: Bus Pact in Grand Rapids
description: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich., Jan. 15 (UPI)A tentative agree ment was reached today by the City Coach Line and bus driv ers who have been on strike since, Dec. 22. About 15,000 riders were affected by the lack of public transportation service.

title: ECONOMIC GROWTH HAS BEEN HALTED, AS WAS PLANNED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15The growth of the United States economy came to a halt in the fourth quarter of 1969which is about what the Government had sought with its policy of restraint.

title: Accident Kills 3 Workmen
description: HUNTINGTON, W. Va., Jan. 15 (UPI)Three workers were killed today and one was injured in, the collapse of a side of a railroad boxcar they were helping to construct at the American Car Foundry Com pany, The dead were identified as. Arthur Howard, 60 years old, South Point, Ohio; Robert Dunn, Apple Grove, W. Va., and John Music, Huntington. The injured Man; was Herman Pemberton, 59 of Chesapeake. Ohio.

title: U.S. Bars Pressure on Nigeria Relief
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15  Under Secretary of State Elliot L. Richardson said today that the United States policy on Ni gerian relief was guided by purely practical considerations aimed at delivering the largest amounts of food, medical sup plies and other required ma terials to the people who need them.

title: Jean Peters, Actress, to Sue Howard Hughes for Divorce
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Jan. 15 (AP)  Jean Peters, the former actress, will seek a divorce from Howard Hughes, the mystery billionaire, a spokesman said to day.

title: $7Million for Salvation Army
description: The Salvation Army an nounced at a luncheon yester day that it raised $7,002,512 to help maintain and expand its services in the city. More than $4million was raised for oper ational expenses, a record. The balance was contributed for capital expansion.

title: JERSEY AIDE ASKS BLUE CROSS RISE
description: TRENTON, Jan. 15  An in crease in Blue Cross costs to New Jersey subscribers of 22 per cent, effective next May 1, has been recommended to the State Banking and Insurance Department by T. Girard Whar ton, special counsel to the com missioner of the department.

title: Nigerians, Well Armed, Quickly Encircled Foe
description: SAO TOME, Jan. 15Biafra began to fall apart on Christ mas Eve.

title: Surgery for Wounded Baby
description: ASHEVILLE, N. C., Jan. 15 (AP)A 5monthold boy, born Aug. 22 with a bullet in his brain, was reported in fair con dition today after surgery to correct cranial swelling caused by the wound. The infant was wounded two days before birth when his father, James Messer of Waynesville, dropped a pis tol, which discharged. The bul let struck Mrs. Messer.

title: Upstate Ski Resorts Welcome Forecast of Warmer Weather
description: SKIERS who have found the cold weather and high winds in recent weeks un comfortable may be able to enjoy a change of pace this weekend. The forecast by the weatherman yesterday called for moderating tem peratures, even high in the north country. It will be a welcome change, said Orville Slutz ky, the head of the Hunter Moun tain center in the Catskills. Our crowds have been large but let's face it, polar bear weather keeps some skiers at home. And, remember, we've had mostly excellent conditions. welcome change, said Orville Slutz ky, the head of the Hunter Moun tain center in the Catskills. Our crowds have been large but let's face it, polar bear weather keeps some skiers at home. And, remember, we've had mostly excellent conditions.

title: U.S PATROL BOAT HUNTS POLLUTERS
description: A patrol boat called Sentry, which belongs to the Army's Corps of Engineers, struggled through deep ice floes in New York harbor yesterday as it made its rounds to check on potential water polluters.

title: Lions Enrich British Estate
description: LONDONFour years ago, it was just an idea to help keep the roof over one of the stately homes of England. To day it is a highly capitalized, growing and profitable busi ness.

title: FORT DIX AGAIN BARS PUERTO RICAN BISHOP
description: FORT DIX, N. J., Jan. 15A Roman Catholic Bishop from Puerto Rico, the Most. Rev. An tulio Parilla Bonilla, was pre vented for the second time to day from seeing prisoners in the post stockade here.

title: British Relief Airlift to Lagos Scheduled to Start Tonight
description: LONDON, Jan. 15 (AP) Britain's mercy airlift to Biafra will begin tomorrow night when a chartered plane takes off for Lagos with 11 tons of supplies, the Foreign Office said today.

title: Laird Says Defense Cuts Will Cost 1,250,000 Jobs
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 About 1,250,000 Americans will lose their jobs as a result of reductions in military man power and spending either already made or planned in the next defense budget, De fense Secretary Melvin R. Laird said today.

title: Durham, Goodman to Receive Boxing Writers' Top Awards
description: Yancy (Yank) Durham, the trainer of Joe Frazier, world heavyweight champion In six states, and Murray Goodman, a former sports writer and boxing publicity man for Madi son Square Garden, were named yesterday to receive major awards by the Boxing Writers Association at the group's 45th annual dinner this spring. The site and date will be an nounced.

title: Direct Election Supported
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (UPI) The League of Women Voters announced today that it would support legislation pending in Congress providing for direct popular elections of Presidents.

title: Three Commuters Arrested on L.I.R.R.
description: Three Long Island Rail Road commuters, angry over having to wait nearly an hour in freez ing weather for a train in Ja maica, Queens, were arrested last night on their homeward bound train after they refused to show their tickets to a con ductor.

title: Beirut Bars Commandos in Two Towns
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 15 The Government today ordered commando representatives out of Hasbeya and Nabatiye, two southern towns, after demon strations in which a commando office had been set afire by angry townspeople.

title: Hanoi Says Nixon Criteria On Pullout Can't Be Met
description: PARIS, Jan. 15Ha Van Lau, North Vietnam's repre sentative at the Paris peace talks, said at the 50th session of the talks today that President Nixon's three criteria for the withdrawal of United States forces in fact can never be met.

title: LLOYD E. VARDEN, PHOTO AUTHORITY
description: Lloyd E. Varden, professor of photographic science and engineering at Columbia Uni versity and a leading consult.. ant to the photographic indus try in this country and abroad died yesterday at Presbyterian Hospital. He was 58 years old.

title: The Times and Two Honored By Medical Writers Group
description: The New York Times received last night the 1969 award of the American Medical Writers Association for excellence in writing about medical subjects for the lay public. The award, a citation, was presented during ceremonies at a dinner of the metropolitan chapter of the as sociation.

title: NATIONAL GYPSUM EXPANDS HOLDING
description: The National Gypsum Com pany has notified the Securi ties and Exchange Commission that it has increased its hold ings in the H. H. Robertson Company to strengthen its in vestment and to facilitate an acquisition of control or a merger or other combination with Robertson. However, Na tional Gypsum did not say whether it intended to pursue any of these possibilities.

title: Bookkeeper Held on Charges That He Embezzled $160.000
description: A 29yearold bookkeeper was arrested yesterday on charges that he had embezzled $160,000 from his employer by thefts from a petty cash fund, which he was said to have re plenished by drawing checks on fictitious expense accounts.

title: New Couple in Town. Find Kin at Rites
description: Mr. and Mrs. William Morris walked a mile in the cold Yes terday morning to stand shiver ing on the corner of Bedford and Willoughby Avenues during the dedication of the Martin Luther King Jr. Building.

title: First Lady Christens, the First 747 Jet
description: WASHINGTON, Jana 15 (AP) Mrs. Richard M. Nixon chris tened the nation's first oper ational 747 jet the Clipper Young America at Dulles In ternational Airport today.

title: Israeli Satirist Quietly Directing Own Revue Here
description: Don't touch her, Jim. You shout at her, but don't touch. Remember, Oriental Jews abuse women but they don't touch themthat's disre spectful.

title: ALLIED FIRE BASE ATTACKED BY FOE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 15Enemy gunners are re ported to have fired about 100 mortar rounds into an allied artillery base near Cambodia and then launched a ground attack that died out after an hour of intense fighting. Allied soldiers killed 29 of the enemy, while suffering light casualties, military spokesmen reported here.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Johnny Murphy

title: Joint East Bloc Efforts Progressing
description: The Soviet bloc's econom ic alliance, which marked its 20th anniversary last year, continues to be frustrated in its attempts at economic in tegration, but it appears to be making progress toward the creation of convertible currencies that would make Eastern Europe's trade more realistic.

title: Ely Troupe Prepares Tour
description: Lyn Ely's Theater in Educa tion is preparing its 15th an nual production, Shakespeare Scene by Scene, for a tour of secondary schools in North Carolina, New Jersey, New York, Connecticut and Dela ware. The troupe of Equity per formers is composed of Michael Diamond, John Fitzgibbon, Lyn Leveridge, Richard Peterson and Ingrid Sonnichsen.

title: A Discussion
description: AT a luncheon in Brussels last month, six experts agreed that new efforts were needed to accelerate progress toward free trade among the world's principal industrial powers. Special attention was given to the revival of protectionist sentiment in the United States.

title: Chase Bank Reports a Decline, Using New Accounting Method
description: The Chase Manhattan Corporation reported yesterday that its profits, computed in conformity with the new ac counting methods, registered a 6.3 per cent decline last year to $93.36million, or $2.93 a common share, from $99.61 million, or $3.12 a share.

title: Riegel Adds Division
description: The formation of a forest products and real estate divi sion by the Riegel Paper Cor poration was announced yes terday. William M. Crilly, a corporate vice president, was named general manager of the division, which will be respons ible for the company's wood lands and real estate interests in New Jersey and North Caro lina.

title: Credit Policy Remains Unclear; Reserve's Data Hint at Easing
description: The Federal Reserve System's banking statistics con tinued yesterday to provide tantalizing indications that the central bank may have begun to modify its 13month program of severe credit re straint.

title: Point of View
description: COMES the revolution there will be Hilton and Intercontinental hotels in every major city, Diners Club and American Express cards in every pocket, Hertz and Avis cars in every garage and Coke and Pepsi in every, bottle.

title: Militants Seize Offices at M.I.T. As Student Ouster Is Protested
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan, 15 The executive offices of the, Massachusetts Institute of Tech nology were seized today by about 70 militants after four young men wearing long white coats and ski masks broke down the president's door with a fourfootIong steel battering ram.

title: Opposition in Bundestag
description: BONN, Jan. 15 (Reuters)  Opposition leaders depicted East Germany today as a satel lite of the Soviet Union unable and unwilling to negotiate in dependently with Bonn.

title: Nigerian Victor: A Prisoner of Duty
description: IN 1966, at the age of 32, Kakubu Dan Yumma Gowon, the fifth son of a Gonwa tribesman, emerged at the center of a turbulent vor tex of coups d'etat and assas sination. The then sixyear old independent nation of Ni geria was being torn apart by reeional conflict and tribal antagonism. The troubles widened. Local skirmishes and mutinies be came civil war. And yesterday General Gowon was em braced by a secessionist offi cer who proclaimed that the Republic of Biafra hereby ceases to exist. Nigeria's an guish, which had been deep ening since 1966, had come to a sort of historical turning point. antagonism. The troubles widened. Local skirmishes and mutinies be came civil war. And yesterday General Gowon was em braced by a secessionist offi cer who proclaimed that the Republic of Biafra hereby ceases to exist. Nigeria's an guish, which had been deep ening since 1966, had come to a sort of historical turning point.

title: Udall Says Nation Must Curb Growth to Spare Environment
description: Stewart L. Udall, the former Secretary of the Interior, said Wednesday night that limits would have to be put on this country's growth in the next decade to avoid destroying the environment.

title: Critics Invited to Paris Is Out, but Not Urgently
description: David Black has modified his original intention of not inviting the New York drama critics to review his latest pro duction, Paris Is Out, sched uled to give its first public performance Monday at the Brooks Atkinson Theater.

title: Point of View
description: AT all times, not only in the 12 years of my tenure of office as president of the Bundesbank [West Germany's central bank], my motto has been the call for a maximum of monetary discipline, that is to say, for a policy which protects the value of money against depreciation by keep ing the supply, of money tight.

title: City Agencies Ask Nearly $8Billion In New Fiscal Year
description: City agencies are requesting a total far in excess of $8bil lion to carry on their opera tions in the fiscal year begin ning July 1, an unofficial tally showed yesterday.

title: BLACK ON SCORES IN WESTBURY PACE
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Jan. 15 Billy Myer was wondering to night what he would have to do for a victory in 1970 at Roose velt Raceway. He finally found the answer in the feature Fam ily Night Pace as he drove Black On to a twolength tri umph in the mile race.

title: COOP CHIEF TO SEEK A TRIAL ON DOG BAN
description: The president of a coopera tive apartment house project on the Lower East Side has an nounced that he plans to press for a speedy trial following judge's refusal to enjoin a ten ant from keeping a dog in her apartment despite a ban against animals in her lease.

title: A. F. L. to Natnath and Dawson, Is the Thinking Man's League
description: Joe Namath is wearing a red sports jacket these days, out of love and respect for his second favorite football team.

title: Europeans Keep on Spending as Their Leaders
description: PARISIt was one of those frenzied years that seem to mark the turning points of history. Americans walked on the moon, and Europeans drew closer together economically. Governments changed, and new openings were made East and West. Out of currency chaos came the beginnings of a new monetary order.

title: Catholic Group Names Communications Chief
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 The Most Rev. Joseph L. Bernardin, general secretary of the United States Catholic Conference, announced today the appointment of Robert B. Beusse as director of the conference's communications department. He succeeds Warren W. Schwed, who re signed to engage in film pro duction and communications counseling.

title: Alice Fenvessy to Become a Bride
description: Miss Alice Fenvessy and James Bruce Healy, who are studying for doctorates at Rockefeller University, plan to be married in May.

title: Oil Called Peril to Food Supply in Sea
description: Ever since the ships of Columbus first became en tangled in its weeds, the Sar gasso Sea has been known for its drifting plants, but today its coating of tar and oil is more extensive than its famous seaweed.

title: Crisis Confronts Dutch Coalition Over Inflation Fight
description: THE HAGUE  Curbing wage and price inflation is the central objective of the Netherlands' coalition Cabi net headed by Premier Piet DeJong, but its critics as well as some of its admirers feel that conflicts over wages and prices may kill the Govern ment prematurely.

title: Diana Ross a Single Now
description: LAS VEGAS, Jan. 15 (AP) Diana Ross parted from the rest of the Supremes early today after the trio sang their last song together, a tearful Some day We'll Be Together. Miss Ross sang brief duets with members of the audience at the Frontier Hotel. Steve Allen, Hugh O'Brien and Bill Russell, the former basketball star, joined her.

title: Robert Cummings Divorced
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 15 (Reuters)  Robert Cummings, the film actor, ended his 22 yearold marriage in Supreme Court here today, becoming the first Hollywood personality to obtain a divorce under Califor nia's radically altered laws, which went into effect Jan. 1. Mr. Cummings, who is 59 years old, had to prove only that marital differences between him and his estranged wife, Mary, 52, a former actress, were irreconcilable. A later hearing will decide on the di vision of their common prop erty, nut at $700,000 to $800.000.

title: Emmanuel de Breuvery Is Dead; Priest Was Economist for U.N.
description: The Rev. Emmanuel de Breu very, a Jesuit priest and econ omist at the United Nations, died of a heart ailment Wednesday at New York Uni versity Hospital. He was 67 years old and lived at St. Ig natius Loyola Residence, 53 East 83d St.

title: Goldwater Assays Inflation
description: NASHVILLE, Jan. 15 (AP) Senator Barry Goldwater, Re publican of Arizona, called in flation the most troublesome problem of the decade today, and attributed it to tighti money and unreasonable union wage demands. Mr. Goldwater told a luncheon sponsored by the printing industry of Nash villa that inflation was a prod uct of governmental foolish ness.

title: Roosevelt Drivers
Francis I. duPont Closing 9 Branches
description: Francis I. duPont & Co., one of the nation's largest broker age concerns, announced yes terday that it either had closed or would close a total of nine of its branch offices here and abroad.

title: Spain's Economic Growth Is Creeping Ahead
description: MADRIDThe two dozen young economists who write Spain's development plans work in a warren of offices in the basement of the ven erable, totally inefficient Pal ace of the Presidency on the Avenida de la Castellana here.

title: Airline Hijacker Is Freed In Beirut on Cabinet Order
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 15 Christian Belon, the 26yearold Frenchman who hijacked a Trans World Airlines' jet to Beirut last Friday, was released from jail today on $8 bail on the order of Minister of the In terior. However, he could not make up his mind where to no.

title: Navy Retiring the Hornet
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (Reuters)  The Navy an nuonced it would retire the carrier Hornet, the recovery ship for the Apollo 11 moon astronauts. The Navy said that the carrier would leave her home port of Long Beach, Calif., in early March for Bremerton Naval Shipyard, where she will be retired June 30.

title: Index of Early Printing Ready for Publication
description: A comprehensive index of early American printing, in volving 50 years of research, will be published this month.

title: Intentionally Is Dead at 14
description: OCALA, Fla., Jan. 15 (AP)  Intentionally, the nation's champion sprinter in 1959 as 3yearold, died today at 14 of what Tartan Farms said was a heart attack. Intentionally, who was retired in 1961, won $652, 258 during his career.

title: Angels Get Jack Fisher
description: CINCINNATI, Jan. 15 (AP) The Cincinnati Reds sent Jack Fisher, onetime New York Met pitcher, to the California Angels today for two minorleaguers Bill Harrelson, pitcher, and Don Loomer, shortstopwho were assigned to the Reds' Indian apolis team in the American Association.

title: FumeFree Cars
description: Several years ago John W. Gardner put the case against automobile pollution in these alarming words: The internal combustion engine is on a collision course with the interests of the American people.

title: DON BESTOR DEAD; BENNY BAND LEADER
description: METAMORA, Ill., Jan. 15 Don Bestir, a composer, con ductor and pianist who had been music director for Jack Benny's radio programs, died on Tuesday. His age was 80.

title: For Belfast, the Sales Pitch Is Stability
description: BELFAST, Northern Ire land  Emerging from the stress and strains of 18 months of civil unrest, North ern Ireland is, to quote the words of Commerce Minister Roy Bradford, attempting to convince industrialists they will find a forwardlooking, stable society.

title: Musical Gets New Name
description: Exchange is the new title for Tamalpais Exchange, the new musical, which is opening Feb. 1 at the MercerO'Casey Theater. Stephanie Sills and Parallel Productions, Ltd., are the producers. Atlantic Records is the principal investor in the show.

title: ExOfficer Says Army Spies on Civilian Activists
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15  A former Army intelligence of ficer said in a magazine article today that nearly 1,000 plain clothes Army investigators keep track of civilian political ac tivity across the country and submit regular reports to a col lection headquarters at Fort Holabird in Baltimore.

title: DR. W. A. HUNTON, EXPERT ON AFRICA
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Jan. 15 Dr. W. Alphaeus Hunton, an American authority on Africa, died here Tuesday. He was 66 years old.

title: Senator Asks News Chain Curb And Ban on Papers' Owning TV
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 Senator Thomas J. McIntyre proposed today a law limiting to five the number of news papers a company could own and a ban on newspaper own ership of a television or radio station in the same metropoli tan area.

title: British Labor M.P. Charged With Violating Secrets Act
description: LONDON, Jan. 15William J. Owen, a 68yearold Labor party Member of Parliament, was charged here today with offenses under the Official Se crets Act. He will appear at Bow Street Magistrates' Court tomorrow.

title: JAILING IN STRIKES SCORED IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, Jan. 15A bi partisan legislative committee urged today that leaders of illegal strikes by public em ployes no longer be jailed under the Taylor Law because confinement tends to make martyrs of them and may increase union militancy.

title: Mechanical Bugs Still Plague Metroliners After Year in Service
description: The Metrolinerthe Penn Central's silverskinned, high speed passenger trainis a year old today, and still a big hit with travelers. But it is so hounded by mechani cal bugs that the men who planned it say they wish they could go back and design it over again.

title: JOHN B. GAGE, LED MISSOURI REFORM
description: KANSAS CITY, Jan. 15 (AP) John B. Gage, mayor of Kan sas City for three terms in the turbulent days after the smash ing of the Tom Pendergast Dem ocratic organization, died to day. He was 82 years old.

title: More Than 100 Trade Fairs and. Exhibitions Scheduled for Yeats
description: Nearly 1,000 trade fairs and specialized exhibitions have been scheduled during 1970 in more than 70 countries, ac cording to a compilation by the United States Department of Commerce. The following listing is a sampling of this compilation, designed to show the variety of exhibits and the wide range of countries in which they are held.

title: BUILDING PAY RISES DECRIED BY BLOUNT
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 15 (UPI) Postmaster General Winton M. Blount said today that out rageous wage settlements in the construction industry were having a devastating effect on the economy and were crip pling the Nixon Administra tion's battle against inflation.

title: In Memoriam
description: ZELTZERBertha (nee Nottingham). lastingly cherished by all who knew

title: FULBRIGHT TARGET OF AGNEW'S TAUNT
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Friday, Jan. 16Vice President Agnew said here today that Senator J. William Fulbright apparently has blown his cool again.

title: Books of The Times
description: EVERY so often in this column I find myself grumbling about the uses in fiction of the conventional thirdper son narrative. Here's a case in point.

title: Another Hectic Year Looms in France
description: PARISLast year was hec tic and unsettling and this year promises more of the same.

title: For Many, investment Is a Club
description: INVESTMENT clubsgroups of peo ple with small recurring surpluses of, money who pool those resources and buy stockscame into vogue in the United States in the early fifties. This June, when the World Federation of In vestment Clubs meets in Brussels, dele gates will be, on hand from 11 countries: Australia, Belgium; Britain, Canada, France, Germany, Ireland, the Nether lands, Nigeria, New Zealand and the United States.

title: Nassau Sues to Keep Barge Away From Bridge
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Jan. 15  Nassau County sought an in junction in State's Supreme Court here today to prohibit the use of the waterway under its Atlantic Beach Bridge by the owners of a barge that re portedly has hit the bridge 16 times in the last 21 months.

title: BULLS TOP ROYALS FOR 5TH STRAIGHT
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 15 (AP) The Chicago Bulls breezed to 130120 victory over the Cin cinnati Royals tonight to equal the club's longest National Basketball Association winning streakfive names.

title: Soviet Sees Siberia Developed by 2000
description: MOSCOWSiberia in the year 2000, most Soviet econ omists and scientists agree, will be the land of developed plenty. In the year 1970, however, it will remain the land simply of potential.

title: Article 1  No Title
RUINS OF A.D. 70 FOUND BY ISRAELI
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 15An Israeli archeologist uncovered today in the Jewish Quarter of Old Jerusalem the ruins of a building that was destroyed in A.D. 70 along with the rest of the city.

title: Alleged Holdup Man Slain In Bar and Patron Is Sought
description: An alleged robber was shot and killed early yesterday by a customer in a Brooklyn tav ern who then disappeared and is being sought, the police said.

title: Foes of War Form Group to Forward Letters to P.O. W.'s
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 15Oppo nents of the Vietnam war an nounced today the formation of a committee to facilitate communication between serv icemen held in North Vietnam and their relatives in the United States.

title: MAYORS URGE G.E. AND UNIONS TO ACT
description: Mayors or their representa tives from 45 affected cities across the country called yesterday for labor and man agement to abandon hard posi tions in the General Electric Company strike in the interest of the nation and the com munity.

title: ORR SETS RECORD, BRUINS WIN BY 63
description: BOSTON, Jan. 15 (AP) Bobby Orr set a National Hockey League record for de fensemen with his 50th and 51st assists of the season to night as the Boston Bruins de feated the Los Angeles Kings, 63.

title: Play on Love Brings London Smug French View of Drama
description: LONDON, Jan. 15Vaguely Anglicized by Ruth Goetz and Bart Howard, with one eye on the West End and the other on Broadway (David Merrick is the London coproducer), Frangoise Dorin's Play on Love trans mits Gallic smugness of a kind that sets one's teeth on edge.

title: 5YEAROLD FIRST IN 16HORSE FIELD
description: MIAMI, Jan. 15  Oneeyed Mr. Brogann opened the eyes of 9,541 racing fans today by slogging to a fivelength vic tory in the $68,300 Tropical Park Handicap, the closingday feature of Tropical's record 52 day meeting.

title: Austria's Mood Carefree
description: VIENNAAustria a nation of just over seven million people, spent $800million on Christmas shopping last month. This means that every one of the 2.5 million salaried citizens spent about three quarters of his monthly in comeon the average $200 in addition to Christmas bonuses.

title: Everglades Jetport Barred By a U.S.Florida Accord
description: WASHINGTON,. Jan. 15The Administration announced today an agreement with the state and local authorities in Florida forbidding the construction of a major international jetport near the Everglades National Park. President Nixon hailed the agreement as an outstanding victory for con servation. jetport near the Everglades National Park. President Nixon hailed the agreement as an outstanding victory for con servation.

title: Washington: Quarterback Nixon's Game Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15That incorrigible football buff, Rich ard M. Nixon, has come to the end of the first quarter with his game plan intact. Like his friend Vince Lombardi of the Washington Redskins, he is sticking to fundamentals and controlling the ball.

title: Soviet Plans Exploitation Of Oil in Western Siberia
description: MOSCOW, Jan 15  The So viet. Union announced today plans for a massive develop ment program in western Si beria to take advantage of enormaus oil and natural gas reserves in that sparsely in habited part of the country.

title: Strike Against T.W. A. Averted As Machinists Accept an Offer
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (UPI) A strike of. Trans World Air lines was averted tonight when union and management repre sentatives reached tentative agreement on a new contract only seven hours before a strike deadline.

title: GOVERNOR VOWS AID ON BIAS LAWS
description: Governor Rockefeller prom ised yesterday that he would personally oversee the imple mentation of stronger, more ef fective antidiscrimination laws, especially in the crucial field of public and private housing.

title: F. C. C. Reassures Broadcasters On Challenges to Their Licenses
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15In an effort to reassure the bulk of the nation's broadcasters, the Federal Communications Commission said today that it would not entertain license challenges against radio and television stations that sub stantially met the programing needs of their communities.

title: S.E.C. SEES CURBS ON ADS VIOLATED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 15The Securities and Exchange Com mission filed suit today against American General Insurance Company, two organizations in the Channing group of mutual funds and the Variable An nuitw Life Insurance Company, charging violations of long standing legal restrictions on advertising that offers securi ties for sale.

title: Inflation Takes Its Toll in Israel
description: JERUSALEM Pinhas Sa pir returned to an old post, Minister of Finance, late last year and was staggered when he opened the books. Within days he had called for dras tic measures to bridge Is rael's growing trade imbal ance.

title: Miss Mir Triumphs in Downhill As French Take First 4 Places
description: BAD GASTEIN, Austria, Jan. 15 (UPI)Isabelle Mir, Florence Steurer, Michele Jacot and Fran coise Macchi gave France a sweep today in the Silver Jug races  last major downhill event before next month's world championships.

title: Store Sales Increase
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15The Commerce Department today estimated last week's depart ment store sales at $575mil lion, up 9 per cent from the yearearlier $528million. Last week's total retail store sales were about $5,973,000,000, up 1 per cent from $5,905,000,000.

title: U.S. SUES JEWELER AS COURT SCHEMER
description: A Brooklyn jewelry concern accused of using sewer serv ice to sue thousands of cus tomers a year for not paying their bills was sued by the Government yesterday in an at tempt to force it to give back most of the money, it recovered through the courts.

title: Amex Prices Rise in Active Trading
RUBINSTEIN OFFERS NOVELTY BY CHOPIN
description: In the second of his concerto concerts in Carnegie Hall, last night, Artur Rubinstein played something of a novelty. This was Chopin's Fantasy on Polish Airs, a work that is hardly ever heard nowadays.

title: WILEY N. SIMMONS
description: Wiley N. Simmons; associate advertising manager of Ebony magazine, died yesterday ai University Hospital of cancer He was 55 years old and live at 200 West 90th Street.

title: Frost Is Seen Alter Thaw In BonnEastern Relations
description: BONN, Jan. 15 A period of frost is coming in our rela tions with West Germany after the thaw of the last two months, a wellinformed East European Communist official remarked here today, comment ing on yesterday's stateofthe nation speech by Chancellor Willy Brandt. But frost does not last as long as ice, he added.

title: Modern Museum to Drop Fee on Mondays
description: In an effort to make its facilities available to more members of the community, the Museum of Modern Art will suspend its $1.50 admis sion fee, the highest of any museum in the country, one day a week. Starting Feb. 9, the museum will be open free every Monday from 2 P.M. until 9 P.M.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: Finch Not Convinced
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 15 (AP)  Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare Robert H. Finch said today that there was no clearcut evidence that birth control pills are harmful.

title: In 1964, de. Gaulle Saw Great Future for Nixon
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 15 (AP)  Gen. Charles de Gaulle picked President Nixon as a man with a great future when the American's political fortunes were at a low ebb, Foreign Minister Maurice Schumann of France said to day. He told the story to a Brussels lecture audience.

title: Max Hickman Dies at 51; A Drug Sales Executive
description: Max Hickman, vice president sales for CookWaite Laborato ries, a subsidiary of Sterling Drug, Inc., died yesterday of cerebral hemorrhage in To ronto, where he was attending a sales conference. He was 51 years old and lived at 87 Old Farm Road, Pleasantville, N. Y.

title: Point of View
description: THE swing in Britain's ex ternal accounts last year was large and dramatic: The improvement in the current balance over 1968's 265mil lion deficit ($636  million) was probably nearly 650 million ($1.5billion) the fourthquarter figures are not yet completeand if the long term capital account figures are included, the swing was almost certainly even larger.

title: A Glossary Explaining Terms in Discussion
description: American Selling Price: The Tariff Act of 1930 defines the dutiable value of imports as market value in the export ing country before import du ties; for certain chemicals, the value Is put at the Ameri can selling price, which may multiply the duty that must be paid.

title: Lacey Urges Jersey to Make Refuse Industry Public Trust
description: NEWARK, Jan. 15  United States Attorney Frederick B. Lacey said today that organized crime had moved into the gar bage collection and disposal in dustry in New Jersey and urged the Legislature to pass laws making the industry a public trust regulated by the state.

title: Backers Disrupt Arraignment Of 3 in a Bombing Plot Here
description: Supporters of three persons accused in a bombing conspira cy here disrupted arraignment proceedings in Federal Court yesterday with angry shouts of pig when a prosecutor re quested that the court triple the $100,000 bail of one of the defendants.

title: Brick Church Fair Will Hold a Dance
description: The Brick Church Fair's 26th annual dinner dance will be held next Friday in the Plaza's Grand Ballroom. Mrs. James H. Terry Jr. is chairman of the evening, whose proceeds will be added to funds raised at the fair's annual November bazaar in behalf of charities supported by the women's association of the church.

title: MORRIS S. GOLLER, 58; TAUGHT ACCOUNTING
description: Morris S. Goller, chairman of the accounting department of Grover Celevland High School, Ridgewood, Queens, died yes terday in La Guardia Hospital, Forest Hills, Queens. He was 58 years old and lived at 9415 69th Avenue, Forest Hills.

title: Kreiss Upsets Cox
description: CAPE TOWN, South Africa, Jan. 15 (AP)Mike Kreiss, 18 years old, of Beverly Hills, Calif., upset Mark Cox of Britain, the secondseeded play er, 46, 64, 64, today in the quarterfinals of the Western Province tennis championships.

title: TEBALDI AND SIEPI JOIN BOHEME CAST
description: Renata Tebaldi, Colette Boky, William Walker, Cesare Siepi and Gene Boucher entered the cast of Puccini's La Boheme for the first time this season in the performance given last night by the Metropolitan Opera.

title: Consolidated Foods Chief Denies Charges
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 15Wil liam A. Buzick Jr., chairman of the Consolidated Foods Corporation, disputed today the accuracy of published re ports that gave William How lett's version of events lead ing to Mr. Howlett's dismissal as chairman of the company late last year.

title: On the Farm, Food Piles Up
description: PARIS  Farm surpluses have become a major world economic problem.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, JANUARY 16, 1970

title: Burk to Get Rowing Award
description: Joseph Burk, a former Uni versity of Pennsylvania coach who retired last summer, will receive the Vesper Cup at the National Rowing Foundation's annual awards dinner on Jan. 23. The Rutgers championship four will get the Rusty Callow award and Jack Sulger of the New York Athletic Club will receive the John Carlin service award.

title: AARON WEINSTEIN
description: Aaron Weinstein, a printing executive, died yesterday at Long Island College Hospital in Brooklyn. He was 66 years old and lived at 65 Ocean Court, Brooklyn.

title: Inquiry Due on Removal
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (AP)  Representative Wright Pat man, Democrat of Texas, said today he would investigate re ports that Robert M. Morgen thau had been removed as United States Attorney in New York because of his investiga tion of the illegal use of secret foreign bank accounts.

title: RULING TO EXTED TO ALL ELI SPORTS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 Yale University was placed on a twoyear probation in all sports today by the National Collegiate Athletic Association.

title: Muskie Calls President's Antipollution Drive SloganRich and ActionPoor
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 Senator Edmund S. Muskie said today that the Nixon Admin istration's antipollution effort had been sloganrich and ac tionnoor.

title: Tunnel for Those Who Love Plastic Furnishings
description: THOSE traffic jams inside the tunnel Macy's has devised on the northwest end of the ninth floor are not likely to end today when the store opens its newly de signed modern furniture area. And there is a good reason. The tunnel is lined with set tings displaying some of the best buys in mod ern plastic fur Shop nishings, most of Talk which are Amer icanmade and some of which are Imports from Italy and Sweden.

title: RECORD '70 OUTLAY PLANNED BY G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (AP) Republicans looked today to a record campaign budget and talked hopefully of a drive to reverse political history and capture control of the House from the Democrats in this year's elections.

title: Multinationalism Stirs Currency Waves
description: PARISAn American bank er supplied this definition re cently of a currency crisis: the movement of funds by a dozen multinational compan ies.

title: Text of Biafran Surrender
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Jan. 14 (AP)Following is the text of the surrender document signed here today by Lieut. Col. Philip Effiong, who was a major general and is act ism as leader of the Biafrans:

title: California Turf Federation Makes New Offer to Unions
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Jan. 15 (UPI)A spokesman for the strikebound Santa Anita race track and the Federation of California Racing Associations said a new offer had been made today to the striking service employes unions.

title: Cat Cay Comes Alive Again as Sound of Hammer and Saw Pervades Island
description: CAT CAY, BahamasWhen the third day of our stay at Cat Cay dawned cold with the northerly gale of the pre vious 24 hours scarcely di minished, it became clear that we would do no fishing.

title: Civil Servants Reinstated
description: LAGOS, Jan. 15 (Agence FrancePresse)General Gowon announced tonight that all for mer civil servants and officials of public corporations in what was known as Biafra would be reinstated. announced tonight that all for mer civil servants and officials of public corporations in what was known as Biafra would be reinstated.

title: Israeli Arab Gets 10 Years
description: HAIFA, Israel, Jan. 15 (Reu ters)Emil Labib Najar, an Israeli Arab, was sentenced to 10 years in prison today after confessing to spying for Egypt in exchange for money, drugs and other considerations.

title: AMMON HENNACY, PACIFIST AUTHOR
description: Ammon Hennacy, author and former associate editor of The Catholic Worker, a monthly edited here by Dorothy Day and dedicated to the applica tion of radical Christian prin ciples to social problems, died Wednesday in Salt Lake City. He was 77 years old.

title: Manhattan Tops Roanoke As Marren Stars, 8580
description: ROANOKE, Va., Jan. 15 John Marren scored 28 points tonight as he led Manhattan to an 8580, victory over Roanoke before 4,178 at the Salem Roanoke Civic Center. The triumph was the Jaspers' ninth in 12 decisions. Roanoke lost its fourth in 13 games.

title: Nixon Is Said to Have Ruled Out Asking for Increases in Excises
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 President Nixon has all but decided against asking Con gress to increase excise taxes on liquor, cigarettes and gaso line as a means of insuring a budget surplus next year, offi cials disclosed today.

title: A'S GET MINCHER IN SIXMAN TRADE
description: SEATTLE, Jan. 15 (AP)  The Seattle Pilots obtained three Oakland Athletic players today  Lew Krausse, pitcher; Phil Roof, catcher, and Mike Hershberger, outfielder  in ex change for Don Mincher, first baseman; Ron Clark, infielder, and Ken Sanders, pitcher.

title: RATES FOR BONDS RENEW ADVANCE
description: Interest rates, which began to rise this week after a month long decline, took a slightly bigger upward step yesterday.

title: Bonn's East Trade Has Two Edges
description: BONNAs everyone knows, the beetle is German from tip to toe. It may surprise the ordinary West German, therefore, to discover that the bag of tools he received with his new Volkswagen came from Poland.

title: Bostwicks Gain Semifinals In U.S. Open Court Tennis
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 15 Jimmy Bostwick of New York reached the semifinals in the defense of his United States open court tennis championship today by defeating Jimmy Dunn, local professional, 83, 82, at the Racquet Club.

title: WILLIAM H. GARRISON
description: OSSINING, N.Y., Jan 15 William Hart Garrison, presi dent and chairman of the Gar rison. Corporation of New York City, which prints books and greeting cards, died Tuesday of a gunshot wound in his home, 5 Noel Drive. He was 49 years old.

title: BALL BIDS CANADA AVOID NEUTRALISM
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 15George W. Ball, former United States Under Secretary of State, urged Canadians today to avoid neu tralism of the Scandinavian type, and said that the mutual interests of the United States and Canada called for an ex panding free market of trade.

title: Federal Reserve System Statistics
Fugitive Capital Returning to Arab Lands
description: BEIRUT, LebanonFrom Europe and the United States the Arab Middle East may look like an unpromising area for investment, but as 1970 begins, a surprising amount of Arab capital is being repatriated from those two regions.

title: Coal Production Declines
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (UPI) The National Coal Associa tion estimated today that bi tuminous coal production in the United States for the week end ed Jan. 10, was 8,681,000 tons, down from 10,350,000 tons in the corresponding week of 1969. The decline reflected unauthor ized work stoppages following the death of Joseph Yablonski, the murdered mine leader.

title: NEW YORK CLEARING HOUSE STATEMENT
description: WEEK ENDING JAN. 14, 1970

title: Passaic Teachers Vote to Strike Today
description: PASSAIC, N. J., Jan. 15 This city's 430 publicschool teachers have voted to walk out of the system's 10 schools to morrow in a dispute that could set a statewide pattern in teach ercommunity relations.

title: Reagan Welfare Inquiry Finds Fraud
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Jan. 15  A report charging that 10 per cent of the $590million in California welfare grants paid annually to familities with de pendent children are obtained fraudulently was released today to Gov. Ronald Reagan's ad ministration.

title: HAROLD C. HALSTED, YACHTSMAN, IS DEAD
description: Harold C. Halsted, a yachts man and a retired textile manu facturer, died Wednesday in Clearwater, Fla. He was 78 years old and lived there and in Bellport, L. I.

title: Market Place:
description: THE tax law was restruc tured last year amid howls from the oil industry because the 27 per cent de pletion allowance was in jeopardy.

title: Offer Not Rejected
description: BERLIN, Jan. 15The East Germans reflected dissatisfac tion today with Chancellor Willy Brandt's report to the Bonn Parliament yesterday, but they did not reject his offer of talks to renounce the use of force.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Never has Hamlet been rendered with more darity or more biting timeliness!

title: Suns Trim Bullets, 124115
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Jan. 15 (AP) The Phoenix Suns with seven men scoring in double figures defeated the Baltimore Bullets, 124115, tonight.

title: PARKEBERNET SALE TO BENEFIT HARVARD
description: Dealers and private buyers shared yesterday in gathering up riches in jewelry at an auction that yielded $420,165 for outstanding rubies, sap phires and other gems. The con signer to the sale at the ParkeBernet Galleries, 980 Madison Avenue, was Harvard Univergity, which had received the collection as a bequest from Mildred Barnes Bliss, widow of Robert Woods Bliss.

title: Governor and Mayor Lead Thousands at Tributes to Dr. King Here
description: Governor Rockefeller and Mayor Lindsay joined thous ands of New Yorkers yesterday in memorial services and meet ings honoring the birthday of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., the slain civil rights leader.

title: Monte Carlo Rally Will Start Today; 220 Cars Entered
description: MONTE CARLO, Jan. 15 (Reuters)A total of 220 cars will set out from eight points tomorrow on the first and easi est leg of the Monte Carlo Rally. The crews representing 25 countries will leave from Dover, England; Rheims, France; War saw; Monte Carlo, Athens, Oslo, Norway; Frankfurt, West Ger many, and Lisbon on 2,000mile routes that will bring them here on Monday.

title: DR. KING HONORED QUIETLY OVER U.S.
description: The 41st anniversary of the birth of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. was celebrated quietly across the nation yes terday.

title: THIEU OPPOSITION IN SENATE UNITES
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Fri day, Jan. 16Senator Tran Van Don and 14 other members of the South Vietnamese Senate announced today the formation of a political bloc that they said would become the nucleus of a wider opposition front.

title: False Note on Black Panthers
description: Emergence of the Black Panthers as the romanti cized darlings of the politicocultural jet set is an affront to the majority of black Americans. This socalled party, with its confusion of MaoMarxist ideology and Fascist paramilitarism, is fully entitled to protection of its members' constitutional rights. It was to make sure that those rights are not abridged by persecution masquerading as lawenforcement that a committee of distinguished citizens has recently been formed.

title: Democratic Candidates Due to Emerge in State
description: The publication of new Con gressional lines drawn by the Republican  controlled State Legislature, set for Monday, is expected to bring out a large, number of Democratic candi dates for statewide office.

title: RISE IN WELFARE SLOWED SHARPLY IN STATE IN 1969
description: ALBANY, Jan. 15The cost of welfare throughout the state for 1969 was estimated today at $2.2billion, reflecting a drastic drop in the growth rate of Medicaid for the first time since its inception.

title: LEAH GOLDBERG, ISRAELI POET, DIES
description: Dr. Leah Goldberg, a leading Hebrew author, poet and trans lator, died Wednesday night at the Hadassah Hospital in Jeru salem after a brief illness, She was 58 years old.

title: Roche Ousts Smith in Five Sets In 3d Round of Victorian Tennis
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Jan. 15 (AP)Stan Smith of Pasa dena, Calif., the No. 1 ranked player in the United States, lost in five sets today to Tony Roche of Australia in the third round of the Victorian open tennis championships.

title: Detroit and Pollution
description: DETROIT, Jan. 15Detroit has discovered a word: Envi ronment. Today that word is bigger in the motor city than such old standbys as horse power or all new or profits.

title: EXPANSION OF CREDIT TO THE POOR BACKED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (AP) Legislation to expand the availability of credit in poverty areas won the general endorse ment of officials of several leading banks taday at a Sen ate subcommitte hearing.

title: Mrs. Pike Returns to Israel To Complete Husband's Plan
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 15 (Reuters) The widow of Dr. James Pike, the former Episcopal Bishop of California, who died in September in the Judean Desert, returned to Israel to night to continue her husband's research into the origins of Christianity.

title: ALBANY WEIGHING RISE IN SCHOOL AID
description: The current state budget in cludes $2billion for such aid to school districts.

title: Linda J. Palmer Engaged to Wed Mark F. Miller
description: OAKLYN, N. J., Jan. 15 Mr. and Mrs. John Edward Palmer have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Linda Joyce Palmer, to Mark Fulton Miller, son of Mr: and Mrs. John Robin son Miller of Garden City, L.I., and Buck Hill Falls, Pa.

title: After the Mental Hospital, a Room of Their Own in Real Home
description: I WOULDN'T take normal people, Mrs. Julia Bolk said firmly. They wouldn't interest me. And you don't know who you're getting.

title: Birth Pills Termed Still Experimental
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 A prominent scientist cautioned today that all doctors prescrib ing birth  control pills should treat each patient as though she were part of a research project.

title: Nader Says Consumer Power Must Be Developed and Used
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15  Ralph Nader chided fellow con sumer advocates today for hold ing what he depicted as an exaggerated notion of their ac complishments.

title: Parolee Is Seized in South in Connecticut Slaying
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 15. (AP)  A paroled rapist Louis Cofone Jr. of Bridgeport, Conn.was seized with out a struggle here today on charges that he fled Con,, necticut eight days ago after robbing one woman, strangl ing another and kidnapping a third.

title: Patent Treaty to Be Drafted
description: WASHINGTONThe Unit ed States will be host to a diplomatic conference here from May 25 to June 19 to negotiate a patent coopera tion treaty.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Erelene Tait Future Bride
description: DEERFIELD BEACH, Fla., Jan. 15Mr. and Mrs. Wil liam Malcolm Tait have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Erelene Tait, to Peter Winthrop BurrisMeyer, U.S.N., an avi ation electronics apprentice. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold BurrisMeyer of Boca Raton, formerly of Arlington, Va.

title: MGM Is Hopeful on Earnings
description: James T. Aubrey Jr. faced the stockholders of Metro GoldwynMayer, Inc., for the first time yesterday and in almost three hours of ques tioning, much of it hostile, did not once lose his cool.

title: Vietnam Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (UPI) The Pentagon today identified the following servicemen from the New York area as having been killed in Vietnam:

title: Waiting List of Millions
description: LIBREVILLE, Gabon, Jan. 15 (AP)One of the last planes out of Biafra had 40 passen gers and a waiting list of mil lions. The man who decided who got on board enforced his choices with a rifle.

title: KAY MAZZO DANCES TERPSICHORE HERE
description: New York City Ballet's Kay Mazzo made her debut as Terpsichore in Apollo last summer in Monte Carlo, the birthplace of the work, and last night she showed her in terpretation to New York for the first time at State Theater. It was a characterization that pleasingly combined a sober reserve with suave lyricism.

title: London a Villain to Dublin
description: DUBLINA sharp rise in the Republic's international payments deficit and a dimi nution in tourist earnings be cause of troubles in North ern Ireland were the two mat ters of major concern here during 1969.

title: Mayor Asks Intensified Talks To End Strike by Gravediggers
description: Mayor Lindsay called on both sides in the gravediggers strike yesterday to intensify their efforts to achieve a quick settlement.

title: Greece Pinched by Lag in Foreign Investment.
description: ATHENS  The persisting scarcity of sizable foreign in vestments in Greece may force the country's military backed regime to turn this year into a year of belt tightening for the Greeks.

title: Chicago Panthers Are Ordered To Produce Missing Door Panel
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 15An at torney for the Black Panthers was ordered today to produce for two official groups a miss ing door panel from the apart ment in which two Panthers died in a predawn raid. The demand was made in behalf of a Cook County grand jury and a coroner's panel.

title: Two Brooklyn Children Die In a Blaze at Apartment
description: An 8yearold Brooklyn boy and his younger sister were killed yesterday in a fire in their firstfloor apartment in the Crown Heights section while their baby sitter, an adopted brother and another sister managed to escape safely.

title: Schembechler Voted No. 1 Coach
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15Bo Schembechler of Michigan, who suffered a heart attack the day before his Wolverines played Southern California in the Rose Bowl last Jan. 1, was named major college coach of the year today by the American Foot ball Coaches Association.

title: Common Market Vitalized
description: BRUSSELS  After the most severe strains of its 12 year history, the European Economic Community was in fused with fresh vitality last month and moved into what may be its most exciting phase of development.

title: ERVIN CRITICIZES ORDERS ON HIRING
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (UPI) Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr. of North Carolina accused the Ad ministration today of deceiv ing Congress with new orders setting racial quotas for Fed eral contractors.

title: U.S. SAYS IT BUGGED ANTIVIETNAM PRIEST
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15The Government disclosed today that it had electronically moni tored a conversation in 1966 in which one of the parties was the Rev. Daniel Berrigan, the 48yearold Jesuit priest in volved in the antiwar move ment.

title: Canadian Wins Ford Suit
description: TORONTO, Jan. 15Nathan Phillips, former Mayor of To ronto, won a judgment of $79,587 today against the Ford Motor Company of Canada, Ltd., and a distributor for what the Ontario Supreme Court held was a failure of the braking system in his Lincoln Continen tal, which struck a utility pole. The company said it was ap pealing the judgment.

title: SHULTZ PRESSED ON MINER INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 The chairman of the Senate Labor subcommittee called on Secretary of Labor George P. Shultz today to report on the depatment's progress in investi gating the United Mine Work ers of America. There were in dications that the subcommittee was dissatisfied.

title: PACIFIC MISSILE TEST BY CHINA PREDICTED
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 15 (Reu ters)A retired United States Marine general predicted today that Communist China would test an intercontinental ballistic missile in the Pacific this year or early in 1971.

title: Another MenOnly Barrier Falls: United Drops Its ShoesandJacketsOff Flight
description: ONE of the last menonly bastions  United Air Lines' 5 P.M. Executive Flight between Newark and Chicago  died Wednesday amid cheers from women's rights groups. The Executive was 17 years old.

title: COLONELS. DOWN NETS, 132 TO 124
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Jan. 15 (AP)The Kentucky Colonels, tied 44 after the first two min utes of play, broke in front and stayed there tonight to defeat the New York Nets, 132124, in an American Basketball Asso ciation game.

title: State Justice Redesignated
description: ALBANY, Jan. 15 (AP) Governor Rockefeller has re designated Justice Harry D. Goldman of Rochester as pre siding justice of the State Su preme Court's Appellate Divi sion, Fourth Department. The Governor's office also an nounced today that Mr. Rocke feller had designated Justice Frederic T. Henry of Canan daigua and redesignated Justice Frank Del Vecchio of Syracuse as associate justices of the department.

title: Decision Called Firm
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (Reu ters)Secretary of State Wil liam P. Rogers said tonight that President Nixon's decision to end the United States com bat role in the Vietnam war was irreversible and would lead to the eventual removal of all American troops.

title: Money
description: Thursday, Jan. 15, 1970

title: McCovey Is Promoted To the $100,000 Class
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 15 (UPI)Willie McCovey, the National League's most val uable player of 1969, signed a twoyear contract with the San Francisco Giants today that put him in the $100,000 class.

title: Barbara A. Trousdell Is Betrothed
description: OYSTER BAY, L.I., Jan 15 Dr. and Mrs. James Nixon Trousdell have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Barbara Allen Trousdell, to Jose Inacio Gonzaga Franceschini, son of Magistrate and Mrs. Jose Luiz Franceschini of Sao Paulo, Brazil.

title: Bridge:
description: JOUR teams survive un I. beaten in the New York Knockout Championship for the Von Zedtwitz Trophy as a result of matches played this week. The original entry was 59 teams.

title: Moribund EFTA Is Still Expanding
description: GENEVAThe eight mem ber nations of the European Free Trade Association are about to welcome a ninth in to their ranks although the dissolution of the group now seems imminent.

title: 2 IN DE CARLO CASE WIN A SEVERANCE
description: NEWARK, Jan. 15  Federal Judge Robert Shaw granted severance and postponement of trial today to two codefend ants of Angelo (Gyp) De Carlo, a reputed Mafia figure, on charges of conspiracy and ex tortion.

title: JERSEY COMPANIES CALLED POLLUTERS
description: NEWARK, Jan. 15Criminal charges against 13 companies accused of polluting the tribu tary waters of New York Har bor were filed here today by United States Attorney Fred erick B. Lacey.

title: Blues Sink Leafs, 20
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 15 (UPI) Ab McDonald's 20th goal of the season and Ernie Wakely's third shutout gave the St. Louis Blues a 20 victory over the Toronto Maple Leafs tonight.

title: Bethea to Replace de Lima In Felt Forum Bout Tonight
description: Tom (The Bomb) Bethea of New York signed yesterday to replace Juarez de Lima of Brazil in the 10round middle weight fight against Carlos Marks of Trinidad, B.W.I., to night at the Felt Forum. De Lima failed to obtain a visa and was detained by Brazilian immigration authorities.

title: Says Work as College Head Remains Uncompleted
description: HAYAKAWA BARS RACE FOR SENATESAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 15 Dr. S. I. Hayakawa, president of San Francisco State College, chose today to remain at the troubled school rather than embark on a new career in politics.

title: Squash Racquets
description: METROPOLITAN LEAGUE

title: Nixon Preparing to Announce Nominee to U.S. Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 President Nixon is preparing to announce a new nominee to the Supreme Court, amid secrecy that has revealed only that the nominee's name will probably not be a household word.

title: Renault Workers Indifferent to StockSharing Plan
description: PARIS, Jan. 15In an ex periment to bridge the gap between labor and capital in France, President Pompidou wants to give newly created shares of stock to the work ers of the big stateowned Renault auto works. But the workers themselves are in different, if not downright opposed, to the idea.

title: GLAMOUR STOCKS STAGE LATE RALLY
description: A rally in the final hour by high  price glamour stocks brought some downwarddrift ing popular averages back to an even keel yesterday. Mutual funds, meanwhile, made the big splashes in the market by switching portfolio holdings.

title: SOUTH KOREA DENIES ATROCITY CHARGES
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Jan. 15  The South Korean Defense Ministry denied today as un founded and deplorable the charges that South Korean troops had murdered hundreds of South Vietnamese civilians.

title: Menus and Recipes for the Weekend
description: IN the menus below, dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: Red Unions in France Act To Bar Labor Peace Plan
description: PARIS, Jan. 15Communist led unions sought today to nullify a key element in a long term Government effort to end the traditional antagonisms be tween capital and labor.

title: POTATO FUTURES HIT NEW HIGHS
description: Traveling on the momentum created by increases in cash prices and the continuing cold weather, potato futures prices for the most active months again hit new highs for the life of the contracts yesterday.

title: S.E.C. BACKS PLAN FOR NEW HOUSING
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (AP)  The Securities and Ex change Commission gave its approval today to a nation wide patrnership venture intended to create nearly $2 billion worth of new, privately built lower income housing.

title: OTHER COMPANY REPORTS
Cotton Market
Portugal Husbanding Garden Exports
description: LISBONPortugal is start ing to build her fruit, vege table and flower industry, with an eye to foreign mar kets. Up to now, this garden country of Western Europe has barely produced enough farm products to cover her own needs.

title: Hope in Nigeria
