description: Prospects for Nigeria brightened somewhat yester day in the atmosphere of reconciliation at the sur render ceremonies in Lagos where the Nigerian leader, General Yakubu Gowon, embraced Colonel Effiong, the proxy leader of defeated Biafra, and pledged amnesty and protection for former Biafrans.

title: Kapp Gets Lombardi Award
description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 15 (UPI) Joe Kapp, the unorthodox passer who led the Minnesota Vikings to the National Foot ball League championhip, was named today as the second winner of the Vince Lombardi Dedication Award. The award is sponsored by the Wisconsin Chapter, Professional Football Writers Association of Amer ica.

title: 11th Game May Provide Contests Between Top College Elevens
description: Rising costs, competition from professional football, television appeal and confi dence in a current success formula are some of the rea sons back of the decision to allow college teams to sched ?? an 11th game next fall.

title: Dr. Teller Defends Programs of A.E.C. On His 62d Birthday
description: LAS VEGAS, Jan. 15Dr. Edward L. Teller, a: leader in the development of the hydro gen bomb, today celebrated his 62d birthday with a defense of the programs of the Atomic Energy Commission.

title: Music: Concert Fidelio
description: LEONARD BERNSTEIN'S return to the podium of the New York Philharmonic saw him in the latest pliase of his careeran opera con ductor. Last night he pre sente'd a concert version of Beethoven's Fidelio, the opera he is going to conduct this may in Vienna as part of the Beethoven bicenten nial. Thus he killed two birds with one stone, giving the public a Fidelio, of sorts, and himself a rehearsal.

title: Shell Sets Outlay Of $540Million For British Plants
description: LONDON, Jan. 15 (UPI) Plans to spend $540million in a massive investment program in the northwest of England were announced by the giant Shell group today.

title: PUBLIC TV CALLED TO CLARIFY ISSUES
description: John W. Macy Jr., president of the Corporation for Public Broadcasting, suggested yester day that public broadcasting could be a positive, upbeat alternative to the veritable Grand Canyon of disbelief ex isting in the United States.

title: LIQUORI WILL RUN IN MELROSE MILE
description: When Marty Liguori of Villa nova lines up for the Wana maker Mile on Jan. 30 at Madi son Square Garden, many ob servers will be expecting him to provide the 63d Millrose Games with the first underfourminute mile in its history. The Wild cat star filed his entry for the Wanamaker yesterday.

title: KAISER ALUMINUM ACHIEVES RECORD
description: Higher and stronger prices of primary and fabricated aluminum products, among other factors, enabled the Kaiser Aluminum & Chemical Corporation to post the high est earnings for the quarter and the year ended Dec. 31, it was reported yesterday by T. J. Ready Jr., president.

title: Australia Builds West Coast Defenses
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Jan. 14Australia is strengthening defenses on her Indian Ocean coast at a time when a growing Soviet naval presence is re ported in those strategic waters.

title: West Germany Growing Hypertense
description: BONN  Many West Ger man Industries stayed open over the Christmas holidays, churning out goods to meet the extraordinary demands of foreign and domestic con sumers do what continued to be called the country's super boom.

title: Italy's Healthy Glow Getting a Feverish Flush
description: ROMEThe healthy glow that has suffused the face of Italy for the last four years began to take on something of a hectic flush at year's end, threatening a bout of in flation fever for 1970.

title: French Aid Cut Hits Poor Lands
description: PARISIn the efforts of rich countries to reduce their budgets to combat inflation, the poor countries stand to pay a disproportionate share of the burden. The situation in France is no exception.

title: MURPHY MOURNED BY NETS, YANKEES
description: The Yankees and the Mets mourned John Murphy yester day  the Yankees for losing another link to their glorious past, the Mets for losing a cen tral link to their unpredictable future.

title: In World of Happy Boat Owner, Even the Axis Is of Fiberglass
description: FIBERGLASS, which has captured 85 per cent of the recreational boating mar ket since it was introduced just after World War II, is to get a show all to itself and deservedly so. Begin ning next Tuesday and con tinuing for three months, the OwensCorning Center at 717 Fifth Avenue will show visitors how yachts, modern racers, sailboats and runabouts are built in the latest fashion: with whole sections of molded fiberglass.

title: Skipper Tells of Ship Loss
description: SEATTLE, Jan. 15 (UPI) Capt. Charles T. Wilson, skipper of the illfated Badger State, testified today that a huge wave threw the freighter on her side and exploded her cargo of bombs before he gave the order to abandon ship last Dec. 26. The skipper testified at a Coast, Guard hearing. Twentysix of his 40mart crew drowned in mountainous waves in the mid Pacific after they abandoned the munitions ship, which later sank.

title: LEADER PROCLAIMS BIAFRA'S LOYALTY TO LAGOS REGIME
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Jan. 14 Lieut. Col. Philip Effiong, who was the leader of secessionist Biafra in the final hours before it fell last weekend, came to Lagos, today and made a formal declaration of surrender.

title: U. of Tennessee Students Fight Over New President
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Jan. 15 (UPI)Several fist fights broke out today among about 2,000 University of Tennessee stu dents who gathered in front of the administration building to express their differences over selection of a new school president.

title: KNICKS APPROACH END OF ROAD TRIP
description: DETROIT, Jan. 15A three day rest hopefully will have the New York Knickerbockers in ton: form as they resume action tomorrow night against the De troit Tistons at Cobo Arena. The game will be the seventh of an eightgame swing around the National Basketball Association before the Knicks return to Madison Square Garden on Jan. 24.

title: For the Underdeveloped, a Plea Against Disastrous Cuts in Aid
description: THE HAGUEIn the west ernmost part, of the Hague, a wet wind blows in from the North Sea over modest brick hot roofs and tulips in the windows. Chil dren are playing quietly on the sidewalk. A matronly woman is walking slowly, laden with groceries.

title: Con Ed Seeks Rise in Building Plans to $2Billion
description: Consolidated Edison's man agement has proposed to its trustees that its fiveyear con struction program be increased by nearly a third to a total of nearly $2billion.

title: Senators, Scientists and SALT
description: The shaping of American positions for the Strategic Arms Limitation Talks (SALT) with the Soviet Union has shown some alarming signs of excessive military influence and conservative Pentagon technical advice. But recently there have been encouraging indications that a countervailing force may be in the making in the Senate and in the President's Science Advisory Committee (PSAC).

title: Executive Changes
description: Clifton H. Eaton has been named president of the Gillette Safety Razor Company, a division the Gillette Company, effective Feb. 1.

title: Cahill Announces Full Support Of G.O.P. Chiefs for Tax Plan
description: TRENTON, Jan. 15Gov ernorelect William T. Cahill announced today that he had achieved full support from Republican legislative leaders for his $300million tax pack age, which is based on increas ing the state sales tax from to 5 per cent.

title: Inquest Set For Jan. 23
description: WASHINGTON, Pa., Jan. 15 (UPI)  A coroner's inquest into the Yablonski murders will be held Jan. 23.

title: PROTESTERS REJECT ADDICT CARE PLAN
description: Officials of St. Luke's Hospi tal, replying to the demands of a dozen sitin demonstrators, offered a threepoint plan yes terday to expand the hospital's narcotics addiction treatment facilities.

title: Rockets Triumph, 126123
description: DENVER, Jan. 15 (AP)Larry Jones scored 23 points for Denver tonight to become the first player in American Bas ketball Association history to go over the 5,000point maric as the Rockets downed Dallas, 126123, to take over second place in the Western Division.

title: Wilson and Thant to Talk
description: LONDON, Jan. 15 (Reuters) Pr??e Minister Wilson will hold talks with the United Na tions Secretary General, U Thant, in New York Jan. 26. it was announced today.

title: Lindsay Sees Danger to Israel in Misguided U.S. Policy Shift
description: Mayor Lindsay warned last night of what he described as the danger of a misguided shift in the Administration's policy concerning Israel.

title: Child Study Group Uses KnowHow to Help Itself
description: Somebody at the Child Study Association, which is devoted to the mental health of children, has been sneak ing in a bit of adult psy chology in dealings with the charity's supporters.

title: BIG BOARD NAVIES A CLEARING CHIEF
description: The New York Stock Ex change announced yesterday that it was reorganizing the management of its Stock Clear ing Corporation, which proc esses about $1billion in securities transactions daily. Richard B. Howland, a senior vice president of the Ameri can Express Company, was elected president of the Clear ing Corporation. He will be the first fulltime president of the organization.

title: Pepsi Cola Backs Negro Concerns
description: The Pepsi Cola Metropolitan Bottling Company yes terday announced a novel advertising campaign designed to promote small businesses operated by blacks.

title: AUSTRALIA PLANNING EXPORT OF MERINOS
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Jan. 15 The Australian Government tonight fixed Feb. 1 for easing of the 40yearold embargo on exoort of stud Merino rams.

title: Arts Seen in DemandCost Squeeze
description: The Ford Foundation has contributed more than $195 million to the arts since 1957, but on the basis of urgent appeals that it feels deserve attention it would need to distribute a much larger sum in 1970 alone.

title: Biochemist to Wed Gudrun Svensson
description: Mr, and Mrs. Sven Svens son of Junsele, Sweden, have announced here the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Gudrun Svensson, to Richard Weinacht Armentrout, son of Mr. and Mrs. James S. Armentrout Jr. of Ambler, Pa.

title: Chapot, Miss Richardson Cited
description: Frank Chapot, a member of the United States Eques trian Team for the past 15 years and Jolie Richardson, a leading saddle horse exhibi tor from Atlanta, were named Horsemen and Horsewoman of the Year for 1969 yester day.

title: Commuter Train Derailed
description: BOSTON, Jan. 15 (AP)A minor derailment on a Massa chusetts Bay Transportation Authority rapid transit train today stalled thousands of com muters during the evening rush hour. No injuries were reported.

title: PHILADELPHIA SIX LOSES A 31 LEAD
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 15 Twenty years to the day after heturned in his first National Hockey League shutout, Terry Sawchuk perhaps discovered to night that at the age of 40 it's enough to survive when you're a goalie.

title: Dance: Theater Event
description: JOHN CAGE strikes me as more of a mistake than a musicianand, at his very urbane, charming best, more of a joke than either. Last night at the Brooklyn Acad emy of Music, the Merce Cun ningham Dance Company, with a, wistful arrogance that was engaging in its aspira tions, presented something it called Theater Event. It was neither theater nor an event. It was, however, some thingcif a salutary occasion.

title: 1,800 Honor Lefkowitz at Dinner Here
description: They turned out nearly 1,800 strong last nightGovernor Rockefeller, Mayor Lindsay and a host of other elected offi cials, judges and leaders of in dustry, labor and politics and their wivesto salute a lean little man from the Lower East Side who made it bigAttor ney General Louis J. Lefko witz.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Economic Dislocations

title: HARNEY FOLLOWS; MAYER THIRD AT 66
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Jan. 15 (AP) Bert Greene still seeking his first tour victory, carded a sevenunderpar 64 today despite an outofbounds ball and surged into a onestroke lead in the first round of the $10,000 Phoenix golf tourna ment.

title: SONG BY GUTHRIE BARRED AT TRIAL
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 15 Arlo Guthrie found out today you can't get anything you want in Judge Julius J. Hoffman's courtroom.

title: U.S. NOT TO RELEASE MIDEAST PROPOSALS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15Sec retary of State William P. Rog ers decided today to withhold publication of the United States draft proposals for a Middle East settlement.

title: Advertising: Hanging on in a Daisy Patch
description: There's a bit of the Wiid West at 711 Fifth Avenue where an outpest of Kansas City's largest agency is hold ing onto its New York foot hold with pioneer tenacity.

title: 4 TRUSTEES NAMED BY PUBLIC LIBRARY
description: The New York Public Li brary's board of trustees has elected new members to replace four who are retiring.

title: Healthy Yugoslavia Finds Cash Sparse
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia The Yugoslav economy is still undergoing the difficult phases of the economic re form started in 1965.

title: URBAN COALITION GETS NEW LEADER
description: Walter N. Rothschild Jr., president of Abraham & Straus, was named yesterday to suc ceed Andrew Heiskell as chair man of the New York Urban Coalition.

title: The Day J.Barleycorn Hibernated
description: Fifty years ago today national Prohibition closed all The saloons. The New York Times, reporting the re action of the city, said in a headline the next morning that John Barleycorn had died peacefully.

title: British Travelers Symbolize Rebound
description: LONDONIn the years since the end of World War II, the British vacationer has been almost continually re stricted as to the number of pounds he could spend abroad. Urgent balance of payments problems forced limits on sterling outflows.

title: Cleveland Air Unsafe
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 15 (UPI) The Ohio Department of Health reported today that air samplings taken in the Cleve land area showed the atmos phere had reached an unsafe level. The state considers any readings over 75 micrograms detrimental to the health of residents. Twenty samplings were taken in the Cleveland area and ranged from 271 mi crograms per cubic meter of air to about 82, the state enaineer Jack Wunderle said.

title: Economic Change Seen
description: PHILADELHIA, Jan. 15 (UPI) A Philadelphia banker pre dicted today there would be no recessiun in 1970, but that there would be an abrupt change in the economic policy of President Nixon's Adminis tration.

title: Deficit Is Expected By Milwaukee Road After 1968 Profits
description: The Chicago, Milwaukee, St. Paul & Pacific Railroad said yesterday that its preliminary estimates indicated it would report a $6million deficit for 1969. In 1968, the road had earnings of $6,036,171 before various fund charges.

title: New Queen's Reign Profitable
description: LONDON  A recent an nouncement that the Cunard Line's passenger fleet would make a profit this year for the first time in a decade mildly surprised even the man who made it, Sir Basil Smallpeice.

title: William J. Roue, Designed Racing Schooner Bluenose
description: DARTMOUTH, Nova Scotia, Jan. 15 (AP)William James Roue, designer of the cham pionship racing schooner Blue nose, died here yesterday. He was 90 years old.

title: PEACE MASS IS SAID ON PENTAGON STEPS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (AP) A peace fellowship group, in cluding two clergymen now on trial for an earlier incident, conducted a mass without in terference today on the steps of the Pentagon.

title: British Car Maker Bridges Channel
description: LONDONOnce a week, an Italian freight car drops off Lambretta scooters in Sur rey and picks up Austin Morris engines, transmission body pressings and other hardware from the British Leyland Motor Corporation's plants in the industrial mid lands.

title: OJUKWU APPEALS TO WORLD ON FOOD
description: GENEVA, Jan. 15  Gen. Odumegwu Ojukwu appealed to the world today to help save the people of Biafra from com plete annihilation by the Ni gerians.

title: New Nordic Bloc On Customs Lags
description: With the European Com mon Market now beckoning to Norway and Denmark, plans for a customs union of these two countries with Sweden and Finland appear to have been sidetracked.

title: Czech Flights Here Granted
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (Reu ters)President Nixon has ap proved a foreign air carrier permit for Ceskoslovenske Aer olinie of Czechoslovakia to fly between Prague and New York, the Civil Aeronautics Board an nounced yesterday. Pan Ameri can World Airways flies a simi lar route under a bilateral agreement between Czechoslo vakia and the United States.

title: Text of the Statement by General Ojukwu on the Situation in Defeated Biafra
description: GENEVA, Jan. 15 (Reu ters)Following is the text of a statement issued here today by Gen. Odumegwu Ojukwu through Marhpress, a publicrelations concern:

title: Insured Satellite Prepared For Key Orbital Maneuver
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Jan. 15 (UPI)A new international communications satellite, in sured against failure, was ready today for a switch into its final stationary orbit above the At lantic Ocean.

title: A Volunteer Army
description: The conclusion of a Presidential commission that an allvolunteer military force can and should replace the draft raises questions that go beyond the proposal's feasibility in terms of the manpower supply. The impact of the military establishment on a democratic nation's way of life is too serious to allow fundamental policies to be guided primarily by technical concerns. The potential effect on the relationships of civilian and military sectors requires careful assessment.

title: HUMPHREY CALLS CONVENTION VITAL
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Jan. 15 (AP) Hubert H. Humphrey told a Democratic party study group today that national political conventions are essential but that the party must erase the impression they are rigged.

title: Market Place.
description: JOHN M. HARTWELL, an engaging and articulate investment manager, grew noticeably warmer under his buttoneddown collar when he read a suggestion here that mutual funds tell the price at which they buy and sell securities.

title: Giacomin Will Return to Goal To Face North Stars Tonight
description: After having tied the Phila delphia Flyers Thursday night, the Rangers continue their North American wandering to night by facing the North Stars at Bloomington, Minn.

title: BIAFRA OBSERVERS IN ONE AREA FIND NO MISTREATMENT
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Jan. 16An international team of observers just back from the territory that was Biafra reported today that they had found neither widespread starvation nor mis treatment of inhabitants in the part of Biafra that they visited.

title: Transport News and Notes
description: Zim Israel Navigation Com pany, Ltd., Israel's largest shipping company, has gone out of the passengerliner business.

title: Communist China Reported Stepping Up Military Draft
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 16 (Reu ters)  Communist China, en gaged in defensive preparations for a possible war with the Soviet Union, has drafted pos sibly the highest number of re cruits into the army since the Korean war, according to re ports reaching diplomats here today.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Miss Meyer's 4:37 Captures Aussie 400 FreeStyle Swim
description: BRISBANE, Australia, Jan. 16 (AP)Debbie Meyer, the Olympic champion and world recordholder, easily won the 400meter freestyle title in the Queensland swimming cham pionships today.

title: N.H.L.'s BUFFALO SIX NAMES IMLACH COACH
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 16 (AP)  George (Punch) Imlach, dis missed by the Toronto Maple. Leafs last spring, returned to hockey today as general mana ger and coach of the new Buf falo team in the National Hock ey League.

title: Saperstein's Widow Testifies He Came Home Badly Beaten
description: NEWARK, Jan. 16The wid ow of the late Louis B. Saper stein was put on the stand as a Government witness today in the Federal conspiracyextor tion trial of Angelo (Gyp) De Carlo, an alleged Mafia figure.

title: T.V.A. Plans Power Project To Be Cut From Mountain
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Jan. 16 A new kind of $155million hydroelectric project, unusual for the Tennessee Valley Authority, is to be built six miles west of Chattanooga, the T.V.A. announced today. Con struction will begin in mid 1970.

title: 1970 Conferences
description: NATIONAL

title: Dave Breger, Cartoonist of Army Life, Dies at 61
description: NYACK, N. Y., Jan. 16 Dave Breger, the cartoonist, died today in Nyack Hospital after a long illness. He was 61 years old and lived at 26 Smith Avenue, South Nyack.

title: HORSE SHOW GAIN DETAILED BY HART
description: The American Horse Shows. Association licensed 871 shows last year compared with 824 in 1968, Albert E. Hart, the group's president, said in his annual report to the member ship during the 53d annual con vention yesterday at the Wal dorfAstoria Hotel.

title: The Threatening Ghettos of Africa
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Arthur Ichoya is a twentyyearold Kenyan, a Kikuyu, who has a certificate showing that he fin ished three years of secondary school. That is more education than the vast majority of his countrymen have had.

title: Levin, Top Holder, Ousted as Officer At LevinTownsend
description: The sixman board of the LevinTownsend Computer Corporation removed its larg est stockholder yesterday as president and chief executive officer and turned over the two posts to the company's secondlargest stockholder.

title: STOCKS ARE DOWN IN AMEX TRADING
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange continued to decline yesterday in active trading.

title: Kings Recall Campbell
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 16 (AP) The Los Angeles Kings re called a forward Bryan Camp bell, from their Springfield, Mass., club of the American Hockey League today.

title: Calley Hearing Set
description: FORT BENNING, Jan. 16 (AP) hearing for Lieutenant Calley begins here next week, and soldiers are warned they will be held responsible for any information made available to the public.

title: Ragged Biafran Soldiers Wait in Line to Surrender
description: ONITSHA, Nigeria, Jan. 15 Some 200 Biafran soldiers sat disconsolately in the dust here this morning or stood in in terminable lines to register with the Nigerian forces and to receive medical attention.

title: Taming the HBomb
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16  Scientists at the Cornell Aeronautical Laboratory were granted a patent this week for a method of producing power by controlled nuclear fusion, aimed at peaceful applica tion of the force of the hydrogen bomb.

title: Rogers Peet Is Planning To Close Its Boston Store
description: BOSTON, Jan. 16 (AP)The Rogers Peet Company, a men's wear store in downtown Bos ton, will close Jan. 24 because of the company's decision to concentrate in its stores in the New York area, a spokesman said today.

title: CANADA TO PREPARE FOR METRIC SYSTEM
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 16 (AP)The Government announced today its endorsement of Canada's eventual conversion of weights and measures to the metric system.

title: 7 Pedestrian Skyways Link Minneapolis Buildings
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Jan. 14In this city where temperatures never stray far from zero in the winter and where spring is often very late, a secretary can now leave her coat in her office closet and do her employer's errands over a sev enblock area, or go 11 build ings away for lunch, or stop off eight buildings away to shop without ever straying into the cruel air or defying the auto mobiles.

title: Revamping Welfare
description: A significant factor in the low return in human betterment from the $1.5 billion a year the city spends on welfare is the time wasted on bookkeeping by skilled caseworkers. That situation may change for the better before the end of this year as a result of revisions planned by Mitchell I. Ginsberg, retiring head of the Human Resources Administration.

title: Racial Disorders Force Bellport High School to Close for Day
description: BELLRORT, L. I., Jan. 16 Fights between black and white students at Bellport High School forced school officials to call in the police to restore order and to close down the school this morning.

title: $500,000 IS GIVEN TO MISTEROGERS
description: The Corporation for Public Broadcasting is giving $500,000 to enable the Peabody Award winning children's series, Mis terogers' Neighborhood, to be seen on virtually all the public television stations throughout the country.

title: Seymour, Sworn, Sets Priorities
description: Whitney North Seymour Jr. took over yesterday as United States Attorney for the South ern District of New York and said he would put particular emphasis on prosecution of business crimes and narcotics trafficking.

title: COLUMBIA DROPS SECRET RESEARCH
description: The Columbia University Senate adopted regulations yes terday that will prevent the university from participating in classified research projects for either the Government or pri vate industry.

title: HOTEL PURCHASE LINKED TO MAFIA
description: A New York County grand jury is seeking to determine if the Mafia used a New York corporation as a front to buy a hotel and gambling casino in the Dominican Republic.

title: ISRAELIS REPORT RAID BY SOLDIERS DEEP INTO EGYPT
description: JERUSALEM, Saturday, Jan. 17  An Israeli commando I force attacked Egyptian mili tary objectives within 37 miles of Cairo last night in the deep est penetration by ground troops since the war of June, 1967.

title: Sports of The Times
description: ON May 10, 1961, Bill Bradley of Crystal City, Mo., the temporary victim of what he would later call a care fully orchestrated recruiting job, finally decided to attend Duke University. He signed a letter of intent and his mother ended months of chickeninwinesauce dinners for the coaches, vice chancellors and Latin teachers who had swarmed into town after one of the decade's choicest high school prospects. But Bill's father, a bank president, hid his disappointment and quietly suggested that the 17yearold tour Europe that summer and think.

title: U. C.L.A. QUINTET WINS 11TH IN ROW
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 16 (AP) Henry Bibby scored 8 points in the first five minutes of the second half to help spark top ranked University of California, Los Angeles, to a 6156 victory over Bradley in a basketball game of stalling tactics tonight.

title: Morton D. May Shows His German Art
description: Morton D. May, who owns one of the most important col lections of German expression ist paintings in the world, doesn't think they're the sort of works you'd hang over your little blue sofa.

title: Chicago Panther Lawyer Jailed For Not Producing Door Panel
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 16An at torney for the Black Panthers was jailed today for refusing to produce a missing door panel from a raided apartment in which two Panthers died and for refusing to testify before a Cook County grand jury.

title: Jelke Heir Starts Giving Away 26Million Legacy to All Corners
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., Jan. 16 (AP)  Michael James Brody Jr., who is 21 years old and a new millionaire, is out to make people happy by giving away his fortune. He found no shortage of takers today.

title: NETS WIN, 114109, FROM FLORIDIANS
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L.I. Jan. 16 (UPI)Levern Tart and Walt Simon combined for 55 points tonight to pace the New York Nets to a 114109 victory over the Miami Floridans in an American Basketball Associa tion game.

title: Article 2  No Title
9 CONDUCTORS ENTER SEMIFINAL AUDITION
description: Nine young conductors from seven countries were chosen as semifinalists in the 1970 Dimitri Mitropoulos International Music Competition yesterday after quarterfinal auditions were held at Carnegie Hall. They will compete in semifinals to be held Tuesday and Wednesday.

title: Jane N. Fisher Sets Wedding for August
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Jan. 16Miss Jane Nesmith Fish er, a senior at Smith College, and. Christopher Tapley Carl son, a senior at Amherst Col lege, plan to be married in August.

title: Thant Accepts Invitation
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 16Secretary General Thant to day accepted an invitation from Maj. Gen. Yakubu Gowon, the head of the Nigerian Govern ment, and will fly to Lagos Sun day, the United Nations Secre tariat announced today.

title: SHIPPING/MAIL ALL HOURS GIVEN IN EASTERN STANDARD TIME
description: Incoming Passenger and Mail Ships

title: Insko to Drive 121 Shot in One Of 3 Early Bird Paces Tonight
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Jan. 16 Several driver changes were announced today for tomorrow night's $15,000 semi final events in the $150,000 Early Bird pacing series at Roosevelt Raceway.

title: Freight Traffic Dips
description: WASHINGTON, Jam 16The Association of American Rail roads reported yesterday freight traffic in the week ended Jan. 10 totaled an estimated 13 bil lion tonmiles, 5.6 per cent below the corresponding week last year. Carloadings for the same week totaled 455,990, decrease of 38,192 cars or 7.7 per cent below the correspond ing 1969 week.

title: 3 Pieces by Glass Probe The Sonic Possibilities.
description: Three compositions by Philip Glass, all of them written with in the past six months, were spotlighted last night at the Guggenheim Museum. Like so many avantgarde composers of late, Mr. Glass has been ex ploiting the sonic possibilities offered by a very specialized group of instrumentsin this case three organs, a clavinet is a keyboard instrument, two so prano saxophones, a viola and cello, all of them amplified.

title: Books of The Times
description: IT would be easy to give the back of the hand to this long, longwinded and sometimes incoherent exercise in per sonal panegyric. The unending stream of selfpraise begins to sound like a carica ture of itself. The continual assertion of success in occult matters brings on its own skepticism. The lofty soullike language used to describe each new sexual encoun ter becomes as transparent as a Hollywood blurb. The assertive assurance of a young man slowly changes to the whiny bleat ings of an old one. The dark mysteries that he describes, invents and explicates are opaque film that obscures large chunks of this autobiography.

title: British Flu Toll 7,000
description: LONDON, Jan. 17 (AP) Influenza killed 2,850 persons in Britain last week and pushed the fourweek toll to nearly 7,000, the Ministry of Health said today.

title: Pricing of Tractors In Canada Decried
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 16 (Canadian Press)  Canadian farmers could save nearly $15million a year if they could buy trac tors at prices close to those paid by their British counter parts, the royal commission on farm machinery reported today.

title: ZACHARY B. COGON
description: Zachary B. Cogon, a land scape artist and a veteran of Marshal Edmund Allenby's forces in Palestine in World War I, died Thursday in the Florence Nightingale Nursing Home, 175 East 96th Street. He was 75 years old and lived at 55 West 14th Street.

title: Agnew Reaches Hawaii
description: HONOLULU, Jan 16 (AP) Vice President Agnew returned to the United States late to day, ending his 11country tcur of Asia. Mr. Agnew and his wife will relax over the weekend in Hawaii before flying to Washington early Monday.

title: Ottawa Is Reaping Prairie Discontent
description: OTTAWAThe Agriculture Department had some umprom ising news last week for Can ada's 189,000 grain farmers and for the Administration of Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau.

title: Westmoreland Comments
description: HUNTSVILLE, Ala., Jan. 16 (UPI)Gen. William C. West moreland, former commander of United States forces in Viet nam, said today that the Army is not trying to hide any thing in the investigation of the alleged Mylai massacre.

title: I.B.M. LEADS DROP IN STOCK PRICES
description: A lower fourthquarter earn ings report by I.B.M. caught Wall Street by surprise yester day and sent glamour stocks tumbling in the heaviest trad ing of 1970.

title: Bank in Texas Is Robbed
description: TOM BEAN, Tex, Jan. 16 (AP)Robbers abducted the 75yearold president of the First National Bank this morn ing, forced him to open the vault and escaped with $30,000.

title: Voices Heard and Unheard
description: The embattled commuters on the Long Island Rail Road have demonstrated that the voice of the angry rider can make itself heard in Albany. The assurances that the state will lend the Metropolitan Transporta tion Authority $8.5 million on the slender security an Interstate Commerce Commission proceeding still years away from final decision never would have come if the Long Island commuters had not made so vocal their outrage at being asked to pay 20 per cent more for the daily torture to which they are subjected.

title: Bridges
description: THE right way to defend against preemptive open ing bids is a perennial prob lem to which there is no very satisfactory solution.

title: Nixon's Inner Circle Here Remains Close to Him
description: In the five and a half years that Richard M. Nixon lived in New York  from June, 1963, to January, 1969  he had a small group of inti mate friends, men with whom he dined, shared his deepest thoughts, played golf or otherwise relaxed. These friends are high in the metro politan area's banking, bus ness, publishing, legal and political communities.

title: Colgate Agrees to Drop A Baggies Commercial
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 (UPI)The ColgatePalmolive Company has agreed not to use television commercials purporting to show that Bag gies do not leak but other plastic bags do.

title: PRAGUE ANNOUNCES ESPIONAGE ARRESTS
description: VIENNA, Jan. 16  The Czechoslovak Government an nounced tonight that members of an espionage ring had been arrested in Slovakia.

title: Tuition Rise at U. of California Fails First Test Before Regents
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 16A proposal to raise tuition at the University of California failed today to gain the necessary support at a meeting of the Board of Regents and was put over for consideration at their next meeting Feb. 19 and 20 in San Francisco.

title: Chili Hors d' Oeuvre Will Have Holes in Them
description: A STREET vendor, using a 19thcentury French roaster, will be cooking chestnuts over charcoal. A doughnut machine will turn out chiliflavored doughnuts at the rate of 12 a minute. Brassbanded English win dowwashers' pails will hold an unusual assortment of crudits.

title: State Aide Warns Cardinal on Threat Of Teachers Strike
description: The chairman of the State Mediation Board told Cardinal Cooke yesterday that a strike by lay teachers in the arch diocese was dead Certain in the light of the postures of the, parties. But he later when a new contract offer was madeexpressed hope that a strike could be averted.

title: MARKS TRIUMPHS. IN BOUT AT FORUM
description: Carlos Marks of Trinidad made his first appearance in the Felt Forum last night. Billed as a future Sugar Ray Robinson, Marks, in stopping Tom Bethea in six rounds, proved only that he has a long way to go before he even re Motely approaches the fabled Sugar Rav in talent.

title: U.S. Transport Post Filled
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 (UPI) Secretary of Transportation John A. Volpe today appointed Theodore N. McDowell, an executive of The Washington Evening Star Broadcasting Com pany, as director of information of his department. Mr. Mc Dowell, 44 years old, has been general manager of news and public affairs for Star Broad casting.

title: Tapes on Franzese Are Barred To Public by U.S. Judge Here
description: Conversations monitored by the Federal Bureau of Investi gation at the home of an al leged Mafia leader, John (Sonny) Franzese, were ordered withheld from the public yes terday.

title: At 37, Life Now Sparkles for Kenneth J. Lane
description: ONCE upon a time, Ken neth J. Lane was a small time dreamer. He wanted to be a designer of something.

title: CHURCHES TO SEEK CHRISTIAN UNITY
description: The annual Week of Prayer for Christian Unity that begins tomorrow will have a new ur gency, according to many leaders.

title: HERS TURN BACK WARRIORS, 12705
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 16 (AP) Fifteen points by Wally Jones in the second period tonight sparked a 127105 victory for the Philadelphia 76ers over the San Francisco Warriors in a National Basketball Association game.

title: AMERICAN HOCKEY LEAGUE
description: LAST RIGHT'S GAMES

title: Miss Duggan Wed To Thomas Greene
description: Miss Alanna Elizabeth Duggan and Thomas Aquinas Greene were married yester day at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Andrew Avel lino in Flushing, Queens, by the Rev. Charles Coen.

title: Cosmos 320 Put in Orbit
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 16 (UPI) The Soviet Union launched to day an artificial earth satellite, Cosmos 320, Tass, the Soviet press agency, said. It was the second in two days. It was put into orbit with scientific equip ment designed to continue the program of space exploration, Tass said.

title: Bostwick Brothers Advance To U.S. Court Tennis Final
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 16 The Bostwick brothers, Jimmy, the defending champion, and Pete, the world open champion, gained the final of the United States open court tennis tour nament at the Racquet Club today.

title: Law on Unit Pricing Urged at Hearing
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 Professional consumer advo cates called on Congress today to add truthinpricing re quirements to the Fair Packag ing and Label Act of 1966.

title: 16 Die Near Songmy As Vietcong Attack Hamlet of Refugees
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan 16 (AP)  Vietcong guerillas invaded a hamlet near Songmy early today and hurled dyna mite charges into houses, kill ing 16 persons and wounding 21, an American spokesman said.

title: Contract Breach Charged
description: TACOMA, Wash., Jan. 16 (AP)A breach of contract complaint against the Army was filed yesterday in Federal District Court by an attorney for one of the four soldiers charged in connection with the alleged Mylai massacres.

title: From Broadway to 7th Ave.
description: DARLING! How marvel ous to see you! Wasn't he wonderful?

title: Pro Elevens Realigned as Giants Stay in Group With Redskins and Eagles
description: The National Conference of the National Football League went the way of the military draft yesterday and realigned itself by lottery. The New York Giants came out a winner, avoiding the Minnesota Vik ings, and winding up with the traditional rivals they de sired.

title: Maine High Court Declares School Bill Unconstitutional
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Jan. 16 (AP) The Maine Supreme Court, in an advisory opinion, ruled to day that legislation proposing state aid for parochial schools was unconstitutional. The vote was 4 to 2.

title: C5A'S GROUNDED BY CRACK IN WING
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 (AP) The Air Force grounded its huge C5A supertransport planes today after a wing crack was discovered in one of the giant aircraft undergoing wing modifications at the Lockheed Corp. plant in Marietta, Ga.

title: Bangor Punta Forms Unit
description: The Bangor Punta Corpora tion said yesterday it has formed a subsidiary, Smith & Wesson Security Services, to provide banks and industrial companies with protection against theft. William G. Barry, a former vice president of the Bankers Trust Company, heads the new enterprise.

title: LONDON PUZZLES OVER TINY ALICE
description: LONDON, Jan. 16London's theater critics were clearly baffled and generally dis appointed with Edward Albee's play, Tiny Alice, which opened last night in repertory at the Aldych Theater. How ever, they agreed that an Albee failure was more interesting than many playwrights' suc cesses.

title: Melbourne Times Sold
description: MELBOURNE, Fla., Jan. 16 (AP)Gannett Co., Inc., of Rochester, N. Y., has reached an agreement to buy The Mel bourne Times from Perry Pub lications, Inc., of West Palm Beach, it was announced today. Formal closing of the transac tion is expected in midFebru ary. Details were not disclosed.

title: Giovanoli Paces Giant Slalom; Gallagher Leads U.S. Ski Team
description: KITZBUEHEL, Austria, Jan. 16 (AUPI)  A Swiss cook and an unherald Pole pulled the rug from under the Alpine world elite today by placing one, two in the first heat of the Hahnenkamm giant slalom race held in fog and drizzling rain.

title: Kerkorian's Name Is Brought In As Crime Inquiry Hears Tapes
description: Tapes of a nineyearold tele phone conversation that were disclosed yesterday indicate th a reputed Mafia operator had dealings with Kirk Kerkorian, now the controlling stockholder of MetroGoldwynMayer and a major stockholder in Western Airlines.

title: G.E. TALKS VIEWED AS SHOWING GAIN
description: There were indications of some progress yesterday in talks aimed at resolving the 12weekold strike of 133,000 workers against the General Electric Company.

title: Nets Slate Clinic Today
description: The New York Nets of the American Basketball Associa tion will conduct a free basket ball clinic this afternoon at o'clock at the Island Garden, West Hempstead, L. I.

title: RICHARD E. MANN
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 16 Richard E. Mann, who retired in 1961 as West Coast manager of The New Yorker Magazine, died yesterday at French Hos pital here. He was 74 years old.

title: Article 1  No Title
VERSATILITY MARKS JOHN PARKS DANCES
description: Naming dance companies is not one of the more mysterious ex ercises in the dance world. Cho reographers habitually choose their own name. However, last night at Cooper Union An Eve ning of Contemporary Dance with Judy Dearing and Com pany did not find Miss Dearing represented either as a chore ographer or as a performer. Not that it really mattered with as accomplished a dancer as John Parks toi carry most of the cho reography along with the danc ing chores, but one does wonder. night at Cooper Union An Eve ning of Contemporary Dance with Judy Dearing and Com pany did not find Miss Dearing represented either as a chore ographer or as a performer. Not that it really mattered with as accomplished a dancer as John Parks toi carry most of the cho reography along with the danc ing chores, but one does wonder.

title: Vietnam Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 (AP) The Pentagon today identifiedthe following servicemen from the New York area as having been killed in Vietnam:

title: U.S.Mexican Effort Turns Pot To Alfalfa
description: TIJUANA, MexicoA United States airplane flown to Mex ico to pick up half a ton of marijuana returned to Califor nia the other day carrying a load of alfalfa that had been planted in place of the drug.

title: I.B.M. 1969 NET UP, BUT QUARTER LAGS
description: The International Business Machines Corporation said yes terday it had gains in consoli dated gross income and net income for all 1969, despite declines in both categories dur ing the fourth quarter. Thomas J. Watson Jr., chairman, de scribed last year's operations as showing relatively modest rates of growth.

title: Big Gambling Ring Raided in Jersey
description: NEWARK, Jan. 16 The state police said today that they had broken up an Essex County gambling operation that] was under the control of or ganized crime and was doing a $50,000aday business.

title: None Hurt by Volcano
description: RABAUL, New Britain, Sat urday, Jan. 17 (Reuters)  An eruption of 7,500foot Mount Uluwan on this island off New Guinea yesterday caused no deaths or destruction, a survey showed today.

title: 70 Are to Enforce Rules Restricting Midtown Parking
description: Traffic Commissioner Theo dore Karagheuzoff announced yesterday that 70 members of the department's enforcement bureau would be assigned, starting Monday, to keeping midtown Manhattan's traffic moving.

title: A Panther Admits He Killed Another
description: NEW HAVEN, Jan. 16The head of the Black Panther chap ter here pleaded guilty today to shooting a fellow Black Panther who, the police said, was tor tured and killed as a turncoat.

title: How Big the Cutback?
description: The additional cutbacks in defense spending, sketched by Defense Secretary Laird the other day, need to be put in perspective lest they seem larger than they are. They amount only to the reductions in spending to come from a scaling down of opera tions in Vietnam plus a little more trimmed here and there from a bloated budget. They represent no fundamental shifts in strategy, much less any reorder ing of priorities.

title: William T. Piper, Who Developed the Cub, Dead
description: LOCK HAVEN, Pa., Jan. 16 (UPI)  William T. Piper, foun der of the Piper Aircraft Cor poration, one of the world's gi ants in the lightplane field, died last night at Lock Haven Hospital. He was 89 years old.

title: IVY SCHOOLS BACK YALE IN DISPUTE
description: The Ivy League colleges criti cized the National Collegiate Athletic Association yesterday for its action earlier this week that placed Yale on a twoyear probation and tabled future basketball participation by American students in the Mac cabiah Games.

title: Hofstra Trims Adelphi
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Jan. 16 Hofstra defeated Adelphi, 7859, tonight at Woodruff Hall.

title: Youngest Vice President Heads New Amex Unit
description: Thomas E. McInerney, 28 years old, was named yes terday vice president of the American Stock Exchange in charge of a new operations planning division responsible for the controls and planning of Amex automation and sys tems projects. Formerly an assistant vice president in charge of the market opera tions division of the ex change, he becomes the youngest vice president ever appointed by the Amex.

title: City Post Expected For Stephen Smith
description: Stephen E. Smith, the guar dian of the Kennedy family's political interests in New York, is expected to be the next prominent Democrat to become part of Mayor Lindsay's admin istration.

title: Overseas Port Arrivals
The Biafran Minorities
description: Several things must not go unnoticed by a world horrified at the Nigerian tragedy and baffled by its complexities. At the showdown, Colonel Effiong, one of the few nonIbos in Biafra's top echelon, was left to cope with the collapse and preside over the liquida tion of the secessionist effort. Nor should the world overlook that part of Colonel Effiong's surrender broadcast that said: Our people are disillusioned and those elements of the old regime that made negotia tions and reconciliation impossible have removed themselves voluntarily from our midst.

title: TAXLOAN CARD SET AT BANK OF AMERICA
description: The Bank of America an nounced in San Francisco last night that most of its three million BankAmericard holders would be able to pay their state and Federal income taxes through their creditcard ac counts.

title: TOMLINSON FORT, HUNTER TEACHER
description: Dr. Tomlinson Fort, who headed the mathematics depart ment at Hunter College from 1924 to 1927 and taught at sev eral universities in the South, died Tuesday in Columbia, S. C., where he had lived in recent years. His age was 83.

title: William Robertson, Partner In Law Firm, Is Dead at 70
description: Wililam O. Robertson, a part ner in the law firm of Howie & Robertson, died Thursday after a short illness at Lawrence Hospital in Bronxville, N. Y. He was 70 years old and lived at 5 Stonehouse Road, Scarsdale, N. Y.

title: Aide Says Texas Eleven Seeks 14 Black Players
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Jan. 16 (AP) The University of Texas is try ing to recruit 14 black football players, Bill Ellington, assistant athletic director, said today.

title: F. A. Melhado And Mrs. Savitt Married Here
description: Mrs. Louise Liberman Savitt was married here yesterday afternoon to Frederick A. Melhado, a partner in the securities firm of McConnell, Melhado.

title: To Mexicans, Marijuana Is Not Their Cup of Tea
description: GUADALAJARA, Mexico, Jan. 16 (Reuters)Although smokers extol Mexican mari juana as the strongest and the best in the world, users of the weed are few and far between here in Mexico.

title: Outgoing Freighters
Jet's Hijacker Is Having Fun in Beirut
description: BEIRUT, Jan. 16  Chris tian Belon, The 26yearold Frenchman who hijacked a Trans World Airlines plane to Beirut a week ago, wan dered today in a dream world of official hospitality, television interviews, auto graph seekers and pretty girls.

title: G.O.P. Leadership Divided in Indiana
description: INDIANAPOLIS  John IC. Snyder; the treasurer of the State of Indiana, is round faced, mildmannered, conserv ative in dress and viewpoint a typical product of the small town, southern Indiana Repub lican organization that sent men like William E. Jenner and Homer E. Capehart to the Sen ate in Washington.

title: LIBERTY BELL MILE TO ELEPHANT WALK
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 16 (AP) Alfred G. Vanderbilt's Ele phant Walk prevailed in threehorse stretch drive to win the onemile feature at Liberty Bell today by 1 lengths.

title: St. Peters Contains Murphy for a Half, Tops Niagara, 7773
description: JERSEY CITY, Jan. 16 Niagara brought its highly suc cessful Murphy game into the Jersey City Armory last night, but St. Peter's stopped the in vaders cold with a 7773 vic tory.

title: Brandt Unscathed as Bundestag Ends Debate on East Germany
description: BONN, Jan. 16  Chancel1 lor Willy Brandt emerged un scathed today from two days of lively parliamentary debate on his new policy toward East Germany.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Thomas L. Vogt has been elected vice president of the National Zinc Company, Inc. He was formerly assistant to the president.

title: Miss Dean Fiancee Of A. R. Singer Jr.
description: CHADDS FORD, Pa., Jan. 16Miss Elizabeth Hannum Dean has become the fiance of Alain Raunay Singer Jr., a descendant of Isaac Merritt Singer, who invented a sew ing machine and organized the Singer Company.

title: 3 STRIKE LEADERS RELEASED IN OHIO
description: CINCINNATI, Jan. 16The release on bail of three leaders of the Municipal Employes Union today was followed few hours later by an an nouncement that negotiations aimed at ending the 12day strike of 1,500 nonuniformed city workers would be resumed tomorrow afternoon.

title: Stocks in London Are Slightly Firmer
Justice Official Finds Politics In Some Poverty Unit Lawsuits
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 (AP) A top Justice Department of ficial has charged some fed erally paid lawyers with filing politically motivated law suits aimed at embarrassing the, Nixon Administration.

title: Briton to Join U.S. Golf Tour
description: LONDON, Jan. 16 (Reuters) A British Ryder Cup golfer, Brian Barnes, left today for the United States, where he will spend four months on the pro fessional circuit.

title: AGNEW, IN AUCKLAND, IS FIRM ON VIETNAM
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Jan. 16 (AP)Vice President Agnew, winding up his Asian tour, declared tonight that the United States and its allies must stand firm in Vietnam and not be swayed by antiwar factions.

title: Mrs. Jones Gains Final
description: CAPETOWN, South Africa, Jan. 16 (AP)Mrs. Ann Jones of Britain, the Wimbledon champion, and Jane (Peaches) Bartkowicz of Hamtramck, Mich., gained the final today of the women's singles in the Western Province tennis cham pionships.

title: ExPolice Chief of Dallas Finds Data on Kennedy Death Unclear
description: DALLAS, Jan. 16  Jesse E. Curry, retired police chief of Dallas, has suggested in a book just published that the entire circumstances surround ing the assassination of Presi dent Kennedy may not have been told.

title: Family of 4 Dies in Fire
description: HUNDRED, W. Va., Jan. 16 (UPI)A familiy of four per ished early today when fire destroyed their twostory frame house, a week before they would have moved to Mary land. The victims were identi fied as John Tobert Toothman; his wife, Karen, 32 years old, and their children, Gregory, 5, and Amy, 3.

title: Brezhneu Reports Wide Economic Ills, Asks Tight Control
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 16  The Soviet Communist party lead er, Leonid I. Brezhnev, was reported today to have told the party's Central Commit tee last month, in a still un published speech, that the Soviet economy was suffer ing from serious difficulties. in what was described by reliable Soviet sources as an unusually frank report, Mr. Brezhnev was said to have called for tighter state con trol over planning, increased austerity measures and stricter work discipline. in what was described by reliable Soviet sources as an unusually frank report, Mr. Brezhnev was said to have called for tighter state con trol over planning, increased austerity measures and stricter work discipline.

title: Financing Report Completed By Common Market Group
description: PARIS, Jan. 16 (UPI)The Monetary Committee of the European Common Market met today to put finishing touches on an interim report on ar rangements for mutual medi umterm financial aid among the six member nations.

title: Neighborhoods: 60c Fare Mars Rockaways' Winter
description: Winter has brought the calm of snow and cold and empty beaches to the Rocka way Peninsula in Queens, but it is a deceptive quiet.

title: U.S. Banks Allowed to Buy Stock in Housing Concern
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 (A) National banks are authorized to buy stock and limited part nership interests in the new Na tional Corporation for Housing Partnership, William B. Camp, Controller of the Currency, said today.

title: ASHE BEATS STONE, GAINS SEMIFINALS
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Jan. 16 (AP)Arthur Ashe com pleted a rout of the Australian Davis Cup team and went into the semifinals of the Victorian open tennis championships to day with two, Australians and a Briton, all prose.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: FICTION

title: $90,000aYear Rebel
description: WHEN Curt Flood devel oped a sore shoulder two years ago, several offi cials of the St. Louis Cardi nals began whispering that Flood was not helping his injury by staying up all night to paint portraits.

title: Irving Wallace's Mother Dies
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 16 (AP) Mrs. Alex Wallace, mother of the novelist Irving Wallace, died at Mount Sinai Hospital last night after a long illness. She was 79 years old. Mrs. Wallar:e leaves her husband, Aex, a daughter and her son.

title: Lindsay Says Governor Is Wrong About Subsidy
description: Mayor Lindsay yesterday scoffed at Governor Rocke feller's contention that the $24million subsidy from the Triborough Bridge and Tunnel Authority's surplus funds to the city's transit system con stituted a grant by the state.

title: Musicians Union Confers Membership on Merrick
description: David Merrick, Broadway's most prolific producer, has been made an honorary mem ber of Local 802 of the Amer ican Federation of Musicians for his distinguished achievements in the theater.

title: Demonstrators End Their. SitIn at M. I. T. Offices
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 15 1(AP) A crowd of protesters abandoned their sitin at the offices of the top officials of Massachusetts Institute of Technology tonight, leaving the offices a shambles, in the words of a spokesman fort the school.

title: Louis Fischer, a Correspondent In Soviet Union, Is Dead at 73
description: HACKENSACK, N. J., Jan. 16 Louis Fischer, prolific write on Soviet affairs and foreign correspondent, died yesterday of a heart attack at Hackensack Hospital. He was 73 years old and lived in Princeton.

title: Holiday Delays Eased At Five Major Airports
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 (AP)United States air trav elers apparently had a mer rier Christmas and a happier new year this past holiday seasonthey didn't have to spend as much time waiting in terminals and planes as in the past.

title: JIMMY HAHN, OBOIST, IN A JAZZ CONCERT
description: Jimmy Hahn, a young jazz oboist whose performance in the last two years have sug gested that he might emerge as the first major jazz artist on that instrument, appeared last night at Caravan House, 132 E. 65th Street, with a group iden tified as Reverend B.

title: SCHOOL TAX RATES PROTESTED ON L.I
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Jan. 16 The Joint Legislative Commit tee on Education was told to day that property owners can not pay any higher realty taxes to support education and that the state should restore cuts in its aid program.

title: Concert at Y Tomorrow
description: The Symphonic Workshop on the Young Men's and Young Women's Hebrew Association will present its annual winter concert tomorrow at 3 P.M. a the Kaufmann Concert Hall Lexington Avenue at 92d Street Maurice Levine will be the con ductor. Tickets to the concert which is dedicated to Nationa Jewish Music Month, may be obtained by telephoning 427 6000.

title: Harness Unit Names Cohan
description: Harry Cohan of Lake George, N. Y., was appointed a deputy commissioner of the New York State Harness Racing Commis sion yesterday. Cohan is a licensed trainerdriver.

title: Giant Buoys Are Planned for Atlantic
description: Two giant buoys, each meas uring 40 feet in diameter and each heavily instrumented, are to be stationed soon at opposite ends of the North Atlantic.

title: TRIAL IS ORDERED FOR YOUNG LORDS
description: Eight of 13 Puerto Ricans who are accused of disrupting a church service in East Har lem last Dec. 7 were ordered yesterday to be held for trial next April 13 in Manhattan Criminal Court.

title: 3 MAJOR INDEXES CONFIRM SLOWING OF U.S. ECONOMY
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16  Three major economic indica tors confirmed today the con tinued slowing of the United States economy.

title: Art: Harmonious Sculptures in Bronze
description: THE most obvious and also the most attractive thing about Rodger A. Mack's sculptures in his first New York oneman show at the Krasner Galley, 1061 Madison Avenue at 81st Street, is that their author loves bronze an affection that apparent ly is reciprocated. It is a very brassy bronze, highly polished here and blackened there. Occasional casting de fects, such as lightly pitted areas, have been allowed to stand as part of the char acter of the metal, and one wouldn't want them cor rected.

title: New York Hilton To Expand by 50%
description: The Hilton Hotels Corpora tion plans to construct a 45 story tower adjoining the New York Hilton that will make the hotel the largest in the world.

title: Recently Discovered Comet Is Now Visible Over U.S.
description: BOSTON, Jan. 16 (AP)The solor system's most recently discovered comet came into view over the Northern United States last night and will re main visible until early Febru ary, a Hayden Planetarium spokesman sai dtoday.

title: Closings Cut Auto Output
description: DETROIT, Jan. 16 (AP)  Continuing shutdowns by Unit ed States automakers seeking to trim bulging inventories of unsold cars continued to put a damper on auto production this week, the trade paper Automotive News reported yes terday.

title: NIXON NEWS PARLEY SCHEDULED JAN. 26
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 (AP) President Nixon will hold his first news conference of the year on Monday, Jan. 26, the White House said today. The exact time will be announced later.

title: New Orleans May Get Liberal Mayor
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 16 The first thing that the City Council president, Moon Lan drieu, did after winning the Democratic nomination for Mayor of New Orleans was to push through the council a pub lic accommodations ordinance.

title: Antiques: 19thCentury Aids for the Sunday Painter
description: THEOREM paintings are a form of early19th century American endeavor that can be seen currently in the new primitive art depart ment of the Kennedy Geller ies. 20 East 56th Street.

title: Statement by Official
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 15 Howard W. Johnson issued the following statement to night:

title: 3 Missing U.S. Servicemen May Be P.O.W.'s in North
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 Three servicemen listed as missing in North Vietnam may be prisoners of war, according to new information received by the Defense Department.

title: MRS. JACOB CAMINEZ
description: Mrs. Bertha Bloch Caminez, widow of Jacob Caminez, a for mer department store owner in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, died Thursday in a nursing home in Hyannis, Mass. Her age was 99.

title: BETHLEHEM LIFTS STEEL PRICES 5%
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corpo ration said yesterday it would raise prices about 5 per cent on important categories of steel used in the construction of com mercial and industrial build ings, ships, bridges and heavy machinery facilities.

title: Radio Signal Puts Insured Satellite Into Proper Orbit
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 (AP) A small rocket motor that ignited on a radio signal from Washington sent the newest, communications satellite out of an elliptical orbit today into a circular orbit 22,300 miles high.

title: Health Tops Wealth
description: LONDON (AP)  A national poll commissioned by The London Daily Mail showed health tops wealth among British wishes for the 1970's. Forty per cent of those ques tioned wanted health and long life for themselves and families, compared with 15 per cent preferring riches.

title: ADVANCE POSTED BY SOYBEAN MEAL
description: Soybean meal and potato futures continued to dominate the commodities market yes terday. On the Chicago Board of Trade, soybean meal futures jumped more than $4 a ton and influenced an advance of more than 1 cent a bushel in soy beans. Soybean oil futures closed with a loss however.

title: Cairo Claims 3 Planes
description: CAIRO, Jan. 16Three Is raeli aircraft were shot down today during attacks on Egyp tian positions in the Gulf of Suez area, according to Cairo's military spokesman.

title: REGINE, CHANTEUSE, IN CARNEGIE DEBUT
description: Rgine, the popular French chanteuse and leader of the Parisian jet set, made her American debut at Carnegie Hall last night. She danced a little, sang a lot, and captivated a houseful of her highfashion admirers, a fair number of whom had flown to New York especially for the occasion.

title: Attendance and Handle Down From 1969 as Hialeah Opens 40Day Meeting
description: MIAMI, Jan. 16  Hialeah Park opened a 40day meeting today apparently caught in the downward spiral that hit Trop ical Park 10 days ago. Attend ance and mutuel play were both off.

title: On History's Sidelines
description: A schoolteacher who soon abandoned the academic life for the greater excitement of foreign correspondence, Mr. Fischer brought to his work fluency of Russian, a knowl edge of its history and the ca pacity to hold strong opinions.

title: Topics: A Plan for a Progressive CeaseFire in Vietnam
description: STANFORD, Calif. The fundamental flaw in the Administration's program for Vietnamizing the war is that it does not facilitate the very compromise settlement that President Nixon has announced as his objective.

title: RADIOTV CENSORING DENIED BY PENTAGON
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16The director of information for the armed forces denied today that military officials censor the ra dio and television stations that broadcast news to United States servicemen overseas.

title: Frazier, Tuning Up for Ellis, Wins FighterofYear Award
description: Joe Frazier of Philadelphia, in training at Miami to de fend his share of boxing's world heavyweight cham pionship here against Jimmy Ellis of Louisville, Ky., Feb. 16, was named 1969 Fighter of the Year by the Boxing Writers Association yester day.

title: Red Cross Prepares Nigeria Medical Flights
description: GENEVA, Jan. 16 (AP) The International Red Cross Committee said today it had received permission from the Nigerian Government to fly 21 tons of medical supplies to Lagos early next week.

title: Payroll Savings Post Filled
description: Cornelius W. Owens, president of the New York Telephone Company, has been named to the Treasury Department's United States Industrial Payroll Savings Committee by Treasury Secretary David M. Kennedy.

title: India Alters Protocol
description: NEW DELHI (AP)  India, after more than 22 years of Independence, is altering lingering bit of protocol from the days of the British raj. Members of Parliament will be requested, not summoned, to attend sessions.

title: Connecticut Bids Penn Central Act On Complaint List
description: The Connecticut Commission er of Transportation asked the Penn Central yesterday to take immediate action to solve prob lems that have led to a grow ing list of complaints about passenger service.

title: BASEBALL IS SUED UNDER TRUST LAW
description: A suit charging baseball with violation of the antitrust laws, was filed yesterday in. Federal Court here on behalf of Curt Flood, St. Louis Cardinal out fielder for the last 12 years.

title: BIG 6 SCHOOL AIDES TALK WITH GOVERNOR
description: School officials from the state's Big Six cities, after meeting with Governor Rocke feller for two hours yesterday, said he expressed sympathy for school monetary problems, but promised no additional funds for education.

title: Text of Report by Observers Who Visited Biafra
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Jan. 16 (Reuters)Following is the text of a report published to day by an international mili tary observer team that re cently returned from Biafra:

title: Miss GarciaMata Is Engaged To Douglas Kenney, an Editor
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Jan. 15Mr. and Mrs. Carlos GarciaMata of New Canaan and Nantucket Island, Mass., have made known the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Alexandra. Appleton GarciaMata, to Douglas Kenney. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Daniel H. Ken ney Jr. of South Orange, N. J., formerly of Chagrin Falls. Ohio.

title: Bridal Planned By Patricia Lee Of Peace Corps
description: DORSET, Vt., Jan. 16Mr. and Mrs. James W. Lee 2d, formerly of Darien and New York, have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Patricia Lee, to John P. McCormack, son of Mr. and Mrs. George R. Mc Cormack of Vincennes, Ind.

title: Beirut Hails a Hijacker
description: International efforts to control aerial hijacking suffered a shocking setback the other day when Lebanon released on $8 bail a young Frenchman who hijacked and shot up a Trans World Airliner. The hijacker apparently is free to leave the country; is not expected he will ever be brought to trial.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SATURDAY, JANUARY 17, 1970

title: SIMPLICITY GOING TO BRISTOLMYERS
description: The BristolMyers Company agreed in principle yesterday to acquire the Simplicity Pat tern Company, Inc., through an exchange of common stock val bed at approximately $450mil lion.

title: VOLCKER DEFENDS GOLD AGREEMENT
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 The new gold agreement with South Africa provides no as sured floor price in the free market for gold speculators, the Under Secretary of the Treasury for Monetary Affairs said today. Paul A. Volcker said the accord also denied speculators the ability to un load promptly without driving the price down.

title: RCA UNIT TO RAISE TV TUBE PRICES
description: The RCA Electronic Compo nents division of the RCA Cor poration announced yesterday it planned to raise prices on television entertainment and industrial receiving tubes effec tive Feb. 1.

title: HARPSICHORDIST, VIOLINIST IN BACH
description: Bach sonatas for violin and harpsichord were played in Rogers Auditorium of the Met ropolitan Museum last night by James Oliver Buswell IV and Fernando Valenti in per formances that were genteel and pretty but not very Bachian.

title: Libyan Colonel, 27, Becomes Premier; Had Headed Junta
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, Jan. 16 The young military officers who seized control of Libya on Sept. 1 in a bloodless coup d'tat took the first step today to ward direct control of the country's administrative affairs.

title: OF 16 NEW ISSUES, 10 RISE AS 4 DROP
description: The newissue market, rid of the effects of the usual yearend hiatus in fresh of ferings, swung back to more normal operations this week.

title: Tanciulla Returns To Met on Feb. 4 With Renata Tebaldi
description: Renata Tebaldi will appear as Minnie in Puccini's La Fan ciulla del West for the first time with the Metropolitan Opera in the company's revival of the work on Feb. 4, during the sixth week of its season. Sandor Konya will be Dick Johnson, Giangiacomo Guelfi will make his Metropolitan debut as Jack Rance, Raymond Gibbs will make his debut with the company as Larkens, and Andrij Dobriansky will make his debut as Happy.

title: Goodwin Tells Jury in Chicago He Knew No Plans for Violence
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 16Richard N. Goodwin, an aide to Presi dent Kennedy and President! Johnson, testified today that he knew of no plan for viol ence by demonstrators at the Democratic Convention here in 1968.

title: DR. KING'S MURAL SETS OFF MELEE
description: ROSELLE, N. J., Jan. 16Two students and a patrolman were slightly injured today in a clash on the grounds of Abraham Clark High School brought on by a controversy over a mural.

title: Lowest Price in 16 Years
description: LONDON, Jan. 16 (Reuters) Another 5 cents an ounce was clipped off the price of gold here today, bringing it down to its lowest price in 16 years.

title: Emigres Plan Ball on Friday
description: A Masked Ball at the Win ter Palace is to be evoked Friday in the Grand Ballroom of the Pierre. The event, the sixth annual Petroushka Ball, will aid the Russian Chil dren's Welfare Society, Inc., an organization founded 44 years ago by Princess Alexis Obolensky and other mi grs from Imperial Russia to assist children of refugees from the Soviet Union.

title: Knicks Halt Late Rally and Top Pistons, 104102, as Reed Scores 29 Points
description: DETROIT, Jan. 16The New York Knickerbockers were ex pecting a tough game from the Detroit Pistons tonight at Cobo Arena and their expectations were completely fulfilled. The Knicks, sluggish after a three day rest, had a battle all the way in downing the Pistons, 104102, before a screaming crowd of 7.753.

title: Martha Rockwell Scores.
description: PUTNEY, Vt., Jan. 16Com peting on one of the warmest afternoons in this southern Vermont country in more than a month, Mike Gallagher, the slim overland racer from up state Killington, rounded out sweep of three national cross country trials today.

title: Testimony on Mass At Pentagon Given By Senator's Wife
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 (UPI)  Mrs. Philip A. Hart, whose husband is not only Michigan's senior Senator but also a ranking member of the Senate Judiciary Committee, testified in a suburban Virginia Federal magistrate court today as a codefendant with seven other persons arrested for par ticipating in an unauthorized eucharistic mass in the con course of the Pentagon last No vember.

title: 2 Curbs on Smoking in Planes Being Weighed by U. S. Agency
description: The Federal Aviation Ad ministration plans to initiate proceedings this month on proposal to ban smoking on commercial airliners, or, as an alternative, to segregate smok ers and nonsmokers on the same planes.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: No Transit Fare

title: Harney Posts a 69 for 134 to Lead Phoenix Open
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Jan. 16 (AP) Paul Harney, a grayhaired regular of the pro golf circuit who hasn't won since 1965, carded a twounderpar 69 to day and moved into the second round lead in the $100,000 Phoenix open golf tournament.

title: Oistrakh Leads Moscow Philharmonic
description: A musician who is great in one performing area probably would have been just as great in another if that had become his metier. David Oistrakh, one of the supreme violinists of our day, has been doing some con ducting in recent years, and it is a reasonable assumption that if this had been the main con cern of his career, he would now be equally eminent in this field. As it is, with relatively little experience wielding a baton, he creates no small in terest.

title: Unfair to Goliath on Jan, 25
description: Unfair to Goliath, a satiri cal fivecharacter revue, will open on Sunday, Jan. 25, at the Cherry Lane Theater. Herbert Appleman, who adapted the original material by the Israeli humorist Ephraim Kishon, is co staging it with Mr. Kishon. The language throughout the enter tainment is colloquial English. Mr. Appleman has written the lyrics to music by Menachem Zur.

title: S.E.C. Says Calling Times Carrier of Ads Was Error
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16  The Securities and Exchange Commission announced today that it had made an error in stating that some advertise ments that it has attacked as illegal were run in The New York Times.

title: A.F.L. Ceases as Entity After Today
Nixon Plans Fight to Trim International Airline Fares
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16The Nixon Administration out lined today a new policy for international airline service in the period of the iumbo jet, pledging to fight for lower fares for travelers and larger share of world traffic for American carriers.

title: Laborite M.P. Is Denied Bail At Hearing on Secrets Charge
description: LONDON, Jan. 16William 3. Owen, a 68yearold Labor Member of Parliament, was given a brief preliminary hear ing at Bow Street Magistrate's Court today on charges of having passed secret informa tion to a potential enemy. It was not revealed who was al leged to have received the in formation.

title: WILLIAM FELLER, MATHEMATICIAN
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Jan. 16 Dr. William Feller, Eugene Higgins Professor of Mathemat ics at Princeton University, died Wednesday after a long illness. He was 63 years old and lived at 139 Random Road here.

title: Mary Morris, the Actress, Is Dead at 74
description: Mary Morris, the actress who created the role of Abbie Put nam in Eugene O'Neill's Desire Under the Elms in 1924, died yesterday at Roosevelt Hospi tal. She was 74 years old and lived at the Percy Williams Home in East Islip, L. I.

title: The Pill Problem
description: Disturbing questions about the pill and its possible consequences for the millions of women taking it have been raised in Washington this week. Up to the present, most concern about this form of chemical con traception has focused upon the fact that a tiny frac tion of users have developed blood clot problems. Now some doctors and scientists are raising the possibility that the pill may be responsible for causing cancer, damaging genes, and harming the children of women who have conceived after they have ceased to use the potent hormones that prevent pregnancy.

title: Canadian Official Lauds Oil Discovery in Arctic
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 16 (UPI) Jean Chretien, Minister of In dian Affairs and Northern De velopment, has termed a new oil find in the Mackenzie River Delta in the Arctic as signif icant and encouraging.

title: FURNACE FUMES KILL BRONX MAN
description: Carbon monoxide fumes from a coal furnace killed a building superintendent and injured 17 other persons, including 14 chil dren, in a sixstory South Bronx tenement yesterday.

title: Expo Nears, and Osakans Brace for Influx of Relatives
description: OSAKA, Japan, Jan. 14A winecolored shawl pulled tightly over her gray kimono to guard against the chill draft Mrs. Fusea Nakagawa hurried through the vast underground shopping center beneath Osaka's main rail road station.

title: Legionnaires Seek $200,000 for Calley Defense
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Jan. 16 (UPI)  American Legion mem bers here began today a na tional fundraising drive to col lect $200,000 for a legal de fense fund for Army Lieut. Wil liam L. Calley Jr., accused of murdering 110 Vietnamese ci vilians.

title: Students Escape Roof Fall
description: LEBANON, N. H., Jan. 16 (AP)Lebanon High School officials cleared about 350 stu dents out of a gymnasium to day, about 90 minutes before the roof collapsed, apparently from the weight of two feet of accumulated snow. No injuries were reported.

title: Student Says Refugees Toldof Korean Slayings
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 16A student at Saigon Uni versity said today that in 1966 he interviewed at least 100 refugees who told him stories or gave eyewitness accounts of indiscriminate killings and de struction by South Korean sol diers in Phuyen Province.

title: Population Explosion Reaches
description: IN this era of overpopulation when almost everything is crowdedair ports with people and planes, high ways with bumpers nudging bump ersit possibly should not be surprising to hear skiers complain that their wide open mountain slopes are also becoming crowded. Not quite overpopulated yet, but on the way.

title: Son of Jailed Soviet Writer In Appeal in London Paper
description: LONDON, Jan. 17 (Reuters) The 18yearold son of Yuli M. Daniel, jailed Soviet writer, appealed in a letter published here today for outside help for his father and another political prisoner, Valery Ronkin.

title: Advertising:
description: There are great days acomin for the agencies that specialize in apparel adver tising, according to Harold Levine, president of Mervin and Jesse Levine, Inc., an ad vertising agency.

title: Publisher to Be Honored
description: LAWRENCE, Kan, Jan. 17 (AP) Eugene C. Pulliam. Phoenix ??

title: Miss Edwards Triumphs
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Jan. 17 Marigold Edwards of Pittsburgh, unseeded, upset Mrs. Lee Moyer of Pennington, N. J., 1315, 1716, 154, 157, to day in the final of the New Jersey State women's squash racquets cham pionship at the Pretty Brook Tennis Club.

title: Miss Marguerite Upson Fiancee of E. C. Nichols
description: DARIEN, Conn., Jan. 17 Miss Marguerite Barbara Up son, a senior at Mills College in Oakland, Calif., and Ed ward Cremin Nichols, who expects to receive a master's degree in June from the Northwestern School of Busi ness, plan to be married here this summer.

title: News of the Rialto
description: THE story is told that when Leon Uris was writing his celebrated novel, Exodus, and the publishers were hurrying him to complete it, he said, Don't worry. No matter when I finish, there still will he time. The Jews still will be struggling.

title: NEW SITE SOUGHT FOR ATOM WASTE
description: They appear to he working under a deadline; one staff aide at the state capital in Salem says the company, ChemNu clear Services, Inc., of Prosser, Wash., has already signed con tracts to dispose of radioactive materials, and will have to haul it to a federally licensed site near Reno, Nev., if they do not quickly find land that can he used as temporary storage while a permanent dump is con structed.

title: Saigon Youth Hostel to Be Given By U.S. Actor to the Vietnamese
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 12  After 20 months of running a hostel for Saigon's shoeshine boys and homeless children, a 26yearold actor and newsman, Richard Hughes, is turning his humanitarian en deavor into a purely Vietna meserun program.

title: Miss Jacot Finishes First In 58Gate Giant Slalom
description: LES GETS. France, Jan. 17 (Reuters)  Michele Jacot of France, the World Cup leader, won the giant slalom today in the international women's ski ing grand prix in this Alps re sort with a time of 1 minute 27.44 seconds.

title: Church Head to Aid Troops
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Jan. 17 (AP) The Rev. Robert V. Moss, president of the twomillion member United Church of Christ, said today that he would spend Easter in Vietnam to assist chaplains in minister ing to combat troops. Dr. Moss, here for the dedication of the $8million Beatitudes Re tirement Home, said the soldiers bear burdens far heavier than most of us realize.

title: 11 Soviet Journalists Begin A Visit to U.S. Tomorrow
description: Eleven members of the Soviet Journalists Union led by ?? N. Tolkunov, the editor of Izvestia are scheduled to arrive in the United States tomorrow

title: Leading Nonwhite Golfer May Leave South Africa
