description: COLOMBO, Ceylon  The Government of Prime Minister Dudley Senanayake, after leading Ceylon to a 6 per cent economic growth during 1969 is girding for an even greater growth during the election year of 1970.

title: Marx's Memorial in London Damaged by Two Explosions
description: LONDON, Jan. 18 (AP)Two explosions damaged Karl Marx's tomb and memorial in north London during the night, Scot land Yard reported today.

title: David O. McKay, Mormon Leader, is Dead at 96
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Jan. 18 David O. McKay, president of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latterday Saints, died today at the age of 96. Physicians said the Mormon leader died of acute congestion of the heart at 6 A.M. after having been in a coma for six hours.

title: Duryea Says Dr. Ronan Should Have More Help
description: Speaker Perry B. Duryea Jr. of the State Assembly said yesterday that he had urged Governor Rockefeller to give Dr. William J. Ronan more help in running the Long Is land Rail Road and that the Governor had found it a stim ulating idea.

title: Mary Marshall Engaged to Wed W. E. O'Connell
description: CHATHAM, N. J., Jan. 18 Mr. and Mrs. Arthur V. C. Marshall have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Mary Beth Marshall, to William Edward O'Connell, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Timothy O'Connell of Flor ham Park. A June wedding is planned.

title: ExArkansas Prison Head Fined For Cruel Treatment of Inmates
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Jan. 18 James L. Bruton, former su perintendent of Tucker State Prison Farm, has drawn a $1,000 rine and a suspended oneyear prison sentence on a charge of brutality against inmates. Fed eral Judge J. Smith Henley said he refused to send the defend ant to prison because it was likely that Mr. Bruton would be murdered there.

title: Dr. Benjamin J. Pressman, Dentist and Magician, 77
description: Dr. Benjamin J. Pressman, a dentist who became a profes sional magician, died yesterday in St. Vincent's Hospital. He was 77 years old and lived at 345 Eighth Avenue.

title: Zlowe Plans a TV Breakthrough
description: The Zlowe Company, made up of a nice group of people, really, will be introducing nudity to New York television advertising later this week. It's only infant nudity, however.

title: Radio: N.B.C. Seeks the Roots of Disunity in U.S.
description: THE radio news depart ment of the National Broadcasting Company took the unusual step last night of preempting three hours of Monitor for an exhaustive analysis of the subject of dis unity in the United States. Scores of individuals, prom inent experts and unsung laymen, were heard giving diverse opinions on the Viet namese war, the attitude of the younger generation, race relations and a discussion of priorities for healing national divisions.

title: THANT IN NIGERIA TO DISCUSS NEEDS OF WAR VICTIMS
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Jan. 18 Secretary General Thant of the United Nations arrived in Lagos this afternoon to talk with Maj. Gen. Yakubu Gowon, the Nige rian head of state, about the immediate relief needs in the warshattered territory of East ern Nigeria and what is being done to meet them.

title: Outboard Motors Propel a New Drilling Platform
description: Stormdrill VI, the new mobile oil drilling platform recently completed for the Storm Drilling Company of Houston by the Bethelehem Steel Corporation, boasts wrinklelimited propulsion.

title: Sports Today
description: HARNESS RACING

title: Texas Pollution Spurs Action by U.S.
description: HOUSTONA close look at aggravated pollution in south Texas waterways has stiffened the determination of Federal officials to press for quick Congressional revision of na tional water quality laws.

title: Pakistan Political Violence Leaves About 350 Injured
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Jan. 18 (Reuters)About 350 persons were injured today when hun dreds of supporters of rival political parties fought with staves and bricks at a rally here. Eighty persons were hos pitalized, five of them critically injured.

title: India Bedeviled by Agrarian Unrest
description: NEW DELHI  A foreign economist  Wolf Ladejinsky of the World Bankrecently warned the Indian Govern ment that if the widening gap between the incomes of rich and poor farmers was not re duced, the poor farmers would start raising hell instead of crops.

title: Solomon of A.&S. Reaches a Milestone
description: Usually, a man considers his life wellspent when he finds that he commands the affection of his peers and contemporaries and the re spect of the younger genera tion.

title: YOUTH INTERRUPTS SHOW IN MOSCOW
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 18A young Belgian disrupted the intermis sion of the Russian production of My Fair Lady tonight by shouting support for Soviet political dissidents and throw ing hundreds of leaflets to the theater audience.

title: BOLLING SUGGESTS BOLLING AS SPEAKER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 18 (UPI) Representative Richard Boll ing, Democrat of Missouri, the first House member to say that John W. McCormack, Speaker of the House, ought to stand aside for a younger replace ment, called on fellow Demo crats today to start getting their names in the pot.

title: Heart Transplants Tomorrow
description: An encouraging fact, has emerged from the review of heart transplant experience released by the National Heart and Lung Institute. Of the roughly 150 patients who underwent this operation in the last two years, twentyor almost 15 per centsurvived a year or longer. This included thirteen persons still alive on Jan. I. The record is a creditable one indeed for an axperimental procedure that has been confined to desperatelv sick persons in imminent dancer of death.

title: NANCE'S TRUMPET SPARKS QUINTET
description: Ray Nance, the trumpet player and violinist who was a star of Duke Ellington's or chestra for more than two de cades, last night brought an enthusiastically swinging quin tet to the weekly Jazz Jam boree at Uncle John's Strawhat, 316 West 49th Street.

title: Gray and Sammis Capture Final in Platform Tennis
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Jan. 18  Gordon Gray and Jesse Sammis 3d captured the final in the New Canaan Field Club's platform tennis invitation tour nament today with a 60, 62, 62 victory over Chuck Baird and Roger Lankenau, the fifth seeded team and winners of the tournament in 1966.

title: Dutch Official Flies to Sofia
description: AMSTERDAM, the Nether lands, Jan. 18 (Reuters)The Dutch Foreign Minister, Joseph M. A. H. Luns left here by air today for a fourday visit to Bulgaria at the invitation of Foreign Minister Ivan Bashev It is the first visit to Bulgaria by a Dutch minister and is part of the Dutch policy to improve EastWest relations.

title: About Bill BradleyIII
description: Sports of The Times

title: RED WINGS SCORE OVER KINGS BY 31
description: DETROIT, Jan. 18 (AP)  Al Karlander and Pete Stem kowski scored 59 seconds apart late in the second period today to break up Gerry Desjardins's great goaltending effort and lead the Detroit Red Wings to a 31 victory over the Los An geles Kings.

title: A Decorating Idea: Wallto Wall Fish
description: GERDA CLARK certainly has a way with walls. Whether the problem be decorative or remedial, she appears to have solutions in abundance that she is sharing with the public in the six rooms now on view at Abraham & Straus, seventh floor. A wall of fish tanks is the most dra matic answer of fered on what to do with a bare floor  to  ceiling surface. Mrs. Clark arranged 15 glass tanks, framed in chromed metal on shelves, filled them with more than a dozen different species (one type and color to a tank) and lit the kinetic assemblage so that the entire wall appears to glow.

title: A Discussion
description: TRADE and capital liberalization were major issues in relations between the United States and Japan during 1969. The United States Government and some American industries pressed the Japanese to remove nontariff restric tions to imports more quickly and to allow direct capital investment in Japan ese industry.

title: Congress to Begin Action On Vast Welfare Reforms
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 18 Congress will begin work to morrow on one of the most far reaching domestic proposals since the New DealPresident Nixon's plan to provide income assistance for 10 million of the working poorand the political interests concerned are nerv ously maneuvering and prob ing each other's positions like armies on the eve of battle.

title: Airport Windows Rattle
description: CAIRO, Jan. 18Passengers and employes at Almaza, Cairo's international airport, rushed to shelters today as antiaircraft guns fired at two or three diving Israeli planes. Concussion waves from the guns rattled windows in the terminal.

title: BIMONTE, SCHISSLER CAPTURE SKI JUMPS
description: BEAR MOUNTAIN, Jan. 18 Two Lake Placid high school seniors, Eddy Schissler, 17 years old, and Matt Bimonte, 18, went all out today to defeat each other but when the competition was over, each had emerged with victories in the Mount Beacon ski jumping tournament.

title: Ivan Davis, Pianist, in Lisztian Recital
description: Wearing a velvet suit and long sideburns and playing like a reincarnation of an oldtime super virtuoso, Ivan Davis gave a piano recital at Philharmonic Hall yesterday afternoon. There was an air of Liszt about him, both in the type of program and in the way he played it.

title: LEROY D. DOWNS, 70, EXREPRESENTATIVE
description: NORWALK, Conn., Jan. 18 Leroy D. Downs, a former United States Representative and newspaperman, died today at Norwalk Hospital. His age was 70 and he lived at 29 Elm wood Avenue.

title: Korea Acts to Temper Growth
description: SEOUL, South KoreaThe South Korean economy faced problems of everheating in 1970, and the Government has lowered the growth goal to 11 per cent in an attempt to cool things off.

title: ANTHONY M. KOHLER
description: SPRING LAKE, N.J., Jan. 18 Anthony M. Kohler, a manu facturer of heating boilers and refractory equipment, died yes terday in New York, where he maintained a winter apartment. His age was 81 and he also lived at 400 Alien Avenue here.

title: Ailing Thurmond Weighs Quitting
description: AN FRANCISCO, Jan. 18 (AP)Nate Thurmond of the San Francisco Warriors and the National Basketball Associa tion's rebound leader, said to day he probably will get out of pro basketball.

title: Catholic Lay Teachers Approve Pact
description: Members of the Catholic Lay Teachers Group voted yester day to accept a new twoyear contract with the Archdiocese of New York, thus averting strike that would have affected 185,000 pupils in 301 area schools.

title: NEW CHECK ASKED ON DEFENSE WORK
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 18The General Accounting Office has recommended to Congress that uniform accounting standards be established as a check on the price of defense contracts and to prevent contractors from charging the Government twice for certain costs.

title: Advertising: Putting Playbill on the Road
description: Playbill, the program that thinks of itself as the na tional magazine for theater goers, and Bravo, the pro gram that thinks of itself as the national magazine for concertgoers, are both prod ucts of the publishing divi sion of Metromedia.

title: Fire Burns 2 Hours
description: BOMBAY, India, Jan. 18 An Israeli fighter bomber dropped two bombs in the vicinity of the Cairo airport this afternoon, setting a fire that was still burning nearly two hours after the strike.

title: Thriving Thailand's Trade Surplus Narrows
description: BANGKOK, ThailandThe sound of pile drivers prepar ing for new highrise apart ment houses, office buildings and hotels mixed with the blare of automobile horns in 1969 as Bangkok continued to buzz at a frantic pace.

title: Nixon Pay Cut Plea Reported
description: Time magazine reported yes terday that George Romney. Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, has suggested that the President and all his senior political appointees should take an immediate 23 per cent salary cut, according to Reuters. Mr. Romney made the suggestion last week as one way to cut the Federal budget, but the idea was re jected, according to the maga zine.

title: Prosecutors Here Are Divided 3 to 2 on Jury Trials for Misdemeanors Subject to a Year's Sentence
description: New York City's position as the only remaining legal juris diction in the nation that denies a jury trial to a de fendant facing up to a year in jail has sharply divided the city's chief prosecutors.

title: EXCESS SURGERY DISCERNED IN U.S.
description: A Stanford University anes thesiologist, saying that there. Is a disproportionate number of surgeons In the United States, has raised the question of whether there might also be an excessive number of surgi cal operations performed.

title: KATHRYN MEISLE, 75, SANG WITH THE MET
description: Kathryn Meisle, a Metropoli tan opera contralto from 1935 to 193S, died Saturday of a heart attack in her home at 333 West 57th Street. She was 75 years old and was the widow of Calvin Franklin, a concert manager.

title: Armenians Mark Christmas
description: BETHLEHEM, Israeli  Occu pied Jordan, Monday, Jan. 19 (AP)Bells pealed over this an cient hilltop town early today to mark the Armenian Orthodox Christmas, observed by about 1,000 worshipers at traditional services in the Basilica of the Nativity. Patriarch Yeghishi Deredirian read the midnight service at the Altar of the Star.

title: Liberals, in Picking Quebec Leader, Align Firmly With Trudeau
description: QUEBEC, Jan. 18The Lib eral party of Quebec Province aligned itself solidly behind its national leader, Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau, in the leadership convention here this weekend.

title: Congress in the Age of Aquarius
description: In the rhetorical style re served by Congressional leaders for great occasions, Senator Hugh Scott concluded his an nual report as minority leader with the perceptive observation that Omnia mutantur, et nos mutamur in illiswhich he translated, all things are changing, and we are changing with them.

title: Ceylon Attracts Tourism Capital
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon  Gov ernment programs aimed at encouraging foreign invest ment here have resulted in a substantial expansion of tour ist facilities.

title: Lockheed Clears 8 Planes Grounded by a Wing Crack
description: MARIETTA, Ga., Jan. 18 (AP) Eight of the 10 C5 transport planes ordered grounded be cause of a wing crack in one of the aircraft have been cleared to fly again, a spokesman for the LockheedGeorgia Company said today.

title: JOSEPH LUIS JOVA
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 18 (AP)Jo seph Luis Jova, retired presi dent of Jova Brickworks in Newburgh, N.Y., died today at his home here. He was 84 years old.

title: Approval of Phantom Jets For Taiwan Now Unlikely
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 18The Congressional controversy over proposals to grant a squadron of Phantom jet fighterhombers to the Chinese Nationalists on Taiwan is expected to he re solved early this week after blocking for a month the ap proval of foreignaid legislation.

title: LANDLORDS SCORE 2HOME TENANTS
description: A landlord's representative declared last night that 15,000 families here use rentcon trolled apartments as a sec ond home and should be compelled to give up such housing in the current short ate.

title: Aid Group to Disband
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Jan. 18 Joint Church Aid, an air lift operation backed by Ro man Catholic and Protestant churches that made 5,300 flights into Biafra with 60,000 tons of supplies before the enclave's collapse, will be disbanded, the Rev. Viggo Mollerup, secretary general of the organization, said here today.

title: Surging Japan Asks Where Growth Is Leading
description: TOKYO  Japan sailed through its 50th straight month of economic boom as 1969 drew to a close. The dynamism that has carried the country to third rank among industrial nations showed no signs of abating as the new decade began.

title: Fair Trial and the Media
description: The problem of prejudicial pretrial publicity, raised once again by the national attention on the inquiry into New Jer sey's Mafia, is as old as news reporting itself. But where the question was once how to bal ance the defendant's right to fair trial against the public's right to a free press, the ques tion today, for many lawyers, is whether these two rights can be bal anced at all. It is conceivable, these lawyers say, that national press and television coverage has be come so pervasive that in cer tain dramatic cases a fair trial simply could not be heldfor nowhere in the country could jurors be found who had not read hundreds or words or seen TV vignette after vignette, about the defendants.

title: An Active Ecumenicist
description: WHEN the Rev. Mannie Lee VV Wilson told his congrega tion at the Convent Avenue Baptist Church in Harlem that he was going to be the first Negro Protestant to preach in St. Patrick's Ca thedral, he got a fast feed back.

title: Australia Getting Impetus in Ore
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Fab ulous mineral discoveries in the vast wilderness known as the Outback have been the springboard catapulting Australia into a period of the biggest and fastest economic expansion in the country's history.

title: Meehan Takes 12Mile Run
description: Al Meehan of Stamford, Conn., competing with a 10minute handicap, won the New York Road Runners Club 12mile run yesterday over the Harlem River course in the Bronx. The 28 yearold Meehan's corrected time was 63 minutes 2 seconds.

title: Bus Line Proposed From Nassau to City
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Jan. 18Al plan for de luxe bus service be tween four places in Nassau County and the East Side of Manhattan during the morning and evening rush hours has been announced by County Ex ecutive Eugene H. Nickerson.

title: 2 WOMEN AND A MAN DEAD IN HOME FIRES
description: New York City's weekend death toll from fires stood at eight last night and fire fatal ities since Jan. 1 climbed to 26 yesterday with the deaths of two women in Queens and man in the Bronx.

title: THE DOORS DRAW ACTIVE AUDIENCE
description: The Doors, the Los Angeles rock group, fought off repeated assaults by young members of their audience Saturday eve ning as it played its first New York concert in a year.

title: U.S. Pullout to Leave a Vacuum in Okinawa
description: NAHA, Okinawa  About 50,000 workers of Okinawa's employed population of 422, 000 have jobs on the United States military base here.

title: Healthy New Zealand ReSets Goals
description: AUCKLAND, N. Z.Trade figures last year first grati fied officials with the speed at which the economy bound ed back from the recession of 196768, then puzzled them. The continuing dyna mism of the economy is now even causing some misgivings as to whether such an up surge will bring difficulties.

title: The Long and the Short of It Are Shown in Valentino's Hems
description: ROME, Jan. 18So many people pleaded for A place last night at the new Valentino collection that the darkeyed little hero of the Italian couture had to slice a few feet off his runway just to squeeze 30 more bodies into the salon. That is the kind of problem you face if your name is Valen tino. No one in the fashion world can bear to be left out on his opening night, which kicked off the spring summer couture shows here. The earlier shows that day had no kick at all.

title: Rogers Says Attitude Of Lagos Pleases U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 18 (Reuters)Secretary of State William P. Rogers said today that the United States was pleased with the attitude of the Nigerian Government now that the civil war with Biafra is over.

title: Peter Martins Returns as Guest In 2 City Ballet Performances
description: Peter Martins, who has dropped in for the final weeks of the New York City Ballet season, made his formal re entry into the repertory yes terday at the State Theater with Symphony in C in the afternoon and Ballet Imperial last night.

title: Congregation of the Arts Suspended at Dartmouth
description: HANOVER, N.H., Jan. 18  Dartmouth College has sus pended its annual Congregation of the Arts programs in music and theater, a feature for the last eight years of the Dart mouth summer school.

title: Books of The Times
description: BETWEEN the two of them, V. S. Pritch ett and Graham Greene have lived 136 years and published 51 books, you count their novels, collections of short stories and travel writings (a sidelight at which they both excel), Mr. Pritchett's memoirs (A Cab at the Door) and literary criticism, and Mr. Greene's three stage plays. Considering their records, then, should come as no surprise that their latest books come as no surprise. Neither Mr. Pritchett's new collection of stories nor Mr. Greene's novel is a sudden de parture from what has preceded it. Both men write effortlessly professional prose. Neither of their books will alter any repu tations. Both will appeal to their estab lished following, like comfortable old clothes.

title: Brody Says Drugs Inspired Giveaway
description: Michael I. Brody Jr., who has been writing checks to strangers for thousands Of dollars, says he made his decision to give away what he calls it $25million inheri tance while I was tripped out on drugs.

title: Firestone Picks Officers
description: Robert D. Thomas, 60 years old, has been elected presi dent of the Firestone Tire and Rubber Company, suc ceeding Earl B. Hathaway, 66, who retired.

title: Chess:
description: THE decisive battleand the most dramatic game of the recent 20th United States Chess Championship in New York was the last round meeting of the defend ing titleholder, Larry Evans of Las Vegas, and the six time national champion, Sammy Reshevsky of Spring Valley, N. Y.

title: Heavy Backlog of Controversial Legislation Awaits the 91st Congress Today
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 18An edgy and troubled 91st Con gress resumes work tomorrow on a heavy backlog of politi cally and socially controversial issues.

title: ... and the End of a U.S. Boom
description: Tight money has brought the nation's economic growth to a halt. In the final quarter of 1969, Gross National Product increased by $10.3 billionbut the entire gain was due to inflation. If the current eco nomic stagnation continues, however, there can be no doubt that it will eventually reduce inflation and raise unemployment.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, JANUARY 19, 1970

title: COMPANIES ALTER FINANCING SEARCH
description: Corporate financing patterns have changed significantly over the last year, the Federal Re serve reports in its most recent Bulletin.

title: NewCar Dealers Agree Their Sales Are Skidding
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Jan. 18 Everyone's pulling in. Look at my own wife. She's old enough. She's got money. She says she's not going to buy now. It can be a $10 or a $15 item. But she heard at the bridge game or something that prices are too high, or this isn't the time to buy. It all rubs off, and there are thousands saying things like that, said an exasperated Stanley Nelson Sr., a ChryslerPlymouth auto dealer from Lynnwood, Wash., near Seattle. He was trying to explain what has happened to the newcar business.

title: Restraining Orders Issued
description: Temporary restraining orders were issued this weekend by Middlesex County Superior Court in East Cambridge, Mass., against Sidney S. Stogel, David M. Wise and Donald I. Spund, former officers of the Berkshire Apparel Corporation, Malden, Mass. The orders were granted on a bill of complaint by Berk shire Apparel, a subsidiary of Genesco, Inc.

title: Strike Halts 5 Lima Papers
description: LIMA, Peru, Jan. 18 (AP) Only two of Lima's seven morning newspapers appeared today during the 48hour strike mounted by Peru's Fed eration of Newsmen against the new freedom of the press law. The two that appeared were La Crnica and El Com ercio. Newsmen of El Comercio belong to the National News men's Association, which did not join the strike.

title: Cities Changing Shapes
description: Asia's cities are pouring more of their re sources into solving the problems that spring from rapid population increases. Expressways are unrolling in Japan and Australia. Singa pore is in the middle of a housing boom. But for the urban centers in South Vietnam, the struggle is to rebuild, a process that will re quire major aid from foreign sources.

title: Several Arabs Hurt in Blast At Jewish School in Beirut
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 18 A dynamite explosion in a Jewish school early today shattered hundreds of windows and injured several patients at a nearby Arab hospital.

title: Alps Avalanches Kill Four
description: ROME, Jan. 18 (AP)Unsea sonably warm weather started avalanches in the Alps today. At least four, two skiers and two hikers, were killed.

title: Manila Seeks Fiscal Morality in Growth
description: MANILA  I pledge to you the severest leadership in integrity as well as in dis cipline. Public officials shall set the mode for simplicity. The Presidency will set the example of this official moral ity and oblige others to fol low.

title: Sarah A. Stark To Be Married To David Ross
description: Miss Sarah Ann Stark and David Arthur Ross, students at Wesleyan University, plan to be married in June.

title: Einstein Medical Plans Fund Dance
description: The young men's division of the Albert Einstein College of Medicine of Yeshiva Uni versity will hold Its Winter Wonderball Jan. 31 at the WaldorfAstoria.

title: $236Million Allocated by U.S. To Help the States Fight Crime
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 18 (AP) The Government's crime fight ing agency announced $236 million in grants today to help states plan and carry out im provements in their criminal justice systems.

title: Sydney: Blight Being Erased
description: SYDNEY, AustraliaA grand old lady among Australian cities, but still young in heart, Sydney is undergoing billiondollar facelifting that will add to the beauty and livability of this country's oldest, biggest, liveliest and busiest metropolis.

title: Brown Takes Tennis Title
description: WALDWICK, N.J., Jan. 18 Bailey Brown of Bronxville de feated Steve Turner of New York 61, 62, 62, today and won the New Jersey State men's indoor tennis champion ship. Warren Lucas of Saddle Brook and Ted Ware beat Brown and Dave Bonner, 63, 86, in the doubles final.

title: Matsushita Says Its Goal Is Abundance
description: OSAKA, Japan  Visiting the headquarters of the Mat sushita Electric Industrial Company, Ltd., is a bit like attending a Moral Rearma ment meeting.

title: West Misses a Tackle, But Viking Fills Gap
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 18 (AP)Fred Miller, defensive tackle of the Baltimore Colts, was unable to play for the West in the Pro Bowl today when it was discovered he had a detached retina.

title: International Loans Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 18The following is a list of loans and other aid extended last week by United States and other international lending agencies here:

title: Taiwan's Business Sensitivity Grows
description: TAIPEI, TaiwanTaiwan is entering the decade of the seventies with a drawing board full of economic plans, after passing the $2billion mark in foreign trade for the first time since 1969.

title: REGISTRATION BEGINS ON SCHOOL ELECTION
description: Registration for local school board elections throughout the city will open this afternoon, despite a suit by Harlem par ents seeking to halt the redis tricting of Manhattan, Joseph Monserrat, president of the Board of Education, said yes terday.

title: 43 Airlines to Get A Federal Warning To Stop Jet Smoke
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 18  (AP)The Government will tell the nation's 43 commercial air lines Tuesday they must end pollution of the skies with jet engine smoke by 1972 or face punitive legislation from Con gress.

title: U.S. Airmen's Wives in Laos
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Jan. 18 (AP)The wives of four United States airmen missing for four years arrived here today hoping for information about their hus bands from North Vietnamese or Pathet Lao officials. The women, all from California, said they had written to North Viet namese and Pathet Lao officials in Laos several times without getting replies.

title: DELURY SEEKING WAGE REOPENER
description: John J. DeLury, president of the Uniformed Sanitation Men's Association, said yesterday that the union would ask the city for an 8.7 per cent pay in crease to compensate for the rise in the cost of living since the current contract went into effect on Oct. 1, 1968.

title: McNamara Leaves Africa
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Jan. 18 (AP)Robert S. McNamara, president of the World Bank, ended an East African tour to day and left by plane for Lon don. At a brief, airport news conference, he said, The bank is expanding its lending opera tions throughout the world anti it is Try hope thal greater lend ing he made to Kenya and ?? Af??.

title: BUCKS TURN BACK WARRIORS, 123107
description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 18 (AP) The Milwaukee Bucks took a 2019 firstperiod lead today and went on to crush the San Fran cisco Warriors, 123107, in a National Basketball Association game.

title: EDWIN BIGELOW, 84, INVESTMENT BANKER
description: Edwin Hicks Bigelow, a re tired investment banker, who was long active in promoting the game of squash rackets here and abroad, died Saturday at his home at 700 Park Avenue. He was 84 years old.

title: 3 U.S. Helicopters Shot Down, Bringing War's Total to 3,342
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 18 (AP)Three American heli copters were shot down over the weekend, the United States command said today. Five crew men were wounded.

title: Demonstrators Protest City Medicaid Freeze
description: About 50 people picketed near Gracie Mansion yester day afternoon to protest a money freeze that has pre vented many physicians from getting paid for treating Medicaid patients. The dem onstrators said numerous medical centers in poor, Spanish  speaking communi ties were about to close as a result.

title: Sinking of Ship Reported
description: CAGLIARI, Sardinia, Jan. 18 (AP)A man who said he was the only survivor of the 19man crew of the 2,706ton Italian freighter Fusina said today that the ship sank Friday night off southwest Sardinia. He said the vessel went down in heavy seas.

title: Phones in Queens Area Disrupted for the Night
description: Thousands of telephones in the Fresh Meadows section of Queens, including those in a police station serving the area, were out of service through out last night as a result of an underground cable break.

title: Ziegler Says No New Excise Taxes Will Be Needed
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 19 (UPI)After a week of pain ful economizing, President Nixon has come up with a budget for the 1971 fiscal year that will provide at least some surplus and require no new excise taxes, the White. House reported today.

title: Meeting Set for Today Inflation Fight Backed By Romney and Shultz
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 19  Two Cabinet members used the ros trum of the troubled home building industry today to de fend the Administration's tough prescription for curing infla tion, arguing that the bitter medicine would be good for housing over the long pull.

title: GERMAN BANKS RAISE INTEREST ON SAVINGS
description: FRANKFURT West Ger many, Jan. 19 (AP)  Most West German banking institu tutes announced today an in crease of the basic interest rate for saving accounts to 4.5 per cent from 4 per cent, ef fective Feb. 1.

title: OTTINGER TO MAKE RACE FOR SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19  With the disclosure of plans for New York's new Congressional districts today, the Democrats picked up one new candidate for the United States Senate and lost another.

title: National Tire Stores Sued By Goodyear on Trademark
description: MIAMI, Jan. 19 (UPI)The Goodyear Tire and Rubber Com pany of Akron, Ohio, has filed suit In Federal District Court here charging the Miamibased National Tire Stores with de ceptive trade practices and in fringement of Goodyear's Poly glas trademark.

title: Kleindienst, in Mexico, Helps Burn Marijuana
description: MEXICO CITY, Jan. 19 Richard M. Kleindienst, United States Deputy Attor ney General, joined Mexican officials today in the burning of several tons of marijuana, as a symbol of international cooperation to reduce traffic in narcotics and dangerous drugs.

title: N.Y. Life Shows Gain
description: The New York Life Insurance Company announced yesterday that individual and group life insurance passed the $6billion mark last year for the first time; reaching $6.57billion. In dividual life insurance sales ac counted for $5.1billion, a new high. Group life sales totaled $956million.

title: Laver Shifts to Aluminum
description: Rod Laver, the world's No. 1 player, will use an aluminum tennis racquet manufactured by Chemold in the Madison Square Garden invitation tournament, starting tomorrow evening. The Australian has used a wooden racquet throughout his career.

title: Mother Accused of Leaving 3 of 4 Children Alone
description: A woman who allegedly left three children home alone while she went to the movies with a fourth was arrested early yesterday after a fire, ap parently started by one of the unattended children, ruined the family's South Bronx apart ment.

title: H0SPITAL PROTEST BRINGS 4 ARRESTS
description: About 120 Lower East Side residents demonstrated in Beth Israel Hospital at noon yester day to protest the dismissal of a physician who had publicly supported their demand for reforms.

title: Vietnam Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19 (UPI) The Defense Department to day the names of the following servicemen from the New York: area as having been killed in Vietnam:

title: Little Guys Trying Treasury Bills
description: Hundreds of small inves tors, many clutching checks that represented withdrawals from savings banks, con verged on the neoFlorentine palazzo of the Federal Re serve Bank of New York yesterday to purchase high yielding securities directly from the United States Gov ernment.

title: THE MET'S BENCH SCORES IN MOZART
description: Mozart brings out the best and worst in an opera com pany. Last night the Metro politan Opera had eight changes of cast in its perform ance of Die Zauberflte. It survived handsomely, a tribute to its resources and discipline.

title: Excerpts From Rockefeller's Message to Legislature Asking a Higher Budget
description: ALBANY, Jan. 20Following are ex cerpts from the budget message Gov ernor Rockefeller sent to the Legisla ture today:

title: David Merrick, at Cast's Trial, Assails Che! as Without Value
description: David Merrick, the Broadway producer who has on occasion evinced a strong dislike of the ater critics, turned critic yes terday to denounce the Off Broadway play Che!

title: Peace Groups Picket Cahn Over Ban on Flag Symbols
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Jan. 19 About 100 representatives of peace groups picketed the of fices of Nassau County District Attorney William Cahn today to protest his ruling that the use of an American flag with symbols displayed across its face was a violation of state law.

title: NEW RULES DELAY FANNY MAY SALE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19The Federal National Mortgage As sociation announced today that it had rejected all bids at to day's mortgage auction and would resume the auction next week under new rules aimed at combating speculation.

title: Jury and Coroner in Clash at Panther Inquest
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 19A shout ing match broke out today be tween the coroner's jury and the deputy coroner conducting an inquest into the death of two Black Panthers in a pre dawn police raid Dec. 4.

title: In Memoriam
description: FORDPhilip Carleton. Haney Birthday Heaven. Always in our hearts.

title: Several Stores and Sculptor's Studio Damaged in Fire on 23d Street
description: A fouralarm fire swept through a twostory commer cial building on 23d Street, near Seventh Avenue, yester day, causing considerable damage. One fireman was slightly injured.

title: 8 Music Schools Seek a Survival Plan
description: Eight of the country's major privately supported professional music schools believe they have a limited life expectancy unless they can find new sources of sup port in the immediate fu ture.

title: THOUSANDS CLAIM BLACK LUNG FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19 (AP) Unexpected thousands of sickened coal miners are claiming millions of dollars in newly won disability benefits for black lung disease.

title: PacersTop Colonels 108106 On Brown's Shot at Buzzer
When Is a Contract?
description: The cleanest place in town will be the municipal treasury by the time John J. DeLury, president of the Uniformed Sanitationmen's Association, gets through with it. Mr. DeLury has threatened a noovertime strike and other forms of harassment if the city does not reopen its contract with the sanitation union grant an 8.7 per cent costofliving pay increase.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Y. J. Johnson Jr. has been appointed senior vice president of the Bank of AmericaNew York. He has been with the bank for 23 years and since 1950 has been vice president of international banking.

title: England Grants Women Recognition in Soccer
description: LONDON, Jan. 19 (Reu ters)Today was ladies' day in English soccer as the Foot ball Association, governing body of the game here, of ficially recognized women players for the first time.

title: French Narcotics Agents Prefer the Quiet Technique
description: MARSEILLES, France, Jan. 13Called by radio to an in terview, Chief Commissaire Maurice (the Beard) Hug left his men staked out near a suspect bar and returned to his office a little out of sorts.

title: M'DONALD SMITH, 40, LAW FIRM PARTNER
description: BERNARDSVILLE, N. J., Jan. 19MacDonald Smith, a part ner in the New York law firm of Holtzmann, Wise & Shepard, 30 Broad Street, died today of a heart attack at his home on Mendham Road. He was 40 years old.

title: JUSTICES TO RULE ON FINES FOR POOR
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19  Thirty dollars or thirty days, a type of sentence as old as American law, will come under constitutional challenge before the Supreme Court later this year.

title: Supreme Court's Actions
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: COLONIAL SEEKING COBURN CONCERN
description: The Colonial Commercial Corporation announced yester day it had held preliminary dis cussions with some of the directors of the Coburn Corpo ration of America regarding the acquisition by Colonial of about 51 per cent of the outstanding shares of Coburn.

title: 2 U.S. PANELS URGE HELP FOR RETARDED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19 (AP) Two Presidential committees called today for training of the mentally retarded in more fields such as electronics and data processing.

title: Rep. Ruth Seeks Reelection
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19 (AP) Representative Earl B. Ruth, Republican of North Carolina, a firstterm Congressman, an nounced today he will run for reelection this year.

title: Executive Is Promoted By AmericanStandard
description: Bryce S. Durant has been named a senior vice presi dent in charge of operations and planning at American Standard, Inc.

title: PAUL F. COOPER, 70, WROTE FOLK TALES
description: COOPERSTOWN, N. Y., Jan. 19  Paul Fenimore Cooper, greatgrandson of James Feni more Cooper, died in his home here yesterday after a brief illness. He was 70 years old.

title: Southerner Named to Supreme Court; Carswell, 50, Viewed as Conservative
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19 President Nixon nominated Fed eral Judge G. Harrold Carswell of Tallahassee, Fla., to the Su preme Court today.

title: M.I.T. SEEKS ACTION AGAINST PROTESTERS
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 19 (AP)The Massachusetts Insti tute of Technology applied to day for court complaints charging 31 individuals with trespassing in the invasion of the top administrative offices at the institute last week.

title: U.S. Calls Davis Cup Meeting On South Africa and Rhodesia
description: SEATTLE, Jan. 19 (UPI) Robert B. Colwell, first vice president of the United States Lawn Tennis Association, said tonight that, at the request of the International Lawn Tennis Federation, the association had called a meeting of Davis Cup nations to discuss the status of South Africa and Rhodesia in the draw for this year's com petition.

title: BLACK PANTHERS SAY OFFICE WAS BOMBED
description: JERSEY CITY, Tuesday, Jan. 20 (UPI)Members of the Black Panther party here said 10 shots were fired into their storefront headquarters at 384 Pacific Avenue early today. Seven persons were inside, but no one was hurt, they said.

title: NEWS WIRE RATES DEBATED BY F.C.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19 (AP)  The Federal Communications Commission held hearings to day on whether the press should continue to pay a spe cial low rate for leasing tele graph wires to carry the news.

title: A Pragmatic 197071 State Budget
description: ALBANY, Jan. 19There is no philosophy in this budget, a high administration source said of Governor Rockefeller's $7,257,000,000 spending plan for this election year. We didn't begin with any philoso phythis is built from the bot tom up, not from the top down with any philosophical consid erations. The obvious result, then. is a budget that has been moldec by what the Gov ernor sees as cur rent political and fiscal reality. This pragmatic approach re flects two basic considerations revealed in the budget:

title: Senator Nelson to Ask for Antipollution Measure
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19  Senator Gaylord Nelson said today that he would soon intro duce a constitutional amend ment recognizing the right of every American to a decent environment.

title: Delaware River Cleanup
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 19 (AP) The Delaware Port Authority announced today a new cam paign to clean up the Delaware River of both dangerous and unsightly debris. The campaign will begin Thursday with a demonstration of a specially designed boat that scoops up floating debris.

title: Insurance Accord Reached in Jersey
description: TRENTON, Jan. 19As one of the final acts of his ad ministration, Gov. Richard J. Hughes today averted a crisis that threatened hundreds of thousands of the state's auto mobile liability insurance policy holders.

title: Annual Luncheon Set By Brandeis Women
description: Four hundred members of the Gotham Chapter of the Brandeis University Women's Committee and their friends are expected to attend the chapter's annual luncheon and fashion show in the Grand Ballroom at the Plaza next Tuesday.

title: Proposed Congressional Redistricting
description: ALBANY, Jan. 19Follow ing are the boundaries of the proposed new Congres sional districts in Nassau, New York City and West chester. Where changes are not noted the changes are not expected to have signifi cant political effect.

title: Few Register Here for School Vote
description: Voter registration got off to a slow start yesterday for the community school board elec tions that will be held through out the city on March 19.

title: McGovern Accuses Nixon Of Polarizing U.S. Politics
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19 (AP) Senator George S. McGovern, Democrat of South Dakota, accused the Nixon Administra tion today of polarizing na tionalpolitics and said that the Pentagon's budget should be cut by $50billion in the next three years.

title: Supermarkets Rely On Nonfood Items
description: Concerned about their in ability to increase their profit margins on foods, supermarket chains are planning to turn more and more to higherprofit ratio nonfood products.

title: Stock Split Is Approved
description: MANILA, Jan. 19 (AP) Stockholders of the Marinduque Mining and Industrial Corpo ration approved today a 3for2 stock split. The record date for the split was set as Jan. 29. Stockholders also approved an increase in shares to 20 million from 8 million.

title: INJURIES SIDELINE 3 BLUES PLAYERS
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 19 (UPI) East meets West tomorrow night for the first time in an expansion city in the National Hockey League's 23d annual AllStar game.

title: De Carlo Jury Hears Letter by Saperstein on Threats to Family
description: NEWARK, Jan. 19A letter written by a man the day be fore he died was heard by jury in Federal court here to day where Angelo (Gyp) De Carlo, reputed Mafia figure, and Daniel (Red) Cecere are on trial.

title: Kennedy Hearing on Nigeria
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19 (Reu ters)Senator Edward M. Kennedy announced today that he would hold a Senate sub committee hearing Wednesday on American policy toward the relief efforts in Nigeria.

title: Bridge
description: THE Swiss Team tourna ment that closed the Tri State Regional Champion ships at Grossinger, N. Y., Sunday was won by a five man team headed by Murray Schnee of New York. Teamed with Sol Seidman and Jim Becker of New York, Jim Ben nett of Hartford and Tannah Hirsch of Stamford, Conn., he won eight matches out of a possible nine to head a field of 128 teams.

title: MARTIN'S BID DENIED IN SPERRY RAND CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19 (AP) The Supreme Court let stand today a lower court decision that George M. Bunker was acting as a representative of Martin Marietta Corporation when he served on the board of directors of the Sperry Rand Corporation.

title: Narvaez Outpoints Evans; Tomlin Stops Baerga in 5th
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 19 (AP) Frankie Narvaez, a New York lightweight, piled up a lead in the early rounds tonight and gained a split decision over Roger Evans of Philadelphia. The 10round bout was a co feature at the Philadelphia Arena.

title: In Credit Markets, 9% U. S. Sale Is Seen With 8.2% Ford Issue
description: The Federal Government is expected to sell today $350 million of notes at yields approaching 9 per cent. At the same time, the Ford Motor Company will sell $200million at yields of 8.20 per cent or less.

title: University in Venezuela Occupied by the Military
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Jan. 19 (Reuters)  Two hundred steelhelmeted troops armed with submachine guns occupied the campus of National Uni versity today and tore down placards attacking a proposed university reform hill.

title: Molloy's Winning Coach Pens Salute to New York Basketball
description: Jack Curran tossed aside his draft of the opening para graph of the introduction of his book Saturday night on a desk cluttered with papers. It was now game time and Curran, the Archbishop Mol loy High basketball coach, stepped into a packed gym nasium where his unbeaten Stanners were to defeat Bish op Reilly, 7061, for their 12th victory.

title: DRIVERS IN RALLY CLAIM SABOTAGE
description: MONTE CARLO, Jan. 19 (Reu ters)Swedish and Italian driv ers said today their cars had been sabotaged during the first stage of the Monte Carlo Rally.

title: Faculty Voice at Harvard
description: The election of two teacherscholars to Harvard's sevenman governing corporation is a constructive act of institutional renewal. Harvard, incorporated 320 years ago, is the nation's oldest corporation; its decision is hound to influence the trend and tone of the trusteeship of all higher education.

title: Police in Brooklyn Investigate Bloodstained Social Club Room
description: Discovery of bloodstains in a storefront social club in the Bath Beach section of Brooklyn an area long known as a dumping ground for victims of underworld executionshas set off investigations by the police, the Brooklyn District Attorney and the Federal Bureau of In vestigation.

title: Ohio State Triumphs, 8470
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Jan. 19 (UPI)Jody Finney scored 30 points tonight in leading Ohio State to an 8470 victory over West Virginia.

title: Hall to Continue His Hurdling While Awaiting Football's Call
description: In track and field, you know what you can do, Ery Hall said yesterday. You rely on physical training, mental stim ulation and your own com mitment as an athlete.

title: No Veto for Education
description: By calling up the $19.7billion appropriations bill for the Departments of Labor and Health, Education and Welfare as the opener of the session, the Senate Democratic leadership is confronting the Administra tion with a sharp political challenge. If the President carries out his threat to veto the bill as inflationary, he will have to face the charge of having downgraded vital domestic needs, even in the event that Congress should override the veto.

title: NEW PARTY APPEARS THREAT TO VORSTER
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Jan. 19The ultraright fing Reconstituted Nationalist party, led by a former Cabinet minister, Dr. Albert Hertzog, is now considered a bigger threat to Prime Minister John Vorster than his ruling National party Mad believed.

title: A Correction
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19 (UPI)  Senator William B. Spong Jr., Democrat of Virginia, was in correctly identified in a United Press International article last week as being among the 14 Senators given zero ratings by the American Federation of La bor and Congress of Industrial Organizations on 11 key votes during the 1969 session of Con gress. Senator Harry F. Byrd Jr., Democrat of Virginia, should have been listed instead of Mr. Spong among the Senators who voted opposite of what the la bor federation supported in the 11 votes.

title: OUTPUT OF STEEL UP 0.3% FOR WEEK
description: Steel production last week was 0.3 per cent higher than output the preceding week, the American Iron and Steel Insti tute reported yesterday.

title: SAMMARTINO PINS KOLOFF AT GARDEN
description: Bruno Sammartino took 18 minutes and 10 seconds of a single fall match to pin Ivan Koloff last night at Madison Square Garden before a record crowd of 16,858 fans. He re tained the World Wide Wrest ling Federation championship belt, using a doublereverse back flip body hold.

title: LINDSAY SEEKING POLLING REFORMS
description: Mayor Lindsay appointed a threeman panel yesterday to recommend election reforms. He called the existing proce dures a bureaucratic night mare that seemed designed to discourage voters.

title: Reed's Ailment Diagnosed as a Spasm, Not an Ulcer
description: Willis Reed and his fans can stop worrying.

title: Mayor Praises Gottehrer And Gives Him New Title
description: Barry Gottehrer, who devel oped the Mayor's Urban Action Task Force during the first Lindsay administration, was given a new title by the Mayor yesterday along with praise for past performances.

title: An Upward Trend Is Seen Continuing In Prices of Silver
description: LONDON, Jan. 19 (Reuters) Mocatta & Goldsmid, London bullion brokers, in their annual bullion market review, said the longterm silver price trend should continue upward.

title: In The Nation
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 19Anthony Haswell boarded the Broadway Limited here this afternoon and headed for New York via over night sleeper. This was nothing unusual for himin a few days he will be off to the West Coast on the Superchiefbut this par ticular trip gave him a certain symbolic satisfaction.

title: Even the Brunettes Were Blondes for a Night
description: IF ANITA LOOS was right about gentlemen and blondes, the black  tied men who dined and danced at the Fancifull party in the Plaza's Terrace Room last night never had it so good. Most of their partners were blondes. There were silver blondes and gold en blondes, blondes who were born that way or who elected to be. There were even some blondes who usually prefer to be brunettes.

title: Harassment of Peace Corps Brings Cutbacks in Ethiopia
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19 (AP)  Student harassment of Peace Corps teachers in Ethiopia has caused the corps to cut back its educational programs there and to recall some volunteers to the United States.

title: Marine Is Acquitted in Vietnam Killing
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 19An American Marine captain was acquitted tonight by a general courtmartial of the premeditated murder of a North Vietnamese prisoner of war.

title: U.S.Israel Fund Plans a Diversified Benefit Gala
description: Going from one good thing to another is the way sup porters of the AmericaIsrael Cultural Foundation will spend the evening of Feb. 1.

title: SOUTHERN LAYS ON JURIES UPHELD
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19 The Supreme Court declined, today to strike down vaguely worded jury selection laws that Negroes contended had been used in Alabama and Georgia to keep many blacks off jury rolls.

title: COMPUTER FIGHT IN THEATERS HERE
description: Makebelieve boxing makes its debut on the movie screen tonight when approximately 1,500 theaters in the United States and Canada show staged color film of a fight between two former world heavyweight champions, Rocky Marciano and Cassius Clay. A computer will determine the outcome.

title: Sports of The Times
description: THERE is so much starch in the stuffed shirts of the National Collegiate Athletic Association policymakers that they get trapped by their own rigidity. Even when common sense dictates that some flexibility is in order, Walter Byers and his henchmen at the Kansas City com mand post stare fixedly ahead. All they can see is the hated Amateur Athletic Union, an organization that blocks their power grab to take control of all amateur sports in the United States and in the various international councils.

title: Genocide Is Charged By Biafran Unit Here
description: The head of an organiza tion representing 1,500 East ern Nigerians living in the United States charged yes terday that the Government in Lagos was waging. planned and systematic gen ocide on the people of de feated Biafra.

title: EDWARD J. YOUNG
description: WESTFIELD, N. J., Jan. 19 Edward J. Young, president of the Metallics Division of the Vulcan Materials Company in Clark Township, died yesterday in Memorial Hospital, New York. He was 54 years old and lived at 585 Tria?? Place ??

title: Weilerstein and Halligan Play Ives Sonata With Native Grace
description: Even the most gifted lin guists usually speak their na tive tongues more fluently than others, but it was still a gratifying surprise last night at Carnegie Recital Hall to hear Donald Weilerstein and Susan Halligan give so idiomatic a performance of the Ives Sonata No. 2 in G.

title: Mich. Coach Returns Home
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Jan. 19 (AP)Bo Schembechler, coach of the University of Michigan football team returned home tonight from Pasadena, Calif. He had been released from a hospital after treatment for a heart attack suffered just be fore the Rose Bowl game.

title: SURVEY DISCLOSES A PATTERN IN CRIME
description: Burglars and persons who commit felonious assaults fall into a pattern and usually re peat their crimes, according to a police study disclosed yes terday.

title: MISS RAN IS HEARD IN TOUGH PROGRAM
description: Any 21yearold pianist who builds a program around two such humane but towering works as the Schubert post humous Bflat Sonata and the Beethoven Sonata (Op. 110) must be extremely dedicated and serious about music.

title: BYEGONE DRAWS AUTOMATIC NO. 8
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Jan. 19 Larry Mallar, the racing secre tary for Roosevelt Raceway, announced today an eighthorse field for the $25,000 Early Bird Pacing series final Saturday night.

title: Jo Woodley Fiancee of Engineer
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Jan. 19 Miss Jo Woodley, owner of the Improvisation Boutique here, a woman's apparel shop, and Dr. John William Benoit, a research engineer at Princeton University, plan to be married here Jan. 27.

title: STATE REMAPPING OF CONGRESS LINES HELPFUL TO G.O.P.
description: ALBANY, Jan. 19The Republican leadership of the Legislature made public a Con gressional reapportionment plan today that many politicians ex pect to help the election of two or more new G.O.P. Congress men this year.

title: U.S. Protests Broadcasts By Moscow on P.O.W.'s
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19The Soviet Union said today that it would broadcast statements attributed to American prison ers in North Vietnam, and the State Department responded with a formal diplomatic com plaint.

title: Tests May Delay the First Flight of Boeing 747 Jet
description: SEATTLE, Jan. 19Despite around  the  clock escapeslide tests, Pan American World Air ways was still unable to get final approval today to put its new 747 jet into commercial.

title: Two Justices Disagree On Pets in Lease Cases
description: Six days after one judge per mitted a woman to keep dog in her Lower East Side apartment despite a ban against animals in her lease, another judge yesterday or dered another tenant five blocks away to get rid of his dog for violating a similar lease.

title: The 2 Germanys Indicate Readiness to Start Talks
description: BERLIN, Jan. 19West Germany and East Germany indicated in separate statements today that political talks, between them could be opened for the first time since the two states were established 20 years ago.

title: 18 Reported Killed by Enemy Mines at Training Base Near Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 19  South Vietnamese military spokesmen said that 18 persons, including 16 South Vietnamese officer cadets and their instruc tor, were killed today when two Claymore mines that they say were planted by the Vietcong exploded in their training area about 12 miles northeast of Sai gon this morning.

title: NEW HAVEN FARES WILL BE REVISED
description: The Interstate Commerce Commission authorized the Penn Central Company yester day to revise fares on the New Haven Railroad for 16,000 com muters between Connecticut and New York City.

title: Abercrombie & Fitch's Hot Sale Leaves Over 200 Out in the Cold
description: It was 12 degrees at 9:14 A.M., and a quiet line of more than 200 shivering men, women and children stood waiting. One minute later, a man from inside the store opened one door and the panic was on.

title: Levin Fights His Removal As LevinTownsend Chief
description: Howard S. Levin, who was ousted on Friday as the presi dent and chief executive officer of the LevinTownsend Com puter Corporation, disclosed yesterday that he had retained the law firm of Paul Weiss Goldberg Rifkind Wharton & Garrison to represent his inter ests.

title: Red Cross Chief Hopeful After Biafra Tour
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Jan. 19 What I saw with my own eyes was easy meetings be tween federal soldiers and the people walking along the roads, some of them still in Biafran uniforms. I think it is going to be all right.

title: Three More Generals Reported Shifted by Thieu
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 19President Nguyen Van Thieu was reported today to have ordered the shifting of three more South Vietnamese commanding generals in what informed sources said was a major shakeup brought about, at least in part, by American pressure to improve the per formance of the army.

title: MARCH DEBUT SET FOR PAPER HERE
description: Two young men announced last night that they planned to begin publishing in March a new fivedayaweek morning newspaper here.

title: HAL MARCH, ACTOR, TV QUIZMASTER, 49
description: HOLLYWOOD, Jan. 19 (AP) Hal March, who was master of ceremonies of the popular tele vision quiz show The $64,000 Question in the 1950's died to day, at the University of Cali fornia at Los Angeles Medical Center at the age of 49.

title: Medicare Fee Freeze Asked
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19 (AP) The premium paid by Medi care patients for doctors' serv ices would be frozen for another year at the current $4amonth under legislation proposed to day by Senator Walter F. Mon dale, Democrat Democrat of Minnesota. The premium is scheduled to rise to $5.30 a month effective July 1.

title: QDIE SEAGRAVES, 84, TEXAS OIL PIONEER
description: DALLAS, Jan. 19 (AP)  Odie R. Seagraves, one of the last of the early Texas oilmen, plunged to his death today from the eight floor of a Dal las hotel. He was 84 years old.

title: Mayor's Call Brings $1,800 Contribution For Jewish Charity
description: I didn't believe it was him. He asked me how business was. Then he told me he had my card . . .

title: Article 2  No Title
Soviet Fur Auction Opens
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 19 (Reuters) About 2.7 million fur skins were offered by Soviet sellers when the international fur auc tion opened in Leningrad today, the Tass news agency reported. Representatives of furtrading concerns from 24 countries are attending the sale, which will last for about a week. Among the skins on offer are standard and colored mink, blue and white fox, red and silver fox, sable, lynx, marten, ermine, muskrat, wolf and squirrel, in addition to Persian lamb and broadtail.

title: L.I. School Still Closed as Racial Factions Confer
description: BELLPORT, L. I., Jan. 19 Jim Strano, one of the leaders of a group of white students in the school district here, stood next to Clyde Gamble, a leader of a group of black students, to day, and said: If we can get together, the whole school can come together.

title: Summer Offensive Expected
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 18An increasing number of senior American military planners are coming to believe that enemy commanders in Vietnam are building toward a major coun trywide offensive this summer, rather than next month as previously thought.

title: Frederick Atkins, Inc., Promotes Five Executives
description: Five new executive vice pres idents have been appointed by Frederick Atkins, Inc., in a pro gram to strengthen the con cern's merchandising structure. Atkins, which is operated by 40 leading department and spe cialty stores, is a merchandis ing research organization based in New York.

title: Citizens Committee Exerts Strong Influence in Child Care Plans
description: In the kitchen of Public School 166 on West 89th Street, there is a large, mod em heating unit that can warm 600 lunches at one time. But Mrs. Gladys Fitch ett, the school's lunch man ager, spends three and, warm ing hours every day arm ing soup for 300 children on three small, antiquated gas burners while the heating unit remains unused.

title: Japan and Market Set Talks
description: TOKYO, Jan. 19 (Reuters) The European Economic Com munity, or Common Market, will hold preliminary discus sions here next month with Japan on a trade agreement, the Foreign Ministry announced today. The Ministry said the agreement would combine trade pacts already existing between Japan and each of the six Common Market countries.

title: Tucker, Anthony Firm Adds General Partner
description: Tucker, Anthony & R. L. Day, members of the New York Stock Exchange, an nounced yesterday that Rob ert L. Hoguet had been admitted to general partner ship and named a member of its executive committee.

title: INDIA TELLS OIL MEN TO CUT CRUDE PRICES
description: NEW DELHI, Jan. 19 (Reu ters)The Indian Government today warned Burmah Shell Re fineries, the Esso Standard Refining Company and Caltex Oil Refining to reduce the price of imported crude oil for their refineries.

title: 2 Actors Mentioned At Trial of an Aide Over Credit Cards
description: The names of Frank Sinatra it was not clear whether Sr. or Jr. was meantand Jackie Gleason were brought up yes terday at the start of the Fed eral Court trial of the business manager of Frank Sinatra Jr. on charges of conspiring to use stolen credit cards.

title: Aid to City Would Go Up, But at a Decreased Rate
description: State officials said yesterday that Governor Rockefeller's new budget, exclusive of support for public schools, contained an in crease of $138million in aid for the city.

title: Dutch Bishops' Statement
description: The fifth plenary assembly of the Dutch Pastoral Coun cil has expressed the opinion of a substantial part of the church community in the Netherlands as to the junc tion of celibacy and priest hood.

title: OTHER UTILITY REPORTS
description: (Periods ended Dec. 31) PUBLIC SERVICE CO. OF N. H.

title: Albert H. Reinauer Dies at 74
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., Jan. 19  Albert N. (Bert) Reinauer, marine oil transportation ex ecutive, died in Valley Hospital here yesterday afernnoon of pneumonia. He was 74 years old and lived at 154 Park Ave nue. Midland Park.

title: BASEBALL GOES TO COURT TODAY
description: The dispute over baseball's reserve clause grew more clamorous yesterday on the eve of the first hearing in Federal Court here.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
N.Y. Jet Diverted
description: GANDER, Nfld., Jan. 19 (AP) A Boeing 707 jetliner of Trans World Airlines bound from Madrid to New York was diverted here today because three men were causing a dis turbance, authorities said. A passenger said that the three men, who were taken into cus tody by police had warned that they would not allow the flight to continue to New York after an incident involving a stew ardess.

title: Welfare Criticism Stirs Democrats on House Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19 (AP) The House Ways and Means Committee began consideration of President Nixon's proposed welfare reforms today in an at mosphere chilled by the Admin istration's criticism of Congress.

title: J. C. Warnecke Jr. Fiance Of Miss Nancy Chickering
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 19 Miss Nancy Chickering, a senior at Berkeley, plans to be married on March 22 to John Carl Warnecke Jr., a newspaper reporter who used to make a daily detour by the Chickering residence when she was a grade school pupil at the Katherine Del mar Burke School and he was a smitten school boy at the Town School four blocks away.

title: Springs Mills Forms Division
description: Springs Mills, Inc., announced yesterday the formation of a retail and specialty fabrics divi sion, It will combine the retail fabrics organization of Springs Mills and the finished goods di vision bought earlier this month, from Indian Head, Inc.

title: U.S. Artillery Commander In Copter Is Killed by Enemy
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 20 (Reuters)  A Vietcong sharpshooter killed a United States Army colonel while he was flying in an observation helicopter, the United States command announced today.

title: NOMINEE REPORTS OWNING NO STOCK
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Jan. 19 Appeals Court Judge G. Har rold Carswell said today that he had no financial interest that could cause the Senate any difficulty in deciding whether to confirm him as a Supreme Court Justice.

title: Rates Decline in Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19 Treasury bill rates declined at today's auction from last week's levels, the Government reported late this afternoon.

title: Philadelphia Court Orders Alleged Mafioso to Testify
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 19 Angelo Bruno, a reputed Mafia leader here, was ordered today to testify before a New York City grand jury investigating organized crime.

title: Advertising: Peck & Peck's Special Woman
description: For years, Peck & Peck has been a certain kind of store, the kind that used an ad agency instead of having its own ad department. That's unusual in retail.

title: GREECE AND ONASSIS AGREETO PACT ON OIL
description: ATHENS, Jan. 19The Greek Government reached prelimi nary agreement today with Aristotle Onassis, under which the shipping magnate will in vest $600million in industrial projects, including a planned oil refinery. At the same time, the Government pressed simi lar negotiations with another millionaire, Stavros Niarchos, for a $200million contract.

title: Grace Line Gets New Name and a New President
description: Grace Line started its second halfcentury of passengership operations to Latin America yesterday under a new name and a new chief executive.

title: Teachers Out, Passaic Shools Are Shut
description: PASSAIC, N. J., Jan. 19  This city's 11 public schools were closed today for the second day as the Passaic Edu cation Association continued its strike in defiance of a tempo rary injunction ordering its 431 teachers back to their class rooms.

title: Bahrein Shuffles Ton Aides
description: BAHREIN, Jan. 19 (Reuters) The ruler of Bahrein, Sheik Isa bin Sulman alKhalifa today named his brother, Sheik Khalifa bin Sulman, President of a 12member State Council in a major Government re shuffle.

title: Kirk Says Florida Can't Meet Integration Deadline
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19 (AP) Gov. Claude R. Kirk Jr., of Florida told the Supreme Court today that his state was finan cially and physically unable to meet the terms of the Court's order for immediate school de segregation.

title: C. F. Mansbach, Nancy L. Kaplan Engaged to Wed
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 19Miss Nancy Lamport Kaplan and Charles Fred erick Mansbach, reporters for The Worcester Telegram, have become engaged and plan to be married March 7 at the Cambridge home of the prospective bride's par ents, Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Kaplan.

title: The Anastasia Question In German Court Again
description: KARLSRUHE, West Ger many, Jan. 19 (AP)The civil branch of the West Ger man Supreme Court began hearings today in the case of the 69yearold woman who for almost 40 years has claimed to be the Grand Duchess Anastasia, youngest daughter of Czar Nicholas II of Russia.

title: African Talks Start Today
description: The annual series of lectures on Africa at the Countee Cul len Branch of the New York Public Library, 104 West 136th Street, will begin today at 7:30 P.M. Dr. Elliott Skinner, former United States Ambassador to Upper Volta and professor of anthropoloby at Columbia Uni versity, will speak on High lights of Traditional African Culture.

title: Vehicle Will Aid Collection of Lunar Rocks and Soil
description: Starting with Apollo 14 this fall, astronauts who go to the moon are expected to leave, wheel tracks among their foot prints. They will be using a twowheel, rickshawlike cart when they are on the lunar surface, collecting moon rocks and soil.

title: AN AITIBUSING DRIVE ASKED BY M'KEITHEN
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 19 Gov. John J. McKeithen called tonight upon Americans to speak out against the busing of schoolchildren.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Illegal War

title: Israeli Jets Raid Egypt
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 19 (AP) Israeli jets attacked Egyptian army outposts, artillery and antiaircraft guns in the central sector of the Suez Canal today, military spokesman said. They reported that all planes returned safely from the 40minute raid.

title: ROLLIN CRAMPTON, ABSTRACT ARTIST
description: Rollin Crampton, an abstract artist whose paintings are in the collections of many leading museums, died Saturday in Woodstock, N. Y. He had moved there recently from New York.

title: PRICES ROSE 6.9% HERE DURING '69, THE MOST SINCE '51
description: The cost of consumer goods and services rose 1 per cent in December in the metropolitan area, making price increases here in 1969 greater than in any year since 1951.

title: VOLPE'S RAIL PLAN FINDS OPPOSITION
description: The Bureau of the Budget was reported yesterday to be opposing approval of a plan by Transportation Secretary John A. Volpe for creation of a quasipublic corporation to run the nation's railroad passenger system.

title: Walter S. Robertson Sr. Dead; Former U.S. Aide on Far East
description: RICHMOND, Jan. 19Wal ter Spencer Robertson Sr., As sistant Secretary of State for Far Eastern Affairs in the Eisenhower Administration, died here last night, apparently of a heart attack. He was 76 years old.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES ADVANCE IN PRICE
description: Influenced by the weather, trading on the Chicago Board, of Trade opened on a mixed and active note yesterday, slowed down for a while and then quickened in the closing minutes of the session.

title: Fete to Help Achievement Institute
description: Mrs. Edward A. Hansen, a lawyer's wife, and Mrs. J. Ben Ali Haggin, whose hus band is a member of the New York Stock Exchange, head a committee of 45 planning a dinner dance Jan. 29 to bene fit the New York Institute for Achievement of Human Potential.

title: SHIPPING/MAIL
description: ALL HOURS GIVEN IN EASTERN STANDARD TIME

title: INDUSTRIAL LANDS EXPECT A SURPLUS
description: PARIS, Jan. 19Virtually all the industrially advanced coun tries expect a surplus in their trade in goods and services with the rest of the world next year.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, JANUARY 20, 1970

title: Airlines Seek a Limit Of 2 Drinks to a Fare
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19 (UPI)Three of the nation's largest airlines American, Trans World and United asked the Civil Aeronautics Board today to approve a twodrink limit for passen gers on domestic flights.

title: KANSAS CITY GETS N0.3 DRAFT PICK
description: Noland Smith, already dis tinguished because he is the smallest athlete in pro football at 5 feet 6 inches and 155 pounds, became the first play er yesterday to be traded under the new interconference trad ing rules of the National Foot ball League. Smith, a kickre turn runner with three sea sons of experience, was traded by the Kansas City Chiefs of the American Conference to the San Francisco 49ers of the National Conference for a thirdround choice in next Tuesday's draft of college play ers.

title: Ann Corio's Burlesque Is Set for Feb. 11 Return
description: Ann Corio, last of the cote rie of runway queens that included Gypsy Rose Lee, Margie Hart and Georgia Sothern, is bringing back This Was Burlesque. The 1970 edition of the show, a musical satire based on Miss Corio's recollections, opens at the new Hudson West Cabaret, 57th. Street and Ninth Avenue, on Feb. 11 for an indefinite run.

title: Mistrial Is Ruled in Case Against Klein and 2 Others
description: WHITE PLAINS, Jan. 18The trial of Julius Klein jr., who has been convicted of mur der, and two others on robbery and kidnapping charges, result ed in a mistrial today.

title: 11 SOVIET NEWSMEN HERE FOR A U.S. TOUR
description: Eleven Soviet editors, headed by Lev N. Tolkunov of Izvestia, the Government newspaper, ar rived here yesterday for a three week tour of the United States. They are returning a visit to the Soviet Union by 10 mem bers of the American Society of Newspaper Editors last year.

title: C5A WING CHANGES PUT AT $6.41MILLION
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19 (AP) The Air Force estimated to day that it would cost $6.48 million to strengthen the C5A cargo plane against potential wing cracks that turned up in one of the planes last week.

title: If It Is a Trend, Pity the GirlWatchers
description: ROME, Jan. 19The new est feud, or polmica, simmering backstage at the spring and summer couture shows this week is between the Italian and foreign mod els.

title: BRUCE A. HAINSWORTH
description: PLAINFIELD, N. J., Jan. 19 Bruce A. Hainsworth, a for mer project engineer with the Olin Mathieson Chemical Cor poration, died in a hospital here today of heart failure. He was 73 years old and lived at 263 Farview Drive, Mountainside.

title: Agnew Returns From His Asian and Pacific Trip With New Image
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19 The high point of the 37,000 mile odyssey that Vice Presi dent Agnew ended here to night may have occurred at a hole in the ground 37 miles north of Saigon on New Year's Day.

title: 2 BANKS REPORT HIGHER EARNINGS
description: Two giant New York bank holding companies reported yesterday sharp Increases in net income last year.

title: BIG SOVIET CRUISER SAILS INTO ATLANTIC
description: NAPLES, Italy, Jan. 19 (AP) The Soviet missilehelicopter cruiser Moskva has left the Mediterranean and is sailing in the Atlantic for the first time, a United States Sixth Fleet spokesman said today.

title: A Republican Borough Chief Continues to Fight City Hall
description: Shortly after 9:30 A.M. on a recent Tuesday, the dozen or so aides of Staten Island's Borough President, Robert T. Connor, entered his paneled office and gathered around a thick table.

title: Carb of Thanks
description: SIEGALThe family of the late Rachel Leah Siegal wishes to express sincere thanks and appreciation to their many friends who showed their sympathy during their hour of sorrow.

title: TRAVEL AILMENT TRACED TO GERM
description: A team of researchers says that it has detected a new strain of a common intestinal bacteria and that this strain caused diarrhea in a group of British soldiers flown from Britain to Aden, in the Middle East.

title: DUTCH BISHOPS ASK CELIBACY CHANGE
description: UTRECHT, the Netherlands, Tuesday, Jan. 20The eight Bishops of the Roman Catholic Church in the Netherlands said last night that there should be room in the church for both married priests and celibate priests.

title: Bronx Synagogue Damaged by Fire; Arson Is Suspected
description: A fire that the Fire Depart ment said was of suspicious origin caused extensive dam age late last night to the Congregation Ahavath Torah Synagogue at 170 East Mount Eden Avenue, The Bronx.

title: Three Oarsmen Get an Unscheduled Dunking in East River Race
description: Three National Boat Show oarsmen braved yesterday's cold in the hope of racing against a British team, but took a dip in the drink in stead.

title: SYNTEX DROPPING BIRTH PILL TESTS
description: Syntex Laboratories an nounced yesterday that it was suspending clinical tests of its minidose oral contraceptive pending further analysis of un usual changes in the breast tissue of dogs treated with the drug.

title: COURT ORDER ASKED IN TEACHERS' STRIKE
description: GARY, Ind., Jan. 19The Gary School Board asked a Superior Court today for a re straining order to halt a two weekold strike by 2,000 teachers'union members. The request followed a 12hour meeting yesterday that failed to produce a settlement.

title: Salt Lake City in Mourning After Mormon Chief's Death
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Jan. 19 This city was in semi official mourning today as Mormons and gentiles alike marked the death of 96year old David O. McKay, ninth president of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latterday Saints.

title: Powell Tells of Cancer Fight; Reaffirms Vow to Run Again
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19 (UPI) Representative Adam Clayton Powell, the Harlem Democrat, Mold colleagues today that he had been battling cancer for the better part of a year and that he believed he had won.

title: Bonn Lost 113 Starfighters
description: BONN, Jan. 19 (AP)West Germany has lost a total of 113 Starfighter jet planes since this country first flew them in 1961, the Government acknowledged for the first time today. By unofficial count, the 55 crew men have died in the accidents involving the Americande signed planes.

title: ARMY TURNS BACK FAIRLEIGH, 4438
Summer Clothes With Flair
description: WHILE hemlines are grimly tumbling down in Eu rope, summer started with a lighthearted bounce on Sev enth Avenue yesterday.

title: Bronx Heroin Treatment Unit Gets Summons
description: A private Bronx treatment center for adolescent heroin addicts has received a sum mons for violation of the new Building Code.

title: CONSPIRACY JURY HEARS EXU.S. AIDE
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 19  A for mer highranking Justice De partment official testified to day that the department made unsuccessful efforts to get Chi cago officials to negotiate with demonstrators prior to the 1968 Democratic National Conven tion here.

title: Congress Ready for Test Today As Senate Opens Priority Fight
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19The 91st Congress began an elec tionyear session on a conten tious note today as Senate Democrats squared off with the Administration for a battle of national priorities.

title: The Consumer Acts to Beat Inflation
description: In San Diego, Mrs. Carmen Gilman regularly drives 15 miles south of the city to cross the Mexican border and do her shopping in Tijuana. Like a growing num ber of other San Diego house wives, she makes the trip to take advantage of lower Mexican food prices. Hus bands occasionally go along to get a less expensive haircut.

title: PRICES ON AMEX CONTINUE TO DROP
