description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 Reu ters  The Senate Mapority Leader, Mike Mansfield of Mon tanto, said today that he would continue to press for reduction of United States troop strength in Europe, despite a counterat tack yesterday by the Nixon Administration.

title: Theater: A Double Bill With Promise
description: THE Playwrights Unit has moved to Broadway. Well, not quite, but this organiza tion, founded in 1961 and now directed by Richard Barr, Edward Albee and Charles Woodward, has opened a two week engagement at the ANTA Theater with a double bill of plays by Philip Mag dalanv.

title: LONDON PLANNING BIG BOXSHIP PORT
description: LONDON, Jan. 21  The Port of London Authority, which manages 2,700 acres of docks and warehouses along the Thames River, today an nounced a fiveyear develop ment plan that would close half of its 108 generalcargo berths. The anticipated growth of con tainer traffic was the reason given for the move.

title: Miss Nancy H. Rogers Affianced
description: DARIEN, Conn., Jan. 21 Mr. and Mrs. Sydney Har wood Rogers have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Nancy Howell Rogers, to Lieut. E. Bloxom Baker, U.S.A., son of Mrs. Marjorie Credo Baker of Princeton, N. J. and Nantuck et, Mass., and Elias B. Baker of New York and Little Silver, N. J.

title: ALAN S. DOWNER, 57, ACTOR AND TEACHER
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Jan. 21 Alan S. Downer, professor of English at Princeton University and author of books on the the ater, died yesterday at Prince ton Hospital after a short ill ness. He was 57 years old and lived at 294 Nassau Street here.

title: BRITISH IMPORT CURB IS ACCEPTED BY I.M.F.
description: GENEVA, Jan. 21The Inter national Monetary Fund cau tiously approved today Brit ain's continued penalizing of importers to strengthen her bal ance of payments.

title: HARRISINTERTYPE TELLS OF HOE OFFER
description: George S. Dively, chairman of the HarrisIntertype Corpora tion, of Cleveland, testified in Federal Court here yesterday about his company's offer to take over printing operations of R. Hoe & Co. in proceedings, for reorganization of the New Yorkbased maker of printing presses.

title: STOCKS ADVANCE; A.T. & T. UNTRADED
description: American Telephone, which unveiled the largest corporate financing in history, did not trade yesterday as the general market posted a modest ad vance.

title: Redistricting in the Dark
description: Call it redistricting or call it gerrymandering, the new Congressional lines designed by the Republican leadership in Albany are highly partisan, yet sup posedly drawn in the name of oneman, onevote. The plan to railroad new districts through the State Legislature at the last moment allowed by a Federal court order has much to do with gaining Republican seats and little to do with giving fair representation to the voters of New York.

title: NATHAN DRETZIN
description: Nathan Dretzin, a founder of WorldWide Volkswagen Corporation, died yesterday in his home at 101 Central Park West. He was 68 years old.

title: Con Ed Told to Name Those Who Approved Pacts Under Inquiry
description: Consolidated Edison was di rected yesterday to give the Public Service Commission the names of it executives who ap proved construction contracts involved in bidrigging exposed a grand jury.

title: Mayor Gives $100 to Pay For Damage to a Temple
description: Mayor Lindsay presented his personal check for $100 last night to the spiritual leader of an Orthodox Jew ish temple in the Bronx which was badly damaged last Monday in a fire be lieved to have been set by vandals.

title: ...and on Foreign Policy
description: President Nixon's promise of a separate State of the World report to Congress may explain in part why he limited his foreignpolicy comments to gener alities. But, in that case, it is puzzling why he gave the subject 1,000 words of platitudes and optimistic predictions of peace in our time, skimming over some of the grimmer realities that face the United States.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Sidewinder on Display For SpeedMinded Fan
description: A pair of Super Side winders, high performance boats with low profiles, are on display for speedminded visitors at the Arrow Marine exhibit at the boat show. The boats look fast and built for water skiing or racing. For those of limited buying power who like their boat ing at top speed, there's the new Super Sidewinder 16, which takes an outboard engine of up to 1,50 horse power. The model retails for about $1,800. A stern drive version is also available.

title: Gas Fume Emergency Ends
description: DICKINSON, W. Va. Jan. 22 (UPI)Hundreds of persons re turned to their homes today after being evacuated in near zero temperatures when a huge tank car filled with lethal ammonia ruptured, releasing acrid fumes. More than 20 per sons were treatedd at hospitals after breathing the fumes last night but most of them were quickly released. A few elder ly persons, held for observa tion, were reported in satisfac torv condition.

title: School Draft Advisers Urged By Education Board Member
description: The Board of Education isi considering a proposal by one Of its members to have full time draft counselors in each of the city's 91 high schools.

title: DISTRICTING PLAN FOR STATE PASSED BY 1VOTE MARGIN
description: ALBANY, Jan. 22The State Senate and Assembly ap proved a Republican Congres sional redistricting plan today after seven hours of interparty wrangling that ended when convalescent Senator was rushed to the Capitol to cast the deciding vote.

title: BOAT BUILDING BIG IN A SMALL TOWN
description: A small South Jersey town has received a new resurgence of life due to its booming boat industry during the last 10 years.

title: Gonzales: Hoad Toughest Rival When He Wanted to Be
description: In reflecting on more than two decades of quality ten nis, Richard (Pancho) Gon zales chose Lew Hoad, one of his many Australian rivals, as probably the best and toughest player when he wanted to be of all his fa mous opponents.

title: Boat Show Sets Course For Another Record Run
description: In spite of subfreezing cold and slippery snow outside, in spite of tight money and cramped space inside and in spite of a lack of anything exceptionally new, the 60th National Boat Show, which opens to the public tomorrow at 10 A.M. at the Coliseum, geared itself for a ninth straight recordproducing run.

title: Former Tax Agent Guilty In $3,000 Bribe Charge
description: A former Internal Revenue Service agent was found guilty by a Federal Court jury in Brooklyn late Wednesday night of receiving a $3,000 bribe to refrain from further tax exam ination of several related Long Island corporations.

title: Schaffer Is Promoted By Bertram Yachts
description: Paul Schaffer, executive vice president of the Bertram Yacht Corporation since 1967, has been named acting president of the Miami boat building firm. He succeeds Peter Rittmaster.

title: India Names Envoy to U.S.
description: NEW DELHI, Jan. 22 (AP) The Indian Government an nounced today the appointment of Lakshmi Kant Jha, 56, gov ernor of the Reserve Bank of India and a career civil servant, as India's Ambassador to the United States. The present Am bassador, Nawab Ali Jawar Jung, is returning home to be come governor of Maharashtra State.

title: Philharmonic And Bernstein Play Wagner
description: Leonard Bernstein goes from opera to opera, from Wagner to Wagner, and it is an interesting journey to keep track of. This season his first three appearances in New York have been conducting Mascagni's Cavalleria Rus ticana at the Metropolitan Opera and, with the New York Philharmonic, concert versions of Beethoven's Fi delio and excerpts from Wagner's Gtterdm merung.

title: Safety Guide Is Available To Small Boat Operators
description: A Safety Primer for Pleas ure Boat Operators, available from the National Association of Engine and Boat Manufactur ers, is a guide to safe equip ping and operation of small craft. It covers most of the ba sics of small boat handling and is suited for use in instruc tional programs.

title: ROCKLAND DEMOCRAT OPPOSING LEFKOWITZ
description: District Attorney Robert R. Meehan, the first Democrat to win that office in Rockland County in 54 years, announced yesterday that he was a Demo cratic candidate for Attorney General this year.

title: MODULAR CONCEPT WILL REDUCE COST
description: A new concept in boat build ingthreepiece modular con struction of fiberglass run aboutscan reduce manufac turing costs by as much as 15 per cent and eliminate interior maintenance for the owner, according to manufacturers.

title: New Paint Said to Resist Heat Up to 1,200 Degrees
description: Paint for objects that must withstand tremendous tempera tures charcoal grills, stoves, heaters, manifolds, mufflers, hi bachisis now available in spray cans.

title: Store Sales Increase
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 The Department of Commerce reported today that total re tail store sales for the week ended Jan. 17 were an esti mated $6.02billion, 1 per cent above the $5.9billion sales for the corresponding week of last year. Department stores sales for the Latest week were an es timated $562million, 9 per cent above the $515million sales for the corresponding week last year.

title: Gasoline Engines Maintaining Pace With 101 Margin
description: About 707,000 gasoline and diesel inboard engines were in use during 1969, according to estimates released by recrea tional boating industry sources.

title: Allis '69 Net Seen At $1.50 a Share After a Loss in '68
description: The AllisChalmers Manufac turing Company expects to re port earnings of about $1.50 a share for 1969, David D. Scott, president and chairman, said at the company's annual meeting in Milwaukee yesterday.

title: New President Is Elected By Delta Air Lines, Inc
description: Delta Air Lines, Inc., named W. T. Beebe yesterday as the carrier's president. He had been senior vice presidentadminis tration.

title: COCACOLA SEEKS A DESALTING UNIT
description: The CocaCola Company de cided yesterday to move out side the grocery products field through a merger with Aqua Chem, Inc., a manufacturer of equipment for desalting sea and brackish water.

title: Bohm, for First Time This Year, Conducts the Met in Hollander
description: One of the nicest things about the Metropolitan Opera's revival of Wagner's Der Flie gende Hollnder last night was the hearty applause given to the conductor, Karl Bhm, when he stepped on the podium before the opera began. He is a principal adornment of the Metropolitan conducting staff, and his first appearance here this season was, therefore, welcome event.

title: British School Is Training Site for Sailing Enthusiasts
description: Britain's National Sailing Center, situated on the River Medina at Cowes, Isle of Wight, with access to the waters of the Solent, was opened by the Duke of Edin burgh last May as a training ground for boating enthusi asts, from novices to poten tial instructors.

title: Dartmouth Names Hendrick To Coach Lacrosse Team
description: HANOVER, N.H., Jan. 22 Dudley F. Hendrick, who gained allAmerica recognition as a member of three national champion lacrosse teams at the United States Naval Academy, was named today head coach of lacrosse at Dartmouth.

title: Too Quiet on Potomac, Race Seeks Unlimiteds
description: Officials of the President's Cup Regatta would like to see unlimited hydroplane racing return to the Potomac River this year.

title: CLIFFORD ROLE FIRST FOR MERRILL ASHLEY
description: It scarcely matters at this point that John Clifford spelled ACB instead of ABC with the movement blocks he in herited from George Balanchine in his first major ballet, Stra vinsky Symphony. Now en sconced as part of the New York City Ballet repertory, the piece has a raw veracity that poses its own problems. The lead girl in the fourth move ment was danced last night at the State Theater for the first time by Merrill Ashley.

title: Gov. Kirk Tells a Federal Judge He'll Fight Early Desegregation
description: MIAMI, Jan. 22  Florida's Gov. Claude R. Kirk Jr. reaf firmed in Federal Court today his intention to issue an execu tive order to block further de segregation of the state's public schools.

title: In Memoriam
description: CANTONH. J. Jan. 23, 1964. In loving memory.

title: More Boats Sunday
description: The New York Times will publish on Sunday a special 36page supplement contain ing additional Boat Show news and information of general interest ??

title: Mrs. Dillonbeck a Winner
description: FRANKLIN LAKES, N. J., Jan. 22  Mrs. Gloria Dillon beck of Montclair, N. J., and Mrs. B. J. DeBree of Rumson, N. J, won the New Jersey women's piatform tennis cham pionship today, defeating the Short Hills team of Mrs. Char lotte Cox and Mrs. Odin Cox, 64, 64, at the Indian Trial Club.

title: RALPH STANG OFFERS AMBITIOUS PROGRAM
description: You do need a voice to sing a song recital, despite the evi dence to the contrary that is continually being offered. And Ralph Stang, who offered a tremendously enterprising and ambitious program last night at Carnegie Recital Hall, does have a voice, though on this, occasion it sounded seriously out of sorts.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: French Arms to Arabs

title: Jesse Snead and Sheppard Gain in MatchPlay Tourney
description: PALM BEACH GARDENS, Fla., Jan. 22 (AP)Jesse Snead of White Sulphur Springs, W. Va., defeated Stan Thirsk of Overland Park, Kan., 1 up, today in the opening round of the Professional Golfers' Asso ciation match play champion ship.

title: FIGURES CONTRADICT NIXON ON INFLATION
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22  In his State of the Union Ad dress, President Nixon said to day that the nineteensixties had brought the greatest in crease in inflation and the greatest social unrest in Amer ica in 100 years. But the Gov ernment's own statistics do not support the assertion about inflation.

title: Sports of The Times
description: THE ballots had been printed and the envelopes had been addressed. All was in readiness last monthor so it seemedto poll the tribunal of 1,000 sportsmen in the annual voting for the Sullivan Award, the highest honor for an amateur performer in this country. The list of candidates had been drawn up by the Amateur Athletic Union some time previously and the goof therein was monumental.

title: Carswell Reviews Copies of Paper He Edited From '46 to '48
description: IRWINTON, Ga., Jan. 22 Judge G. Harrold Carswell, Pres ident Nixon's nominee for the Supreme Court, last night re viewed newspaper articles he wrote 22 years ago.

title: The Newer Nixon ...
description: President Nixon's first State of the Union Message raises the question whether he is a reformer stuck with his party's tradition of financial caution or a financial conservative obliged by the times to raise an occasional banner of reform. Certainly the language was sprinkled with the phrases of the crusader break with tradition, new decade, new begin nings, great age of reform. At the same time he blamed the unbalanced budgets of the sixties for the current inflation and the personal indebtedness of mil lions of Americans, pledging that he would present a balanced budget for 1971 as the highest priority objective of responsible government.

title: Books of The Times
description: JERZY GROTOWSKI is not exactly con venient. Even the pilgrims have had trouble reaching him. His statesup ported Polish Laboratory Theatre lies even farther to the East than the shrine of the Berliner Ensemble. Westerners who do get to Wroclaw, where the theater was moved from Opole in 1965, find Grotowski distant and secretive, a priest at commu nion, and his per formances often sold out. During his visit to New York last fall, it was difficult even to learn where his troupe was play ing, let alone to see it. His public statements have been few and far between. His ideas are elusive and his rhetoric knotty, especially in trans lation. Altogether, and most untheat rically, he eschews the public. Yet there are rumors and indi cations and even eyewitness reports that what Grotowski is doing is the most im portant thing that is happening in Western theater today, that he is the natural heir to Stanislayski, Brecht and Artaud, that he, if anyone, will lead theater out of the wilder ness of celluloid and videotape that, now oppresses it. So it is with some appetite that one snatches up the statements, inter views, critiques and sundry documents con tained in this collection, Towards a Poor Theatre.

title: ELECTRONIC AIDS BOON TO SKIPPERS
description: Boating has increased tre mendously in popularity in re cent years and, at the same time, has become a lot safer than driving a car.

title: OUTBOARD ADVICE: CAVEAT EMPTOR
description: What should the outboard boat buyer look for? Here are some suggestions:

title: Winter Wonderland Is Found in North
description: When the first chill winds of fall and winter start icing the fringes of your pump kin, as well as your boat, you don't have to think about southern Florida, southern Texas, southern Cal ifornia or even Hawaii. That's only the conformist in you.

title: Winter Antiques Show Unveils Its Rarities Today
description: The Winter Antiques Show, which opens its 16th edition today, changes from year to year, but one factor remains constant  its overall high quality.

title: Boat Show Information : How to Reach Coliseum
description: HOURSShow opens to the public tomorrow, Jan. 24, at 10 A.M. Public hoursMon day, Jan. 26, through Friday, Jan. 30, noon to 10 P.M.; both Saturdays, 10 A.M. to 10 P.M.; both Sundays, 1 to 7 P.M.

title: PARENTSKIPPER A HELPFUL SOUL
description: Young children can be a drag or a delight on a weekend boat ing trip. The early years, which everyone seems to dread as far as babies and boats go are, contrary to popular belief the easiest. A suitable portable crib, a couple of jars of baby food and that everpresent bot tle, disposable diapers a few toys and you're all set. At this age they need very little.

title: Bridge:
description: With all four hands in view it is nearly always relatively simple to deter mine the best contract avail able for either side. One of the rare exceptions requiring more careful study is the diagramed deal, played Sun day in the Swiss Team Championship in the Tri State Regionals at Grossing er's.

title: U.S. Indicts 3 Union Aides in Newark
description: NEWARK, Jan. 22A former New Jersey Assemblyman who heads a Teamsters union local and two of his associates were indicted by a Federal grand jury today on charges of em bezzling union funds.

title: UpperClass Trainer Puts On No Airs, Only Those of Success
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Jan. 22 Neal Shapiro found room to sit on a cluttered table in a grubby tack room at Roose velt Raceway this morning. He was dressed no better or no worse than any other trainer with 11 head of all different class horses, none of them very good.

title: On 7th Ave., the Score Was 2 to 1 in Favor of Short Hemlines
description: UNLIKE so many design ers, I wear the clothes in the collection, Pauline Trigere began. About the longer ones, I don't like them.

title: JUDGE TO DIRECT MODEL CITIES HERE
description: Mayor Lindsay yesterday ap pointed a Family Court judge, Joseph B. Williams, to the new ly created post of Administra tor of the city's Model Cities Program.

title: Senate Rejects Moves to Alter Crime Control Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22The Senate beat down today two attempts to modify the new omnibus crime control bill, pressing for final passage of the stringent measure tomor row.

title: De Carlo Defense Rests Reluctantly
description: NEWARK, Jan. 22The de fense reluctantly rested today in the Federal conspiracy and extortion trial of Angelo (Gyp) De Carlo, reputed Mafia figure, after complaining that it had been unable to lind witnesses it wanted to subpoena.

title: Papp Resigns ANTA Posts, Citing Festival's Demands
description: Joseph Papp has resigned as president of the American Na tional Theater and Academy as well as from its board of direc tors. His decision, he said, was prompted by the extraor dinary demands made on my time and person by the Shake speare Festival Public Theater.

title: 38 SEIZED IN JERSEY IN NARCOTICS RAIDS
description: FREEHOLD. N. J., Jan. 22 In subzero darkness early to day 100 New Jersey state troopers, aided by policemen from nine Monmou?? County shore communities, arrested 35 men and three women in near ly, a dozen towns on charges of narcotics sale, use or pos session.

title: Boating Booklet Gives Information and Advice
description: Keeping Pleasure Boating Pleasant, a 24page booklet of advice and suggestions about small craft, is being offered to the public at no charge by State Farm Fire and Casualty Company.

title: REV. ROBERT A. PERRY
description: CATSKILL, N. Y., Jan. 22 The Rev. Robert Allen Perry, pastor of the First Dutch Re formed Church here, died to day at the Middlesex General Hospital, New Brunswick, N. J. after a brief illness. He was 31 nears old.

title: SKIS NEED CHECKING AFTER BUSY SEASON
description: If water skis were equipped with mileage counters, you'd probably be startled at how many miles you piled up last summer.

title: CARSWELL SPEECH MISSED IN CHECK
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22  The Nixon Administration did not know of the existence of the white supremacy speech by Judge G. Harrold Carswell when President Nixon named him to the Supreme Court, a Justice Department source said today.

title: PRICES ARE MIXED IN AMEX TRADING
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange ended mixed yerter day on moderate trading after profit taking erased some of the earlier gains.

title: At Pebble Beach, the Dancing Golfer Wanted No Rain
NIXON, STRESSING QUALITY OF LIFE, ASKS IN STATE OF UNION MESSAGE FOR BATTLE TO SAVE ENVIRONMENT
description: WASHINGTON, Jan 22 President Nixon committed him self and challenged the country today to rescue the American environment from years of hu man indifference and to display, in the decade ahead, a deeper concern for the quality of Amer ican life.

title: W. Va. Names Negro Coach
description: MORGANTOWN, W. Va., Jan. 22 (UPI)  Garrett Ford, the career leading rusher at West Virginia University, was appointed today an assistant coach on the Mountaineer foot ball staff. Ford, who becomes the first Negro coach in W. V. U. history, will be in charge of scouting and will help coach the running backs.

title: Druz Series for WNYE
description: WNYEFM, New York City's Board of Education radio sta tion, will begin a series of pro grams on drug use and abuse on Feb 2. The programs, a series of 88 called Report on the Drug Scene have been broadcast over WCBS Radio since last November.

title: Waldegaard, in Porsche, Takes Monte Carlo Rally for 2d Year
description: MONTE CARLO, Monaco, Fri day, Jan. 23 (AP)Bjorn Waldegaard and Lars Helmer roared to a predawn finish of the Monte Carlo auto rally in their West German Porsche to day to be declared the unof ficial winners.

title: Rockefeller Receives an Award At Fete Marking Printing Week
description: The Franklin Award for Dis tinguished Service was present ed to Governor Rockefeller last night at a dinner marking the observance of Printing Week.

title: Proposed Settlement Filed In Second MasterKey Suit
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 (UPI) The Justice Department an nounced today a second pro posed settlement of its four antitrust suits against the na tion's principal manufacturers of masterkey systems.

title: Tips on Giving First Aid in Emergency
description: Ask an amateur boatman about safety practices on the water and you'll likely get as an answer: Know the naviga tional rules of the road and keep your craft in shipshape condition. Forgotten all too fre quently is a necessary part of nautical knowledgehow to administer first aid.

title: ALBANY MAY ACT ON STORE RENTS
description: ALBANY, Jan. 22  State Senator Roy M. Goodman in troduced a bill today that would permit the New York City Council to control com mercial rent rates.

title: President Terms Prospect For Peace Much Improved
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22The prospects for peace Vietnam were described today by President Nixon as far greater than they were a year ago. He foresaw a good pros pect of a generation of unin terrupted peace for America.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: MARINE EQUIPMEN AND ACCESSORIES

title: NIGERIA INCREASES FUNDS FOR RELIEF
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Jan. 22 Maj. Gen. Yakubu Gowon, the head of Nigeria's military Gov ernment, declared today that his country could solve the gigantic problem of emer gency relief for the territory that was Biafra.

title: Schumann Asserts France Favors Britain in Market
description: LONDON, Jan. 22 (AP)For eign Minister Maurice Schu mann of France said today that France  along with the five other memberswanted Britain to join the Common Market.

title: Kadoda Outpoints Sok
description: TOKYO, Jan. 22 (AP)  Shi nichi Kadoda of Japan, 133 ?ounds, outpointed Sok Chong Ku of South Korea, 131, in a 10round bout tonight.

title: Clash Reported by Cairo
description: CAIRO, Jan. 22Egyptian troops were reported engaged in handtohand fighting today with an Israeli airborne force that landed on the island of Shadwan.

title: Some Menu Ideas For Weekend Chef
description: IN the menus below, dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: TESTS FIND STIMULI AID BRAIN GROWTH
description: Research by two California scientists has shown that the informationprocessing parts of the brain develop faster in ani mals that are handled, stroked, shaken, sung to and otherwise stimulated during the first days of life.

title: Doctor Says Birth Pills'
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22A British doctor said today that birth control pills had exten sive effects on the body sug gesting possible hazards re lated to several important diseases.

title: Essex Community College Closed in Student Protest
description: NEWARK, Jan. 22 (AP)Es sex County Community College was ordered closed today be cause of class boycott, picket ing and threats of a building takeover.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON DRIFT DOWNWARD
Auto Makers Report Sales Lag Of 17 Per Cent in MidJanuary
description: Sales of new cars produced in this country continued to lag behind last year's pace during the middle of January, the four major United States manufacturers reported yester day. Retail deliveries in the period from Jan. 11 to 20 were 152,618 units, a drop of 17 per cent from 184,148 sales in the comparable period of 1969. The two periods had the same number of selling days

title: SAILING IN ARCTIC DESOLATE DELIGHT
description: An adventurous former pro fessor and his wife, who live in Manhattan and love to sail in the lonely and desolate Arctic, are planning another voyage that will take them far into northern waters for the fifth time.

title: TV: The Networks Assess the President's Message
description: THE TELEVISION networks engaged yesterday in instant and careful analysis of President Nixon's State of the Union Message continu ing a tradition that preceded Vice President Agnew's out burst over immediate com mentary on a Presidential address.

title: Hearing Set in Murder Case
description: KANSAS City, Mo., Jan. 22 (UPI)A closed hearing is scheduled Feb. 4 to determine whether the trial of John Col lins, accused of murdering a coed at Eastern Michigan Uni versity, should be moved to another county for trial.

title: AIRSWT CONCEPT EASES POUNDING
description: Southern Florida has held the reins of the pleasureboat in dustry production for many years, with Miami and Biscayne Bay emerging as dominant and thriving locations for boating enthusiasts.

title: RAIL TONMILEAGE SHOWS 2.7% DROP
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 Freight traffic on United States railroads and intercity truck tonnage in the week ended Jan. 17 were both below the volume in the corresponding week of last year.

title: CARRIER RAISES PRICE OF AIRCONDITIONERS
description: Citing higher costs, the Car rier Corporation announced yes terday that its airconditioning divisions would increase prices by 3 per cent to 5 per cent on a wide range of aircondi tioning products.

title: Appeals Court Blocks A CoralReefs Nation
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 22 (AP)A Federal appeals court upheld today a decision dashing fantastic plans to set up a sovereign nation on two coral reefs four miles off Florida's coast.

title: EGYPTIAN ISLAND REPORTED SEIZED BY ISRAELI FORCE
description: JERUSALEM, Friday, Jan. 23 An Israeli task force led by helicopterborne commandos yesterday captured the Egyp tian island of Shadwan, at the entrance to the Gulf of Suez, and prepared to remove its radar station, the Israelis re ported.

title: New Model Cities Chief
description: WHEN Family Court Judge I Joseph B. Williams was asked what his old position had in common with his new one as the city's Model Cities Administrator, he said:

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, JANUARY 23, 1970

title: Sunfish Attains World Status
description: Sunfish, the bright little boats that sparkle in har bors around the world, have graduated to new honors: their first world champion ship and recognition by name on a foreign postage stamp.

title: A Republican Enters Race For Governorship in Texas
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Jan. 22 (AP) Paul Eggers, general counsel for the United States Treasury De partment, announced today his candidacy for Governor.

title: Another Folk Singer Silenced By Judge at Conspiracy Trial
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 22  Songs and movements have no place in the Chicago conspiracy trial, Judge Julius J. Hoffman ruled today.

title: White House Books Uncut 1776
description: The Broadway hit musical 1776 will be given in its entirety at a special com mand performance for Presi dent and Mrs. Nixon and guests on Washington's Birthday in the East Room of the White House.

title: IslandHopping in the Grenadines a Magnetic Cruise
description: GRENADA, British West Indies  The TV commercial for an airline exhorts:

title: Washington: For the Record
8 BUS LINES WIN FARE RISE TO 25C
description: Eight private bus companies, with operations in four bor oughs, were authorized by the Board of Estimate yesterday to raise their basic fare from 20 cents to 25 cents at 12:01 A.M. Sunday.

title: An Unpredictable Factor
description: Every summer for five years a credibility gap has grown: The difference between the weather report and the weather is enough to stir up a storm.

title: Peru Fines U.S. Tuna Boat After Charge of Incursion
description: LIMA, Peru, Jan. 22 (Reuters)  A United States tuna boat was arrested and fined yester day for fishing inside the 200 mile territorial waters Claimed by Peru, the Navy Ministry an nounced today.

title: FLA. STATE ROUTS CLEMSON, 12280
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Jan. 22 (AP) Led by Dave Cowens, Florida State hit a season high tonight as the Seminoles downed the Clemson five, 122 80.

title: U.S. Denies Charge
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 State Department officials de nied today a charge by De fense Minister Michael Debre that the United States had of fered to sell military equipment to the new Government in Libya.

title: Seattle Franchise on the Brink, With Dallas Likely to Catch It
description: BELEAGUERED baseball's second front, the Seattle franchise war, flared yester day with a report that the American League had ap proved a transfer of the Pilots to DallasFort Worth and another that the Pilots would become the Milwaukee Brewers by the end of the week.

title: Petraglia Holds 51Pin Lead For 3 Rounds in Las Vegas
description: LAS VEGAS, Jan. 22 (UPI) Averaging 235 pins a game, Johnny Petraglia of Brooklyn moved into the lead after three rounds today in the $77,777.77 Show Boat invitation bowling tournament.

title: Sinatra Out of Political Fete
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 (AP) Frank Sinatra has canceled an appearance as master of ceremonies at a Democratic fundraising event in Miami Beach on Feb. 5, a party spokes man said today. Sammy Davis Jr. will replace him, the spokes man said. A change in sites from the Miami Beach audito rium to the Fontainebleau Ho tel apparently created problems involving Mr. Sinatra's parti cipation because of contractual commitments involving other hotels.

title: Pearson: Oak From Acorn
description: Any resemblance be tween the role of Pearson Yachts in this year's Boat Show and that of its appear ance at the 1959 marine shnocase is absolutely mon umental.

title: Murder Charges Filed
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 22A Gov ernment attorney said today that Joseph A. Yablonski was murdered by three Cleveland men to keep the rebel mine union leader from testifying before a Federal grand jury.

title: Oil Prevents Trouble Afloat
description: Proper mixture of oil and fuel is essential to obtain good performance from your out board motor. Using less than the recommended proportion of oil may result in serious mo tor damage due to insufficient lubrication. Using more than the recommended proportion of oil will cause sparkplug foul ing, erratic carburetion and excessive smoking.

title: The Great Slob Society
description: The ecological changes in our marine life have an ef fect on boating as well as living. From barnacles to eel grass and other earlywarn tag systems of marine life, the message is: The Great Slob Society has to go.

title: City Offers Free Help In Computing Taxes
description: New York City taxpayers can obtain free help in filling out their income tax forms.

title: POP TAIL, $297.80, SCORES ON A FOUL
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 22 (AP)A disqualification en abled Pop Tail, a 6yearold mare that hadn't won a race in five months, to become the longestpriced winner in Penn sylvania thoroughbred history at Liberty Bell race track to day. Pop Tail paid $297.80 to win.

title: Soviet Journalists Stuck in Elevator In Chicago City Hall
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 22 (AP)  Eleven Soviet newsmen, on their way to visit Mayor Rich ard J. Daley today, got trapped in a City Hall elevator.

title: BUSINESS LEADERS HAIL NIXON GOALS
description: The business community re acted favorably yesterday to President Nixon's State of the Union Message, particularly to his plan to present a balanced budget for the next fiscal year.

title: NEWPORT TURNING TO 18TH CENTURY
description: Imagine an 18th century wa terfrontship chandlers, a cou ple of square riggers with spreading yards, cobbled streets, granite walls, lobsters, tavern.

title: Commuters in Tragicomedy
description: SCENE: A cold, damp Penn Central train that left Katonah, N. Y., at 7:45 A.M. The train lumbers toward Chappaqua.

title: Where the Real Beautiful Meet the Real Great
description: The Real Beautiful Society picked its way through the garbagedappled snow on East Seventh Street last night to the home base of the Real Great Societyor, as it is now called, the Uni versity of the Streets.

title: Prague Party Unit Urges An Inquiry on 11 Liberals
description: VIENNA, Jan. 22The Cen tral Control and Auditing Com mission of the Czechoslovak Communist party announced to day that it had recommended fresh investigations of 11 party members on charges of right wing opportunistic, meaning liberal, activism.

title: FirstAid Kit Is Geared For Variety of Ailments
description: Reflecting increased em phasis on safety and first aid afloat, leading boat manufac turers at the show are display ing a specially designed ma rine first aid kit as accessory equipment.

title: Fred E. Kimmerly Is Dead; Manager at Union Carbide
description: Fred E. Kimmerly, manager of the computer network in the data processing department of the Union Carbide Corporation, collapsed and died yesterday at 47th Street and Fifth Avenue. He was 49 years old and lived at 391 North Ridge Street in Rye, N. Y.

title: OLD BOATS SOUGHT FOR SPECIAL RACE
description: LONG BEACH, Calif.  For more than a month, the search has been going on in musty corners of boathouses all along the West Coast for old time racers and excursion craft eligible to compete Feb. 78 in an unusual classic boats grand prix from Long Beach Harbor to Catalina Island and back.

title: British Accents Take Charge Of Boatyard on Fourth Floor
description: Visit the fourth floor of the Coliseum and you will find yourself in what might be a British boatyard  surround ed by Westerlys, Vivacitys and Romanys; by the designs of Laurent Giles, Ian Proctor and Alan Gurney; as well as by a variety of accents from around the British Isles.

title: BUCKS TURN BACK ROCKETS, 115106
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 22 (AP) Elvin Hayes fouled out on the final play of the third period but outscored Lew Alcindor, 2927, tonight in their second Astrodome showdown as Al cindor's Milwaukee Bucks de feated the San Diego Rockets, 115106.

title: Automatic Disposal System Triggered by Boat's Engine
description: New on the market is a wastedisposal system for cabin cruisers, sport fishermen and auxiliaries that attaches to the conventional toilet now in use and works off the boat's engine.

title: Summer Cruise Among Events Listed for Multihull Association
description: Members of the Multihull Cruising Assocation have scheduled several major races of their own for the 1970 sea son.

title: Anonymously Backed Bail Refused in Bomb Case Here
description: Federal Judge Milton Pollack refused to accept a $100,000 hail bond yesterday for Samuel J. Melville, indicted on charges of conspiring to bomb Federal facilities.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Wildfowl Lair
BRUINS' LATE GOAL TIES FLYERS, 3 TO 3
description: BOSTON, Jan. 22 (UPI) Phil Esposito's goal with only 6 seconds remaining tonight) enabled the Bruins to tie the Philadelphia Flyers, 33, and extended Boston's unbeaten record against expansion clubs to 23 names over two seasons.

title: NEW SAFETY BILL WIDELY DEBATED
description: Out of the more than 100 ma jor bills related to consumer protection introduced into the 91st session of the United States Congress during 1969, two ma jor boating bills emerged, the recreational boating safety, measure and the omnibus water pollution control bill.

title: Monetary Base Growth Pace Continues Brisk for Recent Months
Henry Luhrs's Sons To Operate Own Yard
description: John and Warren Luhrs, heirs to an honored boat building legacy, are branch ing out on their own.

title: Battery Recharge Is Vital During Nonsailing Months
description: What can you do with the boat battery during the winter months when it's out of use? Best bet is store it at a marine or service station where it can be hooked onto a trickle charger, which maintain it in fully charged condition at at all times and yet not over charge it.

title: CHURCH UNIT ASKS BROAD LABOR LAW
description: TULSA, Okla., Jan. 22The National Council of Churches called on Congress and the various state legislatures today to permit public employes and the employes of nonprofit hos pitals to organize and bargain collectively under the protec tion of the National Labor Re lations Act.

title: THEY VARY WIDELY IN SIZE AND SCOPE
description: More and more boating en thusiasts are spending their free time on weekends and va cations under sail. Although it is conservatively estimated that there are more than 350, 000 sailboats in use today, there are many more buffs who go sailing regularly even though they don't own a sailboat.

title: Memorial Services
description: COLLESANONatale L. In memory of my dear brother Natele L. Collesano, there will be a second anniversary Mass Saturday, Jan. 24, at St. Peter's Church, Staten Is land, Mr. Collesano was an official Inter preter at the State Supreme Court in New York for 35 yrs. and was also a graduate of the New York Law School.

title: SINKING FEELING EASY TO ACHIEVE
description: It had been an almost ideal July Sunday, even if his sister Mabel had invited herself. Steve, four of her six kids and a couple of ringers she said were the kids' best friends. Of course, his brotherinlaw was well on his way toward his usual weekend oblivion and really shouldn't be steering.

title: Democrats Ask for Specifics but Praise the Goals
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22  President Nixon's State of the Union Message was widely re garded on Capitol Hill today as a skillful political speech that seized the political high ground and took electionyear issues away from a Democratic Con gress.

title: DELAY LAID TO U.S. ON FAT IN HOT DOG
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 Senator Abraham A. Ribicoffl accused the Agriculture De partment today of secretly undermining its order limiting the fat content of hot dogs. He produced the text of a depart mental memorandum as evi dence.

title: ... on Inflation ...
description: President Nixons address was remarkable for the way he finessed any real discussion of current eco nomic problems. He declared that no action would be more beneficial for the country than stopping the upsurge in the cost of living. But the beginning and end of his prescription for accomplishing this was a reduction in Federal expenditures to balance the budget.

title: CONVERSION EASY FOR SPORTFISHING
description: Anyone with $40,000 or so to spare can get just what he wants in the way of a fishing boattuna tower, mechanized fighting chairs, radar, the works.

title: Social Work Award Given
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va., Jan. 22The Council on Social Work Education yesterday conferred its Distinguished Service Award, for volunteer service in social work educa tion and social welfare prac tice, on Henry N. Sachs, secre tary of the council's board of directors. The award was pre sented at the council's annual meeting by James R, Dumpson dean of the School of Social Service, Fordham University.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: Protecting the School Vote
description: Maximum citizen involvement is vital to the reform of the school system; and the dismally small turnout in these early days of voter registration for the city's first community school board elections is a grave dis appointment. Only through active participation by all parents and teachers can the election of broadly repre sentative district boards become a reality.

title: Met Shares as Bori Fund Is Disbursed
description: The Metropolitan Opera and eight organizations here and abroad will share in grants totaling nearly half a million dollars as the result of final distribution of the assets of the Lucrezia Bori Foundation.

title: Foreign Affairs: Who Won and Who Lost?
description: PARIS  Among nonAfrican powers the only clearcut win ner in the Nigerian civil war was Britain and the only clearcut loser was France. Russia gained while the fighting was on and its prestige is currently very high but this will probably diminish as construction suc ceeds destruction.

title: Market Place
description: WHEN S. Robert Fleer joined Shields & Co. as a regis tered representative six and a half years ago, he had a background of more than 20 years of trading for his own accountbyplay during a ca reer in the textile business.

title: A Calendar for the Boat Show
description: TODAYAmerican Boat Builders and Repairers Association an nual meeting, New York Athletic Club, 59th and Seventh, 8:30 A.M.; National Association of Engine and Boat Manufacturers annual meeting, Essex House, Central Park South, 4 P.M.; Na tional Association of Engine and Boat Manufacturers annual din ner, Essex House, reception, P.M., dinner, 7:15 P.M. (By in vitation only.); Society of Small Craft Designers dinner and meet ing, Holiday Inn, West 57th St., 6:30 P.M.

title: 2 STREETS HERE HIT BY POWER BLACKOUT
description: A power blackout darkened 67th and part of 66th Streets between Columbus Avenue and Central Park West for several hours last night and today, cut ting off electrical service to half a dozen large apartment buildings, most of the Hotel des Artistes, and a number of offices at WABCTV.

title: La Mama Play to ANTA
description: The Off Broadway La Mama Experimental Theater Club pro duction of Julie Bovasso's Glo ria and Esperanza will move briefly to Broadway on Feb. 4, when it opens a twoweek run at the ANTA Theater, 245 West 52d Street. Its engagement is part of the series of regional, repertory and experimental theater companies being spon sored by the American National Theater and Academy, in asso ciation with the National Coun cil on the Arts.

title: Narnath Tells Franchise Inquiry Business Isn't a Passing Fancy
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22  The New York Jets' quarter back, Joe Namath, testified be fore a Senate subcommittee to day that he was one celebrity who was in the franchise busi ness to stay.

title: MacGregor Yachts Offers Its New Venture 22 Sloop
description: The MacGregor Yacht Cor poration is introducing a new Venture 22 sloop and also showing its Venture 24. Both boats are of fiberglass with re tractable keels and outboard rudders.

title: Dining Out: Best Italian Food Around?
description: A selective list of restau rants in New York and vicinity is given on this page on Friday. The restaurants are rated four stars to none, based on the relationship of food and service to cost. Credit cards are honored in the restaurants where indi cated.

title: VESSEL'S ENGINEER GUILTY OF DRINKING
description: LONG BEACH, Calif.. Jan. 23 (UPI)  The chief engineer of the S.S. Connecticut, which al most sank in heavy seas Jan. 9, was found guilty today of drinking while the vessel was imperiled.

title: HERBERT HARGRAVE, DACHAU PROSECUTOR
description: Herbert W. J. Hargrave, one of the prosecutors at the war crimes trial at Dachau, Ger many, died yesterday at his home after a long illness. He was 72 years old and lived at 24 Beech Road, Islip, L. I.

title: Superstition Traced To Calling Boats She
description: Why is a boat called she? If you think, writes Alan P. Major of Nautical Maga zine, knowing the reputa tion of sailors, the reason is attraction of the sexes, you are partly correct.

title: Flocks of Snow Geese Find Protection Where Blackbeard Met His Doom
description: OCRACOKE ISLAND, N. C. Ducks and geese, or fowl as they are called locally, were plentiful all along Ocracoke Island and northward up the Cape Hat teras National Seashore, but were either out of range or not legal game.

title: MISS ROTHENBERGER PLEASES IN LIEDER
description: Anneliese Rothenberger, who sang at Tully Hall last night, is the kind of soprano who leads with her voice, not her mannerisms, and whose clear, unforced enunciation and thoughtful musicianship makes everything she does a delight to hear.

title: Suspect, 16, Found Suicide By Hanging in Cell Upstate
description: ROCHESTER, Jan. 22A 16 yearold prisoner awaiting trial on charges of burglary and petty larcency was found dead today in his cell in the Monroe County fail here.

title: Pro Basketball
description: AT CHICAGO

title: TEACHERS STRIKE IN EAST BRUNSWICK
description: EAST BRUNSWICK, N. J., Jan. 22Teachers struck this city's 15 public schools today in a dispute similar to the one that led last week to walkout by Passaic teachers.

title: Stove and a Canvas Cabin Aboard Grumman Canoe
description: A 20foot cruising canoe, complete with head, stove and a canvas cabin, is a novelty of the National Boat Show.

title: Plane Deal With Libyans Evokes Shock in France
description: PARIS, Jan. 22The disclo sure that France is selling Libya not 50 but 100 warplanes drew the all but anamious con demnation of the press today, including newspapers normally friendly to the Government. The feeling of having been de ceived was as evident as con cern about what was widely assailed as a cynical policy, putting oil and trade above peace and morality.

title: U.S.Warns Gouverneur Health Center of Aid Cut
description: A feud between Lower East Side community groups and the Gouverneur health center is jeopardizing the continuation of Federal support, a Federal official warned yesterday.

title: FULL SPEED AHEAD FOR AMERICA'S CUP
description: The sweat and toil at sea and the heady triumphs and deep disappointments of the world's foremost sailing event, a match for the America's Cup, lie months ahead, but for now there is work and plan ning enough in preparations.

title: Daughter in Soviet Told About Miss Alliluyeva
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 22 (AP) Svetlana Alliluyeva's daugh ter expressed surprise at the news that her mother, the daughter of Stalin, has been deprived of Soviet citizen ship.

title: ST. LOUIS ERASES EARLY 21 DEFICIT
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 22Persist ence paid off for the St. Louis Blues in their National Hockey League game with the New York Rangers tonight. Outskat ed, outshot and outscored in the early stages of the clash, the home forces nevertheless carried the play to their favored rivals and came through with a 43 victory.

title: John von Wicht, Painter, Dead; His Works in Leading Museums
description: John von Wicht, an abstract expressionist whose paintings are included in the collections of several American and Eu ropean museums, died Tues day night at his home, 35 Clark Street, Brooklyn. His age was 81.

title: Hennessy Grand Prix Changes Course, Base
description: The Hennessy New York Grand Prix, an ocean power boat race that grew out of the Around Long Island Mar athon, will undergo more changes this year.

title: The Met Museum Provides a Setting For Tharp Dance
description: Granted that the dance avantgarde's current experi ments with spatial environment follow the halfcenturyold footsteps of Isadora Duncan, an expert at exploring the pos sibilities of great lawns and palaces built by Louis XIV. It is nonetheless disappointing to see a previously disciplined and original talent such as Twyla Tharp lose control of the per forming situationas occurred last night in the Metropolitan Museum's Great Hall, left alcove, main staircase and Blumenthal Patio.

title: MARLOWE YACHT RIGGED AS KETCH
description: DEER PARK, L. I.One of the largest sailing yachts to be built on Long Island in many years is rapidly taking shape in a 50,000square foot indus trial plant near the Deer Park Airport.

title: Refiner's Income Drops 6.1% for the Year
description: Texaco, Inc. ended 1969 with the smallest decrease in earn ings in the fourth quarter over the previous three periods and consolidated net income for the year was down 6.1 per cent to $769,804,000. or $2.83 a share, from $819,646,000, or $3.02 a share, in 1968.

title: CREALY CONQUERS SMITH AT SYDNEY
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Jan. 22 (AP)  Dick Crealy, a second stringer on the Australian Da vis Cup team, upset Stan Smith of Pasadena, Calif., the United States' No. 1 player, today in the Australian and New South Wales tennis championships.

title: Mary Heathcote, Ballet Student, Is Engaged to Norman B. Pinto
description: CHESTER SPRINGS, Pa. Jan. 22Miss Mary Stewart Heathcote, a student at the Royal Ballet School in Lon don, and Norman Bruce Pinto, who is studying English and theater at Yankton (S. D.) College, plan to be married.

title: Students Flock to Philadelphia School Without Walls
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 21  About a year ago, amid great fanfare, high hopes and some skepticism, the Philadelphia school system initiated one of the nation's boldest experi ments in public education, the Parkway Program, in which high school students choose their own subjects of study and use the city's institutions and businesses as class rooms.

title: MAYOR IS CLEARED ON ETHICS CHARGE
description: Mayor Lindsay and a West Side movie studio, where campaign fundraising party was held for him last October, were both cleared of any im propriety by the Board of Eth ics yesterday.

title: SENATORS' DEBATE ON LAOS CENSORED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 (AP) Excerpts from a secret Senate. debate on Laos were published today, but heavy censorship, kept from the record the ex tent of United States involve ment in aerial combat there and the number of American casualties.

title: Transcript of the President's State of the Union Message to Joint Session of Congress
description: Following is a transcript of President Nixon's State of the Union Message to Congress yesterday, as recorded by The New York Times:

title: Connecticut Political Fever Turns Out to Be Catching
description: NEW HAVEN, Jan. 22 From bigcity wards to back country Assembly Districts, Connecticut is in the grip of political fever.

title: Metal Producer Sets Record Results
description: The Aluminum Company of America, the nation's largest producer and fabricator of aluminum, reported yesterday that sales, earnings and ship ments of metal rose to records in 1969.

title: 4 ARE CONVICTED IN C.C.N.Y. PROTEST
description: Four young men were found guilty in Manhattan Criminal Court yesterday of unlawfully occupying the City College stu dent center on Nov. 7, 1968. A fifth defendant, a clergyman, was acquitted.

title: Gabon Gives Refuge to Biafran Exiles
description: LIBREVILLE, Gabon, Jan. 22 If the Americans can get to the moon, why can't they get into Biafra? the wiry Bia ifran representative asked with a hopeless shrug.

title: Sirhan Curb May Be Eased
description: SAN QUENTIN, Calif., Jan 22 (AP)San Quention prison of cials will review next month the possibility of easing secu rity restrictions that keep Sir han Sirhan in isolation from other prisoners on death row, Associate Warden James Pa rk says. Sirhan, sentenced for the assassination of Senator Rob ert F. Kennedy, ended a 13 day hunger strike Dec. 10.

title: Arrival of Buyers
description: CLASSIFIED BY OFFICE

title: A. MAX KELLY
description: WATERVILLE, Mo., Jan. 22  A. Max Kelly, president of the former Wallace Company of Brooklyn, makers of choco lates and candy, and later, dur ing World War II, a purchas ing agent for the Maritime Commission in Portland, died here today. He was 87 years old and lived in Belgrade, Me.

title: President Is Appointed By Walter Kidde & Co.
description: The advancement of Mau rice M. Rosen to the office of president of Walter Kidde & Co., Inc., was announced yesterday. He succeeds Fred R. Sullivan, who continues as chief executive officer and chairman of the board.

title: PROFIT IS IMPROVED BY TEXAS EASTERN
description: The Texas Eastern Transmis sion Corporation and its sub sidiaries reported yesterday a new high in net income for 1969. B. D. Goodrich, presi dent, put net income at $53, 443.000 against $51,325,798 a year earlier.

title: Chilean Left Finally Picks Allende to Run for President
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Jan. 22 (UPI)  The Chilean political left today selected a Marxist Socialist senator. Dr. Salvador Allende, as a unity candidate for the presidency in the gen eral elections set for Septem ber.

title: Harvard Punishes 29 Black Students In Building Seizure
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 22 Twentynine black students were notified today of disci plinary action taken against them by Harvard University for their part in last month's oc cupations of the school's main administration building.

title: Two Starficrhters Collide
description: KAUFBEUREN, West Ger many, Jan. 22 (UPI)Two Starfighter jet planes collided in flight over this south Ger man town today and crashed, the police reported. The crash brought to 115 the number of Starfighters lost in accidents since the Americanbuilt planes went into service in West Ger many.

title: BONN VOTES PLAN TO SLOW GROUTH
description: BONN, Jan. 22  The West German Cabinet unanimously approved today a longponder ed stability program, de signed to curb the republic's economic boom and also to provide funds in case a reces sion followed the program of restraint.

title: Negro College Fund Names Officer
description: The United Negro College Fund named Vernon E. Jor dan Jr., lawyer and former director of the Southern Re gional Council's voter edu cation project in Atlanta, as its new executive director yesterday with the goal of raising $10million this year.

title: EUSTACE LINGLE
description: SUMMIT, N. J., Jan. 22  Eustace Lingle, who retired last year as vice president, secre tary and a director of Oakite. Products, Inc., maker of clean ing and sanitizing products in Berkeley Heights, died yester day in Overlook Hospital. He was 63 years old and lived in Sea Girt.

title: WILLIAM C. PIERCE
description: OLD GREENWICH, Conn., Jan. 22William C. Pierce, president of the Marvel Oil Company of Port Chester, N. Y., died yes terday in his home, 60 Shore Road, of cancer. He was 51 years old. The company blends oil additives used in automo tive, marine and industrial engines.

title: Music: Ashkenazy Opens With London Symphony
description: THE London Symphony Or chestra is in town for three consecutive Carnegie Hall concerts, each one with Vladimir Ashkenazy sharing the program. Last night he played the Beethoven Piano Concerto No. 4. Tonight and tomorrow he will turn his at tention to Nos. 3 and 5, re spectively. Andre Previn, in addition, placed the Beetho ven Seventh Symphony on the program, though his other two concerts will avoid the other Beethoven svmphonies.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
ANTIWAR GROUP ASKS F.C.C. FOR AD RULING
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22The Business Executive Move for Vietnam Peace charged today that the rejection of its radio spot commercials is a denial of free speech and violation of the Federal Communications Commission's fairness doctine.

title: And Away We'll Go
description: SHE: I suppose you're go ing to insist on another two  week winter vacation and drag me down to the Caribbean again.

title: Trend of This Year's Flotilla Is More Power in Small Craft
description: If continuity and widespread adaptation are marks of a trend, then trendspotters viewing the 1970 fleet of small and med ium  sized power craft can count at least six trends:

title: BRANDT PROPOSAL IS SENT TO STOPH
description: BONN, Jan. 22Chancellor Willy Brandt of West Germany sent proposals for talks to Pre mier Willi Stoph of East Ger many in a letter today.

title: Riley in New Penguin Post
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 22 (AP) Jack Riley, general manager of the Pittsburgh Penguins, has been named interim president of the National Hockey League club, succeeding Sen. Jack Mc Gregor who resigned to run for Governor.

title: New Type of Miracle Rice Is Being Planted in Vietnam
description: SAIGON, Jan. 22 (Reuters) A new strain of miracle rice that combines high yields with better taste is being introduced to South Vietnam, which is al ready nearing selfsufficiency in its staple food, the United States Embassy said today.

title: Army Has New Suspect
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 (AP)  The Army reported today that it had added another sol dier to the list of those being investigated for possible charges in the alleged massacre at the South Vietnamese village of Songmy. Thirtytwo soldiers and former soldiers are now considered suspects. The latest suspect was not identified.

title: 4 Panthers Get Jail Terms
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Jan. 22 (AP)Four members of the Black Panthers were found guilty in Municipal Court to day of interfering with police officers in performance of their duty and were sentenced to 90 days each at the Municipal Farm. The defendants were Pete O'Neal, Tommy Robinson, John Jacobs and Edward Rol lins. The charges grew out of a fight outside the office of 0. M. Kelley, chief of police, on Dec. 5.

title: Turkey Agrees at Meeting To Tighten Curbs on Opium
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Jan. 22, (AP)Turkey agreed at a two day meeting with French and United States narcotics agents this week to take stricter measures to cut down on opium smuggling on ships headed for Europe, Interior Ministry sources said today.

title: OUTPUT OF DIESELS CONTINUES TO GAIN
description: By the end of 1970, the pro duction of marine diesel en gines is expected to reach 21, 000 units a year, more than double the 1967 output, accord ing to H. 0. Bedsole, marine division manager of Perkins Engines, Inc. The figure attests to the increasing demand formarine diesels but not to the reasons why more people are buying them.

title: Mills Cites Urgency On Textile Imports
description: Time is running out on ne gotiations to limit textile im ports, Representative Wilbur D. Mills, chairman of the Ways and Means Committee, Warned yesterday.

title: Bloomingdale's Was Right for Part
description: REMEMBER when Holly Golightly seemed rather daring and pathetic for long ing to breakfast in Tiffany's? Well, now there is a girl who makes the Truman Capote character seem like an under achiever in the dream depart ment.

title: STATE'S SOCIALISTS NAME CANDIDATES
description: The New York State Social ist Workers party yesterday announced its candidates for offices in this year's elections and said its key campaign is sue would be support for lib eration struggles of all peo ples.

title: HIALEAH FEATURE ENDS IN DEAD HEAT
description: MIAMI, Jan. 22 (AP)Futura Bold and Ghost Train, the first and second choices with the crowd of 14,549, finished in dead heatthe first of the meeting  in the seventh race today at Hialeah.

title: An Independence Leader Escapes From Taiwan
description: Peng Mingmin, a prominent member of the Taiwan inde pendence movement who had been living under house arrest in Taipei, has escaped from the island.

title: I.M.F. to Help Bonn
description: PARIS, Jan. 22The Inter national ??

title: Advertising: Under Three Flags
description: In a flagdraped room and in the presence of appropriate dignitaries, American, British and French ad agencies yes terday announced the forma tion of a network with a total of $300million in bill ings and representation in 93 per cent of the freeworld markets.

title: YANCEY REGISTERS BIRDIES AT 7 HOLES
description: PEBBLE BEACH, Calif., Jan. 22Despite fog enveloping the Monterey Peninsula, four golf ers emerged and shared the lead today with 67's in the $125,000 Bing Crosby pro amateur golf tournament.

title: Handlebars on WaterSkiing Boat
description: A 9foot fiberglass fun boat called the HydroCycle is attempting to prove that you can go waterskiing on a shoestring.

title: MURPHY GETS 38 AS NIAGARA WINS
Visit by Suspect Reported
U.S. Seizes Cases Of Excedrin P.M.; Asks Test of Tablet
description: Agents of the Food and Drug Administration and the United States Attorney's office in Brooklyn yesterday seized 40 cases of Excedrin P.M., a new painkilling and sleepinducing tablet.

title: Marjorie Swirsky Fiancee of Student
description: The engagement of Miss Marjorie Ann Swirsky, a sen ior at Barnard College, to James Patrick McCann, a senior at Columbia College, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Dr. and Mrs. Leo Jerome Swir sky of Brooklyn. Mr. McCann is the son of Mr. and Mrs. John Mames McCann Jr. of Durham, N. H.

title: HELP FOR BIAFRA AID TO SOYBEANS
description: A report circulating in the pits of the Chicago Board of Trade that the United States Government would make avail able to defeated Biafra 40,000 tons of highprotein food a month helped to send soybean futures up 1 cents a bushel early in the day. Soybeans are said to be high in protein value.

title: Ronan Rejects Bid to Delay Hearing on L.I.R.R. Fares
description: Dr. William J. Ronan, chair man of the Metropolitan Trans portation Authority, yesterday rejected a plea from the leader of a commuters' organ ization for postponement ofnext Monday's scheduled hear ing on a fare increase for the Long Island Rail Road.

title: Margaret Tama to Be Married to Peter F. Howell
description: Miss Margaret Mary Tama, a systems engineer with the International Business Ma chines Corporation in Denver, and Peter F. Hovell, formerly a marketing representative with I.B.M. in Denver, were married here yesterday morn ing in the Roman Catholic Church of Our Saviour.

title: 2 CONGO LEADERS FAIL TO HOLD TALKS
description: KINSHASA, the Congo. Jan. 22 (Reuters)  A meeting be tween the President of this former Belgian colony and the President of the neighboring Congo Republic, whose capital is Brazzaville, was called off today. The Kinshasa Govern ment blamed the Congo Repub lic, a former French colony, for the cancellation.

title: MATES BRUSH UP ON RADAR TASKS
description: In a darkened room five stories above Boston Harbor, Coast Guard boatswain's mates learn to make the most of radar.

title: Wall Posters Depict Line of Pearson Yachts
description: Pearson Yachts is offering a series of color wall posters showing their boats at fa mous yacht centers through out the world.

title: CHILDREN'S BOOKS REWARD AUTHORS
description: A first  time novelist who used to teach history and now raises sheep in Connecticut, William Steig, the cartoonist, and E. B. White, the author, were named winners yesterday of the nation's leading awards for children's books.

title: Washington: President Nixon and the New Age of Reform
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22Pres ident Nixon is bringing the ship of state back home for repairs. It will be a long, slow voyage, but he seemed to be saying in his State of the Union Message that the old girl had been bat tered in stormy foreign waters too long, and needed to be tidied up, scraped, painted and remodeled for her 200th anni versary in 1976.

title: Wilson Defends Lagos
description: LONDON, Jan. 22  Prime Minister Wilson insisted in the House of Commons today that the Nigerian Government was coming to grips with the re lief problem, but he left many members skeptical and they forced an emergency debate next Monday.

title: U.S. HOUSING EFFORT DRAWS $5MILLION
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 22  Half a dozen large industrial con cerns and financial institutions have invested $5million in the National Corporation for Hous ing Partnerships in the first week of its subscription offer ing, Ray A. Watt, president of the FederalGovernment spon sored effort to draw private capital into the homebuilding market said today.

title: New Slogan Will Proclaim Safe Boating Week in July
description: The theme for National Safe Boating Week next July will be Safe Boating Is No Accident.

title: Javits Arrives in Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 22 (UPI)Senator Jacob K. Javits, Republican of New York arrived in South Vietnam today on his first visit here in four years. The Senator, who is a member of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, told newsmen that he planned to study the Vietnamization pro gram, the withdrawal of United States forces and foreign policy relations between the United States and the Government of South Vietnam.

title: Nixon Sends Supplies by Plane In Response to a Lagos Request
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 The White House announced today that President Nixon had received an urgent request from the Nigerian Government for refugee aid in the former ter ritory of Biafra.

title: Diana Human, Leland Frazier To Wed in June
description: WATERLOO, Iowa, Jan. 22 Miss Diana Lyn Human and Leland Scott Frazier plan to marry in June.

title: 10,000 IN TEMPLE FOR M'KAY RITES
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Jan. 22 David O. McKay, the ninth President of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latterday Saints, was buried here today after a funeral service in the centuryold Tabernacle in Temple Square in the center of the city.

title: Consolidated Earnings Include Rank Unit
Boat Industry Issues Call to Landlubbers
description: A national promotion de signed to help newcomers get started in boating will be conducted during the month of March.

title: Reagan Urges a Broad Program To Curb California Polluted Air
Conglomerates Spreading Tentacles to Boat Industry
description: The independent boat builder has given way to large, massproduction companies. These companies, in turn, have been purchased by major conglomerates.

title: CONCRETE GAINING AS HULL MATERIAL
description: Be careful when you start hullthumping at the boat show one of them might be made of concrete.

title: Screen: Viva Max and the History of the Alamo
KitePowered Sailing Is a Novel and Tricky Pastime
description: When sailboat skippers talk about flying a kite, they mean a spinnaker  the ny lon headsail that looks like a big balloon as it billows out ahead of the boat.

title: Standard Brands Elects
description: Mills E. Godwin Jr., former ly Governor of Virginia, has been elected a director of Stand ard Brands. Inc. John Mackie has been elected a vice presi dent and a director of the com pany. Mr. Godwin, whose term as Governor of Virginia ex pired last week, had been an attorney with offices in Suf folk, Va., since 1948.

title: Open Interest
description: Thursday, Jan. 22, 1970

title: 8 Die in Colorado as Plane Crashes in Yard of House
description: ASPEN, Colo., Jan. 22 (AP)  Eight persons were killed today when a Rocky Mountain Airways plane crashed, nar rowly missing a house, while approaching the airport at this mountain resort town, the air line reported.

title: 400, With Cooke Officiating, Attend Donovan Funeral
description: Terence Cardinal Cooke, Archbishop of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York; presided at a funeral service yesterday at St. Pat rick's Cathedral for Dr. James B. Donovan, president of Pratt Institute. About 400 people at tended the service.

title: Executive Changes
description: Paul V. Gartland has been elected president of the J. & H. Equity Corporation, a wholly owned subsidiary of Johnson & Higgins, insurance broker age and employe benefit consulting concern.

title: Aronow, Man in a Hurry, Is Looking for New Challenges
description: Don Aronow, perhaps the greatest offshore powerboat racer in history, has always been in a hurry.

title: JUMBO JET ENDS OCEAN ROUND TRIP
description: The Boeing 747 jumbo jet completed its first commercial roundtrip flight across the At lantic last evening, winning much praise from its paying passengers even though the huge plane left New York seven hours late because of engine trouble.

title: IND Rider Tells of Hijacking
description: Hundreds of subway commut ters, angry when no express trains showed up on the Eighth Avenue IND line in upper Man hattan, were said to have seized a local train during the rush hour Wednesday evening and forced it to travel on express tracks 39 blocks beyond the end of its normal route.

title: Kiki Cutter Upsets French Skiers to Win Special Slalom in France
description: ST. GERVAIS, France, Jan. 22 (AP)Kiki Cutter, the 105 pound skier from Bend, Ore., outclassed the favored French on their home track today in winning the womens' special slalom of the St. Gervais Ski Grand Prix.

title: GATT Attacks Quotas
description: GENEVA, Jan. 22A new attack on nontariff barriers to trade was launched today by the international organization that establishes the rules under which about 85 per cent of world trade is conducted.

title: Walking Hand in Hand With Hills
description: At a news conference yes terday, Hills Supermarkets, whose consumeroriented, educational advertising has been praised in Washington and New York Government circles, explained it yester day as, our way of walking hand in hand with the con sumer of the seventies.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The appointment of James R. Kerr, president of Avco Corporation, a film and broad casting enterprise, as na tional chairman of United Community Campaigns of America was announced yes terday by Bayard Ewing, president of United Commu nity Funds and Councils of America.

title: Quarantine to Keep Liner In Vancouver Another Week
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia, Jan. 22 (Reuters)the liner Oronsay, quarantined Jan. 14 after a typhoid outbreak, will stay in Vancouver until at least Wednesday, it was announced today.

title: Brazil World Cup Favorite
description: LONDON, Jan. 22 (AP)Hills of London, a leading British bookmaking establishment, made Brazil the 31 favorite today to win the World Cup in soccer in Mexico next May, with the de fending champion, England, sec ond favorite at 61.

title: BROOKDALE HOSPITAL TO WORK WITH N.Y.U.
description: The affiliation of the Brook dale Hospital Center in Brook lyn with the New York Univer sity Medical Center in Man hattan was announced yester day by Dr. James H. Hester, president of the university, and by Arnold Schwartz president of the Bronkdale center.

title: U.S. Communications Unit At Wheelus Given to Libya
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, Jan 22 (Reuters)The United States today turned over to Libya its former telecommunications cen ter associated with the Wheelus air base near here.

title: Johnson Fishes in Mexico
description: ACAPULCO, Mexico, Jan. 22 (AP)Former President Lyn don B. Johnson went fishing to day while President Nixon made his first State of the Union Message. Mr. Johnson, who arrived in Acapulco yes terday on vacation, left the home of former President Mi guel Aleman of Mexico at about 8 A.M.

title: JAKARTA YOUTHS IN NEW PROTEST
description: SINGAPORE, Jan. 22Sev eral thousand high school chil dren today resumed demon strations in the streets of Jakarta ostensibly protesting against recent Government in creases in prices of gasoline and kerosene used as fuel for cooking.

title: Ionesco Elected to French Academy
description: PARIS, Jan. 22  Eugne lonesco, the avantgarde playwright, was elected to day to the French Academy, a 335yearold citadel of the Establishment.

title: At Big Vanilla, Skiing Patrons Are Saying, Make Mine Igloo
description: AND now the operator of the Big Vanilla at Davos Ski Resort in the southern Catskills is offering his pa trons the chance to build their own igloos. He prom ises to provide the land, the instructions and the sleeping bags. We've been searching for an unusual recreational ac tivity for our guests, said Mark Fleisch mann, the owner of the resort, yesterday. All candidates will have to do is supply their own show and ice. But that should he easy. There's plenty of both around area.

title: Questions Rise With savings Interest
description: Changes in rules governing interest rates thrift institu tions may pay on savings cer tificates have prompled ques tions. Practices vary some what among institution and many do not yet have copoes of the official regulations. Moreover, some changes are still possible.This is the pie ture now:

title: Saigon Bans Issue of Life
description: SAIGON. South Vietnam, Jan. 22 (Reuters)The South Vietnamese Government today banned the Jan. 19 issue of Life magazine, saying an article on the alleged massacre at Songmy included extremely violent pictures.

title: DAVID BUMBERG
description: David Bumberg, a founder of the East Side Torah Center at 313 Henry Street, died Tuesday at Long Island Doctors Hos pital in Roslyn Heights. He was 95 years old and lived at 550 Grant Street.

title: Iraq Executes 11 More Accused as Plotters and 7 Termed U.S. Spies
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 22  Eleven more men were exe cuted today in Baghdad eight army officers and three civiliansthe Iraqi radio said, bringing to 27 the number of persons who have been shot or hanged for their part in an al leged rightwing conspiracy Tuesday night to overthrow the Baathist Government of Iraq.

title: TRAILERS ENJOY BOOMING MARKET
description: There was a time when a recreational boatman launched his craft on a river, lake or ocean and kept it there for the entire boating season. He got to know his home waters very well.

title: DR. MARIE S. MURRAY
description: Dr. Marie Smith Murray, a dentist and a founder of Christ United Methodist Church in Brooklyn, died Wednesday at the Lutheran Medical Center in Brooklyn. She was 82 years old, the widow of Dr. Daniel Murray. Dr. Marie Murray lived at 336 86th Street, Brooklyn.

title: Masked Revelers to Meet Feb. 5
description: Guests arriving at the Riverboat Feb. 5 for the 31st annual dinner dance in behalf of ColonySouth Brooklyn Houses have been asked to wear whatever they wish to carry out its Mardi Gras theme. However, all will have on one thing in com mon, simple face masks pur chased at the door for $5.

title: Nyack Club Keeping Dues Down By Work Parties on Weekends
description: NYACK, N. Y.The Nyack Boat Club, on the Tappan Zee of the Hudson River here, gets its chores done and saves a mint of money by means of weekend work parties made up of members.

title: Births
description: SCHLOSSINGERBarbara and Lewis announce the birth of their son in Abbott Hospital, Minneapolis, Minn., on Jan. 17th, he is named Gregory Lewis Schlossinger.

title: SHEAD ADVOCATES USE OF ALUMINUM
description: Next season in Britain prom ises to be as busy as ever for powerboats. A full racing pro gram has been planned, in cluding the 213mile Cowes Torquay and the 180mile Wills Trophy race, the two British events that count for the world offshore championship title.

title: L.I. Bank Has Plenty of Money for Boat Loans
description: Oh to buy a boat, a boat, almost any kind of boat, in the moneycrucial year of 1970. John T. Coughlin, who should know, says: Money for boat loans is just as available as money for automobile loans.

title: Coast Guard Points to Record As 180th Anniversary Nears
description: Looking back upon the ac complishments of his service in 1969, Adm. W. J. Smith, Coast Guard Commandant, reports gains in all major phases of operations, ranging from sup port of the conflict in South East Asia to such peacetime activities as marine safety, oceanic research, efforts to combat oil pollution and the drive for service modernization.

title: $10BILLION ASKED FOR CLEAN WATER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 President Nixon said today he would propose a $10billion program to clean up America's waters over five years. In formed officials said later that, under the President's plan, the Federal Government would pay 40 per cent of the cost and the states and cities 60 per cent.

title: Bridal Is Planned By Karen Landers
description: FORT LEE, N. J., Jan. 22 Miss Karen Sue Landers, a junior studying photojournal ism at the University of Kan sas, and Raymond John Dulye Jr., a junior studying television production and di rection at Syracuse Univer sity, have become engaged.

title: NUMEROUS ITEMS FOR ALL TASTES
description: Landlocked, frozen in and im mobilized until springthe boatman has his frustrations in wintertime. However, like the gardener reading his seed cata logues, the yachtsman can spend many pleasant hours with his order blanks, outfitting or just perusing. Here is an eclec tic catalogue of catalogues.

title: P. S.C. Will Sue Penn Central Over Number of Its Late Trains
description: The Public Service Commis sion announced yesterday that it planned to go to court to force the Penn Central Company to comply with ontime per formance standards on the rail road's Hudson and Harlem divi sions.

title: Brokers Form PayBargaining Units
description: Groups of stockbrokers in major cities around the United States are forming organizations  loosely knit in most casesto bargain with brokeragehouse man agements over pay scales. The result may be unioni zation of securities salesmen for the first time in Wall Street history.

title: U.S. Rejects Soviet Views on the Mideast
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 22The United States today rejected So viet suggestions for an Arab Israeli peace formula and warned that there was no point in continuing the twopower talks unless the Russians adopted a more flexible posi tion.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: WASHINGTON. Pa., Jan. 22 A bizarre account of events preceding the murder of Joseph A. Yablonski and his wife and daughter began to unfold here today.

title: PRIVATE HOSPITALS TO GET $6.5MILLION
description: After warnings that clinics in sonic of the city's private hospitals might have to close their doors to the poor, the Board of Estimate voted yes terday to provide $6.5million to 17 of the hospitals.

title: WIDE DIVERGENCE IN CRAFT SLATED
