description: CLAYTON, N. Y.The 85 to 100 boats expected to assemble at the Municipal Dock, here next Aug. 15 and 16 will have one thing in commonthey will all belong to the over30 gen eration of boats.

title: Canadian Bills Auctioned
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 22 (Canadian Press)New 91day Govern ment of Canada treasury bills auctioned today: $140million at an average price and yield of 98.094 and 7.79 per cent. Last week, $130million same term, 98.089 and 7.81 per cent.

title: FOE IS STEPPINGUP ACTIVITY IN DELTA
description: CHAUDOC, South Vietnam, Jan. 21Here on the edge of the Mekong Delta and else where in the flat, fertile area life has become dangerous for civilians in recent months and progress of the pacification pro gram has slowed.

title: Sail Is New Magazine for Boatman
description: Where have all the sailors gone? The question started a young Boston publisher, Bernard Goldhirsh, thinking. The result was a new maga zine called Sail, which went on the newsstands this month with a price of 75 cents.

title: Away From Draft Absolutism
description: By ruling that the Selective Service System lacks the power to speed the induction of those who engage in antidraft activism, the Supreme Court has taken a significant step toward eliminating the threat of military service as punishment for dissent. Although its decision does not specifically determine whether draft boards may end the deferment of those who turn in their draft cards, the Court denied the right of Selective Service authorities to ride herd on the registrants, using immediate induction as a discipli nary or vindictive measure.

title: 79Inch Powered Board Is Boat Show Novelty
description: Every major boat show has its novelties. With a craft like the AquaDart, a 79inch surfboardlike design, this year's National Boat Show is no exception.

title: GIANTS AND JETS BOOK A REMATCH
description: The Giants and the Jets will play a preseason game again this summer in the Yale Bowl at New Haven. The date is not set, but likely it will be Sunday afternoon, Aug. 23, with tickets again priced at $7 each for the 70.874 seats

title: Lindsay Calls on All Local State Areas to Seek Aid
description: YONKERS, Jan. 22  Mayor Lindsay talked here today about summer school problems in Chenango Forks, snow re moval problems in Albany and welfare problems in Erie Coun ty.

title: BOAT CAN BE FUN FOR ALL SEASONS
description: When you buy a boat, you become owner of something that can bring pleasure on yearround basis. In spring summer and fall you enjoy it on the water. In the winter you enjoy boating vicariously by planning and preparing for next season's fun.

title: U.S. Power Squadrons Strive to Convert Landlubbers to Finished Skippers
description: They have no distinguishing marks, no special look of the sea, but of all the buffs poking around at the boat show, none go about it in quite the same way as members and students of the United States Power Squadrons.

title: MAYOR ACTS TO AID HEATLESS TENANTS
description: Mayor Lindsay declared last night that a heating crisis existed in the city and directed the Housing and Development Administration to use emergen cy powers to help tenants in unheated buildings.

title: Theater: Conrad Bromberg Triple Bill
Engineers Study 747 Engine Enigma
description: Airline and industry engi neers worked yesterday to solve a perplexing mystery: Why did one engine of a Boeing 747 jetliner run out of breath just before its sched uled maiden commercial flight Wednesday night?

title: SOUTHERN CIRCUIT SET FOR BIG DUEL
description: The 1970 Southern Ocean Racing Conference circuit, starting next Friday with the St. PetersburgVenice race, will match for the first time the two sailing yachts generally considered to be the world's fastest.

title: Nixon Ready to Accept Rise in Impact School Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 President Nixon is prepared to accept higher funding of the politically popular impact areas school aid in an effort to forestall Congress from over riding his promised veto of the $19.7billion health and educa tion money bill.

title: Consumer Bandwagon
description: Kissing babies has long been a favorite preoccupation of political leaders, but it is in danger of losing its preemi nence to the latest trend known as embrace the consumer.

title: Avco President Heads U.S. Community Drive
description: Avco President Heads U.S. Community Drive

title: Interest Rates Show Rise For TaxExempt Bonds
72 of Enemy Reported Killed in Delta
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 22 (AP)Striking from a forest stronghold, enemy forces assaulted a command post of a South Vietnamese Marine bri gade in what was termed the biggest attack in the Mekong Delta in two months.

title: Chandris Line Buys Constitution and Roosevelt
description: Two wellknown passenger ships now flying the American flag may soon switch emblems.

title: For the Buyer, a Plethora of New Boats On Hand: 3,672 Stock Models
description: If you're planning to take to the water in a new boat, you'll have 3,672 stock, models from which to choose.

title: Vietcong, in Paris, Allege a Massacre
description: PARIS, Jan. 22The Viet cong asserted today that South Korean and South Vietnamese troops massacred more than 700 villagers last November in a pacification sweep command ed by Americans.

title: TELEPHONE SLIPS AS MARKET GAINS
U.S. Attorney Tells Journalists To Guard Against Corruption
description: IRVINGTON, N. J., Jan. 22 United States Attorney Fred erick B. Lacey warned journal ists tonight that they must use increasing vigilance to guard against the influence of or ganized crime in their reporting of news.

title: DEFENDERS ADVANCE IN WOMEN'S CURLING
description: MOUNT HOPE, N. Y., Jan. 22Massachusetts rinks repre senting The Country Club of Brookline and the Winchester Country Club, the defending champion, won the semi final matches today the 16th annual Empire State women's bonspiel at St. Andrew's Golf Club. They will meet for the Clarke Trophy tomorrow in a 10end final starting at 11:30 A.M.

title: Triple at Liberty Bell
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 23  Martin Fromin, who had been in somewhat of a slump since losing his apprentice allowance of Jan. 14, broke out of it by booting home three winners at Liberty Bell race track today.

title: L&N.MONON DEAL WINS I.C.C. BACKING
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 (AP)  An Interstate Commerce Commission hearing examiner recommended approval today of the merger of the Louis ville & Nashville and Monon Railroads.

title: Israelis Neutralize Egyptian Island Base in Fiercest Fighting Since '67
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 23An Israeli task force withdrew today from the Egyptian is land of Shadwan after a 30 hour operation in which that Red Sea outpost was com pletely neutralized as a mili tary base. All its installations were said by the Israelis to have been destroyed and all the equipment, including radar unit, removed by heli copter. A lighthouse on the island was left intact, the Israelis said. The Israeli raid, described by its commanders as part of the war of attri tion initiated by the Egyp tians, led to the fiercest and costliest fighting since the 1967 war. Some 70 Egyptians were reported killed, includ ing 40 crew members of three boats the Israelis said they sank as the Egyptians sought to relieve the be leaguered island. In addition 62 Egyptians were reportedly taken prisoner. Three Israelis were reported to have died in the fighting, which was said to have ended at noon yesterday, or three hours after the task force arrived. The rest of the time was taken up with flushing Egyptians out of hiding places, collecting equipment and demolishing in stallations. [In Cairo, a mili tary spokesman said 80 Egyp tians were killed, wounded or missing in the fighting, and estimated Israeli casualties at 50 dead or wounded.]

title: Gulf Oil Aide Says Spain Seeks Property Nationalized by Bolivia
description: MIAMI, Jan. 23  An officer of the Gulf Oil Corporation said today that he had been informed that the Spanish Gov ernment was negotiating for control of Gulf property na tionalized by Bolivia.

title: FLUTIST DISPLAYS TECHNICAL GRACE
description: Robert Willoughby is pro fessor of flute at the Oberlin College Conservatory of Music, and he knows his instrument inside out. Tackling a demand ing program at Carnegie Re cital Hall last night, he met every technical challenge with fluent and confident ease.

title: Washington : For the Record
Sports Today
A HANOI BUILDUP IN LAOS REPORTED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23  Officials of the State Depart ment said today that North Vietnam had recently massed more troops and military sup plies on the edge of the Plaine des Jarres in Laos than ever before.

title: Rangers to Defend Lead Today Against Bruins at the Garden
Mrs. Francis Hogan Dies; A Hospital Executive, 54
description: Mrs. Elizabeth Doyle Hogan, assistant to the administrator of the Morrisania Hospital and the wife of Francis L. Hogan, chartered life underwriter for the John Hancock Insurance Company, died Thursday at the Montefiore Hospital. She was 54 years old and lived at 2515 University Avenue, the Bronx.

title: And Now Sarmi Says No to the Midi
description: MOLLIE PARNIS really started a trend. Since she denounced longer hem lines at the start of her sum mer show earlier this week, any number of designers have felt compelled to do likewise.

title: WORD OF SHIP'S SALE SPURS 5 WALKOUTS
description: The disclosure that American Export Isbrandtsen Lines had entered into an agreement with a Greek shipowner to sell the passenger liner Constitution produced protest demonstra tions aboard five of the line's cargo ships yesterday.

title: COURT BARS PAPER ON NONVIOLENCE
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 23An un equivocal stand against violent demonstrations at the 1968 Democratic National Conven tion here was read into the record at the Chicago con spiracy trial today.

title: Israeli Court Rules a Jew Can Be One by Nationality
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 23  The Israeli High Court decided to day, by a vote of 5 to 4, that an Israeli could register his children as Jewish by nation ality rather than by religion even though their mother was not a Jew.

title: Democrats to Turn to ManintheStreet in Giving Own State of Union Message
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 Congressional Democrats de cided today to present their own state of the union message to the country by turning to the man in the street to discuss the problems confronting the nation.

title: U. S. Court of Claims
Sports Lodge Will Honor Stars at Dinner Tonight
description: The 19th annual Bill Corum Memorial dinner of the Sports Lodge of B'nai B'rith, will be held tonight at the Hotel Roosevelt.

title: Neighborhoods: Flatbush Ave. Shops Feel New Pressures
description: There's nothing you could want that you couldn't buy on Flatbush Avenue, said Philip Elkin, owner of the oldest store in one of the city's oldest neighborhoods.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Alfred J. Phillips and Virgil N. Woolfolk have been elected vice presidents of the Manu facturers Hanover Trust Com pany.

title: Investing Concern In Asia Announces First Major Project
description: TOKYO, Jan. 23The Pri vate Investment Company for Asia, S. A., (PICA) S.A., a cap italist venture in development assistance, announced today its first major financing projects.

title: Fiat's Sales Rose By 6.66% in 1969
description: ROME, Jan. 23  Italy's mo tor giant, Fiat, announced to day that it had done very well in 1969 but could have done even better had not a plague of strikes hampered production during Italy's hot autumn of labor unrest.

title: Nixon Flies to Camp David; Plans a Trip to Philadelphia
description: THURMONT, Md., Jan. 23 (UPI)President Nixon flew to Camp David today for the start of a weekend of relaxation with his wife and their daugh ter Julie, and her husband, David Eisenhower.

title: Little Disqualified By Italian Referee For Not Fighting
description: ROME, Jan. 23 (AP)The world junior middleweight box ing champion, Freddy Little of Las Vegas, Nev., was disquali fied tonight for not fighting during a nontitle bout with Eddie Pace of Los Angeles.

title: Louis Darling, 53, Illustrator And Conservationist, Is Dead
description: NORWICH, Conn., Jan. 23 Louis Darling, an author and illustrator of books on natural history, died in a hospital here Wednesday of cancer. He was 53 years old and lived in Old Lyme.

title: F.A.A. CHIEF HINTS NEW DRUG CHECK
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 The new Commissioner of Food and Drugs hinted today that his agency might take a look at the safety and efficacy of drugs that have been on the market for many years.

title: Bolivia Reports Finding C.I.A. Office in La Paz
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Jan. 23 (AP)The Bolivian Govern ment said today that it had uncovered a downtown office here run by the United States Central Intelligence Agency and that it will ask for the removal from Bolivia of any Americans involved in the center of operations.

title: New Jersey Utility Reports Advance In Operating Net
description: The Public Service Electric and Gas Company of New Jer sey reported yesterday gains in operating revenues and net in come for 1969.

title: Watchdog of Liberties
description: The American Civil Liberties Union, which this week celebrated its fiftieth anniversary and the coin cidental eightysixth birthday of its founder, Roger N. Baldwin, started out as a watchdog of constitutional liberties at a moment in history when another Attorney General was cracking down on those who disagreed with the prevailing notion of what was patriotic thought and conduct. The organization's original char ter called for taking all legitimate action to protect freedom of speech, press and assembly and the other rights in the Constitution. It is still doing business the same stand for the same cause.

title: GOALBY, WIECHERS, HOLD SECOND SPOT,
description: PEBBLE BEACH, Calif., Jan 23As gale winds of 34 mile; an hour swept along the Mon terey Peninsula today, Beri Yancey played the Spyglass Hill course, the most sheltered of the three sites used in the Bing Crosby proamateur golf tourney, today and led with a 36hole aggregate of 137.

title: CON ED IS CALLED BUILDERS' VICTIM
description: A series of books of com puter printouts, ledger size and two inches thick, were offered yesterday to prove a charge that a conspiracy by contrac tors to rig bids had inflated the Consolidated Edison Com pany construction costs by nearly 10 per cent.

title: JOHN E. RIORDAN SR.
description: NORWALK, Conn., Jan. 23 John E. Riordan St., engineer and superintendent of the First District Water Department, died today at Norwalk Hospital. He was 68 years old and lived at 37 France Street.

title: BRITAIN AND FRANCE DISCUSS KEY ISSUES
description: LONDON, Jan. 23 (P)  The foreign ministers of Brit ain an France agreed today to restore cooperation between their two countries in as many fields as possible, including for eign affairs.

title: Article 1  No Title
An Empress Publishes Her Paintings
description: A little bird flew into the garden of the Fukiage Palace as the Emperor and Empress of Japan were talking after lunch.

title: Mansfield Rebuts Stand on NATO Cut
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23The Senate majority leader, Mike Mansfield, today challenged the Administration's contention that political, military and financial considerations justified the maintenance of American troops in Western Europe at their pres ent level.

title: 7 REPUTED MAFIOSI HELD IN TAX BRIBE
description: The Government accused eight reputed Mafia members yesterday of conspiring to bribe Internal Revenue Service agents. Seven of the eight were arrested along with a tax con sultant who was a former tax agent and an I.R.S. agent.

title: RICHARD A. SHAFTER, CARE PRESS AGENT
description: Richard A. Shafter, a press agent with the Cooperative for American Relief Everywhere and a former newspaperman, died Thursday in Belleville, N. J. He was 73 years old and lived at 131 Bremond Street there.

title: Bridal Is Held For Mrs. Kelly
description: OSSINING, N. Y., Jan. 23 Mrs. Lynn Kelly and Thomas Michael Hamm were mar ried here this afternoon at the home of the bridegroom's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Fred erick Werner Hamm.

title: To Revive Rail Travel
description: The Department of Transportation's plan to create a semipublic corporationRailpaxto revitalize and run the nation's disintegrating intercity passenger rail service merits support it has not so far received from the Bureau of the Budget and the White House.

title: EARNINGS OFF 4C FOR IMPERIAL OIL
description: Indicated earnings in the fourth quarter of 1969 by Im perial Oil, Ltd., Canada's larg est integrated oil company, fell to $26million, or 20 cents a share, from $30million, or 24 cents, in the yearago period. Indicated sales for the quarter, however, rose to $433million From $413million in the corre sponding period of 1968.

title: U.S. Joins Search for Hogs
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 (UPI) The Agriculture Department announced today that it had joined in the search centered in Texas and New Mexico for pork from 11 hogs believed con taminated with a dangerous mercury fungicide that the au thorities warned could kill in large doses.

title: The Price of Pot
description: Congressmen who have doubts about a pending measure to lighten Federal penalties for possessing marijuana should study the case of a young student recently pardoned in Virginia. No action taken by Congress would directly affect penalties imposed by the states, but the incident should serve to point up the savagery with which American society has been approaching the subtle and difficult problem of drugs.

title: Soviet Sources Say 2 U.S. Demands Block Progress in Talks on Mideast
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 23Soviet officials say the two most important points preventing progress here in the Big Four talks about the Mid dle East are United States in sistence on ArabIsraeli nego tiations and on demands that the Arab Governments accept a compromise to prevent guer rilla activities against Israel.

title: Miss McIntire, Mrs. Cudone Are Beaten in Doherty Golf
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Jan. 23 (AP)Barbara McIntire and Mrs. Carolyn Cudone were eliminated today as four youngsters emerged as semi finalists in the 38th annual Doherty Challenge Cup golf tournament.

title: Francis X. Bowie Victor
Joyce Death Mask Stolen
description: DUBLIN, Jan. 23 (UPI)A death mask of James Joyce, the Irish novelist, has been stolen during a public exhibition, offi cials of the James Joyce So ciety said today. A committee member said he discovered the loss today when he arrived at the society's premises, where the mask was on view.

title: 4 Airlines Facing Penalties
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 (AP) The Civil Aeronautics Board's enforcement bureau asked today for the suspension of two American supplemental airlines and two foreign lines for alleged illegal transAtlan tic charter flight operations.

title: MRS. THOMAS M'DANNEL
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., Jan. 23Mrs. Lucy Sevier Jones Mc Dannel, the widow of Thomas H. McDannel, a tax consultant with an office in New York City, died yesterday in the Beechwood Manor Convalescent Home here of pneumonia. She was 88 years old.

title: Gonzales Defeats Laver Before 14,761
description: Respondong to 14,761 spec tators who provided a bull fight atmosphere, Richard (Pancho) Gonzales gored the matador, Rod Laver, at Madi son Square Garden last night in the opening match of the Tennis Champions, Inc., $200,000 Classic.

title: DR. ALBERT REISSNER, PSYCHOTHERAPIST, 86
description: Dr. Albert Reissner, a psy chotherapist who had been on the staff of the Alfred Adler Consultation Center here for decade, died yesterday in the Holy Family Hospital, Brook lyn. He was 86 years old and lived at 93 Eighth Avenue, Brooklyn.

title: L.I.R.R. Union Abandons WishyWashy Federation
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Jan. 23 Harold J. Pryor, head of the United Transportation Union. which represents union mem bers working for the Long Is land Rail Road, said today that his union had withdrawn from the Long Island Federation of Labor.

title: JOHN C. M'CARROLL
description: John Clyde McCarroll, a law yer, formerly associated with, Debevoise, Plimpton, Lyons & Gates, 320 Park Avenue, and since 1966 a graduate fellow at Harvard Law School in Islamic law, died Thursday of leukemia in Memorial Hospital. He was 34 years old and lived at 135 East 17th Street.

title: New Books
description: A Matter of Diplomacy, by Warren Tute (CowardMcCann, $4.95). Diplomatic intrigue and suspense in Greece.

title: 76ERS TURN BACK BULLETS, 133118
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 23 (AP) The Philadelphia 76ers got 54 points from their starting forwards, Billy Cunningham, and Jim Washington, tonight as they scored an easy 133118 victory over the Baltimore Bul lets in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Boy, 11, Accused Of Selling Heroin In Brooklyn Home
description: An 11yearold Brooklyn boy has been arrested on a charge of selling heroin through a mail slot in the door of his home, the police said yesterday.

title: RALSTON CAPTURES MARATHON MATCH
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Satur day, Jan. 24 (Reuters)Dennis Ralston, the American profes sional beat John Newcombe of Australia today in the longest major tennis match played in Australia at the Australian nnen championships.

title: TV: A suspenseful Pose
description: The program known as On Stage, which has made some important dramatic con tributions to television, settled last night for a very light comedy of suspense. Robert Culp's performance was all that held together the thin handiwork of John Morti mer's Married Alive on the National Broadcasting Com pany.

title: TRIUMPH IS FIFTH OVER CHICAGOANS
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 23The Chi cago Bulls clawed tenaciously at the New York Knickerbock ers tonight, displaying one of their best performances of the National Basketball Association season, butto the disappoint ment of a cheering crowd of 14,505 at Chicago Stadium emerged only with their fifth straight loss of the season to New York. 120117.

title: Olin Filly Pays $13.20
description: MIAMI, Jan. 23 (UPI)J. M Olin's 4yearold bay filly Gu nite, making her first start of the season, captured the $10, 000 Gainsborough Girl Purse at Hialeah Park today.

title: Miss Deborah B. Cahn Affianced to Student
description: Mr. and Mrs. Joshua Binion Cahn of New York and East Hampton, L. I., have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Deborah Binion Cahn, to Thomas Richard McIntosh. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas John McIntosh of South Weymouth, Mass. A June wedding is planned.

title: Child Care at Creedmoor Trbuble's Queens Aide
description: An assistant Queens dis trict attorney investigating charges of child abuse toured the center for disturbed chil dren at Creedmoor State Hos pital yesterday and said that everything about it remind ed me of a prison.

title: PREY CONQUERS SCHUBERT CYCLE
description: Schubert's Die Winterreise, the greatest of song cycles, poses the greatest test for lieder singer. Its 24 songs have to be sung without interrup tion, spanning approximately an hour and a quarter. Its over all mood is gray, ending in the blackest of despair. A few songs, ironic, nostalgic, raging, falsely courageous, relieve the gloom. Only Schubert's music, outwardly simple, inwardly pro found, always right and always beautiful, beggaring descrip tion in words, alone makes the sentiments bearable.

title: Teachers' Strike Closes Schools in 3d Jersey Area
description: NORTH ARLINGTON, N. J. Jan. 23A strike by the Teach ers Association today closet this community's five publi?? schools.

title: Engine Test Set
description: WINDSOR LOCKS, Conn., Jan. 23Engineers will use a propellerdriven airliner to create artificial winds tomor row in an effort to solve an ontheground engine problem in the Boeing 747.

title: LIST TURNS DOWN IN AMEX TRADING
description: The American Stock Ex change ended the week in bearish manner yesterday as the list declined on moderate trading.

title: Governor Signs State Bill Setting New District Lines
description: ALBANY, Jan. 23Governor Rockefeller signed into law to day the new boundaries for the state's 41 Congressional dis tricts, for which representatives are to be elected this year.

title: Brown Reports to Wilson On His Middle East Tour
description: LONDON, Jan, 23 (AP)  George Brown, a former foreign Secretary, conferred with Prime Minister Wilson today to re port on his recent private visit to the Middle East.

title: Realty Man Denies He Knew of Employe's Alleged Link to Mafia
description: Anthony A. Cantalupo, presi dent of a Brooklyn realty com pany in which Joseph Columbo, a reputed Mafia boss, is salesman, denied yesterday that he knew of his employe's alleged underworld connections and said that he had been harassed by the Federal Bu reau of Investigation.

title: IMPORT LIMITS END FOR FOREIGN SUGAR
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 (AP) The Agriculture Department announced today the removal of limitations on the amount of sugar that foreign suppliers can ship into the United States in the first Quarter of this year.

title: POET JOINS ACTOR TO PRODUCE FILMS
description: Rock Hudson, the actor, and Rod McKuen, the poet and song writer, have formed an indepen dent movie company, R and R Productions. The first film to be made under the new partner ship will be Chuck, from a novel by Carl Sterland pub lished last year by Doubleday & Co., which Mr. McKuen re cently acquired for filming.

title: Article 3  No Title
Rio Beaches: Everyone's Summer Backyard
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Jan. 23 The New Year began with celebrations on the beaches here as it has for years.

title: East Germany Is Mildly Critical of Brandt's Letter
description: BONN, Jan. 23  The East German press agency, A.D.N., issued a short commentary to day mildly criticizing the letter sent yesterday by the West Germany Chancellor, Willy Brandt, to the East German Premier, Willi Stoph, propos ing negotiations between the two states.

title: Yablonski Inquiry Reported to Focus On a Sum of Money
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 The Federal investigation of the murder of Joseph A. Ya blonski was reported today to be focusing on what was described by Government of ficials as a sizable sum of money promised the killers by a person or group in the Kentucky  Tennesseee coal fields.

title: Clemson Hires Football Aide
description: CLEMSON, S. C., Jan. 23 (AP)George M. Maclntyre, an assistant for two years at Tem ple University, joined the Clem son football coaching staff to day.

title: STATE TO TAKE OVER MORE CITY INMATES
description: The state will take over 1,500 more of the city's 6,000 prisoners under an agreement announced yesterday by Mayor Lindsay and Governor Rocke feller. The pact brings to 2,500 the number the state will ac cent in its institutions.

title: Industrial Park Project in Bronx Brings Protests
description: The city's latest industrial park project, a 100acre site in the Bronx, is expected to pro vide 3,000 new Jobs when con struction is completed in about four years. But the city's in tention to acquire 37 acres of land in assembling the site has caused protests by businesses that apparently will have to relocate.

title: Cyclists End Race In South Vietnam With No Casualties
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 23 (AP)The South Viet namese Government demon strated today that it could con duct a bicycle race along 290 miles of its roads so long as several thousand soldiers were available to protect the cyclists.

title: 3 FOUND GUILTY HERE IN AIR TICKET DEAL
description: Tino Barzie, the former manager of Frank Sinatra Jr., Jackie Gleason and Tommy Dorsey, and two codefendants were found guilty by a Federal jury here last night of con spiracy to use stolen credit cards to purchase thousands of dollars worth of airline tickets.

title: Abernathy Urges Senators To Turn Down Carswell
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 23 (AP)The Rev. Ralph David Abernathy said he sent a telegram today to Senate leaders urging them to oppose the nomination of Judge G. Harold Carswell to the United States Supreme Court.

title: Martina Arroyo Hailed For London Trovatore
description: LONDON, Jan. 23 (UPI) Martina Arroyo won plaudits from the critics last night for her role as Leonora in Verdi's Il Trovatore at Covent Gar den Opera House in London.

title: CAIRO TIGHTENING DISCIPLINE AS FOE INTENSIFIES RAIDS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 23 The United Arab Republic, un der intensifying pressure from Israeli attacks, is taking steps to tighten discipline in the armed forces and to sustain civilian morale, according to information reaching here from Cairo.

title: 5Day Strike by Okinawans Ends at U.S. Military Basess
description: TOKYO, Jan. 23 (Reuters) A fiveday strike by Okinawan workers on United States mili tary bases on Okinawa ended tonight without settlement of the issue of almost 1,200 dis missed workers.

title: Nasser to Visit Spain
description: MADRID, Jan. 23 (UPI) President Gamal Abdel Nasser of the United Arab Republic has accepted an invitation from Generalissimo Francisco Franco to visit Spain, the Foreign Min istry announced today. No date has been set for the visit.

title: Byegone Is 31 Choice Tonight In Rich Early Bird Pace Final
description: WESTBURY, L.I., Jan. 23  Byegone, the 5yearold son of Bye Bye Byrd, who is owned, trained and driven by John Pat terson Sr., is the 31 choice to win the $25,000 Early Bird pacing series final at Roosevelt Raceway tomorrow night.

title: Mormons Designate Conservative Head
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Jan. 23 Joseph Fielding Smith Jr., the 93yearold grandson of one of the early Mormon martyrs, was designated today as president of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latterday Saints.

title: German Steel Unit in U.S.
description: Edelstahlwerke Buderus, A.G., a leading West German special ty stel and alloy producer, said yesterday it had established North American marketing sub sidiary to be known as the Bu derus Steel Corporation. The new unit, with offices in South Hackensack, N. J., and will be headed by O. A. Kaletsch.

title: Autos Spilled in Derailment
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Jan. 23 (AP)Fifteen cars of a Penn Central Railroad freight train derailed here early today, rip ping up track, snapping several utility poles and spilling loads of new autos and trucks, auto parts and foodstuffs over a wide area.

title: Proctor Sets N.A.I.A. Mark With Long Jump of 254
description: Proctor Sets N.A.I.A. Mark With Long Jump of 254

title: Judicial Precedent
description: It hardly speaks well for the thoroughness or the quality of the Justice Department's research that the white supremacy speech delivered by Judge G. Har rold Carswell in 1948 was only uncovered by a televi sion reporter following Judge Carswell's nomination to the Supreme Court. This deficiency in the department's homework, all the more astonishing in the aftermath of the Haynsworth debacle, intensifies exist ing doubts about the value of Attorney General Mitchell as the President's chief political and judicial adviser. Either Mr. Mitchell didn't have the informa tion he should have had, or he ignored information that must have acutely embarrassed the President and for the second time within a few months.

title: North Biafra: A Land of Unimagined Devastation and Suffering
description: NEWI, Nigeria, Jan. 22In the northern part of the former Biafra region, the Nigerian Army is behaving with disci pline, but relief efforts are pa thetically slow and appear to be inadequate.

title: 100 Skiers Ready For U.S. Tourney; Watt Will Defend
description: EAU CLAIRE, Wis., Jan. 23 This old ski jumping strong hold is about to play host to its first national tournament since 1909. Nearly 100 skiriders have come here to display their prowess on the city's yearold 73meter Silver Mine Hill.

title: Finding Peace Through Handicrafts
description: WARREN, N. J.  Howard and Dorothy Leichter es caped the madness of the city about 18 months ago by set tling into a sparsely furnished multilevel ranch house nes tled in the hills of Somerset County. Snow, space and si lence surround them in the winter, a screen of fullleafed trees in summer.

title: Charles Burchfield, a U.S. Provincial
description: DESPITE the air of na tional celebration and selfcongratulation that now presides over the historiog raphy of American art in the 20th century, we are still remarkably ignorant about the careers and achievements that give this period its dis tinctive character.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Dr. Hankins, who had re cently moved from Northamp ton, Mass., to Franklin Lakes, N.J., taught at Smith from 1922 to 1946 and earlier at Clark University in Worcester, Mass. He was visiting professor at the University of Pennsyl vania from 1946 to 1948.

title: Harrassment Intensified
description: BERLIN, Jan. 23  The East Germans today intensified their harrassment of traffic on the access routes to Berlin, block ing roads to all German motor ists during much of the day.

title: WHITE HOUSE ASKS OPEN F.C.C. POLICY ON USE OF SPACE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23The White House said today that domestic communications satel lites should be developed and operated on a competitive basis by private interests.

title: Dassault, Mirage Jet Builder, Says He Has No Control Over Sale by France
description: PARIS, Jan. 23  Marcel Dassault, the French aircraft builder whose Mirages may be tipping the balance of power in the Middle East, in dicated today that he had nothing to do with policy re garding the sale of French military planes.

title: Muskie Hails Nixon's Concern On Pollution but Asks Specifics
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 Senator Edmund S. Muskie said today that President Nix on's rhetoric of concern about the environment In his State of the Union Message yesterday was excellent but that any final judgment of the extent of the President's com mitment to environmental quality would depend on the programs he proposed and the money he requested.

title: Trademark Suit Settled
description: AKRON, Jan. 23 (UPI) The Goodyear Tire and Rub ber Company announced today it had settled a fiveyear old trademark infringement suit against the WeatherRite Sportswear Company of Brook lyn. WeatherRite agreed to refrain from using trademarks similar to those of Goodyear.

title: MAFIA OBTAINED SECRET U.S. DATA
description: Seven months before Joseph M. Valachi, the defector from the Mafia, disclosed its secrets at public hearings in Washing ton, members of the criminal brotherhood were overheard discussing evidence that the Government was preparing supposedly in secret  against them.

title: FLOYD CLYMER, 74, AUTOMOTIVE AUTHOR
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 23 (UPI)  Floyd Clymer, automobile and motorcycle dealer and pub lisher of automotive books, died last night apparently of heart ailment. He was 74 years old.

title: Dow Industrials Sink 10.56 Scuttling Combined Gains of 3 Preceding Sessions
description: A selling squall buffeted the stock market Yesterday after noon, sending the DowJones industrial average down 10.56 points and erasing the com bined gains of the three pre ceding sessions.

title: Coal Output Estimated
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 (UPI)  The National Coal Associa tion, from incomplete carload ing reports from the railroads, estimates last week's bitumi nous coal production in the United States at 10.88 million tons. Production in the year's earlier period was 10.9 million tons. Production reported by the Bureau of Mines for the week ended Jan. 10 was 8,676, 000 tons.

title: STEPHEN A. ARGERIS
description: DEAL, N. J., Jan. 23Ste phen A. Argeris, a senior part ner in the law firm of Hanlon, Argeris & Amdur of Asbury Park, died today in Monmouth County Medical Center. He was 48 years oia and lived at 2 Queen Avenue Drive.

title: FaceMask Allows Portable Oxygen Use
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 Concerned at the rapid increase in pulmonary dis ease, a Philadelphia physician has invented a portable thera peutic facemask, named BreathAid. A patient can treat himself with it in home, train or office.

title: Penn Central Fighting State Order on Equipment
description: The Penn Central said yester day that it had not taken any action to comply with a seven monthold order of the Statel Public Service Commission cali ing for immediate steps to purchase or lease 80 new cars and 24 new engines for the1 line's Harlem and Hudson com muter divisions.

title: Indonesian Students Widen Price Protests
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Jan. 23 (UPI)  Student protests against Governmentordered increases in the price of gaso line and kerosene spread to day from Jakarta to Jog jakarta in Central Java. The army warned that troops were ready to enforce a ban on demonstrations.

title: Divers Recover Bag In Search for Clues
description: FREDERICKTOWN, Pa., Jan. 23Seaching for clues in the slaying of Joseph A. Yablonskl, scuba divers re covered today a bag of ma terial from the iceclogged Monongahela River.

title: U.S. Aide Urges Inquiry On Fees U.S. Lines Paid
description: A hearing examiner for the Federal Maritime Administration has called for an investigation of fees, aggregating $939,500, paid by the United States Lines to a marine engineering com pany owned by the ship com pany's president.

title: SENATE UNIT BACKS HUGE SCHOOL BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan.23 (AP) The Senate Labor and Public Welfare Committee recom mended to the Senate today a huge $35billion education bill going far beyond President Nixon's recommendations.

title: Council of Churches Names Panel to Set Goals and Priorities
description: TULSA, Okla., Jan. 23  We have spent four days tink ering with the machinery, Roger Burgess said this after noon, but I think now we are ready to go.

title: LONDONERS PRESENT BEETHOVEN CONCERT
description: The omnipresent figure of Beethoven (200 years old this year in case anyone is still un aware of the fact) hovered once again over the London Symphony Orchestra's concert at Carnegie Hall last night. Vladimir Ashkenazy played the Piano Concerto No. 3 and his performance was a marvelous one, full of strength, steel and sinew. Unfortunately Andr Previn's imprecisely conducted accompaniments seemed whol ly workaday in comparison.

title: Sturdy Leader of the Mormons
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Jan. 23 Although the honor was a long time coming, it may have seemed inevitable that Joseph Fielding Smith Jr. was elected today as president of the Church of Jesus Christ of Lat terday Saints to succeed the late David O. McKay. His greatuncle was the prophet Joseph Smith. His grandfather was Hyrum Smith, the prophet's brother and second patri arch of the Mor mons. His father was the sixth Mormon president. His half brother, Hyrum Mack Smith, was an apostle, and he, him self, has served as an apostle for 60 years, less three months. As well as being his heritage, the church has been his life.

title: Reed Paper Group In Britain to Absorb Largest Publisher
description: LONDON, Jan. 23The In ternational Publishing Corpo ration, the largest publishing company in the world, is to be taken over by the Reed Paper Group.

title: Protest March in Nairobi
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Jan. 23 (Reuters)  Shanty dwellers whose homes were burned in a city cleanup campaign Monday daubed their faces with ashes and marched with charred frag ments of their homes in front of the new $6million Hilton Hotel here today. The demon strators mistakenly thought Prosiclynt Jomo Kenyalta would

title: BLACKS HERE PLAN A LIBERATION WEEK
description: A group of black leaders an nounced plans yesterday for the marking of Black Liberation Week next month to make the community aware of the grave peril facing us and to organize, new common strategies for our Protection.

title: TAYLOR ACCEPTS PACT AT $28,000
description: The New York Mets started paying the price of success yesterday  almost $80,000 worthwhen they signed Jerry Koosman and Ron Taylor to their 1970 contracts.

title: Fewer Deaths on N.J. Road
description: WOODBRIDGE, N. J., Jan. 23 (UPI)The Garden State Park way carried a record number of vehicles last year, but recorded fewer fatalities. The New Jer sey Highway Authority, which operates the toll road, reported today that parkway traffic fa talities dropped from 28 in 1968 to 24 last year, while the esti mated volume of vehicles using the highway increased nearly five million to almost 146 million.

title: CAPACITY OUTPUT OF FACTORIES OFF
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 233 The nation's manufacturing in dustries were operating on the average at only 81.8 per cent of capacity in the fourth quar ter of last year the Federal Reserve Board reported today.

title: ROMNEY URGES RISE IN PRIVATE BUILDING
description: George Romney, Secretary of Housing and Urban Develop ment, said here yesterday that $20billion more a year in pri vate investment in housing was needed to meet the goal fixed by Congress of 26 million new housing units by 1978.

title: Collegiate Chorale Celebrates Beethoven With Missa Solennis
description: The Collegiate Chorale has wasted no time in getting its celebration of the bicentennial of Beethoven's birth under way. At Philharmonic Hall last night, this biggest and best of our amateur choruses per formed Beethoven's Missa So lemnis, and that is celebration enough for any group of sing ers.

title: NETWORKS PRAISE SATELLITE POLICY
description: The major television and radio networks applauded yes terday the Administration's pol icy of open entry and rate competition for a domestic communications satellite sys tem.

title: LAYOFF IN JERSEY EXTENDED BY FORD
description: METUCHEN, N. J., Jan. 23 (AP)The Ford Motor Compa ny plant here announced today that it would be closed for the next three weeks, rather than for one week, in the second temporary layoff since produc tion of 1970 cars began.

title: Dance: Bugaku, Oriental Idyll of Love
description: GEORGE BALANCHINE'S ballet Bugaku, given by New York City Ballet at the New York State Theater last night, is an Oriental epi thalamium, a careful mar riage ritual suggesting Japa nese connubial ceremonies in a happily familiar European translation. The ballet, which happens to be extraordinari ly beautiful, suggests eroti cism without exoticism and exoticism without eroticism.

title: Conrad in South Pole Crash
description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand, Jan. 23 (UPI)  Max Conrad crashed in his Piper Aztec plane today while attempting to take off from the South Pole for the next leg of his aroundthe world polar flight. The 67 yearold pilot from Flagstaff, Ariz., was reported in good condition after a physical ex ainination at the Amundsen ??

title: U.A,R, ROLE SEEN IN LIBYAN JET DEAL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 The Arab negotiating team that concluded Frances controver sial arms deal with Libya in cluded key military experts from the United Arab Republic posing as Libyan officials, ac cording to diplomatic intelli gence reports.

title: Argentine Doctors Strike
description: BUENOS AIRES. Jan. 23 (AP) Most of Argentina's 33,000 physicians staged a 24hour strike today to protest the gov ernment's public health poli cies. State, city and private hospitals had only small staffs to deal with emergency cases.

title: Takers of the Pill Held More Prone To Risk of Cancer
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 (AP)  Preliminary findings of Governmentbacked study in dicate that women who decide to use birth control pills may be more prone to cancer than women who do not, Congress was told today.

title: Market Summary

description: How could the Viennese Opera Ball in New York be more genuine Viennese than it usually is. By celebrating, as it did last night, the 100th birthday of Franz Lehr, the operetta king. For if there is one thing the Viennese love more than whipped cream, it is whipped cream music.

title: Lindsey Latimer Planning Marriage
description: ROSE VALLEY, Pa., Jan. 23  Miss Lindsey Paige Latimer and Bruno La Rocca, who are with the Bankers Trust Company in New York, plan to be married in May.

title: TWO B52 MISSIONS REPORTED BY U.S.
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 23 (Reuters)  A United States spokesman said today that B52's struck targets around a Mekong Delta prov ince today and in a province near Saigon.

title: 84 CHURCH AIDES PLEAD FOR LORDS
description: Eightyfour elected execu tives of several national Protes tant denominations and the National Council of Churches asked yesterday that charges against the Young Lords for disrupting services and occupy ing the First Spanish Methodist Church in East Harlem be dropped.

title: Pressmen Pick Acting Chief
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 (UPI) J. Frazier Moore of Detroit has been elected acting presi dent of the International Print ing Pressmen and Assistants Union of North America. The union said Mr. Moore was elected by its executive board to succeed Anthony J. DeAn drade. who died Tuesday.

title: Typhoid Fever Verified; 1,600 Remain on Liner
description: The diagnosis of typhoid fever has been confirmed in 36 and is suspected in 30 addi tional crewmen and passengers from the British liner Oronsay, now in the harbor of Van couver, B.C. About 1,600 per sons remain in voluntary quarantine aboard the cruise shin.

title: Books of The Times
description: Familiar too is the Auden cadence: happy is he who hopes for better, / what awaits Her may well be worse, the pro nouns as usual without anteced e n t s. Occasional AngloSaxon lines (s c a r e and scream, the scathe of battle) reflect an early interest of Auden's and his naturalness in using it. Very much in evidence is the poet's tech nica?? mastery, one that shows no sign of faltering. Unlike so many other single books that have one voice and main tain a single verse form, City Without Walls provides handbook of poetic excellences: long lines of weight and majesty; short twobeat and threebeat lines as strong and sinewy as braided wire; catchy songs in anapestic measure with double and triple rhymes; couplets with rhyming variants so unob trusive as to suggest a pianist of great license and great discipline, and a mag nificent set of translations from Bertolt Brecht's Mother Courage.

title: INSPECTORS AGREE TO CHECK ON HEAT
description: A threatened impasse be tween the building inspectors union and the city over Mayor Lindsay's directive to assist tenants in unheated apartments was ended last night after nego tiators reached a general agree ment.

title: Auto Output Up for Week
description: DETROIT, Jan. 23 (AP) The nation's newcar production was scheduled at 161,477 this week, higher than the 138,517 last week, but still below the 193,380 for the corresponding Period a year ago.

title: kin. PLANS RAID ON N.B. A. TALENT
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 23The American Basketball Associa tion, in a quick aboutface, to night declared allout war on the National Basketball Asso ciation.

title: InterfaithMarriage Guidelines Issued
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 23 The Massachusetts Commis sion on Christian Unity issued 10 guidelines today signaling major changes in hieratical at titudes toward marriages be tween couples of differing de nominations.

title: Union Oil signs Contract
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 23 (UPI) The Union Oil Company has signed a contract to build an $80million electric power plant in South Korea as a joint ven ture with the Korea Explosives Company.

title: CRITICS GET BIDS TO PARIS IS OUT
description: New York drama critics were informed yesterday that they may attend any performance of Paris Is Out from next Wednesday through Saturday and then print their comments on Feb. 3.

title: A Correction
description: A dispatch in The New York Times Wednesday on the cir culation of The Guardian of Britain gave the impression that the paper was losing cir culation. In fact, The Guardian has led other quality British newspapers in circulation rise in the last 12 months with an increase of 11 per cent to 292,000.

title: WINCHESTER RINK WINS IN CURLING
description: MOUNT HOPE, N. Y., Jan. 23 The Winchester, Mass., Country Club rink, skipped by Mrs. Walter L. Wilcox, re tained the Empire State wom en's curling championship and the Clarke Trophy today.

Justice Tilzer, who was named to a twoyear term by Governor Rockefeller, was an appellate justice from 1966 until his re tirement Jan. 1.

title: 'Female Animal'
description: THE distributors of "Female Animal" are touting this new sex teaser as a successor to "Inga" and "Fanny Hill." It's duller than either, at any rate. Here is a mess of pottage, replete with nudity and anatomical intertwining to mollify most Peeping Toms. This Italian-Spanish co-production creaked and panted into town yesterday, mooring at the Victoria (of all theaters!) and the Avco Embassy East.It's the old one, fresh from the Stone Age, about a bad girl  played by a comely, blank-faced and elastic brunette named Arlene Tiger  and How She Got That Way. Kicked out of home by a mean stepmother, she becomes a kind of jet set Cinderella as a servant in a household of rich, perverse worldings.There's papa, who casually hands the bewildered girl over to his svelte, longtime mistress. The spoiled son also scores. Let's see, who else? Oh, yesthe stable boy, who apparently is also a sideline plaything of the father. The girl's uncle fails, her cousin succeeds. The chauffeur, who may be just tired, snubs the lot of them.The sexual passages, with the alert photography underscored by sinuous music, are clearly the point. The acting, the English-spoken dialogue and the direction are atrocious, almost infantile. Miss Tiger's pursuers are, in order of prominence, Vassili Lambrinos, Andr Landzaat, Jean Avery and Robert Darchi.Sadder than all the wasted energy is the wasted scenery, a lush, tropical locale gleaming in handsome color. Otherwise, "Female Animal" just mews, carnally and piteously.

title: Hirsch Jacobs Hospitalized
description: MIAMI BEACH, Jan. 23 (UPI) Hirsch Jacobs, noted trainer of thoroughbred race horses, was reported in satisfactory condition at the Miami Heart Institute today after having been hospitalized for treatment of a heart condition.
