In the gritty little coal towns with narrow, pitching streets', signs admonishing check your guns with the sheriff have dis appeared from the courthouses only in this generation.

title: Puerto Rican, 17, Is 9th Suicide In a City Jail Since Start of '69
description: A 17yearold Puerto Rican inmate was found hanged yes terday in a cell at the Adoles cent Remand Shelter on Rikers Island. The youth was the ninth suicide in city correctional in stitutions since the beginning of 1969.

title: Dame of Sark, Decides, At 86, Not to Abdicate
description: LONDON, Jan. 24 (Reuters) Dame Sibyl Hathaway, the 86yearold feudal ruler of the tiny English Channel island of Sark, announced this week that she would not abdicate after all.

title: CITY IS CRITICIZED ON LINCOLN CENTER
description: Nine months ago, the chair man of the City Planning Com mission signed an agreement to encourage lowincome housing in the Lincoln Center area in Manhattan.

title: Scrimshaw Kept Whalers Busy
description: THERE is a story, probably apocryphal but worth re peating, that has been kick ing around Cape Cod, Nan tucket, and Martha's Vine yard about the complaint of the wife of an oldtime whal ing captain.

title: De Vicenzo Gets Jones Award For Sportsmanship in Golf
description: Roberto de Vicenzo of Argen tina, who missed a chance for a firstplace tie in the 1968 Mas ters tournament by signing an incorrect scorecard, received yesterday the Bob Jones Award of the United States Golf Asso ciation for distinguished sports manship in golf.

title: Age of elegance
description: Miniskirts may come and maxicoats may go, but elegance is always inespecially for women who are, as the French say, of a certain age. Mrs. George L. Armour doesn't think she should dress like her 16yearold granddaughter. She prefers simple, timeless designs by the likes of Norell, Galanos, Chanel and Balenciaga. I used to buy Paris, she says, but we haven't been there in five years. I also liked to order in the custom department at Bergdorf's, but that is no more. So she has copies of French couturier designs made at Madame Claras, an East 53d Street salon. She generally gets two evening dresses in the fall and two in the spring and keeps them for years (Good things you can always wear). Pink, white, black and navy are favorite colors (My husband doesn't like brown), and they go with her gray hair.

title: U.S.Red Study By Experts Is Due
description: Management experts from stateowned enterprises in the Soviet Union and Eastern Europe will begin studying American management tech niques in the United States this year, while American business leaders will go to Moscow, Sofia and Warsaw to study the Communist sys tem.

title: Favored Tall Order Takes 2d Victory at Narragansett
description: PAWTUCKET, R. I., Jan. 24 (AP)John A. Palumbo's Tall Order, winner of the Auld Lang Syne Handicap when Narragansett Park opened on New Year's Day, scored his second victory of the season today by taking the $7,500 Newport Handicap.

title: OLD TOWN RUNABOUT ON EXHIBIT AT SHOW
description: The Old Town Canoe Com pany is back at the show with a fleet of fiberglass and wooden canoes along with a pair of stern drive power boats and a mediumsized runabout.

title: Q
Dog Show Calendar
description: Today  Watchung Mountain Poodle Club match; The Towers, Route 23, Cedar Grove, N. J.; entries 10 A.M.; judging 1 P.M.; information: Carol Comerford, (201) 5344135.

title: BRITISH ARE SELLING 40 USED NAVY SHIPS
description: LONDON, Jan. 24 (Reuters) Britain has 40 naval vessels for sale.

title: PROP DIRECTION USEFUL TO KNOW
description: Next time you find yourself standing behind your boat as if rests on its trailer, back up several feet and note the di rection of propeller rotation. Climb aboard and, with pro peller rotation still clear in your mind, sit in the driver's seat.

title: Strike Ends in Okinawa.
description: NAHA, Okinawa, Jan. 24 (Reuters)  Okinawan wor res returned to work at Un fed States military bases on Otis Pacific island today after a fiveday strike. But the iss e that caused the strikethe dis missal of 1,200 local worekrs remained unsettled.

title: Mr. Nixon, Reformer
description: In the lofty tones of his first State of the Union Message, President Nixon endeavored to give voice the state of the American mind. He placed his empha sis on the desire for peace rather than victory in Vietnam, on reform of existing institutions rather than creation of new ones at home, and on improve ment of the quality of life rather than on the quantity of material growth for the people of this country and the world.

title: Mrs Eckdorf In O'Neill's Hotel
description: William Trevor likes to scrape together human flot sam and scrutinize it with a pitiless and fishy eye. His fourth novel presents another eccentric's caravanserai like The Boarding House; this time, however, the master plan is far more intricate  and the result is a small work of art. What you will encounter in these ingenious pages is an inspired misanthropy that rings a medley of changes on the themes of selfdeception and utter hopelessness.

title: Two Get Jail in Effort to Integrate Carolina Church
description: SUMTER, S.C., Jan. 24Two Negro college students who had attemped to worship at the allwhite First Presbyterian Church here have been con victed of disorderly conduct.

title: DEPTH SOUNDER RATES NO. 1 AID
description: For most boat owners, the first electronic aid to be in stalled will be a depth sounder, the second will be a radiotele phone, and the third, a radio direction finder.

title: Nigeria 2: Balance Sheet on Friends And Foes
description: LAGOS, Nigeria  The Ni gerians are both cockahoop and angry. They have won their awful war by themselves. They even paid cash for their weap ons. No wonder Maj. Gen. Yaku bu Gowon was beaming and shifting restlessly in his chair in Nigeria's disused Parliament building last Thursday when he spoke to newsmen from around the world.

title: ALTER OF DETROIT WILL DRIVE CRAFT
description: Sometime in February, the first turbinepowered unlimited hydroplane, driven by a Det roiter, Freddie Alter, will be given trial runs on Lake Gun tersville in Alabama.

title: Expenses of City Families
description: Following is the United States Bureau of Labor Statis tics' equivalence scale for estimating the needs of urban families for goods and services.

title: STANDARDIZATION IS AIM OF SYSTEM
description: There's a cloud no bigger than a space capsule over the boating horizon. It serves as advance notice of an approach ing front in marine technology when most boats, at least in the larger sizes, will have elec tronic equipment built in as standard equipment.

title: Airlines in U.S. Carried Empty Seats Often in'69
description: The nation's scheduled do mestic airlines flew more miles of empty seats than full ones last year, according to the Air Transport Associa tion.

title: FOUR DONZI MODELS WILL BE SHOWN HERE
description: Donzi Marine, the Florida firm that makes fast fiberglass inboard boats, has four of its models at the Coliseum.

title: Impact School Aid, Target of Nixon Veto Threat, Is a Congressional Favorite
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 24  By vowing to veto the educa tion appropriation bill, Presi dent Nixon has challenged one of the most popular programs in Congressaid to impacted areas.

title: Music Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: New Retail Frontier: The Small Town
description: The new frontier for stores may well be where the fron tier of the country was a century agothe small town in the rural areas where in dustry is now becoming the economic partner of the farmer.

title: Paladin Rides a $90,000 Yacht
description: Richard Boone, better known as Paladin of televi sion's Have Gun . . . Will Travel series, is also a boat man and enjoys sportfishing aboard a 43foot Pacemaker sportfisherman.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: HOUSTON  Amid the technological revolu tion of the 20th cen tury, home building remains basicail3 a local business in which the typical entrepre neur produces fewer than 25 dwelling units a year.

title: Oil Units Seek Ceylon Rights
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, Jan. 17 Sixteen international oil corporations are seeking government permission to be gin oil exploration oper tions in the northwestern coastal belt of Ceylon.

title: Need OutboardMotor Advice? Check the Manual
description: Outboard motor owners con stantly seek more information on how to improve the per formance of their boating rigs. Here are answers to some of the more frequent questions:

title: Boston Fed to Build 45Story Tower
description: BOSTON, Jan. 24  The Federal Reserve Bank of Boston has completed agreements to purchase 14 parcels of property for the site of a $45million bank building adjacent to the South Station Terminal of the Penn Central Railroad.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: PARIS  No one knows how deep the auto recession will go. I have already had to reduce my plant by not replacing employe turnover, not recuperating holidays. The credit restraint now in force hits the auto industry the hardest. Credit like that would completely shut down the United States market.

title: Miss Laura Lee Noon Is Married
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., Jan. 24Miss Laura Lee Noon was married here this after noon to Lieut. Thad Paul Al ton Jr., U. S. A., of New York. The ceremony was performed at the Community Congregational Church by the Rev. Kenyon J. Wildrick.

title: Carswell May Make Sothe People Long for Haynsworth
description: WASHINGTON  President Nixon, who had been expected to nominate to the Supreme Court a man who would appeal to Middle America, fulfilled all expectations last week with the selection of G. Harrold Cars well.

title: An economist against military spending
description: The divorce of economics from politics is not ancient. A political economist, as John Stuart Mill used the word only a century ago, was someone who pursued the science of ra tional choice, or economics, without foregoing the art of public decisionmaking, or poli tics. The goal of objectivity, or pure science, prompted the sep aration of theoretical econom ics from its practical applica tion. Of late, however, there has been increasing recognition that at least in the public policy area a reconciliation is essen tial.

title: From Sweden
description: SWEDEN on Feb. 9 will re lease two new definitive stamps and a booklet of stamps. The first stamp will be a 20ore showing St. Ste phen as a stableboy. It was inspired by medallions paint ed on the ceiling of the Dadesjo church of Smaland. These depict scenes from the life of Christ and legends surrounding himin this in stance, that of St. Stephen as a pious young man with. his arms extended in prayer toward the stars, a horse in the foreground drinking from a stream, and another turn ing his head to the star.

title: U.S. Aide Awarded Degree
description: Helen Delich Bentley, chair man of the Federal Maritime Commission has been awarded an honorary doctor of laws de gree by the University of Mary land.

title: Jersey WoodenBoat Buldier Joins the 40Foot Class
description: The Post Marine Company a New Jersey builder of wooden boats, has moved into the 40 foot class with three models. At the Coliseum is a fisher cruiser version in that length.

title: Brutality and Pillage Worrying Lagos
description: OWERRI, Nigeria, Jan. 23 A few days after the Biafran surrender, a group of Americans near here saw Nigerian soldiers driving Red Cross trucks out of the newly occupied area. The trucks were filled with goods stolen from refugees and the local population. The trucks had been stolen too.

title: Seats in Cairo for An Israeli Air Show
description: CAIROWith the nonchalance of performers at an air show, Israeli fighter bombers streaked downward, released bombs and climbed into the light overcast to wheel into position for an other diving approach to the target, an army camp at Wadi Hauf, only 12 miles south of Cairo.

title: LIVINGCOST RISE SPURRING UNIONS
description: The continued rise in the cost of living is spurring union de mands for the largest wage increases in years.

title: PROPER PLACING IN BOAT IS VITAL
description: Flotation has become a lively subject in the recreational boat ing industry. Last June Con sumers Union reported results of tests it had conducted, which showed that six of 13 outboard boats were judged not acceptable because they had turned bottom up when swamped.

title: Masters First Day Aug. 22
description: PETERSBURG, Ill., will be the site for the firstday sale of the start of a new series of United States stamps hon oring American poets. In that town, on Aug. 22, a multi colored 6cent stamp will be issued paying homage to the author of Spoon River An thology, Edgar Lee Masters, who is buried there.

title: Writing Contest Listed For Junior Yachtsmen
description: Junior sailors under 18 years of age have been in vited by Yachting Magazine to enter a writing contest in the boating field. The articles should be between 1,000 and 1,500 words long on any phase of the writers' sailing experience and activity. The article should be the work of the entrant and of particular interest to young sailors.

title: Slide Projector Innovation
description: THERE is a new shape in slide projectors and several new convenien ces that put everything out in the open and give pro jector operation a refreshing ly novel facility and direct ness. The innovational unit is the Bell & Howell Slide Cube Projector, a squareshaped machine that measures 9x9x8 inches and uses a 21inch square 40slide container that takes up a fraction of the space of the conventional slide tray or reel. The avail able four models range in price from $112.50 to $184.50.

title: Kennedy Library Faces Rise in Cost
description: The directors of the John F. Kennedy Presidential Library are moving, after a sixyear de lay, to come to grips with the problem of raising several mil lion dollars to bring the project to fruition.

title: Miss Arar Affianced To Allen M. Sussman
description: Mr. and Mrs. Victor Caro of Mount Royal, Quebec, have anounced the engage ment of Mrs. Caro's daugh ter, Miss Yardena Fortunee Arar, to Allen Michael Suss man, son of Dr. and Mrs. Harry Sussman. of Yonkers.

title: NEWPORT TO HAIL ONCEFEARED SHIP
description: The 20gun frigate H.M.S. Rose, which in 1775 threatened to bomb Newport, R. I., in re taliation for townspeople burn ing a tender, will return to Newport early this year to add another dimention to the resto ration of the town.

title: Spain Busily Reshuffling Her Foreign Relations
description: I MADRID, Jan. 24 Spanish foreign policy, normally rigid and slow moving, has displayed almost frenetic activity for the last month.

title: Prices Putting Westchester Out of Reach of the Middle Class
description: SOARING prices for homes in Westchester have made it all but impossible for middleclass fam ilies to relocate in this suburban county, tradi tionally one of the prime residential communities in the metropolitan area.

title: 18 ISRAELIS KILLED IN AN ARMS BLAST AT DOCK IN ELATH
description: JERUSALEM, Sunday, Jan. 25 A munitions explosion at a military dock in Elath, Israel's southern port, killed 18 soldiers yesterday and injured 42, about half of them seriously.

title: Goldsteins Have Child
description: A daughter was born Jan. 11 to Dr. and Mrs. Robert S. Goldstein of Freeport, L. I., in the Flower and Fifth Ave nue Hospitals. The child has been named Laura Emily.

title: Richey and Graebner Gain Final in Florida Tennnis
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Jan. 24 (AP)Cliff Richey of San Angelo, Tex., and Clark Graebner of New York ad vanced today to the final of the Austin Smith tennis cham pionship.

title: Hints to Handymen
description: BECAUSE they are often exposed to moisture which attracts and holds dirt, zippers on overshoes and other forms of outer wear sometimes tend to jamb or become stiff. One easy way to prevent this is to keep the zipper lubricated with a powdered lubricant. White stainless powders that are greaseless and odorless are ideal for this. They come packaged in handy squeeze tubes as shown below, and will help to preserve metal, leather, rubber and plastic.

title: Soviet Police Aide Urges Major Alcohol Curbs
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 24A senior Soviet police official called to day for a sharp curtailment in the sale of Vodka amid indica tions that the Government would soon take stricter meas ures against drunkenness.

title: Two Cancellations: A Trend?
description: LAST week brought ominous news. Two summer festivals announced their suspension for at least a year. The im mediate reaction: Was this a sign of things to conic or was it just a coincidence?

title: Four Seized in Port Chester Called Major Drug Suppliers
description: PORT CHESTER, N.Y., Jan. 24Four persons described by the Westchester County Sheriff as major suppliers of narcotics in eastern Westchester and Lower Connecticut were ar rested this morning.

title: Nathaniel S. Wilson Is Fiance Of Miss Judith Virgnia Conn
description: McLEAN, Va., Jan. 24  Capt. Robert H. Conn, U.S.N. and Mrs. Conn of McLean and East Boothbay, Me., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ju dith Virginia Conn, to Sea man Recruit Nathaniel Smith Wilson of the Coast Guard, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Gregg Wilson of Fisherman's Island and Boothbay Harbor, Me.

title: Stevens: What Went Wrong?
description: IN George Stevens' 1935 film version of Booth Tarkington's Alice Ad ams, the heroine, the smalltown girl from the wrong side of the tracks, wins the hand of the rich young man from the right side of the tracks  an upbeat al teration of the novel in which Alice goes off to become a secretary, and probably a spinster. In Stevens' film version of The Diary of Anne Frank, made 25 years later, little Anne, just before she and her family are carried off to a concentration camp, looks up at a sky of fleecy white clouds and says: I still believe  in spite of every thing  that people are ba sically good. . . . I think the world is going through a phaselike I am with moth er.

title: Charles B. C. Carey Dies; Had Led Yale and Towne
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 24  Calvert Carey, former presi dent of the Yale & Towne Manufacturing Company, died of a heart attack yesterday at the Georgetown University Hospital. A former resident of Greenwich, Conn., he was 76 years old and since 1956 had lived here in Georgetown, where he collected modern sculpture.

title: Show Marks ASMP's 25th Year
description: IS contemporary photo journalism abandoning its traditional realm of objec tive reality for a modern ized version of pictorialism? The question is suggested by the main display, which is predominantly in color, in the third floor gallery of the In finity '70 exhibition at the New York Cultural Center (formerly the Gallery of Mod ern Art) in Columbus Circle. The show, which marks the 25th anniversary of The American Society of Maga zine Photographers and con sists of more than 100 prints contributed by members, will run through March 8.

title: POLICYRATESVARY FOR NORTH, SOUTH
description: Anyone who owned a boat in the old days paid for the privilege. He couldn't benefit from mass production and marketing techniques because almost everything, from in boards to insurance, had to be handtailored.

title: Spitz Swim Mark Falls
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 24 (UPI) John Kinsella, a Hinsdale High School student, broke the na tional high school swimming record today for the 400yard freestyle with a time of 3 minutes 36.5 seconds. The record was previously held by Mark Spitz, Indiana University star, who recorded 3:38 for the event as an Indiana high school sophomore in 1968.

title: Accountants Scarce, So Prospec is Are Paid While They Learn
description: It's a fact of life for many professions that by the time a person completes his un dergraduate or graduate ed ucation, it's usually too late for him to change his career plans to a field in which he has not had proper training. The cost and the time in volved in switching goals at this stage of his life freqent ly stops a man from moving into another area that only recently has become fasci nating to him.

title: Wheat Shortage Seen in Argentina
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 17 (AP)Officials in Argentina have told flour millers they face a wheat shortage again this year, thus strengthening earlier reports that the coun try will be once more in the market for grain.

title: Everyone was playing an old game, and in Europe the playing field had changed
description: One certain aftermath of a war is the appearance of historical works revising the interpretation of the causes of the conflict. World War I produced a whole series of highly influential books of this type. Even World War II (the causes of which seemed so plainly the mad ambitions of Hitler and the flatulent appease ment by Western European leaders), has been followed by its revision ism, most spectacularly the 1961 volume of the British scholar, A. J. P. Taylor, The Origins of the Second World War. With what is widely considered more flair than cogency, Mr. Taylor argued that Hitler was not irrevocably determined to undertake vast expansion and that the British leaders were not wholly unwise in dealing with him as they did.

title: Parley Scheduled On Whey Output
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 24 (AP)Government and uni versity officials plan to hold a conference at the Univer sity of Maryland June 2 to 3 to see if more whey can be used.

title: Lucy E. Schneider Betrothed To John Fergus McDiarrnid
description: Miss Lucy Elizabeth Schneider and John Fergus McDiarmid, who were grad uated with the class of '68 from Swarthmore College and are studying for doctor ates in English at Harvard and Yale, respectively, plan to be married in June.

title: For $1,440, a TwoSeat Sub
description: PARIS  JeanClaude Mayas drew a big circle on the back of a brown envelope and then three smaller circles scattered inside the larger one.

title: ELECTRONIC ITEMS BOON TO BOATMAN
description: Water can be a hostile en vironment, but electronics man ufacturers have helped in the last decade to make it more friendly to pleasure boatmen.

title: A TwoYear Threat to Seoul Is Seen
description: A Koreanborn professor at Columbia University who has closely studied the North Ko rean leadership for the last decade has concluded that South Korea faces a serious threat of aggression from the North in the next two years.

title: Religion
description: With the consent of his lay leaders, the pastor of a Roman Catholic parish in Oregon re cently arranged for a priest who had married to replace him dur ing his vacation.

title: One Year Later, Impact of Great Oil Slick Is Still Felt
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., Jan. 24One year after the great offshore oilwell blowout here, the leakage of gummy petrol eum has largely been stemmed and the beaches are generally Clean. But repercussions from the ecological shot heard round the world continue.

title: Boating on Ice Provides Thrills, Chills and Spills
description: It had been a dull after noon as iceboating after noons go; only a couple of bad spills during the sixrace program, and only one skip per and his sailtender were plucked from the frigid lake.

title: Snow Speed Returns America to the Prix d'Amerique Trot Today
description: PARIS, Jan. 24The soot black racetrack at Vincennes is oblivious to weather. In the brightest sunshine, look ing its best, it appears to be an unfinished parking lot; in the rain, under layers of cin dery mud, it has all the charm of a railroad yard.

title: Pop
description: BLUE AFTERNOON: Tim Buckley (Straight STS 1060). Tim Buckley is one of the most under rated, and one of the most gifted, of today's young song writersingers. He's made good records before, but this one is far and away his best to datea crystalclear dis tillation of the many eclectic elements which make up his talent.

title: West Routs East, 12898, As A. B. A. Averts Strike
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 24  Spencer Haywood and Larry Jones, who have led the Den ver Rockets to 14 straight American Basketball Associa tion victories, lent their talents today to the West AllStars.

title: Nest German Team First In CrossCountry Skiing
description: REIT IM WINKEL, West Ger nany, Jan. 24 (AP)West Ger nany won the 30kilometer 18.6 miles) crosscountry relay in an international Nordic ski met today. The United States team was fifth.

title: PENALTY HELPFUL
description: Faced with the task of de fending sole possession of first place against the Bruins yes terday, the Rangers came through, bouncing the Boston ians by 81 with an overall display of control hockey.

title: 2 RECORDS FALL IN N.A.I.A. TRACK
description: KANSAS CITY, Jan. 24 (AP) Two more meet records turn bled and a third was tied to night as the defending cham pion, Eastern Michigan, piled up a commanding lead atter half the events were completed in the fifth National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics in door track meet.

title: Lindsey Plastics Showing CanadianDesigned Sloop
description: A new Lindsey Newport 27 auxiliary sloop designed by the Canadian firm of Cuthbertson & Cassian and a Newport 20 designed by Gary Mull occupy the space of Lindsey Plastics of Santa Ana, Calif.

title: U.S. Business:
description: MILLVILLE, N. J., Jan. 24 As its name implies, the New. Jersey Silica Sand Com pany is in the sand business.

title: TV BROADCASTING IS DEBATED AT U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Jan. 24When future television au diences begin receiving pro grams from space satellites, will they be treated to soap op era, singing commercials or po litical propaganda?

title: U.S. Selects a Site F or Ground Tests Of Rapid Vehicles
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 24A site in Colorado near the Army's Pueblo Ordnance Depot has been chosen for con struction of a new highspeed ground test facility for the De partment of Transportation.

title: Memurial Seruices
description: BEINECKEEdwin John, a memorial service for Edwin John Beinecke will be held at 11 A.M. at the Church of the Heavenly Rest at 2 East 90th Street, Manhattan, on Janu ary 26. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to Northern Westchester Hos pital, Mt. Kisco, N. Y. or to your favorite charity.

title: Decline Forecast For Vegetables
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 17 (AP)  The Agriculture De partment says consumers can expect a smaller total supply of winter vegetables this season, although more tomatoes, onions and lettuce are indicated.

title: Small Investor: Essential but Too Costly
description: For nearly a decade the small investor has slowly been vanishing from Wall Street and now the forces of change that are causing tumult in the securities industry threaten him with virtual extinction.

title: 2 CATHEDRAL HULLS IN CHRYSLER'S LINE
description: Two new 18foot fiberglass cathedral hull boats are making their debuts along with a high performance 15foot sailboat, in the Chrysler Corporation ex hibit. In addition, Chrysler is showing four HydroVee boats and another cathedral hull model the Snort Fury.

title: ARMY VANQUISHES PENN STATE, 7154
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Jan. 24 Army's amazing defense had few problems today as the cadets beat Penn State, 7154.

title: LOTTERIES BY MAIL FACING REVISIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 24  Another somethingfornothing schemeone that has spawned the mailing of hundreds of mil lions of promotional circulars in the last few yearsappears te be headed for extinction, at least in its present form.

title: New Styles in Tuberous Begonias
description: BEGONIA turberhybrida, commonly called tu berousrooted begonia, was found In the cooler high altitudes of the tropics where it grew in moist soil rich In humus. Plants were protected from the midday sun by the lush forest growth. With this natural habitat clue, garden ers of moderate experience can be successful In growing these beautiful plants. Color ful pictures in the new cata logues and current garden magazines attest to the hy bridizers' skills in developing the diversity of forms and colors of these magnificent plants. Illustrated here are four flower styles that are currently popular among home gardeners.

title: SEMINAR LISTED IN PREDICTEDLOG
description: The third annual seminar on predictedlog competition will be held Saturday in the South American Room of the Coliseum during the Boat Show.

title: Article 13  No Title
description: closing of military bases and defense plants.

title: Author's Query
description: I am writing a history of the Brooklyn Eagle newspaper and would be most grateful to re ceive source material or the recollections of employes and others associated with the Eagle.

title: Drug With Promise and Peril
description: WASHINGTONIf a drug Is found that may dramati cally help a small percentage of persons afflicted with a debilitating and often dev astating disease, should Its use be publicized or would this raise false hopes in the majority of sufferers who would not be aided?

title: Insurers Still Add Annuities
description: The nation's insurance companies continue to add stockmarket oriented prod ucts to their inventory shelves, hedging their bets against a public that is in creasingly aware of the bite of inflation.

title: MORE POWER SOUGHT FOR CITY RIGHTS UNIT
description: The New York chapter of the American Jewish Cominittee has called on Mayor Lindsay to place all city offices and agen cies dealing with social prob lems and race relations under the Commission on Human Rights.

title: Laurel Pierson Becomes Bride
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Jan. 24 Miss Laurel Pierson, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Fiske Pierson, was married here this morning to Craig H Deery, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert L. Deery of Car thage, N.Y. The Rev. Dr. Don ald F. Campbell performed the ceremony in the First Presbyterian Church.

title: Nun Joins Chamber Board
description: PORTLAND, Me., Jan. 24 (AP)  A Roman Catholic nun has been named a director of the Greater Portland Chamber of Commerce. Sister Ann Coblan is executive director of Portland's Mercy Hospital.

title: Cold Weather Is Killing Florida's Walking Catfish
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., Jan. 24 (AP)  The walking catfish, an import that has been multiplying in South Flor ida, has been hit hard by the subfreezing weather early this month.

title: Israel Is Inviting Newsmen for Visit
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 24  Is rael's Ministry of Tourism has decided to invite 1,200 foreign newsmen to visit here this year in an effort to offset the nega tive effect of headlines telling of fighting.

title: Recordings
description: THE attempts often made to represent Erik Satie as a talented primitive, the Grandmere Moise of French music, never did persuade anyone who knew his works. Now that his mu sic is becoming positively popular the fallacy must be clear even to those who con fuse simplicity with simple mindedness. Satie himself said, I came into this world very young at a very old time. He was the John Cage of La Belle Epoque, the child for whom play is serious business.

title: Robin Rosenberg Engaged to Capt. Jaffe
description: FLORIDA, N. Y., Jan. 24  Mr. and Mrs. William Rosen berg of Florida and Hallan dale, Fla., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Robin Beth Rosenberg, to Capt. Michael Jaffe, Medical Corps, U.S.A.F. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Morris Jaffe of Brooklyn, New York.

title: Nixon Calls for Lift of A Driving Dream
description: WASHINGTON  Richard M. Nixon was making fresh, pen ciled changes in his State of the Union Message until 30 minutes before he appeared in the House of Representatives to deliver it last Thursday. But well before then, in the solitude of San Clemente and Camp David, he had fashioned an address that was conspicuously different in style and substance from any so far unveiled in his brief and rela tively uneventful Presidency.

title: Article 7  No Title
Boat Show Opens As Early Arrivals Brave 20 Weather
description: At 10:01 A.M. yesterday, Mr. and Mrs. James R. McQueen Jr. snipped a purple ribbon in the lobby of the Coliseum, a group of about 30 United States Power Squadron and Coast Guard Auxiliary members posed for pictures and Ed Collier of South River, N. J., the first per son in line, raced up to the fourth floor to see the Romany 21, an English boat.

title: Yes I Am a Black Playwright But . . .
description: AT time I moved Into acting seriously, here New York, there were damned few jobs in this profession for anybody, black or white. I turned to writing out of expediency. I love the theater and I had to do something to stay in it. Like I had reached a point of no return. You know what I mean? My main reason for going into writing was creative desperation. In my opinion, there was absolutely nothing being written that I considered to be saying anything for myself or for other persons of color.

title: Stiff Curbs on Credit Restrict Sales by Simca
description: Six stories above the Champs Elyses, the Ameri can manager of the Chrysler owned Simca Automobile Company, 60yearold Harry E. Chesebrough, describes how his company increased production and sales by more than 10 per cent last year, and has now run into a slump.

title: Call Your Own Cruise Shots and Ports
description: So you want a winter cruise  on your own terms, to your own taste, where you call the shots and ports, and on which there's no entertainment direc tor dedicated to the proposi tion of dragooning you into the most  beautiful  legs contest (male  or hairy  division).

title: San Juan Hotel Strike Ends
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Jan. 24 (UPI) Operations have returned to normal at the touristpacked El San Juan Hotel with settlement of a threeday strike by 850 workers. The workers struck earlier this week after an inci dent in which a hotel executive allegedly abused a union officer. The agreement ending the walk out stated the intention of man agement and the union to work toward better understanding.

title: Councilmen Cite Budget Shift In Areas Unfriendly to Mayor
description: City Council leaders said yesterday that preliminary investigation of the draft capi tal budget confirmed that neighborhoods that opposed Mayor Lindsay in last Novem ber's election suffered the loss of significantly more school projects than those that had supported him.

title: SHAPE OF A BOAT KEY TO HANDLING
description: Boats and girls are often compared invidiously. They're temperamental, expensive, oft en frustrating and lots of fun.

title: News of the Rialto
description: IN Morristown, N. J., on a wall of the local library, there now is a plaque that reads, Sherman Edwards Worked Here. That tribute, of course, stems from the fact that in this library, in the area where General George Washington had his headquarters and made Amer ican history fighting the Brit ish, Edwards researched the musical hit, 1776.

title: Port Body Elects Head
description: The Warehousemen's Associ ation of the Port of New York has announced the election of P. H. Stetler as president. Mr. Stetler is vice president of Pouch Terminal, Inc.

title: GLAMOUR OF RACES DEPICTED IN FILM
description: Title Drive, a new, 20min ute motion picture on the world outboard championship, and racing internationally, has been produced by Evinrude Motors of Milwaukee.

title: DOWNHILL RACE WON BY MISS MIDDLETON
description: JEFFERSONVILLE, Vt., Jan. 24The women's downhill event of the Madonna Cup race was won today by Karen Mid dleton of Brattleboro, Vt.

title: Speaking of Books: The Yale Younger Poets
description: Fifty years ago this month the Yale University Press brought out a small collection of verse by Howard Buck, titled The Tempering. It dealt mostly with World War I, and the tempering Mr. Buck had undergone in the trenches. It was Volume I in the Yale Series of Younger Poets, an enterprise designed to afford a publishing medium for the work of young men and women who have not yet secured a wide public recog nition.

title: Advertising :
description: At DancerFitzgeraldSam ple for the last year there has been no creative director, Instead, there have been six senior vice presidents, all creative directors who meet every Monday morning, act as their own critics and will ingly pitch in on one an other's problems.

title: ANTIWAR SOLDIERS FACE ARMY TRIALS
description: FORT GORDON, Ga. Jan. 22 Four Army privates who tried to open their own Investigation of war crimes are awaiting trial by special courtmartial on charges of undermining loyalty, morale and discipline.

title: In The Nation: The Pollution of Promises
description: WASHINGTON  President Nixon's State of the Union em phasis on improving the en vironment ought to be a major gain for that cause, since Pres idential leadership still can be one of the most effective steps toward getting anything done in the lumbering American polity. It Is not yet clear, how ever, that Mr. Nixon's plans are equal to his oratory.

title: The Capital of Haute Cuisine Acquires a, Foreign Accent As Restaurants Go International
description: PARISSome selfappointed guard ians of French, culture fretted a few years ago that foreign influ ences were eroding the language into what they callect Franglais. Now, the impact of tourism is giving cultural purists something else to worry about: On Avenue des ChampsElyses, French cuisine, the perennial touchstone of France's glory and grandeur, is disappearing.

title: Rule Would Aid Shoppers
description: A group of major food re tailers has sued the city's Department of Consumer Af fairs in an effort to strike down a regulation that would require stores to put more specific price labels on a variety of goods starting Feb. 20.

title: EXPERTS DEBATE FARM POLLUTION
description: ROCHESTER, Jan. 21Gov ernment experts meeting here have disagreed sharply on the solution to the problem of agricultural pollution, with some calling for a revision of the technology that has in creased agricultural production and others relying on the same technology to deal with the pollution it produces.

title: Spotlight:
description: The New York Stock Ex change issued its monthly shortinterest figures last Tuesday, But William A. Kent merely gave them a passing nod.

title: Stocks Decline Slightly On Amex and Counter List
description: Investors have become discouraged and tired of waiting for bullish news so they mostly sold.

title: France and Libya Both Deny U. A. R. Role in Jet Plane Deal
description: PARIS, Jan. 24The French Government and the Libyan Embassy denied today that Egyptians had participated in the recent arms negotiations here.

title: Industry Aims At Landlubbers
description: WE would talk with you at the wheel, when the blue waters grow a white and foamy streak astern . . . or drift in the holy silence of evening upon the broad and placid bosom of sonie hillencircled lake. . . . It is a gentle and honest sport, this sport that finds its home upon the deep and shallow waters.

title: DE CARLO ASSIGNED LAWYER BY COURT
description: NEWARK, Jan. 24Federal Judge Robert Shaw summoned a Jersey City lawyer to court today and ordered him to take over the defense of Angelo (Gyp) De Carlo to avert the possibility of a mistrial because of the continued illness of the lawyer who has been represent ing De Carlo.

title: Point of View
description: A NEW YORK CITY land mark is a good invest ment, for the owner and for the community. I shall not dwell here on the intangible returns that land marks can bring  the sense of history preserved, the liv ing evidence of a more gra cious past, the pride of a city with roots. Rather, I would like to review the very real economic benefits that accrue when a landmark or historic district is protected by official designation.

title: Shelley D. Susskind Engaged To Michael Dwayne Andreas
description: Mr. and Mrs. David H. Susskind of New York have announced the engagement of Mrs. Susskind's daughter, Miss Shelley Davidson Suss kind, to Michael Dwayne An dreas, son of Mr. and Mrs. Dwayne O. Andreas of Min neapolis, New York and Bal Harbor, Fla.

title: Gateway to Northwest Passage Holds Promise of a New Society
description: ARCTIC BAY, Northwest Territories Arctic Bay is an Eskimo settlement strung along the shore of Baffin Island, backed by sentinel stone moun tains and ice rivers guarding the eastern entrance to the Northwest Passaee.

title: Pope Paul Proclaims Spanish Sister a Saint
description: ROME, Jan. 25Pope Paul VI, what he called a moment of great consolation in this hour of trubulation for the church and bitterness for us, today proclaimed as a saint a Spanish sister who helped found a religious order.

title: Dorothy Jordon Wed On L.I. to Gary Weitzer
description: LAWRENCE, L. I., Jan. 25The marriage of Miss Dorothy Jordon, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles R. Jor don of West Hempstead, to Gary Weitzer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Stanley Weitzer of the Bronx, took place here today in Temple Israel. Rab bis Sidney Ballon and. Joel Zion officiated.

title: Russia Tells of Plans To Build Jumbo Jets
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 25 (Reu ters)Yevgeny F. Loginov, the Minister of Civil Avia tion, said today that Rus sia is planning to build its own jumbo jets, which would seat from 300 to 500 passengers. He told news men that the planes would go into service in the com ing years, but gave no further details.

title: Bakke Takes U.S. Ski Jumping Title
Shipowners Bringing Substantial Profits to Norway
description: OSLO, Norway  We're not part of the jet set, the Norwegian shipowner said with a smile. You mustn't confuse us with the Greeks. Norway is very democratic. If anyone in Oslo drove a RollsRoyce, he'd be hounded out of society if there is any society.

title: Brazil Builds in Petrochemicals
description: RIO DE JANEIROBrazil's rapidly growing demand for plastic packaging, pipes and synthetic fibers will be met by large new petrochemical plants starting this year.

title: West Coast Retailer Plans New Ventures
description: The biggest retailer in the West, the $630million Broad wayHale Stores, Inc., is now deeply involved in two im portant new ventures, ex pected to have a strategic bearing on its future. Each is different.

title: Opponents of the Abortion Law Gather Strength in Legislature
description: ALBANY, Jan 25For the fourth consecutive year, the question of reform or outright repeal of the state's abortion law will come before the legis laturethis time amidst a mood of uncertainty over whether to act on the contro versial issue or to leave its resolution to the courts.

title: Dreyfus Corp. Organizes Offshore Investment Fund
description: The Dreyfus Corporation has announced the formation of the Dreyfus Intercontinental Invest ment Fund, N. V., an openend offshore investment company incorporated in the Netherlands Antilles.

title: Hijacked Plane in Curacao
description: WILLEMSTAD, Curacao, Jan. 25 (AP)A Netherlands Antil les airliner with 32 persons aboard arrived in Curacao at midnight after having been commandeered to Cuba by a young hijacker.

title: BUCKS SET BACK HAWKS BY 131116
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 25 (AP)  Flynn Robinson and Lew Al cindor collaborated for 64 points today to lead the Mil waukee Bucks to a 131116 triumph over the Atlanta Hawks in a nationally televised National Basketball Associa tion contest.

title: Point of View
description: CANANADIANS. like most citi zens of other relatively ad vanced countries, look on the population explosion as rank ing with or even before nu clear war as the greatest threat to the future of man kind. However, because Can ada is such a sparsely settled country, most of us feel that overpopulation is a remote problem that does not direct Iy concern us in our own homeland. I suspect that most Canadians never think at all about Canada's population problems, but revert to at titudes that were acceptable 50 years ago, and say the more the better (always, of course, with personal, region al or ethnic reservations about the kind of immigrants who should be admitted).

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: A Beggar in Jerusalem, by Elie Wiesel, translated from the French by Lily Edelman and the author (Random House. $5.95). The effect on one man of Israel's SixDay War.

title: Rockefeller Report Divides Officials
description: When President Nixon took office a little over a year ago, his first official visitor was a plain  talking United States  educated Ecuadoran who also happened to be the highly regarded Secretary General of the Organization of American States.

title: Central America Seeks Integration
description: GUATEMALA CITY  The Central American Common Market has survived a test of fire: the fiveday war be tween Honduras and El Sal vador last July.

title: TKACZUK,RATELLE GET EARLY GOALS
description: Orland Kurtenbach, who wishes people would recognize him for the gentle person he is, threw his first punch of the season last night in what turned out to be a startlingly close game won by the Rangers, 32, from the Los Angeles Kings.

title: Dr. Winston Hole, Aided Research for Defense
description: Dr. Winston L. Hole, a for mer physics professor, died Saturday in St. Joseph Hospi tal, Yonkers. He was 59 years old and lived in Hastingson Hudson, N. Y.

title: Cuba Mobilizes for Sugar
description: MIAMIThe sugardomi nated Cuban economy, fol lowing what was perhaps its poorest annual performance since the 1959 revolution, tnay stage a moderate ad vance this year.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: National Interest

title: Point of View
description: THE sixties have been difficult for Latin America, and it faces the seventies with negative factors predominant.

title: Renewal of Ties With Cuba Is Urged by Chilean Paper
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Jan. 25 (Reuters)  The Government owned newspaper La Naci6n came out strongly today in favor of a renewal of diplo matic and trade relations with Cuba.

title: Episcopal Seminary Cut Set as Funds and Rolls Lag
description: The Episcopal Church, on the recommendation of its Board for Theological Education, is going to reduce the num ber of its seminaries from the present 11 to five or fewer because of a lack of funds and small enrollments.

title: U.S. JUDGES TOLD THEY MAY TEACH
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 (AP)  A sevenjudge ethics com mittee appointed by Chief Jus tice Warren E. Burger has ad vised Federal judges that it is all right for them to teach at law schools or serve as a paid trustee under a relative's will.

title: Nixon's Pollution Panel
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 25The President's Water Pollution Control Advisory Board is find ing that water presents not only chemical annoyances but also on occasion rough sailing.

title: Uruguay Continues Downhill Trek
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay During the thirties a politi cal party here promised vot ers large savings on gasoline by making highways run only downhill. The party's leaders gathered the biggest crowds and the fewest votes.

title: East Meets East at L.I. Center, Where Stress is on China of Old
description: HEMPSTEAD, Jan. 24 The delicate sounds of the yangchin, the henghsiao, the erhhu and the pipa filled the small crowded room as a quar tet of musicians played at a musicale at the Chinese Center on Long Island here recently.

title: SHIPPING/MAIL
description: Incoming Passenger and Mail Ships

title: Fares Rise a Nickel Here On 8 Private Bus Lines
description: Bus fares went up a nickel to 25 cents yesterday for the basic fare on eight privately owned bus lines in the city.

title: Villella Makes Source Debut; Slaughter on Tenth Ave. Given,
description: As every child knows by now, the New York City Ballet, more than any other company today, reflects the artistic vi sion of a single choreographer, and that choreographer is George Balanchine.

title: Japan Is Widening Her Investment in Latin America
description: Japan is now the fourth largest foreign investor in Latin America, after the United States, Britain and West Germany, a leading British bank has reported.

title: U.S. Seeks TV Film From Panther Show
description: Federal authorities have sub poenaed the tapes and the outtakes (unused portions) of a television program dealing with the Black Panthers, Rich ard S. Salant, president of the Columbia Broacicasting System News Department, said in an interview last night.

title: Lemaire Nets 2 Goals
description: DETROIT. Jan. 25 (UPI) Jacques Lemaire scored twice within 59 seconds in the first period tonight and started the Montreal Canadiens on their way to a 41 victory over the Detroit Red Wings. Lemaire, who leads the National Hockey League in goals, now has 28.

title: Complacency on High?
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 Have American economists, including many in the Government, become complacent about the onceburning question of the United States balance of international payments? The is sue has been raised forcefully by Kenneth N. Davis Jr., Assist ant Secretary of Commerce for Domestic and International Busi ness. He believes there is anew complacency and he takes vigorous exception to it. This is known to reflect a difference between Mr. Davis and some other Government officialsnotably, it is under stood, the Council of Economic Advisers.

title: JAMES BRUMMELEN, 50 YEARS A MARINER
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 25Capt. James Brummelen, who had sailed the seas for 50 years, died here today of a heart ail ment. He was 73 years old.

title: Chess:
description: THE recent annual Adver tising Chess League Swiss system was won by Bernard Friend, who swept the opposition 60. Second place went to John Sarar, who, with 51, lost only to Friend. Gordon Tweten, president of the chess league, took third place.

title: Wilson Begins Trip to Washington
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 25 (AP) Prime Minister Wilson of Britain arrived here today on his way to Washington for talks with President Nixon.

title: Duo Recital to Benefit Chinese School Fund
description: A duo recital by Ma SiHon, violinist, and his wife, Tung RwongKwong, pianist, was giv en at Alice Tully Hall on Satur day night to assist in the estab lishment of a New York Chinese School Music Program Scholar ship and Expansion Fund.

title: Philadelphia Enrolls TeenAge Police
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 25 The first armed policeman at the scene of trouble in the City of Brotherly Love later this year may be a teenager.

title: U.S.Latin Negotiations at Stalemate
description: WASHINGTONThis year is viewed here as one of stale mate in the economic rela tions between the United States and Latin America, notwithstanding the new co operative programs outlined last November by the Nixon Administration, but optimists here hope this may lead to a more fruitful partnership in the future.

title: M*A*S*H Film Blends Atheism, Gore, Humor
Quicksilver Group Brings New Pianist To Fillmore East
description: Quicksilver Messenger Serv ice was one of the early San Francisco rock groups, and still is one of the best.

title: Federal Reserve Bank Names Senior Officer
description: The appointment of Robert G. Link as senior vice presi dent of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York was an nounced over the weekend by Alfred Hayes, president.

title: Increase in Fares Is Found in Major Cities Across the Nation
description: Bus and subway riders in major cities across the country are experiencing sharp rises in fares that, in some cases, are headed toward the 50cent level.

title: LYMAN D. WARNER
description: Lyman D. Warner, who re tired six months ago as man ager of international sales for Dresser Manufacturing, a divi sion of Dresser Industries, died Saturday in Lenox Hill Hospi tal. He was 63 years old and lived in Greenwich, Conn.

title: Urgency on Electoral Reform
description: If essential improvements are to come before the approaching statewide elections, the threeman panel selected by Mayor Lindsay to recommend changes New York's election laws must plunge into its work immediately. The recommendations, to have value, must be made in time for action at the current ses sion of the State Legislature.

title: Iba's Successor Reported
description: STILLWATER, Okla., Jan. 25 (UPI)Sam B. Aubrey, an as sistant in his 16th season at Oklahoma State University, will be named to replace Henry Iba as Cowboy basketball coach after 36 years, United Press In ternational learned today.

title: Gains Abroad Chill Oilmen
description: CARACAS, VenezuelaThe new oil discoveries in Alaska added another chilling fear last year to Latin America's petroleum industry, which is struggling to cope with grow ing nationalism and airpollu tion, not to mention a buyer's market.

title: U.S. Panel Backs Sale of Chickens With Cancer Virus
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 (AP) A Government panel of sci entists has recommended that chickens bearing cancer virus be allowed on the market as long as the birds do not look too repugnant. The basis for the recommended change in inspection standards, accord ing to Agriculture Department officials, is scientific evidence said to dispute any link be tween cancer virus in chickens and disease in humans.

title: LEON S. BRACH
description: LIVINGSTON, N.J., Jan. 25 Leon S. Brach, inventor and former president of L. S. Brach Manufacturing Corporation, Newark, makers of electrical specialties and radio and tele vision antennas, died today in St. Barnabas Medical Center. He was 86 years old and lived at 67 South Minn Avenue, East Orange.

title: Daniel Heifetz Offers Tchaikovsky in Debut
description: The repertory doesn't come any more standard than that offered by the Washington Na tional Symphony yesterday afternoon at Philharmonic Hall Tchaikovsky's Violin Con certo encircled by Strauss' Don Juan and Beethoven Eroica  but there was a happy touch of novelty in the choice of soloist.

title: Sports Today
description: BOXING

title: Prospering Guyana Builds Her Budget
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana Guyana, the only English speaking country on the South American mainland, maintained political stability and continued her economic advance in 1969.

title: Huge Paper Plant Planned in Chile
description: A $50million cellulose plant is expected to be built soon in Chile, the Bank of London and South America says.

title: 2 Policemen Wounded by Sniper Fire
description: Sniper fire injured two policemen who were respond ing to a report of disorderly conduct by a group of youths on a Harlem street last night.

title: FRENCH RULES BAR RECALL OF A RACE
description: PARIS, Jan. 25The race was over before it started and afterward, when it was too late Gerhard Kruger was bitterly saying it should never have started in the first place.

title: Elizabeth C. Hadas Is Married
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 25 Miss Elizabeth Chamberlayne Hadas and Jeremy William Heist, doctoral students in English literature at Wash ington University, were mar ried here this afternoon. The ceremony was performed at the bridegroom's home by the Rev. Robert L. Epps, a Meth odist minister.

title: 1969's MOVIE BESTS GIVEN THEIR AWARDS
description: Awards for screen achieve Iment in 1969 were presented yesterday afternoon by the New York Film Critics at a reception held at Sardi's West Restaurant, 234 West 44th Street. The awardwinners and the 22 movie reviewers who chose them were joined by from the entertainment field.

title: Vatican Refuses to Accredit Bonn Envoy Who Is Woman
description: ROME, Jan. 25 (Reuters) The Vatican has refused to grant accreditation to a West German diplomat because she is a woman, a Vatican spokes man said today.

title: A Town of Alleys and Lanes Growing at Turnpike Speeds
description: FORT ST. JAMES, British ColumbiaOur famed fivecorners intersection needs either a traffic control system or a flagman to in sure that no one gets killed, The Caledonia Courier de clared in a frontpage edi torial.

title: Panama Staging A Brisk Recovery
description: PANAMAThe economy of this buoyant little country at the maritime crossroads of the Americas recovered smartly last year from the political instability and growth depression of 1968.

title: German Hungarians Subdue Hungaria in Indoor Final,51
description: WHITE PLAINS, Jan. 25  The GermanHungarians tri umphed over New York Hun garia 51, today in the final of the indoor tournament of the GermanAmerican Soccer League at the Westchester County Center, before 2,293 spectators.

title: JOSEPH A. MITCHELL
description: Joseph A. Mitchell, who retired in April as an account executive in the industrial de partment of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., after 35 years with the con cern, died Saturday in Triboro Hospital, Jamaica. He was 65 years old, and lived at 8718 248th Street, Bellerose, Queens.

title: Chaos Hovers Over Latin Lands
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  Latin America entered the seventies with a heightened sense of terror. It is not the terror of politically motivated groups, rather, it is the prospect of impending social and economic chaos.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
DUQUESNE SUBDUES LA SALLE, 67 TO 64
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 25 (AP) The 6foot11inch Nelson twins Garry and Barry, led Duquesne to a 6764 victory over La Salle of Philadelphia today, scoring 18 of 25 secondhalf points be tween them while holding Ex plorer star, Ken Durrett, to five.

title: KEY SUSPECT EYED IN YAELONSKI CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25The Federal Bureau of. Investigation was reported today to have ze roed in on a key suspect in the effort to find who had hired the killers of Joseph A. Yablon ski and his wife and daughter.

title: Quebec's Poor Find Hope in Social Animation
description: RIMOUSKI, Quebec  In the next three years, 26.6 million trees will be planted in the old, depressed parishes of Eastern Quebec. But re forestation is only one part of a $259million Federal provincial experiment in rural planning and social ani mation.

title: 3 Charter Airlines Deny Charges of Illegal Flights
description: Three charter airline com panies yesterday denied charges by the Civil Aeronautics Board that they had carried on illegal transAtlantic charter fights op erations.

title: MRS. L. C. CARTER, ONCE DEWEY AIDE
description: Mrs. Lisle C. Carter, a lawyer and social worker, who was the first black woman assistant dis trict attorney here, from 1935 to 1945, died of cancer at Knick erbocker Hospital yesterday.

title: Colombian Builds on Nation's Wealth
description: BOGOTA, Colombia  The financial empire controlled by 39yearold Jaime Michel sen is notable in that it con sists solely of Colombian capital.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, JANUARY 26, 1970

title: 16 HURT IN DJIBOUTI IN TERRORIST ATTACK
description: DJIBOUTI, French Territory of Afars and Issas, Jan. 25 (Agence FrancePresse)  Six teen Europeans were injured, four of them seriously, late last night in a hand grenade attack on a restaurant in the center of Djibonti.

title: STRIKE BY TEACHERS SETTLED IN PASSAIC
description: PASSAIC, N. J., Monday, Jan. 26 (AP)The Passaic Associa tion and the Board of Educa tion reached agreement on a new contract Sunday night to end a strike by 433 teachers that began Jan. 16.

title: LIQUORI'S SEASON GETS SLOW START
description: Indoor track and field meets may be fun for the fans and financially fine for the promot ers. But before the snow melts round Philadelphia's Main Line, Marty Liquori will spend some lonely afternoons trying to sal vage his pride from an em barrassing defeat in the one mile run to Kipchoge Keino last Saturday night.

title: Bridge:
description: SWISS team championships, in which teams are matched in short encounters with others of roughly equal standing in the event, have become phenomenally popu lar within the last year. The entry of 128 teams in the TriState Regionals this month was far from a rec ord, for more than 170 teams competed in Lancaster, Pa., in November.

title: Andean Trade Bloc Jelling
description: BOGOTA, ColombiaAfter four years of preparation, five Andean countries took the first steps this month to ward forming an economic common market.

title: RABBI ISAAC ROSENBAUM
description: Rabbi Isaac M. Rosenbaum, who retired two years ago from Temple Gates of Prayer, Flush ing, Queens, died yesterday in Flushing Hospital. He was 82 years old and lived at 14108 Cherry Avenue, Flushing.

title: Lankenau, Mrs. Gerrish Win
description: RYE, N.Y., Jan. 25Roger Lankenau of the Westchester Country Club and Mrs. Thorn ton Gerrish Jr. of Apawamis, the third seeded team, won the annual invitation mixed doubles platform tennis final at The Apawamis Club today by de feating Bruce Newman and Mrs. Jack R. Ackerman, Cen ??my, 61, 64.

title: StrongArm Moves Paying Off for Peru
description: LIMA, Peru The ruling military junta confounded and defied its critics last year by a series of strongarm moves that left Peru's econ omy in its best statistical position since the boom in period of the early sixties.

title: NORMAN TURKELL
description: Norman Turkell, owner of the Rip Apartment Hotel, 10 Fort Washington Avenue, and former ipartner in Victory Clothes, an apparel manufacturing con cern, died of a heart attack Saturday at the ColumbiaPres byterian Medical Center. He was 49 years old and lived at 154 Maytime Drive, Jericho, L. I.

title: SPACED OUT TAKES HORSE SHOW TITLE
description: NORTH SALEM, N. Y., Jan. 25A van carrying Barney Ward's Spaced Out crashed into a bridge abutment while traveling from Harrisburg to the Washington horse show slightly more than three months ago. The 8yearold brown gelding was thrown from the van and was injured.

title: Dubcek Lands in Istanbul
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Jan. 25 (AP)  Alexander Dubcek ar rived tonight from Czechoslo vakia. Turkish policemen kept him from a crowd of newsmen and took him to a waiting limousine. The Czechoslovak press agency C.T.K. said in Prague that Mr. Dubcek would spend the night in Istanbul and travel to Ankara by car to morrow.

title: Martin Tepper, Lawyer, Weds Susan J. Levin
description: Miss Susan Jane Levin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Philip J. Levin, of New York, was married here yesterday to Martin Bruce Tepper, a lawyer with Schrieber & Lancaster, Newark. The cer emony was performed at the Pierre by Rabbi Irwin Fish bein of Temple Beth El, Eliza beth, N. J.

title: U.S. SAYS. POLLUTERS MUST PAY THE con
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 (AP)  Businesses that pollute the air and water will bear much of the cost of President Nixon's campaign to clean up the en vironment, Secretary of the In or Walter J. Hickel said to day.

title: Weekend Rock Festival In Australia Ends Quietly
description: OURIMBAH, Australia, Jan. 25 Reuters)Australia's first mammoth openair pop festi val ended quietly tonight after a weekend of amplified rock music, occasional nudity and peaceful dealings with the police.

title: Irish Appeal Seeks Funds To Rebuild Belfast Street
description: A United Irish Appeal for funds to rebuild a street in Belfast devastated during last summer's rioting in Northern, Ireland was begun yesterday by the American Irish Develop ment Committee, the National Association for Irish Justice, and several other IrishAmer ican organizations.

title: Bolivia Still Poor, Confused
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia  South America's most volatile coun try had its 185th change in government in 144 years of independence last Sept. 26, and once again confusion en veloped what is also the con tinent's poorest land.

title: Miss Martinez Net Victor
description: MANILA, Jan. 25 (UPI) Cecilia Martinez of San Fran cisco, the 11thranked United States wonpn's player, won the metropolitan open singles championship with a 62, 60 victory over the defender, Pat Yngayo of the Philippines, today. Raymundo Deyro won the men's title.

title: U.S. War Outlays Aid Korea and Philippines
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25Sta tistics on United States spend ing for the war in Vietnam show that the conflict is provid ing significant benefits for the economies of South Korea and the Philippines as well as help ing to shore up their military establishments.

title: Stokely Carmichael in Sudan
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, Jan. 25 (Reuters)Stokely Carmi chael, the American black mili tant, arrived today on a visit planned by the Sudan's Minis try of Youth. During the visit, expected to last several weeks, he will lecture in Khartoum and elsewhere. He has been living in Conakry, Guinea.

title: TERRY JAZZ AMENDS ST. PETER'S VESPERS
description: Jazz and laughter were blended in a vesper service yesterday afternoon by Clark Terry's big band and the com edian Hank Garrett. The service was one of a weekly series of jazz vespers at St. Peter's Lutheran Church, 54th Street at Lexington Avenue.

title: KENNECOTT'S NET IN YEAR A RECORD
description: The Kennecott Copper Cor poration and subsidiaries re ported over the weekend gains in sales and net income for both the fourth quarter and the calendar year, with net for the year reaching a record high of more than $165million. This compared with the previous high of $143million reported in 1956.

title: Autos Pulling Brazil Out of a Rut
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil When the storage lots at the Volkswagen subsidiary plant here began to fill with un sold cars late last year, there was quiet, urgent talk of a coming recession in Brazil.

title: Dubcek Flies to Turkey to Take Up New Post
description: VIENNA, Jan. 25Alexander Dubcek, the former head of the Czechoslovak Communist Party, flew to Turkey tonight to take up his new post as ambassador.

title: RUSSEL CAPTURES SPECIAL SLALOM
description: MEGEVE, France, Jan. 25 (AP)Patrick Russel of France continued his domination of the World Cup skiing by easily winning the special salolm event of the 26th Megeve Grand Prix today.

title: Army Checks Ulster Roads
description: LONDONDERRY, Northern Ireland, Jan. 25 (Reuters) Troops put up roadblocks and checked cars in Londonderry today after a flareup of fight ing in the streets yesterday. About 400 soldiers were called in yesterday to clear roads as rival groups of Irishmen clashed briefly.

title: Theater: Unfair to Goliath Arrives
Paraguay Gets Free Cars . . . Rio Gets Sidewalk Parking . . . Investors Get High Rates
description: ASUNCION, ParaguayThe Japanese are using a new twist on the ancient newlampsforold game to knock their competitors out of the automotive market here.

title: Berres of Sweden Breaks World SpeedSkating Mark
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 25 (UPI) Hasse Berres of Sweden set a world speedskating record to day for the 500meter race in 38.87 seconds, Tass, the Soviet press agency, reported.

title: A Time of Challenging Questions for Canada
description: TORONTOCanada 1970: On the western and northern frontiers, the life style and comforting sentiments of a simpler past linger, but most of the country is grappling with a complex presentchanging mores, urban con gestion, pollution, the multinational cor poration, federalprovincial rivalryand inflation.

title: Board of Education May Select Brown's Successor Today
description: The members of the Board of Education will meet in informal session today in an effort to select a successor to Dr. Nathan Brown, the Acting Superintend ent of Schools, who will go on retirement leave March 1.

title: BUILDING ACTIVITY IS FOUND LAGGING
description: The multibilliondollar con struction industry is not keep ing pace, economically, with the rest of the United States private economy, according to a report published yesterday by the National Industrial Conference Board.

title: Agnew and Lindsay Top Ballots in Fashion Vote
description: Vice President Agnew re placed President Nixon and Mayor Lindsay supplanted Mayor Richard J. Daley of Chicago on a list of the best dresseed men of 1970 issued yesterday.

title: EDUCATION LOBBY MARSHALS FORCES TO SAVE FUND BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25A carefully primed lobbying ma chine will move into high gear tomorrow in an effort to prod Congress to override President Nixon's impending veto of the health and education appropri ation bill.

title: Major Bills in Congress
Captain Replaced After Crew Threat
description: The French adage, the more it changes, the more it remains the same thing, apparently does not apply to once unques tioned authority of a master in the British merchant navy any more.

title: MAURICE LEONARD
description: Maurice (Jack) Leonard, a supervisor of advertising lino type for The New York Times, died yesterday in Elmhurst Gen eral Hospital, Queens. He was 45 years old and lived at 4030 75th Street, Jackson Heights, Queens.

title: Clothes With Which to Educate a Tot
description: THE trend these days is, as soon as possible, to hoot the baby out of the bassi net into Academia, filling his chubby little hands with toys, books, records and mo biles brimming with play value.

title: HOUSING PROJECT IN QUEENS SCORED
description: Despite a contention that Panic and fear have spread across a section of $50,000 homes in Queens because of a proposed lowincome housing project there, the city is going ahead with the plan.

title: Argentina Acts on Wheat Crisis
description: The Argentine Government, faced by a decline in the wheat crop, has decreed that export commitments will have first priority on supplies acquired by the National Grain Board.

title: DANCERS PERFORM FOR CLARK CENTER
description: The Clark Center for the Per forming Arts of the West Side Young Women's Christian As sociation has for years unsel fishly provided established and aspiring talents with a mid town showplace. Yesterday eve ning some of the betterknown performers repaid the kindness with a benefit performance at the Clark Auditorium.

title: Yancey's 69 for 278 Wins Crosby Golf as Nicklaus's 65 Falls Stroke Short
description: PEBBLE BEACH, Calif., Jan. 25Bert Yancey withstood closing bid of 65 by Jack Nick laus today to win the Bing Crosby golf tournament by one stroke.

title: Oil Fails to Calm Venezuela's Turbulent Waters
description: CARACAS, VenezuelaThe sea of petroleum that buoys this land proved a bit rough last year. Although Venezue la remained the world's lead ing oil exporter, her share of the international petroleum market declined further.

title: Big Board Names Officer To Head Electronic Center
description: The New York Stock Ex change announced over the weekend that John J. Alex ander Jr., 34, had been named vice president in charge of the exchange's Electronic Systems Center.

title: AMNESTY FOR KURDS REPORTED IN IRAQ
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 25 A decree issued in Baghdad to night was reported to have offered amnesty to all Kurdish tribesmen who have partici pated in the nationalist insur rection in northern Iraq since 1961.

title: ... and Troop Cuts
description: Financial pressures, and later the requirements of the Vietnam war, provided the original impetus in Washington for troop cuts in Europe. But the renewed debate has a very different financial base from that involved in the reductions that have already cut American forces in Europe by onequarter from the peak levels of the last decade.

title: Sports of The Times
description: CLYRE is wearing one blue lace and one orange lace on his basketball sneakers. Why, Clyde?

title: Copper Is Building British Columbia
description: ASHCROFT, British Colum biaFew vehicles roll on the unnumbered road that winds through the Highland Valley a good thing considering its unannounced dips and curves. One of these days, however, a survey crew will be along, figuring out how to make the road safe for hundreds of commuting min ers.

title: Nixon Assures Jewish Leaders on Mideast Policies
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 President Nixon sent a mes sage to an emergency confer ence of Jewish leaders today reiterating Administration as surances that the United States believed peace in the Middle East could come only after a negotiated agreement between Israel and the Arab states.

title: Dublin: Calling All Limerick Writers
description: DUBLINThe limerick re mains one of literature's minor unsolved mysteries. Where was it invented, or when, or by whom are ques tions that have never been definitively answered. Learned encyclopedias specu late and agree to differ, but there can be no doubt that if the limerick di not originate Arts Limerick, a ve Abroad dant, dairy tour ty that border the river Shanno on the east, it at least ha extremely strong connection with the area.

title: OldTime Riches Decline in Pampas
description: BUENOS AIRESA half century ago the Argentine farmer could produce on the rich Pampas huge wheat crops and some of the finest beef in the world with almost no capital investment.

title: LOWENTHAL STYLE SHAPES A RECITAl
description: A pianist who puts Liszt's Mazeppa and Schubert's So nata in C minor (Op. Post.) on the same program obviously does not wish to be typecast. Two more temperamentally dis similar composers of the last century would be difficult to find, and only a supreme stylist could be comfortable both with the floridly theatrical Liszt and the inwardly dramatic Schu bert.

title: REFUNDING PLANS OF TREASURY DUE
description: The Treasury is expected to announce Wednesday how it plans to refinance $4,381,000, 000 of 4 per cent bonds that mature on Feb. 15.

title: Securities Dealers' Group Punishes 2 Firms and 4 Men
description: The National Association of Securities Dealers has an nounced disciplinary actions against two securities firms and four securities salesmen.

title: Article 1  No Title
Niekro Has Appendectomy
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 25 (UPI) Phil Niekro, a 23game winner for the Atlanta Braves last sea son, underwent an emergency appendectomy today and was reported in good condition by Dr. Harry Rogers, the team phy sician.

title: The Mansfield Fallacy...
description: The debate between Senator Mansfield and Under Secretary of State Elliot Richardson has clarified some of the issues raised by the majority leader's revived resolution calling for a substantial cutback of American troops in Europe.

title: West Coast Steals Show in Stocks
description: TORONTOWhile the To ronto Stock Exchange strug gled stolidly to achieve the calm, gray respectability of its New York counterpart, the bumptious West Coast market stole the limelight in Canadian stocks last year.

title: WEST GERMAN SLED WINS WORLD TITLE
description: ST. MORITZ, Switzerland, Jan. 25 (AP)Horst Floth and Josef Bader of West Germany won the 1970 world twoman bobsled championship today as the Italians were shut off with out a medal for the first time in 14 years and a United States team slipped to seventh.

title: Javits Leaves Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 25Senator Jacob K. Javits Jeft Saigon today after a fourday visit that he said had served to confirm his view that the United States should withdraw its troops from South Vietnam at the earliest possible date.

title: Black Colonel Getting General's Rank
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25The Senate is expected to give rou tine approval soon to a list of 76 Air Force colonels nominated by President Nixon for the rank of brigadier general.

title: Seals Down Stars. 41
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Jan. 25 (AP)Mike Laughton scored three times today and Gary Smith, the goalie, turned back 42 Minnesota shots as the Oak land Seals beat the North Stars, 41.

title: Ft. Gordon Rifle Theft Ends With Recovery of 80 Guns
description: FORT GORDON, Ga., Jan. 25 (UPI)Two men tied up a Fort Gordon soldier, then fled with 8.0 M16 rifles from the base armory early this morning.

title: EDWIN R. ROONEY JR.
description: Edwin Richards Rooney Jr., a television and radio adver tising director, died Saturday after a long illness. He was 44 years old and lived at 233 East 46th Street.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Announcements of deaths, marriages, births and engagements may be tele phoned to Oxford 53311 until 11 P.M. in suburban offices. 9.00 A.M. to 4:30 P.M. Monday through. Friday N??cark (201) Market 33900; White Plains (914) White Plains 95300; Hempstead (516) I Vanhoe 36660; Commack (516) 5435400; Stamford (203) 3137767.

title: Leaf Rally Beats Hawks
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 25 (AP)  Dave Keon and Mike Walton scored 44 seconds apart in the final period tonight to give the Toronto Maple Leafs a 32 vic tory over the Chicago Black Hawks.

title: A Starring Role Is Not for Mrs. Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 Nobody ever wonders about Pat Nixon, said a man the other day who has seen first ladies come and go and who spends much time criss crossing America on the speech circuit. Nobody asks you: What is she really like?

title: Stanfield Scores 17th
description: BOSTON, Jan. 25 (AP)Fred Stanfield's powerplay goal early in the third period to night snapped a 11 tie and helped the Boston Bruins score a 31 National Hockey League victory over the Pittsburgh Pen guins.

title: SEGOVIA TRANSFIXES CAPACITY AUDIENCE
description: Coming out into the raucous New York night after an Andres Segovia recital is as startling as being thrown into a cold shower, though less invigorat ing. Mr. Segovia, who will be 77 years old next month, still knows how to enrapture an au dienceeven the sprawling one that last night filled Philhar monic Halland make it lean forward and live from note to note.

title: Nayar Turns Back Terrell In Squash Racquets Final
description: RYE, N. Y., Jan. 25 Anil Nayar of Boston, the national champion, won the 28th annual invitation squash racquets tour nament at The Apawamis Club today. Nayar, who headed the draw, defeated Lawrence Ter rell of Harvard, seeded No. 3, 155, 1510, 1513.

title: Rosalind Rees Sings In Town Hall Program
description: Rosalind Rees, soprano, ap peared in a program of vocal chamber music presented at Town Hall Saturday afternoon under the direction of Stanley Hoffman. Miss Rees, who is studying here with Adele Addi son after having graduated from the Cleveland Institute of Mu sic, showed that her pleasing and wellpoised voice adapts smoothly to music of various periods and styles.

title: Barbara Ruth Wed To Jonathan Kurtiri
description: WOODSBURGH, L. I., Jan. 25Miss Barbara Field Ruth, daughter of Donald S. Ruth, Mayor of this village, and Mrs. Ruth, was married this evening to Jonathan Brill Kurtin, son of Mrs. Abner Kurtin of the Bronx and the late Dr. Kurtin, who was a dermatologist.

title: Rev. Aime Deschamps, 54, Augustinian Secretary, Dies
description: The Rev. Aim A. Deschamps, who was recently named exec utive secretary of the North American Province of the Ro man Catholic Order of Augus tinians of the Assumption, died Friday of a heart attack. He was 54 years old and was sta tioned at the provincial house at 329 West 108th Street.

title: Israeli Ceremony Honors Pikel
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 25 (AP) The first saplings of a forest in memory of the late Bishop James A. Pike were planted during a ceremony today near a remote settlement in the north ern Negev. Bishop Pike's widow planted the first sapling.

title: Show Is an Island Surrounded by Fans
description: There's just too many people here, dear . . .  With that apology, a har ried husband took his wife by the arm yesterday in the Coliseum, leaned forward like a fullback going into the line and tried to gain a yard or two at the National Boat Show. He gained about a foot.

title: COLLEGE FOR NUNS TO OPEN ITS ROLLS
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J.For the last 42 years the sisters of St. Lucy Filippini here at Villa Walsh College have been teaching only postulants for their Roman Catholic order. Eightyfive women are cur rently studying for their vows on the quiet 160acre campus.

title: DEMOCRAT IN LINE FOR EISENBUD JOB
